Stay With Me Until I Die  -  Asking a person significant to you to share your final moments.
X Makes Anything Cool  -  Not a placeholder, but the literal letter "X", is just so cool.
Pull Yourself Down The Spear  -  An impaled person pulls themself down what they're stuck with to attack its wielder.
Tonka Tough  -  Nigh-Invulnerable toys.
Easy Road To Hell  -  You can go to hell just for doing a small number of bad things, or for arbitrary factors completely out of your control.
The Sheriff  -  Top Law Enforcement official for a county. In Westerns, usually the top Good Guy. In other genres, likely as not, corrupt.
Couch Gag  -  The intro or outro is changed in every episode.
Law Of Conservation Of Normality  -  No matter what else gets changed, and no matter how irreversible those changes are, basic societal practices and mores will remain in sync with the culture the work is written in.
My Sister Is Off Limits  -  A brother who bars anyone from dating his sister; be it his friend or any of the other nice guys.
Dye Hard  -  A person/character who's known for dying their hair.
Expose The Villain Get His Job  -  Your reward for taking down the villain is the job you proved them unfit for.
Informed Loner  -  Said to be asocial, but hangs out with others all the time.
Reality Is Unrealistic  -  Storytelling conventions lead to realistic elements being seen as inaccurate.
Grand Theft Prototype  -  Hijacking an enemy prototype tech.
Sherlock Scan  -  A character notices a few simple clues and then quickly reaches an impressive logical conclusion.
Sobriquet Sex Switch  -  A character who is transgender, changed sex, or disguised as the opposite sex goes by a name derived from their old one.
Karaoke Bonding Scene  -  A public karaoke performance that emphasizes the singer's relationships with their co-performer or someone in the audience.
Bringing In The Expert  -  When the mooks don't cut it, pay for the best man or woman for the job.
Wet Blanket Wife  -  A female character that constantly reminds The Hero (and the audience) how much fun they SHOULDN'T be having.
Monster Protection Racket  -  A monster attacks so someone they're in league with can profit from stopping it.
Fatal Attraction  -  Trope: Never stick it in crazy.
Femme Fatalons  -  A character has long, well-kept fingernails, indicating that they're a villain, untrustworthy and/or dangerous.
Dressed To Plunder  -  Pirates in fiction tend to wear specific stuff.
Transformation Trinket  -  An object that turns its wielder into a superpowered being.
Paradise Planet  -  The most habitable and desirable of all planets.
Stone Soup  -  Manipulating others via feigned eccentric behavior.
Immortal Procreation Clause  -  If you can't die, you can't breed.
Lets Have Another Baby  -  A character decides that he or she would like a baby.
Space X  -  Instant Technobabble, just add "space".
Make An Example Of Them  -  Getting people to follow rules by showing them the punishment done to others.
Now How Much Would You Pay  -  A question during an advetisement about how much the customers would pay.
Planimal  -  An animal that's at least partially plant.
Nonchalant Dodge  -  Alice dodged 1. and barely moved, 2. in the last second possible, or 3. and didn't pay attention.
Phlebotinum Bomb  -  Bomb that destroys certain things and leaves the rest undamaged.
Silly Rabbit Cynicism Is For Losers  -  A cynical character has their worldview proven incorrect or presented as flawed.
Grimy Water  -  Swim in this, and you're dead.
I Need To Go Iron My Dog  -  An unconvincing or implausible excuse.
Beware The Superman  -  The existence of superpowers has an almost if not entirely negative effect on the world.
He Who Fights Monsters  -  Character becomes the very evil they fought against.
Unwilling Suspension  -  The ceiling is a good place to chain people from if you're low on options.
Trapped With The Therapy Session  -  Interpersonal drama happens, and an uninvolved third party is stuck there watching it.
Tension Cutting Laughter  -  Laughter that deflates the tension built up over a scene or sequence.
Cats Are Superior  -  Cats are better than humans (or dogs, or any other type of animal) — and they know it.
Straw Affiliation  -  If you're a part of this group, you must fit a certain stereotype.
Ominous Cube  -  Foreboding, cube-shaped Plot Devices.
Death Dealer  -  This person uses playing cards as weapons.
Lite Creme  -  Using Weasel Words to make a food sound 'better' somehow.
Took A Level In Kindness  -  Nicer character development.
No Such Thing As Wizard Jesus  -  The demonstrated existence of superpowers doesn't dilute religious miracles.
Wetware Body  -  Organic bodies possessed by A.I.
Our Souls Are Different  -  Ambiguous spiritual energy, that can contain anything from one's mind, to life energy, to emotions, morality or even memories.
And Knowing Is Half The Battle  -  That last-second Aesop Tag at the end of a cartoon.
Never Grew Up  -  The character is, in-universe, unable to grow up.
The Blacksmith  -  A character who specializes in crafting things (usually weapons and armor) with iron and/or steel.
Non Idle Rich  -  Rich characters that actually get out and do things.
Religion Is Right  -  Religious beliefs are demonstrably accurate.
Pirate Girl  -  Even feminines make good pirates.
Drop Pod  -  A single-use vehicle used to launch troops from space or the air quickly into battle.
Teleporting Keycard Squad  -  Take item; receive instant Mook rush.
Emphasize Everything  -  Absolutely EVERYTHING is treated as crucially important.
A Date With Rosie Palms  -  Masturbation.
Neutral Female  -  While two male characters are battling each other, one female character is also present and could interfere but chooses not to.
The Man Behind The Monsters  -  A human (or something resembling a human) leads an army of monsters.
You Fight Like A Cow  -  Exchanging witty insults during combat.
Chronoscope  -  A device that allows its user to view past and future events.
I Can See My House From Here  -  When extremely high up, a character comments they can see their residence from their vantage point.
Evil Is Not A Toy  -  Don't open the can if you can't control the Sealed Evil inside of it.
Sleazy Politician  -  They lie, cheat, take bribes...and they're running for public office.
More Than Infinite  -  Something is infinite, so something needs to go beyond that.
Space Filling Empire  -  The earth is home to a limited number of large countries.
Beard Of Barbarism  -  Barbarians don't shave.
Animals Lack Attributes  -  Artistic Censorship of Non-humanoid Animals.
New Year Has Come  -  A work set on New Year's Eve.
War Has Never Been So Much Fun  -  Strategy video games that eschew the Real Is Brown aesthetic for something more colorful.
Attention Deficit Ooh Shiny  -  The character is very easily distracted.
Widely Spaced Jail Bars  -  If that drawing was a realistic depiction of jail bars, then the imprisoned could just walk out.
Scenery As You Go  -  The area builds/manifests itself into existence as you travel through it.
Better Living Through Evil  -  The villain makes sure that his job offers are tempting.
The Cartel  -  Latin American organized crime who primarily deal in the drug trade.
The Artful Dodger  -  Crafty, street-wise homeless child.
Disappearing Bullets  -  In media, bullets never seem to overpenetrate their targets.
Whos Laughing Now  -  A Butt-Monkey or Chew Toy becomes a villain.
Creepy Crows  -  Ravens and crows are disturbing, if not outright evil.
Transparent Closet  -  Alice is gay. Everyone knows except Alice.
Omnicidal Maniac  -  A villain who wants to destroy everything.
Coitus Ensues  -  A sex scene that comes completely out of nowhere.
Top Heavy Guy  -  A man with an upside-down-triangular frame consisting of a heavily-built upper body and a noticeably less-than-built lower body.
Backstory Horror  -  Horrifying details of a Backstory directly explained in Canon and/or from Word of God.
Take That Audience  -  The work makes fun of its own audience.
Overrated And Underleveled  -  A "legendary warrior" joins your party, and he's not very good in gameplay.
Glowing Eyes Of Doom  -  Glowing eyes mean Bad Things are about to happen.
Appendage Assimilation  -  Character "regenerates" their lost limbs by stealing them from others.
Cliffhanger Copout  -  Events leading up to a cliffhanger are retconned in the next instalment to have a different outcome.
Real Is Brown  -  Desaturated colors automatically means more realistic.
Synchronization  -  One character's pain is felt by the other character at the same time.
High Turnover Rate  -  When many people fill a job in a short time.
Refusing Paradise  -  A dead character chooses to return from the dead instead of going to a peaceful afterlife.
Shameful Strip  -  A character is stripped of their clothing as a form of humiliation.
Successful Sibling Syndrome  -  Someone lives in the shadow of their more successful sibling.
Hacker Collective  -  A group of hackers.
Clingy Aquatic Life  -  A character comes out of a body of water with an aquatic animal or plant stuck to them.
Blunt Yes  -  A character bluntly answers yes to a question whose asker would consider a "no" or some other hesitation more appropriate.
Charity Workplace Calendar  -  Posing for a workplace calendar to raise money.
Evil Smells Bad  -  Something evil or dangerous comes from a repulsive stench.
Dead All Along  -  They only looked alive.
Cat Smile  -  A character goes :3
Dr Fakenstein  -  A Mad Scientist whose name references Victor Frankenstein.
Star Trek Movie Curse  -  A long-running franchise that alternates between well-received and poorly-received installments.
Hard Work Fallacy  -  The misconception that hard work is the only thing needed to succeed.
Put On A Bus To Hell  -  A character is Put on a Bus through rather spiteful means.
Metal Poor Planet  -  People settle on a planet with little to no available metal.
Your Days Are Numbered  -  Character is going to die and knows it.
Straight Man And Wise Guy  -  A duo consisting of a Straight Man and a Plucky Comic Relief.
Evil Orphan  -  Not all orphans are heartwarming.
Hashtag Rap  -  Lyric— *Beat*— Connected Phrase.
Instant Expert  -  You got something new, and it takes all of three nanoseconds to learn how to use it.
Psychotic Smirk  -  Little smile, BIG trouble.
Forgiven But Not Forgotten  -  A character forgives others, but still will not forget what they've done.
Artifact Domination  -  The Ancient Artifact controls the wielder, not the other way around.
What The Fu Are You Doing  -  Hilarity Ensues when you suck at martial arts.
Traumatic C Section  -  A cesarean section performed for drama.
Springy Spores  -  Bouncy mushrooms.
Mistaken For Afterlife  -  Someone thinks they have died and gone to an afterlife.
Casino Park  -  Big, flashy Casino-themed level. Usually over-the-top.
Elite Four  -  Four Is Death, so groups of four spell doom.
Narrative Filigree  -  Works full of details that are interesting, but not necessary for the plot.
Identity Amnesia  -  A character with amnesia forgets their entire life and identity.
Double Speak  -  A character thinks of themselves or their job with polite euphemisms.
Pure Energy  -  Although energy is the capacity to do work and work is interpretable as "action for producing reaction", "pure" energy is treated like a substance that is also manipulatable at will.
Indy Hat Roll  -  Rolling under the slow door right before it closes.
The Final Temptation  -  Character is given a chance to abandon his difficult life for a better one, complete with imagery for the latter.
Points Of Light Setting  -  A setting that consists of numerous small communities separated by a hostile expanse.
Manual Misprint  -  Sometimes, even the freaking manual gets stuff wrong.
Vampiric Draining  -  The ability to suck blood or drain life in a "vampiric" fashion.
Tear Off Your Face  -  A character gets their face destroyed or removed.
You Know What You Did  -  A character assumes the worst about someone without bothering to confirm it.
Trickster Twins  -  Rascally twins.
New Season New Name  -  Same TV show, with a new title every season.
Astral Finale  -  The Climax of a mostly planet-bound work happens in outer space.
Jaded Professional  -  A character who used to enjoy their job, but they now hate it.
Suicide By Cop  -  Killing oneself with another's hands.
Inscrutable Aliens  -  Aliens about whom we know nothing and with whom we can't communicate.
Bribe Backfire  -  A character's attempt to bribe someone makes the situation even worse for them.
Divine Right Of Kings  -  Royals rule by right granted to them by God or some other supernatural entity.
Cool Clear Water  -  Clear water = Clean water. Unlike in Real Life.
Flying Dutchman  -  Those who wander for the rest of their lives. Sometimes forever.
Mass Oh Crap  -  Multiple characters go like Oh, Crap! simultaneously.
Higher Tech Species  -  A race with access to technology far more advanced compared to other races.
Ninja Editor  -  Some dumbass who edits posts sixty-nine times in a microsecond for no reason.note This page was edited 666 times since you opened it, but it was so fast that not even we know what has been written.
Artifact Collection Agency  -  An organization that specializes in collecting Ancient Artifacts.
Adoptive Name Change  -  A character gets their name changed upon being adopted.
Family Title  -  Work named after the leading family.
Superweapon  -  An ultimate weapon or defense with no true counter.
Minigame Zone  -  An area of the game that allows you to play several minigames.
Language Of Truth  -  A language with which you literally cannot tell any lie or false statement.
Entendre Failure  -  Why is everyone laughing? Was that line supposed to be dirty or something?

Just Between You And Me  -  Speech detailing the Big Bad's Evil Plan.

Driven By Envy  -  The Green-Eyed Monster tries to take down The Protagonist.
True Love Is Exceptional  -  You prefer Type Xs but end up falling in love with a Type Y.

Birthday Suit Surprise Party  -  Somebody inadvertently attends a surprise celebration naked.
Legitimate Businessmens Social Club  -  Criminal organization with a legitimate front; may or may not be obvious.
Plagued By Nightmares  -  When a character has either the same nightmare or a similar series of nightmares repeatedly, signifying an underlying issue.

Fruit Cart  -  An outdoor, easily-smashed display will get smashed.
It Was A Gift  -  A character's possession is given significance by having it given to them.
Terrible Artist  -  Characters have comically bad art skills.
Enlightenment Superpowers  -  Superpowers are available to anyone who achieves the necessary level of spiritual enlightenment.
Finagles Law  -  Anything that can go wrong, will, in the worst, most spectacular way.
Go And Sin No More  -  The hero spares the villain and tells them to atone for their crimes.
I Sophagus  -  Someone swallows a musical instrument or electronic device and it still plays inside of them.

Confess To A Lesser Crime  -  The criminal pleads guilty to a lesser crime to avoid punishment for a bigger one.
Sword And Gun  -  A blade in one hand and a firearm in the other.
Embarrassing Rescue  -  A character finds being rescued embarassing and is angry with the rescuer for helping them.
Junkie Parent  -  A parent who is addicted to drugs, often neglecting their children in the process.
Forgotten First Meeting  -  Two characters meet each other and think they've never met before. They have, a long time ago, but either one or both of them has forgotten.
White Anglo Saxon Protestant  -  Stereotypical snobby white person.
Itasha  -  Let me show you how much I love my anime by pasting decals of the characters on my car.
Standard Fifties Father  -  The dependable, reasonable, squeaky-clean, paternal figure of sitcoms past.

Ripple Effect Proof Memory  -  Even though you went back in time and changed history, you still know what originally happened...

Aspect Ratio  -  The shape of a rectangular image or screen, being the ratio of width to height.
