Relative Button  -  Villain kicks the dog by taunting a victim about their family/friend/lover/whatever that the bad guy killed - unfortunately for them, this tends to be a major breaking point for the victim.
Humongous Mecha  -  GIANT ROBOTS!
Role Playing Endgame  -  When a Tabletop RPG includes explicit rules for retiring player characters or even for ending the entire campaign.
Darth Vader Clone  -  An Expy of Darth Vader.
Revenant Zombie  -  Our Zombies can think and behave like the living.
Inheritance Backlash  -  You just inherited something awesome! But you're going to pay for it one way or another...
Beergasm  -  An over-the-top expression of pleasure after taking a drink.
Raised By Grandparents  -  A character is (or was) raised by grandparents instead of their parents.
Chic And Awe  -  One character assumes that another will be unattractive, but, upon seeing them in person for the first time, discovers that they're incredibly good-looking.
Recurring Fanon Character  -  A fan-made or unofficial character that becomes ridiculously popular in the fandom.
Spider Tank  -  More legs than a Walking Tank.
Curiosity Causes Conversion  -  Evil Cannot Comprehend Good, and will, in trying to, eventually find itself to have become good.
Idiot Ball  -  A character who is normally much more competent starts acting stupid in order to drive the plot forward.
Cheese Eating Surrender Monkeys  -  Stereotype depicting the French as cowards at war.
The Unfought  -  A major antagonist who is never fought despite being built up as an opponent.
Comically Inept Healing  -  Maybe we should call an actual doctor.
Pieta Plagiarism  -  Art Imitates Art with Michelangelo Buonarroti's Pietà.
Incomprehensible Entrance Exam  -  Becoming a student/member/employee requires a test that makes little to no sense.
How Much Did You Hear  -  The answer is, "more than you intended, apparently."
Secret Room  -  A hidden room in a building, usually holding plot-relevant items.
Happier Home Movie  -  A character watches an old video of their life to reminisce on happier days.
Bug War  -  A war involving (usually giant) insect-like or otherwise non-humanoid creatures from outer space.
Elfeminate  -  Male elves look effeminate.
Near Villain Victory  -  The Bad Guy Almost Wins.
Hot Teacher  -  A T.I.L.F. ("Teacher I'd Like to Fuck")
Cant Live With Them Cant Live Without Them  -  A solitary character is fond of another character's unwanted company.
Clothes Make The Legend  -  A character's outfit stays the same because it's so iconic.
Canon Sue  -  A stand-in for the author which is a Mary Sue; essentially, an Escapist Character for the author.
Trapped With Monster Plot  -  Characters are in a Closed Circle with something hunting them.
Intoxication Ensues  -  A character accidentally consumes something which makes them go bananas.
Walkie Talkie Gag Over  -  Two characters confuse due to not being familiar with the codes over the walkie talkie.
Pinned Down  -  A friendly or enemy is forced to Take Cover! by opposing gunfire, and cannot move from their position.
Not Your Daddys X  -  Remember X? It's back and better than ever!
Sharpshooter Fallacy  -  Using the same data to generate both the hypothesis and the conclusion.
Pink Means Feminine  -  Pink and femininity go hand-in-hand.
Wedding Finale  -  Ending a story with a wedding.
The Omniscient  -  Knows everything.
What Do You Mean Its Not Political  -  The audience reading political allegory into a work that didn't intend it.
Ineffectual Sympathetic Villain  -  A villain who fails so often that you feel sorry for them.
Second Person Narration  -  The narrator tells what happens to you, the main character, through the story.
Disabled In The Adaptation  -  A character has a disability in an adaptation that they didn't have in the original.
Sexier Alter Ego  -  A character takes on a more attractive version of themselves.
Rated G For Gangsta  -  Making it to mainstream causes a lot of R-Rated performers to do more mainstream-friendly works.
Thermal Dissonance  -  An object or creature is remarked to be different in temperature than what it clearly should be.
Food God  -  God of whatever food is the basis for a culture's survival.
Two Teacher School  -  The school staff are an Oddly Small Organization.
Sanity Has Advantages  -  Insanity could be easily exploitable.
Watching The Sunset  -  A couple watches the sunset.
Discontinuity Nod  -  Character makes a backhanded reference to a Canon Discontinuity, or a Fanon one.
Stillborn Franchise  -  A "franchise" that doesn't live past its first installment.
NOT  -  You say something without tacking on a "not" or a "yeah, right" at the end. NOT!
Its Not Supposed To Win Oscars  -  Asserting that certain entertainment doesn't need to be well-written, directed, acted, etc.
Flashback Echo  -  Flashback to an event that parallels the current plot.
Red Headed Stepchild  -  The token red-head is ripe for abuse.
Going By The Matchbook  -  The logo of a book of matches provides a clue to where its owner has recently been: the location where he obtained it.
Contractual Immortality  -  Did they die? Nah, their actor's contract is still in effect.
Da Chief  -  The guy who tells you to Turn in Your Badge.
Escape Route Surprise  -  A false route of escape, usually with a door leading to danger instead of an exit.
Fixed Forward Facing Weapon  -  A powerful front-facing weapon that you can only aim by turning the entire vehicle.
The Coup  -  Overthrow of the government by illegal means other than full-scale rebellion.
Sexophone  -  Sax is for sex.
Le Film Artistique  -  Because true movies are angsty and incomprehensible.
My Fist Forgives You  -  Punching someone as a way of forgiving them.
Fiery Lion  -  A lion with a fire motif.
Talkative Loon  -  A character is shown as crazy by the way they speak; high on words, low on meaning.
Franchise Original Sin  -  A flaw with the franchise that was there before it became 'bad', but now lacks what first balanced it out.
Teens Are Short  -  In Hollywood, shorter means younger.
Time Travel Tense Trouble  -  Time travel usually will be going to have been complicating verb usage.
Warm Hearted Walrus  -  When walruses are portrayed as heroic and/or lovable characters.
Sympathetic Adulterer  -  Infidelity is justified.
Love Goddess  -  A deity of love.
Backhanded Apology  -  How to apologize to someone in the most insulting manner possible.
Strong Ants  -  Ants are so strong, they can carry away pretty much everything.
Fighting Irish  -  We Irish love a good bit o' fightin'.
Video Game Cruelty Punishment  -  Being a dick in-game has dire consequences.
Immune To Mind Control  -  A character is unable to fall under any sort of Mind Manipulation.
Born Again Immortality  -  An immortal character is rebirthed as an infant upon death.
If You Kill Him You Will Be Just Like Him  -  Killing villains leads you to Jumping Off the Slippery Slope.
A Match Made In Stockholm  -  Two people end up becoming lovers or friends after one kidnaps the other.
Razor Floss  -  Strings that slice.
Fake Hair Drama  -  Drama over wigs, weaves and such.
Suspiciously Similar Song  -  Soundtrack that sounds familiar, but at the same time not exactly.
Fictionary  -  A made-up language based off an existing language, retaining the latter's grammatical structure.
He Panned It Now He Sucks  -  When a critic receives a backlash for negatively reviewing a well-loved work.
See You In Hell  -  A dying character says some variation of, "I'll See You in Hell."
Always Someone Better  -  Anything you can do, another character can do better (even if it's something you're really good at).
Forgot To Gag Him  -  A character is restrained, but not prevented from talking, which lets them be a threat anyway.
You Wouldnt Hit A Guy With Glasses  -  If you wear glasses and say this phrase, chances are you'll get hit.
Eye Catch  -  This series will return after the commercial break. But first, here's a poster-esque image of something/someone relevant to the show.
Gender Blender Name  -  Character's name is typical for the opposite gender.
Epic Rocking  -  A really, really long song.
Stone Punk  -  Cavemen modernize with tech made from rocks and animals (dead or not).
Hippie Van  -  The vehicle of choice for weirdos.
Happiness In Mind Control  -  A victim of Mind Manipulation prefers what has been done to them.
First Love  -  The first person a character has ever fallen in love with.
Great Big Library Of Everything  -  A giant library that has essentially every informational source that can be found.
Mother Goddess  -  Immortal goddess and creator of the world.
Zeroth Law Rebellion  -  Being disobedient by technically following the rules.
Boundareefs  -  Visible obstructions that prevent travel by sea.
Fisticuffs Boss  -  A boss you must fight unarmed.
No Endor Holocaust  -  An event that should cause massive collateral damage, but doesn't.
Long Last Look  -  A character takes a moment to get one last look at something or someone before leaving it forever.
Copy Cat Sue  -  A Mary Sue just like the author's favorite character.
Creator Worship  -  Creators who are particularly revered by their fans.
Under Age Casting  -  Actor or actress is too young to be the character they're portraying.
Fetish Fuel Future  -  Any fictional setting where the sexual kinks of the author are considered normal by society.
Wacky Parent Serious Child  -  A goofy, laid back adult has a more mature child.
Man Of Steel Woman Of Kleenex  -  A character with supernatural characteristics has sex. Fridge Horror ensues.
Freaky Friday Sabotage  -  One party in a "Freaky Friday" Flip takes measures to ensure that during the switch, the other party will find themselves in an unpleasant situation.
Genre Busting  -  Work does not fit into any established genre.
New Parent Nomenclature Problem  -  A character debates what to call a caregiver who isnt their biological parent.
Mad Science Fair  -  Mad Scientist Science Fair
Nineties Anti Hero  -  Violent and ruthless Anti-Hero with gritty design and an aggressive and/or rough personality
Foxy Vixen  -  Fox Folk for Fanservice, usually as a Visual Pun.
Place Before Time  -  A universe that existed before the current one
Spammer  -  Someone who sends a mass, unwanted message (usually of commercial nature) to tons of e-mail addresses, posts it to fora, or uses other methods to send/post it. Alternately, someone posts something repetitive and of zero value to where it's posted.
Talking Animal  -  An animal that can talk. Has little or no human-like features apart from this.
Taser Tag Weakness  -  Using electricity to take down powerful enemies.
Tree Buchet  -  Spring action turns a tree into a catapult.
Last Girl Wins  -  The last lover interest introduced ends up being the one that lasts.
Deflector Shields  -  Invisible shields against enemies.
Rival Turned Evil  -  A friend becomes a rival, then an enemy.
Overcome With Desire  -  When hormones are too strong to resist.
Spiteful Suicide  -  A character commits suicide just to spite someone.
Legion Of Lost Souls  -  Fictional portrayals of the French Foreign Legion.
Crucified Hero Shot  -  Character's arms are outstretched, reminiscent of crucified Jesus.
Enemy Mine  -  Enemies team up against a common threat.
Porn With Plot  -  There's sex in it — but nobody watches it just for that.
Open Fly Gag  -  Uh, hello, your zip's undone!
Post Victory Collapse  -  Someone collapses after completing an awesome but strenuous task.
Death In The Clouds  -  The trope: Somebody is murdered while on an airplane.
Death Of The Hypotenuse  -  Alice loves Bob and Charlie. Charlie dies.
Tomboyish Voice  -  A female character has a low and/or raspy voice to signify them as a tomboy.
Fantastic Fauna Counterpart  -  A fantasy species takes the place of a real life animal, or a real life animal takes the role of another animal.
Stock Star Systems  -  Frequently used stars (not counting our own Sun) in science fiction.
Security Blanket  -  An item that leaves its owner feeling vulnerable if bereft of it.
Bull Seeing Red  -  The colour red is a Berserk Button for bulls.
The Multiverse  -  A way of connecting different works of fiction with different rules, allowing for crossovers.
Cement Shoes  -  It's what you wear when you go sleep with the fishes.
Not Evil Just Misunderstood  -  A character/object isn't really evil. Just misunderstood
Heroic Sacrifice  -  Character sacrifices him/herself to save others.
Stealthy Mook  -  A Mook whose speciality is stealth, hiding and camouflage.
Human Mom Non Human Dad  -  Half-Human Hybrid's mother is human, their father is not.
Dying Town  -  Soon-to-be Ghost Town.
Now Or Never Kiss  -  Because a pair of people think that they're gonna die, they decide to kiss.
Cobweb Of Disuse  -  You know that no one's been around in a long time if there are lots of cobwebs.
Friendly Neighborhood Vampire  -  Vampires that need blood but don't want to hurt you.
Elder Employee  -  A (usually) elderly potential employee, competent or otherwise, who works at or applies for a job that is more suitable for a younger person.
Safe Sane And Consensual  -  If no one gets seriously hurt, no one's under the influence of anything, and everyone wants to do this, then it's fine.
The Drifter  -  A protagonist who walks the Earth, helps in a place for a time and always leaves in the end.
Excuse Plot  -  A plot that's just an excuse for the action happening.
Under The Sea  -  Generic Video Game underwater level.
Blasphemous Boast  -  A character compares themselves favorably to a deity.
Short Lived Big Impact  -  A person or thing that has only been around for a short time, but its impact can still be felt in modern life today.
Guest Fighter  -  A character from a pre-existing franchise appears in another franchise.
Early Installment Weirdness  -  First releases of franchises that include very surprising differences in specific tropes or even the absence of a trope that later became predominant in that work.
Of Corsets Sexy  -  A character wears a corset as outerwear and/or as part of fanservice-y outfit.
Professionals Do It On Desks  -  Sex on a desk.
Mars Wants Chocolate  -  Earth food: so delicious, even aliens want it.
Barely There Swimwear  -  Swimwear that's thin on the "wear".
Avengers Assemble  -  Heroes, take your positions and let's go kick some ass!
Do Not Drop Your Weapon  -  Characters never lose a grip on their weapon until they die.
All Therapists Are Muggles  -  A character needs therapy, but the events they need to talk about are part of some big secret that no human therapist knows about.
Man Eating Plant  -  A massive carnivorous plant.
Run The Gauntlet  -  Fighting several notable enemies in quick succession.
Long Runners  -  TV shows, books, and other forms of media that have been around forever.
Elemental Baggage  -  Those with Elemental Powers seem to take their fuel from Hammerspace.
Crazy Jealous Guy  -  Get your hands off my girl!
The All American Boy  -  The innocent, cheerful, athletic, adolescent boy in American sitcoms from decades' past.
I Shall Return  -  The hero must leave the people who helped him in peril, but vows to come back and save them.
Act Of True Love  -  An act of sacrifice or high risk, motivated by love, which proves beyond a doubt that you put your loved one's needs before your own.
Strawman Product  -  Ad makes Product X look better by depicting Product Y as crap.
Canon Immigrant  -  A Canon Foreigner that's been put into official Canon.
Overt Operative  -  Secret agent that isn't.
Cultural Posturing  -  My culture is better than yours!
Method Acting  -  Trying to think like the character, rather than simply act like the character.
Enemy To All Living Things  -  This character's powers/aura hurt everything that breathes.
Impassable Desert  -  Deserts in video games are impossible/almost impossible to pass until certain conditions are met.
Useful Book  -  Additional usages of books other than reading.
Straw Nihilist  -  Overly dramatic depictions of nihilistic philosophers in media.
Direct To Video  -  When a movie is never in theaters.
Insulted Awake  -  Insulting people gets them awake.
Underwater Base  -  A underwater Home Base
Parody Retcon  -  Yes, but it sucked on purpose!
Unreplaced Departed  -  When a member leaves the bunch and doesn't take in any new member in their place.
Troubled Fetal Position  -  Hugging your knees when overwhelmed emotionally.
The Man Is Sticking It To The Man  -  Be rebellious by buying what we're selling.
Back To Front  -  Reversed is things of order.
Context Sensitive Button  -  A video game control that does different things depending on the current situation.
Only The Creator Does It Right  -  It wasn't made by the series' creator; therefore, it automatically sucks.
Archive Panic  -  Hey, this work is kinda interesting. Let's hit the archives- HOLY CRAP, THAT'S A LOT OF MATERIAL!
Banana Republic  -  Fictional Latin American dictatorship.
Physical Therapy Plot  -  A severely-injured character needs physical therapy to gain their mobility back, while learning to persevere and overcoming doubts and physical limitations.
Depraved Bisexual  -  An Ax-Crazy bisexual.
Our Presidents Are Different  -  Fictional world leaders.
Appeal To Worse Problems  -  Being concerned about one issue means you don't care about more serious issues.
Sacrificial Lion  -  Significant character is killed to show that death really is a threat.
Myopic Conqueror  -  When The Conqueror has no plans or interests for a place he conquers.
Chained To A Railway  -  Impending death by train.
Charity Motivation Song  -  A big, extravagant song made to encourage people to donate to charity, often featuring lots of celebrities.
Mistaken For Masturbating  -  Someone is thought to be masturbating when they are not.
No New Fashions In The Future  -  The series is set in the future, the outfits resemble contemporary fashion.
All Natural Gem Polish  -  Naturally occurring gems are already cut and polished.
Translation Punctuation  -  Use of nonstandard punctuation and/or formatting to indicate the use of a Translation Convention.
Eternal Love  -  Immortal or near-immortal couple whose Romance Arc can last for centuries.
Recoiled Across The Room  -  Blowing someone across the room will cause you to be blown as well
World Of Symbolism  -  All the characters and/or events are symbolic of something.
Effortless Achievement  -  The game gives you an achievement just for doing a very easy and inevitable early-game task.
Multi Directional Barrage  -  Shooting in every direction at once.
Give Me Back My Wallet  -  A pickpocket is caught in the act by their intended victim.
Greater Scope Villain  -  An evil that is greater than the Big Bad in some way, but is not directly causing the conflict of the story.
I Warned You  -  Crying Wolf finally comes true.
One Bullet Clips  -  Magazines and clips aren't counted separately in a video game's ammo pool; only the rounds themselves do.
Egopolis  -  Naming places after one of your country's leaders.
Bolivian Army Cliffhanger  -  The Season Finale ends with a cliffhanger leaving the audience uncertain who survived and who did not.
What The Romans Have Done For Us  -  The Evil Empire is actually helping people.
Adaptational Mundanity  -  Characters are normal and more realistic in-adaptation.
The Hashshashin  -  The order of assassins from the Medieval Middle East.
Groove Metal  -  A slower, Bluesy version of Thrash Metal.
It Seemed Trivial  -  Knows important information, but not that the information is important, so they don't mention it.
Government Drug Enforcement  -  The Law is an aggressive drug dealer.
Witless Protection Program  -  In fiction, Witness Protection never works.
Everything Makes A Mushroom  -  Any explosion or sufficiently forceful impact will create a mushroom cloud.
Mad God  -  A deity with an unstable mindset to go with his vast power.
Gratuitous German  -  Using German instead of words in your own language, often in a way that seems odd to actual speakers.
Good Flaws Bad Flaws  -  Character Alignment is determined by a character's imperfections (and the severity thereof).
Freestyle Version  -  An artist performs their own lyrics over the beat and melody of someone else's song.
Beating A Dead Player  -  Aggressive enemy A.I. stays aggressive even after the player is dead.
What Were You Thinking  -  Character A does a stupid thing that goes horribly wrong. Character B asks the reason behind such stupidity.
Dont Say Such Stupid Things  -  Telling people to stop putting themselves down in a blunt manner.
Too Happy To Live  -  If the start of a narrative has overly happy people, watch out. They're in for a world of hurt.
Acting Unnatural  -  Telling someone to act ordinary makes them act odd and obvious.
Sibling Team  -  Siblings that work together side-by-side.
First Kiss  -  Character's first kiss is Serious Business.
Magical Girlfriend  -  A supernatural woman of your dreams moves in with you to start the plot.
GIFT  -  Being anonymous usually makes you act more like a dick.
Everythings Better With Llamas  -  Llamas are great and they can improve almost anything.
Voiceover Letter  -  Someone reading out a letter out loud, which fades into the sender's voice then back into the receiver's voice.
Superpower Lottery  -  Superpowers are common, but the powers of a character who's "won the lottery" are far greater than most.
Het Is Ew  -  Yaoi Fans and Yuri Fans view heterosexual ships as "gross".
Steven Ulysses Perhero  -  Character's real name hints at their abilities or role.
Suddenly Harmful Harmless Object  -  Innocuous-looking scenery starts attacking you once you set off the Scripted Event.
Parting Words Regret  -  A character regrets the last thing they said to someone who died or left.
Sixties Hair  -  Hairstyles of the 1960s. (Bouffants, beehives, geometric bobs, bigger pompadours, hippie hair)
Designated Monkey  -  A Butt-Monkey whom the audience sympathizes with or feels that their abuse is overkill.
Sickeningly Sweethearts  -  The way these two show their love for each other is adorable, but flat out obnoxious.
Wingdinglish  -  A fictional language that's actually English with a really strange font.
Madness Makeover  -  Insanity reflected through physical appearance, followed by unsettling results.
Tough Act To Follow  -  A creator makes such a great work that it overshadows everything they do afterwards.
Touche  -  A character gracefully concedes a good point or event in the other's favor.
Color Coded Stones  -  Jewels, gemstones, minerals and other precious objects have stock colors associated with them.
Floating Clocks  -  Clocks can be seen floating around when someone is time traveling.
Huge Schoolgirl  -  A girl is unusually huge for her gender, and thus is self-conscious about her size.
Blatant Burglar  -  Burglars dress in ways that make them obviously burglars.
Vicious Cycle  -  Bad events occur on a strict, repeating schedule.
Monster Mash  -  Massive Multiplayer Crossover between iconic monsters from the world of fiction.
Slimeball  -  A sleazy, and morally-slippery character.
Copycat Mockery  -  Making fun of someone by copying their mannerisms.
Signing Off Catch Phrase  -  A certain phrase or collection of phrases said at the end of every episode.
Compromising Call  -  An attempt at stealth fails because someone left their cell phone turned on.
Hollywood Mirage  -  Mirages portrayed as full-out hallucinations.
Retroactive Recognition  -  Well-known actors/actress before they were recognized.
Invisible Anatomy  -  Parts of the body (mostly appendages) are invisible.
Conscience Makes You Go Back  -  A character walks away from those in need, but stops and helps them anyway.
War Elephants  -  Elephants intimidate your opponents when you ride them.
Mary Sue  -  An implausibly flawless character and/or an idealized stand-in for the author most often found in fan works.
Pop Goes The Human  -  Someone inflates so big they pop.
EX Special Attack  -  A powered-up special attack executed by spending part of a meter.
Poverty Food  -  An unattractive, usually mushy meal as a shorthand for poverty.
Cooldown Hug  -  Hug counteracts a Freak Out.
Bathroom Break Out  -  Using the privacy of a toilet break to escape from your captors.
Nice Job Fixing It Villain  -  Villain makes things better and accidentally helps everyone.
Did Not Do The Bloody Research  -  Misusing swear words when writing foreign dialogue.
Guyliner  -  Guy wearing eyeliner.
Dancin In The Ruins  -  Someone is happy to see that a civilisation has been destroyed.
Historical Villain Downgrade  -  Historical figure was even worse in real life.
Unacceptable Targets  -  Not considered fair game for ridicule or scorn.
Washy Watchy  -  Watching the laundry spin in the washing machine is treated as great entertainment.
Tick Tock Terror  -  Creepy and/or haunted places have an ominous clock chime / tick / both as part of their sound background or soundtrack.
Sexy Priest  -  A handsome priest who may or may not exploit that fact.
Sea Sinkhole  -  A hole in the middle of the ocean with water continuously pouring in. Somehow, it never seems to fill up.
Vampire Vannabe  -  Vampire groupies.
White Flag  -  The universal symbol for a surrender.
Golden Moment  -  A moment where An Aesop is delivered in a Sitcom, usually fried in schmaltz with added cheese.
The Girl Who Fits This Slipper  -  The only character compatible with something specific.
Plot Tunnel  -  The player's freedom of exploration is temporarily suspended until plot-relevant levels are cleared.
Gamebooks  -  Turn to page 203 for book-form interactive fiction.
Hope Bringer  -  This character acts as the inspiration for his civilization.
Irony  -  An outcome of events contrary to what was, or might have been, expected.
Unwanted Harem  -  Character annoyed by too many love interests.
Nuclear Option  -  Nukes used reasonably.
Anti Role Model  -  This character sets a bad example for kids everyone.
Hollywood Genetics  -  Biologically related characters look way different.
Quicksand Box  -  I can go anywhere! Where do I go?
Collect A Thon Platformer  -  Platform Game where progress depends on stuff you collect by exploring around.
Fleeting Passionate Hobbies  -  A character gains a hobby, gets passionate about it, then abandons it.
Meaningless Meaningful Words  -  Sure, it sounds meaningful, but does it actually mean anything?
Dramatic Chase Opening  -  A story begins with a dramatic chase scene.
Gossipy Hens  -  Girls love to Gossip.
All Star Cast  -  The best of the best, all acting in the same movie or TV series.
Lethal Klutz  -  Clumsy. Dangerous. Clueless. RUN!!!
Second Super Identity  -  When a superhero creates another super identity.
Funetik Aksent  -  Werdz spellt lyke tha carictur sez 'em, orr lyke un alitturut pursun wood rite 'em.
Blood Sport  -  Sports + violence = awesome.
Backup From Otherworld  -  The dead acting as reinforcements for the not-dead.
Sub Trope  -  Tropes that focus on a specific aspect or implementation of a broader idea conveyed in a Super-Trope
Ultimate Gamer 386  -  The one and only master of MMORPG gaming.
Stock Ness Monster  -  Fictional portrayals of the Loch Ness Monster and other similar lake creatures.
Face Of The Band  -  The lead singer is sometimes the only member of the band that is recognized by the audience, depending on the form the band is marketed.
Implied Love Interest  -  They may or may not be a couple since Word of God neither confirms nor denies.
I Miss Mom  -  A character misses their mother, be it that she passed away or is beyond their reach. Usually a Stock Phrase.
One Dialogue Two Conversations  -  A conversation where everyone is talking about something different.
Cunning Linguist  -  Master debater of many tongues in the team.
Burly Detective Syndrome  -  Authors using descriptions instead of the names of characters in narration.
Even The Rats Wont Touch It  -  Something so disgusting even vermin won't eat it.
Degraded Boss  -  First appears as a boss, then as a regular enemy.
Thought Controlled Power  -  Any superpower or magic that is controlled by thought or will alone.
Fantastic Romance  -  A romance that is only possible due to magic or highly advanced technology.
Playing The Player  -  A game mechanic lies to the player about the game's plot.
Seadog Beard  -  Sailors and pirates will grow long beards.
Moral Guardians  -  Viewers that morally object to certain types of work and wish to see it banned or censored.
Screw Learning I Have Phlebotinum  -  Increased brain power means knowing things you never learned.
Flying Cutlery Spaceship  -  Impractically aggressive-looking spiky, bladed spaceships.
Cowboy Cop  -  A loose cannon cop who DOESN'T play by the rules!
Real Time With Pause  -  The ability to affect gameplay while it's paused.
Polish The Turd  -  Making something bad look good.
Letting The Air Out Of The Band  -  The music slows to a stop upon the revealing of something not so good.
Disproportionate Celebration  -  Characters overreact over minor achievements.
Fighting Spirit  -  A fighter's spiritual power manifests as an active physical entity.
The Art Of Bra Removal  -  Men can't undo bras to save their lives.
I Hit You You Hit The Ground  -  Stock Phrase candidly declaring violent intent.
Good Luck Gesture  -  Hand gestures used as anti-jinx measure, to gain good luck or avoid back luck, or to express intense hope.
Combat Hand Fan  -  Like your average fan...except weaponized.
Villains Blend In Better  -  Villains blend into new environments easier than heroes.
Always Check Behind The Chair  -  You'll need to look very thoroughly to find certain things in Video Games. Leave no stone unturned!
Hunting Accident  -  A hunting trip is the perfect time to Make It Look Like an Accident.
Repressive But Efficient  -  The Empire is cruel, but efficient.
Vanilla Protagonist  -  The Protagonist is made intentionally bland to allow for more focus on a colorful supporting cast.
Sit Rep  -  Character present gives a Situation Report over a long distance.
Neologism  -  A fairly recently created word.
So Beautiful Its A Curse  -  A character's beauty is a source of problems.
American Robot  -  Metallic freedom fighter fueled by Patriotic Fervor.
Fourth Wall Myopia  -  The audience becomes biased in assessing the actions of characters due to knowing more about events of the story than they do.
Punished For Sympathy  -  A character gets punished or ostracized for showing sympathy to the enemy.
Doppelganger Attack  -  Creating clones to use for Attack or Defense.
Freeze Frame Bonus  -  You won't see it unless you pause the video.
Scully Syndrome  -  Skeptical characters come up with convoluted ways to explain away a phenomenon that is blatantly supernatural in nature.
Fixed Damage Attack  -  An attack always deals a set amount of damage under any circumstances.
It Works Better With Bullets  -  Getting a hold of your opponent's gun... only to find it isn't loaded.
Defensive Feint Trap  -  Fake weakness to trap an enemy.
Out Of Character  -  A character does something that goes against their characterization.
Go Getter Girl  -  A young woman who strives to be perfect in every respect.
Take Over The World  -  The ubiquitous goal of many stock villains: Global domination!
Shadow Discretion Shot  -  Something happening behind the shadows as opposed to seeing it explicitly.
De Power  -  A powerful being or thing loses some or all of their powers.
The Government  -  The government as a malevolent, mysterious force.
Cute Witch  -  A witch that can cast a spell on you without magic through the power of being adorable!
Morality Chain  -  They are the main reason (if not the sole reason) a character doesn't turn completely evil.
One Time Dungeon  -  A level that can only be accessed once, in a game where the other levels can be accessed as many times as you want.
Beam Spam  -  Massive firing of beam or laser weapons.
Wrong Turn At Albuquerque  -  That one wrong turn that screws you over.
Unintentionally Unsympathetic  -  We're supposed to feel bad/cheer for this Jerkass?
Age Appropriate Angst  -  The age of a character determines what is appropriate for them to angst over.
Zombie Gait  -  Zombies are slow.
Indecisive Medium  -  A work in one medium that uses stylistic quirks from a different medium.
Rocket Punch  -  Arm doubles as a self-propelled projectile.
Genocide Backfire  -  Genocide survivors defeat the perpetrator(s).
Wacky Racing  -  Racing with gimmicks.
Religious Russian Roulette  -  If God doesn't come to save me, I'll no longer believe.
Rescued From The Underworld  -  Rescuing a dead character from the afterlife.
Powers In The First Episode  -  People usually unlock their powers in Episode 1.
A Sinister Clue  -  Left-handed people are unsavory.
Either World Domination Or Something About Bananas  -  A translator provides two possible translations, a reasonable one and an absurd one.
Fish Out Of Water  -  Someone in a place or situation outside of their experience or knowledge.
Villain Exit Stage Left  -  The villain is defeated, but escapes.
Child Prodigy  -  A genius younger than 13.
Desk Sweep Of Passion  -  A character clears off an office desk in one mighty sweep to show that they're ready to make love on it.
Fat Idiot  -  Overweight characters are The Ditz.
The Wild Hunt  -  A hunt of the supernatural, where humans are usually the prey.
Shatterpoint Tap  -  In case of emergencies, no need to break the glass. Just tap in the right spot and *boom*!
Cute Little Fangs  -  A character has a small pair of fangs to add to their adorableness.
Schmuck Bait  -  Falling for obvious traps.
Bit Character  -  A character whose role consists merely of a few lines, but is more specific than a generic extra.
Shipping Torpedo  -  One character dislikes the idea of two others getting together.
Little Miss Almighty  -  God is a girl.
Age Lift  -  Characters' ages are changed in an adaptation.
Self Inflicted Hell  -  The afterlife is whatever you make of it.
Anvil Of The Story  -  A moral that is incredibly unsubtle and presented in a heavy-handed manner.
Road Runner PC  -  The player is the game's fastest character.
Visual Pun  -  A play on words in the form of an image.
I Let Gwen Stacy Die  -  When a hero feels responsible for a loved one's death.
Teens Are Monsters  -  Teenagers are portrayed as cruel demons.
Santa Claus  -  That fat guy wearing a hat who delivers all the presents on Christmas morning while riding a sleigh driven by reindeer.
Ragtag Bunch Of Misfits  -  Flawed or quirky team of outcasts who save the world.
Mistaken For Terrorist  -  A person is mistaken for a terrorist.
Defcon Five  -  5 is peace, 1 is war — but fiction often gets it backwards.
Quickly Demoted Leader  -  A powerful character immediately becomes second to another hero at the start of the story.
God Is Flawed  -  The supreme being isn't all-perfect.
Villain Possessed Bystander  -  When the Monster of the Week is a bystander empowered and controlled by the Big Bad.
Camp Gay  -  Homosexual men with stereotypical girly traits.
Please Shoot The Messenger  -  A message contains a request to harm the person delivering it.
Treacherous Advisor  -  The hero's mentor turns out to be a villain.
Slow Loading Internet Image  -  This image just won't load!
Letting Her Hair Down  -  A serious woman usually wears her hair up but lets it down in moments of vulnerability.
Ocean Awe  -  Seeing an ocean (or another large body of water) for the first time is awesome
Singer Namedrop  -  A singer or a band drops their name in a song.
Afraid To Hold The Baby  -  A character is afraid of holding babies
Persecuted Intellectuals  -  In-universe distrust, fear, or persecution of intellectuals.
Harping On About Harpies  -  Monstrous bird/woman hybrid.
Bulungi  -  Fictional country in sub-Saharan Africa.
Enemy Detecting Radar  -  A tool or HUD element that displays enemies in the area.
Commie Nazis  -  Mixing metaphors to symbolize evil, even when said mix is arguably contradictory.
Death Is Such An Odd Thing  -  People are alive right up until they die. Isn't that weird?
A Day In The Limelight  -  An episode focused on a secondary character.
Jennys Number  -  References to the number 867-5309 from the song with the same name.
Parental Obliviousness  -  Parents are unaware of their children's shenanigans.
Jedi Mind Trick  -  A magic/psychic power or device that hides one's presence.
Bad Powers Good People  -  I have evil powers, but I will be good instead.
Brutal Honesty  -  Honest truth hurts.
Cold Sleep Cold Future  -  Someone wakes up from being a Human Popsicle... only to discover the future is a Crapsack World.
Wrap Up Song  -  A musical number that ends every episode of a television series.
Standardized Leader  -  The Leader is The Generic Guy.
Unspecified Apocalypse  -  The Apocalypse happened, but exactly how is unexplained.
Love Hurts  -  Falling in love leaves you susceptible to the worst emotional pains.
Minority Show Ghetto  -  The belief that stories focused on minorities won't interest majorities.
Unfortunate Item Swap  -  Character mixes up two similar but very different items intended for different things.
Shot To The Heart  -  Adrenaline injection directly into the heart.
Mixed Animal Species Team  -  A team comprised of different kinds of animals.
Motorcycle Dominoes  -  A row of parked bikes knock each other over.
You Didnt Ask  -  Withholding information because it wasn't requested.
Cold Blooded Torture  -  Subjecting people to severe pain either for information, as punishment, or out of sadistic pleasure.
Karmic Misfire  -  The cosmos inflicts Misplaced Retribution on an undeserving character.
Platinum Makes Everything Shinier  -  Platinum is awesome, and even better than gold!
Title Scream  -  The name of the work is screamed at you.
Arkhams Razor  -  The most bizarre explanation is usually correct.
Contemplating Your Hands  -  Someone is fascinated by their hands while on drugs.
Lounge Lizard  -  A smarmy lounge singer with poor or weird fashion tastes.
Damsel Scrappy  -  A Distressed Damsel whom the fans don't consider to be worth saving.
So My Kids Can Watch  -  A creator for adult-oriented media does some projects to appeal to younger family members.
Earned Stripes  -  A traditional physical change in appearance that indicates your rank.
Precedent Excuse  -  Nobody wants to give a specific something to someone, so the someone explains why they should get it.
Story Reset  -  A retro-rewrite that branches off the main canon of a storyline, offering a possible change in story arcs.
Too Old To Trick Or Treat  -  The belief that trick-or-treating, and sometimes Halloween in general, is only for children.
The Golden Rule  -  Treat people the way you want to be treated.
Serenade Your Lover  -  A character sings to his or her Love Interest to convey their passion.
A Fool And His New Money Are Soon Parted  -  When a character goes from Rags to Riches and back again.
Network Decay  -  The channel becomes about something other than what it was originally.
Swiss Army Tears  -  Tears heal everything.
Knows The Ropes  -  Rope or string as a combat tool.
Mindlink Mates  -  Lovers who share their consciousness together.
Mentor Occupational Hazard  -  Mentors die for a plot/character significant reason.
Artificial Atmospheric Actions  -  Artificial measures designed to make the world seem real, but only highlight that it's not.
Evilutionary Biologist  -  A Mad Scientist who seeks to "improve" humanity.
Nerd  -  Usually intelligent but socially and/or physically awkward.
Roar Before Beating  -  Monsters roar before attacking.
No Bulk Discounts  -  Buying lots of stuff at once won't get you any discounts.
Behemoth Battle  -  Giant creatures fighting.
Adaptational Skill  -  A character has a talent (not supernatural) that they lacked in the source material.
Never Accepted In His Hometown  -  Hero is popular/loved everywhere but at home.
Sexy Mentor  -  An attractive mentor as well as a potential love interest to the protagonist.
Violence Is Disturbing  -  Violence as Nightmare Fuel.
Disappeared Dad  -  The dad is absent.
Mask Of Power  -  A mask that grants power to the wearer.
You Dont Want To Catch This  -  Faking an illness to keep people away.
Dhampyr  -  Half Vampire.
Double Blind What If  -  What If? Alternate Continuity asks the opposite What If? in their own universe.
Projectile Kiss  -  Character creates a lip or heart shape from his/her mouth that flies off at a target.
Ambition Is Evil  -  Obsession with self-improvement corrupts.
Computer Equals Monitor  -  Computer monitor is treated as the computer itself.
Selective Enforcement  -  I will ignore their arson and murder, instead I will bust 'em for jaywalking.
Laborious Laziness  -  Working really hard for the sole sake of being lazy.
Saharan Shipwreck  -  A ship is grounded really far away from water.
Bat Family Crossover  -  A crossover that only affects characters living in their own part of The 'Verse.
Football Hooligans  -  Short-tempered Delinquents who take their passion for football very seriously.
Timed Mission  -  You must finish your goal quickly!
Violin Scam  -  Two people trick a third person into buying a worthless item at an exorbitant price by preying on the person's greed.
The Ditherer  -  Can't make a decision to save their life.
Longest Pregnancy Ever  -  A pregnancy that goes well beyond the standard nine months.
Cant Stay Normal  -  Someone lives a normal life after retiring from heroism, but is pushed back into the world of adventure.
Anime Hair  -  An art style where drawn or anime characters have exotic and improbable hair.
My Car Hates Me  -  The car never starts when you absolutely need it to.
Expressive Skull  -  A skull that can express emotion like a head with flesh and muscle.
Realistic Diction Is Unrealistic  -  Fictional dialogue is unrealistically polished.
Dreadful Dragonfly  -  Gigantic scary dragonflies.
Point Of No Continues  -  A video game stops you from continuing (and even stops all potential extra players from joining in) completely once you reach its final stages.
Gaining The Will To Kill  -  A character decides that killing people is acceptable for his or her goal.
Cute Monster Girl  -  Female monsters tend to be strangely human-like... and attractive.
Stopped Caring  -  A character decides that nothing really matters anymore and begins to thrive on only what's sufficient.
That One Attack  -  Everyone hates seeing this attack.
It Was Here I Swear  -  While witnesses are being retrieved, the evidence disappears.
Space Mines  -  Like their seagoing counterparts, but in space!
Ninja Log  -  Character switches their place with a dummy or object like a log. Often done to avoid detection or attack.
Expository Pronoun  -  Specific or unusual use of a certain pronoun to underline a character's personality or a dynamic between two characters.
Flashback Nightmare  -  A bad dream of a bad memory.
Foul Flower  -  Flowers used as or associated with villainous characters for Subverted Innocence.
Framing The Guilty Party  -  A villain is set up by another party to be prosecuted as a criminal, usually for something that's irrelevant to the crime they initially committed.
Inertial Impalement  -  A victim is stabbed by moving into a stationary blade.
Eyes Always Shut  -  A character's eyes seem to always look closed.
Panacea  -  A medicine that cures everything.
I Just Shot Marvin In The Face  -  A case of negligent gun handling actually getting someone shot.
Lets Watch Our Show Plot  -  A story where characters watch their own show.
Anti Love Song  -  Silly Love Songs MY ASS.
In The Local Tongue  -  Something that sounds cool in its own language means something stupid when translated.
Former Bigot  -  Practitioners of discrimination have a HeelFace Turn.
Helicopter Blender  -  Using a helicopter's blades as a weapon.
The Tonsillitis Episode  -  An episode where a character gets tonsillitis.
Shoo Out The New Guy  -  New character is introduced, flops, and is abruptly written out.
Prescience By Analysis  -  The future is predicted with math.
Separated By The Wall  -  A visual metaphor in which two people are separated by a physical barrier to symbolize some other divide keeping them apart.
Oneshot Revisionism  -  A Canon Handwave which is ignored in future installations of a series.
Hero Of Another Story  -  They have their own adventures, you just don't get to see them.
List Of Transgressions  -  A list of all the bad stuff someone did.
Eleventh Hour Ranger  -  A Sixth Ranger that joins the Five-Man Band at or near the Final Battle.
Sacred Cow  -  Something that can't be criticized by either fans or non-fans.
Lunarians  -  Beings from the Moon.
Giant Hands Of Doom  -  Giant floating disembodied hands.
Token Yuri Girls  -  Yuri-style lesbian relationships between secondary characters, outside of Yuri Genre works, to appeal to the Yuri Fan base.
But Not Too White  -  Shame over pale skin.
The Mothership  -  A unique, extra-large space flagship.
Beautiful Singing Voice  -  A character is noted in-universe as having a beautiful singing voice.
Ear Worm  -  A character gets a song frustratingly stuck in their head.
Most Writers Are Male  -  Most creators that get published are male.
The Fun In Funeral  -  Hilarity taking place at a funeral.
Turbulent Priest  -  Religious leader stands up against a corrupt or immoral regime.
Typical Cartoon Animal Colors  -  Cartoon animals tend to get standardized color patterns.
Dark Messiah  -  Trope: A ruthless and often Ax-Crazy demagogue who obtains absolute power or otherwise secures the fanatical following of a substantial multitude by presenting themselves as a savior.
Combo Rifle  -  Two guns that can combine into one.
Supernatural Fear Inducer  -  An ability that induces fear on others.
Script Swap  -  When a document is intentionally or not swapped with another. Thus leading to quid pro quo.
Soldier Vs Warrior  -  Organized troopers vs brutal militants.
Through The Years Credits  -  Opening credits that show the cast growing older with each season.
Villainous BSOD  -  A villain develops a conscience and is so shocked that he stops responding.
Destroy The Product Placement  -  When Product Placement is damaged, broken or destroyed.
All Natural Snake Oil  -  Just slap "natural" or "organic" on the label, and some idiot will buy it.
Ballroom Blitz  -  Protagonist or bad guys interrupt the party.
Try To Fit That On A Business Card  -  A character has a remarkably long list of titles.
Wrecked Weapon  -  The destruction of the hero's weapon to show how dangerous the new antagonist is.
Assassins Are Always Betrayed  -  If the main character is an assassin, they'll be betrayed by their superiors (or other characters in that position).
Lies Damned Lies And Statistics  -  Using credible-sounding statistics for deception.
Playing Games At Work  -  Someone's goofing off at work and not doing their job.
Ringer Ploy  -  A gambit where everyone is disguised as the same guy.
Nobody Loves The Bassist  -  Bass guitar players are the least interesting or the member of the band that you would never bother to pay attention to.
This Bear Was Framed  -  Making a murder look like an animal attack.
Translated Cover Version  -  A song that is sung in a different language than the original.
Prom Is For Straight Kids  -  Only straight teenagers are allowed to enjoy prom.
Silly Will  -  A nonsensical will.
Enforced Method Acting  -  External conditions force a genuine reaction from an actor.
Flat World  -  The world has no horizon due to it being flat
Attention Whore  -  LOOK AT ME!!
Joggers Find Death  -  A jogger will either find a corpse, or become one.
Being Watched  -  A character has the sudden feel that someone's watching them.
Mobile Maze  -  The worst kind of maze: one where the walls move.
Giving Radio To The Romans  -  Going back in time and giving modern technology to ancient people.
School Of Hard Knocks  -  Schools where students are explicitly allowed to fight each other.
Unnecessarily Large Vessel  -  A vessel that is way bigger than it needs to be to fulfill its design purpose.
Homing Boulders  -  A projectile hitting or missing depends on something other than its in-universe physics.
Hes A Friend  -  Someone tries to defuse a hostile situation by saying both parties are his friends.
Cold Equation  -  Considering murder so others can live longer.
Compulsory School Age  -  Characters must attend school at the grade typical of their physical age, regardless of their mental age, knowledge, or maturity.
Mistaken For Gay  -  A character or a duo are mistaken to be homosexual by other people.
Tragic Keepsake  -  A memento from a great tragedy.
Royal Blood  -  Royal ancestry as a plot point.
Stealing The Handicapped Spot  -  An able-bodied person parks in a handicapped space, just to be a jackass.
Villain Teleportation  -  Villains have better Teleportation than heroes, who may even lack the ability entirely.
Angst Nuke  -  When losing control of your emotions results in an actual explosion.
Control Freak  -  Someone who dictates exactly how they think things should go.
Portmanteau  -  Mash-ups of words.
Astral Projection  -  The spirit acts elsewhere while the body is unconscious.
Taking The Heat  -  Pinning the guilt onto yourself for someone else.
Eenie Meenie Miny Moai  -  Humanoid stone statues from Easter Island.
Once Upon A Time  -  For the stock phrase: The standard opening to classic stories.
The Only One  -  Only one specific person can effectively deal with a situation.
I Am Not My Father  -  A character actively defies becoming like their parent.
Centipedes Dilemma  -  Paralysis by too much analysis.
Inept Mage  -  A real sorcerer and a real klutz.
Hulk Mash Up  -  Expy of The Incredible Hulk.
Medium Blending  -  Multiple mediums used in the same work.
Memetic Personality Change  -  A character is popularly depicted behaving in manners unsupported (or outright contradicted) by Canon.
Promoted Fanboy  -  A fan of something becomes a developer or writer for it.
Messy Male Fancy Female  -  He's sloppy, she's groomed, they're both fauna.
One Of The Boys  -  A female character hangs out with male characters.
Informed Poverty  -  A supposedly poor character who somehow can afford products that only middle or even upper class people can.
Prophecy Armor  -  A character destined to die from a specific circumstance cannot die from anything else.
Advertising Disguised As News  -  An advertisement is designed to look like a news story.
Orphans Plot Trinket  -  Plot-critical object of sentimental value to an orphan.
The Pratfall  -  Man falls on his buttocks. Hilarity Ensues.
Wacky Wayside Tribe  -  Need more story? Throw in a random encounter!
Sleeping Single  -  Both members of the couple have their own bed.
The Klan  -  Ku Klux Klan Expies.
Artifact Alias  -  A character continues referring to themselves by their alias even after their original name is revealed.
Dead Pet Sketch  -  Owner of a pet goes away and a caretaker comes in. Said pet then dies under the caretaker. Caretaker then attempts to hide the calamity by using a substitute. It usually fails.
Well Done Son Guy  -  The role model who knows you but never acknowledges you and thus you never stop trying to please them hoping one day they will.
Self Recovery Surprise  -  After taking damage that should've killed them, a character reveals their Healing Factor.
Evolving Title Screen  -  A video game title screen that changes to reflect player's in-game actions and achievements.
Choice And Consequence System  -  A game sub-system that tracks the player's plot decisions to modify the story accordingly at some later point.
Condescending Compassion  -  Compassion tainted by a sense of superiority to the victim.
Cabin Fever  -  Film: Teenagers go out camping, but become infested by a flesh-eating virus.
Changed My Mind Kid  -  Friend abandons hero, then saves him at the last moment.
High School Sweethearts  -  Love in high school lasts forever.
And Now For Someone Completely Different  -  You are forced to play as multiple characters in shifts.
Wily Walrus  -  When walruses are portrayed as villains, jerks, or antagonists.
Adaptational Heroism  -  A character is more of a hero in an adaptation than they were in the original material.
Ladies And Germs  -  A humorous play on the traditional "Ladies and gentlemen".
Covert Group With Mundane Front  -  That perfectly ordinary and boring business is staffed by spies.
Merciful Minion  -  The bad guy has mercy!
Item Get  -  Victory pose + fanfare while holding a collected item.
The Darkness Gazes Back  -  Eyes appearing out of the darkness are scary.
Devolution Device  -  Applied Phlebotinum that makes something revert to a previous "stage" of evolution.
Cruel Twist Ending  -  A mean-spirited Twist Ending.
Naive Everygirl  -  She's innocent and clueless. Just like our target demographic.
Path Of Most Resistance  -  Taking the harder routes in video games yields better rewards.
The Unwitting Comedian  -  He's the funniest one around (whether he wants to be or not).
Climactic Volcano Backdrop  -  When a climactic scene takes place in or around volcanoes or volcanic-esque eruptions for dramatic effect.
Pedestrian Crushes Car  -  When a car hits some pedestrians, the opposite of what usually happens...happens.
Protagonist Title  -  When the name of the main protagonist is title of their series
Skinny Dipping  -  Swimming in the nude.
Angst Dissonance  -  Character is angsty. The audience doesn't sympathize.
Absolute Xenophobe  -  A group that kills anything that is not one of them.
Superheroes In Space  -  Superheroes who fight crime and preserve peace in space.
Conveniently Close Planet  -  In space, your destination is far closer and more convenient to reach than in reality.
Japanese Beetle Brothers  -  Two characters based on the Stag Beetle and the Japanese Rhinoceros Beetle.
Multiethnic Name  -  These full names use at least two or more languages, one for each part (e.g. John Sakaguchi or Jiro Smith).
Jesus Was Way Cool  -  Jesus is portrayed as the Nice Guy, even in non-religious or anti-religious media.
Mundane Wish  -  A character uses a magic wish on something common.
Sexy Surfacing Shot  -  A character surfacing or climbing out from a body of water being played for Fanservice.
Shared Life Meter  -  A group of video game characters share a life meter.
Two Girls And A Guy  -  A Power Trio with The Heroine and her female foil, joined by their male best friend who's just a friend.
Third Act Misunderstanding  -  A character distrusts another because they find out who they were before they became the mask.
Metamorphosis Monster  -  A non-human species undergo a change in form.
I Always Wanted To Say That  -  Character wants to utter a Stock Phrase.
Deadly Road Trip  -  Far from home? Bad stuff happens.
Kill Screen  -  A level so high that accessing it screws up the game.
Swapped Roles  -  Two characters decide to swap their identities to understand each other's life.
Women Are Wiser  -  Women are depicted as more sensible than men.
Cap  -  The maximum amount allowed of a video game resource.
Historical Rap Sheet  -  Fictional character was responsible for a historical crime or disaster.
Cats Hate Water  -  Cats hate water, often to an extreme degree.
Covert Pervert  -  They're pervy but you'd never guess it.
Summon Magic  -  Using your powers to teleport in or create a creature.
Twang Hello  -  An arrow as a signal of another character's presence.
Shapeshifting Lover  -  A person has a lover or spouse who can shapeshift.
Those Two Guys  -  A pair serving as a mundane Greek Chorus.
Domestic Abuse  -  Forcefully controlling the significant other in a relationship, often by means of physical and/or verbal harm.
Trial By Friendly Fire  -  The only way to beat the enemy is to shoot through your ally.
Hollywood Tone Deaf  -  A character's singing is cartoonishly bad to the point of sounding fake.
Role Swap Plot  -  An episode switches the roles of certain characters.
Incriminating Indifference  -  Lack of emotion proves you are guilty.
Power Crystal  -  Crystals used as a power source.
Quizzical Tilt  -  Tilting your head to show that you're confused and/or curious about something.
Humans Are Psychic In The Future  -  Excuse for Magic by Any Other Name in a "realistic" sci-fi setting: evolution allowing Psychic Powers.
Painfully Slow Projectile  -  Bullets are slow and easy to dodge.
Jossed  -  Fan theories that are disproved either by canon or Word of God.
Fake Real Turn  -  Something fake becomes real.
Doppelganger Crossover  -  Crossover between two different series that share an actor.
Brains Evil Brawn Good  -  Evil uses brains, good uses brawn.
Parental Title Characterization  -  What someone calls their parents signifies their relationship with them.
Eggshell Clothing  -  A creature that hatched from an egg wears the egg's shell as an item of clothing.
Waiting Skeleton  -  The wait was so long, they died and decayed into a skeleton.
Face Monster Turn  -  A good guy becomes a villain not out of choice, and is usually accompanied by a change in appearance.
Formula With A Twist  -  A work that's Strictly Formula except for a gimmick or two.
Secret History  -  A work claims its events took place in Real Life, but were kept secret by In-Universe actors.
Mistaken For Murderer  -  Someone mistakenly believes that another character killed someone, tried to kill them, or is thinking of killing them.
Real Joke Name  -  Real name is mistaken for a joke in-series.
Damage Reduction  -  How much damage a character can take before it starts lowering their HP.
The Internet Is For Cats  -  Memes on the internet are always about cats.
Screwball Squirrel  -  Trope: Squirrels depicted as crazy and/or hyperactive tricksters.
Universal Universe Time  -  The rest of the universe follows Earth's time system.
Pinball Spinoff  -  Take a popular Video Game property and make a Licensed Pinball Table out of it.
Superman Stays Out Of Gotham  -  Differently powered superheroes in the same Shared Universe stay out of each other's way for the Rule of Drama.
Ambiguously Evil  -  A supposed villain that can't be pinned down as outright evil.
Blackmail Is Such An Ugly Word  -  A tamer-sounding synonym is used to describe a criminal act.
Lineage Comes From The Father  -  If there's anything of note in your bloodline, it will only involve your male ancestors.
Baddie Flattery  -  Villain says nice things about the hero to the hero.
All American Face  -  He's a good guy! And he loves America!
Undead Tax Exemption  -  Identification paperwork is given a Hand Wave for extranormal characters.
The Hilarity Of Hats  -  Hats are funny.
Designated Love Interest  -  Romance that accidentally comes off as platonic or outright unloving to audiences.
Unplanned Crossdressing  -  Crossdressing through desperation or ignorance.
Designated Bullet  -  Specific bullet (or other such projectile) intended for specific target.
Took A Level In Idealism  -  A pessimistic character learns to be more trusting, caring, and generous over time.
Draft Dodging  -  Trying not to get drafted by the armed forces for various reasons.
Dream Weaver  -  Someone who can shape dreams any way they want.
Sudden Downer Ending  -  A dark, depressing ending to an otherwise upbeat work.
Sword Almighty  -  In a world with a Weapons Kitchen Sink, the swordsman is king.
Combat Tentacles  -  Weaponized tentacles.
Shoulder Sized Dragon  -  A dragon small enough to perch on your shoulder.
Dead Horse Trope  -  A trope that is now parodied, subverted or deconstructed more often than it's played straight.
Fear Is The Appropriate Response  -  Choosing "flight" over "fight".
Fantastic Nuke  -  A supernatural or otherwise fictional weapon or spell which recreates the destructiveness of a nuke.
Obfuscating Insanity  -  Not as crazy as they seem.
Real World Episode  -  An episode where some characters (theoretically) enter the real world.
Thats What I Would Do  -  Hero and villain are similar enough that one can predict the other's choices by the choices they themself would make.
Colony Drop  -  Big Dumb Object falls, everyone dies.
Hot Pursuit  -  A full-blown police chase with all manner of hardware for comparatively petty reasons.
Putting On The Reich  -  Evoking the image of the Nazis, through uniforms, rallies, banners, insignias, etc.
Tontine  -  Whoever's the last one left alive gets all the goods.
Torture Porn  -  A work that puts a definite focus on Cold-Blooded Torture.
Sage Love Interest  -  A wise and often spiritual love interest, who provides helpful advice to their significant other.
Whammy Bid  -  An attention-grabbing, often absurdly high, bid in an auction.
Miracle Rally  -  Despite incredible odds, the team manages to win in the last minute.
Machine Monotone  -  Artificial Intelligences, robots, cyborgs and voice synthesisers cannot simulate emotional inflexion.
Bara Genre  -  Japanese-made Gay Romance featuring traditionally masculine men.
Made Of Magic  -  An object, place, or being is made of or from magic.
Snowball Fight  -  A bunch of people get together to throw clumps of snow at each other.
House Inspection  -  Inspectors are coming. The place is a mess despite your best efforts.
Crunkcore  -  Musical fusion of screamo with electronica/hip-hop.
Self Destructive Charge  -  Dying is not always an excuse to stop heading to your destination.
Flight  -  Trope: Humans or humanoids can fly.
Phlebotinum Overload  -  Phlebotinum-based energy detection/absorption/protection has a limit, and surpassing it will have catastrophic results.
Bizarre Instrument  -  Made-up musical instruments.
Speak Friend And Enter  -  The solution is much simpler than it seems.
How Dare You Die On Me  -  Getting mad at somebody because they died and you didn't want them to.
Chef Of Iron  -  Fighting cook.
Incredibly Obvious Tail  -  Someone follows another as unstealthily as possible.
Lawful Good  -  A character alignment involving good and order.
Born In The Saddle  -  Cultures that revolve around riding animals, primarily but not limited to horses.
So Long Suckers  -  Firing off a one-liner as you make your escape.
Clock King  -  Plans everything down to the last second.
Van In Black  -  Ominous surveillance vehicle.
I Choose To Stay  -  A character refuses to go back to their old home after the events that happened in their current destination.
Romantic Rain  -  Rain means love; lovers enjoy the rainfall.
Stellar Name  -  A name of a character/work/celebrity that comes from something found in the night sky (e.g. a star, planet, constellation, or other object).
Friendship Moment  -  A sudden yet heartwarming affirmation of close friendship between two characters.
Kill All Humans  -  Entity or organization's goal is humanity's extinction.
It Is Dehumanizing  -  Referring to someone as "it" to imply that they are subhuman.
Branch And Bottleneck Plot Structure  -  A video game plot that branches out early on, then re-joins all branches for the finale.
Through A Face Full Of Fur  -  Furry animals can visibly blush.
Naughty Birdwatching  -  Binoculars being used for perverse purposes.
Armored But Frail  -  A character's high defenses are counterbalanced by their low stamina.
Gameplay Randomization  -  Gameplay mechanics that involve explicit randomization in some way or form.
Hurl It Into The Sun  -  When you need to Kill It with Fire and nothing short of nuclear fusion will do.
Idiosyncratic Episode Naming  -  Episode titles following a theme.
Theyre Called Personal Issues For A Reason  -  Some secrets really should be kept rather than exposed.
Informed Judaism  -  A character is explicitly stated to be Jewish, but otherwise shows very few to no signs of being Jewish.
Large Runt  -  A large character that is nonetheless small in comparison to others of their species.
Just Giving Orders  -  Justifying evil actions by shifting all the (moral) responsibility for them to one's inferiors.
Down On The Farm  -  Classic view of fewer than one thousand people living in the middle of nowhere surrounded by fields of corn and potatoes.
Slapstick  -  A comedy genre centered around Amusing Injuries.
Disneyfication  -  Softening up dark elements of a story to be suitable for children.
Unwinnable  -  The ability to finish the game is permanently missable.
Shrug Of God  -  Fan: "What's the answer to this question about your story?" Author: "I have no idea."
Sue Donym  -  A fake alias that's very similar to its real name.
Try Not To Die  -  Stock Phrase, where one character sends another on a mission, stating this as one of the rules.
Classical Movie Vampire  -  He vants to suck your blood! Mwahaha! [cape flourish]
Berserk Button  -  A character's unusual Disproportionate Retribution rage trigger.
Patchwork Kids  -  Kids that have the combined physical features of their parents.
Elemental Hair  -  Hair that's colored so that the color hints at the Elemental Powers used by the character, in a way that fits with Color-Coded Elements.
Stuff Blowing Up  -  Explosions are cool!
Bad Luck Charm  -  An item that is deemed to give bad luck.
Bait And Switch Gunshot  -  Gunfire goes off but the character who was shot isnt who the audience was led to believe.
Moral Luck  -  Praising (or blaming) a character for an action they carried out, the consequences of which were primarily dependent on blind luck.
Big Name Fan  -  Notable fan of a property.
Earth That Used To Be Better  -  Earth used to be well-regarded, but is now seen as lesser by those who has left it.
The Four Loves  -  There are four main definitions of "love":
Plan B Resolution  -  When something or someone that is believed to be the only thing that can stop the Big Bad fails, the heroes must come up with a new plan.
Dual Boss  -  Two simultaneous bosses in one battle.
Shoot The Hostage Taker  -  Simply shooting a hostage taker to save the hostage.
Bully Bulldog  -  Bulldogs depicted as vicious jerks.
Camel Case  -  WordsAreStuckTogetherAndCapitalizedMakingItVeryHardToRead.
Legacy Team  -  A team with parallels to a predecessor team.
Point Of No Continues  -  A video game stops you from continuing (and even stops all potential extra players from joining in) completely once you reach its final stages.
Desperation Attack  -  The Player Character's attack power skyrockets if he's on the verge of death.
Disease Bleach  -  An illness turns someone's hair white.
One Man Industrial Revolution  -  Most of the technology used in a setting was invented by one person.
Cast From Money  -  Skills that require money instead of Mana or health.
All There In The Script  -  A character's name isn't mentioned in the primary medium itself but is mentioned in another source material.
You Wouldnt Like Me When Im Angry  -  Make them angry, face the consequences...
Miss Kitty  -  Ex-prostitute, now entrepreneur.
Textbook Humor  -  Jokes in textbooks that you'd expect to keep a serious tone.
Single Palette Town  -  A setting dominated by a singular color scheme.
Only One Female Mold  -  All the female characters have the same type of body (mostly voluptuous).
Villainous Aromantic Asexual  -  A character's lack of interest in sex and/or romance underscores their villainous nature.
Badass Baritone  -  Someone with a deep, badass voice.
Stoners Are Funny  -  Most drug addicts aren't funny. Stoners are.
Taught By Experience  -  A character learns new things by doing them.
Straying Baby  -  If a baby leaves your field of vision - even for a second - expect it to get into some dangerous situation it has no business being in.
An Entrepreneur Is You  -  Simulate running your own business.
Broken Hero  -  A hero who's kind and cheerful despite their Dark and Troubled Past.
Alliterative Family  -  Every name in the family starts with the same letter.
Totalitarian Utilitarian  -  Villain wants to make everyone's lives better.
Multiple Gunshot Death  -  Fatal gunfire overkill.
In Another Mans Shoes  -  Experiencing life from someone else's perspective ("Walking a mile in [their] shoes").
Ironic Birthday  -  Just when you're feeling miserable, your friends throw you a surprise birthday party that you'll have to pretend to enjoy.
Second Place Is For Winners  -  The prize for first place isn't as good as a lesser one.
Bonus Dungeon  -  Difficult optional dungeon.
Leonine Contract  -  A one-sided bargain that the victim can't afford to refuse.
Big Lipped Alligator Moment  -  Bizarre scene that is never brought up again.
They Look Like Us Now  -  The creatures discover a way to appear human, without possessing or controlling actual humans in the process.
Lets Wait A While  -  A couple puts off Their First Time until the time is right.
Left Hanging  -  A story ends with some serious plot threads left unresolved.
Fakeout Escape  -  Escaping by pretending to escape.
War Hero  -  A character who served/serves in the military and been decorated for heroism on the battlefield.
City Noir  -  A grim urban setting.
Unmanly Secret  -  I can't let them know I actually like (Gasp!) feminine stuff!
Everybody Knew Already  -  Your secret isn't.
Anti Cavalry  -  Effective against mounted targets.
Dead Alternate Counterpart  -  Character's Alternate Self is dead.
Plot Induced Illness  -  Illness strikes when it's (in)convenient.
Knowledge Broker  -  Always seems to be on the ball with current events, no matter how obscure.
The Soulless  -  These characters are soulless, both literally and metaphorically.
Hair Today Gone Tomorrow  -  Younger, hair; older, gone.
Teeth Flying  -  One hit with the fist, and teeth start flying.
Ripping Off The String Of Pearls  -  A pearl necklace is removed by force, and it's symbolic.
Vent Physics  -  Air vents that blow characters away.
Urban Warfare  -  Military conflict in a city.
This Is Not A Floor  -  Using mind control and illusions to trick someone to their doom.
Sympathetic Inspector Antagonist  -  A persistent law-enforcer justifiably, but unsuccessfully, attempting to capture the Villain Protagonist.
License Added Game  -  An existing video game series gets a Licensed Game installment.
Shonen Hair  -  Big messy spiky hair denoting a hot-blooded rebel in anime and manga, particular in works aimed at young males.
Soulsaving Crusader  -  A character who tortures and murders people "for their own good."
Strong And Skilled  -  Character has both brains and brawn and knows how to use them.
Gay Best Friend  -  Token Gay Character defined by two characteristics: they're sassy and they have advice to give the straight protagonist.
Friday Night Death Slot  -  Getting moved to Friday nights = the death sentence for (American) TV shows.
Recursive Ammo  -  Projectile that spits out more projectiles.
Gang Of Critters  -  Cute cuddly animals, usually with magical powers and a tendency to work together.
Love Makes You Evil  -  Character does bad things in the name of love.
If You Call Before Midnight Tonight  -  The company has a great deal, but if you believe their ad, it's only available for a limited time.
My Little Phony  -  My Little Pony lampooned In-Universe.
On Patrol Montage  -  A montage of a new hero doing a series of heroic deeds to display what can be done and how the world reacts.
Spoonerism  -  Mixing up the lirst fetter or sound of two words.
Effeminate Misogynistic Guy  -  The flamboyantly dressed, fabulous woman hater who might fit somewhere in the LGBTQ rainbow spectrum.
Psychological Projection  -  I'm not like that, everyone else is!
A Lesson In Defeat  -  The mentor must also teach his student how to fail.
Roundhouse Kick  -  A 360-degree or 180-degree spin kick.
Smoking Gun Control  -  Easy methods of solving a crime are out to lunch because to have them wouldn't make for very interesting drama.
Stealth Hi Bye  -  Where did you come from/where did you go?
Dreadlock Warrior  -  A character whose hairstyle preference is dreadlocks, cornrows, or a mane of many braids will being an ass-kicking fighter.
Magic Eater  -  Consumes magic, magic stuff, and magical people who do magic things.
Friendless Background  -  A character starts out the story with no friends.
Welcome Back Traitor  -  A party member changes sides only to come back and is received in open arms.
Adult Fear  -  Threats and fears that most adults would worry about in real life.
Messy Hair  -  A character has messy hair.
The Schizophrenia Conspiracy  -  In fiction, schizophrenia turns you into a Conspiracy Theorist, but that's what they want you to think!!
Bio Augmentation  -  Humans with biological enhancements.
Short Range Shotgun  -  Fiction exaggerates the shotgun's capability for short-range annihilation and long-range ineffectiveness.
No Hit Wonder  -  Successful but has no hit singles.
The Men In Black  -  Secret government agency in charge of maintaining The Masquerade.
Banana In The Tailpipe  -  Stuffing an object into a pursuing car's tailpipe to slow then down as a prank.
Situational Sexuality  -  Everyone is bisexual, in the right situation.
Apocalypse Cult  -  A cult that center around one's own death, the death of their own species, and just the Apocalypse in general.
Cloudcuckoolander  -  An oddball character who lives in their own little world.
The Twink  -  A sylphlike young gay man.
Attractive Bent Species  -  Character changes into a highly attractive member of another species.
Cataclysm Backstory  -  An advanced civilization violently collapsed long ago, and that event affects the plot of the setting.
Game Maker  -  Rapid prototyping tool for video games, usually genre-specific.
Cartoon Bug Sprayer  -  Old-fashioned canister bug sprayer with hand pump. Still commonly used in Cartoon Land.
Third Line Some Waiting  -  Three plots: Two flow into the main story while there are intermittent narratives to the third one.
Bullying A Dragon  -  Hey, let's go mess with the guy who can easily kill us all!
Viral Marketing  -  Marketing that goes through word of mouth like wildfire.
Emergency Authority  -  A public official is granted authority powers he wouldn't otherwise legally have in order to avert a catastrophe. This often ends badly.
HAD To Be Sharp  -  Where they came from, the law of the land was "Improve or die."
He Man Woman Hater  -  A macho, chauvinistic, masculine man with misogynistic tendencies.
Urban Hellscape  -  The inner-city area that is overrun by crime and poverty.
Flash Mob Coverup  -  A character organizes a Flash Mob in order to obscure some other action.
Bizarre Alien Reproduction  -  Aliens are weird, and so are their reproduction cycles.
Brought Home The Wrong Kid  -  A caretaker brings back the wrong kid at home.
Verbal Tic  -  A catch phrase used purely out of habit.
Forgotten Framing Device  -  The story within another story is missing the latter half of its outer frame.
Ambiguous Innocence  -  Innocent meaning a lack of moral understanding - not actually being good, nor evil - making their actions seem strange or uncomfortable by common moral standards.
Progressive Jackpot  -  Each time somebody fails to get prize money, it gradually increases, until somebody wins it and the prize resets.
No Equal Opportunity Time Travel  -  Time travel and period bigotry do not mix.
Lazily Gender Flipped Name  -  Lazily feminized male names or masculinized female names, done in haste or in jest.
Equivalent Exchange  -  Equal power, equal price.
Zebras Are Just Striped Horses  -  Zebras portrayed as behaving like domestic horses.
Genuine Human Hide  -  Turning human skin into articles of clothing.
Armor Piercing Attack  -  Armor won't protect you from this.
Ballad Of X  -  Things that are named "The Ballad of (Something)"
Muggles  -  Random ordinary people who are unaware of—or unaffiliated with—any plot-related supernatural matters around them.
Celebratory Body Tossing  -  Somebody gets tossed up into the air as part of a celebration.
The Loonie  -  Plays games to have fun and do crazy things.
Career Ending Injury  -  Character suffers injury that makes them unable to pursue their goals or career.
Negative Space Wedgie  -  Strange spatial phenomena.

Furry Ear Dissonance  -  Animals with unrealistic ears.
Evil Is Cool  -  Evil is stylish, awe-inspiring, and badass.
Stepford Snarker  -  Someone who uses sarcasm to hide their emotions.
Good Republic Evil Empire  -  Good guys are democratic, bad guys are imperialistic.
Recycled Script  -  Reusing an old script (or storyline), with only slight changes.
Terrifying Rescuer  -  At last, my gallant hero has co—AIIIIEEE! Someone save me from my rescuer!
Non Actor Vehicle  -  A celebrity not famous for acting plays the main character in a production.
Hot Skitty On Wailord Action  -  It does not make sense that these creatures can interbreed and produce offspring, yet they do.
Kigo  -  A word or phrase used in Japanese poetry that evokes a particular season.
Competitive Balance  -  Different characters, different skills and weaknesses.
Lone Wolf Boss  -  A villain with their own agenda and not associated with the game's main antagonist(s).
