Beneath The Mask  -  Our true personality is rarely shown to others.
President For Life  -  A democratically-elected official does away with democracy to stay in power.
Real Trailer Fake Movie  -  A trailer is made for a movie that has no intention of being made.
Multiform Balance  -  Character with the ability to be switch between mulitple forms each with different strengths and weaknesses.
Off With His Head  -  Death by decapitation.
Fork Fencing  -  Kitchen utensils other than knives used as improvised weapons.
Airport Novel  -  A book you can read on a plane.
NEET  -  A character who's not employed, in education or in training.
Spider Swarm  -  Many spiders in one place.
Softspoken Sadist  -  Having a villain's voice and/or mannerisms be calm and gentle makes them more unnerving.
Real Women Dont Wear Dresses  -  A female character can be girly, or she can be badass, never both.
Psycho Poodle  -  Poodles portrayed as vicious, or even evil, as a subversion of their usual Dog Stereotype as cute and delicate.
Characters Dropping Like Flies  -  Lots of named characters die throughout the course of the series.
Fantastic Fighting Style  -  A fictional martial art that involves the use of one or more superpowers.
Goldfish Poop Gang  -  Incredibly persistent recurring antagonists who never pose any threat.
Many Questions Fallacy  -  A question which assumes a negative or positive response to another.
Summer Blockbuster  -  Big-budgeted films produced during the summer months.
Stoic Spectacles  -  Glasses make them look stoic.
Recurring Character  -  A character that appears prominently in multiple episodes.
Role Called  -  The name and job in the title.
Waking Up Elsewhere  -  After a character has lost consciousness for a long period, they slowly awaken into an unfamiliar environment...
Hot Line  -  Direct, custom-installed communication lines from one important character to another. Usually only used in a crisis.
Popularity Power  -  The more popular always wins.
The Heros Journey  -  The path taken by the protagonist through the series, episode, or Story Arc.
An Offer You Cant Refuse  -  An offer where the choices are "Accept or die."
Its Quiet Too Quiet  -  Silence is golden ominous.
Binomium Ridiculus  -  Silly-sounding Latin-style names for things.
Mistaken For Granite  -  Those statues aren't just statues: they'll move and attack you if you do something they don't like.

Ms Red Ink  -  Someone who wastes a lot of their family/friends' money.
Implacable Man  -  A villainous Determinator, with the toughness to back it up.
Not In The Face  -  Character begs not to be struck in the face.
Heritage Face Turn  -  Character's loyalty shifts upon finding out they came from the group they'd previously opposed.
Involuntary Group Split  -  A sudden disaster creates a physical barrier between a group of characters, forcing them to split up.

Wall Slump  -  A body is slumping on the wall, face hidden to dramatize the death.
D Cup Distress  -  A character hates her large chest.
Laymans Terms  -  Complex concepts explained in simpler words.
I Resemble That Remark  -  After being insulted, your actions prove the insult to be accurate.

Becoming The Boast  -  A character lies about a skill they have, but succeed when they needed it.
Freaky Friday Flip  -  People swap bodies.
The Xenophile  -  Human characters who are fascinated by space aliens.
Scrappy Weapon  -  This weapon sucks.
Posthumous Sibling  -  When a character is born after their older sibling has already died.
Toilet Paper Trail  -  TP stuck to your foot after using the bathroom.
Twenty Minutes Into The Past  -  Works set in the (then) recent past.
Long Bus Trip  -  The character was Put on a Bus with a possibility of returning, but it hasn't happened in real life years.
Too Kinky To Torture  -  Character enjoys being tortured.
Cuteness Proximity  -  As you approach a cute thing, your intelligence and sanity drops off proportionally.
Jurisdiction Friction  -  Conflict between different law-enforcement agencies.
We Care  -  A corporation tries to improve its image with a blatantly false PR campaign.
Unexpected Character  -  A character whom the audience knows, but has no reason to expect to appear.
Dirty Cop  -  A corrupt cop who commits police misconduct.

Death Is A Slap On The Wrist  -  When dying isn't much of a punishment in a video game.
Monster Closet  -  An innocent-looking wall pulls away to reveal a mook ambush.
Based On A Great Big Lie  -  A work purports to be Based on a True Story, but is actually complete fiction.
Defector From Decadence  -  Someone who joins the other side only because they thought their previous alliance sucked.
Thriller On The Express  -  A crime/espionage/murder mystery story centered around a moving train setting.
Rage Against The Legal System  -  Convicted and/or incarcerated criminal seeks revenge against authorities for his punishment.

Lima Syndrome  -  Captors start showing empathy towards their captives.
Stubborn Mule  -  Bad ass! Bad ass! Stand up already!
Opaque Nerd Glasses  -  Glasses that hide the wearer's eyes to indicate how geeky they are.
Eternally Pearly White Teeth  -  The characters' teeth are perfectly healthy and they're pearly white.
Follow The Leader  -  A successful or groundbreaking work kick-starts a series of other similar works.
I Am Not A Gun  -  I was created for war? But I don't want that life!
Asian Rudeness  -  Asians are portrayed as rude.

Healing Factor  -  Regenerates when injured.
Grave Robbing  -  Stealing corpses.
Fifteen Minutes Of Fame  -  Someone starts getting a lot of attention... briefly.
Evil Chancellor  -  The king/queen's primary advisor/second-in-command is clearly antagonistic to them.
The First Cut Is The Deepest  -  A character is unable to date someone new because they still have a broken heart from their last relationship.
Once Killed A Man With A Noodle Implement  -  Someone is killed with a weapon that's rather unusual or unconventional.
Explaining Your Power To The Enemy  -  I'll tell you exactly what I can do, because the element of surprise is for THE WEAK!
Romance And Sexuality Separation  -  A character is emotionally unable to both love and have sex with the same person.
Scotireland  -  Scotland and Ireland are the same place in fiction.
Parental Abandonment  -  The character's parents aren't shown, or they're dead.
Metalcore  -  Extreme Metal meets Hardcore Punk.
Maurice Chevalier Accent  -  Ze stereotypical French ahccent? You have come to ze right place, mon'ami.

Agent Mulder  -  The character who believes in paranormal and that science cannot explain everything. He is usually right.
Clique Tour  -  The social groups of the setting are quickly introduced to the audience.
Good Armor Evil Armor  -  Character Alignment is displayed on your protective outfit.
Humiliation Conga  -  Everything dear to the villain has fallen apart. Enter his victims.
Cyanide Pill  -  Emergency suicide plan.
Family Friendly Firearms  -  No real guns on kids' shows, but plenty of laser guns, phasers, and blasters.
Rebellious Princess  -  Princess who doesn't like being a princess.
Self Restraint  -  A prisoner voluntarily staying captured
Save This Person Save The World  -  This someone will do a great good for the world. Protect them at all costs and we all benefit.
Professional Wrestling  -  Choreographed wrestling performances that emphasize theatrics alongside action.
Ashcan Copy  -  A work that's produced and disseminated quickly and cheaply to claim a trademark, keep a use-it-or-lose-it licence from expiring, or something similar.
G Rated Sex  -  Characters don't have actual sex, but they act like they are having sex. Either that, or it's implied they had sex. Both played for Innocent Innuendo.
Reaching Between The Lines  -  Telephone users taking "Reach Out and Touch Someone" literally.
Schoolmarm  -  The only teacher at single room, mixed grade school.
Good Looking Privates  -  A character is considered more attractive to other characters because of their military uniform.
Theme Naming  -  Names following a theme.
Potty Failure  -  Someone fails to hold it in.
Omnidisciplinary Scientist  -  A scientist who knows everything about science. Everything.
Suddenly Speaking  -  The Voiceless FINALLY speaks.
Home Nudist  -  A person who walks around in the buff at home.
Love Informant  -  Y tells Z that X is in love with them.
Money Mauling  -  Money as a literal weapon.
Soap Opera  -  Heavily formulaic and melodramatic drama show with daily Cliffhangers.
Imposter Forgot One Detail  -  When a Doppelgänger makes a slip that gives them away to whomever they're trying to fool.
Abandoned Catchphrase  -  A character has a catchphrase early on, only for it to fall out of favor.
The Team  -  A group of characters working together.
Market Based Title  -  Title is changed to make it more audience-friendly, because of translation problems, or other reasons.
Its Not You Its My Enemies  -  We can't be together because my enemies will try to kill you.
Enclosed Extraterrestrials  -  Aliens who are completely covered up from head to toe.
You Keep Telling Yourself That  -  Someone gives a justification for their actions, and the person they're talking to challenges its sincerity.
Meet The New Boss  -  Old villains are replaced by suspiciously similar substitutes.
Everybody Loves Zeus  -  The god of light and the heavens are portrayed as good and pure even if they weren't in the original mythology.
Captain Ersatz  -  A character who is meant to be very similar to one from another series, but just different enough to avoid copyright infringement.
Hundred Percent Adoration Rating  -  Universally adored ruler.
I Will Wait For You  -  Waiting a long time for your love to return.
Magma Man  -  Lava-based (fire and earth combo) Elemental Powers.
Secret Identity Identity  -  You have to disguise yourself as a new person every now and then. So which is the real you?
Villainous Advice Song  -  The villain tricks the hero into assisting their Evil Plan in song form.
Toon  -  Trope: Animated and wacky characters.
Possessive Wrist Grab  -  A character aggressively grabs the wrist of another character to display power or dominance.
Age Down Romance  -  A character is de-aged and starts a romance with someone of their new age.
Evil Twin  -  He's your own look-alike twin, but evil.
Number Two  -  Trope: The Leader's right-hand man or second-in-command.
The Computer Is A Cheating Bastard  -  The artificial opponent cheats or has unfair advantages over the player.
Eurabia  -  Somewhere in the near future, Europe becomes an Islamic theocracy, usually because of invasion or mass immigration.
Flowery Insults  -  Insulting with Purple Prose.
Hints Are For Losers  -  The game mocks you for looking for hints or clues.
Age Progression Song  -  A song that tells how a character grew up.
Fast Food Nation  -  Americans eat a lot of fast/junk food and obsess over it.
Awesome Anachronistic Apparel  -  Old-fashioned outfit makes him cool.
Battle Of The Bands  -  Musical bands duke it out.
Dungeon Maintenance  -  Dungeons are deliberately kept in a state fit for adventurers to explore.
The Dreaded  -  A character defined by the fear that others have of them.
Injured Player Character Stage  -  Your player character suffers an injury - and you have to play through said injury next.
Strawman Has A Point  -  The Straw Character makes a better argument than the author intended.
Cop Show  -  A show about cops.
Take A Third Option  -  When life hands you lemons, make toast.
Ridiculously Difficult Route  -  When a route is usually never used because it's just too difficult and/or there are other, easier ways.
Swear Word Plot  -  Characters get in trouble for using curse words or swears. Usually teaches an aesop about appropriate language.
The Jailer  -  A character whose hat is to imprison people.
Hood Ornament Hottie  -  Attractive character sexily draped over a vehicle.
Tastes Like Chicken  -  Everything in fiction is said to taste like chicken.
Life Energy  -  The longevity and health of a person is dependent on their Life Energy, which can be stolen.
Fire Forged Friends  -  Initially cold to each other, they became friends after fighting together.
Lingerie Scene  -  Victoria shows you her secret.
Door To Before  -  At the end of a long level, there happens to be a door leading to the entrance.
Cannibal Larder  -  Where a man-eater stores his "leftovers".
Alien Landmass  -  Landmass clearly showing that action does not occur on Earth.
Creepy Crossdresser  -  An icky-looking crossdresser, who can also be a bad person.
Super Weight  -  TV Tropes' home-grown numbered power scale for characters.
Eighties Hair  -  Hairstyles from the 1980s (i.e., big, poofy bouffants, Joe Piscopo-style man perms, jheri curls, crimped ponytails on teenaged girls, mullets, mohawks, etc)
Crossover Cosmology  -  Many Gods and Elements from different Religions and Mythologies exist in the same universe.
Strategy Schmategy  -  Someone has no idea what they're doing, which works to their advantage.
Sapient Ship  -  A ship that can think.
Improvised Golems  -  Golems made of whatever's handy.
Ominous Music Box Tune  -  A music box used in creepy music.
Secret War  -  There's a war going on but only the immediate combatants are aware of it.
Electric Torture  -  Electricity is a good tool for torture
Stupid Evil  -  Being evil even when it directly harms you, offers practically no meaningful benefits, and/or is unnecessarily challenging in comparison to non-evil methods.
Rule Of Symbolism  -  Themes or imagery inserted for symbolic value.
Color Wash  -  A form of color change to make the work look fancy.
Office Golf  -  High-powered boss plays golf in the office.
Screw The War Were Partying  -  Characters party while there's a war going on nearby.
Two And A Half D  -  3D graphics, 2D motion.
Effeminate Voice  -  A male character with a soft or feminine voice to accentuate his femininity
Two Part Trilogy  -  A trilogy composed of two story arcs: one in the first installment, and the other split between the second and third.
Elevator Escape  -  A person being chased escapes in an elevator.
Wink Ding  -  Winks aren't the most audible of movements... But when they do, they make this noise.
Goblin Face  -  An incredibly exaggerated and wrinkled facial expression.
Psychic Link  -  A telepathic connection.
The Women Are Safe With Us  -  The villain's army is prone to rape; the hero's army is not.
Stock Light Novel Hero  -  A character type that bundles ordinariness, stoicism, accumulation of power and admirers.
Forced Into Their Sunday Best  -  A character is forced to dress up nicely, but not without complaint.
Parasol Of Prettiness  -  Parasols with a women signify and/or give her beauty.
Parodies For Dummies  -  Parodies of For Dummies books and similar instructional guides.
Creepy Jazz Music  -  Jazz music used for creepy effect, often through association with villainous characters.
The Croc Is Ticking  -  The monster's appearance is heralded by a familiar sound.
The Dead Have Names  -  The dead are named to show their significance.
Guys Smash Girls Shoot  -  Male melee/close-range fighters, female ranged warriors.
Forgot About The Mind Reader  -  Did I Just Say That Out Loud?
Kinda Busy Here  -  People calling at the most inconvenient times.
Curtain Call  -  At the very end, the whole cast appears all at once.
Level Locked Loot  -  Gear you can only use if you're mighty enough.
Justice By Other Legal Means  -  You commit Arson, Murder, and Jaywalking and spend the rest of your life in jail for the jaywalking.
The Backwards R  -  TЭЖT THДT LФФKS ЯЦSSIДИ JЦST БЗCДЦSЭ IT HДS CЧЯILLIC LЭTTЭЯS.note Text that looks Russian just because it has Cyrillic letters. Transcribed TEJT THDT LFFKS YaTsSSIDI JTsST BZCDTsSE IT HDS CChYaILLIC LETTEYaS.
Room Escape Game  -  Point and click games based on escaping a room, or a series of rooms, while solving puzzles.
Youngest Child Wins  -  The youngest of them all wins.
Blended Family Drama  -  The growing pains of a family unit formed by two parents with children from preexisting relationships.
Gardening Variety Weapon  -  Need a weapon? Just grab something from the garden shed!
You Sexy Beast  -  Dangerous monsters make the best lovers.
Dagwood Sandwich  -  A sandwich with more fillings than the normal human jaw can accommodate.
Friend Of Masked Self  -  A superhero, in their civilian identity, claims to be friends with their Secret Identity.
Horror Hunger  -  A character feels a supernatural and irresistible hunger for other humans.
Single Phlebotinum Limit  -  Everything's powered and/or built from one thing.
Improbable Power Discrepancy  -  If you're tremendously powerful, rats and slimes are too.
Gentleman Thief  -  A Man of Wealth and Taste who steals for sport.
Forced Friendly Fire  -  A character gains control of their opponent's firearm and forces them to shoot it at allies.
From Clones To Genre  -  At a certain point, it stops being a rip-off and starts being a genre.
Peter Pan Parody  -  Stock Parodies of Peter Pan.
The Sacred Darkness  -  Darkness treated as a benevolent force.
False Roulette  -  The gun isn't loaded, but he doesn't know that.
Chain Of Deals  -  Trade A to get B, trade B to get C, and so on.
Nuclear Nasty  -  Radiation makes monsters and supervillains.
Geodesic Cast  -  Groups of counterparts in the same cast.
Shocking Moments  -  Moments in works that shocked us.
Computer Voice  -  Artificial voice that often seems off somehow.
Pet Baby Wild Animal  -  A young character adopts a baby wild animal. Either it has to be set free, they try unsuccessfully to set it free, or it dies.
Language Of Magic  -  Spells are cast by speaking in a specific language.
Nobody Touches The Hair  -  A character's personal Berserk Button is having their hair messed with.
Green Rocks  -  An object, technology, or substance whose effects are seemingly random and varied.
Whispering Ghosts  -  Whispering sounds in the background make for a creepy mood.
Product Promotion Parade  -  Who needs pacing when there are products to pitch?
Slavery Is A Special Kind Of Evil  -  Slavery is considered worse than any other capital crimes.
Handshake Refusal  -  A character refuses to shake hands with another character.
Hopeless Boss Fight  -  You will always lose this fight because the plot (in-universe or meta) demands it.
Metal Slime  -  A rare, powerful, and elusive Mook, likely to drop some useful item if you manage to defeat it.
Interservice Rivalry  -  Two government agencies have bad blood that may even affect their work.
Two Words Added Emphasis  -  Summing something up with only a few words.
Everybodys Dead Dave  -  Everyone is dead... except you.
Revive Kills Zombie  -  Healing magics or restorative items damage the undead.
Offscreen Inertia  -  Wondering if characters are still doing whatever they were last seen doing.
Monty Hall Problem  -  Should you change to another door number? Yes!
Speak Of The Devil  -  Say the name of the villain, and he shall appear.
Mobile Suit Human  -  A human-like Humongous Mecha for small beings.
Power Stereotype Flip  -  Someone's personality is at odds with what is expected from their superpowers.
Survival Through Self Sacrifice  -  When characters are spared after choosing to lay down their lives.
Disproportionate Retribution  -  Severe punishment for petty offenses.
Boke And Tsukkomi Routine  -  Stupid and straight comedy act.
Domestic Only Cartoon  -  Production of an animated work done entirely in the country of origin with no outsourcing involved.
Heart Is An Awesome Power  -  Seemingly weak power comes in handy.
Drop The Washtub  -  A washtub on the head instead of an anvil.
Maturity Is Serious Business  -  Serious = "Mature".
Mechanically Unusual Class  -  Classes with unusual mechanics that are typically not damage dealers or healers. Often named bards.
Unreboot  -  Series instalment that ignores the Continuity Reboot before it in favour of being a followup to the prior continuity.
Butterfly Of Transformation  -  Butterflies as a symbol of change.
Tuxedo And Martini  -  James Bond Expies.
Series Continuity Error  -  Events in a story that contradict previous explicitly established canon.
Prematurely Grey Haired  -  A character has grey hair as a result of traumatic experiences rather than old age.
Was It Really Worth It  -  Probably not.
Ambiguous Syntax  -  Word order makes it confusing what describes what, or who does what in a sentence.
Releasing From The Promise  -  The character who received a promise releases the promise-maker.
Im A Humanitarian  -  Cannibalismnote Among humans. Humans being eaten by anything not human is not an example.
Took A Shortcut  -  NPCs always inexplicably beat you to the destination.
Fox Chicken Grain Puzzle  -  A precedence logic puzzle with counter-intuitive solution.
Over The Top Secret  -  A piece of information which is so preciously secret, "Top Secret" is an Understatement.
Exotic Eye Designs  -  The character has different pupil designs and/or sclera colors than what is usual.
The Old Gods  -  Entities that are above and/or came before the gods.
Refusal Of The Call  -  The plot wants the character, but the character doesn't want the plot.
Americasia  -  An area based on both America and Eastern culture.
Waggle  -  Gameplay elements shoehorned in to exploit a console's capacity.
Pungeon Master  -  Character a-pun-dantly makes puns.
Space Romans  -  An alien culture that resembles a historical Earth culture.
Heal It With Water  -  Water has or is associated with healing, medicinal, or restorative properties.
Baa Bomb  -  Exploding sheep are hilarious.
Mind Rape  -  Psychic or mental torture presented in a way that resembles rape.
Environment Specific Action Figure  -  A show's toyline has character costumes that do not appear in the actual show.
Not If They Enjoyed It Rationalization  -  Rape is considered okay by the perpetrator if the victim enjoys it.
Fad Super  -  A character based on a then-current cultural fad.
New Old Flame  -  The protagonist has "history" with their new Love Interest.
Static Character  -  Character stays the same throughout the story, exempt from development.
Deathcore  -  Death Metal Meets Hardcore
Knight Errant  -  A deliberate Drifter with a case of Chronic Hero Syndrome.
When You Coming Home Dad  -  Why do you have to be so busy all the time, Dad?
Say My Name  -  Dramatic uttering of somebody's name.
Cool Starship  -  A one-of-a-kind (or at least unusual) space vessel for protagonists to travel in.
Time Skip  -  Time advances to bring forth a new story after the old one ends.
Wardens Are Evil  -  Prison wardens are evil, often bullying or tormenting prisoners.
Hard Work Hardly Works  -  Some people are just better, regardless of effort.
Quad Damage  -  Grab this item for a temporary boost in stats.
Yukionna  -  Youkai women with ice powers who lures men into mountains to either love or kill them.
Picked Last  -  Being the final person to be chosen for a team.
Lightworlder  -  Adapted to low gravity worlds, these characters are delicate and often fragile.
Enemies Equals Greatness  -  Having enemies or detractors is a good thing for a character.
Man Of Kryptonite  -  Someone effectively made of the stuff that weakens a superhero.
Driven To Suicide  -  Events lead a character to kill themselves.
Nurikabe  -  A Youkai that manifests as an obstructive barrier.
Bubble Boy  -  Someone literally living in a bubble, likely to protect them from allergies or diseases.
Normal Fish In A Tiny Pond  -  Person who is normal in their home world is powerful in another world because of differences between the worlds.
Absurdly Ineffective Barricade  -  This barricade is not going to work.
Versus Title  -  A work is named for one thing going up against another thing.
Kill The Poor  -  Genocide eliminates poverty, when you really stop and think about it.
Final Girl  -  The last survivor of a Slasher Movie.
Blanket Fort  -  Making a little clubhouse out of various bedding materials.
Plato Is A Moron  -  When someone considers other famous people, often renowned geniuses to be inferior to them.
Observation On Originality  -  Quality and originality are mutually exclusive.
Lessons In Sophistication  -  Getting trained on how to be a Proper Lady or a Gentleman and a Scholar.
Manly Tears  -  Even a male badass is permitted to shed tears.
Classic Villain  -  A villain who acts as an evil foil to the hero's personality and is a main block to his journey towards his destiny.
Hidden Elf Village  -  A secret location inhabited by isolationists.
Pretty Spry For A Dead Guy  -  Oh my gosh, looks like he is Back from the Dead! Except not.
Continuity Lock Out  -  The later you join the fandom, the less you understand what's going on.
Pet Gets The Keys  -  Character breaks out of captivity by getting an animal to bring them an implement of escape, often keys.
Nature Lover  -  A character loves natural surroundings.
Caught Monologuing  -  Taking action while your opponent is busy talking.
Goo Goo Godlike  -  An all-powerful child who doesn't know any better.
Power Hair  -  A woman in politics or business will keep her hair short.
Out Of Job Into The Plot  -  The main character loses his old day job shortly before/after the story starts.
Big Little Brother  -  Bigger doesn't always mean older among siblings.
Blade On A Stick  -  Using a polearm (such as a spear, lance, naginata, etc.) as a weapon.
Absent Animal Companion  -  A pet or other animal introduced as if they would be a regular character disappears, often without explanation.
Murderous Malfunctioning Machine  -  A robot goes haywire and starts to Kill All Humans.
Learned From The News  -  Getting personal news from a public source.
Backpack Cannon  -  Loaded, fully operational heavy artillery on your back.
The Wrongful Heir To The Throne  -  Character who is the heir to the throne by all rights, but is utterly ill-suited for the position.
Lack Of Empathy  -  Character is totally apathetic toward other people's feelings.
Hooks And Crooks  -  Hooks or objects that contain hook-shapes used as weapons.
Failure Gambit  -  Failing actually helps someone, rather than a purely negative outcome.
Stab The Sky  -  Raising your sword in the air above your head.
Award Category Fraud  -  Someone is nominated for (or wins) in what is clearly the wrong category.
Its All Upstairs From Here  -  Video Game tower level, involving upward advancement.
Prehensile Hair  -  Treating long hair as one or more extra limb(s).
Fatal Mac Guffin  -  Object that everyone wants kills you when you use it.
The Pollyanna  -  A character who is always optimistic no matter what may happen to them.
Post Final Boss  -  A boss fight after the Final Boss that is easy or effortless, made to wrap up the plot.
Combat Haircomb  -  Hidden Weapons worn in a woman's hair.
Minor Injury Overreaction  -  Tiny boo-boo, MASSIVE screaming!
Pants Positive Safety  -  A firearm is stored directly inside one's trousers.
Self Surgery  -  You're in urgent need of a doctor... Unfortunately, you can't get to one, so you'll have to suffice.
Inhumanable Alien Rights  -  Aliens, supernatural beings or transformed humans somehow have no rights.
Remarried To The Mistress  -  A man marries his mistress once his wife is out of the picture.
Silent Snarker  -  If they could talk, they'd be a Deadpan Snarker.
Manchurian Agent  -  The brainwashed self is awakened by a certain trigger.
Genghis Gambit  -  Stopping a conflict by creating a larger threat to unite against.
Hailfire Peaks  -  Two different, often contrasting, generic Video Game areas smooshed together.
Dragons Up The Yin Yang  -  Using oriental dragons and/or the yin-yang symbol to indicate awesome Asian stuff.
But Not Too Foreign  -  This foreign/mixed-blood person is like one of us!
London Gangster  -  Scary London dudes with guns.
Mood Dissonance  -  Something in the story clashes with its overall mood.
Astonishingly Appropriate Appearance  -  The design really fits the character. What a coincidence!
Rainbow Motif  -  The seven colors of the rainbow applied in fiction.
Kirby Dots  -  An arrangement of coloured dots outlined by black dots to indicate raw energy.
Humanity Is Infectious  -  A non-human entity develops human-like qualities from hanging around humans.
Call A Hit Point A Smeerp  -  Well known meta concepts given different names to stand out.
Progressively Prettier  -  A character that started looking ugly gets prettier in later installments.
Doomed Contrarian  -  The Complainer Will Always Die!
Non Indicative Name  -  A wrong or inaccurate name or use of a term.
Locked In A Room  -  Two characters with tension between them are stuck in a room together where they are finally able to sort out their issues.
Saturday Morning Cartoon  -  Cartoons that kids wake up in the morning to watch after school's out.
Im A Doctor Not A Placeholder  -  A character doesn't have the skill or knowledge for something they've run into despite having the title to have it.
Wackyland  -  Generic I'M TOTALLY TRIPPIN BALLS video game level.
Ye Goode Olde Days  -  Making the past look nicer than it actually was.
Backported Development  -  Their characterization in flashbacks is tweaked to resemble their current self.
Hook Hand  -  A person whose hand is replaced with a hook.
Angelic Abomination  -  When our angels are depicted as Eldritch Abominations.
Panty Fighter  -  Shows about pretty girls doing martial arts with an emphasis on titillation.
Mouthy Kid  -  Snarky but reasonable kid.
Quit Your Whining  -  Cruelly telling people to stop wallowing on their sorrows.
Read The Fine Print  -  The smallest fonts on a contract hold the biggest problems.
Sword Beam  -  Energy beams emitted from a bladed weapon.
Latin Lover  -  Hispanics, Latinos, Spaniards, and Mediterranean people are sexy.
We Cannot Go On Without You  -  When the protagonist dies, the game's over. The state of the rest of your party does not matter.
Undying Loyalty  -  This character is loyal to another character. No matter what.
Comically Missing The Point  -  A character humorously misunderstands another person's point.
Hat Of Power  -  A Nice Hat that grants the wearer super powers.
Abomination Accusation Attack  -  You want to ruin someone's life? Accuse them of something demonstrably bad. Doesn't matter if they actually did it; just say it and people will knee-jerk believe it.
Getting Hot In Here  -  Temperature's rising. So characters are stripping.
My Death Is Just The Beginning  -  A character (usually a villain) sacrifices himself to advance his plan.
Screwed By The Merchandise  -  A work is cancelled because The Merch didn't sell well enough.
Clean Dub Name  -  Someone's name is changed in a foreign dub because its original name would sound too suggestive.
Closet Key  -  A character makes another character realize they are gay/lesbian/bisexual.
Dirty Business  -  A hero does something evil or morally ambiguous out of necessity and feels remorseful about it.
Lemming Cops  -  The police follow whoever they are chasing, even at the expense of their own safety.
Parental Savings Splurge  -  Child finds out their parents have spent money they'd expected to be used for them.
Reluctant Mad Scientist  -  A scientist discovers a new technology with the hopes of making humanity more peaceful and prosperous. Said technology is used for war and devastation.
A Man Is Always Eager  -  All men always want sex.
Interspecies Romance  -  Romance between different species.
Failsafe Failure  -  In fiction, when devices fail, they do so dangerously.
Duct Tape For Everything  -  Something broken? Duct tape to the rescue!
Speak Now Or Forever Hold Your Peace  -  Drama always breaks out at a wedding when the priest gets to the "Speak now or forever hold your peace" line.
Solar And Lunar  -  A visual and/or thematic contrast between the sun and the moon.
Slasher Movie  -  Horror Films about Serial Killers.
Gender Separated Ensemble Episode  -  An episode fully separating the sexes.
Slash Fic  -  Fanfiction about the relationship of characters (usually) of the same sex, often also including some eroticism.
Infodump  -  Large deposits of exposition given to the viewer at once.
Platonic Cave  -  The world is not as it seems.
Hiding Your Heritage  -  A character tries to hide their race for some reason.
Mature Animal Story  -  Animal cartoons and comics aimed at and containing themes more suited to adults and older teens.
Yellow Snow  -  Snow colored with pee.
Anatomy Anomaly  -  Some characters have totally different anatomy from others.
Platonic Prostitution  -  Sex work without the sex.
Averted Trope  -  A fitted trope does not appear in the work.
Wasteful Wishing  -  A character uses a magic wish on something stupid.
Bullet Hell  -  A subgenre of Shoot 'em Up with overwhelmingly high bullet counts.
There Is Another  -  He's not really the Last of His Kind after all.
True Companions  -  Friends as close as family, and just as protective.
Blind And The Beast  -  Someone with a freakish appearance befriends a blind person.
Terse Talker  -  Speaks in shorthand. Straight to the point.
Slow Paced Beginning  -  A work starts off largely dull and uninteresting, but reaches a defined point where it significantly picks up in quality.
Inevitably Broken Rule  -  Narratively speaking, rules are made to be broken.
The Breakfast Plot  -  A Homage or Whole Plot Reference to The Breakfast Club.
Argumentum Ad Lapidem  -  Dismissing an opposing argument as ridiculous without bothering to show what is wrong with it.
Fireballs  -  A ball of fire as a projectile.
Heh Heh You Said X  -  Character says something that can be cherry-picked as a Double Entendre. Heh heh, cherry-picked.
Strong As They Need To Be  -  How strong and competent the characters get portrayed as depends on what the particular story's plot needs to function.
Jumping The Shark  -  The tipping point where a series makes a sudden and desperate move to stay relevant but ends up pushing viewers away.
Flash Back Back Back  -  Flashback sequence preceded by an echo or eerie sound effect.
Villainous Legacy  -  The villain is dead, but certainly not forgotten.
Collateral Angst  -  When someone gets in trouble, another person's angsty reaction gets all the focus.
Arachnid Appearance And Attire  -  A character with a spider motif for their looks.
Magic Wand  -  A small magic stick.
The Last Straw  -  The tiny increase that breaks the resistance.
Alcoholic Parent  -  A parent who is an alcoholic, often neglecting their children in being one.
Road Runner Vs Coyote  -  The antagonist repeatedly tries and fails to capture or defeat the protagonist in a variety of humiliating ways.
Fractured Fairy Tale  -  A parody of fairy tales.
Self Proclaimed Love Interest  -  Someone falsely proclaims themselves to be the significant other of a person they're attracted to.
Hot Scientist  -  An expert on science who happens to be attractive.
Call Of The Wild Blue Yonder  -  A character wishes they could fly and repeatedly tries and fails at it.
Expository Hairstyle Change  -  Hairstyle change signals a characterization change.
You Know The One  -  Character speaks cryptically in situations they don't need to be so the audience is kept out of the loop.
Oblivious To Love  -  Clueless about someone's interest in them.
Script Wank  -  Didn't catch the episode's Aesop? Then here it is, spelled out for you.
Bad Is Good And Good Is Bad  -  Your evil is my good.
Love Letter  -  A confession of love in written form.
Clingy Mac Guffin  -  There's just no getting rid of this!
Earth Shattering Poster  -  The stock image version of Earth-Shattering Kaboom.
Ate The Spoon  -  A liquid is shown to be incredibly dangerous by dissolving the spoon used to stir it.
Demonization  -  Intentionally making something seem like a monster or a demon.
Rock Theme Naming  -  Characters with rock/mineral/gemstone-themed names.
Curse Cut Short  -  Character is interrupted mid-swear.
Sour Supporter  -  A member of a team of heroes is cynical.
Lead The Target  -  Aim at where the target will be, not where it is.
Mana Burn  -  Ability destroys target's spell resources.
Flaming Sword  -  Just like a regular sword...but it's ON FIRE!
Demoted Memories  -  Someone recontextualizes a part of their life as being something they dreamed, imagined or misremembered.
Settle It Without Weapons  -  Two fighters discard their weaponry to beat the crap out of each other with bare fists.
Dull Eyes Of Unhappiness  -  Eyes losing their luster due to the character experiencing a grim moment.
I Have This Friend  -  A hypothetical question in which the "friend" is actually you.
Streetwalker  -  A prostitute who walks the street in order to find clients. Has a low-status and dangerous job.
Comic Book Time  -  Even as the in-series date advances with real life, characters don't get any older.
Beauty Brains And Brawn  -  A female Power Trio formed by an attractive girl, a smart girl, and a strong girl.
Nature Spirit  -  An Anthropomorphic Personification of the forces of nature.
It Tastes Like Feet  -  It tastes like something that no one in his right mind would ever have tasted.
Not Good With Rejection  -  A character doesn't take well in being rejected by the person they love.
Perilous Power Source  -  A power source which is extremely dangerous.
Heroic Lineage  -  Heroism is passed down through the family.
Its Going Down  -  Impressive structures are the most doomed.
Werewolf Theme Naming  -  Werewolf names are almost always wolf-themed.
Kid Amid The Chaos  -  A little kid who's found themselves all alone and crying in the middle or in the aftermath of a grand scale disaster, a.k.a the perfect way for a hero to step in and show their mettle.
This Page Will Self Destruct  -  After you listen to a recorded secret message, it self-destructs within a few seconds.
Wake Up Call Boss  -  First hard boss early in the game.
Artistic License Medicine  -  Medicine and medical treatments are presented inaccurately in order to make the story work better.
A Lighter Shade Of Black  -  More sympathetic one in the conflict of the unambiguously evils.
Lying Finger Cross  -  A character crosses their fingers while making a vow, oath, etc., to show they're lying.
Adjective Animal Alehouse  -  If you're going to make a bar, name it after an animal and an adjective.
Eye Lights Out  -  The eyes of a robotic or magical being with Glowing Eyes fade when they die.
Fall Of The House Of Cards  -  Small, precariously built structure is toppled.
Elaborate Equals Effective  -  The stronger the weapon, the fancier it looks.
Sliding Scale Of Law Enforcement  -  Good Cop/Bad Cop or just plain incompetent cop?
Trees Into Toothpicks  -  Destroying trees for incredibly wasteful or trivial purposes.
Caged Inside A Monster  -  A monster that entraps its victims in or on its body.
Internet Incorporated  -  The internet is owned/controlled by a single corporation.
You Did Everything You Could  -  A character is told that they did their best, despite being a failure.
Situational Sword  -  A weapon whose power is only fully realized under certain conditions.
You ALL Look Familiar  -  Character models are reused for other NPCs.
Kung Fu Jesus  -  The trope: Jesus reimagined as a badass.
A Death In The Limelight  -  Minor character gets fifteen minutes of fame before dying.
Emperor Scientist  -  He took over the world using his scientific genius.
No Dialogue Episode  -   An episode where nobody says anything.
Fake King  -  A good ruler is secretly replaced by an evil lookalike who then abuses their position.
Intellectually Supported Tyranny  -  The smart people support the dictatorship.
Coffee Shop AU Fic  -  Alternate Universe Fic, usually set in modern and non-fantastic times, where the main cast works/hangs out in a coffee shop.
Visual Initiative Queue  -  A meter (mostly used in Eastern RPGs) that tells the player when it's their turn to act.
Cosmic Deadline  -  The rate the plot resolves itself starts going into overdrive near the end of the story due to development problems.
Cute Owl  -  Owls depicted as cute widdle birbs.
Literally Shattered Lives  -  Death by being smashed into smithereens.
Cone Of Shame  -  A medical cone is placed around a character's head, making them look silly.
Bootstrapped Theme  -  A track that wasn't the Theme Tune the first time it was used, but is now.
Facial Horror  -  A character has or has had their face gruesomely disfigured.
Appeal To Nature  -  The logical fallacy that anything from nature is good by default and that the "natural" way is the right way.
Big Dumb Body  -  A big, burly, usually unintelligent character gets mind-controlled and used for their physical strength.
Forgetful Jones  -  A character with a defining trait of being forgetful.
Raised By Robots  -  A child has a robot as their primary caregiver.
Pre Battle Banter  -  Characters making small talk before the Final Battle.
This Is Gonna Suck  -  Oh, Crap! plus Casual Danger Dialogue. Usually Played for Laughs.
Vetinari Job Security  -  A character stops doing his job, and the other characters discover that no one else can do the job at all.
Damsel In Distress  -  A female character is kidnapped or otherwise in danger and in need of rescue.
Back From The Brink  -  The place/faction you're start in is almost destroyed... until you came along.
Reign Of Terror  -  La Résistance purges elements of The Empire... violently.
World Of Badass  -  The entire cast are badasses.
The Dentist Episode  -  Episodes that feature a character visiting or being scheduled to see a dentist.
Fight Magnet  -  Hero attracts fights wherever he goes.
Nudity Equals Honesty  -  A character approaches another without wearing any clothes to show that they're not a threat.
Game Gourmet  -  Choice of food in video games.
Post Cyber Punk  -  Cyberpunk with less Dystopia. Genre Reconstruction to Cyberpunk's Deconstruction.
Soul Sucking Retail Job  -  Retail hell.
Despotism Justifies The Means  -  The villain doesn't care about the state of the world as long as he takes it over in the end.
Holy Hand Grenade  -  Weaponizing the dangerous nature of holy powers.
Hot Wind  -  Wind blowing behind an attractive (usually female) character makes them look sexier.
Genericist Government  -  A generic government; run the way someone who doesn't work for a government would expect.
Common Nonsense Jury  -  Stupid jury rendering an inept verdict.
Near Death Experience  -  A character experiences an event that almost kills them.
Iron Maiden  -  Heavy Metal band with lots of Filk Songs and a cool Mascot.
Guns In Church  -  Carrying weapons in a strictly no-weapons zone.
Tertiary Sexual Characteristics  -  Stereotypical aspects indicate something's sex, such as bows or baseball caps.
Percussive Maintenance  -  It's broken.
Sink Or Swim Fatherhood  -  A character unexpectedly becomes a parent and must figure out how to do it with no prior knowledge or preparation.
Kindhearted Cat Lover  -  Liking cats portrayed as a good (or at least somewhat redeeming) character trait rather than a mark of evil.
Semi Divine  -  Part normal, part supernatural being. Or in between them in general.
Remade For The Export  -  A game isn't released outside of its home country at first, then when it is, it's remade.
Exactly What I Aimed At  -  The gunman seemingly misses their target, but takes out another target.
Seashell Bra  -  A bra made out of seashells.
Character Shill  -  Characters of the work stop whatever they're doing to advertise something or to talk about their sponsor.
Intermission  -  Break in the action, half-time show, or interlude.
Mutilation Interrogation  -  You want to interrogate them right, you gotta remove a few body parts.
Excuse Me While I Multitask  -  A character multitasks while fighting.
Kleptomaniac Hero Found Underwear  -  A kleptomaniac hero may find underwear when they search through drawers.
Tagalong Kid  -  An enthusiastic child follows the heroes around and is an inconvenience to them.
Romantic Plot Tumor  -  A romantic sub-plot that swallows and derails the main story.
Placebo Effect  -  Something (like a drug) works solely because the user believes it works.
Cock Fight  -  Two guys fight openly over a girl.
Malcolm Xerox  -  A character who is willing to resort to extremist violence as means of pushing for civil rights for an oppressed minority.
Nice Guy  -  An overall pleasant, kind-hearted character with no glaringly dark traits.
Worker Unit  -  A unit that helps build, maintain and expand your Real-Time Strategy / 4X empire.
Anti Grinding  -  A game actively discourages Level Grinding.
Hero Ball  -  Heroic lapses in judgment which prolong or facilitate the plot.
Aside Glance  -  Fictional characters looking at the Fourth Wall.
Hyperspace Lanes  -  Faster-Than-Light Travel is restricted to certain system-to-system jumps.
Strange Syntax Speaker  -  From odd construction, do sentences define such a character.
Pilot  -  The trope: The first episode to air, often to see if a series can work, but doesn't always take off.
The Earth Prime Theory  -  In every multiverse, there is one universe that existed first... and it's a keystone for the existence of all the others.
Dueling Scar  -  A scar on the face that happened in a sword duel.
The Eleven O Clock Number  -  A song sung toward the end of a musical to wrap up its main plot and initiate the climax.
Girl In A Box  -  Person (usually female) fit inside a box or another small compartment.
Spectator Casualty  -  Someone watching a dangerous show and gets harmed by the things coming from it.
Awesomeness By Analysis  -  Using observation and calculation to succeed.
You Cant Go Home Again  -  A central character is unable to return home.
Because Im Good At It  -  Character does a job he detests because he's good at it, not because he must.
Straight Man  -  The guy who sets up the punchline for the Plucky Comic Relief.
Cover Innocent Eyes And Ears  -  The kids shouldnt see or hear this!
Retconning The Wiki  -  A character edits a wiki with false or subjective information for the purpose of a joke, or just for kicks.
Pandaing To The Audience  -  Pandas are adorable.
Word Schmord  -  Warning shmarning, none of my business.
Makeover Montage  -  A montage that shows a character getting a makeover for something.
Conveniently Timed Attack From Behind  -  A character attacks the character who has the hero cornered from behind just in time to save him.
Neurodiversity Is Supernatural  -  A mental condition is created by something supernatural.
Expert Consultant  -  Someone much more knowledgeable about something.
Source Music  -  Background music that is actually playing in-universe.
Mad Artist  -  He'll do the most grotesque, evil things for the sake of creating his art.
Sweet Seal  -  Seals portrayed as cute and friendly.
The Resenter  -  A character who actively resents another for their success.
Frontline General  -  A flag officer who leads from the front instead of the rear.
Saved From Development Hell  -  Sometimes, a work luckily gets out of Development Hell.
Issue Drift  -  An apolitical work turns political.
Stupid Sexy Flanders  -  Stop making me question my own sexual orientation, dammit!
Fingerless Hands  -  Characters' hands are drawn without fingers, yet they can still hold things.
Chekhovs Gift  -  Character A has received a gift from Character B in the past. Expect it to be important to the plot later.
Motor Mouth  -  Talkstoofasttalkstoomuch.
Twisted Eucharist  -  Eucharist symbolism Played for Horror.
Fatal Method Acting  -  A performer dies suddenly during their performance.
Power Echoes  -  Fear my reverb! I'm OVER NINE THOUSAND!AND!and!and!...
The Fool  -  An irritatingly lucky Ditz.
As Long As There Is One Man  -  ...they will continue to oppose tyranny.
Hero Harasses Helpers  -  The hero rejects the help of other characters to fight with them.
I Have Your Wife  -  Do what I say or your wife gets it.
Inherently Funny Words  -  Words that sound so peculiar, they can make people laugh.
Throw Down The Bomblet  -  Portable explosives as a Weapon of Choice.
Loner Turned Friend  -  A solitary character becomes a part of a group of friends/allies.
Compliment Backfire  -  When complimenting other characters go wrong.
Prima Donna Director  -  A melodramatic, egotistical film director.
Mars And Venus Gender Contrast  -  When men and women are portrayed like they're complete opposites.
Happy Holidays Dress  -  Holiday equivalent of trademark Pimped-Out Dress.
Random Number God  -  Probability is sentient, and needs appeasing, lest it afflict you with downright rotten luck.
But What About The Astronauts  -  Astronauts in space are the sole survivors of a global disaster.
Torture For Fun And Information  -  Torture interrogation played not-serious.
Stock Superhero Day Jobs  -  Typical social roles of super hero secret identities.
Peeve Goblins  -  Beings that exist to inconvenience people.
Savage Spinosaurs  -  Spinosaurs depicted as violent and ferocious and possibly palaeontologically inaccurate.
Fanfic Fuel  -  Unexplained elements in canon that are frequently exploited in fanfiction.
More Teeth Than The Osmond Family  -  Creatures with a huge number of teeth.
Never Got To Say Goodbye  -  A character leaves, and another character, usually a loved one, doesn't wish them farewell. The leaving character never comes back.
All Guys Want Cheerleaders  -  A boy is attracted to a (usually popular) cheerleader.
Assumed Win  -  Someone thinks they are about to be announced winner, but then find out they actually lost.
Hair Trigger Explosive  -  Explosives + any impact = boom.
Alien Kudzu  -  Plantlike alien infestation.
Peace And Love Incorporated  -  This corporation projects an extremely benevolent image publicly, when behind closed doors they are anything but.
No Warrant No Problem  -  Cowboy Cops enter a building or residence without a warrant, using a flimsy excuse or Blatant Lies
Resigned In Disgrace  -  A scandal forces a character to resign from their post - willingly or otherwise.
Bleed Em And Weep  -  Breaking down in tears after killing someone.
Dry Docked Ship  -  They are exes in Fanon.
Alien Among Us  -  Aliens trying to blend in a human society.
This Is What The Building Will Look Like  -  A scale model of a projected building.
Author Filibuster  -  The story grinds to a halt for a long, rambling speech.
Mundane Made Awesome  -  Ordinary, mediocre and everyday tasks made EPIC.
Looming Silhouette Of Rage  -  Imposing shadows of some incredibly angry characters. Makes their target appear very small.
Opposite Day  -  Not the day when you say the opposite of what you mean.
Good Guy Bar  -  A place where the good guys go to hang out off-duty.
Arc Number  -  Numbers that appear repeatedly throughout a work.
Halloween Songs  -  Songs about Halloween
Fanservice  -  Audience-pleasing material (often sexual).
Porting Disaster  -  Video game conversions gone horribly, horribly wrong.
Ambiguously Absent Parent  -  A character's parent is absent, but it's never explained or in most cases, even acknowledged.
Deliberately Monochrome  -  Limited color palette on purpose.
Construction Is Awesome  -  When construction, creation, and productive work are portrayed as awesome.
Emotion Eater  -  Using others' emotions as energy.
Home Early Surprise  -  Arriving home early is bound to give you a surprise.
Camping A Crapper  -  Want to kill someone? Ambush them in the bathroom.
Arson Murder And Jaywalking  -  Minimum three items: start dark, continue dark, finish weak.
Cast The Expert  -  Hiring a professional to act in a work about said profession.
Together We Are X  -  The individual members of your band introducing themselves, and then saying "Together, we are..." whatever your band name happens to be.
Genial Giraffe  -  Giraffe characters are usually kindhearted and heroic.
Germans Love David Hasselhoff  -  Something is inexplicably very popular outside its birth nation. Perhaps far more than within.
No Sidepaths No Exploration No Freedom  -  Video game linearity taken to its extreme.
The Confidant  -  The one who will listen to other characters' hangups and baggage, and keep it to themselves while they're at it.
Morale Mechanic  -  A game mechanic simulating the combatants' morale and fighting spirit.
Amnesiac Lover  -  Love Interest under Laser-Guided Amnesia.
Player Character  -  You play as this character.
Same Plot Sequel  -  A sequel to a work is almost a retelling of the original, but is in the same canon.
End Of An Age  -  A chapter in private or public history that, once completed, can never be returned to again.
Heroic BSOD  -  A character experiences an emotional breakdown. Basically, a downplayed and temporary version of Despair Event Horizon.
Big First Choice  -  One decision at the beginning of the game determines how the rest of it unfolds.
Wash Me Graffiti  -  A joke where someone writes a message on a dirty surface to ask to clean it.
Pineapple Surprise  -  Someone pulled the pin on your grenade when you weren't paying attention. Uh oh.
Grave Humor  -  A humorous inscription on a gravestone.
Newscaster Cameo  -  Real life news reporters as fictional news reporters.
Mutually Exclusive Party Members  -  One party member or the other. Choose one.
Literal Change Of Heart  -  A character's heart is replaced with a biological, magical, or mechanical substitute.
Silly Spook  -  Ghosts who act goofy instead of scary.
To The Future And Beyond  -  Using Time Travel to go to multiple, progressive more distant future eras.
Fauns And Satyrs  -  Appearances of fauns, Satyrs, or similar myths in media.
My Hero Zero  -  Your name is "Zero"? Cool!
Poison Is Corrosive  -  Poison makes whatever it touches melt.
Gaussian Girl  -  Beauty is out of focus.
Writers Cannot Do Math  -  Numbers given in a story do not add up.
Ascended Fridge Horror  -  Fridge Horror becomes real canon.
Arbitrary Gun Power  -  Firearms doing different damage than they would in real life for the sake of balance.
Bad Girl Song  -  A woman sings an "I Am" Song about her sexuality.
Science Marches On  -  New discoveries make old theories (and stories) obsolete.
Culture Clash  -  When cultural differences cause misunderstandings/problems.
Scales Of Justice  -  The use of scales (either literal or as a image) in court cases, law, justice or judgment.
Comic Book Fantasy Casting  -  Non-Live Action character isn't played by this actor. But looks like them.
Grammar Nazi  -  We are Grammaryans and we will not tolerate inferior grammar and spelling!
Adaptational Karma  -  A character who was a Karma Houdini in the source material gets their comeuppance in the adaptation.
Quarter Hour Short  -  A 15 minute show.
Digital Avatar  -  The digital, graphical representation a person uses to represent themselves on the Internet.
The Federation  -  Good union of countries/planets, though not without its flaws.
The Barnum  -  Cheerfully blatant Con Man.
Insufficiently Advanced Alien  -  How the hell were those aliens able to build a spaceship in the first place?
Hate Dumb  -  Haters taking their vitriol to truly moronic levels.
Foreign Looking Font  -  English text in a font resembling one used when writing the setting's language.
Galactic Conqueror  -  An extremely ambitious Evil Overlord with plans on an extraterrestrial scale.
Feudal Overlord  -  Effective dictatorship by evil aristocrat due to geopolitical isolation.
Insanely International Ancestry  -  A character has ancestors that have lived across the world.
Villain No Longer Idle  -  Orcus on His Throne no more.
Practical Effects  -  Special effects achieved without computers.
Soul Eating  -  Consuming the souls of the living.
Raised By Rival  -  A child is raised by the rival or enemy of their parent.
The Alleged Car  -  Less-than-road-worthy vehicle. Don't try driving it.
Who Is Driving  -  Character questions who's driving (whether missing or abnormal character).
Casual Danger Dialog  -  Speaking casually while in danger.
Sword Drag  -  Dragging your sword across the ground.
Strike Me Down With All Of Your Hatred  -  The villain taunts the hero into killing him.
Technicolor Ninjas  -  A character who wears highly visible colors but is stealth personified.
The Faceless  -  Character with a hidden face.
Common Place Rare  -  Something that is or would be considered common is actually rare and valuable.
Artistic License Traditional Christianity  -  A mistake about Traditional Christianity is done for the sake of a better story.
Rage Against The Heavens  -  Character fights the Powers That Be, whoever or whatever they are.
The Hecate Sisters  -  A trio of female archetypes: an alluring young maiden, a matronly mother, and a wise crone.
Les Collaborateurs  -  A member of the conquered group who works with the conquerors willingly.
Thin Skinned Bully  -  A bully dishes out plenty of abuse, but crumbles upon being insulted themself.
Practical Taunt  -  When a taunt has a useful, or at least slightly meaningful application.
Sinister Surveillance  -  We are always being monitored.
Parental Marriage Veto  -  Sorry, my child, but I'll never let you marry them!
We Have Reserves  -  You are all easily replaceable.
Divided We Fall  -  Dissension within the hero's alliance.
Honorary True Companion  -  A True Companion who cannot join full-time.
Capcom Sequel Stagnation  -  A work that gets re-released several times with occasional tweaks to make it seem new.
My Sibling Will Live Through Me  -  A character impersonates their deceased sibling.
Book Dumb  -  A character who isn't academically competent, but often shows skill and talent.
Is That What He Told You  -  A character is told how someone they trust has lied to them.
Renamed The Same  -  A person's new name is almost identical to their original one.
Better By A Different Name  -  I liked X better when it was called Y.
Solo Tabletop Game  -  Tabletop Games for one.
Wicked Stepmother  -  An evil step-parent.
Bat Deduction  -  Ass Pull applied to deduction plots which allows to further them.
Interscene Diegetic  -  Source Music can still be heard by the audience even as scene moves to someplace where it would not be audible.
Eat The Camera  -  A zoom into a character's mouth ends the shot.
Blackout Basement  -  A video game location or level with poor lighting.
Demonic Spiders  -  These enemies aren't bosses, but you will learn to hate and/or fear them.
The Apocalypse Brings Out The Best In People  -  The end of the world improves people.
Fate Drives Us Together  -  The main couple meets by repeatedly bumping into each other.
You Cannot Grasp The True Form  -  Something is too strange and horrendous for the human mind to comprehend. If you could understand it, you'd Go Mad from the Revelation.
Adaptational Wealth  -  The character is richer or poorer than in the source material.
Gay Panic  -  A character's real or perceived homosexuality is toned down to appease Moral Guardians.
Smoldering Shoes  -  A character is either disintegrated or cast completely free of their still-intact footwear.
Another Mans Terror  -  Alice experiences Bob's death in one form in order to avoid the same fate or to understand the situation.
Sensei Chan  -  A teacher who's just as mature as her students, maybe less.
Burger Fool  -  Hellish fast food workplace.
Helpless Good Side  -  The good side of a Split Personality can't do anything useful.
Military Maverick  -  A member of a service who is successful despite (or even because of) their flouting of the rules.
Making Room For Baby  -  A family moves to a bigger place to make room for a new baby.
Missing Man Formation  -  A ceremonial incomplete formation to honor a fallen teammate.
Father I Dont Want To Fight  -  The Proud Warrior Race Guy is upset that his son doesn't want to embrace his warrior culture.
Frictionless Ice  -  Things on ice will slide forever until they hit something solid.
Lady Not Appearing In This Game  -  Using an attractive person (usually female) to advertise one's game- despite said person having little or nothing to do with the game's actual content.
Chekhovs Gunman  -  Earlier-introduced minor character is actually very important.
Punctuation Shaker  -  Ap'strophes m'ke al'en n'mes cool'r.
San Dimas Time  -  We have a time machine, but we still have to hurry.
Absurdly Long Stairway  -  An obstacle in the form of a ridiculously long stairway.
Iconic Outfit  -  An outfit that's associated with a character.
Spaghetti And Gondolas  -  The Theme Park Version of Italy.
Bar Full Of Aliens  -  A bar full of non-human characters.
Fake First Kiss  -  Two characters with UST share their first kiss for reasons other than romantic feelings. Their relationship doesn't change.
Jabba Table Manners  -  A villainous character has bad table manners to emphasize their badness.
Obvious Crossover Method  -  A Fandom-Specific Plot Crossover Opportunity.
Mundane Solution  -  Simple solutions to complex problems.
I Never Got Any Letters  -  Someone intercepts messages before they reach their intended recipient.
Missing Episode  -  An episode of a series that is not shown in Syndication, and is not rerun.
Super Identikit  -  Police sketch artists are super-humanly good.
Price On Their Head  -  Someone is willing to pay for this character, dead or alive.
Hour Of Power  -  Activated powers that work for a certain amount of time.
Something Person  -  Generic superheroes are named for a trait and then by gender.
Typhoid Mary  -  Someone has no idea, or refuse to accept the fact, that they're carrying and spreading a deadly disease.
Mayor Pain  -  A city leader who does not lead his people.
Non Player Companion  -  Computer-controlled aide to the Player Character.
Heaven Above  -  When the sky is associated with things pertaining to the divine.
Onee Sama  -  A graceful, doting and highly respected older sister (or figure). Derives from the honorific Japanese term.
Fire Means Chaos  -  Fire = Disaster
Hell Bent For Leather  -  Leather. Badasses wear it.
Frameup  -  Making an innocent look guilty.
Haughty Help  -  Servants who are proud, patronising, or snobbish.
Sequelphobic  -  The tendency of people to dislike sequels for just being sequels.
False Innocence Trick  -  An incapacitated stranger feigns innocence to trick some poor sap into freeing him/her.
Exact Words  -  True to the letter, not the spirit.
Clarkes Law For Girls Toys  -  Boys' toys use technology. Girls' toys use MAGIC!
Limp And Livid  -  If you see someone hunched over and glaring menacingly...watch out.
Out Of Holiday Episode  -  The work is set on a holiday, but came out at a different time of year.
The Straight And Arrow Path  -  Guns are available in this setting, but a character picks a bow or a crossbow as their Weapon of Choice instead.
Humans Are Survivors  -  Humanity's hat is being The Determinator.
Not Himself  -  A character isn't acting like their normal personality.
Sentimental Music Cue  -  Sappy music played in emotional moments.
Evil Detecting Baby  -  A baby cries when evil is in the room.
Release Date Change  -  Due to circumstances, the release of a work is rescheduled to a slightly earlier or later date.
Big Rock Ending  -  The Grand Finale of a song is spent with the musicians hammering away on their instruments.
One To Million To One  -  A single being is able to split themselves into several others and then come back again.
By The Book Cop  -  A police officer who follows the rules and regulations.
I Just Write The Thing  -  Yes, they write the plot, but in their minds, they have very little control over the finer details of the story.
Unintentionally Sympathetic  -  An unsympathetic character gets more sympathy than the author intended.
Designated Villain  -  They're the villain because the story says so. Even if their actions and motives say otherwise.
Combat Pragmatist  -  Does whatever possible to win—rules and honor be damned.
Villainous Cheekbones  -  High cheekbones just scream villainy.
Stone Wall  -  Terrible offense, great defense.
The Glasses Gotta Go  -  Remove glasses to be more attractive.
Book Snap  -  Slamming a book shut as a sign you're angry or about to take action.
Peoples Republic Of Tyranny  -  Dictatorship pretending to be a democracy. The more a nation's name implies democracy, the less likely that it's really democratic.
Dumb Blonde  -  Blonde hair on a person (usually a woman) shows stupidity.
Terrified Of Germs  -  A character has a phobia of germs, going as far as to clean any surface they touch with disinfectant.
Colorful Song  -  A song about colors.
Valentines Day Vitriol  -  One or more characters express antipathy towards Valentine's Day.
Firing One Handed  -  A certain weapon is shown firing successfully with just one hand, without any recoil-related problem most of the time.
What He Said  -  You should check out the main article.
Pig Latin  -  Unfay ithway itchingsway owelsvay and onsonantscay.
Virtual Ghost  -  A functioning, interactive copy of an individual's consciousness and personality, usually in the form of an Artificial Intelligence, that can be used to simulate conversation with them after the real deal is dead and gone.
Teen Drama  -  A series that focuses on teenagers and the issues they face.
Civil Warcraft  -  A story scenario that makes a player fight against their own faction instead of an enemy.
Series Hiatus  -  A series stops updating.
Stalker Shot  -  A character is unaware they're being watched, eavesdropped, or followed until the camera reveals the stalker to the audience.
Wizard Mode  -  The ultimate mission in a pinball game, often worth a massive amount of points if completed; the Pinball equivalent of the Final Boss.
Daywalking Vampire  -  Whatever else daylight can do to these vampires, it can't kill them.
The Omniscient Council Of Vagueness  -  The guys shrouded in darkness who exist mainly to comment cryptically on the plot in cutaway scenes and plot Gambits behind our backs.
Its Personal With The Dragon  -  The Hero has a more personal connection to (and grudge against) The Dragon than the Big Bad.
You Are Who You Eat  -  Eating a person in order to shapeshift into them.
Polar Madness  -  Too much time in the ice can drive people insane...
Archangel Gabriel  -  One of the archangels, usually a messenger depicted with a horn, and very important in Islam as he gave Mohammed his revelations.
The Wonderland  -  An alternate world that doesn't make the kind of sense the protagonists are used to.
Never Be Hurt Again  -  A character who has suffered abuse, loss, and/or mistreatment, decides to make sure they never suffer such again.
Hypothetical Fight Debate  -  When nerds debate who would win in a fight between two fictional characters.
Betrayal By Inaction  -  Betraying someone by just doing nothing.
Bridge Bunnies  -  Despite not being main characters, these ladies are the ones actually running your spaceship/mech.
Title Only Chorus  -  You will just listen to that single phrase repeated three times or more in the chorus.
Demonic Possession  -  Someone or something is possessed by a demon/ghost.
STD Immunity  -  No one ever has to worry about STDs, no matter how much unprotected sex they have.
Claimed By The Supernatural  -  A supernatural being "claims" a person with some sort of mark.
Subverted Rhyme Every Occasion  -  Setting up a rhyme, then not delivering the line.
Embarrassing Nickname  -  Character hates their nickname.
The Call Put Me On Hold  -  I'm supposed to have powers; why don't I?
Deconstructed Trope  -  A trope with its realistic assumptions, flaws, consequences, and origins exposed.
Spiritual Successor  -  A work that is similar in some way to another previous, unrelated work.
Gag Boobs  -  A character's large chest is used as a source of jokes (usually in a Fan Disservice manner).
I Just Want To Be You  -  A character wants to be another character.
Nature Versus Nurture  -  Is one's character inherent or shaped by circumstances?
Ghost Planet  -  This planet used to have a civilization. Now it does not.
Curb Stomp Battle  -  Defeating an opponent with barely any effort.
Immortality Field  -  An immortality-inducing place.
Remember The Alamo  -  A Battlecry remarking a past enemy's atrocity.
Reasonable Authority Figure  -  Authority figure who helps the heroes.
Lightning Bruiser  -  Strong, tough, agile, and fast.
Dumbwaiter Ride  -  People riding in dumbwaiters.
Person Of Mass Construction  -  A person permanently builds things very quickly and often, either by supernatural or mundane means.
Victorious Roar  -  Roaring is the best way to let everyone know you won.
A Cappella  -  Music without instruments.
Cathartic Exhalation  -  Taking a breath after a tense moment.
Not Really A Birth Scene  -  A scene that comedically parallels giving birth.
Just Train Wrong  -  Trains do not work that way.
All Guys Want Sorority Women  -  Joining a sorority is the key to popularity and desireability for a college girl.
No Range Like Point Blank Range  -  You can't miss now! The gun is in his face!
Exploding Closet  -  Open a bulging door and you get junk falling on you.
Faction Specific Endings  -  Each major faction in the game gets an ending where it wins.
The Underworld  -  The land of the dead; the gloomy True Neutral equivalent to Heaven and Hell.
Private Eye Monologue  -  The metaphor-strewn thoughts of a Private Detective.
Waxing Lyrical  -  A song that's popular in Real Life is in the work, but it's dialogue and not the actual song.
Acting For Two  -  One person plays multiple roles in the same production.
Sarcasm Mode  -  Marking sarcasm to indicate it as such.
Sequel Escalation  -  Sequels always have more than the previous installment.
Shoot The Hostage  -  The Human Shield is deliberately shot.
The Dilbert Principle  -  The less competent a worker, the higher he's likely to be Kicked Upstairs. Not always a bad thing.
The Snack Is More Interesting  -  A character expresses their boredom with the proceedings by munching on some food.
Hufflepuff House  -  Important in the setting, irrelevant in the plot.
Heroic Fire Rescue  -  A heroic character shows their heroism by rescuing someone from a burning building or something similar.
You Cant Make An Omelette  -  You can't create something without destroying or sacrificing something else.
Anti Christmas Song  -  A song about how much Christmas sucks.
Combat Commentator  -  While the hero and their opponent fight, this character stands back to narrate.
Magick  -  An alternate spelling of the word "magic".
Dreaming Of Things To Come  -  Dreams telling about the future, good or ill.
Suicidal Gotcha  -  Hero jumps off cliff, but climbs/flies right back up.
Based On A Dream  -  A work that was inspired by a dream, bizarre or something different.
Glad I Thought Of It  -  Character dismisses someone else's idea and immediately claims it as their own.
Yoyo Plot Point  -  A premise-changing plot point is resolved and unresolved several times over the course of the work.
Code Name  -  Nonstandard name to conceal identity.
Characteristic Trope  -  Trope becomes discredited due to the audience associating it with a certain work.
Traitor Shot  -  WARNING: This character is going to betray you all.
Villain Ball  -  Villain does something stupid for the sake of being evil.
Villainous Crush  -  The villain has a crush on one of the heroes.
What Do You Mean Its Not For Kids  -  Child-unfriendly work is mistakenly marketed or seen by viewers as being safe for kids.
What We Now Know To Be True  -  ...is dismissed by characters as outdated.
Born As An Adult  -  The individual born is not disguising their immature form with an older alter ego or transformation. They're naturally like that.
Cousin Oliver  -  A young character brought in to liven up an aging cast.
Premature Aggravation  -  An imaginative man who works himself into a passion because he thinks someone may insult him.
Obligatory Joke  -  The Pun may be incredibly lame, but everyone's expecting you to make it.
The Stateless  -  A person who has no nationality.
Vocal Dissonance  -  The voice doesn't match the person.
Tamer And Chaster  -  Toning down or removing Fanservice.
Uptown Girl  -  Poor guy and rich girl fall in love, or vice versa.
Dramatic Unmask  -  The ultimate unmasking of a character.
Classic Cheat Code  -  XYZZY, JUSTIN BAILEY, IDDQD, et al.
Monster Mouth  -  People or creatures with abhuman mouths.
Mr Imagination  -  Someone who lets their imagination run wild.
Rape As Backstory  -  Instant angsty backstory - just add rape.
Homing Lasers  -  Laser beams actually chase the targets.
Like A Son To Me  -  A character considers another character not directly related to them as their own child.
Free Fall Fight  -  A Fight Scene while falling!
Rock Monster  -  A monster made out of a naturally occurring material.
Kids Shouldnt Watch Horror Films  -  One or more children see a horror movie and become very scared.
The Shepherd  -  Treats newbies nicely.
Everyones Baby Sister  -  Threaten this character, and every one of their friends will be gunning for you.
All Or Nothing Reloads  -  In video games, gun-reloading animations must completely finish before you can actually shoot new rounds. If it's interrupted at all, you'll somehow have your old rounds still chambered.
Solar System Neighbors  -  Aliens from other parts of the Solar System.
Memetic Mutation  -  Fandom memes that expand beyond their original meaning, becoming part of the broader culture.
Instant Ice Just Add Cold  -  Extreme cold produces ice out of nothing.
Just A Gangster  -  A criminal who actively resists and rejects attempts to make them or their business legitimate.
Implausible Hair Color  -  A hair color that is unlikely (but possible) given the media's setting.
Tame His Anger  -  An angry character becomes calmer and more peaceful.
Wall Of Weapons  -  Character prepares for the inevitable with a huge weapons stockpile.
Laugh Of Love  -  A character giggles/laughs when around their love interest.
Oppressed Minority Veteran  -  Minority veterans face oppression in civilian life by the government of the country they fought for.
Speaking In Panels  -  A character's narration or recollection is shown as panels within a speech or thought bubble.
Disintegrator Ray  -  Shoot to atomize target.
That One Level  -  A level that is notoriously frustrating.
World Of Silence  -  An Assimilation Plot results in a quiet, emotionless world.
Reed Snorkel  -  Using a reed to breathe underwater.
Mooching Master  -  Teacher who holds their pupil in a debt that (the teacher thinks) can never be repaid. "I taught you everything. You owe me."
Blade Spam  -  Lots and lots of slashes or stabs.
Underwater Kiss  -  Kissing somebody while you're both underwater.
The Annotated Edition  -  The textual equivalent of DVD Commentary.
Oh Wait This Is My Grocery List  -  Character starts reading a list of things, realizing mid-sentence that it is their list of groceries or something similar.
Most Common Super Power  -  Western superheroines almost always have large breasts.
Set Bonus  -  Collecting some or all items of the same set gives you additional powers.
Witch With A Capital B  -  Using the word 'witch' as an insult.
Magical Girl Queenliness Test  -  Royalty with a Royalty Super Power is sent away to test their worthiness.
Legion Of Doom  -  A group of villains plan to kill the hero.
Locked Out Of The Loop  -  Everyone knows what's going on except for this character.
Mister Strangenoun  -  These guys are all named after random nouns.
Turn Based Combat  -  A combat mode in tabletop/video games where combatants act in turns.
My Little Panzer  -  Ridiculously dangerous children's toy.
Bald Of Awesome  -  Lack of hair makes you badass.
The Worm That Walks  -  An organism made up of tinier organisms.
Sleeper Hit  -  It Will Never Catch On, so gets low priority in development... and it's a success!
Stance System  -  An ability to switch between fighting styles on the fly.
They Walk Among Us  -  Creatures that clearly aren't human live among us. Nothing weird about that.
Post Script Season  -  Networks decide to uncancel a series after they've already wrapped up the plot.
Starts With A Suicide  -  When something starts with a character killing themselves.
Kissed Keepsake  -  If you got kissed by someone you love, you should never wash the stain on your cheek.
Comfort Food  -  Eating food to relieve stress.
Laughing Mad  -  Laughter as an expression of insanity or emotional stress.
Sexy Soaked Shirt  -  The Wet T-Shirt Contest's key garment, in other settings.
Magical Eye  -  Eye(s) that have magic powers.
Speed Blitz  -  The ability to fight so fast that the enemy can't even react.
Talking Your Way Out  -  The hero is caught by the villains, but manages to use smooth talking to get away.
Unpleasant Parent Reveal  -  Missing parent is anything but pleasant.
Renegade Russian  -  The opinions expressed by Russian bad guys do not necessarily reflect the views of the Kremlin.
Repurposed Pop Song  -  A popular song gets used in an advertisement.
Your Worst Nightmare  -  Someone is intentionally given nightmares to weaken or harm them.
Go Karting With Bowser  -  Enemies enjoy quality time together.
The One With  -  (insert brief description of what "One" has here)
Razor Apples  -  Hazardous objects hidden in food.
Obstructive Code Of Conduct  -  An ethical code that restricts choice.
Robbing The Dead  -  Theft of items from a dead person.
Teen Genius  -  Young. Smart. And a teenager.
Sucking In Lines  -  Inexplicable lines radially converging to one spot denotes energy buildup.
Dark And Troubled Past  -  Tragic Back Story.
Flower Mouth  -  A monster's mouth opens up like a disturbing flower in bloom.
Walk Dont Swim  -  Walking underwater.
Grind Boots  -  Skateboard-free grinding technology!
Villains Act Heroes React  -  Only villains take a proactive stance in life.
Color Coded Item Tiers  -  That thing where magic items in a video game have color-coded tiers of power and rarity.
Hollywood Costuming  -  Clothes don't fit the time period.
Call To Adventure  -  The protagonist of a story is told, through the words or actions of other characters, that they must do something, leading the protagonist to make a choice about whether to embark on the story or not.
Sidetracked By The Analogy  -  A simile or metaphor is told, but someone gets distracted by something in the phrase's literal meaning.
Hidden Track  -  A track on the CD hidden after the album is finished.
Light Bulb Joke  -  Joke template that asks how many of a certain kind of people it takes to screw in a light bulb.
Viewers In Mourning  -  Fans noticeably react to the death of their favorite character almost as if a loved one had died.
I Am Not Pretty  -  Someone who's considered pretty thinks of themself as ugly.
Magical Star Symbols  -  Magic symbolically associated with stars.
