Weather Of War  -  Weather affecting the outcome of battles.
I Never Said It Was Poison  -  If you are truly innocent, then how did you know this?
The Mirror Shows Your True Self  -  A shapeshifter's true form is seen in the mirror.
Otherworldly And Sexually Ambiguous  -  A god, demon, or otherwise otherworldly being or creature who is both male and female. Or neither.
All Of The Other Reindeer  -  A character is widely distrusted, mistreated, and antagonized by everyone.
Everybody Cries  -  All of the characters, usually the main ones, cry together.
Terra Deforming  -  Bulldozing nature to build more buildings.
Magic From Technology  -  Magic created by technology.
Suddenly Shouting  -  Someone starts speaking in a normal voice, but finishes YELLING AT RANDOM!
But We Used A Condom  -  Condoms don't work.
In The Original Klingon  -  A character claims an invention or artwork for their own culture that, in fact, is original to another.
Waif Fu  -  Tiny girl delivers titanic ass-kicking with power that she presumably shouldn't possess.
Benevolent Architecture  -  The way the place is built is uncannily appropriate for your situation.
Beginners Luck  -  He's new to this business. And really, really good at it.
Mundanger  -  A mundane source of peril in a setting with notably supernatural elements.
Interspecies Friendship  -  Friendship between different species.
Gigantic Gulp  -  A really thirsty character drinks from a really big cup.
Happiness Is Mandatory  -  An oppressive regime forces citizens to be happy.
Organ Dodge  -  Character survives an injury because the organ that would've been damaged wasn't where it usually is.
Shapeshifter Mode Lock  -  When a Shapeshifter gets stuck in one shape and can't transform.
Mad Eye  -  One eye or iris larger than the other.
Nightmare Fuel Station Attendant  -  A character who's scary and creepy without meaning to be; sometimes unintentionally by the author.
Artsy Beret  -  Berets as a visual shorthand for artists, "true" or otherwise.
YIFF  -  Furry smut.
He Will Not Cry So I Cry For Him  -  Someone cries in place of the sad person.
Mac Guffin Super Person  -  A Living MacGuffin sought after for some supernatural ability or quality they have.
The Goomba  -  The simplest, most basic enemy in a video game.
Home Sweet Home  -  The character would rather stay home than adventure.
Journey To Find Oneself  -  Going on a quest of self-discovery.
Shes Got Legs  -  The use of a woman's legs as an object of sexual attraction.
One Letter Title  -  Titles comprised of only one letter.
Putto  -  Naked, chubby children depicted in art. Often depicted as winged-cherubs.
Funny Robot  -  A robot that is funny.
RPG Episode  -  An episode where everyone sits down and plays a role-playing game.
Romantic Candlelit Dinner  -  A couple having a romantic dinner with the candles lit.
Projectile Spell  -  Magic that needs aiming to work.
Leeroy Jenkins  -  An idiot derails The Team's plans by recklessly charging in.
Hate Plague  -  A plot where an unknown force causes characters to become angry and disagreeable with each other.
Climbing Climax  -  When the climatic showdown takes place atop a very tall structure.
The Cuckoolander Was Right  -  They may be a complete lunatic, but they said the truth...
Spirit World  -  The World of Spirits.
Head Butting Pachy  -  The unrealistic portrayal of Pachycephalosauria dinosaurs headbutting things.
Literal Genie  -  A wish gives you what you asked for, but not what you wanted.
Playful Otter  -  Otters are joyful and playful and, sometimes, act like Surfer Dudes.
Put On A Bus  -  Character leaves, but can come back later.
Jammed Seatbelts  -  After an accident, seat belts tend to lock up.
Cut Lex Luthor A Check  -  Obvious potential for lawful income is wasted on criminal pursuits.
Disowned Adaptation  -  An adaptation strongly rejected by the creator of the original work.
Lord British Postulate  -  Even if it's invincible, someone will try to kill it anyway.
Monster Knight  -  A monster that's also an honorable warrior.
German Expressionism  -  A German artistic movement that prioritizes showing emotion over realism.
Bullet Dancing  -  Shooting at the ground near someone's feet causes them to "dance."
Ground By Gears  -  Someone dies from being crushed between the inner workings of machinery, most often gears.
Reset Button Ending  -  Start everything all over again.
Inconvenient Itch  -  A character has an itch they can't scratch.
New And Improved  -  Improving a product esoterically to make it look better in quality.
There Are No Coincidences  -  Character does not believe that strange things just happen.
I Shall Taunt You  -  Strategic insults.
Suetiful All Along  -  Ends up being a Mary Sue after all.
Goddamned Bats  -  Weak enemies that don't pose much of a threat on their own, but harass and impede you as much as they can anyway.
Oops I Forgot I Was Married  -  A character finds out they have been married in a wedding they didn't know was legal.
Widowed At The Wedding  -  Either the bride or the groom isn't going to be leaving alive.
The Commies Made Me Do It  -  Betraying allies because the Big Bad is threatening your loved ones.
Evolving Title Screen  -  A video game title screen that changes to reflect player's in-game actions and achievements.
Social Services Does Not Exist  -  If this was Real Life, these children would have been separated from their parents or guardians immediately.
Kayfabe  -  The suspension of disbelief required to enjoy Professional Wrestling.
Adventurer Archaeologist  -  Archaeology portrayed as less scientific method, more adventure.
This Is A Drill  -  Using a drill as a weapon.
City Mouse  -  Character from an urban area tries to adjust to rural life.
The Ahnold  -  Affectionate parodies of 80's action stars.
Victorian Novel Disease  -  The Incurable Cough of Death has no effect on a character's beauty, or their ability to perform.
Not What I Signed On For  -  Someone is recruited for one cause, but the group's real cause and/or actions make them rethink the deal.
Telephone Song  -  A song about a telephone call.
Captain Crash  -  This character crashes every vehicle they drive or pilot.
Conducting The Carnage  -  During something awful, someone is moving their hands like a conductor.
Fungus Humongous  -  Giant mushrooms are the scenery of an area.
Celestial Body  -  They're literally a universe in a box (or man shaped box).
Taken For Granite  -  Instant petrification.
Territorial Smurfette  -  The only girl on the team is not happy about competition.
Backstory Invader  -  All the other characters think this character has been around for ages. But they've only just arrived, and something is making the others think that.
Bonus Material  -  Extra goods added with the original media.
Harder Than Hard  -  A difficulty level above hard.
Have A Nice Day Smile  -  ☺
Open Sesame  -  Only certain sounds can open the door.
Make A Wish  -  A character makes a longing desire for something.
Disconnected Side Area  -  A portion of a level or area that you can't get to without visiting it from somewhere else.
Giant Food  -  Giants eat giant food, compared to humans' regular food.
Playing With A Trope  -  Explains the standard terminology for different ways various works use tropes.
Foe Yay Shipping  -  Shipping canon enemies.
Values Resonance  -  An older work's moral or themes are as relevant today as they were then.
Ripped From The Phone Book  -  Tearing out a phone book page instead of jotting down the necessary number on paper.
Acceptable Political Targets  -  Some political affiliations are considered fair game for ridicule or scorn.
One Hit Wonder  -  An artist only known for one major success.
Catchphrase Insult  -  Someone's catchphrase is an insult.
Reduce Aggro  -  A technique used to decrease attention from enemies.
Sex Montage  -  A montage of several different instances of sexual intercourse.
Missing Secret  -  A secret seemingly implied by a video game which doesn't actually exist.
Has Two Mommies  -  Character has two or more parents of the same gender.
The Dutiful Son  -  The child who dedicates themselves to taking care of their family.
Secret Keeper  -  One who knows a great, plot-important secret few others are aware of.
Old Windbag  -  An elderly character known for talking a lot.
Interrogation By Vandalism  -  Give me the info or I break your stuff.
Special Person Normal Name  -  They could change the world... but you'd never know it from their name.
Screaming Warrior  -  A fighter who bellows his way through a battle.
Punctuated Pounding  -  Repeated strikes meet Punctuated! For! Emphasis!.
Technical Pacifist  -  A character who is fine with using violence so long as it's non-lethal.
Robo Speak  -  Robot speech sounds nothing like human speech.
Celibate Hero  -  Good guys who understand romance and sex, but prefer not to engage in either.
Gas Station Of Doom  -  Gas station that is set in a horror setting.
Super Strong Child  -  A child with Super Strength.
The Evils Of Free Will  -  Believing that because free will has bad consequences, it should be eliminated.
Evil Detecting Dog  -  Animals can sense evil.
Boulder Bludgeon  -  A brutish, pragmatic, or completely desperate character resorts to using a rock (or similar) as a makeshift weapon.
But I Would Really Enjoy It  -  A character isn't having sex for a (usually pretty respectful) reason—but damn, it would be fun to.
Fanatical Fire  -  Fire is associated with fanatics.
The Time Machine  -  Trope Maker of Time Travel stories. A scientist takes his Time Machine to a far future divided between two classes of Human Subspecies.
Thats No Moon  -  Characters initially assume a huge entity is just scenery.
Mistaken For Object Of Affection  -  A character intends to engage in romantic/sexual contact, but does it with/to the wrong person.
Edited For Syndication  -  Edits made to an episode of a show, whether it's a rerun or an international version.
Starving Artist  -  Artist clearly in poverty.
Big No  -  NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!
Regional Redecoration  -  The local or global geography changes because of a cataclysmic event.
Uke  -  Passive/receptive partner in a Boys' Love Genre relationship.
Anticipatory Breath Spray  -  Using breathe freshener in preparation for a kiss.
Scare Em Straight  -  Using works to discourage viewers from engaging in incompetent or immoral behavior.
Drunken Song  -  A song sung to show that the singer is drunk.
Life Will Kill You  -  Dying in a nondramatic way.
Notorious Parent  -  A character's mother and/or father who are wanted criminals.
Shapeshifter Weapon  -  Shapeshifters transform into their own weapons.
The Conqueror  -  The film where John Wayne plays Genghis Khan.
Silly Rabbit Romance Is For Kids  -  Who cares about that lovey-dovey crap? I grew up.
Frivolous Lawsuit  -  A lawsuit built on very flimsy claims by the plaintiff.
Golden Mean Fallacy  -  Assuming the correct answer is the medium of two extremes just because it is in the medium.
Epic Flail  -  A (spiky) metal head on a chain.
The Virus  -  All who are bitten/killed by the monster, become the monster.
Role Ending Misdemeanor  -  Creator is fired or otherwise loses their career because of personal problems or behaving badly backstage.
Answer Cut  -  A character asks a question, and then the scene cuts, pans, or otherwise shifts to the implied answer.
Throw The Dog A Bone  -  Let's do something nice for the Butt-Monkey.
Unfit For Greatness  -  A character who has good intentions but lacks virtues necessary to wield the power they were given.
All Of Them  -  A joke answer used to emphasize the fact that the real answer is extremely large.
Forced Sleep  -  Magically causing someone to fall asleep.
Power Trio  -  Three-character ensemble.
Action Dad  -  One Badass father.
Gunpoint Banter  -  Pointing guns in each others faces is not a conversation stopper. In fact, it just makes it more interesting.
Not Enough To Bury  -  Serious emphasis is made on the sorry state of a character's body upon death, and how little of it is even left.
The Weird Sisters  -  A trio of supernatural women.
Just Ignore It  -  I'm sure these problems will sort themselves out.
Pretty Freeloaders  -  Girls moving in, and living with the protagonist for free.
Daddy DNA Test  -  Trying to find out who the dad of a baby is (or the mum if something weird happened) by giving the baby a DNA test.
The Napoleon  -  A short person with an even shorter temper and/or a big ego.
Militaries Are Useless  -  When armed forces are particularly bad at their first purpose: dealing with menaces.
Right Wing Militia Fanatic  -  Those who adhere to stereotypical Right-Wing ideologies, most notably an extreme dislike for The Government and an extreme tolerance to gun violence.
Actor Existence Limbo  -  Voice actor is unavailable? Then don't use a voice.
Russia Is Western  -  Russia is portrayed as being unambiguously western-aligned in NATO or in the EU with a culture that reflects it, as opposed to being an orientalist threat.
Chuunibyou  -  Teenager or childish adult with delusions of embodying what they see as "cool".
Scenery Dissonance  -  Unpleasant events occurring in pleasant settings, or pleasant events occurring in unpleasant settings.
Driving Stick  -  Driving a vehicle with manual transmission is treated as a very difficult thing to do.
Curse Of The Ancients  -  Cursing from Ye Goode Olde Days.
Nightmare Fuel  -  Things or moments that fuel our fears and give us nightmares.
Dying For Symbolism  -  A character's death symbolizes something important.
Chastity Dagger  -  A dainty little woman who hides a knife to deter would-be rapists, kidnappers, and the like.
Time Travel Episode  -  An episode about time travel, in a show that doesn't normally feature it.
Dystopia Is Hard  -  Deconstructed dystopia. Fascist, but Inefficient, because Capitalism Is Bad, exacerbated over a long period of time.
Parasol Of Pain  -  Umbrellas used as weapons or containing weapons.
When Life Gives You Lemons  -  A phrase said by someone to show their optimism.
Four Philosophy Ensemble  -  One thinks life sucks, one wants to do what's right, one considers their options, and one doesn't care (if there's a fifth, he just doesn't know what to do).
Transformation Name Announcement  -  Transforming into your super alter ego? Better introduce yourself afterwards.
Expository Gameplay Limitation  -  Temporarily limiting the range of actions the player can carry out in a video game, in order to focus their attention on exposition.
How We Got Here  -  The story stops and retells the events prior leading up to that point.
Cat Girl  -  Human is a Little Bit Feline.
Combat Medic  -  The healer can fight without greatly diminishing their healing role.
The Slacker  -  A character who does as little as possible.
Prodigal Hero  -  A character runs away from home, lives in exile, and returns home to save the day.
Adventures In Comaland  -  An unconscious or comatose character has a profound dream that advances the plot.
Projeggtile  -  Eggs used as projectiles.
This Is No Time To Panic  -  This is actually a good time to start panicking.
Catapult Nightmare  -  Flinging right up or falling out of bed after a Nightmare Sequence.
No Celebrities Were Harmed  -  Expies or Captain Ersatzes of real-life celebrities.
Magical Girl AU  -  Alternate Universes or Fan Works that take the canon characters and re-write them as Magical Girls!
Pro Wrestling Is Real  -  Stories in which Pro Wrestling is not staged.
This Cannot Be  -  This unpleasant development is impossible!
Mary Suetopia  -  Utopia with fundamental logic flaws in reality.
Heel Face Revolving Door  -  A character switches constantly between being good and being bad.
Villain By Proxy Fallacy  -  Anyone even remotely connected to a crime is just as guilty as the one who did it and is therefore deserving of the same punishment as the actual wrongdoer.
Servant Race  -  A race that specifically exists to be servants.
Trilogy Creep  -  Three volumes can't hold this universe.
The Von Trope Family  -  A character with "Von" attached to their family name.
Friendship Song  -  Songs about friendship.
Heroes Gone Fishing  -  The heroes take a break from their mission to enjoy some fun and relaxation.
Stars Are Souls  -  One or more characters become stars or constellations upon death.
Wild West Armadillo  -  Armadillos are associated with The Wild West.
Wilting Odor  -  A smell so awful it degrades the environment.
Goomba Stomp  -  Jump on the monsters to defeat them.
Daydream Believer  -  Someone who believes that a fictional story could be or is real in some way or the other.
Phrase Catcher  -  Something that's always said to a specific person; the inverse of a Catchphrase.
Non Sequitur Environment  -  An area inexplicably transforms into another one while you're travelling through it.
Fake Defector  -  Hero or equivalent character fakes a FaceHeel Turn to get closer to the Big Bad.
Combat And Support  -  One group does the main goals, the other supports that group doing the goals.
Brainwashed And Crazy  -  When Brainwashing drives someone to harm others or engage in destructive behavior.
Literal Transformative Experience  -  Transformation = Character Development.
The Plot Thickens  -  Stock Phrase often said after a turning point in the plot.
Amnesia Danger  -  They'd be able to deal with this easily if they had their memories. Unfortunately, they don't.
Wall Of Blather  -  A character's long speech bubble is obscured (because no one is listening).
The Spark Of Genius  -  Reality isn't a limit for creative science.
Tall Poppy Syndrome  -  Society is hostile and envious towards individuals who are special.
Impact Silhouette  -  A hole in something looking exactly like the thing which passed through it
Smoking Gun  -  Decisive evidence is suddenly presented late in the trial. Everything before that is now pointless.
Indy Ploy  -  When all else fails, wing it.
Rapid Fire No  -  A lot of no's shot out at a fast pace.
One Hit Point Wonder  -  Character that dies in one hit.
Go Back To The Source  -  Someone has to return to the place where they or a plot device first came from to get answers.
The Punishment Is The Crime  -  Someone who committed heinous deeds gets punished by "the deed itself" (the guilt over doing the deed or the loss that he/she experienced, etc).
Unbreakable Weapons  -  Video Game-weapons are a lot more durable than their Real Life counterparts.
Widows Weeds  -  Funeral clothes, usually on a woman.
Blofeld Ploy  -  Threatens to kill someone, only to kill someone else.
Stealth Sequel  -  Seemingly unrelated works turn out to be connected.
Generational Saga  -  A tale spanning multiple generations of the same family.
Game Show Goofballs  -  Comedy trope about direly stupid game show contestants and panelists.
Pstandard Psychic Pstance  -  A pose for when you want to demonstrate psychokinetic powers to blow your friend's mind.
Lady Of War  -  A warrior woman who is also feminine and graceful.
You Need A Breath Mint  -  Halitosis and subsequent reactions.
Super Hero Gods  -  A mythological deity depicted as a Super Hero.
Rasputinian Death  -  A character survives multiple fatal events before (usually) dying.
Southies  -  Residents of South Boston, MA, and the stereotypes that come with.
Fairy Tale Free For All  -  A crossover between many different fairy tales.
Explosions In Space  -  Explosions in space are just like ones on Earth.
Arc Welding  -  A series that so far has been episodic, retcons itself so that it's all linked in a story-arcing plot.
Rainbows And Unicorns  -  The pairing of rainbows and unicorns as a sort of motif.
Dumb Struck  -  Character rendered mute due to trauma.
Parasites Are Evil  -  Parasites and parasitoids portrayed as unambiguously evil.
Love Interests  -  The characters who are involved in romantic plots.
Rated M For Money  -  For mature audiences as a selling point.
Affair Hair  -  A man's partner discovers a hair that is not his and accuses him of having an affair.
Ridiculous Procrastinator  -  Someone who puts off something 'til the last minute.
Game Master  -  The referee of a Tabletop RPG.
Line In The Sand  -  The commander requests volunteers for a dangerous mission.
Fantastic Noir  -  Film Noir with a twist.
Four Is Death  -  Four and "death" sound the same in Chinese, Japanese, and other Asian languages, making it an extremely unlucky number.
Future Slang  -  How to sound ice hot in the future.
I Should Have Been Better  -  Your best wasn't good enough.
Hilarity Sues  -  The Big Damn Hero/Villain goes to court over a lawsuit.
Elder Abuse  -  Deliberate harm in all forms toward old people.
Forbidden Fruit  -  You're told you can't have it, therefore you want it.
Minigame Game  -  A game based entirely, or mostly, on minigames.
Match In A Bomb Shack  -  Match lit up, inside a shed full of explosives.
Defiant Stone Throw  -  A meek character publicly defies a much more powerful character as a symbolic act.
Incompetent Guard Animal  -  The Angry Guard Dog needs more training.
Kamehame Hadoken  -  A surge-of-ki fired from the character's cupped, outstretched hands.
Kiss Of Death  -  A taste of a poisoned paradise.
Innocent Fanservice Girl  -  Character does not know or understand the nudity taboo; often does not even understand the concept of clothing.
Born During A Storm  -  A storm rages as a baby is born — a dramatic start to the baby's life.
The Power Of Apathy  -  The key to strength and power is not giving a crap.
Kent Brockman News  -  A Show Within a Show parody of news shows.
Pacing A Trench  -  Constantly pacing back and forth gradually makes a trench or a groove on the ground.
Love Transcends Spacetime  -  Love is so powerful that it can ignore the physical rules of the universe.
Carrying The Antidote  -  When a villain poisons a hero, the villain has an antidote to the poison.
Could Have Been Messy  -  You know, this stuff really ought to get a few more people hurt...
Humanlike Foot Anatomy  -  An animal's foot has the same structure as a human's foot.
Work Info Title  -  Basic information about a work is used in a work title.
Stalactite Spite  -  Something hanging from the ceiling that seems to wait until it can fall on the player.
Big Damn Reunion  -  Two or more characters are reunited after being apart for a long time.
Society Is To Blame  -  What made this character evil is how society influences them.
Drama Bomb  -  An exceptionally heavy Wham Episode.
Cult Of Personality  -  The mass adoration of a (often idealized or propagandized) political figure.
Subculture Of The Week  -  A police show focuses an episode on a subculture or non-mainstream hobby, and paints it in the worst possible light.
When It Rains It Pours  -  Rain in fiction is either 'none' or 'heavy'—there is no in-between.
Experienced Protagonist  -  The main protagonist is an expert on their respective field already at the start of the story.
Metamorphosis  -  One undergoes an irreversible transformation.
Inadequate Inheritor  -  Heir/potential heir is seen as unfit for the position and must prove their worth (end results vary).
Brain Transplant  -  Swapping brains is as easy as changing a battery.
Naked On Arrival  -  Character is nude when introduced.
Power Parasite  -  Unsatisfied with your ranking on the Superpower Lottery? Steal your way to the top!
Artistic License Pharmacology  -  Factual inaccuracies about drugs in fiction — how they work, the way they're used or administered, or their effects.
Resurrection Sickness  -  A character has various physical ailments after coming back to life.
The Title Saga  -  A work title that ends in "Saga", or has "Saga" in it.
Somethingitis  -  Using "itis" to mean disease.
Emotional Torque  -  The capacity of a story to elicit emotion from its audience.
The Great Politics Mess Up  -  Political assumptions in a work get smashed by real-world events.
Giver Of Lame Names  -  A character gives lousy names.
Guilt Free Extermination War  -  Total war that will only end with the utter annihilation of one side. No rules, no surrender, no mercy, no regrets. It's us vs them.
Kangaroo Pouch Ride  -  When someone rides in a kangaroo's pouch.
Everyone Hates Fruit Cakes  -  Inedible fruitcake humor.
La Resistance  -  Small band of rebels fighting against tyranny.
Vanity Publishing  -  They will publish anything... as long as you pay them.
Yellow Sash Of Power  -  Hall monitors in school having absurd power compared only to teachers, if not higher.
Remilitarized Zone  -  Generic Video Game military-themed area.
Ungovernable Galaxy  -  The galaxy is too large for feasible government.
Artistic License Chemistry  -  A work makes chemistry mistakes for the sake of the story.
Asexuality  -  Character does not experience sexual attraction.
Dont Come A Knockin  -  If the vehicle is a-rockin, the people inside it are probably having sex.
Magnificent Moustaches Of Mexico  -  Mexican men have the best moustaches.
Car Fu  -  Using a vehicle as a weapon.
Whats A Henway  -  A prank that involves making a Perfectly Cromulent Word and getting someone to say "What's <word>?", similar to a knock-knock joke.
The All Concealing I  -  Using first-person perspective to conceal facts about the narrator.
Commonality Connection  -  Two characters form a bond due to having something in common.
Dismemberment Is Cheap  -  A character loses a limb, gets a good replacement, and the whole matter is forgotten.
Spiked Blood  -  Drinking the blood of an intoxicated person passes on said intoxication.
Divorced Installment  -  A series installment that has no connections to the previous titles.
Karmic Trickster  -  The Trickster who dishes out poetic justice when wronged.
Truce Zone  -  This is neutral territory. Disturb the peace/break the truce here at your own peril.
Anything But That  -  A relatively mundane threat is seen as a Fate Worse than Death, often for comedic effect.
Heroic Fantasy  -  A world filled with swords and magic which sits in between Low Fantasy and High Fantasy.
Take That  -  The Trope: When a Shout-Out depicts whatever or whoever is being referenced in an unflattering light.
Twisted Echo Cut  -  The conversation suddenly cuts to another conversation, one that looks unrelated
Fantasy Kitchen Sink  -  Elements from different genres/mythologies interacting in the same story.
Technically Naked Shapeshifter  -  A shapeshifter whose clothes are part of their body.
Spiked Wheels  -  There's spikes coming off the wheels on the Bad guy's car, designed to puncture other car's tyres.
Franchise Killer  -  The negative reception or poor financial performance of one installment in a series destroys the hope of sequels for the foreseeable future.
I Have Boobs You Must Obey  -  Breasts are very persuasive.
The Tetris Effect  -  When you play a game so much, you start to see it everywhere.
Suppressed Mammaries  -  Tying down breasts to appear younger, or male.
Badass Family  -  Most, if not all, members of this family can kick your ass one way or another.
Spies Are Lecherous  -  A secret agent is portrayed as The Casanova.
Nothing Exciting Ever Happens Here  -  ...but now that you've said it, it will.
Puberty Superpower  -  Superpowers develop around puberty.
Bread And Circuses  -  As long as the citizens are fat and happy, the government can get away with anything. OR Dystopia taking advantage of a Crapsaccharine World.
Superhero Packing Heat  -  Differently Powered Individual primarily using firearms in tandem with or more often than their powers.
Negated Moment Of Awesome  -  What looks to be a Moment of Awesome gets negated.
Devil In Plain Sight  -  Obviously Evil to the audience, but the other characters don't notice.
Try Everything  -  When all else fails, try a number of spontaneously random and irrelevant solutions.
One Curse Limit  -  Once you've been cursed, you can't be affected by another curse.
This Is The Final Battle  -  Stock phrase said by someone just prior to facing the Final Boss.
Ace Pilot  -  Improbable Piloting Skills personified.
Express Delivery  -  Super-fast pregnancy.
Compliment Fishing  -  Phrases that are asking for compliments.
Underwear Of Power  -  Superheroes wear speedos or other risque underwear costumes.
Hobbits  -  A race of short, simple folk that usually act as an Audience Surrogate for modern day humans.
Leaking Can Of Evil  -  An evil being is sealed away but can still affect the mortal world.
Fantastic Fantasy Is Mundane  -  Dragons in dungeons enjoy fantasy stories about non-magical folk like us.
Holy Is Not Safe  -  Holy power is just as dangerous to normal people as evil beings.
Departure Means Death  -  Someone cannot leave a certain area or they will die.
Computers Are Fast  -  Computer Players with amazing reflexes are easy to make.
The Perfectionist  -  Everything I do has to be just so!
Wild Wilderness  -  A big adventure in the middle of some remote / pristine woodland that no outsider sees.
Framed For Heroism  -  Well, it certainly looked like you killed the baddy.
Longer Than Life Sentence  -  Criminal got sentenced to prison terms going beyond what's any normal person can serve.
Vertical Mecha Fins  -  A robot with fins and/or other vertical kibble.
Voices In One Room  -  All of the characters' voice actors are in the same recording booth.
Frozen Face  -  Character's face literally cannot emote.
Comic Book Limbo  -  Some characters just disappear from continuity.
Face Of A Thug  -  Good guy (or at the least, halfway decent) looks like a villain.
Fame Gate  -  You must be this famous to receive this quest.
Terrain Sculpting  -  The local terrain of an area is purposely altered by an individual or a group.
Mutual Envy  -  Two characters each think that the other has it way better than they do.
Cape Wings  -  A cape turns into wings or vice versa.
Polyamory  -  A character engages openly in more than one romantic relationship at a time.
Black Hole Sue  -  The entire story bends (and breaks) favorably to this Mary Sue.
Combo Platter Powers  -  A counter-intuitive or random combination of superpowers.
Beautiful All Along  -  Wow, with the hair down and the glasses off, you really are beautiful!
The Mob Boss Is Scarier  -  A criminal is so terrifying that his mooks and innocent bystanders alike are too afraid to inform on him or take any action to cross him.
Super Prototype  -  The prototype is superior to its mass-produced cousins.
If It Bleeds It Leads  -  Violence always makes the headlines.
Cool Train  -  Technology Porn on rails.
Team Prima Donna  -  I do it myyyy waaaayy!
Animation Age Ghetto  -  The belief that animation can be only made for and enjoyed by children and no one else.
Omniscient Hero  -  The being isn't only omniscient, but is a hero as well.
My Kung Fu Is Stronger Than Yours  -  People training to improve their strength and/or skills with the specific intention of beating others.
Verbal Judo  -  Defusing an explosive situation via communication.
Pinky Swear  -  Using pinky fingers as gesture of promise usually by children.
Whack A Monster  -  Enemies that reside in holes and pop up to attack. May retreat to the hole again afterwards.
Ensign Newbie  -  Inexperienced officer put in command.
Popular With Furries  -  A work or character gains a furry audience due to focus on animals, intentionally or otherwise.
I Cant Do This By Myself  -  A character tries to win his allies back on their side by admitting they can't do things alone.
Redhead In Green  -  Red hair, green clothes.
Fake In The Hole  -  Tossing something at your foes and pretending it's a grenade, causing them to dive for cover.
Made Of Explodium  -  Random objects explode VERY easily.
Global Currency Exception  -  In this area of the game, your ordinary money doesn't work and you have to use the local currency instead.
Eek A Mouse  -  A fairly common reaction towards small rodents, particularly among women.
Unrelated Brothers  -  Unrelated professional wrestlers who claim to be relatives.
God Mode Sue  -  Ridiculously powerful Mary Sue/Marty Stu.
Bio Armor  -  Bio Punk Powered Armor.
I Will Find You  -  A character's quest is to get back to a relative, friend, or significant other that they were separated from.
For Inconvenience Press One  -  An automated dialing maze using interactive voice response.
Pumpkin Person  -  Monsters with jack-o-lanterns for heads.
Bandito  -  Rowdy gunslingers from Mexico, basically the Mexican equivalent of the typical American Cowboy.
Fashion Magazine  -  Magazines devoted to fashion and sometimes other subjects, too.
Stuffed Into The Fridge  -  A character is killed off gruesomely and their body is displayed to their loved one to cause emotional trauma.
Paper Thin Disguise  -  Obvious disguise to the audience, not to the characters.
Disobey This Message  -  Poorly-handled lessons about non-conformity.
Insane Troll Logic  -  An argument with bizarre and nonsensical reasoning.
Child Popstar  -  A prepubescent musician.
Magic Antidote  -  Cures and antidotes work instantly and reverse all damage caused by the illness/poison.
Grindcore  -  A hybrid of Hardcore Punk and extreme metal composing of both genres' extremities and a knack for short song lengths.
Stereotype Reaction Gag  -  A character is offended about a stereotypical assumption made about them before immediately demonstrating it themselves.
High Priest  -  The leader(s) of a religion/cult.
Capital Offensive  -  Invading army launches a massive offensive on an enemy force's capital city, usually destroying it in the process.
I Coulda Been A Contender  -  A character retires just when they could have achieved something great.
Kindness Ball  -  A Jerkass temporarily Takes A Level In Kindness for the sake of plot advancement.
Suffers Newbies Poorly  -  Forum users who are icy towards newbies at first until they're no longer newbies.
Cyber Punk Is Techno  -  Futuristic settings tend to use synthetic music to set the tone.
Chained By Fashion  -  Wearing chains signifies great power.
Character Tiers  -  Ranking list of what characters are the best.
Mutually Exclusive Powerups  -  Picking one power-up will result in the permanent loss of the other(s).
Improbable Antidote  -  A poison's antidote turns out to be something very unlikely.
Male To Female Universal Adaptor  -  The aliens have the same genitals as us.
Partly Cloudy With A Chance Of Death  -  The weather gets gloomy when someone dies.
Open Minded Parent  -  Parents who are cool with their kids being different.
Failure Montage  -  A montage showing someone's plans going horribly wrong.
This Looks Like A Job For Aquaman  -  An incredibly lame and/or hyper-specific and limited superpower becomes critically important to save the day.
Not So Harmless Villain  -  A weak or comical villain suddenly becomes a very real threat.
Haunted Fetter  -  Ghost possessed objects that allow their owner to come back....in your body.
Necessary Weasel  -  Illogical trope is a building block of a genre.
Crotch Grab Sex Check  -  Boy or girl? Only one way to find out... *grope*
Action Pet  -  A pet capable of kicking ass.
Disappears Into Light  -  A character dies and becomes a light show.
Bromantic Comedy  -  A mix between Romantic Comedy and a buddy film.
Selective Gravity  -  Some things fall down and some things don't.
Anti Hoarding  -  Gameplay mechanics that discourage hoarding up in-game resources.
Does Not Drive  -  An unwillingness or inability to drive a vehicle reflects a character trait.
Supernatural Is Green  -  The color green associated with aliens, the undead, witches, or other paranormal/supernatural occurrences.
Hard Work Montage  -  Montages that show a character hard at work to accomplish or build something.
Your Mom  -  Yo momma's so fat she doesn't fit on the Laconic page...
Oh Crap Smile  -  Smile! You know you're screwed!
Baby Name Trend Starter  -  When a character is popular in fiction, suddenly many babies in Real Life are named after it.
Touch Telepathy  -  Mind reading initiated by skin contact.
Uncomfortable Elevator Moment  -  In an elevator, everybody does nothing but look forward silently.
Hair Metal  -  What you get when you mix Hard Rock, Heavy Metal, and '80s Pop music.
Full Moon Silhouette  -  Something's silhouette is seen in front of the moon.
Perverse Puppet  -  Marionettes, dolls and puppets that are corrupted and evil.
Worlds Smartest Man  -  Smartest person in the setting.
Handy Cuffs  -  Cuffing an offender with their arms in front makes them still dangerous.
In The Future We Still Have Roombas  -  Robots are nondescript machines for mundane labor.
The Calls Are Coming From Inside The House  -  A person receives a creepy phone call and learns it's from inside their own home.
Cyborg  -  Part organic, part mechanical.
Time Shifted Actor  -  Different actors are used for the same character at different ages.
Sean Connery Is About To Shoot You  -  Cover character points their weapon at the audience.
From Zero To Hero  -  A character evolves from humble beginnings to well-liked fame.
The Farmer And The Viper  -  When good deeds are repaid with evil.
Seme  -  Active partner in a Boys' Love relationship.
Hes Dead Jim  -  In TV Land, you can tell immediately when a character's dead.
Serial Homewrecker  -  Someone that prefers sexual partners who already have romantic partners.
Roguish Romani  -  Romani are stereotyped as criminals and tricksters.
Click Hello  -  One character introduces himself to another with a Dramatic Gun Cock.
Sarcastic Title  -  Titles in Sarcasm Mode.
Masquerade Paradox  -  If supernatural forces are stronger than mundane ones, why and how could they stay hidden from the public?
Half Arc Season  -  A season in which most episodes are standalone while a handful (sometimes half) make up a Story Arc.
Ghost Train  -  A creepy, haunted, and/or sentient train used by (usually malevolent) ghosts or other monsters.
Nipple And Dimed  -  Showing breasts is okay as long as the nipples don't show.
Your Son All Along  -  Character A thinks Character B is someone else's child, but it is revealed that Character B is actually their child.
Reluctant Monster  -  A monster that doesn't like hurting people and just wants to have fun.
To Serve Man  -  Aliens and monsters think humans are tasty.
Lucky Charms Title  -  Symbols that are not letters are put in a title. Tend towards unpronounceable.
Banister Slide  -  A character slides down a stairway's rail.
Standard Starship Scuffle  -  Since Space Is an Ocean, space warships fight by exchanging broadsides.
Double Jump  -  The ability of the Player Character to do a mid-air jump after the initial jump.
Silly Animal Sound  -  Animals make sounds that their species don't normally make.
Useless Without Cell Phones  -  Without their technology, people are Too Dumb to Live.
Music For Courage  -  A song meant to instill courage.
Snuff Film  -  Someone really did die in the making of this film.... intentionally!
Could Say It But  -  I am not allowed to say X, but... X.
Elite Mooks  -  A type of Mook that is considerably stronger than the average mook.
The Generic Guy  -  An unremarkable, ordinary character.
Briefs Boasting  -  Small underwear means masculine and likes to brag.
The Paragon  -  The hero who encourages others to be more heroic.
Too Powerful To Live  -  A villain shows up who is so powerful that he's quickly killed, depowered, or written out of the story to maintain conflict.
Afraid Of Blood  -  A character is afraid of blood.
Deal With The Devil  -  A deal that grants you your heart's desire, at a horrible price.
Do With Him As You Will  -  The hero leaves the villain at the mercy of those they wronged.
Best Friends In Law  -  A character is best friends with their sibling/parent/something-in-law.
Attacking Through Yourself  -  Deliberately attacking through your own body to get an opponent.
Born Unlucky  -  Everything goes wrong with this character.
Location Theme Naming  -  The characters in a work are named after real-life places, usually ones in a single area.
Stupid Sexy Friend  -  Character struggles with lustful feelings towards someone who is supposed to be just a friend.
Gay Moment  -  Straight character complements the looks of a same-gendered character.
Master Race  -  The race that all other races are subordinate to.
Credit Chip  -  Devices for exchanging electronic currency.
Secretly Wealthy  -  Rich character hides the fact that they're rich.
Adam Smith Hates Your Guts  -  In video games, market prices are proportional to game progress, not supply and demand.
The Disease That Shall Not Be Named  -  Aversion to mentioning a terminal disease by name due to social taboos.
Screw The Rules I Make Them  -  Enforcing rules somehow puts you above them.
Powers Via Weapon  -  A weapon that grants the wielder powers.
Captain Obvious  -  States what is blatantly obvious. (That just explained the trope!)
Pedal To The Metal Shot  -  The camera focuses on the accelerator pedal being hit really hard.
Percussive Shutdown  -  It Won't Turn Off.
Made Of Shiny  -  A product sells itself with just looks.
Trash Can Band  -  Group that creates musical instruments out of whatever parts they can get their hands on.
Charm Point  -  An accessory that gives the character ability, or so they think.
Fearless Fool  -  Having no fear makes one more reckless and impulsive.
Science Cannot Comprehend Phlebotinum  -  Science is fundamentally incapable of being used to consider magic or Phlebotinum.
Card Games  -  Games played with cards.
Dub Personality Change  -  A translation or dub changes a character's personality.
Revolving Door Revolution  -  A government is deposed by another, which is soon deposed by another, continuing ad nauseam.
Drunk On Milk  -  Getting drunk off non-alcoholic beverages.
Elephant Graveyard  -  A barren land where an animal (Usually large) goes when they are nearing their end.
Babies Make Everything Better  -  The belief that any couple who's had a baby is now problem-free.
Impossible Theft  -  A theft that is absurd or impossible.
Gag Penis  -  Huge penis, Played for Laughs.
But For Me It Was Tuesday  -  For one person, this event is important. For another, it's inconsequential.
Pottery Barn Poor  -  A character has great living conditions despite being described as "poor."
Will Not Be A Victim  -  Someone tries to kill a weaker character. The weakling will not go down without a fight.
Hello Attorney  -  An attractive (and usually female) legal professional.
Climax Boss  -  Boss fought at a significant point in the plot (and is not a Final Boss).
Hyper Competent Sidekick  -  Somebody's nominal assistant or underling who can handle themselves splendidly.
High Heel Power  -  High heels seen as a symbol of female sex appeal or power.
Screw The Rules Im Doing Whats Right  -  Character disobeys the laws, customs, or their instructions so they can follow their conscience.
Long Runner Cast Turnover  -  Suspiciously Similar Substitute or The Other Darrin, en masse, in a series that's been around a while.
Primal Stance  -  The slouch of a wild character.
Green Hill Zone  -  A hilly plant themed video game level. Usually the first level.
Robo Romance  -  Romance between two Robots or AIs
Girls Behind Bars  -  Women's prisons are fanservice stations.
Cyberspace  -  The Internet but you can walk around in it.
I Want My Jet Pack  -  Overestimating the future results in disappointment.
Spot The Imposter  -  Characters must determine which of two identical people is the real one.
Whoring  -  Pooling all your energy into only one mechanic of the game in order to gain some advantage from it.
Lifetime Movie Of The Week  -  A Made-for-TV Movie with a Chew Toy heroine fighting heroically for empowerment.
Not So Cheap Imitation  -  A work derivative of another work ends up becoming more popular than the work it's copying.
What The Hell Hero  -  The hero gets called out on acting unheroically.
Spiritual Adaptation  -  A work is similar enough to an earlier work in a different medium to be an unofficial Spiritual Successor.
Mummies At The Dinner Table  -  The body's still here, and that's good enough for me!
Irrevocable Message  -  A character sends an offensive message and instantly regrets it.
I Hate Past Me  -  Character regrets their past actions or personality.
Humans Are Leaders  -  Humanity's hat is running The Federation.
Rejection Affection  -  Continuing to chase after an unrequited crush no matter how often they reject you.
Licking The Blade  -  Apply tongue to bladed weapon to up the character's creepy factor.
The Cover Changes The Meaning  -  It's a cover, yeah, but it's also a completely different song from the original.
Casino Episode  -  An episode centered around a casino, usually by having the characters either visit one or start one.
Cute Kitten  -  There is nothing on this Earth that is cuter than a kitten!
The Rule Of First Adopters  -  The "adult entertainment" industry will always be on the cutting edge of New Media.
Hitlers Time Travel Exemption Act  -  Using time travel to stop Hitler never ends well.
Mondegreen  -  Character mishears lyrics or dialogue.
Depraved Dentist  -  Exactly What It Says on the Tin....and it looks like you ate all the cookies inside. Open wide~
Video Game Demake  -  What would this game look like if it was released in an earlier decade?
Version Exclusive Content  -  Content in Video Games that are found in one version.
Elmuh Fudd Syndwome  -  Chawactuhs putting W's in theiw speech whewe they shouldn't.
Simultaneous Arcs  -  Two or more different stories take place at the same time as each other.
Significant Double Casting  -  Actor plays more than one character for thematic or story purposes.
Patchwork Story  -  Multiple works are merged together into a single narrative.
I Got A Rock  -  When Halloween trick-or-treaters get something other than candy.
Friend To All Living Things  -  A kind and gentle person will always get a +10 on their charisma rolls when it comes to animals.
No Dead Body Poops  -  Even in death, Nobody Poops.
Troubled Sympathetic Bigot  -  The character is actually sympathetic. Their views? Not so much.
Faeries Dont Believe In Humans Either  -  Mythical creatures don't believe in humans.
Antepiece  -  A structure that serves as practice for the actual obstacle ahead.
Flippant Forgiveness  -  How to forgive someone in the most insulting manner possible.
The Constant  -  Oh, look, that thing from the past is here in the future!
The Pennyfarthing Effect  -  Somehow, the old one is both more complicated and harder to use.
Good Scars Evil Scars  -  Character Alignment depends on the scars on your body.
A Quest Giver Is You  -  When a game lets you send autonomous NPC agents to do side missions for you.
Recognition Failure  -  A character fails to identify a famous person for comic effect.
Macekre  -  A stronger case of Bowdlerization to a work that often annoys purists.
State Sec  -  Paramilitary government agency.
Heel Realization  -  A character realizes they're the villain.
Getting Crap Past The Radar  -  A work intentionally sneaks in inappropriate content, hoping it evades the Media Watchdogs.
Forced To Watch  -  The villain forces the helpless hero to watch someone they love being harmed.
Trash Talk  -  Insulting your opponents during a game or fight.
Long Range Fighter  -  Great at dealing with things from a distance, useless up close.
Motion Capture Mecha  -  Humongous Mecha imitates pilot's actions.
Smurfing  -  Smurfing words can smurf language.
Tricked To Death  -  A person is tricked into doing something that they don't know will kill them. Invoked accidental suicide.
Digital Bikini  -  Clothes are added onto naked or semi-naked characters in post-production for censorship purposes.
Imperfect Ritual  -  The material lacks or substitutes some key component, but manages to start anyway.
Empty Quiver  -  A nuclear weapon goes missing or falls into the wrong hands.
Worlds Best Warrior  -  A character who, through skill or reputation, is among the very best fighters in the setting of the story.
Polar Bears And Penguins  -  Having polar bears and penguins in the same place, being either the north or south pole.
Iconic Logo  -  A logo known by everyone who has not been living in a cave for the last century. No text needed.
Crush Blush  -  Love makes a character blush.
Brother Sister Team  -  They're brother and sister. And they kick ass.
Alternate Landmark History  -  Giving an alternate backstory to a Real Life landmark.
Trolling Creator  -  Creator who likes to annoy or mess with their audience.
Very Special Episode  -  An unusual episode in a light-entertainment series that suddenly tackles a serious issue, such as drugs, alcohol or gangs.
Distracted By The Sexy  -  Fanservice distracts people.
Weight Woe  -  Someone who has issues with their weight.
If I Can Only Move  -  When everything depends on the slightest move.
Fisher King  -  The state of a location reflects the character of its ruler.
Shipping  -  Playing matchmaker with fictional characters.
Denouement Episode  -  The epilogue after the climactic Grand Finale.
Fight Like A Card Player  -  Cards are used as a game mechanic, but it's never shown being used outside of gameplay.
Bastard Girlfriend  -  A female character is sexy because she's sadistic or abusive.
Unfortunate Names  -  If a person has these, they will be ridiculed or hated.
Portal Crossroad World  -  A world that contains access to many others.
Cute Bruiser  -  A cute character who fights with a Bruiser style.
Arrested For Heroism  -  You've just saved the world? Congrats! Now, here's your arrest warrant for murder, massive property damage, crossing the red light...
The Dying Walk  -  A character who is about to die, (usually from a wound) walks away from whatever they were doing just before their death.
Inconvenient Darkroom Illumination  -  A darkroom is suddenly illuminated at the worst possible moment, instantly ruining any photos that were being developed inside.
Western Zodiac  -  Constellations and personality types are determined by what dates you were you born between.
Short Distance Phone Call  -  Talking on the phone to somebody who's standing right next to you.
Dish Dash  -  One character. Tons of dishes. All at once.
Time Travel Romance  -  A romantic relationship with two characters that belong in different eras.
Emotional Powers  -  Superpowers are strongly tied to emotional state.
Nazi Protagonist  -  The story is centered on a German Nazi from the Third Reich period.
Misery Poker  -  My life sucks more than yours.
Everyone Can See It  -  Everyone can see that two people are in love... except the two people in love.
Murder Is The Best Solution  -  Wouldn't it just be easier to kill 'em?. Especially when it WOULD NOT.
Evil Cannot Comprehend Good  -  A villain loses because he is incapable of understanding what motivates the good.
Appeal To Ignorance  -  The assumption that something not proved true must be false (or vice-versa).
Cheerful AI  -  Artificial Intelligence that is programmed to be friendly no matter what.
No Body Left Behind  -  A character dies without leaving a corpse.
Go Out With A Smile  -  A character smiles during his/her death.
Suspiciously Similar Substitute  -  Replacement character is almost exactly like their predecessor.
Shower Of Angst  -  A character showers to "wash away" his or her problems (often seen crying or in the Troubled Fetal Position and catatonic).
Church Militant  -  This church kicks ass.
Named Weapons  -  A weapon has an actual, specific name, rather than a generic one.
His Own Worst Enemy  -  A character is self-destructive to the point of gradually destroying everything they have worth living for.
Punch Clock Villain  -  Working with the villain is just a job for them; they're not inherently a bad person.
Antagonistic Offspring  -  The parent's child is the arch-nemesis.
Treants  -  Large, humanoid and intelligent trees. They are often guardians of nature and the wilderness, and may posses a Green Thumb.
Foreign Exchange Student  -  An exotic new student introduced as a source of comedy and/or drama.
Easily Condemned  -  It looks like you did something unconscionably evil ... so you are!
Somewhere A Herpetologist Is Crying  -  Factual inaccuracies about reptiles and amphibians in a work of fiction that make the story work better.
Loads And Loads Of Loading  -  Laconic Wiki loading, please wait until you die.
Easily Forgiven  -  Character is forgiven despite crossing the Moral Event Horizon.
Moe  -  Adorable character you want to hug.
Boarding School  -  A school where the student body lives right on the campus.
Sex God  -  A character with extraordinary In-Universe skill in sexual activity.
Neutrality Backlash  -  Choosing neither side results in bad consequences.
Gun Kata  -  Karate WITH GUNS.
Bathtub Mermaid  -  Mermaids or other aquatic folk being kept wet in a tub, tank, or other container for ease of interaction.
Naked Apron  -  Wearing an apron and only an apron.
Shy Blue Haired Girl  -  If you have blue hair, you're shyer than a Flutter.
Privileged Rival  -  The rival is upper-class in contrast to the hero.
Deranged Animation  -  That animation could NOT have been made by a sane person.
Or Are You Just Happy To See Me  -  Are you hiding something in your pants or are you sporting an erection?
Neutrality Sue  -  Just because they're neutral, they can do whatever they want.
Faceless Goons  -  Masks/Visors/Helmets obscure the (evil) mooks' faces.
Outside Ride  -  Hanging on to the outside of a moving vehicle that wasn't designed for that.
Tears Of Blood  -  Crying something that isn't saltwater, normally blood.
Aliens Never Invented The Wheel  -  An alien race lacks a technology that seems trivial to humans.
I Love Nuclear Power  -  Radiation gives you Stock Superpowers.
Slime Girl  -  Slime + Girl = Slime girl.
Old Maid  -  An 'older' woman who has never married/been in a real relationship.
Quirky Bard  -  Gimmicky class/character. Sometimes worthless, sometimes not.
Secretly Dying  -  They're dying, but nobody knows it.
Snap To The Side  -  Instead of turning around, characters move their eyeballs to the side to look behind themselves.
Hats Off To The Dead  -  A witness to death or seemingly imminent death removes their hat as a sign of respect.
Parent Never Came Back From The Store  -  A parent claims to being leaving for a casual errand...and never returns.
Get The Sensation  -  This is how using Product X will make you feel!
Secret Chaser  -  A character who follows around another trying to protect their Secret Identity.
The Fair Folk  -  Fairies and elves are wicked and cruel, or at least have Blue-and-Orange Morality.
Broken Heel  -  Falling or tripping over something during a chase scene.
Pity Sex  -  Sleeping with someone out of pity.
Late Character Syndrome  -  A party member introduced later than others never actually makes it into the active party.
Stealthy Colossus  -  Something huge that's surprisingly good at stealth.
Jaccuse  -  The way to allege wrongdoing when you want to say it in French.
The Future Will Be Better  -  Trouble will be gone in the future.
Offing The Mouth  -  Character is killed for making snarky comments.
Vagueness Is Coming  -  Something bad is coming! What is it? Doesn't matter - SOMETHING BAD IS COMING!
China Takes Over The World  -  China becomes a leading world superpower.
Scatting  -  Rhythmic gibberish.
Name Of Power  -  A regular wrestling move is given a cool name and thus becomes a powerful Finishing Move.
Trick Arrow  -  An arrow with a built-in gimmick.
Vitriolic Best Buds  -  Good friends that act like bitter enemies.
Save The Villain  -  Heroes have to save the bad guy too.
Pick A Card  -  A magic trick using playing cards.
Scene Of Wonder  -  One or more characters see some kind of environment for the first time, and have a short scene where they look around and are struck in awe by what they see.
No Transhumanism Allowed  -  Despite having advanced future technology, (nearly) everyone is recognizably human to the audience.
The Knights Who Say Squee  -  The hero has their own hero to look up to.
Fast Tunnelling  -  Characters can tunnel far faster than their available tools and/or superpowers would suggest.
Cacophony Cover Up  -  Masking a loud sound with another loud sound.
Incoming Ham  -  The character's first line is already enough to let you know he's hungry for some scenery.
Camera Fiend  -  This person has a camera at all times, and isn't afraid to use it!
Fright Induced Bunkmate  -  I had a bad dream. Can I sleep in your room?
Think Of The Censors  -  The characters on a TV show, in a movie, or in a book realize that what they say or do may get them in trouble with the censors.
Adjusting Your Glasses  -  Wear glasses? The way you adjust them can say a lot about your personality.
There Are No Adults  -  Welcome to this trope. No characters over 18 allowed.
The Ferryman  -  A mythical figure whose boat is used as a vehicle to transport people to Other Worlds.
Catchphrase Interruptus  -  Another character blocks your catch phrase.
Fire Of Comfort  -  A nice, warm, comforting campfire/fireplace.
Winged Humanoid  -  A humanoid with wings.
Malaproper  -  The ward sounds wrought, but isn't.
Redshirt Army  -  Good guy Mooks... or many nameless extras who will die.
World Of Muscle Men  -  A series where every male is heavily muscled.
Good Lips Evil Jaws  -  Character Alignment depends on what your mouth looks like. Good if it kisses, bad if it bites.
Extrinsic Go First Rule  -  When who goes first is based on something outside of the game itself.
Dissension Remorse  -  Collaborators of any kind getting into a fierce argument, and regretting and reconciling for it later.
Super Powered Robot Meter Maids  -  A robot with greater capabilities than strictly necessary for its functions.
Resurrection Death Loop  -  A character that is fated or cursed to die multiple times.
Wont Take Yes For An Answer  -  Character continues to argue a point that has already been agreed upon.
Inhuman Resources  -  The department responsible mostly for firing people.
Lots Of Luggage  -  When a prissy character demonstrates just how incapable they're of roughing it.
Deceptively Silly Title  -  A serious work with a lighthearted title.
Frozen In Time  -  A work of fiction (or at least a primary element of it) gets stuck to either the specified time period or the Present Day.
Faux Fluency  -  A character that's fluent in a foreign language is portrayed by an actor who is not, usually resulting in it sounding unnatural or being mispronounced.
Cartesian Karma  -  A person suffers punishment for evil deeds they were not in control of committing.
Idiot Plot  -  A story driven entirely by all the characters being idiots that would otherwise take less than five minutes to resolve.
Racial Face Blindness  -  Characters can't tell someone from a different race apart.
Might As Well Not Be In Prison At All  -  Staying behind bars doesn't stop the bad guys from continuing with their evil schemes.
Orcus On His Throne  -  The villain doesn't do anything to directly stop the heroes.
Thought Aversion Failure  -  Telling someone not to think about something will make them start thinking about it.
Money Multiplier  -  An item that increases the amount of money you gain in-game.
Meaningful Echo  -  A line of dialogue repeated later with enhanced meaning.
Kissing Warm Up  -  Practicing your kissing alone.
Distant Finale  -  The ending/epilogue takes place in the future.
Master Of Your Domain  -  Can control everything related to one's body. Everything.
Smarter Than You Look  -  You fall into some stereotype where I thought you'd be stupid, but you're not!
Holy Burns Evil  -  Religious items hurt evil beings.
Polka Dot Paint  -  A few strokes of a paintbrush = impossible levels of detail.
Alone Among The Couples  -  Everyone in the immediate area is in a relationship but you.
No Points For Neutrality  -  Games with a Karma Meter punish you for not choosing an alignment.
Catch 22 Dilemma  -  You have to do A in order to do B, but you have to do B in order to do A.
Mess Of Woe  -  A character's living quarters go to pot in the throes of grief.
Alliance Of Alternates  -  Incarnations of the same person from different universes, continuities and/or timelines teaming up.
Unexpectedly Realistic Gameplay  -  Something that makes sense if you use Real Life logic, but players don't expect it since they're used to applying video game logic instead.
Reluctant Psycho  -  A lunatic who doesn't want to be one.
Power Upgrading Deformation  -  The stronger you get, the uglier you get.
Father I Want To Marry My Brother  -  A child expresses an innocent desire to marry a family member, oblivious to the incestuous context.
Knuckle Tattoos  -  A person has tattoos on their knuckles.
Fourth Wall Psych  -  A character appears to break the fourth wall, but doesn't.
Mess On A Plate  -  You can eat it, but it certainly doesn't look edible.
Forced Meme  -  Blatant attempts to make something widely known, usually making people avoid it more.
Grocery Store Episode  -  An episode about the main cast doing their grocery shopping.
Whole Episode Flashback  -  An episode consisting almost entirely of flashbacks.
Tandem Parasite  -  Only one passenger in a tandem vehicle is actually pedaling.
Slipping Into Stink  -  A character slips on something disgusting.
Mega Twintails  -  Exaggerated customization of pigtails to the level of impossible.
Confidence Building Scheme  -  A character with low self-esteem is secretly taught to believe in themselves through indirect means.
Real Men Hate Affection  -  A male character doesn't like hugs or other forms of affection.
Mystical 108  -  The number 108 is symbolic and/or significant.
To Win Without Fighting  -  Fighting is pointless or unnecessary, so the individual finds another way to win.
Fantastic Time Management  -  Keeping your appointments by using time travel.
Wacky Waterbed  -  Water-filled mattresses are absurdist.
Blood Transfusion Plot  -  Plot points revolving around blood transfusions.
You Keep Using That Word  -  Someone insists that a word has only one correct meaning, usually its original definition or the way it's used in a specific field.
Ojou Ringlets  -  If you see curls in front of or behind a lady's ears, she's of high class.
Affectionate Nickname  -  An In-Series Nickname, given out of affection.
Painful Rhyme  -  A really strange rhyme that doesn't sound quite right.
Kaiju  -  Japanese term referring to a genre featuring giant monsters, often destroying cities and/or fighting other monsters.
Little Red Fighting Hood  -  Little Red Riding Hood can take care of herself.
Opaque Lenses  -  Can't see their eyes through their glasses.
The Evil Prince  -  An ambitious prince usurps the throne by killing the king (and whoever is in the line of succession before him).
Freudian Slip  -  When you say one thing and mean another.
Off The Table  -  A character rejects another character's offer, but as he changes his mind, the other character won't extend the offer.
Vile Villain Laughable Lackey  -  The main antagonist is dangerous and played seriously. His underlings are not.
The Immune  -  A character that has immunity to The Virus or disease in their body.
Wounded Gazelle Warcry  -  Weakest combatant rushes in harm's way to motivate the others into action.
Character Magnetic Team  -  A group of magnetic heroes that attracts fringe characters and party replacements.
Sir Not Appearing In This Trailer  -  An important character is largely ignored in promotional materials, often to prevent spoilers.
Foregone Conclusion  -  The audience knows how the story ends before it begins.
Savage Piercings  -  Uncivilized savages wear piercings.
Weird Sun  -  The sun acts weird.
Bloodstained Glass Windows  -  Showdown inside a church.
Abusive Parents  -  Their parents were/are not good to them.
Female Angel Male Demon  -  Whenever they are seen together, angels are Always Female and demons are Always Male.
No Such Thing As Bad Publicity  -  Whether you're famous or infamous, your name is still out there, right?
Diagonal Billing  -  Giving two credits equal billing by putting one on the bottom left of the screen and the other on the top right.
Fairytale Wedding Dress  -  A pimped-out wedding dress designed to make the wearer look like a fairytale princess (if she isn't literally one).
I Dont Want To Ruin Our Friendship  -  Having a crush on someone, but choosing not to pursue a relationship for fear of losing an already-established friendship if it didn't work out.
Opposites Attract  -  They have conflicting personalities, but they love each other.
Neglectful Precursors  -  The Precursors owe us big time.
Technicolor Toxin  -  Fictional poison is vividly colored.
Creepy Cool Crosses  -  Christian crosses taken out of context and used as cool and morbidly occult symbols.
Trashcan Bonfire  -  A metal trashcan has a use: Bonfires so you can stay warm!
Cutaway Gag  -  A setup for a joke in a Gag Series that has little to do with the episode's plot.
Weapon Of Choice  -  Characters' weapons reflect their personality and/or traits.
Crippling Overspecialization  -  Great at one thing, bad at everything else.
It Was A Dark And Stormy Night  -  The story begins with a dark and stormy night.
Electronic Telepathy  -  Clairvoyant communication using sufficiently advanced BrainComputer Interface.
Light Em Up  -  Light-based Elemental Powers
Tranquil Fury  -  Calm, but angry.
Stock Series Finales  -  How [insert show here] ends.
Always Chaotic Evil  -  An inherently evil race.
Crime Of Self Defense  -  Self-defense will get a character in trouble with the law.
Narnia Time  -  Time in a different world flows at the speed of plot.
Bulk Buy Only  -  You can only get this thing in really large amounts.
Redemption Equals Affliction  -  HeelFace Turn accompanied by affliction or loss.
Save Game Limits  -  The game's save system has its limits.
Hugh Mann  -  Non-human being acts like a human and does a poor job of it. Everyone's fooled.
Level Up Fill Up  -  Levelling up restores Hit Points (and in some cases, Mana).
Science Is Good  -  Science being portrayed as a force of good that can save humanity.
Hiroshima As A Unit Of Measure  -  Comparison used for measurement.
Beach Episode  -  The cast goes to the beach for an episode. Fanservice ensues.
Day Of The Jackboot  -  The good guys' homeland is successfully taken over by an evil dictatorship.
Accidental Public Confession  -  A large crowd overhears someone talking about a secret they shouldn't reveal.
Corralled Cosmos  -  Interplanetary civilizations are confined to an arbitrarily small amount of space.
Broken Pedestal  -  A character's mentor/role model doesn't live up to what the character thinks of them.
Sequel First  -  A later installment is released before the first installment when a series finally gets localized in a certain region.
Surprise Party  -  A surprise party is held to celebrate an occasion. Depending on the situation and show, hilarity may or may not ensue.
Infraction Distraction  -  The suspect admits to a minor wrongdoing to cover up something much worse.
Magical Society  -  Spellcasters have their own personal community.
I Can Change My Beloved  -  A character (usually female) believes they can use The Power of Love to change their Love Interest for the better. They're usually wrong.
Continuity Reboot  -  The plot of a series is later scrapped and restarted anew.
Body Count Competition  -  Game time! Let's see who can kill the most people!
Artistic License Geography  -  Inaccuracies related to geography make the story work better.
Prestige Class  -  Class change to a previously unobtainable one.
Romantic Two Girl Friendship  -  Young girls' friendship looks a lot like romance.
Have I Mentioned I Am Gay  -  A character's homosexual status is repeatedly asserted and brought up in casual dialogue, even if it's never demonstrated by their actions.
The Bridge  -  The operations and control room of a spacecraft.
Fights Like A Normal  -  Character with fantastic powers mostly fights without them, or at least uses very little of it.
Embarrassed By A Child  -  -Mom, that guy's weird! "-Don't look at him!"
Former Teen Rebel  -  An older character reveals that they were rebellious and troublesome as a youth.
Judgment Of Solomon  -  Two people both claim to be the true owner of something; the judge attempts to split it to get the true owner to come forth.
Hand Cannon  -  A really large handgun.
Life Isnt Fair  -  Someone states that life isn't exactly as you want it to be.
Major General Song  -  A parody or Shout-Out to the "Major General Song" from The Pirates of Penzance, usually by writing new lyrics for the famous tune.
Furry Comic  -  A comic about anthropomorphic animals.
Makeover Fail  -  The makeover did not work out.
Prematurely Bald  -  A character becomes bald at young age.
Conveniently Timed Guard  -  The heroes have just finished their infiltration, but on their way out a guard sees them and sounds the alarm.
Minion With An F In Evil  -  People who just aren't cut out for villainy.
Rotoscoping  -  Animation traced from live action.
Hammerspace  -  A bit of Hyperspace used to hide things, often weapons.
Mistaken For Clown  -  A character (usually innocently) mistakes another character in an extravagant outfit for a clown or similar performer.
All Muslims Are Arab  -  All Muslim characters are from the Middle East.
Pragmatic Adaptation  -  Changing elements that wouldn't work when translating a work to another medium.
They Dont Make Them Like They Used To  -  A form of nostalgia, that prefers the more durable aspects of older designs over the more complex and fragile newer designs.
Santas Sweatshop  -  Santa Claus' workshop portrayed as a filthy, unsafe sweatshop.
Love To Hate  -  Enjoying an evil character's evilness.
You Wont Feel A Thing  -  Except you will.
L Is For Dyslexia  -  Dyslexics read everything with scrambled letters.
Like Cannot Cut Like  -  Weapons able to destroy almost anything can't destroy another weapon/barrier made of the same material.
Trouser Space  -  What's that in your briefs?
Watch It Stoned  -  Better enjoyed while under the influence.
Going Through The Motions  -  Using stock animated gestures for video game cutscenes.
Rage Against The Reflection  -  Looked in the mirror, hated what they saw, and SMASH!
Take Our Word For It  -  Don't show it to the audience, just let the other characters react to it.
Easy Level Trick  -  A secret that makes a level easier.
Scoring Points  -  High-scores in video games as a sign of achievement.
Actual Pacifist  -  Someone who actually won't hurt you.
Rank Up  -  A character is promoted.
Messy Maggots  -  Want to make something look gross? Just add maggots!
Converse With The Unconscious  -  Talking to someone while they've been unconscious for a prolonged period of time.
Good Guns Bad Guns  -  Character Alignment depends on what guns you carry.
Suicidal Pacifism  -  This character will not hurt others, even as a defense to something that's about to kill him.
If I Do Not Return  -  A character leaves for something risky and tells their friends to do something if they don't come back.
Big Yes  -  YEEEEEEEEEEEEEEAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!
Rainbow Lens  -  A story that mimics a Coming-Out Story without the character being LGBT.
Unto Us A Son And Daughter Are Born  -  Onscreen pregnancy produces opposite-sex fraternal twins.
Example As A Thesis  -  Trope page that gives a hypothetical example before actually stating the definition.
BSOD Song  -  Someone who undergoes a Heroic BSoD sings about how bad they feel.
Audience What Audience  -  Some characters aren't aware of the Fourth Wall.
Human Outside Alien Inside  -  They look like a human but are actually alien on the inside.
Tough Love  -  Antagonism towards your loved ones in an effort to make them stronger.
Aesop Collateral Damage  -  Innocent Bystander suffers so somebody else can learn their lesson.
Decade Themed Party  -  A party centred around a particular decade.
Chekhovs Boomerang  -  A plot device that has already been used once, then unexpectedly turns up again.
Neologizer  -  Making up words to try to look cooler.
The Owl Knowing One  -  Owls are smart.
Proud Warrior Race  -  A race/species that is filled with brave, enthusiastic soldiers and warriors who are eager to prove their honor and skills in combat.
Animated Actors  -  Animated (or otherwise illustrated) characters are shown to be genuine actors playing the characters in their own show.
Oculothorax  -  Floating eye creatures.
Fold The Page Fold The Space  -  Paper is used as a Phlebotinum Analogy to explain Quantum Physics (or its Speculative Fiction counterpart, anyway).
White Dwarf Starlet  -  An older performer who is unable to accept that their time in the spotlight is up.
Long Runner Tech Marches On  -  In a long running-series, technology advances with the real world even though no one ages.
Anthropomorphic Transformation  -  A normal animal is made anthropomorphic via Applied Phlebotinum.
Anger Is Not Enough  -  Unstoppable Rage alone will only get you so far; you'll need something else to move past that.
Unpleasable Fanbase  -  You can't please everyone in a fandom. Especially those fans who aren't open minded.
Come Alone  -  Someone wants you to come to a location by yourself. That doesn't mean they'll be by themselves, though...
Space Is Air  -  Spaceships are just airplanes in space.
Mascot Fighter  -  Fighting game with a cast of mascots from other series.
Even More Omnipotent  -  A vastly powerful being is far surpassed by an even more powerful being.
Video Game Perversity Potential  -  Video game editing tools can potentially create quite the dirty stuff.
Sacred Hospitality  -  Code of conduct between hosts and their guests.
The Production Curse  -  When Troubled Production goes Up to Eleven.
Your Mind Makes It Real  -  If you do something in a dream/hallucination/VR sim, the results happen for real.
Distressed Woodchopping  -  A character who is furious or very upset chops wood to let off the steam.
Fire Water Wind  -  An elemental trinity composed of Fire, Water, and Wind.
Wash Me Graffiti  -  A joke where someone writes a message on a dirty surface to ask to clean it.
World Sundering  -  Magical tectonic shift.
The Chiefs Daughter  -  Chiefdom Princess
Does Not Like Magic  -  A character hates magic for one reason or another.
Gargle Blaster  -  Are you sure you want that drink?
Twofer Token Minority  -  A character who belongs to multiple minority groups while the rest of the cast is of majorities.
The Scourge Of God  -  The monster kills the guiltier victims first, then works up from there.
Dying Dream  -  A before-death experience that is All Just a Dream
White Stallion  -  Only the leader gets to ride the white horse.
The Horde  -  Fantasy Barbarians or minions of the Evil Overlord.
Post Scarcity Economy  -  Advances in fabrication technology let people create anything from nothing, rendering capitalism obsolete.
Amusing Alien  -  A non-human weirdo is an easy source of laughs.
Bastard Angst  -  A character's illegitimacy gives them a hard time and may drive them to seek distinction.
Strong Girl Smart Guy  -  Female Brawn and Male Brains.
Poor Mans Substitute  -  Actor X does roles that Actor Y would do if Y were not so busy, expensive, and/or famous.
Screens Are Cameras  -  Screens that contain an unseen camera.
The Player Is The Most Important Resource  -  Characters in-game acknowledge that they need you.
No Damage Run  -  When the player decides to do a full playthrough of a game without taking a single damage.
Mistress And Servant Boy  -  A young man kept under the heel of his typically older, always more powerful, female employer.
Hypno Fool  -  A person is hypnotized and hilarity ensues before it can be undone.
Lured Into A Trap  -  A character is lured to a location under false pretences, so they can be captured or killed.
Stop Poking Me  -  Repeatedly bothering an NPC will provoke a reaction.
Who Forgot The Lights  -  Games where you can't clearly see what's going on without adjusting your monitor's brightness.
Revolving Door Band  -  When a band plays Musical Musicians.
Working Class Hero  -  An ordinary protagonist who struggles to make ends meet.
Majored In Western Hypocrisy  -  A character who hates the west, and yet had a majority of their education and their life from there.
Monumental Battle  -  A battle occurs at a well-known monument.
Aerith And Bob  -  Unusual and mundane names exist in the same setting.
False Soulmate  -  They seem to be your One True Love, but they're actually not.
Mexico Called They Want Texas Back  -  Mexico invades the Southwestern United States as revenge for the Mexican-American War.
The Chain Of Harm  -  People give what they themselves are given, and unfortunately, that includes abuse.
Mistaken For Own Murderer  -  A transformed or disguised hero is mistaken for having killed "himself."
First Gray Hair  -  When a character finds a grey hair in their otherwise non-grey hair, they freak out about getting old.
Hard To Adapt Work  -  Media that (for some reason or another) are difficult to translate to another medium.
Cool People Rebel Against Authority  -  Showing indifference and distaste for authority makes you cool.
Grounded Forever  -  A character is grounded for a ridiculously long amount of time.
Space Western  -  The Old West was a frontier, so is Space.
Nazi Nobleman  -  People of wealth and privilege working with the Nazis.
Dressed In Layers  -  Wearing your costume under regular clothes.
Winds Of Destiny Change  -  The ability to alter probability or luck.
Thousand Origami Cranes  -  If someone folds one thousand origami cranes, a crane will show up and grant them a wish.
Not So Weak  -  Someone is weak and easily bullied until you threaten or insult someone apart from them.
Ring Out  -  Send your enemy out of the ring to win.
Revenge Ballad  -  A song about getting revenge.
Villain Song  -  The villain sings about himself and his evil plans.
Amulet Of Dependency  -  Powerful magical item turns out to be hard to live without.
The Baby Of The Bunch  -  The youngest and/or most childlike member of The Team who is often treated as such by their teammates.
Historical Fantasy  -  Fantasy stories set in times gone by.
The Blind Leading The Blind  -  One character helps another in a subject which neither have much knowledge of.
Sliding Scale Of Silliness Versus Seriousness  -  Nonsense vs Sense.
Laser Cutter  -  Using light or another kind of energy beam to cut something.
RPG Mechanics Verse  -  A setting in which game mechanics like hit points, skill checks, and character alignments exist in-universe.
That Syncing Feeling  -  Someone pretends to perform, and their deception is revealed.
IKEA Weaponry  -  Build your weapon when it's needed.
