Ear Ache  -  Gore-riffic things happen to someone's ear(s).
Match Cut  -  The scene cuts/dissolves from one subject to another similar to it, in appearance and/or position.
Artistic License Economics  -  Monetary systems or economics that wouldn't work in Real Life.
Allowed Internal War  -  Civil war is an accepted part of internal politics.
Detective Mole  -  One of the investigators on the case committed the crime.
Off On A Technicality  -  Legal exploitation allows a prisoner's release.
Saturday Morning Kids Show  -  A Variety Show aimed for children.
Not Drawn To Scale  -  The official measurements of characters and how they look in the story tend not to match up.
Series Goal  -  The goal, task, or desire a character tries to fulfill throughout the series.
Super Sentai Stance  -  Hero team strikes a pose in a symmetrical manner. It's cheesy, but Rule of Cool.
Hades Shaded  -  Those who have turned to The Dark Side also receive a darker skin-tone.
New York Is Only Manhattan  -  Manhattan is the only important part of New York (Whether State or City).
Hair Trigger Avalanche  -  The avalanche is started by some loud noise.
Deadpan Snarker  -  A character prone to sarcastic remarks in a completely serious tone.
Death Equals Redemption  -  A villain decides to do one final noble act because he is going to die, and will be remembered heroically or at the very least get an Alas, Poor Villain.
Math Rock  -  Progressive Rock on crack.
The Apprentice  -  The Trope:
Wacky Startup Workplace  -  A company office filled with excessive amenities.
Sinister Switchblade  -  Switchblade knives are for evil people.
Montage Ends The VHS  -  A series of promos, intros and trailers after the main feature on a VHS tape.
Mistaken For Dying  -  Someone mistakenly thinks that they or another person are dying.
Closed Circle  -  Circumstances prevent characters from leaving an area or getting outside assistance.
Is That What Theyre Calling It Now  -  A character mistakes (or pretends to mistake) whatever the previous speaker said as an Unusual Euphemism.
Powered Armor  -  A suit of armor that enhances the wearer's physical abilities.
Dismantled Mac Guffin  -  Broken pieces of a broken plot device must be found — and put together again.
Token Motivational Nemesis  -  The villain who made the hero, who is killed off in the very first arc.
New Age Retro Hippie  -  Hippies as depicted in popular culture.
Double Agent  -  Usually either a good guy who's secretly working with the bad guys or a bad guy who's secretly working with the good guys.
Passive Rescue  -  Not an aggressive rescue.
Disaster Scavengers  -  People who search for resources in a place that was hit with a disaster.
Only In Miami  -  Works about American criminals and detective takes place in Miami.
Found Footage Films  -  Movies made to look like they were found somewhere, and explain what happens to the filmmaker(s).
Hilarious In Hindsight  -  Something is made funny or more funny thanks to later events.
Bad Mood Retreat  -  A place where the character goes to when they are in a negative mood.
Monster Is A Mommy  -  A menacing creature turns out to have legitimate reasons for its aggression, often that it was protecting its child.
Down The Rabbit Hole  -  Trope: The plot structure of Alice in Wonderland with associated tropes.
Sequelitis  -  Main trope: Series gets worse with each installment.
Faux Adventure Story  -  A work is advertised or set up as an adventure story, but the actual plot turns out quite differently.
Troll Fic  -  This fan-fic is terrible, but that's the point.
Defeat Means Friendship  -  Defeating one's enemies turns them into your friends.
Forgot To Feed The Monster  -  A monster is summoned by the villain, but cannot fight because it was not fed.
Inferiority Superiority Complex  -  Character fakes a big ego to cover up their insecurities.
Last Second Word Swap  -  A character quickly switches words before saying it.
Creator Career Self Deprecation  -  A loser character with the same career as the creator.
Incredibly Long Note  -  Holding a word or syllable for a prolonged period of time during a song.
Offending The Creators Own  -  Causing affront to those like oneself in one's work of fiction.
Nutritional Nightmare  -  An even unhealthier version of an already unhealthy food.
Rainbow Lite  -  A rainbow with fewer than seven colors.
Copy Protection  -  Measures taken to prevent or curb illegal copying of games or other software.
An Ice Suit  -  A costume tailor-made for people with ice powers.
Horrible Judge Of Character  -  Implicitly trusts Mr. Chronic Backstabbing Disorder who is more or less Obviously Evil.
Sarcasm Blind  -  One is oblivious to the fact that the other was being sarcastic.
Amazing Freaking Grace  -  Amazing Grace is just about the only hymn you'll hear at a funeral (or any other time, either) in fiction.
Kill Us Both  -  I can't hold him much longer! Kill us both!
Potty Emergency  -  When you really, really, really can't wait for a bathroom.
Blue Is Heroic  -  Blue is the color of heroes.
Rule Zero  -  The Game Master is always right.
Voluntary Vassal  -  The one vassal province of an empire that wasn't conquered by it but joined.
Groundhog Peggy Sue  -  Character finds himself sent back in time and forced to experience a certain time period endlessly until he sets right what went wrong.
Like A God To Me  -  The moment a character does something so admirable that they are viewed as a god. (not really)
Lazy Husband  -  A man sits around the house while his wife does all the work.
False Utopia  -  A supposed utopia is not as perfect as it seems.
Failure Is The Only Option  -  You will always fail at achieving the Series Goal, because succeeding will end the story.
Poor Mans Porn  -  Makeshift porn-of-last-resort: anything with nudity or even slightly suggestive content.
When I Was Your Age  -  A character of an older generation criticizes the modern generation for not having the standards they have.
One Night Stand Pregnancy  -  A one-night stand leads to an unplanned pregnancy.
Frankensteins Monster  -  A monster who is clearly inspired by Frankenstein's creature.
Anti Frustration Features  -  A video game temporarily changes some of its rules to keep certain segments from being frustrating.
Stepford Suburbia  -  A supposedly ideal and perfect Town with a Dark Secret.
They Do  -  They're promoted to Official Couple and their love story is not getting milked for any more Will They or Won't They? value.
Sesquipedalian Smith  -  Long given name, very short surname.
Paying For Air  -  When the right to breathe will cost you money.
Throw A Barrel At It  -  Got a problem? Just hurl some barrels!
Why Am I Ticking  -  Human bomb.
Clutching Hand Trap  -  A character gets his hand stuck while trying to get a treat from a jar or a hole.
Nature Is Not Nice  -  Nature is depicted as cruel, uncaring, and/or unsympathetic.
Universal Remote Control  -  Universal Remote Control remotely controls universe.
Car Meets House  -  Driver crashes car into house with no consequences other than laughs.
Think Happy Thoughts  -  Sad or despairing? Just think about what makes you happy, and you'll feel better.
Instakill Mook  -  Mook who can "kill" you in one hit.
The Quiet One  -  Doesn't say much.
Princess For A Day  -  Temporary social class upgrade.
Sorrowful Stutter  -  When talking about the deceased, a character pauses for a moment to get their voice under control.
Persecution Flip  -  Inversion of usual discrimination.
The Drag Along  -  If it was up to them, they'd stay home. Too bad the others don't agree.
After Action Patchup  -  After a fight, one character treats another's minor injuries.
Photo Op With The Dog  -  Person appears kind to improve their publicity.
Demoted To Dragon  -  Former main villain now works for the new villain.
Divine Delegation  -  A pantheon consisting of a Top God and several lesser gods serving them.
Everythings Better With Monkeys  -  Monkeys good!
Mook Face Turn  -  Heroes convince a minor enemy to lend them a hand.
No Tech But High Tech  -  Technology is narrowly defined as only things invented since the recent past.
Invulnerable Civilians  -  Civilians in video games can't be harmed.
Butt Biter  -  Characters get their butts bitten by animals.
Shameless Self Promoter  -  Character promotes himself shamelessly.
Wingding Eyes  -  A character's eyes become symbols representing their current state of mind.
Favors For The Sexy  -  Someone volunteers to perform favors for an attractive person, because they're attractive.
Artistic License History  -  The creator of a work ignores historical inaccuracy in the interest of telling a better story.
Virtual Danger Denial  -  Character expresses disbelief that something digital can have an effect on their life.
Fell Off The Back Of A Truck  -  The easy excuse when you acquire something illegally.
Take Off Your Clothes  -  An asexual situation has arisen in which a character must disrobe.
Otaku O Clock  -  Anime aired late in the night.
Bears Are Bad News  -  Bears: Do not mess with them. They will kill you.
Fannage  -  Pop cultural minutiae are more important than facts.
Broken Glass Penalty  -  Children at play break a window.
Obsessed With Perfect Attendance  -  A character refuses to miss a day of school or work, no matter what.
Anti Hero Substitute  -  Darker and Edgier substitute for established character.
Absolute Comparative  -  Describe your product as "better," but don't say what it's better than.
Translation Matchmaking  -  Two unrelated films, through translation, seem related to each other by name.
Just The First Citizen  -  Powerful ruler with a simple title.
Write Who You Know  -  A character is based off a Real Life person the author knows or knew.
Gotta Rescue Them All  -  Rescue hostages for points or as Plot Coupons.
Crappy Carnival  -  A scam featuring creepy carnies, rigged games, and rusty rides.
Dragged Off To Hell  -  A character is dragged down to...well, Hell.
You Cant Miss It  -  Overly complicated directions.
Lookalike Lovers  -  Two lovers look identical to each other.
Team Pet  -  The Team's fauna representative.
Hidden Agenda Villain  -  A villain and their actions are known, but not why.
We Can Rebuild Him  -  A badly injured character returns as a cyborg. Or a robot that is broken is brought back by being repaired.
Subverted Catch Phrase  -  It's the Catchphrase! ...sort of...!
Practice Kiss  -  Kissing someone just to practice for real relationships.
Deadly Gas  -  Don't inhale.
Gay Conservative  -  A gay person with typical American conservative political leanings.
Not Under The Parents Roof  -  Parents do not like the idea of their kids having sex at home.
Narrating The Obvious  -  Someone narrates events as the viewers witnesses them, read the TV Tropes reader.
Avenging The Villain  -  You killed the Big Bad? I'm going to kill you!
Law Of Disproportionate Response  -  The importance of an event is inversely proportional to how intensely the characters react to it.
Would Not Shoot A Civilian  -  Only proper combatants trying to fight back can be killed - not civilians who can't or won't fight back.
Quietly Performing Sister Show  -  A spin-off that is the least well-known.
Clueless Boss  -  A well meaning authority figure is totally disconnected from running things and has no idea what is done in his name.
Revenge Of The Sequel  -  The sequel title or subtitle announces the return of a character (usually the villain).
Recurring Element  -  Common in-world element consistent to a series or a creator.
Take Me Instead  -  Hero offers to take the place of the hostage or targeted individual.
All Women Love Shoes  -  Women will buy expensive shoes even if they don't need them.
Sidelined Protagonist Crossover  -  When Crossovers don't involve the main hero of one or more of the involved works or demote them to extra.
Wartime Cartoon  -  A cartoon released during war, usually containing some propaganda.
Get A Room  -  Stock Response to two characters acting in an unusually lovey-dovey way.
Damn You Muscle Memory  -  Difference in control layouts makes it easy to screw up.
Every Ten Thousand Points  -  Get a 1-Up by scoring enough points.
Invincible Villain  -  A villain who is so powerful and/or cunning that the heroes can never defeat them.
Pluralses  -  Confusings ones and manies.
Another Story For Another Time  -  I could tell it right now, but I won't 'cause it's irrelevant.
Mouth Cam  -  The view from inside a character's mouth.
Shapeshifter Guilt Trip  -  The shape-shifting villain transforms into one of the hero's loved ones. The hero's hesitation follows.
Laxative Prank  -  Someone is tricked into consuming laxatives. Potty Emergency ensues.note In fiction; in real life, the consequences are usually much more serious.
Inertial Dampening  -  Without adequate compensation, the rapid acceleration of a starship would turn the crew into chunky salsa.
Protopunk  -  Punk Rock before Punk Rock.
GPS Evidence  -  Your evidence only occurs in a single part of the world!
If You Ever Do Anything To Hurt Her  -  A relative of a Love Interest threatens a character not to hurt them or there will be repercussions.
High On Homicide  -  Person gets a calming natural high from having just killed somebody.
Rat King  -  Ruler of rat-kind, be they actual rats or a rat-like race.
The Masochism Tango  -  A relationship that walks the line between merely dysfunctional and truly destructive.
Santa Ambiguity  -  Whether Santa Claus exists in a work or not is up to the creators.
Jade Colored Glasses  -  A Naïve Newcomer goes through an epiphany and becomes The Cynic.
Soprano And Gravel  -  Duet of high and deep vocals. Usually female and male respectively.
Cute Ghost Girl  -  She is a ghost but no one cares since she's cute.
Stock Beehive  -  A fictional beehive that looks like a mix between Real Life beehives and paper-covered wasp nests.
Looks Like Orlok  -  A hunched-back, bald Monstrous Humanoid with rat- or bat-like features, clad in black, who bears resemblance to the iconic look of Count Orlok from the movie Nosferatu.
Official Parody  -  A parody created with the permission of the original creator.
If I Cant Have You  -  ...no one will!
Goal In Life  -  A character's greatest goal.
Is This What Anger Feels Like  -  Happy character feels anger for the first time.
Facepalm  -  Palm: Apply directly to the forehead.
Christmas Carolers  -  A group of characters who sing songs for the holidays.
Downplayed Trope  -  Trope played much lighter than usual.
Satiating Sandwich  -  Mmm... sandwich.
Destructive Saviour  -  They saved the village, but destroyed it in the process.
Rube Goldberg Device  -  An elaborate machine utilizing a chain reaction to achieve a simple goal.
Cant You Read The Sign  -  The sign says something important. DON'T IGNORE THE SIGN, you ungrateful bastards!!
Mega Neko  -  VERY BIG CAT.
Ludicrous Speed  -  Insanely and illogically fast, with bizarre side effects.
The Armorer  -  The person who supplies the team their gadgets.
Go Mad From The Revelation  -  A character is driven insane by a terrible experience or revelation.
Spree Killer  -  Killers who go on murder rampages, killing people over multiple locations with no breaks.
Rage Breaking Point  -  A character holds back their anger and eventually lets it out.
Old School Building  -  An old, spooky abandoned schoolhouse.
Brick Joke  -  A joke that was set up and forgotten about finally gets a punchline.
Evil Uncle  -  An evil uncle/aunt.
Even Nerds Have Standards  -  Some things are so nerdy that even other nerds will think you're a loser for doing them.
Full Name Ultimatum  -  Character is called their full name when they're in big trouble.
Squaring The Love Triangle  -  A Love Triangle being resolved by involving the offspring of the primary couple.
Power Incontinence  -  Uncontrollable powers.
Boss Warning Siren  -  Warning - Boss Battle imminent!
Mooks  -  Evil soldiers that exist for the sole purpose of being mowed over by The Hero.
Otaku  -  Obsessive fan, especially of anime or manga.
Time Stands Still  -  Time stops for everyone but you.
Calling The Cops On The FBI  -  Hindering covert law enforcement by making them suspicious to regular cops
Elemental Armor  -  Elemental Powers + Improvised Armour / Instant Armor
Praising Shows You Dont Watch  -  I haven't seen it, but I know I love it!
My Name Is Question Marks  -  Question marks used to indicate unknown titles and names, usually in video games.
Purple Is The New Black  -  A different dark color, such as purple, stands in for black.
Hard Mode Filler  -  A relatively easy level in a video game is reused (either by being copy-pasted or by being revisited) to make it more difficult.
Vigilante Militia  -  A group of like-minded vigilantes form a crime-fighting organization.
Hope Springs Eternal  -  The Trope: There is hope that things will eventually be better than now.
True Loves Kiss  -  A kiss causes a magical miracle, like waking someone from a coma or repairing the multiverse.
Dont Create A Martyr  -  Killing someone will definitely make them a martyr, but not killing them won't.
Cranial Processing Unit  -  A robot's "brain" is in its head.
Self Adaptation  -  An adaptation that has the creator involved.
One Man Army  -  One warrior with the strength of many.
Truncated Theme Tune  -  A show's theme song is greatly shortened late into its run.
Wife Basher Basher  -  You hit a woman? DIE, YOU BASTARD!
Default To Good  -  Neutral characters will likely side with the heroes.
Wham Shot  -  A completely unexpected shot that radically changes a scene.
Pure Magic Being  -  A being made purely of magic
Shut Up Kirk  -  Villain brushes the hero's speech about evil aside and attacks.
Behind Every Great Man  -  A mans success depends on a more capable woman who doesnt receive the credit.
Tsuchinoko  -  A snake-like Youkai/Cryptid of Japanese folklore.
I Should Write A Book About This  -  A story ends with the hero deciding to write a book about their adventures, with the implication that is the story you just heard.
Sleep Aesop  -  Getting sleep is important.
Cataclysm Climax  -  It all gets wiped out. The end.
Baby Factory  -  Women are treated mostly as a means to create offspring.
False Reassurance  -  Got some bad news? Twist it into good news with a little wordplay.
Trap Door Fail  -  The Trap Door doesn't work, usually because it was in the wrong area.
Speak Ill Of The Dead  -  A dead person is an Acceptable Target. Sometimes extremely acceptable.
Just Eat Him  -  The predator holds its prey in its mouth or swallows it whole even though it is counterintuitive to do so.
Face Plant  -  A character falls face down on a floor.
Metal Scream  -  A loud shriek or growl is belted out to draw emphasis on a song.
Cut And Paste Translation  -  Slapping different parts of a work together in translation, often as an end result of censorship or to get the appropiate length for syndication.
We Win Because You Didnt  -  A situation where merely stopping the rival from winning is in itself an accomplishment.
Neuro Vault  -  Hiding important information in somebody's brain.
Acid Reflux Nightmare  -  Bad food = Bad dreams.
Tanuki Kitsune Contrast  -  Tanuki and Kitsune are rivals and/or foils to one another.
Umbrella Drink  -  A drink with a small umbrella in it.
A Space Marine Is You  -  An elite soldier In Space... IS YOU!
You Exclamation  -  Yeah, YOU!
Jizzed In My Pants  -  Premature ejaculation while a man is still clothed Played for Laughs.
Borrowin Samedi  -  Stock Parodies of Baron Samedi.
Shoot The Fuel Tank  -  Fuel tanks exploding (often unrealistically) when getting shot at.
Stop Hitting Yourself  -  When someone physically harms themselves, be it on their own or as a result of attacking others. Often played up with bullies towards weaker people.
Sliding Scale Of Adaptation Modification  -  A five rating scale, regarding how faithful an adaptation is to the source material.
Possession Sue  -  Fanfic writer transforms a canon character into their own Author Avatar.
Veteran Instructor  -  An Old Soldier and an Old Master.
Sidekick Song  -  The sidekick has a moment to shine with a song.
Trap Door  -  X disposes of Y by opening a hatch directly underneath them.
Relative Error  -  Close relatives are mistaken for lovers by someone who doesn't know them.
Shotguns Are Just Better  -  Very useful shotguns.
A Lighter Shade Of Grey  -  One Anti-Hero is more heroic than an Anti-Villain.
Pseudocanonical Fic  -  A fanfic that isn't canon, but is written in a way that it could be.
Arab Oil Sheikh  -  If he's a rich Arab, then he invests big time in oil.
Pining After Protagonists Parent  -  Someone holds a torch for the protagonist's parent.
Dont Ask Just Run  -  When certain people are running, you better not stop to question it and follow.
Non Nude Bathing  -  Washing with clothes on.
Adaptational Attractiveness  -  A character from a derivative work is more attractive than their original version.
Look Behind You  -  Fool someone into looking away so you can do something without them knowing about it.
Sliding Scale Of Cooperation Vs Competition  -  How much the players cooperate and compete with each other in a game.
Plot Twist  -  A sudden, unexpected development in the plot.
Playable Menu  -  Main menu and/or option screen as a separate level.
Im Not A Doctor But I Play One On TV  -  An actor plays a certain professional onscreen usually with the intent of pretending to have the profession's authority.
Vanity License Plate  -  NOTANR
Living Polyhedron  -  A creepily geometric monster. Usually three-dimensional.
Priceless Ming Vase  -  The value of the object is so high, it's an accident just begging to happen.
Frigid Water Is Harmless  -  All water is the same, regardless of climate.
Pen Pushing President  -  A head of state is given so much paperwork that they're unable to spend any time doing anything else.
Lost Aesop  -  An Aesop is set up, and then promptly forgotten.
Short Title Long Elaborate Subtitle  -  The title is short, and its subtitle explains most of the work.
Fearful Symmetry  -  A fight scene where both fighters are using identical movements and attacks, like a mirror's reflection.
Counterfeit Cash  -  Fake money that is created by a character.
We Will Not Have Pockets In The Future  -  In science-fiction, people wear clothes with no pockets.
Your Soul Is Mine  -  Because of the power they hold, characters acquire or collect souls, by either buying, stealing, or devouring them.
Lifesaving Misfortune  -  Something inconvenient that happens to someone ends up saving them from death.
Kissing Under The Influence  -  Two characters kiss because at least one of them is under the influence of a mind-altering substance such as drugs, alcohol, or magic.
Limited Animation  -  Reusing the same animation frames for certain sequences (such as a walk cycle) as opposed to redrawing new ones for each frame to save on time and/or cash.
Backup Bluff  -  Threatening someone with backup that doesn't exist.
Midlife Crisis Car  -  Cool Cars (or other vehicles) driven by middle-aged men to remind them of their lost youth.
Team Dad  -  The surrogate father to the The Team or the True Companions.
Agony Of The Feet  -  There's no thrill of victory when you hurt your foot.
Character Death  -  A character dies.
Ignored Enemy  -  The allies take a moment to bicker amongst themselves, while paying the enemy no heed.
Sorry Ociffer  -  Of course I'm drot nunk...
Berserker Tears  -  Tears of rage.
Rock Is Authentic Pop Is Shallow  -  One type of music is seen as more artistic and valid than the other, which is seen as vapid and manufactured.
Creepy High Pitched Voice  -  Characters with unnaturally high-pitched voices are usually evil.
Furry Female Mane  -  Female members of an anthropomorphic race have human-like hair. Males don't.
TV Teen  -  Teenagers in fiction are portrayed unrealistically and that's okay.
Second Season Downfall  -  A show has a strong first season, disappointing second season, and no third season.
Band Wagon Technique  -  You should do it if everyone's doing it.
Littlest Cancer Patient  -  A child with a terminal disease that can survive anything, but cant survive the cancer killing them.
Awesome But Impractical  -  Even though it can do something really cool, it has so many drawbacks that it's rarely used.
Horror Hates A Rulebreaker  -  In the horror genre, the supernatural hates rule breakers.
The Power Of Glass  -  Elemental Powers over glass.
Fair For Its Day  -  When a work that was progressive and radical at the time is considered backwards and offensive by modern standards.
Palette Swapped Alien Food  -  Alien food looks like Earth food, except it's weirdly colored.
Cleaning Up Romantic Loose Ends  -  The romantic plotline is resolved in a rushed, abrupt manner.
What Measure Is A Mook  -  Heroes will show mercy to characterized villains, but not their nameless mooks.
Home By Christmas  -  Soldiers are promised (and higher-ups actually expect) to be Home by Christmas.
Good Lawyers Good Clients  -  Only innocents hire Lawful Good lawyers.
Heroes Frontier Step  -  A character commits an action so noble that it proves that they're a hero.
Cereal Vice Reward  -  Commercials encourage horrible human behavior for the sake of obtaining the advertised product.
Barbarian Hero  -  Lone, heroic barbarian.
Dummied Out  -  // Leftover data you can only get to by hacking.
Purely Aesthetic Gender  -  Player character's gender has little to no effect on gameplay.
Tough Room  -  Wisecracking characters amuse nobody within the fourth wall.
Captive Push  -  Walking the dog with the captives as it.
Big Fancy House  -  You have to be in the top tax brackets to afford this place.
Social Semi Circle  -  Characters always face the camera when sitting around a table.
Millennium Bug  -  Computers around the world were supposed to go haywire at 12:00 AM on January 1, 2000.
Translator Buddy  -  An associate of a character who also serves as their interpreter.
TV Head Robot  -  A robot with a screen for a head.
Good Animals Evil Animals  -  Character Alignment depends on what animal you are.
Facial Markings  -  A character has permanent facial markings for some reason.
My Greatest Failure  -  The mistake that motivates the hero.
Mecha Mooks  -  Evil robots that exist for the sole purpose of being mowed over by The Hero.
The Sky Is An Ocean  -  Sky travel is treated like sailing an ocean.
Legend  -  A classic fairy tale of good vs. evil with The Hero rescuing his Princess Classic from the Lord of Darkness.
Bruce Wayne Held Hostage  -  Villain decides to lure out The Hero by capturing a civilian, and accidentally gets The Hero in their Secret Identity, who has to save the day without blowing their cover.
Children Forced To Kill  -  A child is forced to bloody their hands with death.
Surprisingly Sudden Death  -  A character is killed entirely out of nowhere.
Apothecary Alligator  -  All proper wizards need at least one taxidermy alligator in their Mage Tower.
Perpetual Motion Monster  -  It never eats but doesn't starve. It never drinks but isn't thirsty. It never sleeps but isn't tired.
Cant Bathe Without A Weapon  -  One can never be too careful when one is washing up. Best bring a gun.
Semper Fi  -  US Marines portrayed in the media as an elite unit.
Requisite Royal Regalia  -  Royals wearing extremely flashy get-ups to show their status.
Limit Break  -  A powerful attack or technique available after some requirement during battles is fulfilled.
Phlebotinum Breakdown  -  Fantastic, plot-important equipment malfunctions.
X Pac Heat  -  The audience hates the performer instead of the character.
Desert Bandits  -  Damn desert thieves
Appeal To Obscurity  -  Prove an action is foolish/worthless by bringing up the last guy who did it; no one even remembers him.
Nervous Wreck  -  A jittery, neurotic character.
You Wouldnt Believe Me If I Told You  -  The truth is too hard to believe, so someone refuses to even say it.
It Wont Turn Off  -  The machine/device does not turn off no matter how hard a character tries.
Devoured By The Horde  -  A character is Eaten Alive and/or torn apart by multiple parties.
Smash Cut  -  The scene abruptly cuts from one to the next without impact.
The Igor  -  Yeth Marthter, I'll help with your mad thcienthe.
Binocular Shot  -  A shot with a visible matte shaped like a circle or Venn Diagram to show that it's being viewed through binoculars or a telescope.
Limerick  -  Rhyming poem with precise line lengths and meter.
Creators Oddball  -  A work that is much different from the rest of a creator's output
Getting The Boot  -  Showing a character physically being removed from a building after being asked to Get Out!.
Game Changer  -  Something new is added to the story that changes the situation.
Standard Fantasy Setting  -  Swords, sorcery, dragons, wenches.
Share The Male Pain  -  All men wince when they see a Groin Attack.
The Stool Pigeon  -  Ratting someone out behind their back.
Unwitting Instigator Of Doom  -  The meager actions of this character have caused a significant disaster.
Secret Level  -  Generic Video Game unlockable level.
Zombify The Living  -  Use of necromancy on the living.
Rustproof Blood  -  Blood that's out in the open stays red no matter how long you leave it.
Money Dear Boy  -  A perfectly good actor's explanation for their decision to show up in an absolute turkey.
Too Dumb To Fool  -  Too simple-minded to fall for misdirection.
Arcade Sounds  -  Video games depicted by other media will make primitive sound effects from The '80s regardless of when the story takes place.
Born Lucky  -  Everything goes right with this character.
Star Derailing Role  -  One bad role destroys an actor's standing on the A-list.
Or So I Heard  -  Distancing yourself from something by claiming that your knowledge of it comes purely from hearsay.
Robotic Reveal  -  A character previously thought to be organic is revealed to be a robot or a cyborg.
Everythings Deader With Zombies  -  Flesh-eating zombies are added to the story simply because of their coolness factor, with little actual impact on it.
Yellow Lightning Blue Lightning  -  Cartoonish lightning colors.
Carload Of Cool Kids  -  A group of cool characters, usually bullies, inside a vehicle.
Monster Of The Aesop  -  The Monster of the Week is a lot like An Aesop.
Private Military Contractors  -  Professional Mercenaries, fighting for just who hired them as opposed to a nation or political entity.
Player Death Is Dramatic  -  The game takes your death very seriously. Losing isn't fun.
Bound And Gagged  -  A character is tied up and silenced.
Kirk Summation  -  The hero verbally deconstructs the villain.
Muzzle Flashlight  -  Firing a gun in lieu of a proper light.
No Party Like A Donner Party  -  Cannibalism to stop starvation.
Angelic Beauty  -  Good looking angels.
The Cavalry Arrives Late  -  The Cavalry arrives after the Big Bad has already been dealt with.
Sufficiently Analyzed Magic  -  Magic is treated as a science.
Declaration Of Protection  -  A character promises to defend someone.
Dropped A Bridge On Him  -  An important character is killed off in a very abrupt, unceremonious way.
Party Scattering  -  The main cast is involuntarily scattered across the world, and has to reunite before they can reach their goal.
Doesnt Know Their Own Child  -  A parent doesn't know personal information about their kid that they probably should.
Matriarchy  -  A state or society where women are in positions of power and men have little or no role in its affairs.
Defying The Censors  -  Intentionally and clearly trying to beat the censors by putting inappropriate content.
Same Clothes Different Year  -  When clothing, usually the character's Iconic Outfit, is still worn even across different time periods.
Overclocking Attack  -  An attack that overloads its target with energy beyond its capacity.
Where No Parody Has Gone Before  -  When a work of Sci-Fi decides to parody Star Trek.
Playing Possum  -  Playing dead, pretending yourself as a dead body.
Lock And Load Montage  -  A montage showing the characters equipping and readying their weapons for an battle/raid or something else.
God Created Canon Foreigner  -  Adaptation-exclusive character created by the original work's writer.
Informed Attractiveness  -  This character is attractive, just take our word for it.
The Alleged Expert  -  A character who doesn't have the necessary skill/competence to perform his own job.
My Beloved Smother  -  A controlling, clingy and overly-protective mother.
Never Had A Birthday Party  -  A character has never had a birthday party... until now.
Fearless Infant  -  A infant who lacks any real fear of anything.
Off The Chart  -  The results so far that a chart can't display them.
Reminiscing About Your Victims  -  Someone fondly recalls a victim they murdered, raped, etc.
Sorry Im Gay  -  Invoking Incompatible Orientation when you get hit on, even if it's just to get someone to stop hitting on you.
Take Care Of The Kids  -  In your final moments asking someone to take care of your kids.
Rabid Cop  -  A cop who regularly commits unwarranted violence against suspects.
Flashy Protagonists Bland Extras  -  Major characters have designs that heavily contrast to minor characters and extras.
Magic Versus Science  -  A rivalry exists between scientists and wizards.
Temporary Online Content  -  Online content that the creators of a Video Game add for a while and then withdraw. Cannot be recovered by Save Scumming or starting the game over.
Child Marriage Veto  -  Character refuses to marry the person their parents chose for them.
Neighbourhood Friendly Gangsters  -  Criminal groups with redeeming values.
Anguished Declaration Of Love  -  Love Confession + Angst.
Hot Consort  -  Power-wielders often have a hot spouse/lover.
Monochromatic Eyes  -  Eyes that are a single color. No iris, no pupil, just sclerae.
Canon Welding  -  The creator combines their previous works into one series.
Memetic Troll  -  Fandom portrays this character as a troll, regardless of its canonicity.
Something That Begins With Boring  -  People only play "I Spy" when all other distractions are exhausted.
Deadly Rotary Fan  -  A rotary fan may kill.
Broad Strokes  -  These past events did happen, but not necessarily every detail.
Lethal Harmless Powers  -  An ability that seems harmless turns out to have lethal applications.
Mistaken For Aliens  -  A character from Earth is mistaken for an alien.
Hypocritical Heartwarming  -  Hey! No one's mean to that person except ME!
The One Thing I Dont Hate About You  -  One character hates everything about their enemy... except for one particular quality.
Criminal Amnesiac  -  Amnesiac characters are convinced by the villains that they are on their side.
It Began With A Twist Of Fate  -  The protagonist's involvement in a story's events results from a simple decision.
Walkie Talkie Static  -  *kHhHht* Using this... *static* ...right now. Over. *khHhHt*
Gratuitous Italian  -  Using Italian instead of words in your own language, often in a way that seems odd to actual speakers.
Living Memory  -  By some means, a memory of a character becomes alive and able to interact with other characters.
Armor And Magic Dont Mix  -  Spellcasting characters can't or don't wear armor.
Iaijutsu Practitioner  -  Fastest blade in the East.
Designated Hero  -  The story says they're a hero, so they're a hero. Even if their actions say otherwise.
Rogue Drone  -  Individuals broken off of the Hive Mind.
Red String Of Fate  -  Character knows another character is their soulmate because a plot device connects to them. (Invisible red string, birthmarks, and timers are popular.)
Unholy Nuke  -  Concentrated Evil weaponized.
Outdated Outfit  -  What do you mean it's not fashionable anymore?
Mad Lib Fantasy Title  -  A title made of only awesome-sounding words that have become clichés.
Diegetic Interface  -  The game's interface is justified in-universe.
Grandpa God  -  God looks like an old, bearded man.
Coconut Superpowers  -  Informed super abilities brought on by a small budget.
Propaganda Hero  -  A hero who is made into the symbol of a cause.
Vocal Evolution  -  When character voices evolve.
Leaf Boat  -  A boat...that's actually a leaf.
Doting Parent  -  A parent who is extremely proud of their child.
Cower Power  -  Hiding behind someone else until the danger has passed.
Overused Copycat Character  -  Everyone keeps making expies of this character. And we're pointing that out.
Mind Over Matter  -  They can move stuff with their mind.
Noodle Implements  -  A bunch of objects are gathered to do something we never get to see.
Heavy Voice  -  A character grows larger, and their voice gets deeper.
Child By Rape  -  A child is conceived via rape.
Damn It Feels Good To Be A Gangster  -  Glamorous portrayal of organized crime.
The Proud Elite  -  A proud, handsome, arrogant, sophisticated, cold person who often has Hidden Depths of kindness.
Bloodbath Villain Origin  -  Villain's Start of Darkness involves them committing a mass murder.
Straw Vegetarian  -  Vegan or Vegetarian Stereotype in which they condemn meat eaters.
Snark To Snark Combat  -  Two snarky characters engage in an argument.
Prequel In The Lost Age  -  The Prequel that's set in the original story's lost age, before/as the end of that age ensues.
Stock Femur Bone  -  The femur bone is practically the only bone you ever see in fiction.
Altar The Speed  -  The act of moving up a wedding date due to extenuating circumstances.
Asymmetric Multiplayer  -  Same game, different experiences for different players.
Accidental Dance Craze  -  Became a Dance Sensation by pure accident.
Wave Motion Tuning Fork  -  Two-pronged Energy Weapon.
Counter Earth  -  A hypothetical planet on the other side of the Sun from the Earth which is usually like the Earth, but hidden.
Hazy Feel Turn  -  Who's good and who's bad in this story? Who knows? But someone's switched between them.
Wisdom From The Gutter  -  Sometimes the solution to your complex problem is in the last place you'd expect.
Lethal Joke Item  -  Seemingly useless item with a powerful hidden property.
Internal Reveal  -  The Reveal in-universe. The audience knew that; the characters didn't.
Sandal Punk  -  Punk Punk translated to the Bronze Age up until the Middle Ages.
Humble Pie  -  One event humiliates a usually haughty character.
Go Mad From The Isolation  -  Insanity caused by being alone for too long.
Red Ones Go Faster  -  ZOOM!!! ZOOM!!!
The Paralyzer  -  A means of paralyzing someone, non-lethally.
White Dude Black Dude  -  Jokes about the differences between black people and white people.
Mad Scientist  -  Character who exploits science for fun, profit and possibly evil.
Shoot The Mage First  -  Shooting a key member of the enemy group to prevent him from doing major damage.
Karmic Transformation  -  Laser-Guided Karma turns a bad character into the very thing they dislike.
Felony Misdemeanor  -  An exaggerated response to a minor crime.
Deconstruction Fic  -  Deconstruction through Fan Fiction.
Alternate Continuity  -  An adaptation of a work is treated as its own separate universe rather than part of the original's timeline.
For Halloween I Am Going As Myself  -  On Halloween and other special occasions, everyone assumes that your inhuman appearance is just a well-made costume, or that your superhero costume is just cosplay.
Sex For Services  -  Offering sexual gratification as currency or a reward.
Mike Nelson Destroyer Of Worlds  -  Someone arbitrarily causes The End of the World as We Know It by accident or without understanding what that means.
Heart Is Where The Home Is  -  Character turns down a foreign Love Interest for someone from their home country.
Sick Episode  -  A major character is sick for one episode.
Chain Reaction Destruction  -  Instead of "BOOOM!", things in video games tend to go down with "Pow! Pow! Pow! Pow!...".
Muppet Cameo  -  The Muppets or Sesame Street characters appearing in other works as themselves.
Super Human Trafficking  -  Enslaving and/or exploiting Differently Powered Individuals.
Britain Is Only London  -  If it's in Britain, it's in London.
External Combustion  -  A car is rigged to explode when someone starts it.
Draconic Humanoid  -  A humanoid with features like those of dragons.
Revised Ending  -  Changing an ending in an adaptation to make it more suitable for the viewing audience.
Dumpster Dive  -  Voluntarily climbing into a dumpster to find or retrieve something.
Calvinball  -  A game where you make up the rules as you go.
Orphaned Etymology  -  Anachronisms in the form of words and expressions normally used in Real Life being utilized in fiction.
One Last Smoke  -  It's your last dance, so you might as well enjoy tobacco one last time.
We Are Experiencing Technical Difficulties  -  Something disastrous happens, and the camera cuts out.
Skepticism Failure  -  If you're a skeptic in a paranormal or supernatural work, you will be proven wrong. Painfully.
All There In The Stinger  -  When The Stinger provides information that is necessary to understanding the overall plot.
Convenient Slow Dance  -  Just after the main couple meets up at a party, a slow song starts up.
Comet Of Doom  -  A comet in the sky signals — or perhaps causes — a truly momentous event.
Chicken Walker  -  A humanoid mecha with knee joints that bend backwards instead of forwards.
Attack On One Is An Attack On All  -  A group protects its individuals fiercely.
Darkest Hour  -  The point in the story when all hope seems lost.
No Challenge Equals No Satisfaction  -  Getting what you want is better when you have to actually earn it.
Comedy Ghetto  -  Comedic works don't win awards.
Dull Surprise  -  Blank expression of many emotions.
Signature Move  -  A "move" a character regularly uses to the point where it is specific to them.
Blood Knight  -  Lives for fighting and battling.
Cowboys And Indians  -  Kids playing war.
Shock Value Relationship  -  They're in an unorthodox relationship only for the attention.
Calling Your Nausea  -  When someone is nauseous and they warn people of their imminent vomiting.
Jerkass Ball  -  A Nice Guy temporarily Takes A Level In Jerkass for the sake of plot advancement.
Accidental Kidnapping  -  We didn't intend to kidnap that personnote we may have been after someone else, it was an accident and now we're just not sure what to do now!
Wizard Duel  -  Spellcaster vs. Spellcaster! Winner takes all!
Conveniently Common Kink  -  Your romantic partner will always share your fantasies, no matter how obscure they are.
Ghostly Wail  -  Ghosts groaning, moaning, or screaming for added scare value.
Vorpal Pillow  -  Suffocating someone by smothering them with a pillow is a guaranteed kill.
World Of Pun  -  A work which is full of puns.
Bridezilla  -  Wedding planning brings out a bride's absolute worst.
Let Us Never Speak Of This Again  -  A character invokes the Noodle Incident trope by telling other characters never to mention a crazy, shocking, or embarrassing moment ever again.
Colour Coded Emotions  -  Emotions are symbolised by different colours.
Catch Your Death Of Cold  -  Catching a cold as a result of the weather.
Dream Walker  -  Someone who can travel through the dreams of others.
Caps Lock Num Lock Missiles Lock  -  The big red button of universal death is right next to a button for everyday deeds.
Undisclosed Funds  -  We're not telling you how much money it is, but trust us, it's a lot.
Sniping Mission  -  Mission in a video game (usually a First-Person Shooter or Third-Person Shooter) which involves using a Sniper Rifle to cover allies and/or eliminate enemy units.
One Bullet At A Time  -  If too many of something are on the screen, another won't appear. Even if it's bullets from your gun.
See No Evil Hear No Evil  -  The Trope: Things that should logically be quite noisy make no sound at all until they are on-screen.
Unusual User Interface  -  Visual shorthand for how technologically-advanced a world is, by the medium through which people use it.
Mal Mariee  -  A young woman unhappily married to a jealous older man, who often falls in love and cheats on him with a young lover.
Insane No More  -  You are now legally "not-crazy." Congratulations.
And Now You Must Marry Me  -  The villain tries to force a protagonist to marry them.
Noob Cave  -  Generic Video Game training area.
Evil Tastes Good  -  Villains using food and eating metaphors for evil deeds.
Audible Gleam  -  Noisy incidental light reflection.
Planning For The Future Before The End  -  A character makes mundane plans for the future, knowing they won't live to see those plans through.
Eight Point Eight  -  The stir created when a game receives an unexpected review score.
Double Standard Violence Child On Adult  -  Children physically assault adults and it's harmless, but the other way around is downright cruel.
Bowel Breaking Bricks  -  A character's surprise is accompanied by a visual metaphor for them soiling themselves.
Talking In Your Sleep  -  Secrets and important information diverged unconsciously through a sleeping character.
Laugh Track  -  Synthesized laughter used to denote the parts the creators think you should laugh at.
TV Genius  -  A stereotypical smart person.
Hollywood Economics  -  A character's monetary situation makes no sense.
Worth Living For  -  A character realizes that life is something worth living for.
Rage Quit  -  A losing player abruptly quits mid-game.
Eat The Evidence  -  Eating something that incriminates you.
Tragic Stillbirth  -  A fetus or baby dies in the womb, causing their family tragedy.
Sentient Stars  -  The stars are living beings in their own right.
Out Damned Spot  -  Obsessive ways to cleanse oneself of guilt.
Irrevocable Order  -  Can't call it off.
Wooden Ships And Iron Men  -  The Age of Sailing in all its bloody, wooden glory.
Opinion Changing Dream  -  A Dream Sequence that changes the opinion of someone, usually for the better
Unmoving Plaid  -  The patterns of clothes ignore contours and perspective and are displayed as if on a completely flat plane.
Honor Related Abuse  -  A character's family or friends abuse them because they feel they have "dishonored" them.
Kid Samurai  -  The art of Bushido, in the hands of a small child.
Broken Base  -  A franchise's fandom suffers a sustained and exceptionally vicious conflict between two or more large, vocal, and entrenched factions with little or no middle ground to be found between them.
Antlion Monster  -  A monster that waits for its prey at the bottom of a pit.
Paying For The Action Scene  -  A character engages in a fight inside a private establishment and pays for any damages done to the surroundings.
Deconstructor Fleet  -  Subverting and deconstructing lots of tropes to create something completely new.
Paralysis By Analysis  -  When given an option, one is overwhelmed by the hypothetical consequences of making that choice.
False Cause  -  People assume that correlation equals causation.
Played For Horror  -  Horrific elements of a trope are played up.
Mouthscreen  -  A character's mouth and lips are given a close-up.
Expanded Universe  -  All the details of a fiction world that do not affect the main storyline.
Inkblot Test  -  An analysis of one's psyche with a Rorschach test.
Methuselah Syndrome  -  Humans living and staying able-bodied far longer than in real life, with little to no explanation.
Sea Serpents  -  Large, aquatic, serpentine beasts.
Motherly Side Plait  -  A motherly character wears her hair in a loose side plait or ponytail.
Staggered Zoom  -  Zooms accomplished by jump-cuts.
Ending Aversion  -  Avoiding spending time dedicating oneself to a work because you know the ending will be disappointing.
Goomba Springboard  -  Gain an extra jump by bouncing off someone else.
Cannot Cross Running Water  -  Rivers are a Supernatural Repellent.
Shutting Up Now  -  A person who's talking realizes they sound stupid/crazy/etc, and shuts up.
The Savage South  -  The Deep South, only more brutal.
Abstract Apotheosis  -  A character becomes an abstract concept or an idea.
Post Rock  -  (Progressive Rock+Alternative Rock)^2.
Third Option Love Interest  -  A new character that is introduced to let someone Take a Third Option in a Love Triangle.
Magic Brakes  -  Brakes randomly fail, making the vehicle uncontrollable.
Foregone Victory  -  A point where victory is assured.
Jerkass Dissonance  -  Fictional jerks are somehow more likable than real ones.
Pretending To Be Ones Own Relative  -  A character has to make believe they're one of their own relatives.
Merged Reality  -  All of the realities are combined into one.
Wham Episode  -  An episode that permanently changes the status quo, shocking the viewership.
Bad Omen Anecdote  -  A not-so helpful story told when a better one is so badly needed.
Red Sock Ruins The Laundry  -  A single deep-colored fabric stains the whole wash with its tint.
The Corpse Stops Here  -  A person who is seen hunching over the victim's body is usually accused right away as the murderer.
Monster Adventurers  -  An adventuring monster.
A Dog Named Dog  -  A thing is named after the thing it is.
Babies Ever After  -  A Happily Ever After situation adds one or multiple babies to make it happier.
Swan Song  -  A creator nearing the end of their life makes what they know will be one last work.
Un Evil Laugh  -  Laughter that is not so frightening or unnerving.
Sequential Boss  -  A boss fought through consecutive phases.
Rags To Riches  -  Once impoverished, now wealthy.
Feathered Fiend  -  Cruel birds (or birdlike creatures).
Alternate Universe  -  Other worlds similar to ours, but with key differences.
You Require More Vespene Gas  -  Real-Time Strategy games have resources. These are what they look like. Careful—you might run out of them.
Distress Ball  -  Character becomes a Damsel in Distress because they did something stupid that could have been avoided.
Character Customization  -  When a game allows you to customize its protagonist to your tastes.
The Irish Mob  -  Scary Irish dudes with guns.
Secondary Fire  -  Why have one type of attack per gun when you can have two?
Brandishment Bluff  -  Threatening someone with a weapon that doesn't exist.
All Girls Want Bad Boys  -  A woman is attracted to a man because he's 'bad'.
Centrifugal Farce  -  Fun with giant centrifuges.
Evasive Fight Thread Episode  -  Fight between heroes with an ambiguous resolution.
Fun T Shirt  -  A T-shirt with a funny message on it.
Kangaroo Court  -  A sham trial with a predetermined verdict.
Politicians Kiss Babies  -  If you want to get elected, be prepared to kiss a lot of babies.
No Final Boss For You  -  You can't fight the Final Boss unless you fulfill certain conditions.
Subverted Kids Show  -  A supposed "kids' show" that eventually reveals its true colors.
Rump Roast  -  A literal fire on a character's rear end.
Tomboyish Ponytail  -  Tomboys wear their hair in ponytails.
Combining Mecha  -  Larger robot made of several smaller robots.
Fake Cross Over  -  A crossover is non-canonical within one or more of the universes involved.
Mystical High Collar  -  High collars just scream sorcerer.
Name Amnesia  -  Character can't remember their own name.
Pre War Civilian Career  -  What happened to a character before they joined the service.
No Pregger Sex  -  Sex whilst you're pregnant is a no-no.
Mercy Invincibility  -  A brief period of invulnerability after taking damage.
Family Versus Career  -  For women, a thriving career is mutually exclusive with raising a family.
Arc Words  -  Recurring words of great significance.
This Is Your Brain On Evil  -  A villain becomes 'addicted' to being evil.
Impartial Purpose Driven Faction  -  A faction, group, or organization that ignores taking sides in favor of pursuing their own non-political agenda.
What Do You Mean It Wasnt Made On Drugs  -  Something so strange, the audience assumes the creator was on drugs while creating it.
I Cant Believe Im Saying This  -  Begrudgingly agreeing with someone you would never expect to provide such valid points.
Reactionless Drive  -  Ships with no visible means of propulsion.
Apathetic Teacher  -  A teacher doesn't care about teacher or grading their students.
Everyone Is Gay  -  Since when did all the characters start playing for the other team in fanfics?
Dark Fantasy  -  Fantasy that is Dark(-er and Edgier).
Suicide Pact  -  Two or more characters kill themselves.
Broken Bridge  -  You're not going beyond this point yet! Go do a quest or something.
Perky Goth  -  A Goth with a cheerful personality.
Intangibility  -  Seen, but can't be touched.
The Battlestar  -  Spaceship + Strikecraft Carrier.
Life Drinker  -  A character who maintains immortality by consuming some vital force from their victims.
Passing The Torch  -  The Leader names a successor before stepping down.
No Brows  -  A character lacks eyebrows.
My Real Daddy  -  They may not have created the character, but they definitely created the one you know.
Sealed Good In A Can  -  A virtuous entity is imprisoned for centuries.
Appearance Is In The Eye Of The Beholder  -  The being's form is perceived differently by different beings.
Corporal Punishment  -  Inflicting physical pain as a form of punishment.
Launcher Of A Thousand Ships  -  Character X can be shipped with anyone.
Familial Cannibalism Surprise  -  That meat you're enjoying? It's your relatives.
Extra Strength Masquerade  -  Even though the Masquerade should logically be broken, it's not.
Ancient Order Of Protectors  -  They have guarded the MacGuffin through the ages.
Unstable Powered Woman  -  A woman comes into power but can't control it, leading to devastating consequences.
Best Years Of Your Life  -  A line that parents use to their children in attempt to cheer them up despite their bad days in high school.
Rubber Man  -  Flexibility Up to Eleven as a superpower.
Suffrage And Political Liberation  -  Marginalised or oppressed groups try to win the right to vote and become politically liberated.
Chupacabra  -  A Mexican goat-slaughtering monster.
Speech Bubbles  -  Characters & words surrounded by a border, overlaid on image or drawing as a means to indicate a character's speech.
Backstab Backfire  -  Defeated villain tries to strike back at the victor. It doesn't work.
Afterlife Antechamber  -  What you see on the screen is the afterlife with training wheels. The real afterlife remains offscreen.
Starboarding  -  One-sided shipping.
Instant Convertible  -  Car loses roof and windows, but is still operable.
Knight In Sour Armor  -  The Hero knows their job isn't easy, but they keep trying anyway, despite how cruel the world can be.
Human Hammer Throw  -  Swinging someone around by their feet and throwing them as far as possible.
Bathos  -  Silly and serious, juxtaposed.
The Dark Times  -  The distant past was really scary.
Deaths Hourglass  -  The physical and personal manifestation of the time someone has left until it's up... literally.
No More Holding Back Speech  -  The hero makes a speech about the problems they've experienced and how they overcame them.
Bishoujo  -  The stereotypical anime-style young and attractive female character.
Mortality Phobia  -  The fear that you will die someday motivates people to do crazy, extreme things to escape it.
Space Cold War  -  A cold war between fictional (space) powers.
Space Episode  -  One or more of the characters go into space for an episode where space travel is not the norm.
Curtains Match The Window  -  The hair (curtains) and the eyes (window) are the same color. Any color.
Always Know A Pilot  -  A pilot's skills prove useful or necessary during the course of an adventure.
Volumetric Mouth  -  When a character shouts, their mouth takes up their entire face to emphasize the loudness.
Declarative Finger  -  A character holding up one hand, and sticking up the index finger, while saying something.
Mad Doctor  -  Ax-Crazy "medical doctor".
Sealed With A Kiss  -  The Official Couple gets The Big Damn Kiss near or at the end of the story.
Wannabe Secret Agent  -  A character who pretends to be a secret agent to escape their dreary everyday life.
Deadly Dodging  -  Dodging to make your opponent hit something they really didn't want to hit.
Inbred And Evil  -  A villainous child of inbreeding.
Tilesweeper  -  Puzzle games like Minesweeper.
White Magician Girl  -  Kind female with supportive magical abilities.
Bond Villain Stupidity  -  Hero gets dinner and an easily escapable death trap instead of just shooting him already!
Sex Tourism  -  Going to a foreign country to (try to) have sex with the people who live there.
Quotes Fit For A Trailer  -  Editing quotes from movies into their trailers so it seems like they're saying it for the trailer.
Token Religious Teammate  -  A member of the main cast is explicitly religious in a setting where this is unusual.
Lampshaded Double Entendre  -  Using a phrase with an obvious innocent meaning, but also a taboo meaning, usually sexual. Then pointing that out.
Standard Snippet  -  Pieces of a musical work that play primarily when a particular scene is shown. (Or, you hear it and know it almost on the spot.)
High Class Call Girl  -  A hooker deluxe.
Karmic Rape  -  An antagonist becomes a victim of sexual assault as a form of karmic justice.
Mystical City Planning  -  When a structure, city, or even a nation makes up a mystical glyph no one notices because it's huge.
The Nothing After Death  -  A bleak and boring afterlife.
Best For Last  -  A boon that is late in coming is always worth the wait.
Imperial Stormtrooper Marksmanship Academy  -  Mooks are lousy shots when trying to hit the heroes.
Transformation Is A Free Action  -  Everything pauses when a Transformation Sequence happens.
Superhero Team Uniform  -  A team of heroes wears matching costumes.
Captain Geographic  -  A Superhero with a name or outfit, and characteristics based around their country of origin.
Shipper On Deck  -  In-universe Shipping.
Miami Bass  -  Southern Dance Rap meets the Roland TR-808
Secret Handshake  -  A long, involved handshake between two allies.
Robot War  -  When intelligent machines turn against their creators.
Distracted By The Luxury  -  Give her something fancy, and she'll forget all her problems.
Eccentric Mentor  -  The eccentric but wise and skilled mentor.
Drunk With Power  -  Using an acquired authority position in a self-serving way.
Title In  -  Displaying location name, date, and/or time of a scene as it opens.
Big Fancy Castle  -  Humongous castles that are often hard to navigate and have plenty of show-offy things.
Psychic Block Defense  -  Immunity to telepathy.
Schrodingers Gun  -  Anything not yet explicitly revealed can be seamlessly retconned, with the viewer none the wiser. Usually in response to viewer reaction.
People Puppets  -  Controlling someone like you would a puppet.
It Works Itself  -  Something is advertised as being so easy to use, it works itself.
Dumbass No More  -  A character who acts dumb becomes smarter.
Manipulative Bastard  -  A character who manipulates others through elaborate schemes and/or persuasive speaking.
Spinning Clock Hands  -  As time passes, a clock shows how much.
Nothing Is Scarier  -  Emptiness used to invoke fear by leaving it to the audience's imagination.
Autocannibalism  -  Eating yourself.
Breather Episode  -  A lighthearted upbeat episode after a hectic Story Arc.
Undead Abomination  -  An Eldritch Abomination that is undead in nature.
Renowned Selective Mentor  -  A mentor character who is selective about who they teach.
Pink Heroine  -  Pink is the go-to color for superheroines.
Stalker Without A Crush  -  A stalker driven by motives other than romantic or sexual desire.
Fiery Coverup  -  Burning all the evidence of a crime.
Three Wishes  -  Someone is granted three wishes. The first is for something trivial, the second backfires horribly, and the third hits the Reset Button.
Cosmetically Different Sides  -  Looks different, plays the same.
Everything Breaks  -  Almost everything is destroyable.
Old School Dogfight  -  Air and spacecraft behaving like pre-Cold War planes in situations where they shouldn't.
Nausea Fuel  -  Things that make you want to puke.
Powerup Mount  -  Video game character can temporarily ride an animal.
Breaking In Old Habits  -  Someone gets a hand replacement. They instantly decide to use it for... erm... something...
Classified Information  -  I can't tell you because it's an official secret.
Kill Him Already  -  The villain is RIGHT THERE! You have a GUN! KILL HIM!
In Case Of Boss Fight Break Glass  -  The foe's weak point is made of glass.
Sphere Eyes  -  A character's eyes are shaped like giant spheres and usually attached to each other.
Red And Black And Evil All Over  -  Red and Black are used as an indicator of evil.
Blank Slate  -  A new character ready to learn new things.
Freak Lab Accident  -  An accident that gives a character their superpowers.
Cutting Back To Reality  -  Transitioning from an illusory perspective on events to a real one.
Deadly Book  -  A book that can inflict harm on or even kill the reader, or in some cases the writer.
Redemption Demotion  -  The character is less powerful post-HeelFace Turn.
Miscarriage Of Justice  -  Someone is found guilty of a crime that they didn't commit.
Medicate The Medium  -  Supernatural powers are mistaken for mental illness.
With This Ring  -  Wacky wedding ring hijinks.
No True Scotsman  -  An attempt to defend the definition of a group by selectively updating the definition to exclude counter-examples.
Technicolor Eyes  -  Characters have otherwise unnatural eye colors which makes it easier to tell them apart.
Time Rewind Mechanic  -  A gameplay trope where the player can rewind time back at any point.
Instant Turn Off  -  Something causes someone to lose their arousal very quickly.
Happy Marriage Charade  -  A loveless couple cannot split up for whatever reason, so they agree to keep up appearances of a happy marriage.
Buried In A Pile Of Corpses  -  Being presumed dead as a result of being in a pile of dead bodies.
Battle Strip  -  Taking some clothes off before a fight.
Maximum Fun Chamber  -  The ultimate, but nondescript torture room, Played for Laughs.
April Fools Plot  -  An episode set on April Fools' Day.
Auto Scrolling Level  -  You have to keep up with a level where the screen advances by itself.
Deathly Dies Irae  -  The Standard Snippet of the original Dies Irae, Dies Illa melody signifies death and doom impending.
Power Tattoo  -  Tattoo grants power.
Cheated Angle  -  The character's iconic feature should NOT be seen from that angle, but is drawn anyway.
Adjacent To This Complete Breakfast  -  Food that's touted as part of a healthy meal, but only if you eat healthier foods along with it.
Spoiler Opening  -  Characters and events in the opening credits reveal information about the story.
Vanity Project  -  An artistic work created mostly by one person for egotistical purposes.
Cain  -  Fictional depictions of one of the first Biblical Bad Guys from The Bible's Cain and Abel.
The Last Of These Is Not Like The Others  -  A list is made according to a more or less obvious pattern, and then ended with something that very clearly doesn't fit that pattern.
Medieval Morons  -  People of the past were really, really stupid.
Pec Flex  -  A male character flexes their pectoral muscles to express their manliness.
Ripple Effect Indicator  -  An object or person that changes because of alterations to the timeline.
Themed Wedding  -  Weddings with a theme.
Knife Nut  -  A character who uses knives as a scary and badass Weapon of Choice.
Violence Is The Only Option  -  There are no options available that do not involve violence.
Younger Than They Look  -  Person looks older than their actual age.
Dr Psych Patient  -  A mental patient mistaken for a professional (usually a doctor) by the clothes they are wearing.
Reflectionless Useless Eyes  -  Eyes that don't reflect light = Blind eyes
Anti Villain  -  They are firmly antagonistic, but have minor redeeming qualities that dont make them straight-up evil. The exact opposite of Anti-Hero.
The Hyena  -  Likes to laugh a lot.
I Love The Dead  -  Necrophilia.
Fixed Relative Strength  -  Members of the main cast can all get more powerful, but their power relative to each other never changes.
The Oner  -  Long, uncut camera shot.
Double Dont Know  -  If you really don't know, say it twice.
Studiopolis  -  Trope: A Video Game Setting in a Hollywood or film studio-themed area.
Falling Into The Cockpit  -  Someone falls into a cockpit of a giant mecha and has the skills to pilot it.
Super Registration Act  -  The government singling out Differently Powered Individuals through legislation.
Game Mod  -  A modification to an already existing game.
Sound Defect  -  Unusual sound effect gag.
Undressing The Unconscious  -  A character has their clothes changed or removed after being rendered unconscious.
Acquainted With Emergency Services  -  A character is well-known by Emergency Services due to how often they see each other.
No OSHA Compliance  -  An industrial area or a procedure that is very, very, very unsafe.
Mouthy Bird  -  A bird's beak is designed to look more like a mouth.
Subliminal Seduction  -  Supposed subliminal messages hidden in works.
Multi Armed And Dangerous  -  Greater limb count means greater threat.
Help Help Trapped In Title Factory  -  Forced to work in a factory involuntarily? Hide a message for help in the outgoing products!
More Predators Than Prey  -  An ecosystem that has far more predators than should be realistically possible.
Mind Prison  -  Legal imprisonment inside a virtual world.
A Hero To His Hometown  -  A hero to their homeland and nowhere else.
Memento Mac Guffin  -  A Tragic Keepsake that just so happens to be a MacGuffin.
Esoteric Happy Ending  -  Only the author thinks the story's ending is happy.
Your Normal Is Our Taboo  -  A culture or subculture has some really odd ideas about what should be considered mainstream, kinky or perverse.
Everything Trying To Kill You  -  Everything wants you dead, regardless of how harmless or illogical it seems.
Fearless Undead  -  The animated dead has no self-preservation instinct.
Glory Seeker  -  When it comes to these characters, fame is the aim of the game.
Individuality Is Illegal  -  Society can't tolerate individuality.
Epileptic Flashing Lights  -  Light that flashes/strobes at a ridiculously fast speed.
Quicksand Sucks  -  Fictional quicksand possesses a mysterious suction.
Misleading Package Size  -  When the contents of a package is either a lot smaller or somehow bigger than the package itself.
Failed Attempt At Drama  -  A character In-Universe attempts to be dramatic but fails miserably. This was intentional on the writer's part.
Griping About Gremlins  -  Little creatures that tamper with machines.
Narrative Backpedaling  -  An incredibly shocking or bizarre plot twist is immediately revealed to not have actually happened.
Modesty Shorts  -  Shorts worn under a skirt to avoid Panty Shots.
Armed With Canon  -  Multiple creators of a single work use their authority over canon to attack each other's contributions.
Making The Choice For You  -  Someone solved a Sadistic Choice for you.
Fauxtivational Poster  -  A motivational poster that's not exactly meant to teach a lesson.
The Fantastic Trope Of Wonderous Titles  -  The Lengthy Title of Multiple Syllables and Whimsical Visual Elements.
Patrolling Mook  -  These fellas will alert other fellas about your position if they spot you.
Non POV Protagonist  -  All the main characters have chapters narrated from their point of view... except this one.
Twenty Percent More Awesome  -  Statistics measure intangible things.
The World Is Not Ready  -  Something is kept a secret out of fear of the masses mishandling the findings.
Denial Of Diagonal Attack  -  You can only shoot in certain directions.
Salem Is Witch Country  -  Remember the Salem Witch Trials? There may have been something there.
Cannot Tell A Lie  -  Character can only tell the truth.
Insubstantial Ingredients  -  Non-physical ingredients in a recipe.
Weapon Across The Shoulder  -  Sling your weapon, blade or gun, across your shoulder, and presto! - you've got this pose.
Smoky Voice  -  A character has a coarse, gravelly voice caused by years of consuming cigar(ette)s.
Slipknot Ponytail  -  A compact hairdo gets undone during a fight or action scene.
Rejected Marriage Proposal  -  Someone says "no" to a marriage proposal.
Rake Take  -  Someone steps on a rake (or hoe, or shovel...) and gets the stick part in their face.
Dual Meaning Chorus  -  The chorus is intentionally written to have two or more interpretations.
Stock Sound Effects  -  Hey, I know that sound! (And not just from there.)
You Cant Kill Whats Already Dead  -  The Undead have Nigh-Invulnerability
Better As A Lets Play  -  Enjoying a game mainly for the reactions and experiences other people have to it while playing rather than actually playing it yourself.
Intellectual Animal  -  Has human level intelligence, but still behaves and lives like an animal.
Plot Coupon That Does Something  -  Plot-vital item that does something besides.
Charles Atlas Superpower  -  Superhuman abilities through mundane training.
Allegorical Character  -  A character who represents a group or idea.
Makeup Weapon  -  Weaponized cosmetics.
Snake Oil Salesman  -  A salesman who claims his products can do a lot more than they actually can.
Pre Character Customization Gameplay  -  When a game with Character Customization precedes it with some normal gameplay.
Reading Ahead In The Script  -  A character consults the script for the show (or a similar item) to find out what's going to happen next.
Conspiracy Redemption  -  People working for the Ancient Conspiracy really aren't that evil.
Emergency Energy Tank  -  The best Healing Potion.
Arranged Marriage  -  A type of marriage where the bride and groom are selected by their families. Angst/Comedy/Drama ensues.
Red Herring  -  A misleading and distracting "clue".
In The Hood  -  A hood is worn to conceal identity and/or be mysterious.
Little Sister Heroine  -  A little sister (or similar) who is a love interest — typically cute and/or sexy, rather clingy, in need of protection at least sometimes and prone to adoring her brother.
In Scene Title Text  -  Using CGI to make text seemingly exist physically in the scene.
No Off Button  -  Once you turn it on, you cannot turn it off.
Having A Blast  -  The ability of a character to create explosions without needing the actual explosive items themselves.
Face On A Milk Carton  -  The face of a missing person on a milk carton.
Slap On The Wrist Nuke  -  A superweapon that does not live up to its name.
Sympathetic Murder Backstory  -  A character intentionally killed someone in their backstory and now regrets it.
Shotoclone  -  A standard fighting game character: Possesses an unremarkable moveset, projectile and jumping uppercut included.
Stupid Neutral  -  Idiotic devotion to neutrality/apathy.
The Triads And The Tongs  -  Chinese organized crime.
Muscle Beach Bum  -  Muscled character found in beach settings.
Battle Butler  -  Butler who kicks ass.
Humans Are White  -  The human race is depicted as universally white in fantastical works.
Big Beautiful Man  -  A fat man portrayed as attractive.
Dance Party Ending  -  Story or arc ends with the characters dancing and celebrating.
True Art Is Angsty  -  Real art needs to be cynical.
Plot Hole  -  The story contradicts itself by breaking a rule established earlier in the story.
Moral Dissonance  -  No one calls out the hero if he goes against his own code, yet it's horrible if the villain does it.
Mes A Crowd  -  When someone clones themself a lot to get things done.
Contempt Crossfire  -  A character is hated by two characters of different sides, especially by the one he's closely aligned with.
That Came Out Wrong  -  Saying something that could be interpreted as something you didn't want to say.
Mass Teleportation  -  A bunch of things are teleported somewhere else.
Chaos Architecture  -  How come this place looks different in the sequel than in the original?
Boss Arena Idiocy  -  The place you fight the boss in factors into the boss's only weakness.
Humanity Is Advanced  -  We aren't better than you, our internet is just faster.
Reclaimed By Nature  -  In the absence of people, nature reclaims lost ground.
Rounded Character  -  A detailed character, complete with depth and complexity. The standard mold for the main cast.
Unseen No More  -  The Ghost finally appears.
Extinct In The Future  -  A common or recognizable species in our world is wiped out in The Future.
Wanting Is Better Than Having  -  Bob wants something. When he gets it, it doesn't live up to his expectations. An Aesop: The journey is its own reward.
Innocent Innuendo  -  A situation seems erotic, but is actually completely innocent.
Mid Battle Tea Break  -  Characters take a break in the middle of a fight. Doing something silly in midst of the break is optional.
Jerkass Woobie  -  An asshole who you still sympathize with.
Embedded Precursor  -  You can play the older games in the series in the game.
Dungeon Based Economy  -  Dungeon Crawling is the major local industry.
Guardian Entity  -  Beings that protect other beings.
Talking Heads  -  The trope: Comic/show primarily consists of shots of talking heads, usually because of layout/budget constraints.
Heroic Suicide  -  Suicide as a heroic deed.
Sold His Soul For A Donut  -  Character sells their soul for something comically insignificant.
Fish People  -  People. Who look like fish.
Devious Dolphins  -  Dolphins as evil and malevolent creatures.
Mysterious Waif  -  Mysterious young girl with importance in the plot.
Impending Clash Shot  -  A stock pose where two characters are about to exchange blows.
Mascot With Attitude  -  A Mascot with stock cool traits.
Nested Story Reveal  -  Supposedly real events turn out to be a fictional story within a larger story.
The Brigadier  -  A no-nonsense Muggle Reasonable Authority Figure who battles the supernatural.
Do Not Touch The Funnel Cloud  -  Tornadoes are safe, so long as you stay away from the big swirly part.
Animate Body Parts  -  Parts of the human body behave on their own and have emotions.
Green Thumb  -  Elemental Powers over plant life (water and earth).
Seriously Scruffy  -  A dishevelled appearence which serves as shorthand for being busy or stressed.
Mood Motif  -  Musical instruments associated with certain situations.
CCG Importance Dissonance  -  Characters in the card game are significantly more or less powerful than in the source material.
Boy Meets Girl  -  Boy meets girl, boy loses girl, boy finds girl again.
Albinos Are Freaks  -  Albino characters are considered bad or cursed purely because of their skin color. Whether this is true depends on the character.
There Are No Rules  -  Screw the Rules, There Are No Rules!
Perpetual Molt  -  Always losing feathers.
Evil Is Sterile  -  Evil cannot create, only destroy or corrupt.
Le Parkour  -  Finding quick and efficient ways for getting from point A to point B.
One Product Planet  -  A Planet of Hats where the hat is making hats (or something else).
Steampunk  -  Advanced machines, steam age tech, often with a Victorian flavor.
Superior Species  -  A race that is better than us Puny Earthlings in practically every relevant way.
New Weapon Target Range  -  The area following the obtention of a new item is tailored for it's use.
Childish Older Sibling  -  A character acts far less mature than their younger sibling
Discard And Draw  -  Losing a power to gain a new one.
Derailing Love Interests  -  Warping the other love interest's personality to be unlikeable, as to make way for the Official Couple.
Halfway Plot Switch  -  Abandoning one plot in favor of another.
Like You Would Really Do It  -  Being Genre Savvy ruins the dramatic tension regarding (what seems like) a character's death.
Pirates Versus Ninjas  -  Pirates hate ninjas; ninjas hate pirates. Don't ask why, it's just cool.
Cramming The Coffin  -  Getting rid of a murdered corpse by putting it in with another body scheduled for cremation or burial.
Fairy Companion  -  A sidekick who's an often small fairy creature.
Black Comedy Rape  -  Rape or other types of sexual violence played for pure humor.
Mix And Match Critters  -  Want to invent a new monster/animal/whatever? Just take two or more existing creatures and combine them!
Child Mage  -  The Tagalong Kid can do magic!
Hospitality For Heroes  -  Generous shopkeeper gives away product to heroes or generally good people for their deeds.
Instructive Level Design  -  The level teaches you most of what you need to play the game.
Variant Chess  -  Chess, with a twist.
Visible Invisibility  -  The characters can't see it, but the audience can.
Action Commands  -  Hit button on screen NOW, get results.
Little Bit Beastly  -  Characters who, apart from a few animal traits like ears, wings, and/or a tail, look perfectly human.
Wind Turbine Power  -  Giant fans generate power.
Perplexing Pearl Production  -  Pearls in fiction are often naturally created quickly and perfectly, and any bivalve can create them.
Greeting Gesture Confusion  -  Several characters meet, and use mismatched gestures when greeting one another.
The Juggernaut  -  A character who's damn near unstoppable.
Occupiers Out Of Our Country  -  Get out of our country, foreign nation.
Vengeful Vending Machine  -  An appliance that's uncooperative, sometimes extremely so.
Deconstruction Game  -  The game shows more realistic results through Deconstruction.
Waiting Puzzle  -  A puzzle that is solved by the player remaining inactive for a certain period of time.
Lost World  -  A hidden geographic location not featured in any maps.
Crack Fic  -  Bizarre fanfiction.
Bragging Rights Reward  -  The best stuff in a video game is only unlocked after proving you don't need it to win.
Flawless Token  -  When the Token Minority and/or Token Female can do no wrong.
Celebrity Paradox  -  When Work X references Work Y, and Actor X was in both.
Screw The Money I Have Rules  -  Character turns down money due to their moral standards.
Space Zone  -  Space levels in video games.
Fourth Wall  -  The abstract division between a creative work and its audience.
Nuclear Nullifier  -  A new development removes nuclear deterrence as an option.
Aliens Speaking English  -  There is no language barrier between humans and extraterrestrial aliens.
Evolutionary Levels  -  Evolution has distinct levels. And you can go backwards too.
Naked People Trapped Outside  -  You're naked and outside, and you can't get in to get yourself some clothes.
