Ineffectual Loner  -  Lone wolves seem cool, but in nature, wolves without a pack usually kind of just die.
Magical Divorce  -  A marriage is terminated through supernatural means.
Christmas Light Chaos  -  Someone tries to rig up Christmas lights, and it goes wrong
Point Of View  -  The narration type a writer uses to convey the story to the reader.
Land Poor  -  A person lives on land that's too expensive for them.
I Just Like Saying The Word  -  A character says something simply because they enjoy how it sounds.
Southern Gothic  -  Horror, madness and decadence in the southern U.S.
Hobbes Was Right  -  Humans Are Bastards, and only tyranny can make them anything else.
You Shouldnt Know This Already  -  If a game character hasn't learnt about a mechanic or a bit of information yet, they can't use it — even if the player already has.
Its Probably Nothing  -  A character notices something suspicious, but wrongly writes it off as unimportant.
Arboreal Abode  -  Houses in the trees.
Hollywood Tourettes  -  Tourette's Syndrome causes random swearing.
Walking Shirtless Scene  -  A character who is often or always shirtless.
Sensory Abuse  -  OH MY EARS AND EYES!!!
Midnight Snack  -  Getting hungry and heading off to the kitchen in the middle of the night.
Faceless Masses  -  Animators choose not to bother adding details to the generic characters.
Kaiserreich  -  Fictional portrayals of Prussia and Imperial Germany.
Horned Hairdo  -  A devilish good hairstyle.
Einstein Sue  -  A Mary Sue that is a genius underdog.
All Loving Hero  -  A heroic character whose love and compassion are unlimited.
Speech Bubbles Interruption  -  Text gets covered/interrupted under speech bubbles.
Disturbed Doves  -  Mass bird take-off is always symbolic.
Perception Filter  -  Invisibility via being unnoticed.
A Degree In Useless  -  Degrees in certain areas are useless past college.
Combat Stilettos  -  Wearing high heels in combat.
Chased By Angry Natives  -  When the character gets chased by angry native population.
Gilded Cage  -  You have all the luxury you could ask for, but you can't leave.

Hollywood CB  -  When two-way radios are like cellphones, but cooler.
Oral Fixation  -  People who just need something to chew on.
Shoe Slap  -  Fighting using foot wear.
Woodland Creatures  -  Creatures that live in the forest.
Post Hardcore  -  More experimental, dynamic Hardcore Punk.
Album Title Drop  -  A song lyric that provides the title for an album.
Crushing Handshake  -  A person, often a big or strong guy, returns a handshake with a grip that causes the other pain.
Looks Like Cesare  -  Eerie Pale-Skinned Brunette + Creepy Shadowed Undereyes + Messy Hair
No Poverty  -  A world in which there are no poor people, everyone is relatively rich.
Expo Label  -  A very obvious and/or extremely specific label, so the audience knows exactly what the labelled thing does.
Ironic Inversion  -  The obvious choice is passed over for the obviously bad or disinterested choice.
NPC Amnesia  -  NPCs won't remember your actions for gameplay purposes.
Warrior Therapist  -  A warrior who can understand and affect his opponent's psychology through fighting.
Runs On Ignorance  -  A device that works as long as the user doesnt know how it works.
Fat Comic Relief  -  An overweight character serves as a comic relief.
Seinfeldian Conversation  -  A detailed conversation about mundane things.
Screwed By The Merchandise  -  A work is cancelled because The Merch didn't sell well enough.
Title 1  -  Adding "1" to your title in case you make more sequels... or not.
Become A Real Boy  -  Non-human character goes on a quest to become human.
Artistic License Engineering  -  The creator of a work ignores the realities and limitations of engineering to create a better story.
Note From Ed  -  The editor of a publication comments on the text.
Bad Date  -  A character's date goes horribly (or hilariously) wrong.
Confession Triggers Consummation  -  Alice: "I love you, Bob!" Bob: "I love you, Alice!" Alice: "Wanna have sex?" Bob: "Okay!"
The High Queen  -  The queen is beautiful and good to an inhuman degree, and is to be held in awe.
Who Murdered The Asshole  -  Murder investigation is stymied by there being no lack of people who hated the asshole and wanted them dead.
Deconfirmed Bachelor  -  Character who previously refused to get married or be in a relationship changes their mind upon meeting the love of their life.
Scavenger World  -  Everything's jury-rigged.
The Password Is Always Swordfish  -  People pick really simple passwords.
Military Superhero  -  Military training makes caped-crusading much more efficient.
Mirror Morality Machine  -  A machine that makes good guys turn bad (and vice versa).
The Mistress  -  A male character's recurring side dish.
Bathe Her And Bring Her To Me  -  The villain has the damsel cleaned up before... well, you know.
Long Song Short Scene  -  Music that gets very little play time in its respective work.
The Ghost  -  Mentioned but never seen character.
Compressed Vice  -  A character develops a flaw out of nowhere for the sake of An Aesop.
Crime Time Soap  -  Crime show with a Soap Opera feel.
Aliens Are Bastards  -  Intelligent aliens who are, as a whole, Jerkasses.
Ashes To Crashes  -  If you see an urn full of ash anywhere in a work of entertainment, you can guarantee the ash will come out eventually.
In The Past Everyone Will Be Famous  -  Time travelers accidentally encounter historical celebrities.
Lord Country  -  A ruler shares his name (or a part thereof) with that of the country he governs.
Children Are Special  -  A child's uniqueness gives them exclusive feats.
Second Law Of Gender Bending  -  Gender Bender Rule #2: People who undergo gender transformation enjoy the new gender more.
Lovely Angels  -  Duo of contrasted Action Girls.
Lost Colony  -  A group of people who are stranded in some usually unknown location and are (more often than not) forgotten about.
Really Moves Around  -  A character moves around a lot for various reasons.
Recursive Reality  -  Reality exists within itself.
Furry Reminder  -  These characters aren't human, remember.
Master Computer  -  A powerful supercomputer.
Geo Effects  -  A specific area or terrain gives a specific advantage to a specific target.
Explain Explain Oh Crap  -  Explaining a situation thinking all's well and good only to suddenly realize it's just the opposite. Alternatively, Exposition leads to Fridge Horror.
Owls Ask Who  -  Owls are associated with (and are often confused for asking) a certain one-word question.
Double Take  -  1. Look at something. 2. Turn away, having little to no reaction to it. 3. Look back at the thing faster, with a shocked expression.
Nails On A Blackboard  -  Really annoying attention-grabbing technique.
Space Opera  -  Epic action/adventure story set in space.
Revenge Fic  -  A fanfic that has a hated character get their just deserts.
Five Second Foreshadowing  -  Foreshadowing an event just moments before it happens.
Psychological Horror  -  A type of Horror which uses in-depth exploration of psychology.
Bastard Boyfriend  -  Fetishized Romanticized Abuser male Love Interest.
World Of No Grandparents  -  Nobody has any grandparents. Period.
All Deserts Have Cacti  -  Cacti in non-American deserts.
Dialog During Gameplay  -  Video game characters converse without interrupting the player's actions.
Satan  -  The original Fallen Angel, and the most notorious denizen of Hell.
Ass Shove  -  Something is stuck up someone's rear-end.
Dead Hand Shot  -  When a character dies and only a dead hand is shown.
Very High Velocity Rounds  -  Your projectiles are unaffected by Bullet Time.
Dont Be Ridiculous  -  Don't be silly! I'm about to say something really silly!
Marriage To A God  -  Mortals dedicating their lives to their gods at the expense of Earthly things (especially romance).
Have I Mentioned I Am Heterosexual Today  -  Character asserts, without any context, that he is absolutely, positively, not gay.
The Call Knows Where You Live  -  Refuse the Call, and it will get personal.
Schrodingers Canon  -  Spinoff or derivative work is simultaneously canon and not canon.
Hard Light  -  Something made of pure light that is solid.
Who Wears Short Shorts  -  Short shorts show off a character's hotness.
Story Driven Invulnerability  -  A Video Game character cannot be killed until the story says it's time.
All Bikers Are Hells Angels  -  Motorcyclist = huge scary gang member.
Living Gasbag  -  A balloon-like alien or magical creature that floats through the air.
Offing The Annoyance  -  A character kills someone for irritating them.
Humanoid Abomination  -  An incomprehensible nightmare in broadly human(oid) form.
White Mage  -  A character specializing in defense and holy magic.
Songs In The Key Of Lock  -  Play a song to open a lock.
Iron Lady  -  A non-royal, power-wielding, tough-as-nails woman.
Ironic Nursery Tune  -  An innocent tune used in Dissonant Serenity.
Professional Killer  -  Homicide is their job.
Ignored Enamored Underling  -  A minion who has unrequited love for their superiors.
Survivor Guilt  -  They've outlived everyone. They feel unworthy to have done so.
Dude Shes A Lesbian  -  Telling someone that the person they're flirting with has an Incompatible Orientation.
Big Bra To Fill  -  A comic book character with the Most Common Superpower is played by an actress with a much smaller bust size in Real Life.
Absurdly Huge Population  -  The setting is in the future. A consequence of this is a population so huge it's inconceivable.
Funny Octopus  -  Cephalopods (octopuses, squids, etc.) depicted as funny characters.
Cardiovascular Love  -  Hearts mean love.
Boxing Kangaroo  -  Kangaroos shown actually fighting by boxing.
Polite Villains Rude Heroes  -  Villains are courteous and heroes are not.
Wolves Always Howl At The Moon  -  Wolves howl at the moon at night.
Occult Detective  -  Person who investigates the unknown.
Cattle Punk  -  The Western meets Steampunk.
Obscured Special Effects  -  Partially concealing special effects to avoid noticeable Special Effects Failure.
How The Mighty Have Fallen  -  This character was once powerful, but now has almost nothing.
Take Cover  -  Hiding behind something to avoid attack.
Chocolate Frosted Sugar Bombs  -  Cereal that's nothing but sugar.
Bewildering Punishment  -  A character has no idea why he's being punished.
True Love Is Boring  -  When the Official Couple say They Do, the story ends. If it doesn't, they're DOOMED.
Big Creepy Crawlies  -  Giant bugs.
Splash Panel  -  A large two-page illustration in a comic book/manga.
Metagame  -  Strategies in a game that evolve based on how everyone is playing.
Split Personality  -  A character whose mind is split into multiple different personalities.
Black Sheep Hit  -  A big hit that doesn't sound like anything else the artist ever did.
Freudian Slippery Slope  -  Chronic foot in mouth syndrome.
Boxed Crook  -  You can die in prison, or you can do us a favor.
The Twelve Principles Of Animation  -  The twelve basic rules of how animation works.
Orochi  -  A mythological giant snake from Japanese mythology.
Malignant Plot Tumor  -  What seems to be a minor plot line at first ends up overtaking the others.
Come Out Come Out Wherever You Are  -  Stock phrase said to coax someone out of hiding.
God Does Not Own This World  -  The creator of this work doesnt actually own it, which limits their creative control thereof.
Silver Has Mystic Powers  -  Silver has supernatural or paranormal powers.
Game Breaking Bug  -  A glitch that renders the game unplayable.
Convenient Terminal Illness  -  One of the characters in a group has to make a Heroic Sacrifice. They choose the one that's dying anyway.
Eating Optional  -  Eating is optional instead of a necessity for them.
Clip Show  -  An episode that's a collection of clips from previous episodes.
Infernal Background  -  When someone is being (or acting) evil, flames appear behind them, or they stand in front of a flaming object.
Set Wrong What Was Once Made Right  -  Someone's attempt to change the timeline for the better makes it worse, causing them to have to undo their original attempt.
Personality Swap  -  People swap personality traits, but not minds.
Anthropomorphic Shift  -  Animal characters become more anthropomorphic as the series of works they're from progresses.
Conspicuous Consumption  -  Public excess as 'proof' of wealth.
Watershed  -  Time when you can start showing uncensored content.
Butch Lesbian  -  A manly lesbian.
Instant Allegiance Artifact  -  An Ancient Artifact that alters the user's personality.
Shut Up Kiss  -  A kiss that shuts you up.
Variant Power Copying  -  Copying the functionality of another's abilities through a method different than the original.
Dating What Daddy Hates  -  A girl, typically a Bratty Teenage Daughter, dates a boy whom her father disapproves of.
Absurdly High Stakes Game  -  Betting ludicrously high, or betting non-cash items, on a gambling game.
Came Back Wrong  -  Resurrection goes wrong.
Villain Sue  -  An evil Mary Sue.
Talking Poo  -  A piece of poo who can talk and walk
Amputation Stops Spread  -  Someone cuts off a contaminated body part to prevent the spread of the contamination.
Two Aliases One Character  -  Two different characters are revealed to be the same person in-universe.
Cryptic Conversation  -  Characters conceal important information during a conversation.
Kids Love Dinosaurs  -  Dinosaurs are cool and awesome according to children.
Big Word Shout  -  I don't need to yell this one word, but I WIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIILLLLLLLL!!!!!!!!!
No Immortal Inertia  -  A Really 700 Years Old character loses their immortality and rapidly ages to their true age.
Empty Chair Memorial  -  An empty chair commemorates the person who always sat in it.
Chokepoint Geography  -  A dungeon blocks path from point A to point B.
Nordic Noir  -  Crime Fiction from the Nordic countries.
Opinion Flip Flop  -  A character continually agrees with another despite the latter changing their minds.
All Part Of The Show  -  Stop cheering! This outrageous occurrence is not an act!
Psychotic Love Triangle  -  A Love Triangle where two (or more) of the participants are psychopaths.
Failing A Taxi  -  A taxi drives past a potential customer despite being hailed.
Bomb Whistle  -  Falling objects create the same sound as a falling bomb's whistle, even if it isn't a bomb.
Quality By Popular Vote  -  What the masses like won't always align with your personal tastes.
Shear Menace  -  Scissors as a Weapon of Choice.
The Mind Is A Plaything Of The Body  -  Shapeshifting is personality shifting.
Its All Junk  -  Something with only sentimental value loses said value or is destroyed.
Check And Mate  -  The victor of the battle/match/war goes to explain how the loser lost, and/or how they won.
Wolf Man  -  Canine-like humanoid.
Schizophrenic Difficulty  -  A game's difficulty doesn't follow any kind of logical progression.
Weather Saves The Day  -  A sudden change in the weather saves the heroes.
The Gay Nineties  -  1890s.
Heavy Mithril  -  Fantasy-themed Heavy Metal.
Weaponized Offspring  -  A creature gives birth to Cannon Fodder as a defense mechanism.
Mr Vice Guy  -  Character has an obvious vice, but is a good person nonetheless.
No Heterosexual Sex Allowed  -  Straight sex is banned for Population Control purposes.
Not Bad  -  A character grudgingly admits another did pretty good.
Emotional Maturity Is Physical Maturity  -  Characters act as old as their appearance dictates, even if they're actually much older or younger.
Gainaxing  -  Unrealistic breast movement in animation.
Crystal Clear Picture  -  A TV (most often a CRT) is shown with a higher resolution than it should be able to produce
Complete Immortality  -  Complete Immortality = The Ageless + Nigh-Invulnerable
Romantic Asexual  -  Character does not experience sexual attraction, but still experience romantic attraction.
Product Switcheroo Ad  -  Hey, this great product is actually this other one you thought was crappy!
Anti Regeneration  -  Someone has a Healing Factor? There are ways to stop it.
The Cracker  -  A hacker who uses their skills for non-harmless applications.
Default Setting Syndrome  -  The game offers a variety of options, but everyone just picks the defaults.
Swiss Cheese Security  -  What is this "building security" of which you speak?
Stats Dissonance  -  A character's stats do not convey how they should actually be played in-game.
Locked Away In A Monastery  -  Monasteries used to dispose of people, either temporarily or permanently without killing them.
The Undead  -  They're dead but behave as if alive.
Impossible Pickle Jar  -  A character tries opening a tenacious jar or bottle with mixed results.
Deep Sleep  -  Some takes an unwakable sleep out of a need for rest and recovery.
Kitchen Sink Included  -  The common expression "Everything but the kitchen sink" is used, followed by the arrival of said sink.
Staging An Intervention  -  A character's friends/family formally confront them about their unhealthy habit.
Eye Of Horus Means Egypt  -  Wadjet = Egyptian
Garbage Post Kid  -  A person who edits pages and adds offensive language, gross imagery, links to Shock Sites, etc.
Death Equals Emotion  -  Only when they face death does The Stoic show emotions.
Future Food Is Artificial  -  In the future, we will eat mock food.
Wham Line  -  A single line of dialogue that changes everything.
Everybody Did It  -  Every suspect is guilty.
Musical Chores  -  The character performs mundane chores such as cleaning the floors or menial tasks in their ordinary job while singing a cheery tune.
Bulverism  -  Arguing that someone should not believe in an idea without actually demonstrating that the idea is wrong in the first place.
Loads And Loads Of Writers  -  Works with not one, not a few, but a great many writers over its history.
Married To The Job  -  The character's work life takes a toll on their personal life.
That Russian Squat Dance  -  The squat-and-kick dance usually known as "Cossack dancing" in the west.
RPG Elements  -  A game incorporates RPG elements into it, even though it's not an RPG.
Jukebox Musical  -  A musical that uses pre-existing songs that weren't specifically made for it.
Obligatory Earpiece Touch  -  Characters communicating via earpiece will feel the need to touch it frequently.
Too Much Information  -  I really didn't need to know that.
We Will Have Perfect Health In The Future  -  Welcome to the future, where everyone is always healthy!
Crime After Crime  -  A crime that leads to a series of crimes to cover it up.
Animated Tattoo  -  A tattoo that can move.
Flat Scare  -  ...Boo.
Reclusive Artist  -  Their work is pretty much all you know about them.
Overpopulation Crisis  -  The population is so large that it is causing problems.
Even Mooks Have Loved Ones  -  Mooks have to choose between their loved ones and their loyalty to the Big Bad.
I Know Mortal Kombat  -  I learned how to kick ass from fiction.
Police Psychic  -  Someone who uses their supernatural powers to help law enforcement solve difficult but mundane cases.
Robot Wizard  -  Robots casting spells.
Forbidden Love  -  Taboo and social norms conflict with True Love.
Grimmification  -  An attempt to de-bowdlerize a story that ends up going to the opposite extreme instead.
Lost In Character  -  An actor gets so involved in playing a character they lose their identity and become their character.
Nerds Are Innocent  -  Nerdy people are naive and unworldly.
Birds Of A Feather  -  Characters are drawn together by their similar personalities or interests.
Got The Call On Speed Dial  -  The Hero seeks out a new Call to Adventure.
Dr Jerk  -  A great doctor who is a horrible human being.
Justified Save Point  -  There's an actual in-universe reason to be able to save your game.
Macabre Moth Motif  -  Moths are a bad omen.
Bromantic Foil  -  Foil of the male romantic lead.
Hat Of Authority  -  You can tell they're in charge by the Nice Hat they wear.
Combat Breakdown  -  As fights progress, it gets more primitive.
Animal Testing  -  The very controversial act of testing medicine on animals.
Privilege Makes You Evil  -  When being handed a lot of things corrupts a character.
Forgotten Superweapon  -  A powerful weapon that characters resort to much later than they logically should have.
Tall Dark And Snarky  -  Handsome guy (with dark hair and sometimes skin) who's the Deadpan Snarker.
Nerdy Bully  -  Yes, nerds can be bullies too.
Right Hand Versus Left Hand  -  People on the same side work against each other because of poor communication and/or infighting.
Loading Screen  -  ____LOADING...
Harp Of Femininity  -  Playing the harp exalts a woman's femininity.
Decon Recon Switch  -  A combination of Deconstruction and Reconstruction in the same work.
The Social Expert  -  A character who has very good social skills and understands social psychology.
Omnicidal Neutral  -  The Player can choose to Kill 'Em All.
Who You Gonna Call  -  Groups who tend to the paranormal in fiction.
Film Noir  -  A film genre involving detectives, Chiaroscuro lighting, crime, and a 1940-60s setting.
You Leave Him Alone  -  ...And deal with me instead!
Is That Cute Kid Yours  -  An adult(s) is mistaken for the parent of a young child.
The Great Whodini  -  Magician The Magnificent
And A Diet Coke  -  Offsetting a huge high-calorie feast with a single low-calorie item.
Not Christian Rock  -  Music mistaken for being religious even though the artists themselves are not.
Gay Option  -  Same-Sex Optional Sexual Encounter.
Contrapposto Pose  -  Stock Pose of a standing human figure whose weight is unequally distributed between the two legs.
Surreal Theme Tune  -  A Theme Tune with surreal and confusing lyrics that don't have any correlation with the actual show.
Synthetic Voice Actor  -  Computer-generated dialog.
Reformed Criminal  -  Small time Criminals who have a change of heart and join the good guys.
Romantic Vampire Boy  -  A male Love Interest who is a vampire.

Dark Is Not Evil  -  Darkness is associated with the forces of good.
Pastimes Prove Personality  -  It's easy to see someone's personality based on the pastimes they do.
Uniformity Exception  -  A member of an otherwise identical group has a distinguishing feature.
Soap Within A Show  -  Other works portray Soap Operas as the same over-the-top tropes.
Idea Bulb  -  A lit light bulb floats over a character to signify their Eureka Moment.
Billions Of Buttons  -  A control interface has a copious amount of buttons.
Toothy Bird  -  A creature that normally doesn't have teeth is given teeth.
Common Meter  -  Line one contains eight syllables. The next contains just six. For emphasis: iambic stress. That's it, no other tricks.
Fauxshadow  -  When what's been repeatedly hinted at never happens.
The Load  -  A useless character who does nothing but weigh down the group.
Insecurity Camera  -  These surveillance cameras fail at surveillance.
Spontaneous Choreography  -  Characters can perform perfectly-choreographed dances on cue with no practice.
You Have To Have Jews  -  Jewish people being written and cast as leading characters, even if they don't fit with the setting.
Groin Attack  -  Attacking a man's (or woman's) private parts inflicts MASSIVE damage.
Cipher Scything  -  A generic or Featureless Protagonist in a video game is either given a personality or removed entirely in non-interactive media.
Shamed By A Mob  -  A crowd is antagonistic towards a character for something wrong they've done.
Hardcore Punk  -  More political, faster, and angrier Punk Rock.
Great Bow  -  Absurdly large bows for firing abnormally large projectiles.
Dog Got Sent To A Farm  -  Telling a small child their pet/relative has gone somewhere else when they've actually died.
Cosmic Egg  -  The universe begins the same way a chicken does.
Occult Blue Eyes  -  Blue eyes indicate a character possesses supernatural abilities/origins.
Eurobeat  -  High speed techno music popular in Japan because of a car anime.
Clothing Damage  -  Somebody's clothing gets damaged to show some skin, often for fanservice purposes.
Writing For The Trade  -  The arc is gonna be fun to read as a whole, but it's not as fun while still in monthly installments.
Fishing Minigame  -  Videogame developers love fishing.
Milking The Giant Cow  -  Making grandiose gestures while overacting.
Exactly Exty Years Ago  -  Events happened an oddly rounded number of years ago.
Static Role Exchangeable Character  -  When the player can assign different characters to act out specific roles in the game's plot.
Assassin Outclassin  -  Assassination attempts fail miserably.
Tsuchigumo And Jorogumo  -  Shapeshifting, spider Youkai of Japanese Folklore.
Rocky Roll Call  -  All the characters repeat each other's names to either dramatic (or comedic) effect
Our Gargoyles Rock  -  Gargoyles are way cooler in fiction.
High Heeled Feet  -  Creature or robot with feet that resemble high-heeled shoes, usually to make them seem more feminine.
Cryptic Background Reference  -  Pieces of background trivia that are mentioned but never explained.
Scaramanga Special  -  An assembled weapon whose parts can be disguised as other things.
The Gift  -  A character born extraordinarily talented.
Inferred Holocaust  -  Death and destruction is glanced over.

Farts On Fire  -  Light the match and pass some gas.
Demonic Head Shake  -  Creepy head twitching in high speed.
Residual Self Image  -  A physical representation of one's soul/personality looks different than their physical body.
The Greatest Story Never Told  -  Something awesome happened, but nobody hears of it.
Designated Girl Fight  -  In a team vs. team fight, the female characters will fight each other so that we don't have to see male heroes beating up a woman.
You Break It You Profit  -  Breaking something earns you the amount of money that it was worth.
Just Hit Him  -  A character who is capable of overpowering another character with ease uses seemingly inefficient attacks in order to preserve dramatic tension.
Orion Drive  -  Rocket jumping with nukes... IN SPACE!!!
Our Slogan Is Terrible  -  A really bad slogan used by a fictional company.
Druid  -  Nature-based White Mage.

Eye Spy  -  An out-of-body eye that transmits what it sees back to its owner.
Whale Egg  -  Creatures lay eggs even when biology says they shouldn't.
How Much More Can He Take  -  When a fight or struggle involving beings who are Nigh Invulnerable or Made of Iron drags on so long that it becomes impossible to tell how much damage they've really sustained.
Most Common Card Game  -  Go Fish, or some other common children's card game.
Our Weapons Will Be Boxy In The Future  -  Nothing screams futuristic weapon better than a rectangle that shoots lasers.
Good Bad Bugs  -  An entertaining or useful glitch in a video game.
George Lucas Altered Version  -  Additional scenes and changes to make earlier films more appealing.
Chainmail Bikini  -  What that "armor" has on Fanservice lacks on protection.

Unflinching Walk  -  Don't react to nearby explosions.
Cuckold  -  A (usually willing) victim of infidelity.

Bigfoot Sasquatch And Yeti  -  A massive, hairy, ape-like monster.

Closed Door Rapport  -  A (possibly one-sided) conversation between two people on opposite sides of a door.
Split Personality Team  -  A character's multiple personalities have different skills and responsibilities, and they take control as appropriate.
Out Of Focus  -  When one character gets the spotlight, others tend to disappear or fade into the background.
Classy Cravat  -  Cravats tend to show off classy characters.
Human Alien Discovery  -  A Human Alien is raised believing that they're human until something happens that leads them, and possibly their adoptive family, to learn the truth.
Invulnerable Horses  -  In combat scenes, horses and other mounts never seem to be shot, killed or injured even when it would be likely for them to be.
Man Hug  -  Two men (who are usually not gay or bi, and who generally are not huggers in general) hug.
Honorable Marriage Proposal  -  A man offers to marry a woman in order to salvage her reputation.
Children In Tow  -  Softening the image of a character by having them followed by cute babies.
Stock Money Bag  -  Money and treasures in fiction is often stored inside sacks.
Invisible Parents  -  A character who's confirmed to have two living (and not missing) parents—they're just never seen in person.
Not What It Looks Like  -  Characters look like they're doing something wrong, but they aren't.
The World Mocks Your Loss  -  EVERYONE makes out after you have a break up.
Golden Snitch  -  The last stretch of the game is the only part that counts.
No Guy Wants To Be Chased  -  A male character is only interested in romantically passive females.
Old Soldier  -  Military Old Master.
Seemingly Hopeless Boss Fight  -  A boss fight seems hopeless until a cutscene makes it winnable.
Flavor Text  -  Narrative Filigree unrelated to the rules of a game.
Mid Season Twist  -  A pivotal plot twist or Wham Episode that occurs around the end of the exposition. Usually falls on episode 7 (of 13) in television, or at the 1/4, 1/3, or 1/2 point of other serials.
Rape By Proxy  -  Forcing other people into having sex with each other.
Game Breaker  -  Doing this or using this makes beating a game ridiculously easy.

Assimilation Academy  -  Schools literally discourage creativity.

Satire  -  The form of humor which points out the folly of people, organizations, ideas, or institutions.
Detail Hogging Cover  -  The box art looks WAY better than the actual work itself.

Notice This  -  In video games, if it looks conspicuous, you can interact with it.

Some Kind Of Force Field  -  A force field that's not noticed or noticeable until interacted with.

Macro Zone  -  Video game level where everything is large - or you are very small.
Opportunistic Bastard  -  A character who constantly seizes opportunities to benefit him/herself, often latching onto the plans of others in the process.
Cold Blooded Whatever  -  Fish/amphibian/reptile hybrid animals.
Roundabout Shot  -  Head-on close-ups of characters and/or objects spinning around.
Poorly Timed Confession  -  When a character reveals something at a very inappropriate time.
Deadly Euphemism  -  What they call death/murder/execution by another name.
Game Over Man  -  The person on the Game Over screen.

Perfect Health  -  Characters are only sick when the plot requires it.
Xtreme Kool Letterz  -  Misspelling words gives them the appearance of having a "cool attitude."
Fake Weakness  -  They deliberately lied about their weakness and acting like it is.
Fantastically Indifferent  -  Magic? Cool. What's for dinner?

Mirror Boss  -  A boss that fights like you do.
The Cardinal Virtues  -  Prudence, Courage, Temperance, and Justice.
Escort Distraction  -  One person takes a second one elsewhere as a distraction, usually for a third person's own plans.
The Gunslinger  -  Gun-toting badass.
Pen Pals  -  The Trope: Two characters who grow close to each other through written correspondence.
Accidental Theft  -  A character accidentally commits theft.
Voodoo Zombie  -  The original zombie of the Caribbean Voudon folklore.
Post Stress Overeating  -  A character is upset, and gorges on Comfort Food to try and feel better.
Sdrawkcab Alias  -  A character creates a pseudonym for themselves that's a reversal of their real name.
Snakes Are Sexy  -  Snakes, and to an extension reptiles in general, are seen as sexy and useable for fanservice.
Crazy Cat Lady  -  An older, poorly adjusted woman who finds company in her excessive number of pet cats.
Forest Of Perpetual Autumn  -  No matter what, this area always looks like it's in autumn.
Eagle Squadron  -  Soldiers volunteer to fight in a war that their country isn't part of.
Stay On The Path  -  ...Because if you stray from it, bad things immediately happen to you.
Reality Has No Soundtrack  -  A work forgoes background music for artistic reasons.
In Universe Soundtrack  -  Most or all songs featured in a work's soundtrack are also played inside the work's universe.
Smug Snake  -  A slimeball with an unjustly-overinflated ego and delusions of grandeur.
Handy Feet  -  A character can perform dexterous tasks with their feet as easily as with their hands.
Too Awesome To Use  -  This could be useful now, but what if I need it for a worse situation later? Better hang onto it...
I Minored In Tropology  -  A character is a scholar in a skill unexpected for him or her.
Tin Tyrant  -  Evil Overlord in an evil-looking suit of armor.
Watching Troy Burn  -  Your home, or a place you love is being destroyed, and all you can do is watch.
Clint Squint  -  A character constantly squints their eyes for some reason.
Re Release Soundtrack  -  A re-release of a work features a different score or soundtrack from the original release, often due to rights issues.
Real Men Wear Pink  -  An intimidating-looking male character with a stereotypical feminine trait or hobby.
Chariot Pulled By Cats  -  Animal-drawn vehicles being pulled behind creatures that are not normally used for such duties, in particular large, predatory animals.
Humans Are Bastards  -  Most humans (if not all) are depicted as evil and ruthless.
Sequel Reset  -  The first story's resolution is undone for the sequel.
Magic Prerequisite  -  What you have to do to make the magic work.
Leet Lingo  -  1N73RN37 F4D 0pH U51|\|9 |\|U|\/|B3R5 4|\|D 5'/|\/|B0L5 1|\| PL4(3 0pH L3773R5.Translated Internet fad of using numbers and symbols in place of letters.
Stacys Mom  -  A teenage or young adult character has a crush on a middle-aged woman/man.
Staff Created Fan Work  -  People who work on a series create their own fan-works for them.
Correction Bait  -  Information so blatantly wrong, people can't help but try to fix it.
Cheshire Cat Grin  -  A really wide smile before a very mischievous act.
Edible Bludgeon  -  Using food as an Improvised Weapon.
Smashing Survival  -  Mash X To Not Die
Either Or Offspring  -  Children of Interspecies Romance are (usually) the same species as one parent or the other — not hybrids.
Useless Accessory  -  Accessories with no functional purpose are consistently worn by a character.
Adapted Out  -  A character who was fairly important in the source material is cut entirely from an adaptation.
Trans Tribulations  -  Being transgender brings up internal and external drama.
Porn Stache  -  A style of mustache commonly associated with porn.
Network Death  -  Channel/network disappears or is assimilated with another one.
Critical Hit  -  An attack that deals more damage than normal through sheer luck.
Feedback Rule  -  Microphone gives feedback at the most inopportune time.
Cover Version  -  A music artist performs another music artist's song.
Hostile Hitchhiker  -  A hitchhiker attacks or victimizes the driver who picks them up.
Spiky Hair  -  All hair sticking up, like spikes sticking out from the head.
Association Fallacy  -  Object A is Adjective B. Object C is also Adjective B. Therefore, Object A is equivalent to Object C.
Aborted Arc  -  An ongoing storyline is abruptly abandoned.
Informed Ability  -  A character reputedly has a certain ability or attribute, but the audience never sees it.
Gray Rain Of Depression  -  Depression and Rain go well together, because you stop caring about rain when you're that depressed.
Candy Striper  -  A work includes hospital volunteers in distinctive red-and-white striped uniforms.
Fun Personified  -  A character who is all about being silly and having a good time, even in a serious setting.
Single Parents Are Undesirable  -  A single parent has a hard time getting a date.
Human Architecture Horror  -  The use of human figures melded permanently to their surroundings — alive or not — to illicit horror.
Foreign Culture Fetish  -  A shallow obsession with another country.
Mundane Luxury  -  A character is overjoyed at simple kindnesses or conveniences after a long period of deprivation.
No Flow In CGI  -  In computer graphics, long, flowing things are hard to animate, so everything is shortened.
Evil Weapon  -  A sapient weapon that is evil in itself. Side effects may include Demonic Possession, unquenchable bloodlust or wielder death.
Celebrity Masquerade  -  Superhero whose secret identity is a big star.
Tell Me About My Father  -  A child inquires about a parent (or parents) they never knew.
Im Having Soul Pains  -  Any form of torture leaving no physical scars.
Dictionary Opening  -  The opening defines an uncommon or fictional word that is important to the story.
Spinning Paper  -  Front page headline of a newspaper spins onto the screen.
Contractual Obligation Project  -  Worksgood and badmainly done to fulfill a pre-existing contract.
Dead Weight  -  Fat undead creatures. They'll often be tougher to kill than skinny undead creatures.
Teacher Parent Romance  -  A teacher and the parent of one of their students start a romantic relationship.
Moby Schtick  -  References to Moby-Dick
Department Of Redundancy Department  -  Humorous and funny repetition for the sake of comedy and humor, which is created by humorous and funny repetition.
The Punishment  -  The trope: You did a bad thing, so we'll make you immortal and give you superpowers; but you will suffer along with everyone else.
Treacherous Spirit Chase  -  A hallucination of a lost loved one leads a character into peril.
Inaction Sequence  -  Characters are supposed to be fighting, but they spend most of the time talking.
The Window Or The Stairs  -  The "safer" choice is never as safe as it seems.
Apathetic Citizens  -  None of the extras really give a shit while the world burns.
Descended Creator  -  Crew members and higher-up acting.
Tableau  -  A scene that communicates without the actors moving or speaking.
Reverse Cerebus Syndrome  -  A story goes from being really dark to really lighthearted.
Your Vampires Suck  -  My vampires are better than yours. Take That!
Only One Finds It Fun  -  Something that was meant to please everyone in a group ends up only pleasing one person.
Neutral Evil  -  A character alignment involving personal gain above all else, especially at the expense of others.
Stewed Alive  -  A character gets boiled in a pot, alive.
Failure Knight  -  I will not fail you like I failed them.
Little Old Lady Investigates  -  A little old lady is actually an expert detective.
Famed In Story  -  The hero's story is well-known throughout the world.
Mohs Scale Of Rock And Metal Hardness  -  A music scale going from soft rock/ballad music to extremely aggressive music and/or Sensory Abuse, and anything in between.
Snake Pit  -  Snakes in a hole.
Gasshole  -  A character who is well-known for being gassy.
Mona Lisa Smile  -  Art Imitates Art with Leonardo da Vinci's The Mona Lisa.
Grey Goo  -  Tiny robots eat everything to reproduce.
Space Isolation Horror  -  You are in space. You are all alone. This is horrifying.
Weak But Skilled  -  What they lack in raw power they much up for in skill and experience.
Amnesia Missed A Spot  -  A character tries to induce Laser-Guided Amnesia. It doesn't quite work.
Past Victim Showcase  -  A villain threatens the hero by showing off the remains of what they've killed.
Historical Gender Flip  -  A historical or mythical character is depicted as the opposite gender in a work of fiction.
Parental Bonus  -  A joke/reference in a kids' show that only adults will catch.
Last Het Romance  -  The heterosexual with the bad luck of inducing a homosexuality epiphany in their partner.
Bad People Abuse Animals  -  To Kick the Dog by LITERALLY kicking a dog.
Alas Poor Yorick  -  Talking to heads or skulls for drama.
Technology Porn  -  Gadgets are awesome.
Do A Barrel Roll  -  Cool moves for cool flying vehicles.
Never Heard That One Before  -  ...Actually, I have. And I'm sick of it.
Heroic Comedic Sociopath  -  A character, fighting for a good cause, whose evil deeds are Played for Laughs.
Conspicuously Selective Perception  -  Guards in video games only react to actions caused by the player even if a Non-Player Character could have caused it.
Only Fatal To Adults  -  Something only kills adults.
World War III  -  The next big world war, which changes everything.
What Is This Feeling  -  Somebody doesn't recognize an emotion they don't normally experience.
Flight Is The Final Power  -  A character gains various superpowers, with flight coming last.
Lady Land  -  Straw Feminist society. Or "You don't want to be a man here."
Fascinating Eyebrow  -  Amused superiority? Raise one eyebrow.
Ominous Message From The Future  -  The future says hi. And that it's going to suck. Sweet dreams!
Ill Kill You  -  Someone directly threatens to end the life of another.
Stylish Protection Gear  -  Plausible protection and aesthetic beauty, all in one outfit.
Everyone Calls Him Barkeep  -  Only known by their profession, or some other odd word.
Orwellian Editor  -  Author denies the existence of created work or parts of it.
Ferris Wheel Date Moment  -  Take a look at the Rendez-View!
Dolled Up Installment  -  Slapping a franchise on an initially unrelated production.
Playing With Fire  -  Fire-based Elemental Powers.
Tooth Strip  -  Animated characters with one solid block of teeth.
Silly Walk  -  A character has a rather odd way of walking.
Mirthless Laughter  -  Laughter to indicate nervousness or tension.
Un Canceled  -  Series is brought Back from the Dead.
Critical Failure  -  Random chance of Epic Failure. Essentially The opposite of a Critical Hit.
Alternate Character Reading  -  Depending on which characters you use to write a Japanese word and which pronunciation system you base it on, the word can have different meanings.
Dream Sue  -  They're The Ace... in their dreams only.
Alan Fridge  -  Unnamed or vaguely-named "sources."
Hurricane Of Puns  -  Lots of puns in one conversation.
Wire Dilemma  -  Disarming the bomb involves cutting a certain colored wire. Which one?
A Commander Is You  -  You control the armies.
Citadel City  -  A very well fortified city.
Lazy Mexican  -  Mexicans are lazy and take siestas.
High Pressure Emotion  -  Strong emotion makes a character's head act like a teakettle.
Holodeck Malfunction  -  A malfunction makes the simulation dangerous for the people inside.
Rescue Sex  -  Someone has sex with their rescuer to express their gratitude.
Adorable Abomination  -  An incomprehensible nightmare in a broadly adorable form.
Time Abyss  -  An object or lifeform of an inconceivable age.
Artistic License Art  -  Liberties are taken with the world of Fine-Art.
Data Vampires  -  You have just finished a massive entry, and when you try to submit it something goes wrong.
All There Is To Know About The Crying Game  -  The plot twist is the only thing most people know about this work.
Forklift Fu  -  Fighting with forklifts.
Off Screen Romance  -  Two characters are Put On The Bus and come back in a relationship.
Check Point  -  A place you can restart from instead of the beginning of the level.
Final Boss  -  The final enemy of the game. This boss is the last obstacle standing between you and the end credits.
Holiday In Cambodia  -  South-East Asia portrayed as a primitive, violent and depraved tropical place.
Impossibly Awesome Magic Trick  -  A magic trick is performed that shouldn't logically be possible.
Popcorn On The Cob  -  Popcorn can be made simply by heating up a corn on the cob.
Your Princess Is In Another Castle  -  An ending that isn't.
Death By Irony  -  They're killed by something ironic. Usually it's somewhat their fault.
I Will Show You X  -  Comebacks of the form "I'll [verb] you some [noun]!", which varies depending on the previous sentence.
Unreliable Narrator  -  A narrator who may not be telling the truth.
Sister Trope  -  A related trope with the same idea, but different circumstances.
Little Guy Big Buddy  -  A duo composed of a tiny, clueless weakling and their gigantic bodyguard.
Red Oni Blue Oni  -  Two characters, one passionate, headstrong and wild (red), and the other level-headed, collected and rational (blue), are associated with each other for contrast.
The Atoner  -  Former bad guy spends story making up for the things he did.
Visible Silence  -  Ellipsis used to emphasize silence.
Fridge Logic  -  Belated realization of something in a work that wasn't an issue before.
Subbing Versus Dubbing  -  Subtitles are better! "No, dubbing is better!"
Once Per Episode  -  Something that happens in just about every episode.
Bad To The Last Drop  -  Really bad-tasting coffee.
Meaningful Appearance  -  When the way a character looks symbolizes something about them or their personality.
Red Light District  -  Where all of the bars and sex-workers are. Don't bring your kids.
Magical Jew  -  A Jewish character becomes a source of wisdom or a mentor for other (usually non-Jewish) characters.
Enemy Rising Behind  -  The enemy is slowly approaching their victim from behind, but only the spectator knows it yet.
Debut Queue  -  When a series introduces its main characters one by one, across numerous episodes or entries.
Japanese Tourist  -  Stereotypical tourists from east Asia. They travel in big groups and love to take pictures of everything.
Briar Patching  -  Deliberate use of Reverse Psychology to gain a desired result.
Ghastly Ghost  -  Our Ghosts are horrifying and/or malevolent.
Lady In Waiting  -  A personal assistant/companion to a high-ranking woman.
Splitting The Arrow  -  Shooting an arrow through another arrow.
Minimalist Run  -  Completing a game with as minimal collection of items/resources as possible.
Vampires Hate Garlic  -  Garlic is the ideal Supernatural Repellent against vampires.
Drugs Are Bad  -  Chemical substances consumed for recreational purposes? Nope. That's bad. Very, very bad.
Candid Camera Prank  -  A practical joke where the victim doesn't know they're being recorded.
Sound Stone  -  A musical MacGuffin.
Joined Your Party  -  A new character joins the protagonist party, bringing their own unique skillset.
Follow In My Footsteps  -  A parent wants their child to do the same thing they do and continue the family legacy, which often conflicts with the child's own wish.
Hackette  -  The Cracker, whose face is never seen, is revealed to be female.
Blood Is The New Black  -  A dangerous character covered in blood.
Heroic Self Deprecation  -  A hero who thinks they're worthless in spite of all of their heroic deeds and achievements.
Sex Face Turn  -  Doing "it" with the Face ultimately makes the Heel do a HeelFace Turn.
Teen Pregnancy  -  Teenage girls who become pregnant as a result of unprotected sex.
Student And Master Team  -  A duo consists of an older mentor and his young apprentice.
Rhyme Theme Naming  -  Members of the same group, family, or ensemble are given names that rhyme with one another.
Heroes Want Red Heads  -  The redhead has the best chances of getting it on with The Protagonist.
So Unfunny Its Funny  -  A joke so bad it comes back around to being funny.
I Believe I Can Fly  -  Everyone with superpowers can fly.
It Was His Sled  -  The Twist Ending becomes widely known to the public.
Little Miss Badass  -  This cute little girl will end you.
Standing In The Hall  -  The traditional punishment for Japanese school students.
Way Past The Expiration Date  -  A joke involving consuming something way past its expiration date.
Lady Macbeth  -  Woman who spurs a male on to villainy.
Superpowerful Genetics  -  Children of people with superpowers tend to develop their own.
Author Powers  -  An author has the godlike power to change the world's characters.
Instrumental Theme Tune  -  A Theme Tune without lyrics.
British Stuffiness  -  British people not showing emotion.
Emoticon  -  ASCII characters used to represent emotions/faces.
My Country Tis Of Thee That I Sting  -  Self-Deprecation and rage aimed at one's own nationality.
Breakaway Advertisement  -  Ad becomes more famous than its product.
Who Wants To Be Who Wants To Be A Millionaire  -  Game shows that attempt to copy the feel and look of Who Wants To Be A Millionaire?
Land Mine Goes Click  -  Mines that explode when you step off them.
Desperately Craves Affection  -  A character who's so desperate to be loved, they may go to some extreme lengths to gain it.
Extraordinarily Empowered Girl  -  Badass girl with superpowers gets the job done. Sorry boys.
Just Keep Driving  -  Encountering the Unusually Uninteresting Sight while driving.
Bring It  -  You wanna fight? Let's fight, then!
Did You Just Scam Cthulhu  -  A god becomes a pawn. -OR- Cheating a god.
Instant Messenger Pigeon  -  Birds that are used to deliver messages do it much faster than in real life.
Villain Of The Detour  -  An antagonist (currently) not associated with the Big Bad who owns/guards something the protagonists need.
Translation Yes  -  Lengthy phrase with short translation, and vice versa.
Apocalypse Anarchy  -  If an apocalypse is coming soon, anyone can do whatever they want.
Patched Together From The Headlines  -  A story mixes together more than one sensational real-life story.
The Symbiote  -  A living organism inside another living organism.
Spoiled By The Cast List  -  An actor's presence in a cast list spoils a surprise character appearance.
Crying Critters  -  A normal animal that shouldn't be able to cry in real life does so in fiction.
Man Bites Man  -  A pragmatic, savage, or desperate fighter bites their opponent.
Fashion Dissonance  -  Clothes that don't just tell you what year the show was made, they scream it loudly enough to deafen your eyes.
Interrupted Suicide  -  Someone stops a character from committing suicide.
Grade Skipper  -  A significantly younger character in a school where most students are the same age.
It Meant Something To Me  -  One person in a romantic ruse ends up actually falling for the other faker.
Tykebomb  -  A character who is born, bred, and/or raised to serve a villain.
Stringing The Hopeless Suitor Along  -  A Hopeless Suitor is trying to move on, but the person they love wont let them.
Politically Correct Villain  -  They may be evil, but they sure aren't prejudiced.
Demand Overload  -  Overwhelming demand breaks the supply.
Girl With Psycho Weapon  -  Cute girl + Not-so-cute weapon.
Meaningful Rename  -  Old name doesn't fit anymore—it's time for a new one.
The Corrupter  -  A villain who tempts people into doing evil things.
Joke Level  -  A Big-Lipped Alligator Moment in level-form.
Literal Bookworm  -  Either actual worms or wormy bugs that eat books, read books, or read books by eating them.
A Lady On Each Arm  -  A man is shown with each arm around a woman.
Nothing Can Stop Us Now  -  A Stock Phrase villains say at the height of their power before it completely comes undone.
Obliviously Evil  -  Being evil without realizing it.
Absurdly High Level Cap  -  A Level-Cap is much higher than the level you need to be to finish the main game.
Living Mac Guffin  -  A plot object that is a person or an animal.
Company Cross References  -  Work has a Shout-Out to another work made under the same company.
Sudden Intelligence  -  A normally unintelligent or unwise person suddenly turns into a highly intelligent person.
Ascended Meme  -  A Memetic Mutation that is acknowledged and referenced by the work it spawned from.
Battle Amongst The Flames  -  A battle where the area is on fire or is made out of fire.
Lie Detector  -  Lie detectors actually work as advertised in fiction.
Diagonal Cut  -  A sword strike that cuts through something so cleanly that there's a delay before the two halves fall apart.
Mile High Club  -  Sex on a plane, especially in the bathroom.
Absolute Cleavage  -  The entirety of the cleavage is shown, plus part of the abdomen.
It Runs On Nonsensoleum  -  Scientific explanation is excused by comedy.
Adipose Rex  -  Fat royalty.
Crossover Finale  -  The series or season finale of one work involves a crossover with another.
Girls With Guns  -  Works where lead protagonists are female gunslingers.
Purple Is Powerful  -  Purple is used to represent Power and Badassery.
Suspect Existence Failure  -  Innocence equals death.
Sickening Crunch  -  A sound that alerts the audience to an injury.
Theres No Place Like Home  -  A character's main goal is to get back to their home.
Immunity Attrition  -  A natural defense eventually falls to concentrated, continued attack.
Tyop On The Cover  -  A spellng/grammar misteak in a hihgly vissible plaice.
Cat Folk  -  Feline Fantastic Sapient Species.
Rare Random Drop  -  Any reward with a really low probability of being received, most commonly a video game monster leaving the player with a really rare item after being killed. Or more metaphorically, any improbable outcome.
The Grim Reaper  -  The Anthropomorphic Personification of death.
Sequel Gap  -  A long time for the sequel to be made.
Because You Can Cope  -  A character abandons their charge once it becomes clear the charge no longer needs their help.
Heads I Win Tails You Lose  -  You lose to the boss, Game Over. You beat the boss, you get thrashed anyway.
Sympathetic POV  -  Morality is determined by whose perspective the audience is viewing.
One Game For The Price Of Two  -  The game being split into two or more versions. And you need all these games to get all the secrets.
Tank Goodness  -  Tanks are cool and highly effective.
Stunt Casting  -  Casting a famous actor in hopes of cashing in on their popularity.
Creative Sterility  -  Characters who can't make anything new, whether things, ideas or life.
Nighthawks Shot  -  Art Imitates Art with Edward Hopper's Nighthawks.
Real Dreams Are Weirder  -  Metaphorical or magical dreams that make sense are contrasted with ordinary dreams that don't.
Long Lost Relative  -  A character's relative returns after having vanished a long time ago.
Relocating The Explosion  -  Can't defuse the bomb? Move it elsewhere so it will explode without hurting anyone.
Wait Here  -  A Stock Phrase someone says to another character before leaving to ensure that they wander off.
Neck Snap  -  Killing someone by snapping their neck. Like so... *SNAP*
Too Dumb To Live  -  Self-destructive stupidity.
Conversational Troping  -  Two characters talk about tropes in a Seinfeldian manner.
Descent Into Addiction  -  A story arc in which a character slowly becomes addicted to a substance or pattern of behaviour.
Are You Sure You Want To Do That  -  Going through with what you're planning to do might not be a good idea.
Mock Guffin  -  Worthless and/or insignificant object mistaken for something of great value and/or importance.
Silicon Based Life  -  The common use in fiction of alien life forms being based on silicon rather than carbon.
Religion Is Magic  -  Religions can give you Stock Superpowers
Orphans Ordeal  -  Highlighting the unpleasant side of losing one's parents to death or abandonment.
Drunk Driver  -  Alcohol-Induced Idiocy with a motor vehicle. Often ends in a police arrest at best and lost lives at worst.
One Hit Polykill  -  Bullet goes through the guy...and the guy behind him...and just keeps going.
The Heavy  -  Trope: The antagonist who does the most stuff in the story.
Evil Orphanage Lady  -  The headmistress of an orphanage is really mean.
Macho Camp  -  A man with a Manly Gay build and Camp Gay mannerisms.
Extreme Doormat  -  The character is unmotivated and has no drive, but freely bends to the will of others.
Get A Hold Of Yourself Man  -  Heroic BSoD, meet Percussive Maintenance.
Physical Religion  -  A religion is obviously real to its followers, and only the Flat-Earth Atheist says otherwise.
Close On Title  -  A movie, short, TV show episode, or comic book has its title card located at the end, instead of the beginning.
Derivative Differentiation  -  Works that heavily borrowed from another work originally, then became their own thing.
Imprinting  -  A newly hatched creature happens to look at the human protagonist of the episode, believing it to be its mother. Hilarity Ensues.
The Enemy Weapons Are Better  -  Enemy weapons are better than your own, either because they're more advanced, or there's plenty of ammunition for them to go around.
Cute Indignant Girl Stance  -  A cute female character conveys her irritation, displeasure or what have you without compromising her cuteness.
Bonsai Forest  -  Trees in media that are much smaller than trees in Real Life.
Plant Mooks  -  Grow your own Mooks.
Especially Zoidberg  -  We have to do [insert absolute statement]. - "Even X?" - "Especially X!"
The Reveal Prompts Romance  -  Revealing your Secret Identity to someone sparks a romance between you two.
Spice Up The Subtitles  -  Translated dialogue is much more obscene than the original version, because of cross-cultural misunderstandings or because the translators were deliberately trying to be edgier.
There Are No Good Executives  -  Executives are bastards. Every. Single. One of them.
Sexiled  -  Do Not Disturb.
Pair The Spares  -  The loser(s) of a Love Triangle hooks up with someone else to get them out of the main couple's way.
Uncanny Valley Girl  -  She seems perfect, but there's something not quite right about that girl...
Kitschy Local Commercial  -  Stylistic Suck for local commercials.
Made Of Indestructium  -  Cannot be destroyed. Hell, you're lucky if you even dent it.
Rare Guns  -  Firearms that are unusual or hard-to-find in Real Life, but that are widely used in fiction.
Loves Me Not  -  A character does something (usually plucking flower petals) to determine whether someone loves them, alternating between saying "S/he loves me" and "S/he loves me not" with each turn.
Scare Chord  -  A single musical note (or more if needed), coming out of nowhere in order to enhance the creepiness of a sudden scene.
The Killjoy  -  A particularly grumpy stock character spoils or even sabotages any fun.
Attack Of The Political Ad  -  A political ad, the goal of which is simply to attack the opponent. Often exaggerated to extreme degrees in fiction.
Honorary Uncle  -  Children call their parents' friend aunt or uncle.
Friendly Sniper  -  An upbeat, outgoing and sociable sniper. Who will likely also shoot you in the face.
The Don  -  The head of an organized crime family.
Hollywood Nerd  -  The nerds that we all wish we could be (or the nerds we think everyone else thinks we are).
Haunted Castle  -  The trope:
Word Salad Title  -  The title is a bunch of random words put together into one waffle iron wrench lavender quicksilver.
The Plot Reaper  -  Character dies so they won't stand in the way of the story.
Evolving Credits  -  When the opening or closing credits in media change the images/content they show over time to represent change.
Test Your Strength Game  -  A carnival game where the contestant attempts to hit a button to send up a weight to try to ring a bell.
Unishment  -  When the "punishment" seems more like a reward to the punished.
Paedo Hunt  -  Pedophiles...they're everywhere!
Ill Girl  -  A female character who is debilitatingly sick.
Competition Coupon Madness  -  Collect innumerable coupons for a competition!
Ditto Aliens  -  All y'all aliens look alike!
Symbology Research Failure  -  Using a symbol or iconography without realising that it actually symbolises something.
Fandom Enraging Misconception  -  Making a slight error or misconception can anger the fandom.
Money For Nothing  -  It's easy to get lots of money, but there's little or nothing to spend it on.
Trophy Wife  -  A rich man marries a young and gorgeous woman to flaunt his status.
Healthcare Motivation  -  Someone who can't afford healthcare desperately needs it. Someone who cares about them will get the money needed.
Animal Jingoism  -  Two kinds of animals are natural enemies.
Invited As Dinner  -  Guess what's for dinner? You!
Cranky Neighbor  -  The neighbor is always grumpy.
Silent Partner  -  The part of the duo that never talks, or can only be understood by his partner.
Masculine Girl Feminine Boy  -  A feminine male and a masculine female are featured together.
Mistaken For Profound  -  A casual statement is misinterpreted as being deeper than it actually is.
Animalistic Abomination  -  The Eldritch Abomination as an animal.
I Will Fight No More Forever  -  A badass retires from badassery (or tries to).
Rescued From The Scrappy Heap  -  The Scrappy manages to redeem themselves in the eyes of the fandom.
Getting The Baby To Sleep  -  Trying to get babies to sleep in ridiculous ways.
The Insomniac  -  Can't sleep.
Dark Shepherd  -  Uses threats of punishment to discourage evil.
Loot Boxes  -  Boxes of Random Loot in video games, obtained through many different ways, but usually Microtransactions.
Protagonist Centered Morality  -  Characters and events are considered good or evil based solely on their actions towards the protagonist.
Gonna Need More X  -  Whatever x is, you desperately need more of it.
Ship Mates  -  A fan's tendency to support ships that don't interfere with their OTP.
Video Wills  -  Character knows they're gonna die soon, so they record a final video message notifying their allies of their eventual passing.
Big Brother Instinct  -  Never fear! Big Bro/Sis/Sib (biological or figurative) is here to protect you!
Late Arrival Spoiler  -  When major spoilers for a long-running series are featured in trailers, merchandise, and other official sources.
Algorithmic Story Branching  -  The game converts player decisions into numbers, crunches them, and branches the story based on the result.
Retirony  -  Characters often die just before they retire from a dangerous job.
Hair Raising Hare  -  The trope: Rabbits that will give you nightmares.
Concert Episode  -  Characters attend a (usually rock) concert for the episode. Shenanigans ensue.
Jackie Robinson Story  -  Someone tries to be the first of their race or sex in a field occupied solely by white males.
Transhuman  -  A person that's enhanced in some way/moved past their "natural" limitations.
Rape Is A Special Kind Of Evil  -  Rape is considered inherently worse than other major crimes, even murder.
Your Costume Needs Work  -  The real deal gets mistaken for a poor impersonator, cosplayer, etc.
Gay Guy Seeks Popular Jock  -  Gay character is in love (or lust) with the hot jock.
Creepy Cleanliness  -  It's clean...too clean...
Temporary Platform  -  Get off it quick—It won't stay there for long.
Pet Fad Starter  -  A popular work featuring a prominent animal character leads to greater demand for that animal as a pet.
Anti Smother Love Talk  -  A person, often a friend or relative, tries to talk a parent concerned about their child's safety into letting go.
The Hunter Becomes The Hunted  -  A top predator finally gets what's coming — from what could've been their victim.
Resignations Not Accepted  -  No one leaves an evil organization alive.
Adaptation Species Change  -  A pet or character is a different species than they were in the source material.
Sniper Rifle  -  It kills... from far, far away.
Beehive Barrier  -  Tessellating polygonal shields.
Musical Trigger  -  This song will set off the bomb!
Senior Year Struggles  -  Plots focusing on the last year of high school or college.
Statute Of Limitations  -  A criminal can't be convicted of a crime after a certain time has elapsed.
A Wild Rapper Appears  -  A rapper enters a song and then exits as if he was never there.
Eye Colour Change  -  Eyes change color in response to a significant change.
Beware The Skull Base  -  A hideout or locale in which a skull is heavily tied to the aesthetic or layout.
Jaywalking Will Ruin Your Life  -  Minor crimes can have serious consequences.
Sleeps In The Nude  -  A character who wears nothing when going to sleep.
Red Herring Mole  -  The story leads you to believe a certain character's The Mole... except they actually aren't.
One True Sequence  -  The protagonist and the antagonist always find the MacGuffin at the same time.
Wedding Bells For Someone Else  -  They're getting married! Bait-and-Switch! It turns out they're not bride and groom. They're wedding guests at someone else's wedding.
Hoax Hogan  -  An expy of Hulk Hogan.
Aroused By Their Voice  -  A voice other characters find sexy.
Living Structure Monster  -  When a part of a building, usually a floor, wall or ceiling, is actually a monster.
Our Founder  -  A statue of someone who played an important role in founding something.
Meaningless Villain Victory  -  The Bad Guy Wins, but it's ultimately rendered worthless.
Blind Musician  -  A talented person with a handicap preventing them from seeing what they create.
Knockback Evasion  -  Parrying or cancelling Knockback.
Hopeless With Tech  -  When a character just doesn't get technology or gadgets.
Not Listening To Me Are You  -  Person pretends to listen to your problems, but clearly does not.
Polygon Ceiling  -  Jumping from 2D to 3D, and falling flat.
Open Heart Dentistry  -  A doctor has to perform an operation that's outside of their competence zone.
Subverted Trope  -  A trope is clearly set up to happen, but doesn't.
The Darkness Before Death  -  Upon death of a character, eyesight is among the first senses to go away.
Almighty Idiot  -  An Eldritch Abomination so abominable, it even drove itself insane.
The Obi Wannabe  -  When the Know-Nothing Know-It-All tries to be The Mentor.
The Moving Experience  -  Bob thinks Alice is moving to another city, but she's only moving across the street.
Disc One Nuke  -  Something that allows you to be really powerful in the early stages of the game.
Muggle Power  -  Muggles take a stance on superpowered individuals.
Time Freeze Trolling Spree  -  It's fun to mess with people when you can freeze time around you.
Adaptational Wimp  -  A character is made weaker than in the original.
Cant Catch Up  -  Other good guys don't get stronger like the hero does.
Cross Referenced Titles  -  Two related episodes of a series have titles that match or otherwise reference each other.
Not Worth Killing  -  Killing someone is too petty for the would-be killer.
Out Of The Frying Pan  -  You've escaped a great danger - and found a new great danger.
No Biochemical Barriers  -  They evolved on different worlds, but somehow have the same physiology.
Ascended Fanon  -  Fanon gets officially Canonized later.
Rousseau Was Right  -  People are good (or at least innocent) by default unless environmental influences push them towards evil.
Adaptational Modesty  -  Stripperific character wears less revealing clothing in an adaptation.
Later Installment Weirdness  -  A long running series' more recent updates deviate greatly from its earlier fare.
Compressed Hair  -  A large amount of hair is easily put into a much smaller shape.
Hell Hotel  -  You do NOT want to stay at this hotel!
Animated Credits Opening  -  A live-action series has an animated title sequence.
Code Silver  -  How to add drama to a boring day job? Have someone barge in with a gun and take hostages.
Dateless Grave  -  A gravestone without the dates of birth and death.
Anachronism Stew  -  A work set in a certain time period has elements of other time periods thrown in.
Pass The Popcorn  -  A character reacts to a dramatic event by bringing food to watch it.
Fiery Salamander  -  Reptiles and amphibians (salamanders specifically) Playing with Fire.
Recycled Animation  -  Scenes that are just altered versions of other scenes from older productions by the same studio.
Mac Guffin Person Reveal  -  The MacGuffin has been with you all along... as one of the main characters.
Buddy Cop Show  -  Show about police partners, usually two.
Show Within A Show  -  A program that the characters in-universe are watching.
Fire And Brimstone Hell  -  Hell is portrayed as a fiery place of eternal torment.
Thematic Series  -  A series based on themes and settings, as opposed to a specific narrative.
Featureless Protagonist  -  A Player Character devoid of any prior characterization, to let players project themselves onto them.
Precursors  -  The mysterious culture that came before us.
Rules Of The Road  -  Signs invoke plot.
Creepy Cemetery  -  Unusually scary cemeteries, with ghosts monsters abound.
Why Would Anyone Take Him Back  -  When two characters break up and get back together as per the rules of Status Quo Is God, even though one of them is enough reason why they shouldn't.
Wall Of Text  -  Paragraphs that are WAY too long to read with ease.
Attempted Rape  -  A rapist attempts to rape someone else, but gets violently stopped just in time.
Solitary Sorceress  -  A magical woman of great power that lives deep in the wilderness for the protagonists to seek out.
Friendly Skeleton  -  Dem Bones are benevolent.
Indifferent Beauty  -  A character who's actually fully aware of how beautiful they are—they just don't care.
Robe And Wizard Hat  -  Standard attire for those who specialize in magic.
Screamer Prank  -  Web prank that revolves around disturbing imagery jumping out at you without warning.
Door Slam Of Rage  -  I'm so mad, I'm going to close this door really hard to show it!
Kryptonite Ring  -  A hero entrusts an ally with his only weakness in case he ever goes rogue.
Politically Incorrect Hero  -  A good guy who holds racist, sexist and/or controversial views.
Family Values Villain  -  The villain still has traditional morals like those of a parent.
Last Episode New Character  -  The series is ending. Time to introduce another character!
Uriah Gambit  -  Sending an underling off to fight a hopeless mission solely to get rid of them.
Shark Tunnel  -  An underwater tunnel with transparent walls.
Run For The Border  -  The criminal tries to escape prosecution by fleeing the country.
Evil Is Sexy  -  Other factors being equal, evil characters are sexier.
Old Man Marrying A Child  -  A lawfully Arranged Marriage between an elderly man and a girl, who's usually prepubescent or very young and pubescent.
America Is Still A Colony  -  Alternate Universe where either America lost the Revolutionary War or it never happened.
Official Couple  -  Characters who get together in Canon.
Mechanical Muscles  -  Robots or Artificial Limbs designed to mimic the appearance of a human musculature.
Circling Birdies  -  Either stars or birds pop out whenever mainly cartoon characters get hit on the head.
Preachers Kid  -  A child of a pastor who is either an upright angel or an immoral devil.
Forced Into Evil  -  A character commits evil acts against their will.
Cool Loser  -  What do you mean, "they're not popular"?
Break The Comedian  -  A comedic character loses their sense of humour due to trauma or misery.
Callousness Towards Emergency  -  A character expresses a lack of concern for someone in serious danger.
Sympathy For The Devil  -  Good guy sympathizes with bad guy.
Cleavage Window  -  A hole in a woman's top that accentuates cleavage.
Characterization Marches On  -  Early characterization is inconsistent with later, more defined characterization.
Shadow Dictator  -  A ruler who rarely—if ever—appears in public.
No Hugging No Kissing  -  There is no sexuality or romance in this show.
Affectionate Gesture To The Head  -  Headpats.
Dirt Forcefield  -  Character stays clean even when they get down and dirty.
Shorter Means Smarter  -  The shorter you are, the smarter you must be.
Character Focus  -  The idea of focusing on one character's development at a time.
Achilles Power Cord  -  A device needing a power cord is a major weakness.
You Got Spunk  -  Villain is impressed by a woman who resists him.
Rei Ayanami Expy  -  Character that looks and acts like Neon Genesis Evangelion's Rei Ayanami, and isn't her clone.
Ive Heard Of That What Is It  -  Character declares their knowledge of or excitement about something, only to immediately admit they have no idea what it is.
Debate And Switch  -  Setting up, then subverting, a moral dilemma.
Torture First Ask Questions Later  -  Somebody is busy torturing but forgets to actually ask anything.
Visibility Meter  -  A stealth game interface element that shows how well-hidden you are.
Descent Into Darkness Song  -  A song that starts out pretty but then descends into dark tones.
Warning Song  -  A character/group warns in song-form about a place/character known to be dangerous.
Cross Through  -  A Story Arc that affects multiple different series, but they don't crossover.
In Love With The Gangsters Girl  -  The Love Interest is already involved with someone who's a threat to the protagonist's safety.
Principles Zealot  -  A person who blindly clings to principles, refusing to see the big picture.
Fighting Your Friend  -  Circumstances lead to The Hero having to battle against an ally.
Word Salad Philosophy  -  Insane Troll Logic used as a philosophy.
Designated Parents  -  These people about the same age as their best friends tend to be the maturest.
Rampage From A Nail  -  Someone (usually an animal) rampages because it's experiencing pain or discomfort from a small area.
Terrible Trio  -  Team of three usually ineffective, but comedic villains.
Mirror Match  -  A fight between two of the same character.
Never Be A Hero  -  Anyone else trying to imitate the main character's heroics is treated as a bad thing.
Magazine Decay  -  A magazine moves away from its original concept.
Life Of The Party  -  The "party animal".
Good Needs Evil  -  Evil can bring the best out of the heroes.
Island Of Misfit Everything  -  A place misfits, weirdos and rejects go to call home.
Carpe Diem  -  The Webcomic: A furry, gay soap opera.
You Will Know What To Do  -  The character won't figure out how to fire their Chekhov's Gun until the time comes to fire it.
Ice Breaker  -  The trope: Ice makes objects brittle and fragile.
Vandalism Backfire  -  That stuff you laid waste to? Belongs to someone else. Probably more dangerous than you think.
Could Have Avoided This Plot  -  Characters realize their conflict wouldn't have existed had one of them sought the help of the others.
Nobody Calls Me Chicken  -  Calling someone a coward makes them want to prove their bravery.
Channel Hop  -  A show moves to a different channel.
Too Hot For TV  -  Explicit Content that's barred from TV for being too graphic, but is in home video releases.
Sour Outside Sad Inside  -  Angry on the outside, sad on the inside.
Airplane Of Love  -  An airplane symbolising unrequited love.
Does This Remind You Of Anything  -  Something is suggestive of something else other than what it actually is.
Villainous Rescue  -  Villain saves hero from other villain.
Nazi Gold  -  Wealth historically associated with the Third Reich and on occasion Imperial Japan.
Painted On Pants  -  Skin-tight pants are hot.
Make It Look Like A Struggle  -  Pretending to have been beaten by intruders or escapees to cover up that you're on their side.
Revenge Reveal Story  -  A character seeking revenge tells the victim why he's being targeted.
Happy Place  -  Imaginary space inside your head where everything is well.
Rock Me Asmodeus  -  Rock music is for/by the devil, so it follows that the devil is talented with it.
Parents For A Day  -  One or more characters raises a baby or something similar for the duration of an episode (differs from a Babysitting Episode).
Recursive Precursors  -  The Precursors had their own precursors.
Living Statue  -  A statue that's alive.
Convenient Escape Boat  -  There always seems to be a boat for the characters to use when they need to make a getaway.
Gratuitous Special Effects  -  Special effects in a genre that usually isn't known for them.
I Will Fight Some More Forever  -  Surrendering would be a bad idea, so keep shooting even if it doesn't work.
Prophecy Twist  -  A prophecy technically comes true, but not in the way it seemed like it would.
Quieter Than Silence  -  An otherwise silent scene includes minor ambient noise, because true silence might be mistaken for the sound not working.
Tomorrowland  -  An area with unusually advanced technology.
Funny Schizophrenia  -  Mental disorders played for laughs.
Prophecies Are Always Right  -  Prophecies are always correct, and are neither lies nor jokes.
Trick And Follow Ploy  -  Lead a character to a person, place or object as part of a plan.
Wild Teen Party  -  When their parents are away, teenage characters arrange a secret party which gets out of hand.
Controllable Helplessness  -  You can control the Player Character, but there is nothing they can actually do.
Early Game Hell  -  Lack of resources for the player make the game at its hardest near the start.
Gravity Barrier  -  If it wasn't for gravity, you could get past these boundaries.
Wrong Line Of Work  -  Someone somehow ends up with a job that they are absolutely not qualified for.
My Own Private I Do  -  Let's run away and get married in secret before our Big White Wedding!
Pragmatic Pansexuality  -  A character must/is willing to seduce or sleep with someone whose gender doesn't align with their sexual preference to achieve their goals.
Cartoony Tail  -  Animals with unrealistic tails.
Tears Of Remorse  -  Crying because you feel guilty.
True Meaning Of Christmas  -  This Xmas story has an aesop for the occasion.
Caring Gardener  -  Someone who grows and takes care of plants.
Gullible Lemmings  -  Naive people who believe the Villain with Good Publicity and try to help them with their plans.
Static Stun Gun  -  Weapon that stuns with electricity.
Fast Forward Mechanic  -  The game allows you to fast-forward in time if you want to.
Ha Ha Ha No  -  A character pretends to laugh along with the others, then abruptly tells them to shut up. Alternately, they legitimately find something funny, but get serious about it immediately after.
For Science  -  Pursuing the advancement of knowledge, scientific or not, for itself.
Finishing Move  -  A big, flashy, over-the-top attack used to finish a battle once it's already been won.
Celeb Crush  -  Being in love with a celebrity.
Perfect Play AI  -  Video game opponents programmed to flawlessly counter anything you throw at it as long as you fight fairly.
Million To One Chance  -  Low chance means "Guaranteed."
Deadly Prank  -  A seemingly harmless prank goes horribly wrong.
Survivalist Stash  -  All the tools you'll need in an apocalypse, never put to good use.
The Ingenue  -  Innocent, but may cause trouble.
Chubby Chaser  -  A character who is attracted to fat people.
Telegraph Gag STOP  -  TELEGRAPH MESSAGES CAUSE CONFUSION BY SAYING THE WORD STOP INSTEAD OF PUNCTUATION STOP
Forged By The Gods  -  Weapon created by powerful supernatural forces.
Your Worst Memory  -  The worst moment of your life comes back to haunt you.
Smoking Is Not Cool  -  Smokers are jokers!
Geek Physiques  -  Geeks and nerds are either very thin or very fat, with little or no muscle.
