Doomed By Canon  -  In a prequel, events cannot contradict later installments and therefore seal the fates of certain characters.
Heavy Sleeper  -  Character is VERY HARD to wake up from sleep.
Mister Seahorse  -  A man gets pregnant.
Rip Van Winkle  -  A character sleeps, for any reason, and wakes up to find out he is not in his present.
Improbable Taxonomy Skills  -  The ability to fully classify an organism with just a cursory examination.
Travelling Salesman Montage  -  Montage or someone trying to sell stuff door to door.
Advancing Boss Of Doom  -  When the Advancing Wall of Doom is also a Boss Battle.
Hopeless War  -  An endless bleak war with no hope of victory or survival without ruinous cost.
Creepy Uncle  -  This guy is interested in his niece/nephew in all the wrong ways.
RP Gs Equal Combat  -  You're led to believe there are a variety of different ways to progress, but they all revolve around killing.
Easily Thwarted Alien Invasion  -  Powerful aliens have easily exploitable weakness.
Nice Hat  -  Impressive headgear.
In Prison With The Rogues  -  Prison Episode where The Hero is trapped together with their Rogues Gallery.
Soap Punishment  -  Wash that potty mouth out with soap!
Creepy Twins  -  Twins who talk, walk, and act so much like each other it's creepy.
Not Cheating Unless You Get Caught  -  If you don't get caught, you haven't broken the rules.
Establishing Character Moment  -  Moment during or soon after a character's introduction which illustrates their personality.
Evil Is Not Pacifist  -  Villains are always willing to use violence.
Difficulty By Acceleration  -  Gameplay gradually speeds up.
With My Dying Breath I Summon You  -  The Big Bad is defeated, but they had just enough strength to summon the real Final Boss before they died.
Aliens Steal Cattle  -  Aliens stealing farm animals.
Strawman News Media  -  You cannot trust fictional news sources to give news.
Battle Royale Game  -  A large number of players, often 100 of them, go up against each other. Only one will win.
Youre Drinking Breast Milk  -  Character drinks stored breast milk instead of cow's milk.
It Came From The Fridge  -  A dirty refrigerator creating an unknown life-form or visual gag. It's usually left-overs.
Lives In A Van  -  Living in a motor vehicle.
Promoted To Scapegoat  -  When someone is promoted just to take the blame for a current situation.
Peer Pressure Makes You Evil  -  Going along with the group means you're evil.
Elemental Plane  -  A place that embodies or is made of a specific element or concept.
Nightmare Of Normality  -  An important and/or supernatural character is compelled to believe they are mundane.
Anger Montage  -  A montage of someone blowing their top.
Pseudolympics  -  A version of the Olympic Games with silly, strange or unusual sports.
Cute Mute  -  Cute silent person.
You And What Army  -  THIS Army!
Denouement  -  The climax has passed, and the story is wrapping things up.
Girl Next Door  -  An accessible Nice Girl who is often a Childhood Friend of The Hero.
Situational Damage Attack  -  This attack's damage will vary depending on how you set it up.
Bladder Of Steel  -  You can't save, you can't pause... if you stop playing, you lose.
Goth  -  Eccentric, moody oddballs who tend to wear dark clothes.
Shut Up Gunshot  -  Firing into the air to stop the noisy commotion.
Fantasy Gun Control  -  Fantasy without firearms of any description.
Airborne Mook  -  This enemy can fly. Expect some degree of frustration from it.
Mister Muffykins  -  Annoying little yappy dog.
Outgrown Such Silly Superstitions  -  An advanced civilization has given up religion as backward and primitive, and the author approves.
Hand Or Object Underwear  -  When a naked character covers up.
Deliberate Values Dissonance  -  Morals that modern people don't agree with presented in-universe. Not because the author believes in them, but because the culture being represented in-universe does.
No Port For You  -  A game made exclusively for a particular platform.
Microtransactions  -  Individual, one-off payments for accessing additional content in a game.
Non Protagonist Resolver  -  The Protagonist does not get to resolve the conflict... Mr. Sidelines does.
Obsessively Normal  -  People who value "normalcy" to an extreme.
Heavy Meta  -  A song that's about whatever genre of music it's in.
Terrible Pick Up Lines  -  Cheesy, often ineffective pick-up lines.
This Is A Song  -  A song that is at least partially about itself.
What If God Was One Of Us  -  God is a human living among humans.
Final Solution  -  Genocide to permanently end an enemy threat/group or demographic that is perceived as a threat.
Planet Of Steves  -  Everyone or everything has the same name.
Instantly Proven Wrong  -  A character says something, then immediately something happens to contradict their statement.
Adaptation Displacement  -  The adaptation is more popular/well-known than the original work.
Loser Protagonist  -  A protagonist who is considered a loser by society's standards.
Lightspeed Leapfrog  -  A primitive space vessel is beaten to its destination by a later, more advanced one.
Convenient Questing  -  Your next destination will be the closest area that hasn't been accessible before.
Heavy Metal  -  THE GENRE: The amped-up successor to Rock 'n' Roll.
Theme Tune Roll Call  -  The theme song mentions the names of the work's main characters.
Wrong Side All Along  -  The heroes are revealed to have been unknowingly on the villains side all along.
Plummet Perspective  -  Someone hanging on for dear life drops something, and it is lost to view.
Story Overwrite  -  Cutscene canon trumps gameplay.
Body Wipe  -  Part of someone's body gets so close to the screen it covers it up, before the scene cuts/dissolves to something else.
Electromagnetic Ghosts  -  Paranormal beings like ghosts cause electronic interference.
Haughty Hmph  -  A character grunts with disapproval or contempt.
Hey Lets Put On A Show  -  Characters need some money, so they decide to get money by putting on a play/talent show/etc.
Nubile Savage  -  When a female character from prehistory or from a culture with prehistoric technology is impossibly groomed.
Recycled INSPACE  -  X thing is Y thing WITH A GIMMICK!
Big Brother Is Employing You  -  The main character works for the dystopian government.
Maiden Aunt  -  A parent's sister who (presumably) never married and/or had kids.
Clashing Cousins  -  Cousins who either form a rivalry or dislike each other.
The Pen Is Mightier  -  Writing utensils as weapons.
Mundane Object Amazement  -  A character finds an everyday object amazing.
Creepy Dollhouse  -  Dollhouses are used for creepy or unnerving effect.
Accentuate The Negative  -  Complaining by focusing on and only talking about the negative parts of a subject, excluding all positives.
Sensible Heroes Skimpy Villains  -  Heroes always dress modestly while villains dress in skimpy outfits.
Immigrant Patriotism  -  An immigrant who expresses love for the nation that they currently live in.
Stuffy Old Songs About The Buttocks  -  A song focusing on someone's (usually female) gluteus maximus.
Beta Couple  -  A secondary Official Couple that serves as a companion to the "main" couple.
Nerd Glasses  -  Nerds wear glasses. If you wear glasses, you're a nerd.
Bonus Stage Collectables  -  Optional MacGuffins hidden in Bonus Stages.
Fur Is Skin  -  Animals with fur, feathers, etc., that looks like a human skintone.
Break The Haughty  -  Arrogant character goes through hell.
I Am Not Shazam  -  The title isn't my name.
Devoted To You  -  A character who inspires obsessive devotion in those around them.
Literal Surveillance Bug  -  A spy robot or listening device that looks like a bug or insect.
Pop Punk  -  Punk Rock with mainstream sensibilities.
John Barleycorn And Friends  -  Alcohol, tobacco, and other consumable vices are personified or anthropomorphized.
Elvis Has Left The Planet  -  Conspiracy theory: Elvis isn't dead, he just went to space.
Daylight Horror  -  The sun shines on horror-themed stories.
Lying On A Hillside  -  Good for a moment of peaceful reflection with those close to you
The Lava Caves Of New York  -  In fiction, lava can show up in some unusual places.
Vote Early Vote Often  -  Rigging an election with fraudulent ballots.
Contrasting Sequel Antagonist  -  A villain for a sequel is quite different than the villain for the original.
Flat Earth Atheist  -  In a fantasy setting, something fantastic clearly exists, but this character remains arbitrarily skeptical.
Alternative Character Interpretation  -  Not everyone sees a character the same way.
Church Of Happyology  -  Thinly-veiled mocking of a certain religion/self-help creed made by a certain sci-fi author.
Utility Belt  -  A belt (typically worn around the waist) that a character uses to hold all of their gadgets.
Founding Day  -  Celebrating the founding of a city, state, country, or other geographic region.
Primordial Chaos  -  The (no)thing from which the universe/world/gods/life/reality itself popped up from. Or, at least, came before it.
Digitized Hacker  -  A hacker who has been digitized and can move around the cyberworld without needing to use his computer.
Sleepyhead  -  A chronically drowsy character.
The Woobie  -  You can't help but feel extremely sorry for this character.
Every Car Is A Pinto  -  Hollywood cars catch fire and/or explode when badly damaged.
Ratchet Scrolling  -  The screen scrolls in only one direction and does not allow you to backtrack.
Used To Be A Sweet Kid  -  A villain used to be a friendly, ordinary child before becoming evil.
Drill Tank  -  Tank Goodness meets This Is a Drill.
To Hell With This Infernal Job  -  I quit, says Satan. Then he leaves.
Girls Love Chocolate  -  Exactly what it says on the box of chocolates: the girl craves the stuff!
The Ladette  -  Woman with traditionally boorish manly interests and habits.
Eskimos Arent Real  -  Not believing a demonstrably real thing exists.
Stringy Haired Ghost Girl  -  Vengeful Ghosts of Asian folklore; commonly portrayed as girls dressed in white with stringy black hair.
Young And In Charge  -  A very young person in a leadership position.
Lost In A Crowd  -  Congregate with people similar to you, to hide.
Character Depth  -  The measure of what fleshes out a character.
Indulgent Fantasy Segue  -  Holy shi— Did that just actually happen?! ...Oh, wait. Never mind. The character was just having an Imagine Spot.
Undead Barefooter  -  Undead characters or creatures with no footwear.
Boring Return Journey  -  The trip back to the origin pales in comparison to the adventure it took to get to the destination.
Get On The Boat  -  The player has to move on to the next area because there's nothing left to do where they are.
Non Ironic Clown  -  A clown that actually acts like a clown.
You Are Number Six  -  A character's name is a number.
Holiday Pardon  -  Someone escapes punishment or is forgiven for past wrongdoings because it's the holidays.
Disaster Democracy  -  Societal collapse leads the survivors to rally under a new democracy.
She Cleans Up Nicely  -  A shower, some fabulous new clothes, dental work, and makeup, and they're beautiful!
Killer Gorilla  -  Dangerous gorillas and other large apes.
Tears Of Fear  -  Crying out of being completely terrified.
Crapsaccharine World  -  A Crapsack World disguised as a Sugar Bowl.
Overly Long Tongue  -  A tongue that is not the average length of a normal tongue.
Dreaming The Truth  -  Someone goes to sleep and realizes something from a dream they had.
Ridiculously Average Guy  -  The Protagonist is considered remarkably unremarkable.
Lily Pad Platform  -  Lily pads as Improvised Platforms.
Wager Slave  -  Penalty for a bet is that the loser has to do whatever the winner says.
Camera Abuse  -  Shattering the viewers' camera lens either for humor or adding tension.
Depending On The Writer  -  Characterization depends entirely on the current author.
Halloween Cosplay  -  Rather than just making a generic costume, a character cosplays on Halloween.
Fix Fic  -  Fanfic authors change canon elements that they don't like.
Private Profit Prison  -  Jails controlled by private entities for profit.
Big Thin Short Trio  -  A trio consisting of a big (either in height or body weight), a thin and a short character.
Defence Mechanism Superpower  -  A superpower that activates and/or acts on its own, only when its bearer is threatened in some manner.
Awesomeness Meter  -  The bigger the spectacle, the better.
Can Crushing Cranium  -  Crushing a can of beer or soda with your forehead.
The Illegible  -  A character who writes in a way only they can understand.
Hot Witch  -  A witch that can cast a spell on you without magic through the power of SEXINESS!
Unwitting Pawn  -  Character doesn't realize he's furthering someone else's goal.
Macross Missile Massacre  -  Many missiles fired.
Slave To PR  -  Has a reputation to uphold no matter what.
The War Sequence  -  Mook-to-hero ratio is a thousand to one. Time to go to work.
Love Father Love Son  -  A character falls in love with the child (or descendant) of their former Love Interest.
Kindhearted Simpleton  -  Stupid, but nice.
Embodiment Of Virtue  -  Somebody who has a positive quality assigned to them as a trait.
Stolen Mac Guffin Reveal  -  The villain seems to have gotten away the MacGuffin... only for a hero to reveal that they stole it back before they could.
Alliterative Title  -  A title which has more than one word and all the words begin with the same phonetic sound.
Action Bomb  -  An enemy that blows itself up as an attack.
Where Da White Women At  -  African man / Caucasian woman couples are taboo (still....).
I Need A Freaking Drink  -  Booze. Pronto.
Opt Out  -  A character gives up and leaves the story altogether out of principle.
Alternate World Map  -  More than one map, more than one world.
Braces Of Orthodontic Overkill  -  Braces are always ugly and unwieldy.
Everybody Wants The Hermaphrodite  -  Intersex people have something to offer to any gender preference, so they have the most admirers.
Kids Prefer Boxes  -  A character ignores a toy/valuable item and prefers the box it came in.
Child Hater  -  Someone who dislikes children.
Wax On Wax Off  -  Special training through menial work.
Fictional Social Network  -  A social network in a show that doesn't exist in Real Life, and may or may not be a parody of a real one.
Ordered To Die  -  Someone is commanded to kill themselves as a punishment or a demonstration of obedience.
Doing In The Wizard  -  Magic is Retconned as being science.
Limey Goes To Hollywood  -  The tendency of British artists to develop a career in the USA.
God Emperor  -  The ruler, depicted as a deity.
Surprise Incest  -  Two people find out that they're blood-related after they had sex or made out with each other.
Power Creep Power Seep  -  Crossover stories that require the power levels of otherwise incompatible works to be rebalanced in a way that allows characters from both works to function effectively in the new setting.
Last Minute Hookup  -  Cleaning Up Romantic Loose Ends during the last episode.
Conveniently Coherent Thoughts  -  A telepath can read thoughts in the from of precise, coherent, relevant sentences.
The Other Darrin  -  An actor is replaced by another actor in the same role.
Star Crossed Lovers  -  Lovers doomed to be kept apart.
Ass Pull  -  When an author invokes a new plot twist without properly foreshadowing it.
Fake Balance  -  Theoretically balanced game mechanics fail in practice.
Break The Scientist  -  A person (often a scientist) sees something that utterly disproves the way they understand the world works, or their view of history.
Important Haircut  -  New hair, new me.
Monstrous Cannibalism  -  Animalistic monsters eating each other, demonstrating their savagery.
Satisfied Street Rat  -  An orphaned kid who has turned living on the street to their advantage.
Must Make Her Laugh  -  The Plucky Comic Relief tries to make the Emotionless Girl laugh.
Involuntary Shapeshifting  -  Shapeshifter can't control when/where their transformations take place.
Upper Class Twit  -  The idiot offspring of the rich.
Phone Trace Race  -  The police can trace the call, but only if they can keep the criminal talking long enough. Good luck with that.
Not Like Other Girls  -  A character tells a girl that she's not like other girls, without realising the implications of this.
Hollywood Fire  -  Has far less heat and smoke than real life fires do.
Sleep Squashing  -  A big character ends up rolling on and squashing someone smaller while sleeping.
The Dinosaurs Had It Coming  -  The dinosaurs suffered a Karmic Death.
I Knew There Was Something About You  -  Someone has their (sometimes vague) suspicions about another character validated.
America Saves The Day  -  Americans are The Cavalry.
Hot Blooded  -  I go about my life with BURNING PASSION!
Tastes Like Friendship  -  Have some food. We are now friends.
Evil Puppeteer  -  A puppeteer/ventriloquist portrayed as villainous, creepy, or otherwise untrustworthy.
Howard Hughes Homage  -  Characters heavily based by Howard Hughes.
Aliens Love Human Food  -  Aliens come to Earth for its cuisine.
Happily Failed Suicide  -  A failed attempt to commit suicide causes the character to become happy.
Complete Monster  -  The most heinous characters, played seriously with no redeeming or altruistic qualities, with crimes that set them apart from standard villains of the setting.
And Your Reward Is Interior Decorating  -  Some furniture as a reward.
Forgotten Friend New Foe  -  The hero is unaware their new enemy was an old acquaintance.
Ouroboros  -  The symbol of a snake (or two snakes) eating its own tail, representing the Infinite.
Silent Scapegoat  -  A character voluntarily takes all blame to save others, and no one else knows it.
Graceful Ladies Like Purple  -  A character shows her femininity/gracefulness by wearing purple.
Possessive Paradise  -  This place doesn't want you to leave.
Fumbling The Gauntlet  -  An unintentional challenge to fight.
Boxing Lessons For Superman  -  A Differently Powered Individual learns Muggle techniques to improve their abilities.
Protagonist Title Fallacy  -  The false assumption that if the work is titled X, X is the protagonist.
Aluminum Christmas Trees  -  Sounds fictional, but does (or at least did) actually exist.
Starbucks Skin Scale  -  Skin colors are described via coffee metaphors.
I Like Those Odds  -  Being at a numerical, tactical, or strategical disadvantage is not a downside according to this person.
Culture Police  -  Censors who stomp out any art they deem "abnormal" to their values.
Endless Corridor  -  A really, really, really long hallway.
Disability Immunity  -  When a threat affects the sense you're missing, it doesn't affect you at all.
Gold And White Are Divine  -  Gold and White are considered divine colors and typically used by the Big Good.
Feed It With Fire  -  Your attacks make the monster stronger.
The Only Way They Will Learn  -  You'll have to learn the answers on your own.
Talking To The Dead  -  A one-sided conversation with a deceased love one, often at the site of their grave.
Undercover As Lovers  -  Two characters pretend to be in a relationship, for whatever reason.
White Void Room  -  In this room, there is nothing. Just white.
Teamwork Seduction  -  Working together to seduce another person.
Gender Restricted Ability  -  Only men, or else only women, can use the Applied Phlebotinum or a particularly special technique.
Politically Active Princess  -  A princess who involves herself in the affairs of the state.
Dreadful Musician  -  The way they play their instrument is so bad it's painful.
Goth Girls Know Magic  -  The tendency for a Goth girl to have magical powers.
Holding Hands  -  Holding hands as a gesture of closeness, be it platonic or romantic.
Gotta Catch Them All  -  Your objective: Collect all the Plot Coupons.
Improbably High IQ  -  A character's intelligence is shown by their ridiculously high IQ.
Loudness War  -  Dynamic range compression being used to make a song sound louder, capitalizing on the idea that "louder is better".
Super Bowl Special  -  The Super Bowl is the most-viewed TV program every year in the US, so companies bring out their best, most budget-breaking commercials for use in Super Bowl commercial breaks.
Savvy Guy Energetic Girl  -  In this pair, he's pragmatic; she's genki.
Plot  -  A series of connected events that make the story.
Obviously Not Fine  -  They say they're fine... but they're not.
Tuneless Song Of Madness  -  Singing as a sign of insanity in a non-musical work.
Lodged Blade Recycling  -  Pulling the weapon that you were stabbed with out of your body and using it to fight back.
Ban On Magic  -  Magic and other archaic practices are made illegal by the state.
Banned Episode  -  An already-aired episode that's pulled from syndication due to offensive content, legal issues, distancing from current events (and forgetting to bring it back once the event is no longer current) or issues over copyright.
I Am Big Boned  -  Don't call me fat.
Singing Telegram  -  A messenger that sings the message to you.
Resurrective Immortality  -  This person can be killed — but they'll just come straight back to life.
Body In A Breadbox  -  A dead body is found in a highly unusual place.
Too Incompetent To Operate A Blanket  -  Ads featuring new & improved products for morons who can't use the normal products.
Trail Of Bread Crumbs  -  Someone leaves behind a trail of small objects so they won't get lost. Sometimes it goes missing, and the character does get lost.
Running Gag Stumbles  -  A Running Gag is subverted.
With A Foot On The Bus  -  Everything is set for a character to leave the show. At the last moment, they do not.
Villain Has A Point  -  The villain isn't really wrong about their statement.
Reconcile The Bitter Foes  -  A third party mediates a peaceful resolution to an ancient armed conflict.
Klingons Love Shakespeare  -  Aliens and other sapient nonhumans love a specific facet of human culture.
Dreaming Of Times Gone By  -  Someone has a dream or sees a vision of a memory from their past.
Flock Of Wolves  -  A group's infiltrators outnumber its actual members.
Stalker With A Crush  -  Character has an unhealthy obsession with following or spying on the person they're attracted to.
Sliding Scale Of Realistic Versus Fantastic  -  Is this the real life? Is this just fantasy? Caught in a troped slide Of resembling reality...
Inn Security  -  Something bad happens to your Player Character while asleep at an inn.
Weaker Twin Saves The Day  -  Second twin replaces first twin as leader.
Lecherous Stepparent  -  A stepparent who makes sexual advances towards their stepchild.
Once Is Not Enough  -  The hero KO's the villain, then chooses to flee instead of finishing him off.
Dinosaurs Are Dragons  -  Why the hell is that T-Rex breathing fire?
Go To Sleep Ending  -  The story ends with the characters hitting the hay.
Working Class People Are Morons  -  Poor people are dumb, but good.
Long Lost Uncle Aesop  -  Character exists only to give An Aesop.
Hype Backlash  -  This wasn't nearly as good as everyone says.
Shouting Shooter  -  Character yells a lot while firing a weapon.
Misfit Mobilization Moment  -  When the dysfunctional misfits stop being dysfunctional misfits. A scene ensues that shows them preparing for action.
Human Weapon  -  A normal person given special abilities by authority to be weaponized.
Viral Unlockable  -  Unlockable Content you get by playing with someone who already has it.
Transformation Fiction  -  A genre of fiction that involves someone or something transforming into something else.
School Uniforms Are The New Black  -  Wearing your school uniform in any situation— even if it's not school-related.
Go To The Euphemism  -  Euphemisms for taking a bathroom break.
Constantly Curious  -  A young child who asks a lot of questions.
The Cheerleader  -  Cheerleaders are portrayed as stupid and/or mean.
Time Dissonance  -  One's sense of the passage of time can be influenced and disrupted by emotion.
Ham And Cheese  -  Intentional overacting in (perceived) bad movie.
Brainy Baby  -  How the TV Genius started life.
Karakasa  -  Japanese one-eyed, one-legged umbrella creature.
Rap Metal  -  Metal genres that are influenced musically by hip hop and/or having rapped vocals.
Jackass Genie  -  A wish-granting entity deliberately misinterprets the contents of the wish to the detriment of the wisher.
Hyper Destructive Bouncing Ball  -  A small bouncing ball causes a disproportionate amount of damage.
The Wise Prince  -  A ruler who is worthy of their title and also very troubled.
Suicide Dare  -  Telling people to kill themselves.
Violent Glaswegian  -  Ay, Scotsmen with Hair Trigger Tempers.
Sound Coded For Your Convenience  -  Sounds that provide useful information during gameplay.
Really Royalty Reveal  -  A character previously thought to be relatively ordinary is revealed to be descended from someone important and powerful.
Belated Love Epiphany  -  Realizing you love someone only after you can't be with them anymore.
Nanomachines  -  Microscopic robots.
Super Weapon Average Joe  -  A relatively normal weak or normal character is made quite powerful through a weapon or piece of equipment.
Neat Freak  -  This character demands cleanliness.
Just You And Me And My GUARDS  -  Character refuses to fight one-on-one and calls for backup.
Worst Whatever Ever  -  Worst Stock Phrase used to express extreme contempt for something ever!
Original Generation  -  New characters introduced in a Crossover who don't belong to any of the original series.
Caustic Critic  -  Abrasive, scathing criticism, for your pleasure.
You Can See Me  -  People that can see things others can't see were here all along.
Autosave  -  Your progress is automatically saved at certain points in the game.
Sense Loss Sadness  -  Emotional numbness from physical numbness.
Grunge  -  Hardcore Punk + Sludge Metal = The 1990's signature-style of Alternative Rock
Fight For The Last Bite  -  Characters compete for the last bit of food.
Mysterious Informant  -  Some shady, creepy guy/girl who tells you things you should know.
Dance Of Romance  -  A couple shares a romantic dance.
Science Fiction  -  Fiction with a scientific aesthetic.
Comeback Tomorrow  -  A retort comes to mind too late.
Freudian Excuse  -  A traumatic incident in a villain's childhood or youth that makes them the way they are.
Hand Wave  -  When the creator(s) shrugs off a plot hole or mistake with minimal explanation.
Killing Your Alternate Self  -  Through time travel, cloning, an alternate universe, or some other nonsense you kill your alternate self (or is it suicide?)
Power Up  -  A special collectable in video games that grants the user a positive benefit.
They Wasted A Perfectly Good Line Art  -  Good drawing, bad coloring.
Like You Were Dying  -  A character radically changes their behavior because they're about to die.
Third Option Adaptation  -  In the source materials A option or B option is picked, but the adapters pick C option.
In Defence Of Story Telling  -  The moral of the story: Telling stories makes life better.
Dramatic Reading  -  Any form of writ can be made awesome with OVER-THE-TOP NARRATION, no matter how insipid the text may be.
Double Reverse Quadruple Agent  -  A character with way too many concurrent allegiances to opposing factions.
Technopath  -  This character can control and/or talk to machines.
Instant Dogend  -  a character's cigarette is always bent
Creator Provincialism  -  If the creator lives in X, the setting in the work they created will be X.
The Power Of Lust  -  Sex or sexuality empowers or inspires someone to succeed.
Oscar Bait  -  A work designed to cater to those who assign awards, often by having a dramatic, heartwarming story about either a historical figure or a marginalized person.
Final Boss Preview  -  That Hopeless Boss Fight in the prologue? That's the game's Final Boss.
Kill The Ones You Love  -  You and your friend are True Companions. You would die for each other. And you end up having to kill them.
Helmets Are Hardly Heroic  -  Important characters rarely wear a helmet in combat.
Beam Me Up Scotty  -  A line attributed to a character which they never really said.
Cutting The Knot  -  Solving or bypassing a puzzle with brute force.
Alien Non Interference Clause  -  An advanced civilization strictly forbids itself from interfering with primitive ones to avoid harming them.
Technical Death Metal  -  Death Metal with highly intricate and complex songwriting.
Insufferable Genius  -  They are very intelligent and by God they'll make sure you know about it.
Impending Doom POV  -  The audience can see through the eye(s) of whatever's trying to find and kill The Hero.
Punch Packing Pistol  -  Handguns doing more damage than they should for the sake of balance.
Caffeine Failure  -  Caffeine won't always prevent you from falling asleep.
Womens Mysteries  -  How to handle menstruation, and maybe also how to do magic.
Bad Boss  -  A villain who abuses his/her minions.
Fantasy Pantheon  -  The writers invent fictional deities to populate their world.
American Title  -  Titles with "America" or "American" in them.
Abusive Advertising  -  Ads that claim they will punish anyone who doesn't buy their product.
Techno Dystopia  -  A futuristic utopia is actually a hell-scape perpetuated by destructive and/or corruptive technology.
Fun With Subtitles  -  Subtitles being used in a humorous way.
Playing Their Own Twin  -  Twins are played by the same actors.
Major Injury Underreaction  -  Belittling a normally serious wound.
Not Good With People  -  A character can't really relate to other people, but can relate with animals and nature.
Random Power Ranking  -  When Power Levels are particularly simplistic, vague, and/or meaningless, or are not directly tied to whatever they measure (I.e. if your "power level" was a number that was how well you placed in a tournament).
Relationship Salvaging Disaster  -  A catastrophe convinces two estranged characters to kiss and make up.
Couple Bomb  -  Real couples playing fictional couples works less well than you'd expect.
Unable To Support A Wife  -  A man and woman are unable to marry for the lack of money.
The Dragonslayer  -  A character Famed in Story for killing dragons, or who is a specialist at dragon slaying.
Mary Sue Classic  -  Everything about her (including her life) is perfect and everyone knows it (which may or may not include herself) and usually has a super hot guy Love Interest who loves her back.
Living Weapon  -  A Weapon of Choice that's also a living being.
Improbable Weapon User  -  This character's Weapon of Choice is usually an Improvised Weapon.
Mighty Glacier  -  Strong, but slow.
Boy Band  -  A music group of adolescent boys who have lots of fangirls and can sing.
Incurable Cough Of Death  -  Who coughs, dies.
Green Aesop  -  Environmental-based moral.
Surprise Creepy  -  Starts off cute and adorable, then it becomes scary and macabre.
Special Edition Title  -  A TV show jazzes up its Title Sequence for a special occasion.
Joker Jury  -  Hero, you are charged with not being a Card-Carrying Villain.
Make Sure Hes Dead  -  Taking extra precautions to confirm someone is 100% deceased.
Cosmetic Catastrophe  -  A girl experiments with makeup for the first time, with negative consequences.
Skill Gate Characters  -  A character who's easy to use for a newbie, but also easily defeated by a more experienced player.
Super OCD  -  A person obsessed with order, symmetry and following certain patterns of behaviour.
Hourglass Plot  -  A plot where two characters switch roles by the end of it.
Mortons Fork  -  Damned if you do, damned if you don't.
Panspermia  -  Life didn't form on Earth; it immigrated.
Auteur License  -  A creator gets to make his work however he wants.
Up Through The Ranks  -  Veteran enlisted soldier is made a commissioned officer.
Twinking  -  Utilizing high-level characters so low-level characters can deliberately mooch off their efforts.
Confusing Multiple Negatives  -  A character uses a confusing series of negatives when talking.
Evil Is Angular  -  Given two designs, the one with less curves and more edges and angles belongs to the one with the blacker morality.
Supernatural Team  -  A Super Team that specializes in magic and the supernatural in a Fantasy Kitchen Sink world.
Somewhere An Entomologist Is Crying  -  Factual inaccuracies about land-based arthropods (insects and arachnids) in a work of fiction, usually because they make the story work better.
Divorce Requires Death  -  Violent enforcement of "...'til death do us part."
Freaky Fashion Mild Mind  -  Dresses scary, is nice.
We Used To Be Friends  -  Close friends or allies have a falling out and/or become Arch Enemies.
Creepy Centipedes  -  Centipedes, caterpillars, or similar invertebrates are portrayed as frightening.
Dragon Knight  -  A knight with a dragonlike apperance and/or powers.
Reset Button Suicide Mission  -  Performing a Heroic Sacrifice while knowing it will be undone.
Creepy Circus Music  -  Circus music slowed down, played in a minor key, or otherwise distorted to sound creepy or sad.
Ass In Ambassador  -  Asshole ambassador.
Caligulas Horse  -  Animals appointed into positions of power by The Caligula.
Land Of Faerie  -  The home of the Fair Folk.
Earth Drift  -  A setting becomes less similar to real life Earth than it was at the start.
Shock Party  -  A Surprise Party Gone Horribly Wrong.
Overshadowed By Awesome  -  They're not weak, but the other characters are so powerful they seem that way.
Girl Posse  -  An Alpha Bitch who has a group of female friends.
HP To One  -  Attack reduces target's health to the absolute minimum.
Shy Bladder  -  A (usually shy) character cannot pee in the company of others.
What The Hell Player  -  The game calls you out for being an asshole or performing a rather idiotic act.
Graceful Loser  -  A character (often a villain) is defeated but instead of ranting and raging around, takes the loss with dignity.
Bonding Over Missing Parents  -  Two characters share a bond due to them both having missing relatives.
Bring The Anchor Along  -  Tied to a heavy object? Why untie it when you can bring it with you?
His Name Is  -  Character about to reveal critical information is interrupted.
Gallows Humor  -  Character prefers to joke rather than be traumatized.
Dangerously Short Skirt  -  Proof that short skirts don't hamper one's ability to kick ass.
Stock Sitcom Grand Finale  -  A sitcom ends with the main cast gathering in a hangout and reminisce about all the good times they've had over the years, perhaps before their group is about to be split up.
Abandoned Hospital Awakening  -  When a character wakes up in deserted medical facility, typically without knowing why.
All Take And No Give  -  A parasitic lifestyle where one member of a relationship receives benefits from the other without providing anything in return.
Book Safe  -  Hollow book containing an object, usually a gun.
Ripped From The Headlines  -  A recent or ongoing news story is the basis for the plot.
I Cant Believe Its Not Heroin  -  A mundane substance gets someone high.
Outside The Box Tactic  -  Overlooked strategy easily thwarts enemy.
Fake Loud  -  Sounds distorted to convey loudness without actually being loud.
Achievements In Ignorance  -  A character accomplishes an Impossible Task because they didn't know it was impossible.
They Wasted A Perfectly Good Sandwich  -  Characters get their food but never eat it.
Climactic Elevator Ride  -  Tense elevator ride before a confrontation.
Written By Cast Member  -  A work written by a cast member.
Karma Meter  -  Measuring whether you're a Hero or Villain by forced decisions.
Hollywood Satanism  -  The stock media portrayal of Satanism as a Religion of Evil.
Luck Manipulation Mechanic  -  Game mechanics that allow you to influence mostly random elements for a more favorable result.
Awesomeness Induced Amnesia  -  Someone does something awesome but just forgot about it.
Boss Button  -  Press button, hide game from boss at work.
Twin Desynch  -  When estrangement makes twins stop looking alike.
Cool Sword  -  A sword that has a really cool/special trait.
Seemingly Wholesome Fifties Girl  -  Innocent 1950s girl by day, shocking 'bad girl' by night.
Beware Of Hitchhiking Ghosts  -  A hitchhiking ghost who loves to hitchhike.
Appease The Volcano God  -  A virgin is thrown into a volcano to appease the volcano god.
Hologram Projection Imperfection  -  Something is off about the hologram(s).
The Gloves Come Off  -  Deciding not to hold back one bit when defeating the enemy has become priority number one.
Kicking Ass In All Her Finery  -  She'll kick your ass without even taking off her Pimped-Out Dress.
How Dad Met Mom  -  A story within the story detailing how a character's parents met, usually from the perspective of one of the parents.
God Is Evil  -  The Top God is actively malevolent.
Freelook Button  -  Function that switches between controlling player movement and controlling the camera angle.
First Name Basis  -  Addressing others by just their first name.
Bright Castle  -  Just a stereotypical fairytale castle...
Evil Cannot Stand Cuteness  -  Villains hate Rule of Cute.
Horror Hippies  -  Not all Hippies are peace loving. Some are Ax-Crazy.
You Meddling Kids  -  It's acknowledged that the villain would have gotten away with the crime if it hadn't been for those meddling kids.
The Aggressive Drug Dealer  -  This dealer wants to hook you on drugs for the sake of it, rather than money.
Sackhead Slasher  -  A Slasher Film killer wears a burlap sack over his head.
Psycho Supporter  -  Madman who follows anothers beliefs.
Untrusting Community  -  No one in this town likes you.
Mainstream Obscurity  -  A work known mostly through Pop-Cultural Osmosis rather than people experiencing it directly.
The Good Kingdom  -  The realm of a good monarch.
Fembot  -  Feminine robots.
Boyish Short Hair  -  Short hair on a girl indicates tomboyishness.
Kill Me Now Or Forever Stay Your Hand  -  Daring someone to kill you, so that they won't.
Ancestral Weapon  -  A weapon of some history and/or which was passed down several generations (or a single generation) before reaching the hero.
That Poor Cat  -  A random, offscreen cat screeching noise accompanying an accident.
The Diaper Change  -  Changing a baby's diaper.
Safe Word  -  When the word "no" can be Played for Laughs or Played for Drama, the word "Red" does mean "no" for real.
Multiple Game Openings  -  Depending on your choices before the actual gameplay starts (e.g. character or class), you play through different first levels.
Magical Antibiotics  -  Antibiotics as a first-resort treatment for any kind of disease.
Million Mook March  -  Displaying all of your giant army in one march.
I Have No Idea What Im Doing  -  Whatever you're doing, it's working. If only you knew what you're doing to do it.
Fastest Thing Alive  -  Faster than everyone else.
Evidence Scavenger Hunt  -  The part of an investigation where the protagonists look for evidence.
Painting The Frost On Windows  -  Scenic nature is someone's job.
Robot Buddy  -  A supporting character who is an artificially intelligent robot.
Newhart Phonecall  -  A phone call where only one side of the conversation is heard.
Magnum Opus Dissonance  -  Creator and audience disagree on what's the former's best work.
Master Of One Magic  -  They're the best at a type of magic (or something close enough).
Ontological Mystery  -  Where are we? And why?
Underequipped Charge  -  A fearless character charges an overpowering enemy even without an appropriate weapon.
Seven Heavenly Virtues  -  Anime: Seven Archangels try to find the Messiah.
Powerup Full Color Change  -  New colour equals new powers.
White And Red And Eerie All Over  -  White with red accents as an uncanny/creepy color scheme.
Obfuscating Stupidity  -  Smart enough to intentionally act dumb.
The Black Death  -  The Bubonic Plague and the horrifying presence it had in Europe starting with the deadly mid-14th century pandemic.
Must Have Caffeine  -  Addiction to beverages containing high levels of caffeine.
Decision Darts  -  This is a *throws dart* trope about making *throws dart* decisions with a *throws dart* dartboard.
Chiaroscuro  -  One bright light source leaves everything else in shadow.
Gratuitous Nazis  -  Instant Evil: Just Add Nazis!
Guttural Growler  -  Character's voice is coarse and / or raspy.
Foreign Remake  -  A remake of a foreign work.
Unreadably Fast Text  -  Blinkandyou'llmissi-
Dimensional Cutter  -  Interdimensional Travel Device in form of a blade or other sharp object.
Actually Pretty Funny  -  Begrudgingly admitting that something is funny.
A Cat In A Gang Of Dogs  -  The feline is the Token Minority in the canine pack.
Pregnancy Test Plot  -  A plot that involves a woman becoming or believing that she is pregnant through the use of a pregnancy test stick.
Yellowface  -  White people pretending to be Asian.
Elemental Crafting  -  An item's strength comes solely from the material it's made of.
The Metric System Is Here To Stay  -  The metric system will replace conventional units of measurement in the future.
Connected All Along  -  Two or more characters turn out to have crossed paths with each other, met, or are otherwise connected.
Coming Of Age Story  -  Main character matures into adulthood throughout story.
Token Minority Couple  -  Pair the non-whites!!
Horrible Hollywood  -  The dark side of the entertainment industry and everyone in it, writ large.
Dramatic Red Samurai Background  -  A battle or a killing stroke emphasized by a blood red backdrop and monochrome silhouettes, especially as a shout out to samurai duels.
I Taste Delicious  -  -Lick- Hey! I taste great!
Maintain The Lie  -  The Hero recruits his friends to set his Blatant Lies into action to please someone else.
Embarrassing Initials  -  The acronym of someone's name or organization spells out something silly or absurd.
Not The Fall That Kills You  -  You can survive any fall as long as you don't hit the ground.
The Immodest Orgasm  -  You can hear them coming from a mile off.
A Good Way To Die  -  A character dies, but in exactly the way they wanted.
Mecha Expansion Pack  -  A Humongous Mecha gets upgraded through add-ons instead of a full replacement.
Starting A New Life  -  A character makes a fresh start, possibly with a new identity.
Arbitrary Maximum Range  -  When projectiles mysteriously cease to exist upon reaching a certain distance.
Silence Is Golden  -  Intentionally leaving out the sound for artistic effect.
To Make A Long Story Short  -  An overly long explanation is cut short, and shortened to just a couple of words.
Reunion Vow  -  Two people about to be parted indefinitely promise to see each other again one day in spite of the odds.
Spoiler Cover  -  A work's cover spoilers a major plot point.
Exposition Cut  -  Cutting to after the explanation.
Oh No Not Again  -  A character exclaims "Oh no, not again!" (or something substantively similar) in response to something very strange or unusual that one wouldn't expect to have ever happened before.
Pupating Peril  -  Something very nasty is due to emerge from this cocoon...
End Of The World Special  -  A character is given the power to recreate the whole world.
Suspiciously Clean Criminal Record  -  A character's criminal record is too small or nonexistent for them to be guilty of the massive crime they have been arrested for. Suspicious.
Clear My Name  -  The innocent protagonist has been charged with a crime and has to prove their innocence.
Brain Critical Mass  -  Smarts make you psychic.
Big Friendly Dog  -  A big, friendly dog.
A Fool For A Client  -  A character chooses to go to court representing himself.
Every Year They Fizzle Out  -  A strong and popular team or player that is expected to do great things, but always falls short.
Mental Time Travel  -  Your mind travels through time and inhabits your younger self's — or someone else's — brain.
If It Was Funny The First Time  -  A joke that gets reused frequently with no changes.
Sex By Proxy  -  A third person is involved in sexual intercourse without being physically there.
Bad Cop Incompetent Cop  -  Cops are a combination of corrupt assholes and useless idiots.
Predators Are Mean  -  Carnivorous animals tend to be villainous much more often than herbivores in fiction.
Portent Of Doom  -  An omen of ill-fate.
National Anthem  -  The Theme Song of a nation.
Fictional United Nations  -  A formal international diplomatic structure that mediates between nations.
Crunchtastic  -  I made up a word to describe my product so that no one can contradict me!
Mechanical Evolution  -  Machines make themselves better over time.
Functional Addict  -  Their addiction does not completely ruin their lives.
My Horse Is A Motorbike  -  Motorcycles are the modern version of horses.
Kewpie Doll Surprise  -  Anime girls pose the "Y" with their arms when excited.note No, they don't follow up with "M-C-A".
Delirious Misidentification  -  A dying, sick, or otherwise compromised character mistakes a person for someone else.
Smart Animal Inconvenient Instincts  -  An animal may be able to think like a human but still obeys his most basic instinct.
The Stars Are Going Out  -  Stars vanish from the sky.
Gambit Roulette  -  Plan that hinges on unpredictable factors succeeds.
Ruritania  -  Generic fictional Eastern European country.
Flight Strength Heart  -  Useful Combo Platter Powers served with a side of not-so-useful ones.
Developers Room  -  A room with members of the development team and other in-jokes.
Never Trust A Hair Tonic  -  Hair tonic does anything except what it's supposed to.
Exposition Of Immortality  -  He's seven hundred years old. Here's the birth certificate, property deeds and photographs of the last four generations of his 'ancestors' to prove it.
Supporting Protagonist  -  The hero and/or protagonist is not actually the focus of the story.
Doom Magnet  -  Anyone who gets close to him is doomed.
Equal Opportunity Offender  -  Someone that just loves insulting people, with no specific preferences.
Surprise Difficulty  -  Cute and kiddy ≠ Easy.
Alliance Meter  -  A visual indicator of your reputation with a particular faction.
Hand Gagging  -  Silencing someone by putting a hand over their mouth.
Chekhovs Hobby  -  A character is said to possess an irrelevant skill early on, and that skill becomes useful later.
Arms And Armor Theme Naming  -  Things are named after weapons and armor.
Compressed Adaptation  -  To squeeze a long story into a small time-slot, some things have got to go.
Fake Aristocrat  -  Someone posing as a member of high society.
Plot Sensitive Button  -  One button that does something different each press, depending on the situation.
And Im The Queen Of Sheba  -  If youre X, then Im Y! (Which I know Im not.)
Sexy Discretion Shot  -  Off-screen sex in many subtle ways.
Super Gender Bender  -  Getting superpowers causes you to change genders.
Shamu Fu  -  Fish slap! *POW!*
Extraverted Nerd  -  Nerd who is in denial of how unpopular he is.
Satellite Character  -  A character whose entire role is based around another character.
Love At First Punch  -  Romance emerging from combat.
Aesop Enforcer  -  A character who inflicts a change in another character in order for them to learn An Aesop.
Hub City  -  The most relevant and in some cases only settlement in the story.
The Chosen Zero  -  The Chosen One is a loser.
Stupid Good  -  A character is so (ostensibly) good that it works against them.
Jerkass At Your Discretion  -  Someone who pretends to be nice when a certain person/group of people are around, but act mean when they leave.
Cross Player  -  People who like roleplaying as the opposite sex.
Unwanted Revival  -  I liked it better when I was dead.
Cape Snag  -  Capes are a liability for hero and villain.
Cut Himself Shaving  -  An unlikely and/or ridiculous excuse for a wound.
Smith Of The Yard  -  A detective who is a famous face in-universe.
Grotesque Cute  -  Rule of Cute meets Gorn.
Exploited Trope  -  A character is aware of a trope and tries to take advantage of it.
Lizard Folk  -  Humanoid reptiles.
Trope Telegraphing  -  I know exactly what will happen next because of this trope.
Magic Is A Monster Magnet  -  Using magic or other powers draws the attention of Bad Things.
Bait And Switch Comparison  -  A comparison of two things: one's like the other, and the other is the other.
Amnesiac Resonance  -  An amnesiac instinctively performs skills they had before losing their memory, without knowledge of how or why they know them.
Strongly Worded Letter  -  Measly retaliation to major villainy.
Organ Drops  -  Getting body parts from dead animal enemies.
Scavenged Punk  -  Culture and technology built out of scavenged junk.
Multicultural Alien Planet  -  An alien planet isn't a Planet of Hats
Travel Montage  -  Montage of someone's travels.
Rebellious Spirit  -  A character who doesn't abide by the rules.
Thats All Folks  -  Telling the audience that the show is truly over.
Sweet Sheep  -  Sheep and Lambs as symbols of innocence, gentleness, and purity.
Alien Fair Folk  -  Mythological creatures turn out to be aliens, are confused for aliens, or pass themselves off as aliens.
Cyclic Trope  -  Trope goes from been played straight to subverted and back again over time.
Sudden Sequel Heel Syndrome  -  A character who was on the good side in the first installment becomes evil early in the next one.
Human Aliens  -  An alien or species whose appearance is completely indistinguishable from humans.
Spontaneous Human Combustion  -  A human suddenly catches on fire or explodes with no explanation why.
Our Banshees Are Louder  -  A Celtic Portent of Doom in the form of a crying woman. Sonic Scream optional.
Cliche Storm  -  Work with LOADS of clichés.
Compressed Abstinence  -  Characters try to live without reasonable levels of something bad. It doesn't last.
Non Action Big Bad  -  A Big Bad who either can't or doesn't fight.
Discussed Trope  -  Genre Savvy characters discuss how reality differs from fiction relevantly.
Unbroken Vigil  -  A character refuses to leave a sick charge's bedside.
Misbegotten Multiplayer Mode  -  Multiplayer mode that feels like an afterthought rather than the game being designed properly around it.
Kick Chick  -  Action Girl is literally kicking.
Hellistics  -  All is One, and One wants to screw you over.
Brand X  -  Replacing named brands with generic, fictional brands.
Wizards Live Longer  -  Being a spellcaster tends to grant you an expanded lifetime.
Wife Husbandry  -  A legal guardian marries their adopted child.
Fake Interactivity  -  Simulating interactive television using beats for viewers to "respond".
Determinator  -  Never. Gives. UP. For anything.
Faux Horrific  -  Being very scared over something hardly intimidating.
Anthropomorphic Zig Zag  -  Animals who can talk shift between being Civilized Animals, Funny Animals, and Nearly Normal Animals.
Elites Are More Glamorous  -  The Badass Army outclasses and outshines the Red Shirt Army.
Family Unfriendly Violence  -  Violence tame enough to get past the censors, but still intense enough to be uncomfortable for kids.
Sweeps Week Lesbian Kiss  -  Using Lesbian action to boost up the ratings.
Opening Narration  -  Little speech that opens up the show.
Clones Are People Too  -  Being genetically identical doesn't mean that clones all have the same personality and/or are "lesser" beings.
You Are Fat  -  Fat jokes.
Constructive Criticism  -  Saying why X sucks so the creator can correct the flaws in X.
Differently Powered Individual  -  Any alternative term for "superhuman", or anyone who possesses supernatural powers.
Rebus Bubble  -  Images in Speech Bubbles used to convey thought process.
Furry Lens  -  Character is drawn as an anthropomorphic animal, but is considered human in-universe.
Black Knight  -  Trope: A strong, infamous knight clad in black armor.
Doomy Dooms Of Doom  -  Making something sound hilariously evil or dangerous by suffixing it with "of Doom"
Inhuman Emotion  -  Characters with emotions or feelings that are beyond/different from human.
Gamblers Fallacy  -  (1/X) chance of success does not equal one success for every X attempts.
Gravity Is A Harsh Mistress  -  Lady Gravity starts being a fickle bitch because she can.
Chekhovs Army  -  A whole bunch of often unrelated minor characters all become important later.
Awesomeness Is A Force  -  Someone is considered awesome without action, able to make things happen just because he is awesome.
You Look Familiar  -  An actor comes back as a different character in the same continuity.
Female Feline Male Mutt  -  She's a cat. He's a dog.
Streisand Effect  -  Attempts to hide or suppress something only make it more widely known.
Hunter Of His Own Kind  -  Lone decent member of an Always Chaotic Evil species goes after the others.
Orbital Bombardment  -  An orbiting starship attacks one or more locations on the planet's surface.
Multiple Choice Chosen  -  Multiple characters could potentially be the Chosen One out of a list of shared criteria.
Living Bodysuit  -  Someone is puppeteered by a sentient, supernatural force from within the victim.
Editorial Synaesthesia  -  Ways of visually portraying things that can't be seen.
Dragons Are Divine  -  Dragons are seen as divine beings.
The Cat Came Back  -  The Trope:
Green Skinned Space Babe  -  Hot alien chick.
What Year Is This  -  A time-traveler asks a passerby what year it is after traveling.
True Love Is A Kink  -  Where true love, marriage and monogamous coupling based on romance is considered a sexual fantasy.
Rascally Rabbit  -  Our bunnies are tricksters.
Secret AI Moves  -  CPU-exclusive game actions.
Doom It Yourself  -  When someone tries to do maintenance better left to the professionals.
Spacetime Eater  -  A being that devours spacetime, existence, or some other similar concept.
First Period Panic  -  Girl becomes increasingly worried over getting her first period.
Zig Zagging Trope  -  A Trope gets played in many ways at the same time.
Agri World  -  A planet or world dedicated solely to growing food.
The Turret Master  -  A character who fights using immobile minions.
Once More With Clarity  -  We see the same scene... but flipped on its head with new backstory and context.
The Afterafterlife  -  There is an afterlife after the afterlife.
Companion Cube  -  Misdirecting empathy at inanimate objects.
Soul Jar  -  An object that contains a character's living essence.
Wildcard Excuse  -  An excuse that is applied to many different situations.
Giant Equals Invincible  -  Normal weapons don't hurt giant monsters, even when not justified as Immune to Bullets.
Three Laws Compliant  -  Those three laws that mostly ensure Robots won't kill a human.
The Stoner  -  The hipster guy who may or may not be smoking pot.
Coincidental Broadcast  -  A helpful hint is dispensed by the TV.
The Presents Were Never From Santa  -  Character has placed their faith in an authority that turns out to be illegitimate.
Katanas Are Just Better  -  Katana > Any other weapon.
Now Thats Using Your Teeth  -  Catching an opponent's weapon or projectiles with your teeth.
Scandalgate  -  When there's a scandal, chances are "-gate" will be its suffix.
For The Funnyz  -  In-universe character tries to invoke Rule of Funny. Results vary.
Funbag Airbag  -  I didn't mean to faceplant into your cleavage!
Ghosts Abhor A Vacuum  -  Getting rid of ghosts by vacuuming them up.
The Fundamentalist  -  Someone (usually a religious person) who believes that their beliefs are right and all other beliefs are wrong and/or evil.
Guy In Back  -  He's the guy in the same warplane doing stuff so the pilot doesn't have to.
Every Bullet Is A Tracer  -  Shooter games with glowing bullets.
Doing In The Scientist  -  Science is Retconned into magic.
Glory Days  -  A character feels their best times are behind them.
The Minion Master  -  A character who creates Mooks to do their fighting.
Arcology  -  A massive city contained in one building.
Setting Update  -  A work's time period changes when adapted.
Was It All A Lie  -  Were all the good times part of being The Mole?
Kid Has A Point  -  A child (or younger character) has a valuable and accurate insight.
Tidally Locked Planet  -  Natural satellite where one side always faces the body it orbits, and the other side always faces away.
Aftershow  -  A show that's a spinoff of a dead show and was created in order to keep said dead show alive a bit longer.
Dunce Cap  -  A cone-shaped cap placed atop one's head to indicate they've done something idiotic or wrong.
Chummy Commies  -  Positive portrayal of Communists/Soviets from a non-Communist/non-Soviet POV.
Murder The Hypotenuse  -  Character kills romantic rival(s).
Evil Gloating  -  A villain wastes their time gloating.
Nice Character Mean Actor  -  On-screen, a total saint; backstage, an absolute asshole.
Flash Of Pain  -  Enemy flashes a different colour when damaged.
With Great Power Comes Great Insanity  -  Power makes you crazy.
Present Day Past  -  Bits of contemporary culture pop up in a work set in the recent past.
You Kill It You Bought It  -  You keep something that belonged to someone you kill, like it or not.
Snow Means Death  -  ...because white and winter mean death.
No Hero To His Valet  -  No matter how big and famous a person gets, there's always one person who remembers when he was just a guy.
No Social Skills  -  Clueless about normal social conventions.
Accidental Misnaming  -  Out of daftness, Bob refers to Alice by a name other than her own.
Finishing Each Others Sentences  -  Two characters have a tendency to —
Careful With That Axe  -  Singers screaming excessively, so suddenly it can scare listeners.
Commercial Pop Up  -  Annoying ads that pop up during the show you're trying to watch.
Dragged Into Drag  -  Women taking pleasure into putting a male character in a female dress.
Rebel Leader  -  The character who leads La Résistance.
Five Five Five  -  Fictional phone numbers start with 555.
If Its You Its Okay  -  Person is normally only attracted to one gender... but with one exception.
You Can Leave Your Hat On  -  A striptease.
You Used To Be Better Speech  -  What the Hell, Hero? You were much better than this!
Tonto Talk  -  Broken Native American English speech.
Action Fashionista  -  Fashionable asskicker.
Latex Space Suit  -  In the future, people will wear fanservicable spacesuits.
Nice Job Breaking It Rivals  -  Multiple characters fight over something to a point the fight itself renders whatever they were fighting over worthless in the end.
Stealth Mentor  -  A mentor poses as an antagonist to force the hero to become stronger.
Immune To Fate  -  Screwing Destiny as a superpower.
Black Dude Dies First  -  The token minority of the cast is always the first to go.
Adolf Hitlarious  -  Adolf Hitler and Those Wacky Nazis, Played for Laughs.
Love Makes You Crazy  -  Loss of reason due to The Power of Love.
The Spartan Way  -  Training from Hell meant to create a Badass Army.
My Life Flashed Before My Eyes  -  Before dying or almost dying, someone sees their whole life.
Private Detective  -  Gumshoes, private eyes and shamuses.
Taking The Bullet  -  Shielding someone with your own body.
Deus Angst Machina  -  This character's life sucks hardcore.
World Of Ham  -  EVERY CHARACTER OVERREACTS!!!!
Colorization  -  Adding color to monochrome film.
Outside Man Inside Man  -  One friend has a moral awakening, one friend prefers to stay where they are. Conflict ensues.
Family Friendly Stripper  -  A Family-Friendly Stripper wears an elaborate and theoretically sexy costume—that just happens to cover just about everything.
Baby Boomers  -  Bombs disguised as babies.
Horsing Around  -  Horses with an attitude.
Cat Up A Tree  -  Cat goes up tree and won't come down. Who will be the hero that rescues it?
Sistine Steal  -  Art Imitates Art with Michelangelo Buonarroti's Ceiling Fresco in the Sistine Chapel.
Numbers Stations  -  A short-wave radio station that plays sequences of numbers, letters, or other sound bytes with bursts of data meant for spies or government agencies encoded in them.
Content Leak  -  When a work's content is leaked before official release.
Chess With Death  -  The Grim Reaper can not be bargained with, but will accept a challenge of wits.
Good People Have Good Sex  -  Virtuous characters tend to have healthy libidos and be phenomenal sex partners.
Boring But Practical  -  Not exciting, but it works.
Wedding Enhanced Fertility  -  A couple unexpectedly conceive a baby either shortly before or shortly after the wedding.
Wants A Prize For Basic Decency  -  A character expects praise for some mundane virtue.
Incredibly Inconvenient Deity  -  When gods hassle their helpers.
The Character Died With Him  -  The actor dies in real life, and the character dies in-universe.
The Problem With Fighting Death  -  If You Cheat Death, it'll be furious when you eventually die. If You Kill Death, you may well destroy the universe.
Not Hyperbole  -  They are not exaggerating, they are not kidding you. They literally can/will do it.
All Germans Are Nazis  -  All Germans follow Nazi stereotypes.
Ambadassador  -  Badass ambassador.
Slashed Throat  -  Death (or serious injury) via lacerations across neck.
Lovecraft Country  -  New England is a land of PURE EVIL.
Wrongfully Committed  -  A character is wrongfully committed to a mental asylum.
Ad Bumpers  -  Tiny clip after the advert to remind you what you are watching.
Quiet Cry For Help  -  A character asking help to others by some indirect hints.
Who Will Bell The Cat  -  Great plan, but also risky. Who's gonna go do it?
Decoy Trial  -  Falsely accusing an innocent to expose the guilty.
What Is This Thing You Call Love  -  What is this love thing that you speak of?
Gratuitous Mariachi Band  -  A Mariachi band pops ups into the scene gratuitously or in an unlikely scene.
Netorare  -  Cuckold as a Japanese genre.
They Killed Kenny Again  -  A character whose defining trait is dying, then inexplicably returning very much alive for the next episode.
Grail In The Garbage  -  A MacGuffin, the Infinity +1 Sword, etc. is for sale at the pawn shop for $5.
Color Character  -  Super hero named "[Color] [Something]".
Passed Over Inheritance  -  A deceased rich person leaves their entire fortune to someone completely unexpected, usually a someone outside the family.
Robot Dog  -  A robot made to look like a dog.
Reincarnation  -  The essence of a deceased person's soul is reborn into a new living person.
New First Comics  -  A webcomic author gives readers a new place to start off.
Evil Is One Big Happy Family  -  All the villains get along just fine.
Quip To Black  -  Just before a cut... a cheesy one-liner. YEEEEEEEEEEEEEEAH!
Professional Sex Ed  -  A character is taught about sex through actually having sex.
Room Full Of Zombies  -  A locked room turns out to be storing dozens, or a horde of zombies.
Stumbling Upon The Lost Wizard  -  The Protagonist(s) accidentally find a character of great importance when they become lost themselves.
Only Known By Their Nickname  -  Even if their real name is known, no one uses it.
Victory Sex  -  Celebrating victory with sex.
Instant Leech Just Fall In Water  -  Fall into a body of water, and expect to attract leeches.
Explosive Instrumentation  -  Every workstation is a Pinto.
Its For A Book  -  A character uses writing a book as an excuse for suspicious questions.
Dinky Drivers  -  Small characters drive a vehicle.
Multiple Choice Form Letter  -  A written work made customizable with multiple choices.
Bad Future  -  A dystopic future version of the setting's present.
Group Picture Ending  -  The story closes on a still picture of the main cast.
Skill Point Reset  -  An item or character in an RPG that lets you redistribute any points you've put into your Skill Scores and Perks .
Gender Is No Object  -  Many jobs in fiction are equal-opportunity, even if they weren't in Real Life.
Consummate Professional  -  Married to the Job, and it shows.
Torture Is Ineffective  -  Torture is shown or said to be ineffective.
Loan Shark  -  Amoral moneylender.
Cradle To Grave Character  -  A character whose entire life from birth to death is depicted in the story.
Tickertape Parade  -  Flashy Parade with lots of confetti and music.
Fantasy Forbidding Father  -  Parental figure forbids wards from "distractions" they prefer over the parent's idea of success.
Evil Mentor  -  A character who mentors The Hero for their own evil purposes or to corrupt them.
Jar Of Jellybeans Contest  -  How many jellybeans (or a similar item) are in the jar?
The New Rock And Roll  -  No, really... this will cause the death of society!
Living Toys  -  Toys that are alive.
Concussion Frags  -  Frag grenades only cause damage through the initial detonation.
Disrupting The Theater  -  People in a movie theater not being courteous to others by talking, using their phones, etc.
Hive Drone  -  A near-mindless mook of the Hive Mind.
Despair Speech  -  A speech delivered by a character who has lost all hope.
Join The Army They Said  -  Those Army ads ring hollow now that you're actually in the Army.
Sinister Sentient Sun  -  The Sun is evil.
Harpoon Gun  -  Gun that shoots spears.
In Love With Love  -  A character wants a romantic relationship for the sake of one.
Deus Ex Scuse Me  -  Any cheap plot device to get a character out of the scene, so a plot point not involving that character can take place.
Cutscene Power To The Max  -  Characters do things in cutscenes that they can't do in gameplay.
Gas Mask Longcoat  -  Post-Apocalyptic Gas Mask and Badass Longcoat worn in unison for added cool.
Mean Character Nice Actor  -  An evil/mean character is played by someone who's actually quite nice in real life.
Down LA Drain  -  The Los Angeles storm drain system is used as the setting in a film/TV show, usually a car chase.
Just Friends  -  Just friends? Yeah, right.
Chekhovs Skill  -  A previously noted skill or talent becomes essential to the plot.
Damsel Out Of Distress  -  A Damsel in Distress who puts up a decent or successful escape from her captors.
Real Award Fictional Character  -  Non-Historical Domain Character is given a Real Life award or military decoration.
Think In Text  -  Thoughts, telepathy and thought-dialogue in a range of text or printed media.
Judicial Wig  -  Curly white wig worn by judges.
Digging To China  -  Tunneling through the earth and coming out on the other side.
Overused Running Gag  -  We have done this Running Gag way too many times.
Action Mom  -  One Badass mother.
Nature Adores A Virgin  -  Virgins are more desirable and/or valuable than sexually active women.
Parachute Petticoat  -  A petticoat or dress being use as a substitute parachute.
Eldritch Abomination  -  A bizarre entity that defies the laws of reality within a work and is incomprehensible to the characters.
Flame War  -  Vehement ongoing Internet debate about a subject, or the Internet version of a Mob War.
Flaming Skulls  -  Skulls on fire.
Granny Classic  -  As wise as her years suggest, a great cook and baker, nurturing and lovely, often like a parent or confidant to you and your friends, and reliable even in the worst of times. That's grandma.
By The Lights Of Their Eyes  -  Characters' eyes glow in the dark, just so viewers can see their eyes.
Elemental Nation  -  One nation, one magic system. No overlaps.
Ms Fanservice  -  Fanservice is her business.
Homophobic Hate Crime  -  A character attacks another character because of their sexual orientation.
Woolseyism  -  Stuff gets changed during translation to work better in the new language.
Lets Fight Like Gentlemen  -  Combatants lay down ground rules before fighting.
Tin Man  -  Despite his passionate disposition, he still claims to be emotionless.
Reset Button  -  Don't worry; it'll all return to (exactly) what it was before.
Losing The Team Spirit  -  A party-wide Heroic BSoD triggered by some staggering loss, whether an item or a life  or worse.
Actor Inspired Element  -  Character's trait is inspired and/or improvised by their actor.
Proper Lady  -  True ladylike woman or girl.
Form Fitting Wardrobe  -  All clothes are drawn skintight, even when it shouldn't be possible.
Epileptic Trees  -  Insane fan theories.
Adaptational Badass  -  The newer incarnation is much more of an action guy.
Allergic To Love  -  Display of affections make a character literally sick.
Steadi Cam  -  A contraption that stablises an unstable shot.
Orifice Invasion  -  Something nasty invades one of your holes.
Birthday Buddies  -  Two or more characters happen to share the same birth date.
Stealth Pun  -  A really, really, REALLY subtle pun.
Harpo Does Something Funny  -  Space left in a script to allow an actor to improvise.
Take A Moment To Catch Your Death  -  You think you're safe? YOU'RE NOT.
Wrong Guy First  -  Meeting the Romantic False Lead before the person you'll ultimately end up with.
Arabian Nights Days  -  The Middle East is stereotyped as a deserty place full of camels and belly dancers.
Acclaimed Flop  -  A work that fails commercially despite being generally acclaimed by critics and audiences.
Arrowgram  -  Shooting an arrow with a message attached to it.
No Fame No Wealth No Service  -  An establishment refuses to serve those who aren't big-wigs.
Full Circle Revolution  -  La Résistance gains control and becomes another Empire.
The Remnant  -  Leftovers of the defeated faction.
Brawn Hilda  -  A big, mannish, and ugly woman.
Five Finger Fillet  -  The "game" of quickly stabbing a sharp object between your fingers; get hit, and you lose.
Diabolus Ex Nihilo  -  Incredibly evil villain with no build-up or backstory.
Sailors Ponytail  -  Sailor uses ponytail hair to look sailor-ish.
Samurai In Ninja Town  -  If a setting has samurai in it, then it will also have ninjas, and vice versa.
Follow Your Nose  -  A character flies to a smell that goes to their nose.
Family Portrait Of Characterization  -  A family portrait emphasizes something about the familial dynamic.
Humans Are Morons  -  Humanity's hat is being ignorant, hairless apes.
Planetary Romance  -  Fantastic stories set on alien planets (or distant future).
Farm Boy  -  The Hero is a humble farmhand. Except he usually isn't.
Zero G Spot  -  Sex! In SPACE!
What Now Ending  -  A Cliffhanger that allows time to pass within the show between episodes.
Cool And Unusual Punishment  -  Ridiculous (but usually effective) punishments.
Antagonist Abilities  -  Evil Is Easy with powers like these! Did you think it would be that easy, Hero?
Data Pad  -  Sci-Fi Tablet. Zeerust-Candidate
The Big Guy  -  The muscles of the good guys.
Tears Of Joy  -  Crying because you're happy.
Prank Call  -  A call that is a joke.
Body Sushi  -  Serving sushi on a naked body.
Girls Have Cooties  -  Young boys think girls are icky.
Central Theme  -  A philosophy, message, idea, or question at a story's core.
Both Sides Have A Point  -  Everyone's arguments are reasonable.
Why Are You Not My Son  -  Parents compare their son/daughter to their son's/daughter's friend. Jealousy ensues.
Our Product Sucks  -  Self-deprecating advertisement for a product or business for comedy or Reverse Psychology.
Captain Ethnic  -  A superhero whose powers and superhero persona are based on a stereotypical view of his/her ethnicity.
Deliberate Flaw Retcon  -  Claiming that one or more flaws in your work were intentional, but only after the work has been released.
Misplaced Sorrow  -  A character misses another character for shallow, selfish reasons, such as money.
Used To Be More Social  -  A character who used to be friendly and outgoing becomes distant and asocial.
Rooting For The Empire  -  Cheering for the bad guys even knowing full well that they're evil.
But I Cant Be Pregnant  -  A character turns out to be pregnant, despite this being thought impossible.
Ghostly Goals  -  Goals on what ghosts want (e.g. unfinished business, revenge).
Thirsty Desert  -  A desert is a terrible place to be.
Tag Team Suicide  -  Two people kill themselves due to poor communication making one think the other is dead.
Colbert Bump  -  A work gains popularity after being featured or referenced in another more popular work.
Depopulation Bomb  -  A disastrous event wipes most of humanity off the map, leaving only a handful of survivors.
Suspect Is Hatless  -  Eyewitness gives description vague enough to be totally useless.
Bald Of Evil  -  Nothing screams "villain" like a shaven top.
Funny Spoon  -  Spoons have a funny side!
Tutorial Failure  -  Video game tutorials that do anything but help the player.
Light Is Good  -  Light as a force of benevolence / good.
Voodoo Shark  -  The official answer to a Plot Hole just creates another one.
Younger And Hipper  -  A work is retooled to present younger versions of the characters in the original, or cater to the perception of a younger demographic.
Cant Stop The Signal  -  Killing me won't stop the information from getting out.
The Whitest Black Guy  -  Member of demographic B exhibits loyalties, stereotypes, and characteristics of demographic A, aside from belonging to demographic B.
Working Out Their Emotions  -  Work out = anger out.
Secretly Selfish  -  An ostensibly altrustic person has a selfish ulterior motive behind what they do.
Freemium Timer  -  A game mechanic that limits how much a player can actually play during or over a given time.
Advanced Ancient Acropolis  -  A lost or hidden civilization much more advanced than the rest of the world outside it.
Damager Healer Tank  -  Classes and/or combat are split between three roles: the healer, the tank, and the damage-dealer.
White Male Lead  -  In Western fiction, the lead character will almost always be white and male regardless of the supporting cast's diversity.
C List Fodder  -  Established but minor/obscure characters are used to provide casualties in major events. Meanwhile, the big names are safe.
Parrot Exposition  -  Parrot Exposition? Rephrasing exposition in the form of a question.
Plot Device  -  Something important to the plot.
Distracted By My Own Sexy  -  Saw myself in the mirror... I may be some time.
Apology Gift  -  Giving gifts as a way of making amends.
Logical Latecomer  -  New guy who points out weirdness that everyone else ignores or is already used to.
Beethoven Was An Alien Spy  -  Famous historical figures led more interesting lives than the history books tell us.
Murder Ballad  -  A song about a murder.
Before And After Pictures  -  Before = Extremely fat and unattractive. After = Impossibly thin and gorgeous!
Mysterious Antarctica  -  Antartica is cold, near-lifeless, and the continent we know the least about.
Fictional Disability  -  Speculative fiction leads to speculation on fictional handicaps.
Vile Villain Saccharine Show  -  Lighthearted show with a monstrous villain.
The Cover Changes The Gender  -  If you want to cover a song by a person of the opposite gender, just change the pronouns around.
Give Away The Bride  -  The bride is escorted by her father down the aisle.
No Sympathy  -  A character is unsympathetic to another character's mishaps.
Trauma Button Ending  -  An ending where a character reacts negatively to something that reminds them of a recent adventure.
Gratuitous Spanish  -  Using Spanish instead of words in your own language, often in a way that seems odd to actual speakers.
Magic Meteor  -  Power bestowed upon you by a giant plummeting space rock.
Heel Face Town  -  A Sugar Bowl Shining City that was originally a Wretched Hive.
Super Cop  -  Superpowered law enforcement.
Healing Potion  -  Liquefied Healing Factor.
Undignified Death  -  What a hilariously embarrassing way to die.
Eat The Dog  -  Eating a pet to save your life.
If You Can Read This  -  The actual words on a printed page that appear on screen can tell the audience extra information.
With Our Swords Scene  -  One person uses the group's weaponry to fight their enemy.
Human Chess  -  Chess with people as pieces.
The Victim Must Be Confused  -  Heroic Wannabe ignores a supposed victim's claims that their "captor" has done nothing wrong.
Back To Back Badasses  -  Two guys standing by each other's back = it's ass-whooping time.
Reviving Enemy  -  An enemy that can be killed, only to automatically rise up and fight again after some time.
Captain Colorbeard  -  Pirates or captains have names like [X]beard.
Spotlight Stealing Squad  -  The series has an ensemble cast, but this character or group gets a disproportionately large amount of attention.
Bourgeois Bohemian  -  Upper-class liberals.
Real Men Eat Meat  -  You're not a man unless you're a carnivore. note Well, omnivore would also work...
Comic Sutra  -  A strange sexual act that we're never given details of.
Magic Feather  -  A placebo that improves the performance of a character when he was originally inept.
Unsatisfiable Customer  -  No matter what, this customer can never be satisfied.
Expressive Mask  -  A character's mask morphs to fit their expressions.
Flashback Twist  -  The setup for a flashback subverts expectations.
Previously Overlooked Paramour  -  A character who turns out to be the true primary Love Interest, but takes a while to be noticed.
Dystopian Oz  -  The land of Oz is a crappy place to be.
Ballistic Bone  -  Abnormal Ammo x Bad with the Bone.
Tanks But No Tanks  -  Hang on, that tank doesn't look right...
Caught Up In The Rapture  -  God will remove the virtuous from the world to safety just before it ends.
Does Not Like Shoes  -  A character who goes (or performs) barefoot whenever possible.
Top Ten Jingle  -  Advertising jingle becomes a full song.
Rage Helm  -  Scary angry-looking face mask.
Jumping Off The Slippery Slope  -  Setting up, then subverting, a moral dilemma by a character becoming evil.
Lopsided Dichotomy  -  Either something absurd, or the reasonable thing I'm actually suggesting.
Childless Dystopia  -  An entire society with no children set in the future.
Cheap Gold Coins  -  Everyone uses gold coins, even the peasants.
And Man Grew Proud  -  A cataclysm in the past has become a myth in the present.
Sudden Anatomy  -  Simplified characters sprout a body part for one scene.
Serial Escalation  -  Events in the series keep getting bigger.
Duet Bonding  -  Two people become closer by playing instruments together.
Coup De Grace  -  The final killing blow or shot.
Development Hell  -  Where unreleased, pending works go to die.
Allergic To Evil  -  The forces of darkness make you sick. Literally.
