Just Following Orders  -  Justifying evil actions by shifting all the (moral) responsibility for them to one's superiors.
Save Token  -  Items needed to activate a Save Point.
Four Girl Ensemble  -  Sweet, smart, sexy, and snarky estrogen.
Expensive Glass Of Crap  -  Passing off cheap wine as something far more expensive.
Innocent Cohabitation  -  Opposite-sexes living together without sex involved.
Camp Straight  -  Straight with stereotypical Camp Gay behavior.
Double Feature  -  A movie theater sitting in which two movies are shown. Used to be frequent when the movie industry was young.
Knee Fold Fall Of Defeat  -  Defeated Character falls to their knees before hitting the ground.
Spexico  -  Treating Spain and Mexico like they're the same place.
Freakiness Shame  -  Your monster parts are cute!
Fan Wank  -  Fans coming up with theories and excuses to "fix" the canon.
Lights Off Somebody Dies  -  A populated room suddenly goes dark and when the lights return, someone's found mysteriously murdered. Try not to scream.
The Pete Best  -  A replacement becomes more well known than the original.
Wholesome Crossdresser  -  A positive or at least neutral portrayal of a Crossdresser.
Murder Water  -  The water itself actively tries to kill someone.
The Worf Barrage  -  When an ultimate attack...isn't.
Plot Irrelevant Villain  -  An antagonist that, while technically the "main" villain by default, isn't essential to most of the plot points.
Self Serving Memory  -  Someone recalls their own variation of a flashback.
Confronting Your Imposter  -  An impersonator is foiled by the real deal.
Ignored Expert  -  Warning from credible source is ignored.
Sassy Black Woman  -  A black woman with a big voice and an even bigger attitude.
Dramatic Drop  -  A character physically drops something after a shocking development.
Smithical Marriage  -  A couple has an affair at a hotel and registers under a generic pseudonym to hide the fact.
Physical God  -  Corporeal entity with god-like abilities.
Invasion Of The Baby Snatchers  -  Non-humans kidnapping babies.
Extremely Cold Case  -  Investigating a cold case that happened a really long time ago.
Evil Reactionary  -  A villain whose goal is to remodel the world based on their old-fashioned beliefs and/or interests.
Vodka Drunkenski  -  All Russians are Alcoholics.
Living Forever Is Awesome  -  A character enjoys Immortality.
Im Melting  -  A character suffers a literal meltdown.
Whos Your Daddy  -  For the trope: Unknown parentage causes unprecedented amounts of angst and drama.
Give The Baby A Father  -  A man who isn't the father of the child proposes to a pregnant woman.
Common Mary Sue Traits  -  These traits do not make a Mary Sue, but are nonetheless common among Mary Sue characters.
Invincibility Power Up  -  Grab this item for temporary invincibility.
Virgin In A White Dress  -  Virgins wear white.
Devil In Disguise  -  The Devil (or his minions) is hiding in among the living.
I Just Want To Be Beautiful  -  People want to be attractive.
Illogical Safe  -  Character is inside a safe after being crushed by it.
Anatomically Ignorant Healing  -  Someone or something tries to heal an injured person without being familiar with their species' basic anatomy, and Body Horror usually ensues.
Monster Compendium  -  A video game's personal encyclopedia about the enemies you fight.
Adored By The Network  -  When a show is the apple of network execs' eyes at the expense of other shows.
Trailer Joke Decay  -  The joke was funnier in or ruined by the trailer, if not both.
Uncle Tomfoolery  -  A stereotypical black guy as comic relief.
Hates Everyone Equally  -  They're not racist, sexist, or homophobic, they treat everybody like garbage.
Multiple Languages Same Voice Actor  -  In a show overdubbed in a different language, the same actor who did the original language does the overdub in the new language.
Benevolent AI  -  An Artificial Intelligence that is benign and/or benevolent instead of evil.
Shapeshifter Baggage  -  Shapeshifters gain inexplicable mass when transformed into entities larger than themselves.
Serpent Of Immortality  -  Snakes symbolise immortality, regeneration and rebirth.
Self Deprecation  -  Making fun of yourself; the quality of trying to make your abilities or your achievements seem less important.
Black Market  -  A thriving underworld economy for the illegal selling of goods, sometimes depicted as a literal place.
Green Eyed Epiphany  -  Jealousy forces someone in denial to realize they are in love.
Fond Memories That Could Have Been  -  It sucks because this never happened.
Starts With Their Funeral  -  They died.
Summon A Ride  -  A video game ability to conjure up means of fast transportation anywhere in the sandbox.
The Missionary  -  A person who goes abroad to preach.
Child Naming Request  -  The parent (or expecting parent) of a newborn baby gives someone else the privilege to choose a name for that baby.
The Old Country  -  Don't specify the Funny Foreigner's place of origin.
Call To Agriculture  -  Soldiers retire on farms.
Time Is Dangerous  -  When time itself is dangerous, either by time machine, the voyage though time itself, or time flow differences.
Freaky Electronic Music  -  Electronic Music is the theme of villains.
Insatiable Newlyweds  -  A pair has sex the night after the wedding.
Con Man  -  A person who tricks naive enough people to give them their money.
Bring News Back  -  Characters go on a journey to deliver a message about the current situation.
Kangaroos Represent Australia  -  Kangaroo = Land Down Under
Friendly Enemy  -  The heroes and villains are friendly to each other.
Bifauxnen And Ladette  -  Two girls have largely different personalities that both lie on the traditionally masculine spectrum.
The Joys Of Torturing Mooks  -  Creative ways to make Mooks suffer. Actually killing the mooks optional.
Old Master  -  Elderly. Sharp. Dangerous.
Carry A Big Stick  -  My Weapon of Choice is a big blunt object.
Hell Yes Moment  -  Characters discovering that their fortunes have changed dramatically for the better, and then releasing the appropriate response.
Screw You Elves  -  Telling off a Superior Species.
Sitcom Arch Nemesis  -  A character who a member of the main cast dislikes and has petty squabbles with.
Social Climber  -  Someone determined to advance up the social ladder.
Mass Super Empowering Event  -  Something happens, everyone gets superpowers.
Antagonist Title  -  The work is titled after whoever or whatever the protagonist fights against.
Catharsis Factor  -  Violence is satisfying and stress-relieving, especially if the targets deserve it.
Do Androids Dream  -  Do robots and computers have souls?
Martial Arts And Crafts  -  Martial arts styles derived from non-combat skills.
Joker Immunity  -  Some villains are too good or too popular to be Killed Off for Real.
Wave Of Babies  -  rumblerumblerumblerumbleWAAAAAAH
Hollywood Blanks  -  Blank cartridges don't do any damage In-Universe.
Refugee From TV Land  -  Fictional characters experience Real Life, usually leading to the characters discovering that they're just figments of someone else's imagination.
Yubitsume  -  Dishonor in the yakuza means inflicting Fingore upon yourself.
Dead Person Impersonation  -  Impersonating a dead person.
Only Friend  -  A character has only one friend.
Failed Execution No Sentence  -  A convict sentenced to death walks free after the authorities fail to execute him enough times.
Bitch Slap  -  The film: The Faster, Pussycat! Kill! Kill! remake Quentin Tarantino no longer needs to make.
Government Agency Of Fiction  -  That one special part of the government, that you're supposed to think does not exist.
Surprisingly Sudden Death  -  A character is killed entirely out of nowhere.
BFS  -  A character can use a disproportionately giant melee weapon—usually a sword—without any difficulty.
Pet Peeve Trope  -  Tropes that hit the audience's Berserk Button.
Smoking Barrel Blowout  -  Blowing the smoke off the barrel after a gunshot.
Face  -  Professional Wrestler fans cheer for.
Failures On Ice  -  A character can't skate.
Key Under The Doormat  -  The key to something is hidden in a nearby and easily accessible location.
Evil Nephew  -  A nephew/niece is evil and treats his uncle/aunt badly.
A God Is You  -  You play as a god.
Bowdlerise  -  The removal of "questionable" elements from media.
Double Standard Rape Female On Female  -  When a girl molests another girl, it's not considered rape.
Cut The Juice  -  Computer's turning evil, spreading its virus? Just unplug it.
Bling Of War  -  Overly dressy combat gear.
Friendship Denial  -  A character denies being friends with another for certain reasons.
Could This Happen To You  -  Sensationalized reporting baits you to watch a story by telling you need to watch because they're going to inform you about something that scary that could happen to you.
Humans Are Good  -  Some humans (if not all) are depicted as friendly and compassionate.
Crazy Sane  -  Adopting the traits of a madman in order to survive in a maddening world.
Unfinished Business  -  When ghosts stick around the mortal realm to finish some task before passing on.
Taking Up The Mantle  -  After a hero dies or is otherwise ejected from the story, a supporting character continues their legacy by taking on their role and/or codename.
Technicolor Death  -  Someone's death scene is Eye Candy.
Soap Wheel  -  New plots are consistently introduced during, rather than after, existing ones.
Famously Mundane Fictionally Magical  -  Public Domain Artifacts that turn out to have fantastical properties.
Trauma Conga Line  -  Let's see just how much pain our hero can REALLY take.
Political Strategy Game  -  A strategy game that simulates a conflict over influence, policy, and ideology, rather than territory, trade, or production.
Anachronic Order  -  The order in which the story is told is not the order in which its events took place.
Embarrassment Plot  -  The plot, or part of it, relies on a character's embarrassment.
Even Evil Has Standards  -  Some things are too vile even for a villain to do.
Royal Brat  -  A Spoiled Brat of royalty.
Hope Crusher  -  This character likes making people fall into despair and crushing their hopes. A good indicator for villainy.
Just Think Of The Potential  -  Think about what this baby could do for achieving not-so-altruistic ends!
Immortal Hero  -  Even if the villains die, the heroes seldom do.
Lego Body Parts  -  Like a "Freaky Friday" Flip but with body parts.
Bilingual Backfire  -  Think no one will understand your insults in that other language? Think again!
Face Heel Turn  -  Good guy turns bad.
Indestructibility Montage  -  A montage showing something or someone taking various kinds of physical abuse in order to demonstrate how durable they are.
Funnel Cloud Journey  -  Video Game level taking place in the eye of a hurricane or tornado.
Heads Tails Edge  -  A flipped coin lands on its edge.
Social Circle Filler  -  Characters introduced to be the protagonist's friends but have little relevance once the plot kicks off.
Character Name Alias  -  A character uses the name of a fictional character as an alias.
Bluff Worked Too Well  -  Character deceives someone successfully, but ends up giving themselves trouble because of it.
Quarantine With Extreme Prejudice  -  The Plague is so dangerous that lethal force is enacted to keep it from spreading.
Affirmative Action Girl  -  Adding a female to the cast to balance the gender ratio.
Meganekko  -  Cute glasses, cute girl.
Nerds Are Sexy  -  A character is a nerd and is sexy to other characters because of it.
Deranged Taxi Driver  -  A crazy person who drives a cab.
Mistaken Identity  -  Someone impersonates a character; they are mistaken for the real deal. Reality Ensues.
Murder Suicide  -  When you've killed a bunch of people, you finish it off by killing yourself.
Beautiful Slave Girl  -  A girl raised in slavery since birth or childhood grows up to be beautiful.
Robot Hair  -  Robots that have hair or something that resembles it.
The Alleged Computer  -  An unfortunately shoddy computer.
The Catfish  -  An individual of a game animal species, usually a large fish, that is a legendarily difficult catch.
Leave The Camera Running  -  The same scene plays out for a while, whether anything's happening or not.
Yaoi Fangirl  -  A female Otaku who thinks Guy-on-Guy Is Hot
Empathy Doll Shot  -  Showing an abandoned toy to imply that a child died here.
Larynx Dissonance  -  A person trying to sound like the opposite gender often just sounds... wrong.
Writers Suck  -  Writers in shows are always Butt Monkeys.
Multiarmed Multitasking  -  Character with multiple limbs can do multiple things at once, especially if those tasks only require one appendage.
Not So Fake Prop Weapon  -  That weapon you thought was a fake just killed someone.
Non Linear Character  -  A character that is both in and out of time.
Rhino Rampage  -  Rhinos as bad-tempered, brutish, violent animals that ram or trample anything that gets them mad.
Shouldnt You Stop Stealing  -  A character continues unscrupulous behavior even after the original reason for it stops applying.
Beneath The Earth  -  Colossal underground spaces with their own ecosystem.
The Name Is Bond James Bond  -  My name is [Last Name]. [First Name] [Last Name].
Acceptable Breaks From Canon  -  Deviations from official continuity that fans will generally accept in fanworks.
Censor Decoy  -  A questionable scene or line used to draw attention away from another dubious scene or line.
Artistic License Sports  -  An inconsistency about sports is done so the story can be better.
El Nino Is Spanish For The Nino  -  Words are translated identically between languages.
Walking Techfix  -  A character can make any piece of malfunctioning tech work effortlessly.
The Rat  -  A criminal who'll sell information on other criminals to the heroes...for a price.
Double Standard  -  Sexist/Racist/Discriminating tropes.
The Scottish Trope  -  Saying a name is likely to cause something bad to happen.
Writer Conflicts With Canon  -  Word of God and Canon do not agree with each other.
Spin The Bottle  -  A Parlor Game of kissing using an empty bottle.
Press Start To Game Over  -  The game tries to make you lose before it even begins.
Cloth Fu  -  Stray clothes as weapons.
Minus World  -  Usually bug-ridden levels that are only accessible via glitches or hacks.
Dare To Be Badass  -  You could be awesome, so get to it.
Snake People  -  A human or humanoid torso on the lower body of a snake.
Flushing Toilet Screaming Shower  -  Flushing the toilet or turning on the sink changes the temperature in the shower rapidly.
Samurai Ponytail  -  Samurai have ponytails, to show nobility or just because they're samurai.
The Fog Of Ages  -  Live long enough and your brain will run out of memory space.
Science Heros Babe Assistant  -  The attractive, scientifically-challenged female assistant to a scientist hero.
Contrived Clumsiness  -  The act of publicly doing something nasty to someone else and pretending it was an accident.
Walking Spoiler  -  The very existence of this character in a specific story is a massive spoiler in itself.
Identity Impersonator  -  Superhero protects their Secret Identity by appearing with someone else disguised as their other persona.
Be Quiet Nudge  -  A character is cut from revealing a piece of information by a stealth nudge.
Glam Rock  -  Rock that focuses on glamorous outfits and performances, glitter, and general flamboyancy.
Anyone Remember Pogs  -  The use of a forgotten fad in a mocking manner.
Help Mistaken For Attack  -  Character A thinks that Character B is attacking Character C, but really Character B is trying to help Character C.
Afro Asskicker  -  My Afro gives me super strength!
You Always Hear The Bullet  -  You can always hear a gun firing before the bullet hits anything.
Pendulum War  -  Large-scale battles alternate between one side dominating the other based on the actions of plot-relevant characters.
Cartridges In Flight  -  Fired bullets are depicted with the cartridge still attached.
The Power Of Language  -  Whether words/language themselves have inherent power is a Central Theme of the work.
Flashback Cut  -  A very quick flashback.
Sea Hurtchin  -  Urchins seem to exist only to hurt people with their spines.
Locked Into Strangeness  -  Unusual hair as a mark left on the character by certain events.
Accidental Hero  -  Someone who made no plan to do anything noble, but unintentionally does so anyway.
Red Is Violent  -  The color red associated with violent, murderous and blood-hungry characters.
Boss Subtitles  -  Video game boss is introduced by name and title.
Kung Foley  -  Loud, exaggerated sound effects in kung-fu movies.
Maniac Monkeys  -  Evil, sapient monkeys.
Squee  -  Expression of extreme joy, aka "Eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!!!!!"
Honor Before Reason  -  Doing what's right, even if it's foolish.
Camp Cook  -  The cook who serves the camp members their meals, often high-calorie revolting ones.
Developers Foresight  -  The developers account for unlikely occurrences in video games.
The Roleplayer  -  Plays games to tell his character's story.
Judgement Of The Dead  -  A dead person appears before some sort of judge, who evaluates their actions in life to determine their fate after death.
Always Accurate Attack  -  Attack that never misses its target when used. Ever.
Religious Bruiser  -  A fighter or rebel turns out to be very religious.
White And Grey Morality  -  Good hero, redeemable villain.
Pre Explosion Glow  -  Something glows before exploding.
Walking Tank  -  Tank with legs, not treads.
Ability Over Appearance  -  Screw resemblance to the original work; this person has the talent to portray the character.
Suckiness Is Painful  -  The pain from how bad this is! It's palpable!!
What Have We Ear  -  ...asks the Stage Magician. Then with a flourish of the hand... "It's...a coin!"
Outnumbered Sibling  -  A family with three or more kids where all but one of those kids are the same sex.
X Marks The Spot  -  The Trope: The location of a point of interest is denoted by a big "X" on the map of the area and/or the location itself.
No Respect Guy  -  When The Chew Toy is the Only Sane Man.
Kick Them While They Are Down  -  Attacking a helpless person.
Internal Death Squad  -  A position or unit within a larger organization tasked with tracking down and executing its own rogue or unreliable members.
My Friends And Zoidberg  -  Implied exclusion from a group by separate mention.
Superstitious Sailors  -  Sailors portrayed as excessively superstitious with habits and charms to keep bad luck at bay.
Heel Face Door Slam  -  Character considers changing their ways, but immediately dies or is otherwise denied the chance to redeem themselves.
Disco  -  Music used in discoes (duh!) that is mixed in with Funk.
Gun Twirling  -  Spinning a gun by the trigger around your finger.
Friendly Ghost  -  Depictions of ghosts being friendly and/or jovial instead of frightening.
Patricide  -  Character kills their own father.
Animal Athlete Loophole  -  An animal plays sports since no rule bars it.
Snowy Sleigh Bells  -  Music often uses jingly sleigh bells to indicate its wintery theme.
Rapid Aging  -  Physical development and decayment at an unusually fast pace.
Clueless Chick Magnet  -  The Chick Magnet who doesn't realize he's a Chick Magnet.
Secret Society Group Picture  -  A supposedly-secret group makes a picture that will blow their disguise.
Vampire Refugee  -  A monster infectee's struggle to fight their new urges and retain their humanity.
Chickification  -  Action Girl changes into a type that no longer fits the description, instead now being (possibly) a Damsel in Distress, Neutral Female, etc.
Shockwave Stomp  -  A wave of destructive energy that radially emits from those who've impacted the ground with great force.
Weird Trade Union  -  There's a union for everything.
Hands Off Parenting  -  Parents who don't actively raise their children.
Not Actually The Ultimate Question  -  A question meant literally is answered philosophically.
Black Mage  -  A character specializing in offensive magic.
What Could Have Been  -  Something that could have happened, but didn't.
Returning The Handkerchief  -  One character loses or lends out something, usually a handkerchief, and another character finds and returns it.
Compulsive Liar  -  A character will lie even if telling the truth would be more beneficial.
Creator Breakdown  -  When the creator's real life unpleasantness is integrated into their work.
The Fourth Wall Will Not Protect You  -  The audience or narrator is "attacked" by the story's antagonistic force.
Darkness Induced Audience Apathy  -  If the world is too dark and the characters unlikable, the audience won't care what happens next.
Intercontinuity Crossover  -  Crossover between two continuities you'd never think would ever meet. Ever.
Classically Trained Extra  -  A talented actor is severely underutilized.
Kansas City Shuffle  -  A con where the mark figures out an obvious scam only to fall right into a different one.
Decoy Convoy  -  Using extra transport vehicles to confuse would-be robbers.
Mystical White Hair  -  White hair indicates that the person has magical powers, has super powers, is divine, is mysterious, or has otherworldly origins.
God Of Chaos  -  A god or entity representing chaos in some form
Sequential Symptom Syndrome  -  Someone describes the symptoms of something, while someone else experiences them at the same time.
From The Latin Intro Ducere  -  Etymology used to introduce a subject.
Shading Colour Dissonance  -  In monochrome works, characters' colors don't match how they're shaded.
Dogfaces  -  Disney's answer to disallowing humans in a World of Funny Animals? Add dog noses and ears to human extras.
Gold Digger  -  Trope: Says: "I love everything about you". Means: "I love what you can give to me."
The Old North Wind  -  The North Wind, or similar frosty gales, depicted as anthropomorphic characters.
Sickness Equals Redness  -  Illnesses (primarily colds) give their victims red cheeks/noses.
More Diverse Sequel  -  A later installment of a work has more racial, ethnic, sexuality, or gender minorities than its predecessor.
Dress Coded For Your Convenience  -  The good guys and bad guys have their own respective uniforms to distinguish them from each other.
Outfit Decoy  -  A character uses clothes as a distraction.
Rock Beats Laser  -  Low-tech combat manages to beat high-tech combat.
Bindle Stick  -  The stick hobos use to carry their bags on.
Chekhovs News  -  The news reports on something seemingly minor or insignificant, but the subject becomes plot relevant later.
Cartoonish Companions  -  Part of the cast have a realistic build, and the rest are diminutive caricatures, but none of them seem to notice.
GMPC  -  The Game Master's pet NPC who travels with the party and frequently steals their thunder.
Bedtime Brainwashing  -  Communicating with a person in sleep-like state to influence their dreams or actions.
Second Place Is For Losers  -  No contestant is more disappointed than the first runner-up.
The Friend Nobody Likes  -  A group of friends don't get along with a certain member of their group.
Implausible Fencing Powers  -  Doing things with swords that just are not plausible in standard Real Life.
The Dragons Come Back  -  A (sub)plot revolving around dragons or similar apex predators returning from extinction/exile.
Death From Above  -  Falling objects which are fatal.
Changing Of The Guard  -  The old protagonist is replaced with a new character, who does mostly the same things.
Perfect Pacifist People  -  A utopian society of ascended pacifists.
Eating The Eye Candy  -  Female Gaze/Male Gaze presented as a character's point of view.
Bald Women  -  A female character who forgoes hair to symbolize her power and transcend her femininity.
Non Governmental Organization  -  Non-profit organization that is independent of any government.
Spoofing Spoofiness  -  Parody of a parody.
Hereditary Hairstyle  -  Family members have the same hairstyles.
I Know Your True Name  -  The true, original or current name of the person or thing in question actually has significance.
The Family That Slays Together  -  A family of murderers or other criminals.
Reformed Bully  -  A former bully becomes nicer.
Sibling Triangle  -  Siblings are interested in the same person.
Ignore The Fanservice  -  Someone tries to seduce another as overtly as possible. The seducer fails miserably.
Senseless Phagia  -  Eating something when you have no idea what it is.
Beastess  -  Butch and brawny Beast Bi—er... Women.
Autodoc  -  In the future, machines take care of healing you without the need for a doctor.
Verbal Backpedaling  -  Said something you shouldn't have said? Cover it up with a flimsy explanation! They'll buy it.
Spider Sense  -  A psychic ability to sense when a person is in danger.
Screw This Im Outta Here  -  Character abandons their role in the middle of their service out of frustration or fear.
Grenade Spam  -  Grenades used in unrealistically large quantities.
Stuck In Their Shadow  -  Some members of a group rise to prominence while others remain obscure.
Character Name Limits  -  A limit on the number of characters in a name in a video game.
Multiple Choice Past  -  A character with many, often conflicting, backstories.
Sixth Ranger  -  A later addition to an already-established Team.
Passing Notes In Class  -  Passing a note to a loved one during class.
Childhood Friend Romance  -  Friends in youth, but are they mutual lovers in adulthood?
Gang Of Hats  -  A crime group that differentiates themselves from others with a gimmick.
Sphere Factor  -  Large spherical objects are used for transportation.
Unrobotic Reveal  -  A robot is a human in disguise.
Where The Hell Is Springfield  -  A show's setting is never pinned down, and may change as the plot sees fit.
Determined Doctor  -  Medical care must be rendered no matter what.
Drawing Board Hiatus  -  A series is taken off the air to be retooled.
Pimped Out Car  -  A vehicle that has been heavily customized, to the point of being cool or excessively gaudy.
One Hour Work Week  -  A character supposedly has a full-time job. We rarely ever see them actually go to it.
Surprise Witness  -  A witness as a Smoking Gun.
Divine Birds  -  Birds are supernatural.
Cathartic Scream  -  Loud screaming relieves frustration.
The Great Repair  -  You gotta fix it to escape your prison...or the town you live in.
Rogue Planet  -  A planet found outside of a star system.
Jerk Justifications  -  The reason and motive for a character to be a jerk.
Bookcase Passage  -  A secret passage, usually related to a bookcase.
Nice Kitty  -  Making Baby Talk to a giant animal before trying to get away from it.
Lonely Doll Girl  -  She only has dolls that she can call her friends.
Extra Dimensional Shortcut  -  Using other dimensions to travel faster than light.
Magic Staff  -  A big magic stick.
Reality Bleed  -  When another world goes to you.
Unnecessarily Large Interior  -  An interior space that's much larger than it needs to be.
Oxygen Meter  -  A meter that indicates how long a character can hold their breath underwater.
Two Rights Make A Wrong  -  Two or more intended fixes to a bad outcome cause a bad outcome.
Be A Whore To Get Your Man  -  If you want to get your guy, you have to "put out".
Gentleman Wizard  -  A highly-cultured Gentleman and a Scholar practitioner in the mystic arts.
Introduction By Hookup  -  A character has a one-night stand, then encounters his/her partner in an unrelated context the next day.
Glorified Sperm Donor  -  Man who impregnates and then leaves.
Alien Blood  -  A character bleeds a strangely-coloured substance that isn't the red blood of humans to either reveal or emphasise that the character isn't human.
Happy Dance  -  You found the Laconic entry! Do a little dance to celebrate!
Roses Are Red Violets Are Blue  -  Roses are red, Violets are blue. In need of a stock poem? This templates for you!
Boss Rush  -  Multiple Boss Battles, one after another.
Pink Product Ploy  -  Are you making a product for girls or women? Make it pink in the hope that it'll improve sales!
I Say What I Say  -  Copies and/or clones of Bob all speaking in unison.
The Dividual  -  Two or more characters that are collectively identified as one character.
Mad Love  -  A character insanely pursues the affection of a love interest who has made it abundantly clear that they're not interested in them.
Let Them Die Happy  -  Comforting a dying character by lying to them.
Volatile Second Tier Position  -  Being second-best is more dangerous than you think...
Lion King Lift  -  Parodies of the opening scene from The Lion King.
Lazy Bum  -  Unrepentant slacker.
Boss Dissonance  -  Difficulty of a boss doesn't match the difficulty of the level.
Dont Eat And Swim  -  Wait a while to go swimming after eating, or else you'll drown!
Rat Stomp  -  Help me by killing these rats, newbie!
Spider Limbs  -  Having appendages that mimic a spider.
Token Trio  -  A Power Trio usually consisting of a White Male Lead, a non-white male, and a white female.
Fandom Rivalry  -  Fans of show A hate fans of show B, and vice versa.
Kiss Me Im Virtual  -  Romance between a character and a simulation of a character.
Epiphany Therapy  -  A character's psychological hang-ups are resolved in a moment of clarity and insight.
Earth That Was  -  Earth is no more.
Casual Sports Jersey  -  A character (often a Jerk Jock who wants their identity to be known) that wears a sports team uniform outside of a sports environment.
Earn Your Happy Ending  -  Characters go through hell.... but end up happy in the end as a result.
Voice Grunting  -  Hah! Yah! Eeeeeyah! Hoooaaaaah!!! HAAAAA!!!! (Translation: They "talk" through grunting and short lines.)
Fake Kill Scare  -  A death is faked in order to get a certain reaction from someone.
Pop Culture Isolation  -  Significant within one group, but not anyone else.
Costume Inertia  -  An Iconic Outfit is still worn even though the original reason to wear it no longer applies.
Swirly Energy Thingy  -  A whirlpool made of energy.
Locked In A Freezer  -  Locked in a Room where you'll die if you don't get out soon.
Men Cant Keep House  -  If you're a man, your house or room will be a biiiiiggg mess.
Fan Flattering  -  A work says its fans are better than not fans.
Medal Of Dishonor  -  Here's a trophy to celebrate your shameful achievement.
Above Good And Evil  -  A character claims that his objectives are more valuable than good and evil.
Universal Poison  -  All poisons do X% damage each turn.
Say Your Prayers  -  A character facing certain death simply starts praying instead of resisting.
Hollywood Giftwrap  -  A fancy wrapped box with a ribbon, optimized for easy filming.
Draconic Abomination  -  Dragons as Eldritch Abominations (Primordial Dragons).
Boss Only Level  -  A level that is just a boss fight (with maybe a stretch of land beforehand).
Forceful Kiss  -  Non-consensual kissing.
Bolt Of Divine Retribution  -  When God strikes sinners by lightning.
The Queenpin  -  A female organized crime leader.
Solar Powered Magnifying Glass  -  Magnifying glasses used to kill or burn stuff.
Danger Thin Ice  -  Somebody falls through ice and drowns, freezes to death, or simply suffers from serious frost bite.
Camera Screw  -  Poor camera programming in video games leads to a frustrating experience.
My Rule Fu Is Stronger Than Yours  -  Someone attempting Loophole Abuse gets Out-Gambitted.
Call A Human A Meatbag  -  A non-human uses a derogatory term for humans.
Badass Biker  -  A badass who rides on bikes.
Red Skies Crossover  -  A crossover in which a story element affects all parties, but said parties don't necessarily meet because of it.
The Magnificent  -  [Insert First Name Here] the [Adjective that summarizes their personality and/or what they are famous for]
Zero Approval Gambit  -  Making yourself look bad in order to accomplish good.
For Doom The Bell Tolls  -  Church bells are ominous.
All Jews Are Cheapskates  -  Stereotypes that portray Jews as greedy.
Mile Long Ship  -  When a vessel is so massive its dimensions are given in units generally used for geography.
Annoying Patient  -  A sick character is really annoying to their caretaker.
Public Domain Soundtrack  -  Free music from the public domain.
Teachers Out Of School  -  Students are shocked to learn that their teacher or teachers have a life outside of the school building.
Playing Hard To Get  -  Attracting a Love Interest by having them chase after you.
Single Specimen Species  -  A species that only has one single member.
Gendered Outfit  -  A costume is altered depending on the gender of the wearer.
Unresolved Sexual Tension  -  Two people are obviously attracted to each other, but don't get together (at least for a while).
Fainting Seer  -  A dramatic negative reaction to the future you see.
The Bad Guys Are Cops  -  The cops are even worse than the criminals.
Gender Equal Ensemble  -  Equal number of males and females in the ensemble.
Viewer Friendly Interface  -  Text on television and computer monitors is made larger for the audience's convenience.
Earn Your Bad Ending  -  A bad ending that's harder to get than the normal ending.
I Banged Your Mom  -  A guy is insulted when someone has sex with his mother.
Skip Of Innocence  -  Skipping with both arms moving together as visual cue for youthfulness.
Ring Ring CRUNCH  -  Wake me up early, will you? Stupid machine! *SMASH*
Psycho Ex Girlfriend  -  Dumped girl snaps.
Ace Custom  -  Technology modified to fit an exceptionally talented user.
Power Makes Your Hair Grow  -  Characters get larger hair with their increase in power.
Domesticated Dinosaurs  -  Prehistoric animals being kept as pets/mounts/beasts of burden/zoo animals/livestock.
Bambification  -  Deer are sweet and innocent.
We Will Use Manual Labor In The Future  -  In the future use person instead robots to manual labor.
Anti Idling  -  Ways to discourage players from being idle during gameplay.
Modular Epilogue  -  Endings that follow a template but have various parts that can change.
The Force Is Strong With This One  -  Character can sense the presence and strength of other powerful characters.
Disaster Dominoes  -  A tiny incident sets off a chain of events ending in catastrophe.
Mook Bouncer  -  Enemies that eject you to another location.
Transformation Sequence  -  Needlessly long, flashy change in appearance.
Prophecy Pileup  -  When two or more prophecies overlap.
Noodle Incident  -  An unexplained incident is referenced, and it's either funnier or worse in our heads than whatever could be explained.
Parental Sexuality Squick  -  Think about you and/or someone else having sex, no big deal. Think about your parents having sex, require Brain Bleach.
Convenient Coma  -  Getting out of a coma is easy in fiction.
Ramming Always Works  -  When missiles and lasers fail, ramming into the other ship will cause heavy damage.
Fat Suit  -  Costume designed to make the wearer look fat.
Did You Actually Believe  -  Mocking your enemy for having been foolish enough to trust you, or naive enough to think their plan would stop you.
Hand Of Glory  -  A macabre and magical candelabra made from a dead man's hand.
Giving Someone The Pointer Finger  -  Pointing at someone is a super dramatic and serious gesture.
Flying Weapon  -  This weapon moves by itself!
Alt Text  -  Text that shows up when you hover over an image.
Zettai Ryouiki  -  A clothing combination (like short skirt and overknee socks) that exposes just the thighs, often used for subtle fanservice.
Logical Weakness  -  Mundane weakness is a direct result of a character's abilities.
Ignored Epiphany  -  A moment of clarity that's quickly swept under the rug.
Thieves Guild  -  Fantasy faction that regulates and is responsible for virtually all crime.
Rogues Gallery  -  A recurring / extensive cast of antagonists.
The Dreaded Dreadnought  -  The biggest, baddest, and toughest enemy in a vehicle-combat setting tends to be called Dreadnought.
I Have The High Ground  -  Standing on tall, thin structures to make yourself look cool.
Penguins Are Ducks  -  Fictional penguins given attributes of ducks.
Chain Lightning  -  Lightning attack that jumps from one target to another.
What If  -  Altering a crucial plot point established within a continuity, and creating a whole new story from that.
Profile View Gag  -  An object that appears small turns out to be very long when viewed from another angle.
Muscles Are Meaningful  -  Large people must be strong and slow, little people must be speedy and stealthy.
Uplifted Animal  -  A normal animal that's been turned into a Talking Animal.
Bury Your Disabled  -  A disabled character gets killed off.
Switching POV  -  New chapter, new narrator.
Straight For The Commander  -  Kill off the commanding officer, and his/her army will disperse and falter.
Vampires Are Sex Gods  -  Vampires are pretty hot.
Parttime Hero  -  Hero who tries to live a normal life between heroics.
Super Fic  -  A Fan Fic which gives the characters superpowers.
Japan Takes Over The World  -  Minna, sekai wo seifuku suru zo! Translation Everyone, let's take over the world!
Unique Protagonist Asset  -  Something that makes the protagonist be the hero, instead of a hero.
Toasted Buns  -  A jet pack operator's rear end is set aflame by the jet pack.
Sneeze Of Doom  -  A character sneezes at the worst possible time.
Lethal Joke Character  -  A goofy and/or seemingly bad character that is deadly if used right.
Remixed Level  -  A level that was previously visited by the character is re-done.
One Way Visor  -  A mask or visor that completely conceals the wearer's eyes.
Villainous Demotivator  -  You Have Failed Me = bad Mook morale.
Fetish Retardant  -  Fanservice unintentionally Gone Horribly Wrong.
Big Bulky Bomb  -  A bomb that is physically extremely large. We're talking the size of a car, or bigger, here.
Anti Sue  -  A Mary Sue thinly disguised as mundane.
Water Is Blue  -  Because it's easier to draw it that way.
If You Thought That Was Bad  -  ...this even worse story should cheer you right up!
Enforced Trope  -  For various reasons, tropes are added even if the writer didn't want them.
Multilayer Facade  -  Underneath a character's disguise is...another disguise.
Dimensional Traveler  -  Character that able to travel to other planes/universes/realities, either with a device on your own..
Good Cop Bad Cop  -  Carrots and sticks for the suspect.
Floating Mask  -  Mask of Power + Power Floats
Plot Tumor  -  A storyline or plot device that begins to eclipse the entire work.
Light Feminine And Dark Feminine  -  Two female characters portray different aspects of femininity.
Beat Panel  -  A panel with no dialogue to simulate a Beat.
Point Defenseless  -  Anti-air weapons can hit anything that flies....except the Hero.
Not Wearing Tights  -  Superheroes without theatrics.
Hand Stomp  -  Stomp on someone's hands while they're hanging for dear life.
Please Wake Up  -  Not accepting/realizing that someone/something is dead.
Where Are They Now Epilogue  -  So what exactly are all the characters up to now that their story has ended?
Automatic Crossbows  -  A crossbow capable of fully automatic fire.
Braving The Blizzard  -  A character has no choice but to brave a life-threatening snowstorm.
Hidden Buxom  -  Big-breasted characters try to conceal their assets.
Bread Eggs Breaded Eggs  -  Item A, Item B, Item A+B.
After School Cleaning Duty  -  Students stay after class to clean, used as a literary device for character development.
Passed In Their Sleep  -  Someone dies in their sleep.
Intrinsic Vow  -  No matter what, they won't do that.
The Antichrist  -  Trope: A supernatural doom-bringer for the entire world/universe, usually acting in the service of a greater evil.
Artistic License Statistics  -  The creator of a work of fiction simplifies the use of statistics or probability to make the story more interesting.
Benevolent Monsters  -  No matter how dangerous the monsters are, most wouldn't hurt a fly.
Hollywood Hacking  -  Hacking is just like a Video Game in Hollywood.
The Grinch  -  Character who hates Christmas and tries to ruin it for everyone.
Apocalyptic Log  -  Records by the doomed.
Kissing In A Tree  -  A ditty used to tease a Shiptease between two characters.
Offscreen Villain Dark Matter  -  Villains never have problems funding all their expensive evil plans.
Facial Scruff  -  When facial hair is seen as odd, unsightly, unseemly or slovenly.
Moral Pragmatist  -  Joining the side of good because it's practical.
Sung Through Musical  -  The dialogue is entirely sung.
Interchangeable Asian Cultures  -  Elements of one Asian culture are misattributed to another Asian culture.
Arcadia  -  Trope: An out-of-the-way rural area where you get away from it all and enjoy simple pleasures.
Tele Frag  -  Trying to teleport somewhere that's already occupied leaves a mess.
Gigantic Moon  -  The moon appears much larger than it ought to.
Hellhound  -  Big evil supernatural doggie.
Hardboiled Detective  -  Stereotypical tough, cynical, hard-drinking detective.
Minmaxers Delight  -  A single ability, feat, or Character Customization option so universally useful that everyone may as well take it.
Left The Background Music On  -  Background music turns out to be In-Universe.
Implied Trope  -  A trope is hinted at, but not explicitly shown.
Spit Shine  -  Spitting on something to clean dirt off of it.
Developing Doomed Characters  -  Spending too much time developing characters that are likely going to die later on.
Heroic RROD  -  Physical breakdown from overexerting oneself.
Troper  -  Us.
Press Hat  -  A hat with a note that says Press, signifying that whoever wears it is a journalist.
What Other Galaxies  -  A galaxy is treated as if it represents the entire universe.
Notzilla  -  A Stock Parody of a certain giant monster. AwGodzillaChoo!
Mouthing The Profanity  -  A character visibly mouths a profanity without making a sound.
Villains Never Lie  -  Villain manipulates the hero by telling the truth.
Fire Ice Lightning  -  Three core magic elements are fire, ice and lightning.
Pale Females Dark Males  -  Female non-human characters that have lighter-colored bodies than male ones.
Monster Facade  -  Scary monster on the outside, heart of gold on the inside.
Mind Control Eyes  -  When you're mind-controlled, your eyes look weird.
Burn The Orphanage  -  Burning down an orphanage.
Oop North  -  Northern England in stereotypes.
Slave Liberation  -  Freeing people from slavery.
Dangerous Backswing  -  Taking out someone standing behind you by swinging a melee weapon over your head. (Might be an enemy, might be an ally.)
Munchkin  -  The Trope: Plays games to "win", even if that's not the point of the game.
Eye Am Watching You  -  I'M. [points to self] WATCHING. [makes a V sign with fingers, points to eyes] YOU. [points].
The Resolution Will Not Be Identified  -  The final installment of a work is released without announcement, without indication within, or both.
Darkhorse Casting  -  Obscure or little-known actor casted on purpose.
Inhumanly Beautiful Race  -  A non-human species is beautiful beyond human standards.
Defeating The Undefeatable  -  The one who never loses is finally defeated.
Horror Struck  -  A skeptical character freaks out upon discovering a supernatural threat is Real After All.
Oedipus Complex  -  Son wants to supplant his father. Incestuous overtones involving his mother optional.
Simple Yet Opulent  -  Fancy, expensive things that are not visually complicated.
Auto Erotica  -  If the car's A-Rockin', Don't Come A-Knockin'!
Rightly Self Righteous  -  A character sees themselves as morally superior because they really are.
She Is Not My Girlfriend  -  Denying a perceived relationship.
Eyes Are Unbreakable  -  A character's eyeball is intact after an injury that, logically, should have damaged it.
Predator Turned Protector  -  At first they wanted to kill it, only to wind up becoming its guardian.
Polka Dork  -  If you like Polka you must be dumb, weird or a Funny Foreigner.
Cough Snark Cough  -  *cough*Coughing to*cough*hide*cough*snarky comments*cough*.
Confetti Drop  -  Winners of game shows have confetti dumped on them.
No Doubt The Years Have Changed Me  -  Character is unrecognizable after being away for many years.
Seppuku  -  Ritual suicide as a means of atonement, often by means of self-inflicted disembowelment or impalement.
Stealth Insult  -  An insult that is subtle and meant to be misinterpreted.
Awful Truth  -  A truth that the people involved would rather not be true.
Logging Onto The Fourth Wall  -  Seeing a website in a work of fiction will make people check if the URL really works.
Banging For Help  -  A physically restrained character attempts to attract help by producing a banging noise.
Sleeps With Both Eyes Open  -  Falling asleep with your eyes open.
Brain Fever  -  A sickness in the brain caused by shock or stress.
Level In Boss Clothing  -  A boss fight that acts almost exactly the same as a regular level.
Rogues Gallery Transplant  -  Started in Superhero A's Rogues Gallery, now a part of Superhero B's.
Fake Fabric Fashion Faux Pas  -  Characters are met with derision because they wear clothes made out of artificial fabric.
Morality Chain Beyond The Grave  -  Character does good because their deceased loved one would not approve otherwise.
Was Once A Man  -  Some monsters turn out to have once been human.
More Hero Than Thou  -  Characters argue who should perform the Heroic Sacrifice based on their heroism.
Attack Drone  -  Remote-controlled/automated mobile weapons platform.
Girl Friday  -  The dutiful female working behind the scenes.
Deadly Walls  -  If you touch the walls, you die.
Slouch Of Villainy  -  A villain slouches in their chair to show their aloofness.
Decomposite Character  -  Between generations, a character splits in two.
Cherry Blossoms  -  Common Japanese motif for life, death, spring, love, and renewal.
Curiosity Killed The Cast  -  Something looks ominous and dangerous. The characters go check it out.
Planet Of Hats  -  One quirk defines a world/species.
Reassigned To Antarctica  -  A person is assigned to an undesirable post as a punishment or death sentence.
Animesque  -  Non-Japanese series that have noticeable anime influences.
Four Lines All Waiting  -  The series has many simultaneous plots. Have fun trying to follow them all.
The So Called Coward  -  Everyone calls him coward. They're about to be proven wrong.
Beard Of Directors  -  A director worth his salt must have a beard.
Loners Will Stay Alone  -  Being emotionally separate from people keeps you from having the skills to get close to them even when you want to.
Space Madness  -  Being in space will drive you insane.
Statuesque Stunner  -  A woman's tall height is part of her appeal.
Surprise Litter Of Puppies  -  The family pet goes missing, only to reveal that they have a mate and babies.
Unique Enemy  -  A type of Mook that shows up just once in the entire game.
Justified Extra Lives  -  In-game explanation for the existence of 1-ups.
Metaphor Is My Middle Name  -  A Stock Phrase along the lines of "danger is my middle name".
Stalking Is Love  -  Stalker manages to score because he's a stalker.
Beneath Suspicion  -  A character connected with the murder victim who was never a suspect turns out to have done it.
Mini Golf Episode  -  An episode or scene takes place at a mini-golf course — golf-themed hijinks typically ensue.
And That Little Girl Was Me  -  A character tells a story about themselves in the third-person.
Sprite Polygon Mix  -  2D and 3D graphics featured together.
Motion Capture  -  Recording a real person's movements and transitioning them to animation.
Impeded Communication  -  Communication is harmed by an outside force.
Big Ball Of Violence  -  A ball of smoke overlaps two cartoon/video game characters fighting.
Disneyland Dad  -  Absentee parents who try to buy their kid's love.
Do I Really Sound Like That  -  Hearing your own voice replayed and hating it.
Mercy Mode  -  If you're failing so much, the game tries to make itself easier.
Guess Who Im Marrying  -  Stock scene about "You'll never know who's gonna be your stepdad/stepmom! And you probably don't even want to, but he/she seems pretty legit to me...".
Crazy Homeless People  -  EEEEWWW! Homeless people!! KILL THEM WITH FIRE!!
Obvious Rule Patch  -  A rule existing solely to counter one specific situation.
Schrodingers Player Character  -  Choose one character to play. The others don't exist in the story.
No Man Should Have This Power  -  No one person can truly be trusted with this, ergo it has to be destroyed.
Magicians Are Wizards  -  Stage Magicians can do actual wizardry.
Adaptive Armor  -  Armor that can change form and function based on who wears it and where.
What An Idiot  -  A character does something so idiotic that the audience (and sometimes other characters) won't be sympathetic.
Socketed Equipment  -  Items you can equip to your equipment to enhance them.
Parental Fashion Veto  -  A situation with kid(s) dressed wrong when going out, and parents are not pleased.
Hey Thats My Line  -  John Doe says Richard Roe's catchphrase, usually followed by Richard getting annoyed at John.
He Also Did  -  A creator does something beyond what they're most known for.
Parental Favoritism  -  Parent(s) have a favorite kid.
Self Defeating Prophecy  -  The very existence of prophetic foreknowledge Screws Destiny.
Muck Monster  -  A living, moving mass of filth, poison and refuse.
Evil Tower Of Ominousness  -  Obviously Evil tower.
Mini Boss  -  A boss that you encounter in the middle of a level, stage, or world that is not the main boss.
Fanwork Ban  -  A fanwork of a series receives a cease and desist from the show itself.
Hell Seeker  -  A character who tries to get themselves to hell.
Nitro Boost  -  Grab this item for a temporary boost in speed.
Gods Hands Are Tied  -  God has reasons why they can't just fix everything.
Harmony Versus Discipline  -  Acceptance vs Control.
Sweet Baker  -  A person who regularly bakes has a sweet personality.
Eleventh Hour Superpower  -  Hero gains a very powerful ability, very close to the end of the story.
Vindicated By Reruns  -  A work becomes more appreciated through its reruns.
Aesoptinum  -  Applied Phlebotinum that only exists to teach An Aesop.
All For Nothing  -  The results of a complex story/plot are all undone in one fell swoop.
Crew Of One  -  A single person steers a vehicle/operates a weapon designed for two or more crew.
Dark Lord On Life Support  -  The bad guy is incapable of living without the assistance of a machine or another person.
Onrushing Army  -  Armies charge straight into battle with little regard for tactics or formation.
Annoying Younger Sibling  -  A younger sibling who annoys their older siblings.
Continuity Creep  -  A series with no continuity gradually gets one.
Tongue Suicide  -  A character tries to take their own life by biting off or swallowing their own tongue.
Defusing The Tyke Bomb  -  A character believes they can rescue the poor Tyke-Bomb.
Ultimate Showdown Of Ultimate Destiny  -  In an Intercontinuity Crossover battle between character X and character Y, who would win?
Last Of His Kind  -  The last survivor of an order, civilization, or species.
Token Romance  -  A romantic subplot that is shoehorned into the main plot.
Archangel Uriel  -  One of the archangels, the one that stands at the gate of Lost Eden.
Fertile Blood  -  When blood is spilled onto the ground, life (usually plants) sprout up from it.
Marionette Master  -  A character who uses dolls, puppets, marionettes and mannequins to do their bidding. If it involves machinery, the character is a Robot Master.
Extreme Libido  -  Someone has an unhealthy sex obsession.
Pie In The Face  -  Pastry thrust into the faces of others for comedic effect.
Pride Before A Fall  -  A story begins with a prideful character falling from grace.
Psycho Strings  -  Those loud shrieking string sounds that let you know when something bad happens.
Fever Dream Episode  -  During a Sick Episode, the sick character either sees things or dreams for the whole episode.
Dont Call Me Sir  -  A person in authority doesn't like being referred to by their formal title.
Birthday Hater  -  A character who, for one reason or another, doesn't like celebrating their birthday.
Disapproving Look  -  ಠ_ಠ
Delayed Reaction  -  Someone doesn't react to a shocking statement until several moments later.
Transgender  -  Identifying with a gender other than the one you've been assigned to at birth.
Strength Equals Worthiness  -  Proving one's strength equates to being genuinely worthy.
Dungeon Town  -  A town in an RPG that plays like a regular dungeon rather than safe haven.
Tickle Torture  -  Torture via tickling and usually nothing else.
Bad Humor Truck  -  Ice cream trucks are used by bad people.
Sudden Video Game Moment  -  A special case of Art Shift where everything turns into a videogame.
Cruel Elephant  -  Elephants that are violent and aggressive.
Missed Him By That Much  -  Two characters just barely miss running into each other.
Cold Flames  -  Fire that isn't hot.
Spare A Messenger  -  An individual or group spared after a battle because it's part of their attacker's plan.
Unproblematic Prostitution  -  Being a prostitute is awesome!
Five Finger Discount  -  A character transfers money from a victim's pocket to his own.
Weight And Switch  -  Swapping an object for something else of similar weight to avoid setting off a trap.
The Computer Shall Taunt You  -  The game throws insults at you.
The Benchwarmer  -  A character who is often, usually, or always a reserve player of the team.
Flyover Country  -  Nothing interesting happens in the space between New York City and Los Angeles.
Pieces Of God  -  God got broken into many pieces; this is the result of what happened.
Jaw Drop  -  When a character's jaw drops in surprise or shock.
Number One Dime  -  A mundane item with pricelessly sentimental value to a certain character.
Newer Than They Think  -  Fan thinks a trope, plot, or line goes farther back in history than it actually does.
Sentai  -  The Squad with multicolored superheroes, Japanese-style.
Dispense With The Pleasantries  -  A character is bluntly dismissive of flattery and/or small-talk.
Artifact Title  -  A title that is no longer relevant.
Grumpy Old Man  -  An old man or woman with a grouchy disposition.
Delivery Guy Infiltration  -  Character pretends to be making a delivery to be granted access to a secure premises.
Accidental Pun  -  No pun intended.
Kung Fu Sonic Boom  -  When an attack is so powerful, the impact warps the surrounding area like a thunderclap.
Its A Wonderful Plot  -  Character in distress is shown how life would be like with one key change to the past (usually their complete absence).
Spring Loaded Corpse  -  When an undead character or enemy is Faking the Dead only to rise up and attack.
Rule Of Empathy  -  The more sympathetic a character is, the more likely they are to survive.
Four Temperament Ensemble  -  The cheerful, easygoing one (Sanguine), the passionate, short-tempered one (Choleric), the calm, friendly one (Phlegmatic), and the methodical, brooding one (Melancholic), along with an optional fifth neutral one. (Eclectic)
Generation Xerox  -  Kids have the same basic story of their parents/ancestors.
Break Out The Museum Piece  -  Inability to use current technology is no object.
Civilized Animal  -  Animals that do human things but still remain in their animal body and tend to adhere to the natural ecosystem.
Dustbin School  -  A school where all the problem children go.
Numbered Sequels  -  The names of sequels contain numbers to show the order in which they were made, or the order in which they take place.
Bearer Of Bad News  -  Someone doesn't know that bad news. And you have to tell them.
Cheery Pink  -  Pink means cheerfulness.
Terminally Exclusive Club  -  An exclusive club whose set of rules makes it impossible for any newcomers to join.
Heal The Cutie  -  An emotionally broken character (who may have been the Cutie prior) is healed back up into The Cutie.
Dream Crushing Handicap  -  A physical handicap prevents one from doing what one wants.
First Friend  -  The very first friend you ever made, regardless of whether or not it's in childhood.
Disorganized Outline Speech  -  An explanation whose structure is flawed, but the point is sound.
Mana Meter  -  Video game magic resource.
Who Dares  -  Some characters like using the word "dare" to sound imposing to those who disturb them.
Putting The Pal In Principal  -  The archetypal personable school principal.
Delusions Of Eloquence  -  Character uses big words to act smart but gets them wrong.
Scotty Time  -  You have much less time than you need to get the job done. Then it gets done.
Ammo Using Melee Weapon  -  A melee weapon that requires some sort of mundane or fantastic ammunition to use to full effect.
Drunk On The Dark Side  -  A villain destroys and Chews The Scenery to celebrate becoming all-powerful.
Chronically Killed Actor  -  Actor is known for getting killed in films.
Killer Rabbit  -  A monster is much more dangerous than it appears.
Murder Into Malevolence  -  Murder victims become evil ghosts.
Trope Breaker  -  Something that would render a trope useless.
Censorship By Spelling  -  Don't want the kiddies to understand what you're talking about? S-p-e-l-l i-t o-u-t.
Sword Of Plot Advancement  -  It's relevant to the story, and it's useful in combat, too.
Laser Guided Tykebomb  -  A child born and bred to kill someone specific.
Within Parameters  -  Foreboding readings are brushed off as unimportant.
Space Clouds  -  Fictional nebulae behave like clouds.
Admiring The Abomination  -  Someone is extremely fascinated by what's about to kill them.
Mutant Draft Board  -  A bureaucratic government institution created to control a large population of super-powered individuals.
Samurai Cowboy  -  A samurai that is also a cowboy.
Outranking Your Job  -  A military officer has duties that no one in real life would be assigned if their rank was that high.
Shout Out  -  A reference to a person or another work.
Telepathic Sprinklers  -  In fiction, when one fire sprinkler goes off, all the others do, too.
Impossibly Tacky Clothes  -  Clothing that is considered ridiculous and tacky in-universe.
Identical Stranger  -  Two complete strangers look eerily similar.
Mage In Manhattan  -  A villain from a Magical Land comes to our world to cause havoc.
Selective Obliviousness  -  A character cannot or refuses to accept a fact.
Player Tic  -  Video game players habitually doing something that doesn't affect gameplay.
Suspiciously Small Army  -  Armies are smaller than they should be, because of technical or financial limitations.
Inescapable Ambush  -  You can't get out of the room until you defeat all the enemies.
The Spock  -  The logical intellectual.
Ridiculously Loud Commercial  -  A commercial is much louder than the actual program you're watching.
Hakuna Matata  -  A song that means no worries for the rest of your days.
Fright Beside Them  -  The hero discovers they have been cozying up to an impostor when their real friend is revealed to be somewhere else.
Heat Wave  -  It's hot out there... like, thermometer-breaking hot!
Hilarity Ensues  -  There are no realistic consequences for a dangerous, yet funny course of action.
Opposite Sex Clone  -  A clone of the opposite sex of the original.
Having A Heart  -  That wasn't a metaphor, by the way. I'm talking about an actual body part.
Played For Laughs  -  Using a (usually non-comedic) trope for comedy.
Worthless Foreign Degree  -  Job qualifications acquired in another country don't cross borders.
Tiny Headed Behemoth  -  A comically small head in a huge and imposing body.
Sorting Algorithm Of Face Heel Turning  -  How likely will a HeelFace Turn or FaceHeel Turn happen?
No Loves Intersect  -  Everyone ends up with their One True Love without any sort of Triang Relations.
Shipping Goggles  -  Shippers find Ship Tease everywhere. Even where it's not.
Overly Long Scream  -  AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA-
Escapist Character  -  Character depicts who the audience wants to be.
Be Yourself  -  Don't try to be someone else.
Beleaguered Assistant  -  The character who, in relation to the Pointy-Haired Boss, would rather be anything or anywhere else.
Valentines Day Episode  -  An episode or work set on or involving Valentine's Day.
Framing Device  -  Story within another story...
The Cobblers Children Have No Shoes  -  When one's professional skills aren't applied to their personal maladies.
Speaks Fluent Animal  -  A character is able to talk to animals.
Elimination Houdini  -  Horrible contestant on a reality show that overstays their welcome.
Instant Awesome Just Add Dragons  -  Adding dragons just to follow the Rule of Cool.
Gorgeous George  -  A wrestling gimmick of a pretty boy who acts androgynous.
Up Marketing  -  Marketing your expensive product specifically for those who can afford it.
Odd Job Gods  -  An excessively specialized deity.
Cuckoosnarker  -  Sarcasm clues us in that the Cloudcuckoolander is clearly not as dumb or crazy as their eccentricity will have you believe.
Seen It All Suicide  -  I've seen everything I've ever needed to know. Now it's time to die.
Scapegoat Creator  -  It's the (insert production member here)'s fault, regardless of his actual involvement.
Magically Inept Fighter  -  A physically-inclined combatant who is weak in terms of magic powers.
Digital Piracy Is Okay  -  Artists encourage/don't mind digital piracy of their own work.
Triple Shifter  -  Someone who works multiple jobs or leads a double life has little time to rest.
Slow Laser  -  Laser beams depicted as slower-than-light energy bullets.
Desk Sweep Of Rage  -  A character swipes everything off of a desk, either out of rage or frustration
Kid Hero All Grown Up  -  The Kid Hero grows up.
Puni Plush  -  An art style where everything is round and cutesy.
Evil Is Easy  -  It's easy to go the path of evil.
False Camera Effects  -  Simulating camera effects on a non-filmed visual medium.
We Were Rehearsing A Play  -  Trying to pass off suspicous activity as a play rehearsal portraying said activity.
Self Titled Album  -  An album that uses the band/musician's name for a title. Usually a debut release.
Madness Mantra  -  Insanity leads to constant repetition.
Arc Hero  -  The same old Hero, with a new partner or Anti-Hero foil in each major arc.
Arbitrary Skepticism  -  A character refuses to believe something, despite already believing, being involved, or even being something equally or even more unlikely.
Villain Team Up  -  Villains of the hero's Rogues Gallery form an alliance.
Obsolete Mentor  -  The Mentor has been become useless because everyone surpassed them.
Load Bearing Hero  -  A protagonist holds a falling object to save the members of main cast or others.
Game Within A Game  -  A Mini-Game that's shown in-universe to be a video game that the Player Character is playing.
Variety Show  -  A show, that shows a variety of performances not limited to a single kind of entertainment. It's usually hosted.
Fashionable Asymmetry  -  So their clothes aren't even. It still looks good.
Alliterative Name  -  First and last name have the same first letter or sound.
Alien Lunch  -  Food that normal people — of any culture or preference — would not find appealing in any way.
The Aristocrats  -  The Trope: A family goes into a talent agent and does an unbelievably Squicky act, which they call "The Aristocrats".
Audience Surrogate  -  A character is written without strong characteristics of their own, so that the members of the audience can identify with them.
Multi Track Drifting  -  Heavy vehicles handling like sports cars.
Teleportation Misfire  -  Getting teleported somewhere else than intended.
Staged Pedestrian Accident  -  Oh God, you obviously just ran me over! I am in very real pain! I'm gonna sue!
That Man Is Dead  -  Someone completely disregards their old identity for their new one.
Mysterious Middle Initial  -  The middle name of a character without any significant backstory.
Sarcasm Failure  -  A Deadpan Snarker can't come up with a sarcastic response to a situation.
No Zombie Cannibals  -  Zombies don't eat each other.
Morning Sickness  -  Pregnant women puking in the morning.
Lovable Coward  -  A cowardly but otherwise sympathetic character.
Sugary Malice  -  Soft-Spoken Sadist in the guise of The Pollyanna.
Need A Hand Or A Handjob  -  The result of the person talking being too vague.
Dont Try This At Home  -  A disclaimer made for the audience's safety, because you might get hurt or die doing it yourself.
Second Verse Curse  -  What, this song has more than one stanza?!
Box Office Bomb  -  The movie's budget (including marketing costs) exceeds its gross revenue.
Murder Dot Com  -  Murder or other sensational criminal activity is broadcast online for all to see, sometimes tied to the visitor counter of the page.
Ghost Butler  -  A door shuts behind you and locks by itself as soon as you pass through it.
Achievement System  -  Earning achievements in video games as an incentive to play better.
Days Of Future Past  -  Their future resembles our distant past.
Dropping The Bombshell  -  One character catches on to something hidden and distressing during conversation, then reveals it.
Pest Controller  -  (Someone with) an ability to command pests to do their bidding.
Trial Balloon Question  -  Testing the result of a question by disguising it as a hypothetical question.
Never Bring A Gun To A Knife Fight  -  Melee weapons are superior to ranged ones.
Eye Cam  -  The camera shows the view behind someone's eye.
Big Brother Is Watching  -  Sinister Surveillance by a dystopia.
The Untwist  -  The Captain Obvious Reveal that many viewers expected to be a Red Herring ends up being played straight.
Post Game Retaliation  -  A character, furious because he lost, physically assaults his rival but things end worse for him.
Condemned Contestant  -  Those convicted of crimes are often volunteered for dangerous things.
Zeroes And Ones  -  Computers are represented as being in binary.
Nose Art  -  Painting stuff on a plane, just because.
Spare Body Parts  -  Aliens have more of a body part than humans do.
You Cant Thwart Stage One  -  The heroes cannot stop the early stages of the Evil Plan.
With Great Power Comes Great Responsibility  -  The newcomer hero realizes that they should use their powers only to protect those who they're in charge of.
Weird Aside  -  Weird comment in passing.
Slurpasaur  -  Ordinary lizards/animals used as dinosaurs or giant monsters.
Crystal Landscape  -  A setting made of or filled with crystals, gemstones and jewels.
No FEMA Response  -  In times of crisis that requires federal aid, the government will either ignore it or Quarantine with Extreme Prejudice.
Changed My Jumper  -  You're wearing a t-shirt and jeans in medieval England, and nobody around you thinks it's particularly odd.
Total Party Kill  -  Entire party dies unheroically.
His Name Really Is Barkeep  -  A character's moniker by which others refer to him is his real name.
Murder Simulators  -  Violent media clearly causes violent crime!
Uncanny Village  -  A perfect little country town that isn't.
Trapped In Another World  -  Character gets thrust into a new world.
Grew Beyond Their Programming  -  Just a Machine? But they're doing things they weren't programmed to.
Vomit Indiscretion Shot  -  Character throws up messily on-camera.
Last Name Basis  -  Addressing others by just their surname.
Good Is Impotent  -  Pure evil is proactive and efficient. Pure good...isn't.
Super Supremacist  -  A supervillain who believes that superpowers makes them superior to everyone else.
Toxic Inc  -  A company that pollutes heavily.
Missing Floor  -  A numbered floor (often with numbers associated with bad luck) is omitted from public listings, such as on elevators.
Simpleton Voice  -  If a character sounds stupid, then s/he is stupid. Or so it seems.
Animal Religion  -  Animals having their own religious institutions and belief systems.
Hood Hopping  -  A chase scene where people leap across car hoods.
Oblivious Astronomers  -  Objects in space go unnoticed for much longer than they realistically would.
Everybody Has Lots Of Sex  -  In fiction, people have a lot of sex.
On The Rebound  -  Characters A and B breaks up after a serious relationship. Character B responds by launching into a relationship with Character C.
Psychopomp  -  Carries the souls of the dead to the afterlife.
Honor Among Thieves  -  Lawbreakers with their own laws.
Dynamic Difficulty  -  A game's difficulty adjusts in real-time to match the player's performance.
Tiered By Name  -  Additions or alterations to names signify stronger versions of said beings.
Action Dress Rip  -  The heroine cuts/tears off a piece of a long dress for better maneuverability during action sequences.
Botanical Abomination  -  The Eldritch Abomination is a plant or fungus.
Sweet On Polly Oliver  -  Straight male is confusingly attracted to a girl pretending to be a guy.
Start Of Darkness  -  A Prequel or Flashback about how the villain became a villain.
Alternate Universe Reed Richards Is Awesome  -  Alternate Universe character can make changes to the status quo that the main continuity counterpart can't.
Ratings Stunt  -  Something completely different during sweeps week.
New Wave Music  -  The Lighter and Softer offspring of Punk Rock and the father of Synth-Pop.
Deuteragonist  -  The second-most important character in the story.
Swallowed Whole  -  Monster eats people/things without chewing.
Menu Time Lockout  -  Pausing freezes time, but you can still fiddle with your inventory.
Food Pills  -  A meal served as a pill or similar super-compact form.
Spelling Bonus  -  Spell a word, get a bonus.
Wicked Wasps  -  Wasps are mean. Especially in fiction.
Occams Razor  -  The simpler it is, the less likely it is to be wrong/fail.
Oh Crap Fakeout  -  A character fakes an Oh, Crap! to mock his opponent.
Our Nymphs Are Different  -  Female Nature Spirits from Greek Mythology.
Phantom Zone  -  An alternate dimension that the main characters can battle in.
Toy Ship  -  Shipping fictional children together.
Construction Catcalls  -  Construction workers that ogle and whistle at the ladies as they walk pass.
Fair Play Whodunnit  -  You can solve the case at the same time as the detective, if you're smart enough.
Saying Sound Effects Out Loud  -  Spoken onomatopoeia.
Talk To Everyone  -  Talking to every single NPC you encounter in hopes that you'll figure out where to go or get something important.
Love Hotels  -  Japanese hotels built specifically for the purpose of allowing couples to have sex in privacy.
Overdrawn At The Blood Bank  -  Just how much blood does one person have?
Overshadowed By Controversy  -  The controversy is everything people remember about these works.
Really Seven Hundred Years Old  -  Extraordinarily ancient character who looks much younger.
Do Not Taunt Cthulhu  -  Pissing off vastly powerful beings is a bad idea.
Rightful King Returns  -  After all hell broke loose during his absence, the true superior chief has come back to fix things.
Jacob And Esau  -  Each parent favours a different child — or each child favours a different parent.
Selfless Wish  -  A character forfeits their wish on behalf of someone else.
Badass Army  -  A Badass Crew multiplied; do not mess with anyone on this brigade.
The Muse  -  A person, usually a female, who gives the writer inspiration for their work.
Anthropomorphic Personification  -  Living embodiments of abstract concepts.
I Fell For Hours  -  A character has a long fall.
Sherlock Homage  -  A reference to Sherlock Holmes.
Improbable Infant Survival  -  Way too young to die.
Men Use Violence Women Use Communication  -  Facing a threat, men destroy it, women try to compromise with it.
Lethally Stupid  -  A person's lack of intelligence causes problems (and sometimes death) for others.
Colour Coded Timestop  -  Colored visual aid for when Time Stands Still.
Useless Spleen  -  The spleen in fiction is either useless and/or prone to injury.
Portable Hole  -  Holes as tangible objects.
No Animals Were Harmed  -  A disclaimer that there were no injuries or deaths related to animals.
Be As Unhelpful As Possible  -  Might as well have not asked them at all.
Lighthearted Rematch  -  A rematch two or more characters have for fun when all the tension and conflict is off, and no strings are attached.
Practically Joker  -  An Expy of The Joker.
Final Exam Boss  -  This boss requires most of/all the abilities you've learned in the game so far for you to defeat it.
Omniscient Database  -  Highly improbable crime-solving search engines.
Ocular Gushers  -  Crying a river, but usually a waterfall.
Tom Swifty  -  A punny adverb when attributing a quotation, based around the content of the quotation.

Cruelty Is The Only Option  -  Mandatory Video Game Cruelty Potential.

Fake Arm Disarm  -  Character's cybernetic or artificial body part is destroyed instead of their real ones.

Useless Superpowers  -  When great power can't help when you really need it.
Its Personal  -  Character has a very close, emotional investment in the story's conflict.
Tech Points  -  Abstract points you buy or improve your character's abilities with.
Divided For Adaptation  -  Adaptions split to multiple parts.
Crash Into Hello  -  Eventual love interests meet after accidentally crashing into each other.
Understanding Boyfriend  -  Boyfriend acts as an emotional pillar for things most people wouldn't.

Cuckoolander Commentator  -  The Cloud Cuckoolander is also The Announcer.
Space Orcs  -  Aliens, or species in a high-tech setting, distinguished by being warlike, violent and primitive.
Lead Bassist  -  When a bassist is not ignored and functions as the Face of the Band.
Away In A Manger  -  A baby is born on Christmas eve ... by accident.
Reverse Grip  -  Holding a weapon with the blade end towards the pinky.
Extra Turn  -  An ability in a turn-based game that lets the player perform extra actions.
Handsome Heroic Caveman  -  A good-looking (to modern day audiences) caveman who fills a heroic role.

Earth Is The Center Of The Universe  -  That's a lot of unusual activity for such a small planet.
Somebody Named Nobody  -  A character is given the name "Nobody" (or a translation thereof) to make them seem more stranger and/or mysterious.
Leno Device  -  An event is only significant once late-night comics start making fun of it.
Blatant Item Placement  -  My, this is a conveniently placed item!
White Hair Black Heart  -  A character's villainy is signified by the whiteness of their hair.
Hot As Hell  -  Satan is sexy.
That Was Not A Dream  -  When the answer to Or Was It a Dream? is "no".
Lemony Narrator  -  Narrating in an unconventional fashion in third-person.
Mugging The Monster  -  Criminal targets someone much more dangerous than they appear.
AB Negative  -  Everyone in fiction has a rare blood type, leading to drama.
Sniff Sniff Nom  -  Sniffing something before eating it.
A Round Of Drinks For The House  -  In a moment of celebration a character announces to everyone in the bar that they're buying drink for all of them.
Mind Over Manners  -  It's wrong to screw with other people's minds. So the good guys don't do it.
Billy Needs An Organ  -  Someone needs to have an organ replaced so someone else does something crazy to get them their needed organ.
Knights Armor Hideout  -  Is there an empty suit of armour on display? Someone's hiding inside.
What Measureis A Non Cute  -  If it's not cute and adorable, it's not good.
Improbable Age  -  For someone so young, this character has gone implausibly far in life.
Crack Pairing  -  Ships that don't make any logical sense.

Dominatrix  -  A sexualised dominant woman.

Garlic Is Abhorrent  -  Garlic is seen as disgusting or lower-class for its taste and/or smell.
Immortality Hurts  -  Just because you can't die, doesn't mean you can't get hurt.
Nuclear Weapons Taboo  -  Nuclear weapons are a big no-no, especially in Japanese media.
Most Fanfic Writers Are Girls  -  Whatever a work is about, most of the Fan Fic will be romance (including a lot of Slash), mostly written by girls and young ladies.
Inspector Oblivious  -  A hero who has no idea they're defeating the villain.
Grievous Bottley Harm  -  Using a glass bottle as a weapon.
Instant Bandages  -  When a character gets bandages the moment they are injured, despite it not usually making sense.
Artistic Age  -  Don't judge a person's age by their looks.

Poison Mushroom  -  A power-up that is actually a power-down.

Improbably Female Cast  -  Cast is disproportionately female when compared to a Real Life analogue.

Tentacle Rope  -  Tied up with tentacles.
Martial Pacifist  -  Does not like starting a fight, but will sure finish one.
Sdrawkcab Speech  -  Something is spoken or written backwards.
A Friend In Need  -  A character who proves their loyalty and friendship by helping their friend when it would be easier not to and other people would not blame them for not doing so.
Baku  -  A tapir-like Youkai that eats bad dreams.
Man Of Wealth And Taste  -  A villain who is rich and fashionable.
Stronger With Age  -  A character/monster whose power continues to grow instead of declining with old age.
We Are Team Cannon Fodder  -  Only the main character affects the plot, the rest of the cast are benchwarmers at best.
Abandoned War Child  -  Child left neglected during the war.
Cut And Paste Suburb  -  All the houses in this neighborhood look exactly the same.
Tragic One Shot Character  -  A single episode character whose death impacts the protagonist.
Mooning  -  A character exposes their buttocks often in a way of playing a joke or showing contempt.

Lust  -  A deep desire for something immaterial.
Fake Food  -  You know that perfect-looking burger you see on TV? It ain't real food.
Groupie Brigade  -  A swarm of crazed and often screaming fans.
Sincerity Mode  -  When you sincerely mean what you say.
Asian And Nerdy  -  When The Smart Guy is Asian.
