Absurdly Low Level Cap  -  A Level-Cap that is easily reachable before the end of the game.
Protectorate  -  Someone swore to defend this thing.
Word Of Dante  -  A Big Name Fan's statement regarding the work is treated as Canon by the rest of the fanbase.
Science Is Bad  -  Science being portrayed as cold and emotionless.
Only So Many Canadian Actors  -  The acting talent pool is so small in this country/region, you'll see the same actors in a variety of different shows. note Or conversely, Family Kid Com = Junior A. Degrassi = Major juniors.
The Capital Of Brazil Is Buenos Aires  -  Brazil is considered indistinguishable from the Hispanic countries in South America.
New Meat  -  The newbie in warfare.
Children Raise You  -  Looking after a child brings Character Development.
Liminal Time  -  Transitional periods are important.
Fighter Mage Thief  -  The three basic RPG character types: the brawn, the brains, and the sneak.
Scissors Cuts Rock  -  Overcoming a tactical disadvantage in battle through sheer brute force or trickery.
Prolonged Video Game Sequel  -  A newer installment in a video game franchise is notably longer than earlier ones.
Wicked Heart Symbol  -  Heart motifs used with villainous characters for Subverted Innocence.
Scars Are Forever  -  The visual aftermath of severe wounds are permanent.
Soul Crushing Desk Job  -  A character has a menial job that pays well enough, but loathes it very much.
Schematized Prop  -  Diagrams, blueprints, and tech specs for important objects in a series.
Kill One Others Get Stronger  -  If one member of this group is killed, all others' respective power levels grow.
Lawful Stupid  -  Upholds and/or follows laws without reason or logic.
Super Speed  -  Moving really, really fast.
Villain Ball Magnet  -  He wants to be good, but no one will see him as anything but evil.
Cybernetics Eat Your Soul  -  Replacing body parts with machinery makes you a worse person.
The Beard  -  Faking a straight relationship with a person of the opposite sex to deceive others.
First Rule Of The Yard  -  If you wind up in jail, you must assert your dominance.
Call A Rabbit A Smeerp  -  Giving real things made-up names to sound more fanciful and fantastic.
Shorttank  -  Tomboyish co-star next to the male hero.
WTH Costuming Department  -  Those costumes are supposed to be taken seriously?!
Inconvenient Summons  -  A character is annoyed at being summoned while doing something.
Use Item  -  The game instructs you to "use" an item without proper context.
Too Sexy For This Timeslot  -  Fanservice getting bad reception because it's on something meant for children.
Casting Couch  -  A character beds a producer in order to be cast in a movie (TV series, play, ad, gig, etc).
Most Writers Are Writers  -  Writers have characters who are writers.
A Handful For An Eye  -  Throwing sand, dirt or other substance in the opponent's eyes to blind them.
Restricted Expanded Universe  -  The Expanded Universe has rules it is not allowed to break, sometimes resulting in weaker storytelling.
Fake Charity  -  Donate to a good cause... except this one's a scam.
Affection Hating Kid  -  A child who hates being hugged/kissed/etc and/or seeing other people express affection.
Closet Shuffle  -  Hiding someone/something in a place like a closet.
New Old West  -  Classic Western tropes applied to a contemporary or future setting.
Hitler Cam  -  A view from slightly below a person standing alone to make them look tall and important.
Consummation Counterfeit  -  Brides fake a bloodstain on the sheets of the marriage bed, as it is indicative of virginity and consummation.
Male Band Female Singer  -  Everyone in the band has a Y chromosome. Except for their vocalist.
Win The Crowd  -  The first few minutes of a work tell you that this is gonna be awesome.
Curse Of Babel  -  One or more characters lose the ability to speak or communicate clearly for an episode or arc.
Blackface  -  The racist tradition of white actors painting themselves black, often with exaggerated red lips, in order to caricature black people.
Foe Tossing Charge  -  Charging and knocking enemies aside.
Kissing Cousins  -  Romantic and/or sexual interaction/attraction between cousins.
Kick The Son Of A Bitch  -  Someone kicked the dog, but it doesn't seem as bad because the dog was mean.
Modesty Towel  -  A character wears a towel and naught else.
Apparently Human Merfolk  -  Looks perfectly (or almost perfectly) human, but can breathe underwater.
Female Misogynist  -  A girl that hates girls.
Meta Guy  -  They say what the audience would (or could) say in that particular situation.
Sealed Inside A Person Shaped Can  -  A great and powerful being or spell is locked away in a human to keep it from going anywhere.
Blinding Bangs  -  Hair that obscures eyes to underscore shyness or dimwittedness
An Arm And A Leg  -  Relevant dismemberment.
Lottery Of Doom  -  A lottery where to win is to lose.
Attack Reflector  -  A defensive maneuver that sends an opponent's attacks back to them.
Reading The Stage Directions Out Loud  -  Literally reading the script.
My Eyes Are Leaking  -  Character who claims to not have human emotions is revealed to because they can cry.
Liquid Assets  -  Physical or other attributes are treated as a transferable substance.
Everythings Better With Plushies  -  Licensed plushies are a great merchandise style.
The End Of The Beginning  -  The end of the story is the beginning of a new era.
Villain Decay  -  Often due to losing to the heroes time and again, a villain gradually goes from being really threatening to completely harmless.
The Elevator From Ipanema  -  All elevators play "The Girl from Ipanema" all the time.
The Sandman  -  Series of Comic Books starring the King of Dreams.
Celebrity Elegy  -  A Grief Song about a deceased celebrity
I Just Want To Be Special  -  I just want to be cool, like those superheroes!
Tree Trunk Tour  -  Giant trees make for good video game levels.
True Craftsman  -  An artisan who always strives to make top-quality products, no matter what it takes.
What Song Was This Again  -  Dubbed musical number that has very different lyrics from the original version.
Buffet Buffoonery  -  All you can eat? Hmm...
Nothing Personal  -  Shorthand for informing someone that they are collateral damage and/or do not really matter to the speaker.
Precision F Strike  -  A swear word, usually a stronger one, is used by a character or work not known for using them to make a point.
Sword And Fist  -  A fighting style that combines armed and unarmed attacks.
Informed Attribute  -  The audience is told about a property of some object or character but is never shown it.
Boss Corridor  -  A corridor in a level that precedes a boss battle.
Fanvid  -  A Fan-made Video.
Red Is Heroic  -  Red is the color of heroes.
Gratuitous Latin  -  Everything in Latin sounds profound, badass, intelligent, or all of 'em.
Hollywood Autism  -  A crude, wholly inaccurate, and narrow portrayal of autism, as done by allistic writers (who are usually neurotypical as well).
Surprisingly Elite Cannon Fodder  -  Even though their superiors are trying to kill them, they get the job done... and are sent out again and again.
The Sleepless  -  Sleeping isn't a necessity for them.
Cut Short  -  A series unintentionally ends abruptly, leaving it with no ending.
Beware The Quiet Ones  -  The Quiet One has a "Not so quiet" moment.
Fog Of Doom  -  The Ominous Fog is trying to kill you.
Bollywood Nerd  -  Nerds of Indian descent.
The Glomp  -  A tackle hug.
In Love With Your Carnage  -  Your bloodlust excites me.
Working With The Ex  -  Characters who used to be a couple keep seeing each others, usually for professional reasons.
The Chick  -  Socially adept female member of the Five-Man Band who mediates conflicts within the group.
Cute Bookworm  -  Adorable nerd.
Kids Driving Cars  -  Anyone not old enough to have a license driving motor vehicles.
Humble Goal  -  A character wants something unglamorous and/or easily attainable.
Dueling Stars Movie  -  A movie starring two equally-famous actors marketed with the intended purpose of getting audiences to want to see those two actors on-screen together.
Fan Service With A Smile  -  Fanservicey waitress.
Low Fantasy  -  A more mundane take on the Fantasy genre; averts, downplays, and deconstructs tropes normally considered hallmarks of High Fantasy.
No One Could Survive That  -  Death, unseen but (wrongly) assumed.
Sniper Pistol  -  Handguns exceeding their expected range.
Gun Stripping  -  Taking apart a weapon and putting it back together again.
Balloonacy  -  (Balloons x Helium) + Object/Character = Easy Flight.
Only In Florida  -  Stories from Florida tend to be weird.
Screw The Rules I Have Money  -  Character uses wealth to break rules and escape punishment.
Figure It Out Yourself  -  Character refuses to provide easy answers.
Closeup On Head  -  Close-up on someone's head before the camera reveals the strange occurrences around it.
Early Draft Tie In  -  Promotional merchandise for a work is reflective of an early draft - not the final product.
Mooks But No Bosses  -  A game which has regular enemies to fight against, but no real boss battles at all.
The Villain Sucks Song  -  A song that disses the villain.
Anti Poop Socking  -  Game discourages or even forbids player from continuously playing.
Childish Tooth Gap  -  A tooth gap (due to a lack of teeth or not) use as an indicator of youthfulness.
Never Say Goodbye  -  A character refuses to let someone else say "goodbye" for some reason.
This Is Not My Life To Take  -  I won't kill you because my friend wants to.
Fiery Stoic  -  Normally calm / serene bearer of fire-based Elemental Powers.
Barrier Warrior  -  Fights with barriers, often not just for defense.
Thermometer Gag  -  Humor regarding thermometers being inserted into unpleasant orifices.
Incest Subtext  -  Exactly What It Says On The Tin: Characters with incestuous subtext in a story.
Cavalier Competitor  -  A character treats a competition (even if it's Life or Death) as a game.
Visible Odor  -  There's no odor component in fiction, so give consumers a visual shorthand to let them know something smells.
Joshikousei  -  Japanese girls who wear Sailor Fuku.
Jerk To Nice Guy Plot  -  A plot where a character starts off as a Jerkass, but events change him into a Nice Guy.
Witch Classic  -  Stereotypical Witches.
Action Hogging Opening  -  The opening of a show has way more action than the show really has.
Big Man On Campus  -  The high school/college version of The Ace, admired by everyone (or nearly everyone).
Motive Decay  -  Y'know, he used to have a reason for doing that.
Chew Bubblegum  -  Stock Shout-Out towards They Live.
Dying As Yourself  -  A person breaks free of whatever corruption took hold of them, and then dies.
No Title  -  ...So what do we call it?
Its Cuban  -  The cigar is Cuban, implying money or connections.
Female Gaze  -  The framing of male bodies in a fetishizing way by female creators or to appeal to a female audience.
Did You Just Romance Cthulhu  -  Romancing an Eldritch, Humanoid or Animalistic Abomination.
Paying In Coins  -  Someone pays for stuff with a huge number of coins.
Slipstream Genre  -  A genre situated in a Real Life setting, yet weird things start happening for no reason.
Flynning  -  Showy Hollywood swordfighting that would definitely get one killed in real swordfighting.
Space Whale Aesop  -  Moral lesson established by showing consequences unlikely in real life.
Not Quite Saved Enough  -  Just when you think you've won, something happens out of the blue to invalidate all your efforts.
Tattoo Sharpie  -  When a permanent marker is permanent, even on skin.
Pyro Maniac  -  Really loves to start fires/burn stuff.
Fictional Holiday  -  A holiday that only exists in some work of fiction and not in the real world.
Tampon Run  -  Girl is busy and needs her tampons, so she asks a guy to go get some to comedic results.
Evil Hero  -  An evil character who has a traditionally heroic job.
Adaptation Induced Plot Hole  -  An adaptation adds a plot hole.
Tokyo Is The Center Of The Universe  -  Anything interesting happens only in Tokyo.
The Homeward Journey  -  The plot revolves around a character's journey to get back home.
Badass Creed  -  A Catchphrase that doubles as a philosophy.
Twice Told Tale  -  A retelling that requires the audience to know the original story.
Miser Advisor  -  Character whose creed is, "Screw the rules, I want money."
Forced Level Grinding  -  When substantial Level Grinding is necessary to reasonably make progress in a game.
Fantastic Religious Weirdness  -  How do fictional beings practice real religion?

Love Redeems  -  A HeelFace Turn from The Dark Side via The Power of Love.
The Fagin  -  Someone who teaches children how to steal for them.
Prince Charming Wannabe  -  He thinks he'll sweep her off her feet. She wants nothing to do with him.
Angel Unaware  -  Character is implied/revealed to be an angel or other supernatural being.
Intelligible Unintelligible  -  The characters in the story know what they're saying; the audience does not.
Memorial Statue  -  A statue to honor a dead person, usually for a heroic sacrifice.
Psychic Radar  -  Using Psychic Powers to detect people and vehicles driven by people.
Cope By Pretending  -  Dealing with something stressful by pretending things aren't as bad as they are.
Old Guard Versus New Blood  -  The struggle between appealing to newer fans and appealing to veteran fans.
Moral Myopia  -  When we do bad things, it's justified. When you do bad things, it's inexcusable.
Death By Gluttony  -  Eating yourself to death. Literally.
Youre Insane  -  What the hero says when discovering a supposed friend is evil beyond reason.
Hit So Hard The Calendar Felt It  -  An event of such societal importance that they changed the calendar to reflect it.
Scrappy Mechanic  -  A mechanic in an otherwise decent video game that is implemented poorly or is disliked.
Death Is Cheap  -  The dead rarely stay dead for long.
Strange Minds Think Alike  -  Bizarre leap in logic is somehow replicated.
Surreal Humor  -  Humor from the bizarre.
Therapy Is For The Weak  -  A character for some reason rejects therapy.
Collapsing Lair  -  The villain's lair falls apart after they are defeated.
The Mean Brit  -  That one British judge / panelist who's a Jerkass.
Consulting Mister Puppet  -  An irrational character takes advice from an inanimate companion.
Not A Morning Person  -  This character hates waking up and getting up early.
A Homeowner Is You  -  Games that let you buy and/or build personal property.
And The Rest  -  Acknowledging some people in a group by name, then lumping the others as "the rest".

Heartbreak And Ice Cream  -  Coping through tragic times by eating ice-cream.
Screw The Electric Bill  -  Who needs electricity anyway?

The Place  -  The work is named after its main central location.
Ostentatious Secret  -  A secret that you want everyone to know you have, but not what that secret actually is.
Color Animal Codename  -  A character, object, or organization has an operational name based on a color-and-animal combination.
Head Bob  -  Focus on mouthless or inarticulately-mouthed speaker is maintained by exaggerated head movement.
Less Disturbing In Context  -  If you know the context, it doesn't sound as bad.
Cool Shades  -  Badass sunglasses.
Hustling The Mark  -  Deliberately losing a competition against someone so they'll agree to wager on a rematch.

Eye Take  -  O.O

Dont Explain The Joke  -  Explaining the joke's punchline makes it unfunny (which is funny).

Shapeshifting Excludes Clothing  -  The character can shapeshift, but the clothes can't.

Good Versus Good  -  Opposing sides are both unambiguously good.
Epic Instrumental Opener  -  A long beginning to the song in instrumental, usually to provide buildup.

Creepy Cockroach  -  Cockroaches are vile.
Picture Perfect Presentation  -  An image of a location fades into a shot of the location itself.
More Than Mind Control  -  Instead of breaking or overpowering the victim's will, you change their will by convincing them they want to do what you want.
Affably Evil  -  Niceness of inherently evil character is sincere.
Fantastic Legal Weirdness  -  Speculative Fiction settings interact oddly with legal systems.

Clipped Wing Angel  -  A being's true/final/ultimate form has flaws that render it impractical or easily defeated.

Penal Colony  -  A big land of incarceration.

Got Volunteered  -  Involuntary volunteering.
Alone With The Psycho  -  A defenseless character is alone with a dangerous character who wants to kill them.
Supernatural Proof Father  -  Everyone experiences the supernatural events in the setting except the father of the household or male lead.
Ambiguously Bi  -  A character shows romantic/sexual interest in both men and women, but it's unclear if they're truly bisexual.
Silent Antagonist  -  Silence makes an antagonist more intimidating.
Hit Flash  -  A moment of violence is purposely obscured.

Barbarian Longhair  -  Long hair is portrayed as a barbaric trait of a hunk.

Beef Bandage  -  A piece of steak is used as an icepack.

Giant Woman  -  Human giant that is notably female. Often times a Ms. Fanservice.
Only Serves For Life  -  Being President for Life only lasts until you die.
Stranger Behind The Mask  -  The climactic revelation is not at all foreshadowed by the story.
Skeleton Government  -  Due to lack of detail, we don't know much of how the government is run.
Genesis Effect  -  The creation of an entire planet.
Grade School CEO  -  A minor that happens to hold a high-ranking position in a company.
Canon Discontinuity  -  A series acts as though an earlier event or installment never happened.
Barrier Busting Blow  -  The hiding place seemed safe, but the monster broke right through the wall.
Stripped To The Bone  -  The skeleton remains intact even after the rest of the body is destroyed.
Give Me Your Inventory Item  -  When the player is forced to give an important item to a NPC.
Polar Opposite Twins  -  Odd Couple twins: physically identical, but personality-wise complete opposites.
Broken Angel  -  Fantastic creatures who have (usually forcibly) become mundane.
Loyal Phlebotinum  -  Only works for its Chosen One.
Strong Family Resemblance  -  Two family members (usually parent and child) look nearly identical.
Here There Be Dragons  -  Maps that focused more on vague labels rather than geographic illustrations.
Circles Of Hell  -  Sinners are sorted by the severity of their misdeeds.
Tomboy Princess  -  A princess who is a Tomboy.
Trivially Obvious  -  Trivial statement as a compliment.
Veganopia  -  Go vegan before going utopian.
Cast Of Personifications  -  Anthropomorphic Personifications are the main characters.
Embarrassing Middle Name  -  Someone has a middle name that sounds goofy.
Jazz  -  Music genre based on improvisation.
Chest Monster  -  Goodies turn out to be baddies.
Paradox Person  -  People whose existence does not hold order in the natural laws of the world.
Kudzu Plot  -  Many plot threads are started at once, and are not resolved for a long time, if at all.
Magitek  -  Technology from Magic.
Likes Clark Kent Hates Superman  -  A character likes the Secret Identity of a character, but hates their public one.
Our Dwarves Are All The Same  -  The original dwarf myths couldn't keep the details straight, but modern portrayals sure can.
Self Imposed Challenge  -  Purposely limiting yourself to make something more difficult.
You Will Be Beethoven  -  Time traveler must assume the identity of a historical figure.
Chronic Pet Killer  -  Someone who repeatedly has pets die.
Right Hand Attack Dog  -  Villain's active fighter pet.
All Jews Are Ashkenazi  -  Jewish characters in a work are all Ashkenazi Jews.
Loud Of War  -  Using loud and annoying sounds against someone.
Blending In Stealth Gameplay  -  When you avoid detection by blending-in with neutral NPCs and the environment, instead of by avoiding guards entirely.
High School AU  -  The most common Alternate Universe of Fan Works—take the canon characters and re-write them as teens in high school!
Last Breath Bullet  -  You thought the villain was dead? Nope! He just had enough life left to do an unexpected villainous act before dying.
Muggle With A Degree In Magic  -  An unpowered individual is an expert in magic they are unable to use.
Audible Sharpness  -  Your blade is amazingly loud.
Hidden Supplies  -  A hidden stash of supplies.
No Sell  -  Character is unaffected by an attack or ability.
Corporate Conspiracy  -  A business institution has a secret Evil Plan.
Evolving Trope  -  As values change over time, tropes change with them.
Family Unfriendly Death  -  A shockingly gruesome death in entertainment aimed at children.
Derelict Graveyard  -  A Graveyard of ships.
Mechanical Abomination  -  A powerful and incomprehensibly bizarre creature of a mechanical nature.
You Are Already Dead  -  Fatal damage with a time-delayed effect.
Attack Hello  -  Attacking somebody because saying 'Hello' is too normal.
Similarly Named Works  -  These works happen to share the same name, but have nothing to do with each other.
Survival Mantra  -  Repetition leads to confidence.
Sorcerous Overlord  -  An Evil Overlord capable of wielding magic.
Cannot Tell A Joke  -  Failing at telling a joke is funny.
Gay Paree  -  An idealized and cliché version of Paris, France.
Dead Mans Chest  -  Need to hide a body? Stuff it in a trunk!
Do Not Run With A Gun  -  Running while shooting is very difficult or even impossible.
Improbably Predictable  -  Someone knows what you're going to do, right before you actually do it.
School Is For Losers  -  Cool people don't go to school.
Rivalry As Courtship  -  A rivalry stems out of a crush, or a crush stems out of a rivalry.
Ensemble Cast  -  The story spends a roughly equal amount of time on all or most of the characters rather than having a single protagonist.
Audience Coloring Adaptation  -  An adaptation of a franchise that affects its public image as a whole.
Roaring Rampage Of Rescue  -  Character stops at nothing to save another.
Please Kill Me If It Satisfies You  -  Character permits another character to kill them.
A True Hero  -  An exploration of what makes someone a legitimate or better hero.
You Must Be This Tall To Ride  -  Kids can't ride thrill rides because they're too young or too short.
Loss Of Inhibitions  -  Losing your restraint causes you to indulge in your desires.
We Want Our Jerk Back  -  Characters who like a character when he was a jerk.
Sand In My Eyes  -  Feigning an eye irritant to hide tears.
Reliably Unreliable Guns  -  All guns are subject to malfunction at the worst times; you can rely on them being unreliable.
Exotic Entree  -  Evil people eat animals, especially endangered ones or cute/beautiful ones, or prepare dishes that require a lot of animal suffering.
Gradual Grinder  -  Specializes in attacks that steadily drain energy.
Lions And Tigers And Humans Oh My  -  Funny Animals and humans living together in the same world.
Here There Were Dragons  -  Back in the day, magic was real.
Haunted Headquarters  -  A haunted primary setting.
Hard Truth Aesop  -  An Aesop that is unorthodox and/or defies accepted wisdom, but is still good advice.
Resigned To The Call  -  I don't want to be a hero, but I'll do it anyway.
Too Hungry To Be Polite  -  Poor table manners as an indication of lower-class background or desperate hunger.
Adults Are More Anthropomorphic  -  The Sliding Scale of Anthropomorphism of a characacter is directly proportional to their age.
Gunman With Three Names  -  First name + Second name + Surname = That man is a killer.
Keeping Secrets Sucks  -  Actually keeping a secret is absurdly difficult.
Hostile Animatronics  -  When animatronic characters go bad.
Always Identical Twins  -  Identical twins show up more frequently than non-identical ones.
Designated Point Man  -  The team member who goes first in dangerous situations.
It Gets Easier  -  Immorality gets easier the more you do it.
Living Doll Collector  -  Collects people like they were dolls.
Dudley Do Right Stops To Help  -  The hero hinders his quest because he goes out of his way to help some poor sap.
Big Ol Unibrow  -  A character with a unibrow is depicted as evil or comical.
Poisonous Person  -  Poison-based Elemental Powers.
Planetville  -  Planets are treated as just being like big towns.
Combo Breaker  -  Breaking big chains of hits with a special move or game mechanic.
Bazaar Of The Bizarre  -  A strange market.
Boss Room  -  Where the boss monster of the dungeon waits to face the player.
Everyone Chasing You  -  A character or group of characters is on the run from many, many people.
Black Bug Room  -  The dark place in your mind.
Right In Front Of Me  -  A character doesn't realize they're talking to the person they're talking about.
Please Dont Leave Me  -  No matter what the circumstances are, nothing hurts quite like a loved one leaving.
I Wished You Were Dead  -  And now you are and I feel terrible.
Minovsky Physics  -  A fictional item or substance which has strictly and clearly defined limits on what it can do.
Random Events Plot  -  The circumstances that brought on the plot occurred for no reason.
Finishing Stomp  -  The kick that ends the fight.
Down To The Last Play  -  Sports movies endings: heroes win by 1 point.
Restaurant Owning Episode  -  Bob opens a restaurant naively thinking it will be fun.
Halloweentown  -  Trope: A Halloween-themed Setting.
Saving Christmas  -  The Trope: The Christmas Holiday is the Damsel in Distress in need of saving.
Inverse Dialogue Death Rule  -  Important characters take longer to die.
Prematurely Marked Grave  -  A grave with your name on it.
City Of Adventure  -  It's a city. It's adventurous. Yeah.
The Big Damn Kiss  -  The amazing kiss scene that everyone has been waiting for.
Minor Major Character  -  Character who holds a bigger role in the story's world than in the narrative of the story itself.
Too Important To Walk  -  Character travels by the leg power of others.
Completion Meter  -  An interface element that shows how much of the game's content you haven't uncovered yet.
Angst What Angst  -  Improbably quick recovery from emotional and psychological trauma and stress.
Ring Out Boss  -  A boss who must be knocked off the arena to defeat.
No Plot No Problem  -  Here's a game. Just play it.
Nu Speling  -  Inn da fyoocher, wee'll spel lyke dis.
Emissary From The Divine  -  An old fashioned prophet from God, or mortal/angel chosen for a certain role by the divine.
Vocal Tag Team  -  Two or more members of a band regularly contribute lead vocals, often with very different voices or styles.
Disposable Vagrant  -  Nobody cares if a homeless person disappears or is found dead.
Leap Of Faith  -  A blind jump to an initially unseen destination.
Good Old Ways  -  Good-hearted characters behave in old-fashioned ways.
Self Insert Fic  -  A work of fiction features its author (or close equivalent) as the protagonist or in some other vital role.
Psychic Assisted Suicide  -  Forced suicide via Mind Control.
Heroism Addict  -  When someone creates a dangerous situation so that they could swoop in and be The Hero.
Brass Balls  -  Brave but foolish! He has some cojones!
Not As You Know Them  -  A character is derailed and otherwise stripped of their significance in order to push another character into their spotlight.
Microwave The Dog  -  Microwaving a pet.
Tareme Eyes  -  Eyes that droop or sag at the corners, which symbolize soft emotions such as sympathy, kindness, or docility.
Dashing Hispanic  -  Flamboyant, flashy, and dangerous, with a sexy Spanish accent.
No Arc In Archery  -  Gravity somehow doesn't apply to physical projectiles.
Alike And Antithetical Adversaries  -  Moral alignment characterized by whether or not those of the same alignment are all similar or different to one another.
Eloquent In My Native Tongue  -  They don't sound too intelligent in English, but they sound very smart when speaking their native language.
Vicious Vac  -  Vacuum cleaners portrayed as frightening items or weapons.
Deadly Dust Storm  -  A hostile sandstorm.
Inventional Wisdom  -  Machines have mechanisms that serve no possible purpose but to hinder their user.
Redeeming Replacement  -  Character assumes a super identity that normally belongs to villains, but acts as a hero instead.
Lowered Recruiting Standards  -  An elite organisation used to have high requirements for anyone enrolling is now, y'know, not so picky.
Victorias Secret Compartment  -  Need an extra pocket? Use your bra/cleavage!
Merchandise Driven  -  A show made to sell the product that it's based on.
Goodbye Cruel World  -  A character leaves a note of their suicide.
Ape Shall Never Kill Ape  -  A race or society's members act maliciously towards outsiders but not towards each other, and think this is evidence they are "superior" - whatever that means.
Lonely Funeral  -  A character dies, and very few people attend the funeral.
Zany Scheme  -  Ridiculously convoluted plan.
Bath Suicide  -  You want to keep the carpet clean, so best end your own life in the bathtub.
Killer Cop  -  A murderer with a badge.
Diaper Check  -  Someone checks to see if a baby's diaper needs changing.
Totem Pole Trench  -  Two or more small people hiding under a trench coat (or similar article of clothing) to pretend to be one larger person.
Emotional Bruiser  -  The Big Guy doesn't necessarily have to be The Stoic.
Fool For Love  -  Tough, and possibly cynical, but still a sucker for love.
Blessed With Suck  -  Desired quality proves problematic.
Improbable Hairstyle  -  Either an exaggerated hairstyle or a perfect hairstyle without maintenance.
Ejection Seat  -  The seat you leave through the open roof.
Knee High Perspective  -  Adults are seen up to their ankles, knees, or waists.
Medieval European Fantasy  -  A fantastic setting based on the European Middle Ages.
Turn Out Like His Father  -  One parent (usually the mother) tries to prevent their child (son) from taking after the other (father).
Sixty Five Episode Cartoon  -  65 episodes (or 40 episodes in some cases) make for easy syndication.
You Can Panic Now  -  The media's scare of the day.
Miko  -  A traditional Shinto shrine maiden.
Clothing Appendage  -  Those "clothes" are actually part of a character's body.
Ascetic Aesthetic  -  A setting that invokes an ominous feeling through its stark simplicity.
Writer Cop Out  -  Building up a plot into something with potential, then finishing it with something less than impressive.
Surplus Damage Bonus  -  When the game rewards you for damaging an enemy well over its remaining health points.
Attack Its Weak Point  -  Hit the target painted on it for massive damage.
Concept Album  -  An album with a Central Theme.
Black Comedy  -  Serious and horrible things Played for Laughs.
Egg Mac Guffin  -  Protecting an egg because it's important to the plot.
Robbing The Mob Bank  -  Criminals unknowingly robbing bigger and richer criminals.
Twenty One Gun Salute  -  21-gun or three-volley salutes performed by military members to mark special occasions.
All Men Are Perverts  -  Men think about nothing but sex.
Call Back  -  A reference to an earlier event in a series that's relevant for the plot.
Anchored Ship  -  This pairing isn't going anywhere (for now).
Corporate Samurai  -  Hired killer as bodyguard and assassin for organization.
The Commissioner Gordon  -  Civil servant who aids a vigilante.
Removing The Head Or Destroying The Brain  -  The only way to kill something is by destroying or removing its head.
Artistic License Awards  -  A mistake about awards is done for the sake of a better story.
Lemon  -  Fan Fic with explicit sex in it.
Sequence Breaking  -  Taking shortcuts not consciously programmed into the game.
Almighty Mom  -  Mama Bears would tell off God for their children.
Third Law Of Gender Bending  -  Gender Bender Rule #3: Characters undergoing a gender change usually take on (often exaggerated) stereotypes of their new gender.
Getting Eaten Is Harmless  -  Getting Eaten Alive or Swallowed Whole is more of an inconvenience than a death sentence.
Derailing  -  Forcibly changing the subject to silence the original point under discussion.
Morality Chip  -  A Restraining Bolt that changes someone's mindset instead of their physical actions.
Idiosyncrazy  -  A character (often a supervillain) fixated on a very specific gimmick.
To Be Lawful Or Good  -  Do you do the honorable/legal thing, or the compassionate thing?
All Up To You  -  You're the only one that can save the world, Unlikely Hero!!
Crossover  -  When two or more series share a common reality and interact.
The Verse  -  A show or franchise with a verse identifier.
Fun With Acronyms  -  Acronym spells something funny or significant.
Desert Punk  -  The trope: Sci-fi in the desert.
Puzzle Boss  -  A boss that requires a gimmick for you to beat it.
Toilet Paper Prank  -  Throwing toilet paper over someone's property.
A Boy And His X  -  A youth and their Plot Device.
Made Of Plasticine  -  Character's bodies fall apart more easily than in Real Life.
Christianity Is Catholic  -  All Christians in a work seem Catholic.
Archaic Weapon For An Advanced Age  -  Weapons that should be obsoleted by the setting's technology prove not to be.
Den Of Iniquity  -  A room in the lair where naughtiness takes place.
Baldness Angst  -  A bald character who is self conscious about their baldness.
Midair Bobbing  -  Things that hover in place slightly move up and down.
Hard Drinking Party Girl  -  Happily, frequently inebriated chick.
Creature Breeding Mechanic  -  Breeding animals or monsters as a game mechanic, with a particular goal in mind.
You Monster  -  They're a monster. There's simply no other word to describe them after what they did.
Sleepless Alarm Clock  -  Character finally gets to sleep after being up all night only for their alarm clock to go off.
Loved I Not Honor More  -  They have no problem starting a committed relationship, but it will always be secondary to their duty.
Exposed Animal Bellybutton  -  A cartoon animal is given a visible 'human' bellybutton.
Fountain Of Youth  -  An older character is changed into a younger version of themself.
Glass Cannon  -  Excellent offense, terrible defense.
Blind Without Em  -  Character loses their glasses and can't see anything.
Missing Mom  -  A character's mother is absent.
Got Me Doing It  -  When a character's tic is contagious.
Wrap Around  -  Go offscreen one side, come out the other.
The Pardon  -  A character's crimes are legally blotted out.
Real Life Writes The Hairstyle  -  A character's hairstyle is different due to the actor changing it either on a whim or for another role.
Hundred Percent Completion  -  Doing everything there is to do in the game.
Moon Logic Puzzle  -  Ridiculously complicated puzzles that, despite giving you all the needed information, make no sense.
Anachronistic Orphanage  -  A traditional orphanage in a setting where there logically shouldn't be one.
Its Always Mardi Gras In New Orleans  -  Certain cities are always depicted celebrating their signature festivals regardless of the actual date.
Pinball Protagonist  -  The protagonist doesn't affect the plot very much, despite his/her constant presence.
Friendly Address Privileges  -  Only my friends call me X.
Unusual Euphemism  -  Need a euphemism for an unpleasant issue? Make one up.
Public Exposure  -  A person poses nude to be depicted in art form.
Fling A Light Into The Future  -  They couldn't save themselves, but they left something to help others avoid meeting the same fate.
Wise Beyond Their Years  -  A child who is far more mature (emotionally, intellectually, and/or philosophically) than is typical for their age.
Raised Catholic  -  Characters from religious, usually Catholic, backgrounds can't shake its influence later in their lives, even when they later become irreligious.
One Handed Zweihander  -  If someone can effectively one-hand a weapon that's clearly designed to be used with two hands, they must be pretty impressive!
The Mafiya  -  The Russian Mafia.
Vaporware  -  A product that's always Coming Soon! without ever actually arriving.
Metallicar Syndrome  -  Your ride never gets searched for by the cops, no matter how distinctive it is.
Distaff Counterpart  -  A new character from a derivative work with the same tropes but different gender.
Wolverine Publicity  -  A popular character appears solely for marketing purposes.
Marshmallow Hell  -  Smothered by a woman's breasts.
Replacement Flat Character  -  A Flat Character becomes more well-rounded, so another Flat Character is added to the cast.
Least Rhymable Word  -  Characters have trouble rhyming a word. Generally orange.
Signs Of Disrepair  -  Signs that have letters removed or disabled to give a location some new, and often disturbing, context.
Three Stat System  -  A game system built around three core character stats.
What Does This Button Do  -  Buttons exist to tease the destructively curious (or curiously destructive).
Split Timelines Plot  -  A story that switches between Alternate Timelines after depicting a single diverging event.
Four Equal Payments Of  -  Splitting the price of an expensive product to make its high cost more palatable to the consumer.
Minimalistic Cover Art  -  Covers that don't have much on them.
Future Copter  -  Impossibly cool, futuristic, tiltrotor aircraft.
Iron Buttmonkey  -  Takes all the physical abuse in stride.
Tank Top Tomboy  -  A female who wears a tanktop is identified as a Tomboy or an Action Girl.
Pacifist Dojo  -  A martial arts school that teaches its pupils properly.
Ruthless Modern Pirates  -  Vicious and not at all romanticised modern-day pirates.
Improvised Scattershot  -  A projectile is split in two or more parts midair by external forces.
Swamps Are Evil  -  Swamps are very dangerous locations to be.
Endangering News Broadcast  -  A news broadcast that puts someone's life in danger.
Fallen Hero  -  A villain that used to be a hero.
Mangst  -  Subtle angst displayed by tough characters.
Bee Bee Gun  -  Bees or wasps are utilized as a Living Weapon.
Word Of Gay  -  The author clarifies a character's sexuality.
Epic Riff  -  Instantly-recognizable fragment of a song.
Hero With A Unique Name  -  When Awesome McCoolname, Meaningful Name, and/or Odd Name Out helps your protagonist stand out among the rest.
The Unfettered  -  Somebody who will do anything to get what they want.
Dinner And A Show  -  Sitcom family gets together for dinner. Hilarity Ensues.
Amazing Technicolor Battlefield  -  Trippy battlefield, man.
Super Hero Origin  -  The story behind how a superhero became as such.
The Music Meister  -  A character who is able to invoke musical numbers.
Artifact Of Death  -  A magical object that kills its user/owner.
Ultimate Blacksmith  -  A smith with unique or supernatural crafting abilities.
Social Media Before Reason  -  Something serious is happening here, this is no time for tweeting!
Jungle Drums  -  When Hollywood Natives are getting ready to cause trouble, they're either playing the drums really loudly or not playing them at all when expected to play them.
Small Universe After All  -  Traversing the entire universe is no problem.
Wing Shield  -  When wings are used to protect individuals from danger or hazards.
Nasty Party  -  Let's see who makes it out of this party alive.
Invincible Boogeymen  -  Horror monsters that can't be fought or killed, only escaped from.
Died Happily Ever After  -  After a character dies, they are seen as happy just before or after they Ascend to a Higher Plane of Existence.
Vanity Plate  -  A short clip telling you who produced and/or distributed what you're watching.
Goal Oriented Evolution  -  Things evolve toward a specific goal. After millions of years, humans will have evolved to the point of enlightenment and become Transhuman Energy Beings or something.
His Story Repeats Itself  -  To resolve your backstory, you must relive it through a similar event.
Everything Explodes Ending  -  An explosion is used as/instead of a punchline.
Applicability  -  Word of God asks the audience to make up their own mind about the theme.
Chameleon Camouflage  -  A character seamlessly fades into the background.
Kid From The Future  -  A child travels back in time and meet their parents before they were born.
Phenotype Stereotype  -  Stereotypical ethnic/national appearance.
Artistic License Nuclear Physics  -  Nuclear Physics is presented inaccurately in fiction for the sake of telling a better story.
Giant Enemy Crab  -  Enormous antagonistic crustaceans.
Nightmare Face  -  A face liable to cause nightmares.
Suicide Is Painless  -  A character kills themselves happily.
Super Trope  -  Tropes that convey broad ideas and concepts which in turn can specialize into more specific Subtropes.
G Rated Mental Illness  -  Kid-friendly depictions of mental illness.
One Stat To Rule Them All  -  Stat with a disportionately high rate of usefulness compared to the other stats.
Dude Shes Like In A Coma  -  Kissing someone who's unconscious.
Innocence Lost  -  The Trope: Naïve and innocent character (usually a kid) experiences something that makes them lose their innocent worldview.
You Could Have Used Your Powers For Good  -  The hero calls out the villain for using their powers for evil.
David Versus Goliath  -  A battle in which the hero is considerably smaller and/or weaker than the villain.
No Cutscene Inventory Inertia  -  Anything you are wearing or have equipped that isn't the default doesn't show up in the cut scenes.
Tomboyish Baseball Cap  -  If a girl is wearing a baseball cap, it means she's a tomboy.
Leave Me Alone  -  Telling people to leave you alone so you can solve your own problems.
Evil Overlord  -  An incredibly powerful, highly influential despot in a fictional setting usually armed with vast resources and/or unique technology, who is usually the Big Bad of the story.
Chiptune  -  Songs that sound like they're coming from an 8-bit video game.
Merry Christmas In Gotham  -  Even the darkest series goes Lighter and Softer for the Christmas Episode.
Chance Meeting Between Antagonists  -  A coincidental meeting between enemies, while going about their daily lives.
Crossover Ship  -  Inter-continuity shipping.
Vengeance Denied  -  You want revenge, eh? TOO BAD!
AKA 47  -  Bland Name Firearm
Cold Iron  -  Iron harms magical beings.
Genre Killer  -  A work or event that killed an entire genre.
If I Wanted You Dead  -  ...you would be already.
Locomotive Level  -  It's a level! ON A TRAAAAAAIIIIIIN!!!
Romance On The Set  -  When two actors fall in love with each other during filming.
Bullying The Disabled  -  Bullying someone who is physically or mentally deficient.
Clumsy Copyright Censorship  -  Something very obviously and awkwardly gets censored because of copyright issues.
Adam And Or Eve  -  The names Adam and/or Eve used symbolically.
Bait The Dog  -  Setting up a character to be likable, who later is revealed to be the opposite.
My Sensors Indicate You Want To Tap That  -  Super Senses reveal tension.
Uncredited Role  -  A person is involved in the creation of a work, but is not officially credited as such.
A Long Time Ago In A Galaxy Far Far Away  -  An interplanetary setting far removed from Earth and humanity as we know it.
Chained To A Bed  -  Sex restraints are used with ulterior motives.
Cut And Paste Environments  -  Too many rooms look exactly the same.
Disqualification Induced Victory  -  It seems like one has lost a competition, but it turns out his or her opponent(s) were disqualified, granting that character victory by default.
The Mafia  -  Scary Italian and Sicilian criminals with a code of their own.
Loose Canon  -  When a spinoff work is not (clearly defined as) canon but fits neatly into canon by design.
A Riddle Wrapped In A Mystery Inside An Enigma  -  Stock Phrase to emphasize mysteriousness.
Contractual Boss Immunity  -  That One-Hit Kill move you use on all the mooks? Won't work on bosses.
Hijacked By Ganon  -  Old villain behind the new threat.
Phlebotinum Dependence  -  Character relies on sufficiently advanced technology to function.
Space Plane  -  A spaceship that works like an airplane.
Tragic Monster  -  A person who the audience cares about is turned into a monster.
Wheres The Kaboom  -  Bomb fails to explode on cue.
Fisher Kingdom  -  A location that transforms its inhabitants to match its aesthetic.
One Liner Name One Liner  -  Saying the same thing twice for emphasis, reader... saying the same thing twice for emphasis.
Rage Against The Author  -  Characters have some beef with their writer.
Contemplation Location  -  A character uses a particular space to think and/or meditate.
Instant Gravestone  -  After dying, someone turns into a gravestone on the spot.
Gave Up Too Soon  -  Would have succeeded if they had persisted just a little more.
The Man In The Mirror Talks Back  -  Character's mirror reflection becomes its own sentient being.
Solomon Divorce  -  Divorced parents split custody of their children down the middle.
Marrying The Mark  -  Entering a relationship with someone to con or commit a crime against them.
Scary Scorpions  -  Scorpions portrayed as much more dangerous than they are in real life.
Family Relationship Switcheroo  -  A character is claimed to be related to others in a different way than they actually are, and usually doesn't know the truth themselves.
Base Breaking Character  -  Some think they're awesome, some think they're The Scrappy.
Foil  -  A character who highlights another character's trait(s), usually by contrast.
This Is Not A Drill  -  The present emergency is real, and definitely not a controlled exercise.
I Have You Now My Pretty  -  Having your... way with the hostage.
High Altitude Interrogation  -  Dangle someone from a high place, and he'll sing like a canary.
Metal Muncher  -  A character or species that eats metal.
First Girl Wins  -  The male protagonist ends up with the first girl we saw him meet.
Beat  -  A short pause after something is said or happens to let it all sink in.
Monowheel Mayhem  -  A vehicle which consists of one big wheel.
Positive Friend Influence  -  A friend who has a positive influence on their other friends.
Fee Fi Faux Pas  -  Making a major social blunder.
Possessing A Dead Body  -  A dead body that is reanimated by an inhabiting spirit.
Heinz Hybrid  -  A hybrid of an implausible number of different species.
No Eye In Magic  -  If they can't see you, they can't hex you.
Overnight Conquest  -  A military invasion carried out improbably quickly, often by using some form of Applied Phlebotinum.
Hollywood Healing  -  Hero never becomes visibly injured and can recover completely from anything.
The Worsening Curse Mark  -  A scar (of sorts) on the body that will only grow, and not for the better.
The Thing That Goes Doink  -  A deer chaser statue, used to show off being traditionally Japanese or wealthy.
Delayed Oh Crap  -  You take a moment to realize you're in trouble.
Academic Alpha Bitch  -  The Schoolyard Control Freak.
The Usual Adversaries  -  Those Always Chaotic Evil Mooks that never stop attacking and annoying the protagonists, no matter how many they kill.
Repulsive Ringmaster  -  Circus ringmasters portrayed as antagonistic and/or creepy.
Ironic Hell  -  Where the punishment serves as a reminder of the violation.
Staged Shooting  -  A character is apparently shot or executed, but the entire shooting was staged.
Character Blog  -  Real blog updated by a fictional character.
Rodents Of Unusual Size  -  Giant Rodents.
Cross Counter  -  Two fighters land punches. Simultaneously.
Whip It Good  -  Using a whip as a weapon.
Animals Hate Him  -  Animals hate a character no matter how they act.
Brainless Beauty  -  A gorgeous airhead.
Boots Of Toughness  -  Boots indicates badassery.
Underground Level  -  Generic Video Game level set underground.
Spikes Of Doom  -  Sharp, pointy, and invariably lethal.
Snarky Inanimate Object  -  It can't move and technically isn't something that should be sentient, but boy is it sassy!
Gangplank Galleon  -  Generic Video Game pirate themed area.
Scary Skeleton  -  Skeletons portrayed as terrifying monsters.
Superpowered Mooks  -  Supers in red shirts.
Utopia  -  Ideal world.
Translator Microbes  -  Unintrusive means of universal translation.
Numerical Hard  -  Difficulty modes that just change statistics of the player/enemy (such as health or damage).
Awesome Moment Of Crowning  -  I saved the world. King me.
Some Nutty Publicity Stunt  -  Dismissing a strange event as a publicity stunt.
Battle Of The Still Frames  -  A battle is shown as a slideshow instead of being animated.
I Can Explain  -  What characters say instead of actually explaining.
Apocalyptic Montage  -  A montage of landmarks that went through an apocalypse.
Never My Fault  -  A character cannot or will not own up to their mistakes.
Sibling Seniority Squabble  -  Twin siblings arguing over which one is older, sometimes right down to the second.
Hot Guy Ugly Wife  -  She has a man who is much more attractive than her.
The Empire  -  An autocratic superpower that wants to Take Over the World.
Clap Your Hands If You Believe  -  Reality is shaped by beliefs.
Cosmic Flaw  -  A break in the fabric of reality causes problems.
Career Resurrection  -  A superstar falls into disgrace or obscurity, then stages a successful comeback.
Shocking Voice Identity Reveal  -  A mysterious figure's identity is only revealed when their voice is recognized.
Hipster  -  Pre-1990s: Those who based their lifestyles around jazz influences.
Specs Of Awesome  -  A Badass who wears glasses.
Easier Than Easy  -  A difficulty level below Easy.
Hired Help As Family  -  The relationship between the servant and their master is more familial than formal.
Wronski Feint  -  Avoiding an obstacle at the last moment so your pursuer can't avoid it.
Future Imperfect  -  The future will have mistaken beliefs about the past.
Un Installment  -  Series that uses Numbered Sequels skips an installment number.
Accent Interest  -  A character's accent draws attention from other characters.
Literally Falling In Love  -  Two characters finally confessing their love for one another by accidentally falling on top of each other.
No Holds Barred Beatdown  -  A very brutal and violent (often one-sided) battle, often to the point of being disturbing.
Kid Hero  -  A hero who is a child.
Double Vision  -  The art of having one actor on screen as more than one character simultaneously.
Adoption Diss  -  An insult that has to do with being adopted.
Ghostapo  -  Nazis mixed up in the supernatural.
Stop Having Fun Guys  -  This is Serious Business! Who cares about "having fun"? Winning is the entire point!
No Communities Were Harmed  -  A fictional location modeled after a Real Life one.
Gun Porn  -  Fanservice...in Gun Form.
Conviction By Contradiction  -  Finding a hole in someone's alibi immediately proves their guilt, with no chance for reasonable doubt.
I Was Young And Needed The Money  -  Character excuses Old Shame by pointing out financial woes.
Dead Guy Puppet  -  A puppet made out of a dead body.
No Such Thing As Space Jesus  -  There are no gods in space, just very powerful aliens.
Five Stages Of Grief  -  If you're in grief you'll always go through the same five steps in order.
Prophet Eyes  -  All-white eyes, usually resulting in blindness.
Rainbow Pimp Gear  -  A practical (stat-wise) combination of clothes makes you look like a Rummage Sale Reject.
Six Degrees Of Kevin Bacon  -  A game that supposes any entertainer can be connected to Kevin Bacon to some degree.
And All I Got Was This Lousy T Shirt  -  I/my friend(s)/family member(s) went somewhere and/or did something exciting and harrowing...
Snark Bait  -  A work that people watch/read/consume in order to make fun of it.
Military Moe  -  Moe characters in the military.
No Canon For The Wicked  -  When Cutting Off the Branches, virtuous decisions are more likely to be made canon.
Troubling Unchildlike Behavior  -  A young child is doing things usually expected of adults, and that's worrying to the viewers and characters.
Fight Clubbing  -  People meet in secret to beat each other senseless.
Perpetual Poverty  -  Poverty is part of the setting: the main characters will never starve or make a bundle.
Hand Blast  -  Firing energy beams from one's hands, fingers, or wrists.
Gateway Series  -  This show leads you to watch others of its genre.
Koan  -  A deep saying that points out some piece of Fridge Logic for Real Life.
Bad Export For You  -  The foreign port of a work ends up inferior in some way.
Unwinnable By Insanity  -  You did something in the game no sane person would do, now you can't win.
Underused Game Mechanic  -  An interesting mechanic in a game that could have been utilized more and/or better.
Mobile City  -  A city that can move around.
Better On DVD  -  The show or movie is best watched on DVD, as its televised version is either edited, the victim of Executive Meddling or it is better to watch the series without breaks.
AI Breaker  -  The AI can't handle these moves.
Wardrobe Malfunction  -  When clothes fail, decency is lost. note But something else is gained.
Vomiting Cop  -  Cop barfs after seeing a really gruesome crime scene.
Balance Of Power  -  When opposing factions are evenly matched, nobody wants to start a fight
Dude Wheres My Reward  -  Hours of hard work performed for this task. And the reward for it is almost worthless
Nostalgia Aint Like It Used To Be  -  Overuse and/or misuse of Nostalgia Filter makes the past look better than it actually was.
Film Felons  -  Criminals pretending that their robbery, etc. is actually part of a movie.
Instrumentals  -  A song with no vocals.
Elevator School  -  This school has students from every grade in it.
Thanatos Gambit  -  A plan includes the planner's death as a step.
Baby Planet  -  A really tiny planet.
Mercurys Wings  -  Wings on the head or feet.
Button Mashing  -  The act of frantically hammering at the buttons on a controller or arcade console.
Xanatos Speed Chess  -  Quickly altering plans as needed.
Escape Artist  -  Badass Normal whose "power" is the ability to escape anything.
Not In Front Of The Parrot  -  Don't say anything important and/or embarrassing near parrots; they'll repeat it constantly!
Acronym Confusion  -  Mistaking one acronym/abbreviation for another.
Bully Hunter  -  Seeks to take down bullies however they can.
Good Night Sweet Prince  -  Phrase said at the death of a young male, although it's been subject to Memetic Mutation.
Sequel In Another Medium  -  The story of the original work is continued or expanded on in a different medium than that of the original.
Sapient Tank  -  A tank with a mind of its own.
Evil Slinks  -  Lean, mean and sexy!
Recycled Title  -  A different work in the same fictional universe uses the same title as an older one.
Denser And Wackier  -  A series installment is made crazier.
Couple Theme Naming  -  A pair of love interests are given Theme Naming.
Hyperspace Is A Scary Place  -  Hyperspace is drastically different from normal space, and is quite terrifying.
Super Strength  -  Unambiguously superhuman physical strength.
Logical Extreme  -  An instance of a trope that pushes its conventions to the limit (figuratively or literally) without exaggerating them.
World Tour  -  When characters travel to various well-known places around the world.
Quick Nip  -  Casually drinking intoxicants while doing something else.
Creative Differences  -  When disagreements among those involved in a work leads to a collapse of the collaboration.
Exact Time To Failure  -  You have 10 seconds to live. Right down to the yoctosecond.
Knight In Shining Armor  -  A hero who champions the weak and innocent, especially women in distress.
Retail Riot  -  Fighting over a store item.
Oblivious To His Own Description  -  Failing to recognize a definition that fits you precisely.
Tzadikim Nistarim  -  Righteous souls whose existence keeps the world going.
Knight Of Cerebus  -  When they show up, things get dark!
Double Entendre  -  Using a phrase with an obvious innocent meaning, but also a taboo or sexual meaning.
Black Magician Girl  -  Female, youngish Black Mage with an attitude.
Acoustic License  -  The setting may be noisy, but the characters can hear each other perfectly fine.
Square Cube Law  -  1. v2=v1(l2/l1)3note No two parts of the same thing scale proportionately.
Kung Fu Proof Mook  -  Your standard attacks won't have any effect on this baddie. Try something else.
A Mind Is A Terrible Thing To Read  -  You Do Not Want To Know what I'm thinking.
Mayfly December Romance  -  Romance between characters of radically different life expectancies.
Incredible Shrinking Man  -  A character is shrunk.
Listing The Forms Of Degenerates  -  A character makes a list of types of people he considers immoral.
Fantastic Medicinal Bodily Product  -  A product of a creature's biology has fantastic healing properties.
Sleeves Are For Wimps  -  Who needs sleeves when you got fists?
Rock Paper Scissors  -  Popular simple game around the world where rock (fist) beats scissors (V-sign), scissors beat paper (extended palm), and paper beats rock.
Profanity Police  -  A character who doesn't tolerate curse words and is quick to reprimand others who curse.
Tragic AIDS Story  -  AIDS leads to painful and sad death.
Faster Than Light Travel  -  Going faster than 299,792,458 meters note (That is, about 1,000,000,000 feet) per second, which is the Real Life speed limit of the universe.
Lighthouse Point  -  Hey look, it's a lighthouse!
Fictional Video Game  -  In-universe videogames that exist to give extra depth to a fictional setting.
Crowd Song  -  A crowd spontaneously bursts into song.
Lets You And Him Fight  -  Heroes gratuitously fighting heroes due to confusion, egos, a Manipulative Bastard, or some other factor.
Named By The Adaptation  -  A character that is either No Name Given or Only Known by Their Nickname in the original is given an actual name in the adaptation.
Magnetic Plot Device  -  A Plot Device that draws the plot to it.
Muggle Mage Romance  -  Romance between a Muggle and a special person.
Endless Game  -  The only ending is Game Over.
Bait And Switch Sentiment  -  You'd think they will say something sentimental, when really they don't.
Ham To Ham Combat  -  Two or more Large Hams try to see who can eat more scenery.
Room 101  -  You do not want to be sent to this room!
Depraved Dwarf  -  A malicious short villain.
Order Versus Chaos  -  The concepts of "Order" (tradition, history, group cohesiveness) and the concepts of "Chaos" (independence, invention, randomness) oppose each other.
Gotta Pass The Class  -  Someone who is failing their classes needs to get their grades up, or else they will either repeat the grade or be sent to summer school.
Infection Scene  -  A scene that shows exactly how a person becomes infected with a disease.
Sighted Guns Are Low Tech  -  Futuristic weapons lack any obvious means to be aimed.
World Healing Wave  -  A magical force that restores damage on a global or universal scale.
Bad Present  -  A character from the past comes to modern times and doesn't like it.
The Three Certainties In Life  -  Something is considered as certain as death and taxes.
Statistically Speaking  -  In RPGs, stats do not affect your characters outside the battle.
Spiteful AI  -  AI-controlled enemies prioritize disadvantaging the player over their own well being.
Never Hurt An Innocent  -  A villain (or Anti-Hero) refuses to harm innocent people.
Sham Wedding  -  A wedding that turns out to be fake.
Killed Off For Real  -  Character is permanently dead; no takebacks if some exist.
Wuxia  -  Over-the-top martial arts stories with Asian undertones.
Non Lethal KO  -  Not dead, but knocked unconscious. However, you still lose.
Salt And Pepper  -  Two characters—one black and one white—whose personalities are humorously different.
Silver Bullet  -  Silver as a Supernatural Repellent.
Deader Than Disco  -  A work that was once near-universally liked gains a huge amount of retroactive backlash to the point that it becomes near-universally hated.
Immediate Sequel  -  The sequel begins immediately where its previous installment ended.
Mega City  -  A city that is big in just about any aspect.
Bucket Booby Trap  -  Open that door and get dunked with a bucket full of water.
Boogie Knights  -  Dancing whilst wearing knightly armor.
Mac Guffin Delivery Service  -  One group lets another acquire a MacGuffin so they can swoop in and steal it.
Highly Conspicuous Uniform  -  Let's give the Mooks bright uniforms with big targets on them.
Simon Says Mini Game  -  A minigame in which the player must repeat a series of inputs after memorising it.
Artistic License Education  -  The educational system is depicted unrealistically in fiction.
Bizarrchitecture  -  Weird buildings.
All Asians Wear Conical Straw Hats  -  Asian people wear cone-like straw hats.
Unwinnable By Design  -  The game deliberately puts you in a dead end path and lets you keep going down it.
Sock Puppet  -  Another identity someone created solely to provoke a reaction.
Send In The Search Team  -  A Ship has sent an emergency call, the heroes must investigate.
Sarcastic Devotee  -  I'm loyal to you, but I'll still mock you.
Diegetic Musical  -  A musical whose numbers are done entirely in-universe as performances to someone else.
Spelling For Emphasis  -  Spelling out each letter of a word, w-o-r-d, to emphasis its importance.
Boarding Pod  -  A vehicle fired at other ships to board them.
Trying Not To Cry  -  A character avoids the urge to cry in a situation.
All Balloons Have Helium  -  Balloons + Air = Floating Balloon
Staring Kid  -  Camera pans out to show a kid staring at something.
Video Game Cruelty Potential  -  Mechanics of the game allow the player to do some potentially horrible things.
Mad Bomber  -  A person that loves blowing things up too much.
Thong Of Shielding  -  You can show as much of the buttocks as you want on TV as long as the butt-crack is covered.
Those Magnificent Flying Machines  -  Flying machines are heavy, weird, and yet they still fly.
Superhero Horror  -  Superhero stories with elements of the horror genre.
Any Last Words  -  [Alice at Bob's mercy, Alice ready to kill Bob] Alice: Any last words? Bob: [Last words]. [Alice kills Bob or Bob gains the upperhand]
All Your Colors Combined  -  COLOR POWER!!!
Deceased Parents Are The Best  -  The only good parent is a dead parent.
Hookers And Blow  -  Decadent drugs and sex.
Eerie Pale Skinned Brunette  -  Snow White's appearance (blood-red lips optional), used to make a character creepy.
Updated Rerelease  -  It's the same product, but with a few more tweaks and things.

Nigh Invulnerability  -  Near-impossible to hurt.
Gathering Steam  -  A character requires time to reach their full power, or even being able to attack.
Heel Face Brainwashing  -  Using brainwashing in order to reform a bad guy.
Ancient Evil  -  Evil from the past.
Music Video Overshadowing  -  The music video has a meaning different from what was intended with the song, but everyone thinks the song means the same thing.
Enemy Posturing  -  The boss is taunting you! Now's your chance to attack!
Gender Neutral Narrator  -  The narrator's gender is ambiguous.
You Look Like Youve Seen A Ghost  -  If a person is frightened, it looks like he or she saw a ghost.
Pleasure Island  -  Getting addicted to a fun activity comes back to bite you in the ass sooner or later.
Backstabbing The Alpha Bitch  -  The nastiest lead girl in a school is betrayed by a member of her own gang.
Nightcore  -  Electronic Music based around higher-tempo, higher-pitched music.
Electric Slide  -  Running on power lines or something similar.
Will Return Caption  -  The end of a work includes a caption explicitly announcing a sequel.
Ending Fatigue  -  For God's sake, end already!!!
Detective Patsy  -  A detective is hired to solve a crime by the one that committed it.
Playing Nice For Now  -  Two enemies put on an act that they are getting along.
The Chosen One  -  The ancient prophecy says that only a certain person can save the world.
Man I Feel Like A Woman  -  A male character changes into a female. Experimentation ensues.
Defrosting Ice Queen  -  In personality, a cold person who warms up over time due to their relationship with someone (generally their Love Interest).
Iron Woobie  -  A Woobie that takes the Trauma Conga Line in stride.
Dowry Dilemma  -  A woman's family has trouble putting together a dowry for her marriage.
Egg Sitting  -  Characters must act as parents for a day to fake "babies", usually a chicken egg. Cue shenanigans.
No Place For A Warrior  -  A former member of the armed forces is so used to combat and military life that it's difficult or impossible for them to adapt to peace and civilian life.
Burning The Ships  -  A wilful action that makes retreat impossible, to enforce the commitment of the affected.
Knocking On Heathens Door  -  Door-to-door preaching.
My Biological Clock Is Ticking  -  She wants to have kids ASAP.
In Series Nickname  -  Character has a nickname for another character.
Be Careful What You Say  -  What you say has its own power alone; you'll soon regret saying it.
Louis Cypher  -  Satan, or another demonic entity, in disguise, using an alias that hints at his true identity.
Gutted Like A Fish  -  Getting your belly slashed open, so your insides are on the outside now.
As Long As There Is Evil  -  ...in the world, the villain will keep coming back.
Rugged Scar  -  A scar (or scars) is used as shorthand to show a character is tough or a survivor.
Bubblegloop Swamp  -  Generic video game swamp area. Expect reptile- and insect-based enemies and a lot of mud.
Luxury Prison Suite  -  The bad guy gets sent to prison, but he still lives in luxury by the prison's standards.
Chubby Mama Skinny Papa  -  A couple which consists of a thin, scrawny male who has paternal traits and a plump, chubby female who has maternal traits.
Pillow Pistol  -  Sleeping with a weapon under your pillow for self-defense.
Steel Drums And Sunshine  -  Steel drums make for fun music, especially in tropical settings which may or may not be the actual Caribbean islands.
Immigrant Parents  -  When your parents live in a different country than you.
Chocolate Of Romance  -  Chocolate is a main ingredient in a relationship.
Comedic Underwear Exposure  -  Your bloomers are showing.
Big Brother Worship  -  A younger sibling who really, really admires their older brother (or sister).
Do It Yourself Theme Tune  -  The show's theme song is sung by one or more members of the cast.
Arab Beoble Talk  -  The pecularities of the Arabic accent are featured prominently and/or lampshaded.
Vertical Kidnapping  -  An unanticipated pickup from above.
Vibroweapon  -  It shakes really fast so it cuts through anything.
Less Embarrassing Term  -  A term dubbed embarrassing is replaced by an entirely different term that may be both less descriptive and more amusing to those who hear or read it.
Shooting The Swarm  -  When a character uses a firearm or projectile weapon to try and kill a swarm of something with little success.
A Truce While We Gawk  -  Two (or more) characters who are fighting suddenly stop to stare at something.
Psycho Sidekick  -  A questionably-moral friend of a squeaky-clean protagonist who shoots dogs for him a lot.
Would Hit A Girl  -  Male character has no qualms regarding physical violence against women.
Standard Evil Organization Squad  -  A Legion of Doom that runs the Nebulous Evil Organisation over the table.
Panthera Awesome  -  Big cats are badass and awesome.
Our Ghosts Are Different  -  The original ghost myths couldn't keep the details straight, either.
Film Serial  -  The Older Than Television theatrical chapter play Action-Adventure Film format.
Offscreen Crash  -  A collision or accident of some kind occurs just offscreen. Loudly.
Artificial Brilliance  -  WHOA! Where did the computer learn to do that???
Bungling Inventor  -  An inventor whose inventions often go wrong.
Screwed By The Network  -  Network executives intentionally sabotage a show, leading to its cancellation.
Canine Companion  -  Man's best friend indeed.
Death By Genre Savviness  -  They might be genre savvy, but not enough to prevent their deaths.
Air Vent Passageway  -  Conveniently-sized crawlspaces ensuring escape.
Padded Sumo Gameplay  -  Everyone is a Stone Wall.
What Exactly Is His Job  -  A member of the True Companions doesn't seem to have a (logical) role among the True Companions.
Bosss Unfavorite Employee  -  One employee is treated disproportionately poorly compared to the others.
Robot Clown  -  A robot with the appearance of a clown for twice the fun (or scare).
Gorgeous Gaijin  -  A white Western character in an East Asian setting who's played for Fanservice.
Staring Contest  -  Two people stare into each others eyes, the one who stops staring loses.
Deckbuilding Game  -  Tabletop game were the deck is built while playing the game.
Status Buff Dispel  -  A spell that gets rid of buffs.
Parent Child Team  -  A parent and child team up to take on the world together.
Valley Girl  -  The Trope: Like, whatever, I am like so totally OMG!
Begone Bribe  -  Bribing someone to make them go the hell away.
Standard Sci Fi Army  -  Unit classification of sci-fi armies.
I Knew It  -  A fan theory (or theories) that's later proven to be true.
Mad At A Dream  -  Being angry at something that happened in a dream.
Yodel Land  -  Switzerland is represented as full of pastoral fields.
Island Base  -  An island used as a secret base or headquarters.
Adoption Is Not An Option  -  A couple wants a child but it doesn't occur to them to adopt.
Break Them By Talking  -  Breaking someone down just by talking to them.
In The End You Are On Your Own  -  Your allies won't follow you to the very last showdown.
Training From Hell  -  Extremely tough training.
The Penance  -  The Atoner engages in self-harm out of shame.
I Cannot Self Terminate  -  Character is physically unable to kill themself.
Walking Wasteland  -  Character that destroys things on contact.
Spotlight Stealing Title  -  The most popular character is promoted to series title.
Multi Platform  -  Video game available in two or more systems during the same launch window.
Throwing Your Shield Always Works  -  Luckily My Shield is also a Deadly Disc.
Dragon In Chief  -  The second-in-command plays the role of Big Bad while the nominal superior is much less of a threat.
Batman Gambit  -  A plan that relies on its victims doing what they do naturally.
Scarpia Ultimatum  -  Have sex with me, or else your loved one gets it.
Exiled From Continuity  -  Technically canon characters can't appear due to (usually) legal reasons.
Bittersweet Seventeen  -  Seventeen is a bittersweet age bridging the gap between childhood and adulthood.
Hidden Eyes  -  A character is drawn with a shadow completely obscuring their eyes to either show that they are terrifying, or are feeling Angst.
Hybrid Overkill Avoidance  -  Some creatures just aren't allowed to be mixed together.
Temple Of Doom  -  Dangerous shrine.
Lame Last Words  -  Last words upon which nobody would want to die.
Glass Weapon  -  A weapon literally made out of glass.
Bad Habits  -  People up to no good disguising themselves as clergy.
Sweeping Ashes  -  A corpse's ashes get swept up.
The Data Base Hates Me  -  The database hates you right now. The entry might exist or it might not exist. We would clear this mystery up for you, if we could get to the database. We tried to look it up, but the database puked up an error:Can't connect to My SQL server on 'localhost' (10061)
A Good Old Fashioned Paint Watching  -  Our grandparents had really boring entertainment.
God Before Dogma  -  A religious hero opposes the villain's religious beliefs.
Never Split The Party  -  A group decides that they're not going to split up.
Sexual Extortion  -  Withholding something from a target until they consent to sex.
Anti Escapism Aesop  -  Reality is preferable to fiction.
Dogs Love Being Praised  -  Dogs really love being praised, and get upset when referred to as bad.
Fairy Battle  -  A "battle" in which you don't actually fight.
Expository Theme Tune  -  A theme song whose lyrics describe the show.
Hummer Dinger  -  SUVs in fiction are stupidly huge and have laughably poor fuel efficiency.
Sweet Tooth  -  Character who has a thing for sweets.
Hidden Villain  -  The Big Bads identity is unknown for a great portion of the story.
Chewing The Scenery  -  ACTING with EMPHASIS. I'M ACTING!!!
The Everyman  -  His personality is your interpretation.
Super Not Drowning Skills  -  Apparently, the hero can breathe underwater or at least hold their breath for a really long time.
Separated By A Common Language  -  They both use the same language, but each use it differently.
Naughty Nurse Outfit  -  Sexy pretend nurse.
Rubber Band History  -  No matter what, the changes in an Alternate History will be undone to something resembling Real Life.
Machine Empathy  -  A character can diagnose machines just by feeling or listening to them.
Double Unlock  -  One condition reveals a prize, but it's still locked until you do more.
Turned Against Their Masters  -  Artificially derived beings turn against their creators.
Stealthy Teleportation  -  Teleportion that leaves little to no indication of use.
Double Tap  -  Shooting something presumed to be dead, just to be sure.
Empty Levels  -  Gaining a single Character Level isn't worth much.
Cross Popping Veins  -  So angry their blood is grimacing.
Absentee Actor  -  Character doesn't appear in an episode for no apparent reason (or for a reason only readily apparent out-of-universe).
Toros Y Flamenco  -  Stereotypical portrayals of Spain (and other countries adjacent to it).
Small Reference Pools  -  Only making references to very well-known things.
Painted Tunnel Real Train  -  Stock cartoon gag where a painted tunnel somehow becomes a real tunnel.
Bad Samaritan  -  The person who helped you out turns out to have ulterior motives.
Hammer And Sickle Removed For Your Protection  -  Russians that aren't called Russians.
Award Snub  -  Why didn't this get an award? They really deserve one.
The Hero  -  The central character who performs heroic deeds with a heroic motivation.
Un Equal Rites  -  Rivalries between different types of spellcasters.
Automated Automobiles  -  A car that drives itself.
Vichy Earth  -  Alien invaders rule humanity instead of/before exterminating us.
Character Derailment  -  Character changes without rhyme or reason, or without an appropriate explanation. May or may not be for the better.
I Fight For The Strongest Side  -  Couldn't beat them, so joined them.
Masquerade  -  A cover-up that prevents muggles from discovering the existence of the supernatural in their world.
Ring Around The Collar  -  Still characters are easier to animate talking when the head and body are separated by neckwear.
Tsurime Eyes  -  Eyes that slant upwards, which symbolize strong emotions such as arrogance, pride or snarkness.
Like Parent Like Spouse  -  A character's spouse is very similar to one of their parents.
Shoot The Medic First  -  When healers and other support units are very high-priority targets.
Artistic License Linguistics  -  The creator of a work doesn't worry about whether he's following the rules of linguistics or not.
Fair Weather Mentor  -  A terrible teacher who dumps all the blame onto you and takes all the credit.
Multipurpose Tongue  -  A tongue used for something other than tasting or moving food while chewing and swallowing.
Doctor Whomage  -  Expies and Captain Ersatzes of the Doctor.
Dog Food Diet  -  So poor they resort to eating dog food.
Variable Length Chain  -  Chains are as long as they need to be.
Loser Friend Puzzles Outsiders  -  Lampshade Hanging on an Odd Friendship with differences in respect rather than personality.
Item Caddy  -  Specializes in acquiring items and/or using items.
Dual Wielding  -  A character uses two weapons simultaneously.
Hospital Surprise  -  A character apparently dies...before waking up in a hospital.
Fallen States Of America  -  The US has considerably lost geopolitical influence, or fallen apart altogether.
Badass Unintentional  -  A badass character is unaware how badass they are.
Dystopia Justifies The Means  -  The villain wants to create a Dystopia.
Christmas Rushed  -  Something is rushed in time for a certain occasion, with varying results.
Black Bead Eyes  -  When two black ellipses are all you need for a character's eyes.
Disco Tech  -  Technology that runs on music.
Portrayed By Different Species  -  An animal is portrayed as a different species (or breed) than what the animal itself actually is.
Who Writes This Crap  -  In-Universe reactions to bad writing.
Plug N Play Technology  -  All sorts of technology are compatible with each other.
Anything That Moves  -  They're willing to sleep with just about anyone of their species.
Oblivious Adoption  -  Someone is adopted and they don't know it, despite it being blatantly obvious.
Sensei For Scoundrels  -  Someone who mentors another into becoming a better person with shady, unorthodox, and usually amoral methods.
Come With Me If You Want To Live  -  To survive, the person must go with someone they otherwise wouldn't rely upon.
Cumulonemesis  -  Clouds that attack!
I Am Your Opponent  -  I challenge you!
Soul Brotha  -  Impossibly cool and badass black man.
Make Up Is Evil  -  Make-up in fiction is a sign of being evil.
Oh Crap  -  Character realizes they are totally screwed.
Witness Protection  -  A program that helps people who have made powerful enemies start over in a new identity.
Finger Muzzle  -  Using a finger to shut someone up, often in a playful way.
Remarrying For Your Kids  -  Remarrying in order to give your child(ren) a parental figure missing from their life.
Drama Preserving Handicap  -  This fight would be boring or abrupt if the strong character wasn't suddenly weakened.
Sniper Duel  -  Firefight between two snipers.
Death By Materialism  -  A character's Greed leads to their death.
Overly Cool Play Space  -  No way those kids made that playset themselves.
No Accounting For Taste  -  Why are these two people still married?!
Genki Girl  -  Cutesy, hyperactive girl.
Blood Magic  -  Magic runs on blood.
Food Chains  -  Eating food from a strange realm will cost you big.
Smash To Black  -  A Smash Cut straight to a black screen, usually succeeding a dramatic event.
Peek A Bogeyman  -  A monster who just wants to scare people, not actually hurt them.
