Engineered Hashtag  -  A hashtag designed by someone or by a company to be viral.
The Lab Rat  -  A character that does scientific analysis, usually forensics.
The Ludovico Technique  -  A form of conditioning therapy/torture that involves physically forcing the subject to watch various imagery over other stimuli.
Nested Mouths  -  Mouths inside mouths.
Same Content Different Rating  -  A new installment or a re-release has a higher or lower rating than previous releases of the series with little or no noticeable change in content.
Self Fulfilling Prophecy  -  A prophecy fulfilled by attempts to prevent it from happening.
Who Watches The Watchmen  -  Who will enforce the law onto those who enforce law?
Cute Is Evil  -  An adorably evil villain.
Kidnapped Scientist  -  A scientist (or other expert) is kidnapped for their skills.
She Fu  -  Girls fighting with body-displaying acrobatics.
Pummel Duel  -  Rapid-Fire Fisticuffs vs Rapid-Fire Fisticuffs.
Solar Flare Disaster  -  A flare + some hapless target = bad things happening.
Live Action Cutscene  -  A cutscene in a video game that uses live-action actors and sets, instead of computer graphics.
Storming The Castle  -  The assault on the Big Bad's home base.
Sparing The Aces  -  A character is spared because he has an unrivaled ability or skill worth saving.
Almost Famous Name  -  Someone has a similar name to a celebrity.
All Theories Are True  -  Discredited and unproven [pseudo-]scientific ideas are factual in fiction.
Home Run Hitter  -  A character who swings a weapon so hard it knocks their opponent far, far away.
Patter Song  -  A wordy song sung incredibly fast.
Multiple Endings  -  Win different, end different.
Ray Of Hope Ending  -  An ending that would normally be a Downer Ending, but shows that there's still hope left for the heroes.
Skewed Priorities  -  Worrying about something unimportant instead of what's more important.
Love At First Sight  -  Falling in love with someone upon meeting/seeing them for the first time.
Disembodied Eyebrows  -  When eyebrows float and detach from the character for maximum expression.
Ludicrous Gibs  -  Rest in pieces. Lots of pieces. All over the place.
Paper Tiger  -  Character looks tough, but is actually a weakling.
Byronic Hero  -  A troubled, brooding, (sometimes selfish) outcast whose passion causes drama.
Derailed Fairy Tale  -  When an innocent fairy tale goes Off the Rails.
Girl On Girl Is Hot  -  Straight men are turned on by lesbianism: It's the gender they like, plus some more of the gender they like.
Drinking Game  -  Drink one or more shots of alcohol when X happens.
Real Place Background  -  The setting is an exact replica of a real place.
Squats In A Name  -  A seemingly meaningful name isn't.
Classical Chimera  -  A monster made up of multiple different creatures. Most commonly a lion, a goat and a snake.
By The Hair  -  Pulling (usually long) hair.
Toppled Statue  -  The downfall of a character or group is marked by the destruction of a statue of them.
Inspirationally Disadvantaged  -  Being disabled makes you an inspiration to us all.
Babys First Words  -  A baby says their first word(s).
Black Vikings  -  Having a Token Minority in a historical setting where it doesn't make sense.
Thieving Magpie  -  Magpies and other corvids like to steal stuff.
Have We Met Yet  -  A character meets a time traveler for the first time, but the latter is already familiar with the former.
Workplace Acquired Abilities  -  A character's day job turns out to be a Chekhov's Skill.
Upbringing Makes The Hero  -  Good Parents make good Heroes.
Fungi Are Plants  -  Fungi treated as plants.
Windmill Political  -  Trying to save people from a political threat that doesn't exist.
Even Bad Men Love Their Mamas  -  Mothers are important to everybody, even jerks and villains.
Stock Footage  -  Use some footage. Use it again and again to save money.
Sugar Apocalypse  -  Sugar Bowl goes to Hell.
Dump Them All  -  When faced with multiple love interests, the focus of their affection rejects them all.
Suicide Attack  -  Attacker kills himself to kill the enemy.
Sucky School  -  A school is a Crapsack World.
Shoplift And Die  -  Shopkeepers will make you pay. With your life.
Invisibility  -  Not visible.
Voice With An Internet Connection  -  They talk to other characters from afar.
Laugh With Me  -  A villain performs an Evil Laugh and demands others laugh with him/her.
Celestial Deadline  -  You have X until Magic Spell Y breaks/becomes permanent.
Album Closure  -  The final song provides closure to the album and/or its themes.
Catch And Return  -  A maneuver where the user catches some sort of projectile or attack and sends it right back.
Spell My Name With A The  -  (The) Person who insists on the "The" in their name.
Nice To The Waiter  -  Good people treat lower-ranking workers well, bad people treat them poorly.
Megalodon  -  Fictional portrayals of the prehistoric shark megalodon.
Evil Only Has To Win Once  -  If the villains win, it's over.
Healer Signs On Early  -  One of your first allies can heal.
Appropriated Appellation  -  Character uses a nickname or insult given by someone else as an actual name.
Rewind Replay Repeat  -  Spot something on a recording. Rewind. Replay. Repeat.
Drool Hello  -  The first hint that you get that a monster is nearby is them drooling all over you.
The Imp  -  An antagonistic, usually small, character that serves as a nuisance rather than a threat.
Fake Ultimate Hero  -  Famous hero's fame is built on lies.
Imagination Based Superpower  -  A power based around the user's imagination.
Slogan Yelling Megaphone Guy  -  This guy wants to yell out slogans for a cause.
Inspector Lestrade  -  This detective is great at getting the right pieces of the puzzle, but clueless at putting them together.
To Be A Master  -  The protagonist's main goal is to be the very best, like no one ever was.
Rhetorical Question Blunder  -  A question that didn't need an answer gets one anyway.
Angry White Man  -  A (typically) white man who believes diversity and inclusion is a plot to destroy him.
Thriller  -  Trope: Anticipation of action, rather than action itself.
Two Fisted Tales  -  Stories inspired by pulps.
Language Drift  -  Language autonomously changes over time.
Totally Eighteen  -  Pointing out (or claiming) that the character is adult and most definitely not underage.
Tragedy  -  Genre in which a character rises to the top, but is brought to ruin by their own flaws.
Dash Attack  -  An attack that happens when you charge at the target.
B Team Sequel  -  Sequel not done by the original creators.
Drives Like Crazy  -  Crazy person takes the wheel.
All The Worlds Are A Stage  -  The final level or area includes elements from all of the previous ones.
Parody Sue  -  A Mary Sue, Played for Laughs.
Secret Secret Keeper  -  Discovered the secret and doesn't even tell the Secret Keeper.
Dangerous Device Disposal Debacle  -  Because a Plot Device wasn't disposed of correctly, it can be freely utilized again for more plot.
Dramatic Sit Down  -  The situation has changed so much that Alice needs to take a seat.
Benevolent Mage Ruler  -  Spellcasters ruling others with wisdom and fairness.
Interface Screw  -  Your view or your controls are messed up. Good luck.
Treachery Cover Up  -  The cover up of a treacherous deed, for the perceived greater good.
Bonding Through Shared Earbuds  -  Giving someone else the unused earbud as part of getting together.
Prompting Nudge  -  A character gives another a stealth nudge to force them to behave in a proper way.
The Theme Park Version  -  Something complex is stripped down to only the stuff that "matters".
Unknown Character  -  A character is significant to the plot but never actually appears.
Transforming Mecha  -  Through transmogrification, I am a Humongous Mecha.
If My Calculations Are Correct  -  A character claims that s/he made a prediction base on sudden foolproof calculations.
The Man In Front Of The Man  -  A minion of the apparent Big Bad is revealed to be the true villain.
Front 13 Back 9  -  The season starts with 13 episodes which are ordered, then the next 9 will air and be ordered later.
Consummate Liar  -  They can deceive anyone.
Spy Catsuit  -  Impossibly cool but impractical fanservice suit for stealth missions.
Hacker Cave  -  A Mad Scientist Laboratory full of various computing bits and bobs (not always for hacking).
Ooh Me Accents Slipping  -  An actor faking an accent briefly lapsing into their own accent.
Made Of Phlebotinum  -  Phlebotinum makes the world go round.
The Emperor  -  Ruler of more than one polity.
Vampire Variety Pack  -  A work has various types of vampires from different mythologies.
Tear Apart Tug Of War  -  Two or more characters fight over an object, tugging it back and forth until it rips or breaks.
Vendor Trash  -  Items which have the sole purpose of being sold for money.
Two Person Pool Party  -  A couple has sex in a swimming pool.
Lie To The Beholder  -  Something is used to change a character's appearance, often making them seem completely different.
Never Work With Children Or Animals  -  When children or animals in a live-action TV show don't act or react like how you expected.
Artifact Of Attraction  -  Everyone wants this, regardless of what it is.
Projectile Toast  -  When toaster ovens "pop up" toast with enough force to eject it from the toaster.
The Queens Latin  -  The tendency for characters in historical settings (esp. ancient Rome) to speak with British accents.
Doppelganger Replacement Love Interest  -  Identical substitute love interest comes through supernatural means.
Set Swords To Stun  -  Using or being hit by a lethal weapon leads to a Non-Lethal K.O..
Reality Warper  -  Can change the way the world is put together.
Museum Of Boredom  -  A boring museum.
Bunker Woman  -  A woman is kidnapped and held in a contained location.
Oireland  -  Stereotypical Hollywood portrayal of Ireland.
But I Play One On TV  -  People referred to by the names of characters the actors played as rather than those of the actors themselves.
The Topic Of Cancer  -  In fiction, cancer is the most primal fear; more so than any other disease.
Beauty Is Never Tarnished  -  Girls hardly get dirty or scuffed; that takes away from their beauty!
Super Toughness  -  The power of unambiguously superhuman durability.
Betrayal By Offspring  -  Child betrays parent.
Instrument Of Murder  -  Musical instruments that are used as weapons.
Locking Mac Gyver In The Store Cupboard  -  Locking a prisoner in a room that already contains the items needed to escape.
Words Can Break My Bones  -  Certain words have magical power and often stupendous effects from speaking/writing them.
Divinely Appearing Demons  -  An inhabitant of Hell is superficially similar to an inhabitant of Heaven.
Portal Cut  -  Partial teleportation slices objects.
Rapid Fire Shut Up  -  Repeatedly saying "Shut up!" in quick succession to silence other people.
Reentry Scare  -  Radio silence during atmospheric reentry causes tension.
Luxurious Liquor  -  Silly rabbit, alcohol is for the 1%!
Unintentional Final Message  -  A living character receives a message that a dead character composed before they knew they were about to die.
Not So Well Intentioned Extremist  -  A character who commits horrid acts for supposedly good causes, but actually does them for selfish reasons.
Those Were Only Their Scouts  -  The powerful foe the protagonists barely defeated? Merely the vanguard of a much more powerful force.
Lending A Backhand  -  A character offers "help" to another character that actually hurts them.
Evil Is Hammy  -  Villain persona includes acting like a Large Ham and/or more so than heroes.
Liar Revealed  -  The protagonists learn that a character has been lying about something (which the audience is usually already aware of).
Animal Theme Naming  -  Names following a theme from animals.
The Hypnotoad  -  Mind-controlling non-humanoid.
I Read It For The Articles  -  ...And not for the pictures. I swear.
Sacrificed Basic Skill For Awesome Training  -  Can't fry an egg but can do a triple somersault, playing the guitar.
Friends Rent Control  -  The cast's housing space is implausibly large for their financial means.
Delinquents  -  Those kids are up to no good...
Spoiled Brat  -  An arrogant, whiny, entitled child who thinks everything belongs to them.
Your Door Was Open  -  No one questions someone who just walks into a stranger's house.
I Am Not Leonard Nimoy  -  An actor's own personality overshadows that of their character(s).
Body Motifs  -  Symbolic association with a particular body part.
Young Gun  -  Gun-toting kid.
Heel  -  Professional Wrestler whose job is to be hated by audiences.
Killing Intent  -  When someone wants to hurt or kill someone, people nearby can sense it. Sometimes too much.
Cerebus Retcon  -  Something that was Played for Laughs is retconned as Played for Drama.
Trumplica  -  A pastiche, parody, or imitation of Donald Trump.
Power Born Of Madness  -  Insanity functions as a superpower.
In Touch With His Feminine Side  -  Male who has defined feminine traits.
Monochrome Casting  -  The cast is made up of one race.
Things That Go Bump In The Night  -  This monster goes under your bed, in your closet, in the bathtub, and more! For only $12.99! (Shipping and handling of $3.00, offer void in Ohio)
Loners Are Freaks  -  Introversion is considered a character flaw.
No More For Me  -  Character witnesses something surreal/ridiculous and assumes it's the fault of a substance they're imbibing.
Ugly Guy Hot Wife  -  She's a hottie. He's not. Opposites definitely attracted with this couple.
Commuting On A Bus  -  A main character gets Put on a Bus, but returns as a Recurring Character.
Mythology Upgrade  -  You're Sadly Mythtaken, these monsters weren't nearly this badass in their original mythologies.
Bob Ross Rib  -  Stock Parodies of Bob Ross.
Stop Drowning And Stand Up  -  Someone thinks he is drowning when he actually isn't.
Clark Kenting  -  A Paper-Thin Disguise maintained as a Secret Identity for a second life.
Bottomless Pits  -  Falling off the screen kills you.
Supervillain Lair  -  Elaborate base where the Big Bad lives.
Nerf  -  Lowering something's power or efficiency in the name of Competitive Balance.
The Political Officer  -  Official who oversees a military unit to ensure political obedience.
Parrot Expowhat  -  A word needing Expospeak must be repeated by the character being addressed.
Powerful And Helpless  -  Your strengths won't do you any good here.
Offhand Backhand  -  Punching someone without even looking at them.
Weapons Kitchen Sink  -  A setting where all sorts of weapons throughout history coexist, usually when it's not appropriate to the situation.
Sex Is Good  -  There is absolutely nothing shameful or evil about sex.
Tagline  -  The main phrase used in promotion for a work.
Comforting The Widow  -  A newly-widowed woman is comforted by a man...which leads to sex.
Interspecies Adoption  -  Somebody adopts a child who's a different species.
The Elites Jump Ship  -  Upper society flees from the coming catastrophe, leaving everyone else to fend for themselves.
Complaining About Rescues They Dont Like  -  Rescued person complains about being rescued in a less ideal manner than they hoped for while being captive.
Impaled With Extreme Prejudice  -  Supersized stabbing, often all-the-way-through.
Hope Sprouts Eternal  -  Baby plants are inspiring.
One Super One Powerset  -  Status Quo Is God applied to a character's abilities.
Kinslaying Is A Special Kind Of Evil  -  When killing one's relative is considered a Moral Event Horizon.
Psycho Electro  -  Snap! Crackle! Psychopath!
Alter Kocker  -  An old character with a stereotypical Yiddish accent and mannerisms.
Deadly Deferred Conversation  -  Two characters agree to tell each other something later in the story, foreshadowing the death of one or both of them.
My Favorite Shirt  -  YOU RUINED MY FAVORITE X! YOU MUST DIE!
Underboobs  -  When a woman (or man) has the bottom of their breasts exposed.
Zombie Advocate  -  A human who fights for the moral rights of non-humans.
Straight To The Pointe  -  Fictional ballerinas can dance on their toe-tips much easier than in real life.
Its Up To You  -  Only the protagonist can achieve the game's goal. Not your allies, not your rivals, and definitely not the NPCs.
Car Hood Sliding  -  A character jumps and slides across the hood of a car.
The One That Got Away  -  The protagonist didn't end up with his/her One True Love.
Kinetic Weapons Are Just Better  -  In The Future we'll still use old-school ballistics instead of Energy Weapons.
Postmodernism  -  Self-aware artistic reaction to modernity.
Individualism Vs Collectivism  -  When the needs of a group of people and the needs of an individual person are at odds (or are treated as being at odds) with one another.
Four Terms Fallacy  -  If X is Y, and Y' is Z, and Y and Y' sound kinda similar, then X is Z.
Single Target Sexuality  -  Only attracted to one person. To put it other way: extreme monogamy.
Smart Ball  -  Keep the plot going by making someone do something uncharacteristically genius.
Not Even Human  -  If the bad guys turn out to be of a species mindless and alien, it's okay to kill them without any moral issues.
Torpedo Tits  -  Shooting things from the breasts.
The Big Bad Shuffle  -  Multiple candidates for the Big Bad are presented in succession.
Left Justified Fantasy Map  -  Fantasy world maps tend to focus on (south-)western coasts.
Falling Chandelier Of Doom  -  Watch out, that chandelier's going to drop!
Seamless Spontaneous Lie  -  Spur of the moment, airtight alibi.
Enter Solution Here  -  Find answer in place A, enter it in place B.
Lockpicking Minigame  -  Picking locks framed as a Mini-Game in video games.
Enjoy The Story Skip The Game  -  Players and critics find a game's story more interesting than its gameplay.
Mutually Exclusive Magic  -  There are several kinds of magic, but you can only choose one kind to learn.
Excuse Boomerang  -  A character tries to make an excuse, but then the same excuse is used to justify punishing them.
Oddball In The Series  -  Which of these is not like the others?
Bite The Wax Tadpole  -  When advertising gets Lost in Translation.
Swiss Army Weapon  -  What's better than many weapons? A single weapon containing many weapons!
Getting Smilies Painted On Your Soul  -  Being made happy against your will.
Army Of The Ages  -  Army composed of soldiers from different time periods.
Ocean Punk  -  Sci-Fi out at sea.
Passive Aggressive Kombat  -  A social situation presented as a battle.
Visual Novel  -  Japanese-style Interactive Fiction, usally Moe-ified and filled with a detailed background.
Angsty Surviving Twin  -  A twin survives their sibling and it sucks.
Relationship Sue  -  A Mary Sue that is a perfect partner for a specific character.
Amazing Technicolor Wildlife  -  Purple alligators, orange koalas...since when are animals this brightly colored?
Why Dont You Just Shoot Him  -  Villains never take the most direct approach to dealing with enemies.
Dead Artists Are Better  -  Art in fiction is considered more valuable if its creator is deceased.
One Bad Mother  -  Mother is a common villain name.
Kill It With Fire  -  The best (or only) way to get rid of something is burning it.
Graphics Induced Super Deformed  -  Lower number of pixels = larger character heads relative to body.
Demolitions Expert  -  A person who's good with explosives.
Rooftop Concert  -  A music performance on a rooftop to draw passing spectators below.
Pinball Scoring  -  You can always use more zeroes to the right of your score!
President Evil  -  Our elected national leader acts like the all-powerful Big Bad.
Clingy Costume  -  Clothing you can't remove.
Monster Of The Week  -  Facing an unrelated monstrous threat once per weekly episode.
Drive In Theater  -  Lots of people sit down in their parked vehicles to watch a film on a 50-foot-high screen.
Marathon Running  -  A channel shows the same program for a lengthy time period.
Aggressive Submissive  -  Aggressive in sexual advances, submissive in bed.
Random Species Offspring  -  A couple's offspring has a species way different from their parents' species.
Red Herring Shirt  -  A character who seems disposable and insignificant ends up playing a larger role in the story.
Portal Book  -  A book that can transport someone to the world of its story, or the location that is represented in it.
Pay Evil Unto Evil  -  Doing cruel things to cruel people.
Die Laughing  -  When someone dies while laughing.
He Didnt Make It  -  Somber way of saying "he died."
Commissar Cap  -  Peaked caps give you military (dictatorship) cred.
Tesla Tech Timeline  -  Nikola Tesla used to handwave Lightning Can Do Anything.
Villainous Badland Heroic Arcadia  -  The bad guys live somewhere ugly and barren, the good guys live somewhere pretty and green.
Malevolent Mutilation  -  When someone agrees to have a body modification. No, not the "piercing the ear" kind.
Monster Modesty  -  A monstrous character wears as little as possible without being fully unclothed.
Youth Is Wasted On The Dumb  -  Kids and teenagers can be stupid.
Before The Dark Times  -  Things used to be way better than this.
Feeling Oppressed By Their Existence  -  Somebody who has never been harmed by any members of Group X hates Group X anyway.
Resting Recovery  -  A video game mechanic where a resting character's health/mana/stamina regenerate quickly.
Boss Bonanza  -  A dungeon has a disproportionately high number of bosses.
Campbell Country  -  Rural Britain as a common setting for horror works.
Make Them Rot  -  A character with the ability to make things decompose.
Reed Richards Is Useless  -  Amazing things in Speculative Fiction never improve society, because Status Quo Is God.
Creepy Cathedral  -  Scary cathedral of Corrupt Church.
Chaos While Theyre Not Looking  -  Alice walks out, Bob and Charles are trying to kill each other. Alice walks back in and Bob and Charles act friendly. Alice is none the wiser.
Leap And Fire  -  Jumping in the air and firing a lot, usually in slow motion.
Virtue Is Weakness  -  A character, often a villain, thinks being honorable/compassionate/humble/honest etc makes you weak.
Duty That Transcends Death  -  A character so devoted to their cause, not even death stops them from fulfilling it.
Non Action Guy  -  A guy who can't fight.
Death By Looking Up  -  A character about to be squashed looks up juuuust in time to say oh sh-
Big Red Button  -  Activating something important to the plot with a big camera-friendly red button.
Sweat Drop  -  An overly conspicuous bead of perspiration.
Hero Stole My Bike  -  The hero needs to get somewhere fast, so he steals a ride.
Dramatic Necklace Removal  -  No one in fiction is able to take off a necklace without ripping it clean off.
Action Girlfriend  -  A woman of your dreams enters your life... and kicks ass!
Gadgeteer Genius  -  Character is good at inventing gadgets and other devices.
Non Dubbed Grunts  -  When Voice Grunting samples don't need to be localized for other languages.
Movement Mascot  -  Fictional character that later becomes the face of a Real Life organization or rebellion.
The Beautiful Elite  -  Fashionable, sophisticated, beautiful, and almost guaranteed to be fabulously rich as well.
Road Apples  -  Animal poop.
Pre Ass Kicking One Liner  -  To do a One-Liner right before you beat someone up.
Magical Land  -  A fantasy world with magic, somehow accessible from the "real" world.
Writers Block  -  Someone struggles for ideas to put in their work.
Technobabble  -  Meaningful-sounding but meaningless technical jargon.
Holiday Appropriate Weather  -  When there is a holiday featured in a piece, the weather will match that holiday.
The Maze  -  You're lost.
Nested Story  -  A storyline...
Doomed Moral Victor  -  The Hero Dies after making his Last Stand.
Underdogs Never Lose  -  If you're expected to lose, it's a one-hundred percent chance you're gonna win.
Nobility Marries Money  -  Impoverished Patrician marries Nouveau Riche. Hilarity Ensues.
Real Life Super Powers  -  Exceptional (but perfectly plausible) abilities
Fanservice Cover  -  Boost sales by putting sexy women on the cover of your magazine.
Mini Mook  -  A small Mook.
Gay Bravado  -  So secure with their heterosexuality that they have no problems acting Macho Camp.
Poke The Poodle  -  Laughably minor evil acts.
Oven Logic  -  Cutting cooking time by increasing the temperature, with disastrous results.
Turbine Blender  -  Life form + jet engine intake or propeller = Ludicrous Gibs.
Loud Gulp  -  What's that?! *GULP!*
Elemental Punch  -  Charging a physical attack with Elemental Powers.
Supernatural Elite  -  The nobles, royals, and/or generally upper-class supernatural.
Ambiguously Jewish  -  A character that's implied (but never confirmed) to be Jewish.
The Worlds Expert On Getting Killed  -  A supposed expert on a given threat is killed in a Curb-Stomp Battle by the threat.
Poetic Serial Killer  -  A Serial Killer that operates on Death by Irony
The Idiot From Osaka  -  People from the Kansai region (especially Osaka) are portrayed as idiots who are brash, materialistic and/or enjoy comedy (or even view life as one), drinking and/or fighting.
Keigo  -  Very polite Japanese.
Modified Clone  -  A clone has some alterations made instead of being a 100% copy.
Compound Interest Time Travel Gambit  -  Deposit money in your bank account, go to 3000 AD, and let compound interest do the rest of the work.
Falsely Reformed Villain  -  Villain pretends to have reformed, but it's just a cover for their next evil scheme.
Gashadokuro  -  A giant skeleton Youkai manifestation of those who died from famine or war.
Country Mouse  -  Character from a rural area tries to adjust to urban life.
A Mistake Is Born  -  When an offspring was a "mistake".
Hooker With A Heart Of Gold  -  The sex worker who cares.
Time Crash  -  Time itself is broken.
Writer Revolt  -  The writers go heavy on the Biting-the-Hand Humor or the Take Thats, mostly due to Executive Meddling or Troubled Production issues.
One Twin Must Die  -  Elders of the clan, less often the parents themselves, want to kill one of the born twins to avoid a certain curse.
Danger Deadpan  -  A pilot who always keeps his or her cool.
Happiness In Minimum Wage  -  A character has a menial, low-paying job, but enjoys it very much.
Man Child  -  Childish adult.
Genius Cripple  -  Crippled, but still a genius.
Sidetrack Bonus  -  Straying from the path to the goal can be occasionally rewarding.
Dying Moment Of Awesome  -  A character's death, or specifically, how they die, stands out as completely awesome.
Hypocrite Has A Point  -  A character that may not practice what they preach, but is no less right in what they say.
Power Of Trust  -  Trust gives strength.
Fill It With Flowers  -  FLOWERS!!
Public Domain Artifact  -  Ancient Artifacts commonly used in legend and fiction, often exhibiting different powers and properties depending on the source.
Men Buy From Mars Women Buy From Venus  -  Men's ads are alcohol fueled, suggestive, dirty sports binges. Women's ads are chocolate fueled, gossipy, diet shopping sprees.
And You Thought It Was A Game  -  A character thinks a real situation is staged or a fake.
Dead Horse Genre  -  Acceptable genre targets.
Politeness Judo  -  Character gets their way simply by being polite.
Mushroom Samba  -  A character is on hallucinogens.
Prisons Are Gymnasiums  -  The character becomes physically stronger during his time in prison.
Really Was Born Yesterday  -  Excusing ignorance/naïveté with the explanation that one was literally created very recently.
A Wizard Did It  -  It's magic, we don't have to explain anything.
Glamorous Wartime Singer  -  A female singer performing to wartime sailors or soldiers.
Getting High On Their Own Supply  -  A drug dealer gets addicted to their own product.
What Did You Expect When You Named It  -  A thing or character shares the same often tragic fate as what they were named after.
Pandering To The Base  -  Giving what the fans wanted instead of what you think would make a good story.
Eating Pet Food  -  When I Ate WHAT?! applies to pet food.
Shockingly Expensive Bill  -  The bill is HOW MUCH?!?!?!?!
Reality Show Genre Blindness  -  Reality Show participants duplicate the mistakes of their predecessors.
Marshmallow Dream  -  A character dreams of eating a large marshmallow (or other food) to find they have consumed/destroyed their pillow when they wake up.
Anime Accent Absence  -  A character is capable of speaking the language without any obviously audible accent whatsoever.
High Voltage Death  -  A character dies by electrocution to get around the censors or as an accidental or karmic death
Welcome To Evil Mart  -  A store that caters to Card Carrying Villains.
The Kindnapper  -  Someone kidnaps someone for reasons that are (or are believed to be) benevolent.
Not Important To This Episode Camp  -  The kids are "Put on a Bus" for an episode/a story arc.
Super Window Jump  -  Jumping through windows.
Dont Touch It You Idiot  -  Prominent "DO NOT TOUCH" warning gets disregarded by a curious individual who touches the thing they're not supposed to touch anyway.
Formerly Friendly Family  -  When family end up fighting family.
Accidental Murder  -  A situation lacking lethal intent ends with someone dying anyway.
Villain With Good Publicity  -  A villain who's popular with the general public.
Another Side Another Story  -  A mode in certain video games that shows the story from another character's perspective.
The Bet  -  Two characters make a wager. Hilarity Ensues.
Self Disposing Villain  -  Heroes don't have to worry about killing or imprisoning defeated villains; they kill or imprison themselves.
Cycle Of Hurting  -  Take damage. Repeat until dead.
Pregnant Badass  -  A mom-to-be that kicks ass.
Vigilante Man  -  They take the law into their own hands in pursuit of justice.
Dream Episode  -  An episode that's explicitly about one or more dreams.
Writer On Board  -  Making a point at the expense of storytelling.
Guns Are Worthless  -  Guns aren't as good as in real life because the writer says so.
Even The Subtitler Is Stumped  -  Even the subtitler can't understand what people are saying.
Corpse Land  -  A land visibly filled with dead bodies.
Christmas Every Day  -  A character wishes every day could be Christmas only to wake up the next day and see their wish has come true.
My Name Is Inigo Montoya  -  The character announces themselves to their opponents so they know who is about to pound them.
Father Neptune  -  An old sailor.
Ruins For Ruins Sake  -  Ancient ruins with no history.
Sole Survivor  -  The one who didn't die.
Face Of An Angel Mind Of A Demon  -  Adorable on the outside, a monster on the inside.
Jail Bake  -  Hiding something in a cake to help a prisoner escape.
Ungrateful Bastard  -  Doesn't show appropriate gratitude.
Battle Trophy  -  Taking a piece or iconic belonging of your fallen foe to remember your triumph against them.
Not Blood Siblings  -  It's not incest if they aren't biologically related, right?
Secretly Gay Activity  -  Flirting with a member of the same sex within an activity that grants plausible deniability.
Orgy Of Evidence  -  A Frame-Up is given away using too much fake evidence.
Irritation Is The Sincerest Form Of Flattery  -  Imitating someone because you admire them.
Absurdism  -  Let's all laugh at how pointless life is!
Death Activated Super Power  -  A supernatural ability that only activates when its "wielder" dies.
Spoof Aesop  -  An Aesop Played for Laughs.
Planet Of Copyhats  -  A planetary race with very specific, similar traits.
Accidental Truth  -  Character tells truth thinking that it's a lie.
Hunter Of Monsters  -  Someone who hunts and kills monsters and supernatural creatures.
Caught On Tape  -  So you say you didn't do it? Fine! Let's just go to the tape...
Vampire Monarch  -  The one vampire every other follows, willingly or not.
Get Back In The Closet  -  Gay stuff is treated harsher than straight stuff.
Squash Match  -  Curb-Stomp Battle, Professional Wrestling edition.
Musical Squares  -  An album cover with the band members' faces in squares.
Gender Bender  -  Shapeshifting into the opposite sex.
Stockholm Syndrome  -  The Trope: A captive feels sympathy for their abductors.
No Cartoon Fish  -  Everything's drawn in a cartoony style... Except fish.
Reverse Slippery Slope Fallacy  -  If there haven't been any bad consequences from one misstep, then the next steps are all allegedly safe.
Happily Ever Before  -  The source material had a Downer Ending, so the adaptation ends when things haven't gotten sad yet.
Scare Campaign  -  When the Attack of the Political Ad is Truth in Television.
Like An Old Married Couple  -  Two characters who argue constantly, but are loyal to each other.
Immoral Journalist  -  A journalist who doesn't care about writing the truth, and/or doesn't care if getting the story hurts people.
Genius Sweet Tooth  -  Smart people fuel their brains with sweet food.
Words Do Not Make The Magic  -  Just saying the magic words doesn't work for non-spellcasters.
Title By Year  -  Title contains the year the story takes place in.
Pointy Haired Boss  -  He's a total idiot, but he signs your paycheck.
Precrime Arrest  -  Sentenced to punishment before committing the crime that already happened.
I Would Say If I Could Say  -  Lampshading when a Stock Phrase applies to a situation metaphorically, but not literally.
Black And Gray Morality  -  Evil villain, flawed hero.
Magic Tool  -  This tool can do everything!
Tiny Schoolboy  -  The smallest and youngest looking guy on class.
Comedic Sociopathy  -  Watching people suffer as a form of comedy.
Nerdgasm  -  Joking that a nerd culture experience is so pleasurable, it is sexual.
Great Offscreen War  -  A war that is often referenced but never depicted in the story.
Horny Vikings  -  Stereotypical vikings, typically with large figures, large amounts of body hair, and horned helmets.
The War Room  -  Room where war strategies are made, where the general speaks to lieutenants and the like.
Sinister Scythe  -  Farming sickles are good for sending people to the Grim Reaper.
Rent A Zilla  -  Verse-based kaiju.
Tonight Someone Dies  -  A show announces that a major character's gonna get killed off. Tension and speculation abound.
Not Growing Up Sucks  -  Eternal adolescence is not enjoyable.
The Face  -  A character in a team dynamic whose speciality is social skills.
No Ending  -  Ending without resolution.
Master Of None  -  A character who can do anything, but who can't do anything well.
Divine Intervention  -  Where God (or a divine equivalent in the story) takes an active role in a non-divine character's conflict.
Saving The World  -  The ubiquitous goal of many stock heroes: Preventing The End of the World as We Know It!
Evil Knockoff  -  A Villain made an evil copy and now it works for him.
Trash Landing  -  Landing in a dumpster.
Awwchoo  -  Someone has a cute sneeze.
Scullery Maid  -  A female servant who is considered the bottom of the food chain.
Disney Owns This Trope  -  A company owning the rights to something you wouldn't think could be owned.
Rube Goldberg Hates Your Guts  -  A deadly Rube Goldberg Device.
Summation Gathering  -  Everyone gather 'round so you can listen to me solve this mystery!
Merging The Branches  -  Parts of mutually exclusive story branches are retroactively merged into the new canon.
Mascot Racer  -  When an established franchise of a non-racing genre gets a Racing Game Spin-Off.
Cats Are Mean  -  Cats are little assholes.
Gory Discretion Shot  -  Horrible violence is best left to the imagination.
All Anime Is Naughty Tentacles  -  Is it anime? Yuck, it's probably rife with strong sexual or violent content!
The Cavalry  -  Reinforcements for a last-second dramatic rescue of the heroes.
Commie Land  -  Generic depressing communist country.
Gambler Groupies  -  Trophy women who gather around a guy to let you know how good his gambling skills are.
Shield Bash  -  I whack you with my shield.
Uneven Hybrid  -  Character with majority ancestry of one species, and minority ancestry of another.
Closer To Earth  -  Minorities are more sensible than the White Male Lead.
Too Smart For Strangers  -  A Very Special Episode that tells kids not to follow, talk to, or accept things from strangers.
Drowning Pit  -  Being Locked in a Room that's filling with water.
Break His Heart To Save Him  -  Being a jerk to your friend so they'll leave you and stay out of danger.
Author Existence Failure  -  The creator dies before the work is finished.
Right Handed Left Handed Guns  -  Guns in first-person shooters are horizontally mirrored compared to real life equivalents so the casing will be ejected on-screen.
Formal Full Array Of Cutlery  -  There's a ridiculous amount of cutlery and each piece is made for a very specific purpose (eg ice cream spoon).
Never Gets Fat  -  No matter what or how much this character eats, they always look or stay fit.
Woobie Of The Week  -  The main character(s) comes across, and helps, various troubled people to earn their happy ending.
Animal Lover  -  Someone who loves, or at the very least likes, animals.
Feminist Fantasy  -  Fantasy and sci-fi with strong female protagonists at the forefront driving the story and exploring themes related to the feminine experience.
Token Mini Moe  -  A little kid (or someone who looks to be) in an otherwise older cast as cuteness appeal for older viewers.
Nonuniform Uniform  -  Wearing a uniform in an altered fashion unique enough to stand out while still able to be identified as a member of a team/school/military etc.
The Dreaded Thank You Letter  -  A kid is forced to write a "thank you" note after receiving a gift.
Pygmalion Plot  -  Falling in love with one's own creation.
Chuck Cunningham Syndrome  -  A character disappears from the work with no explanation and is never mentioned again.
Going For The Big Scoop  -  Reporter prioritizes headlines over personal safety.
Amnesiac Dissonance  -  An amnesiac character realizes they were of an opposite alignment.
Seldom Seen Species  -  We're not talking about cats, dogs, mice, or so on; we're talking about the truly rare ones!
Accidental Art  -  Wonderful art made by complete accident.
Sweet Polly Oliver  -  A woman disguises herself as a man to achieve a certain purpose.
Free Sample Plot Coupon  -  The first Plot Coupon is gotten much more easily than the others.
Pure Is Not Good  -  One may have a quality, unadulterated, that is either good or bad.
Serial Tweaker  -  He Ninja-Edits a little too much.
No Stat Atrophy  -  Once you get better at a skill, you stay better.
Big Damn Fire Exit  -  An escape route that inexplicably opens up in the event of a disaster.
Heart Beat Down  -  Elemental Powers of the Heart.
Jiggle Show  -  Producer: No bra? No prob!
Hell Of A Heaven  -  Heaven is really disappointing.
Canary In A Coal Mine  -  Canaries freaking out or dying in mines is a signal that there are nearby toxic gases.
Trigger Phrase  -  A specific phrase someone is conditioned to respond to.
Broken Bird  -  Troubled, but Cute person (often female) with a Dark and Troubled Past.
Spoofed The Ironic Film Seriously  -  A parody of a work which was already a parody, but treats the original as if it were played straight.
Yellow Purple Contrast  -  Popular Color Contrast between yellow and purple — light and dark, royalty, and beyond.
Two D Space  -  Spacecraft fail to recognize a third axis of movement.
Alucard  -  Dracula spelled backwards, usually used either to hide his true identity, or by his son.
Premiseville  -  A city with a Meaningful Name.
Precursor Heroes  -  The Heroes of the past.
Visual Development  -  Character appearances change to reflect story developments.
Sexy Dimorphism  -  One and only one of a species' sexes (usually the female) is, by complete in-universe coincidence, attractive by the standards of the time and culture the work's human writer lives in.
Arbitrary Equipment Restriction  -  A weapon or equipment in a video game that is unaccessible for a stupid reason
Fourth Wall Shut In Story  -  Where a creator becomes trapped within his own story.
Literary Mash Ups  -  Genre-swapped public domain literary works.
Converging Stream Weapon  -  All Your Powers Combined, for rays or lasers, to make the Wave-Motion Gun.
Unwanted False Faith  -  I'm not God, I'm just a human like you!
Weird Beard  -  A beard that's made of anything but hair.
Gratuitous English  -  English words implemented in non-English works.
Exposition Beam  -  Artificial exposition.
The Quincy Punk  -  A negatively stereotyped, even violent 1970s / '80s punk character.
Most Definitely Not A Villain  -  A character attempts to convince others that they are something by very deliberately and awkwardly claiming to most certainly be that thing, and definitely not the thing the character actually is.
Greedy Jew  -  Stereotypes that portrays Jews as greedy and evil.
Green Boy Color  -  Video game graphics emulating the Game Boy monochromatic green palette.
Heroic Safe Mode  -  Instead of breaking down, the hero goes into fight-or-flight Determinator mode.
Imperiled In Pregnancy  -  Pregnant woman gets into trouble.
Mistaken For Prostitute  -  A girl is mistaken for a prostitute
Emerging From The Shadows  -  A character steps out of the shadows for a dramatic entrance.
No One Should Survive That  -  Something that should kill completely failed in doing so.
Healing Shiv  -  A weapon that heals its targets.
Reused Character Design  -  An artist uses the same or an extremely similar character design for multiple characters in different works.
Fantastic Naming Convention  -  A culture has a unique approach to naming.
Secret Police  -  Law enforcement that function beyond the public scope so they can eliminate crime morality-free.
Tell Me How You Fight  -  Fighting styles reveal personalities and training.
Sliding Scale Of Like Reality Unless Noted  -  How similar a modern setting in a work is to Real Life.
Stop Worshipping Me  -  A deity does not want any reverence from any of their worshipers.
Unexpectedly Obscure Answer  -  Game show trivia questions that no sane person could be expected to know the answer to.
Spartan Sibling  -  Family members dont care if bad things happen to each other because they think each has to make it on their own.
Head Pet  -  Small animal that often sits on its owner's head.
The Extremist Was Right  -  The Well-Intentioned Extremist's methods turned out to be justified.
That One Puzzle  -  A puzzle that's notoriously frustrating.
Scaling The Summit  -  Mountain-climbing expedition.
Candlelit Bath  -  Someone takes a luxurious bath by candlelight.
Fridge Brilliance  -  Now it all makes sense!
Fictional Sport  -  A sport that exists in a work of fiction, but not in real life.
Appeal To Novelty  -  New is good.
Poirot Speak  -  Otherwise well-spoken language sprinkled with a few inconsistencies here and there to show that the speaker is a foreigner.
The Time Of Myths  -  A past setting where mythological creatures walk through the earth
Action Figure Speech  -  I have no mouth, but I need to indicate I am speaking. *bobs up and down*
Scream Discretion Shot  -  You hear the scream instead of seeing the inflicted pain.
Moe Anthropomorphism  -  Anything can be represented as a cute, bishoujo-esque anime girl (or sometimes boy). Anything.
Somebody Doesnt Love Raymond  -  A character freaks out because someone doesn't like them.
Magical Nanny  -  A nanny who has a profound effect on the children she nannies, and may be literally magical.
Haunted House  -  A house filled with ghosts.
Flung Clothing  -  After a quick costume change, we see a character's civilian clothes being tossed behind them.
Gender Flip  -  Re-envisioning a story with one or more characters as the opposite gender.
Coitus Uninterruptus  -  Interrupted sex... which doesn't stop.
Tomato In The Mirror  -  A character is not what they think they are.
Suicide Mission  -  An endeavor against overwhelming odds where death is likely the only outcome.
Cant Drop The Hero  -  The Hero is a Required Party Member.
Life Death Juxtaposition  -  Life, rejuvenation, or creation motifs and death or disease/illness motifs being used to contrast two related places, characters, or events.
Human Jack O Lantern  -  A jack o' lantern made from someone's head.
Same Language Dub  -  Dubbed voiced overs in the same language.
Tripod Terror  -  Alien Invasion plans tend to utilize Three-legged Monstrosities.
Not Even Bothering With An Excuse  -  Sorry I wasn't here before, but I really didn't want to be.
One Of The Kids  -  An immature adult who spends most of their time with children.
Nice Shoes  -  A character's shoes are quirky and unique.
Harem Genre  -  A young man (usually) is surrounded amorously by members of the opposite sex. Hilarity, and often Fanservice, Ensues.
Elopement  -  A couple runs away to get married because that's the only way they can.
Japanese Ranguage  -  Asian peopre plonouncing "L" as "R", and vice velsa.
Opposing Sports Team  -  The team of humorless, cheating jerkasses who serve as the final opponent of a sports movie.
Infallible Narrator  -  The story is perfectly recounted by a character who shouldn't be able to.
Retired Badass  -  The badass has quit the role which made him badass.
Famous For Being Famous  -  Someone is a celebrity without any particular reason for their fame.
Usurping Santa  -  A villain plots to depose Santa Claus or another holiday figure to gain their power and fame.
Keep The Reward  -  A true hero is blase about collecting a fee.
Black Belt In Origami  -  I don't know Karate, but I know something else that sounds intimidating!
Lets Split Up Gang  -  Let's split up. We can cover more ground that way, and create tension that wouldn't exist if we remained a single unit.
Ask A Stupid Question  -  When you ask a question with an obvious answer, you usually get sarcasm in return.
Anti Nepotism  -  Authority figure makes life difficult for his/her relative to avoid allegations of nepotism.
While You Were In Diapers  -  Boasting about an earlier accomplishment when your foe was younger or weaker.
Drench Celebration  -  Celebrate winning the game by getting dunked with sports-drink by the other team-members.
Aint Too Proud To Beg  -  Begging, cowering before someone in power.
Automaton Horses  -  Horses never seem to need basic care.
Protagonist Power Up Privileges  -  The lead gets gets their standard power up before everyone does, or gets a unique better power up that no one else does.
Wrong Insult Offence  -  If you're going to insult me, do it properly.
Pantsless Males Fully Dressed Females  -  Males can go either nude or half-dressed, but females are always fully clothed.
The Great Flood  -  A disastrous flood of Biblical proportions.
Immune To Flinching  -  The player takes hits without becoming stunned.
Armed Blag  -  Let's rob an armoured car.
Second Episode Introduction  -  A major character isn't introduced until the episode after the pilot.
My Girl Is A Slut  -  You had sex with another man? That is so hot!
The Song Before The Storm  -  A song sung prior to facing the major conflict of a work.
Harem Seeker  -  Character who wants to date and/or marry multiple partners.
Proportionately Ponderous Parasites  -  Giant creatures have giant parasites.
Fictional Political Party  -  A political party that only appears in fiction.
Fictional Earth  -  Same name, mass, Sun, Moon, etc., but a completely different world.
Gothic Horror  -  A subgenre of horror that tends to play on both the thrill and fear of the unknown, and places a great importance on atmosphere and symbolism.
Waterfall Into The Abyss  -  Islands that float and have waterfalls continually coming off them.
Yin Yang Bomb  -  Combining opposite forces with devastating results.
Hakuna Matata  -  A song that means no worries for the rest of your days.
Dirty Kid  -  Perverted children.
Sealed Evil In A Duel  -  Keeping a malevolent entity locked away by trapping them in battle forever.
Cinderella Circumstances  -  A formerly well-to-do child is reduced to a lower state in life, generally to the position of a servant.
Repeat To Confirm  -  Confirming an order, an instruction, or a command by repeating it.
Breather Boss  -  A fairly easier boss in the middle of hard bosses.
Ironic Fear  -  When you are terrified of the one thing you should naturally not be afraid of.
Threat Backfire  -  Someone makes a threat, but it doesn't have the desired effect.
Middle Eastern Coalition  -  The Alliance of Quracs.
Cosmic Motifs  -  Motifs based around objects in space.
The Law Of Diminishing Defensive Effort  -  The less an enemy tries to defend themselves, the less they actually need to.
Epic Fail  -  A failure so spectacular, it shouldn't even be possible.
Baker Street Regular  -  Kid assists a police officer.
Elephant In The Living Room  -  We're not talking about that blatantly obvious issue.
Grey And Gray Morality  -  Opposing sides are neither completely "good" nor completely "evil".
Hoist By His Own Petard  -  Defeated by one's own device or plan.
Painful Transformation  -  Shapeshifting hurts.
Evolution Power Up  -  A power up or transformation is called evolution.
Wolverine Wannabe  -  An Expy, Pastiche or parody of Wolverine.
Mocking The Mourner  -  A character uses another character's loss as a means to deride or harangue them.
Snake And Serpent Tropes  -  An index of tropes about serpents and snakes.
Identical Twin ID Tag  -  These twins are perfectly identical, so they need to make up their own distinctions so you can tell them apart.
Never Recycle Your Schemes  -  Never improve on plans that failed once before.
Dramatic Wind  -  A sudden rush of wind emphasizes a dramatic event.
Flying Broomstick  -  Witches travel around on cleaning implements.
Basso Profundo  -  And you thought Badass Baritone was deep.
Thicker Than Water  -  Blood ties trump everything else.
It Was With You All Along  -  That thing you've been spending the entire story looking for?... Well, guess what?
Stock Scream  -  An overdone and overused screaming sound effect in media.
Guilt Complex  -  Character blames themselves for everything.
Measuring The Marigolds  -  People who understand something too well can't appreciate it(s beauty).
Rescue Arc  -  A story arc about how someone is rescued.
Healer God  -  Gods of healing or medicine.
Transforming Vehicle  -  Normal vehicle with transforming capabilities.
The Scrounger  -  Can find whatever you need depending on the situation.
Someone To Remember Him By  -  He's dead, she's bearing his child.
Delayed Ripple Effect  -  The present is not instantly affected by changing the past.
Made Of Iron  -  Character is way tougher than possible in Real Life, and there's no fictional reason either.
The City Narrows  -  The seedy part of town.
Baths Are Fun  -  A work, usually aimed at young children, advocates the idea that bathing can be fun.
Faux Yay  -  An extended ruse where characters act homosexual.
Camp Wackyname  -  A camp with a silly name, sometimes intended to sound vaguely Native American.
Dear Negative Reader  -  A creator releases a statement responding to negative feedback from the audience.
Cant Get In Trouble For Nuthin  -  A character wants to get in trouble, but finds out they can't.
Team Mom  -  Surrogate mother to the The Team, the True Companions, or like groups.
Extended Greetings  -  When just saying "hello" isn't enough.
Medieval Stasis  -  Time advances, technology doesn't.
Those Two Bad Guys  -  A pair of psychos who provide exposition, Seinfeldian Conversations, and violence.
Howling To The Night  -  When the sun has gone down, wolves howl.
Drag Queen  -  Men who like dressing like women.
Movie Superheroes Wear Black  -  Superheroes tend to wear black and/or leathery costumes in their films.
One Password Attempt Ever  -  An attempt at maximum security by giving the user only one attempt to pass the security features before locking them out, deleting the protected data, etc.
Stripperiffic  -  Outfit stresses sexiness over function.
Kill Sat  -  A satellite armed with a powerful anti-ground weapon.
Cure Your Gays  -  The idea that homosexuality can be "cured."
Previously On  -  A montage at the beginning of an episode that sums up what happened the last episode previously, usually if it ended on a Cliffhanger.
Shipping Bed Death  -  The actual relationship kills the appeal of a ship.
Parasitic Horror  -  Parasitism being played for horror and squick.
Head Tiltingly Kinky  -  Censoring bizarre sexual acts via the reactions of other characters.
Hide Your Pregnancy  -  Hiding an actress' pregnant belly to avoid having it be written into the story.
Video Game Lives  -  Games have several lives, unlike reality. Don't lose them, or you lose the game.
Where Where  -  Gag where a character fails to realize who is being spoken of when other characters make shocked exclamations upon seeing them.
The Starscream  -  Villain's top minion plans to betray their master to claim power for themselves.
Detective Animal  -  A detective who is an anthropomorphic animal.
Not Afraid Of You Anymore  -  A character finally decides to overthrow their abuser and reverse the roles.
Cryptically Unhelpful Answer  -  A Handwave explanation which explains nothing
Dress Code  -  When in Rome, dress as the Romans do.
Mistaken Age  -  A character is mistaken for being older or younger than they actually are.
Adaptation Distillation  -  Removing elements in order to make a shorter adaptation.
Herr Doktor  -  Scientific genius of Germanic origins.
Similar Squad  -  Main cast meets another group of people functionally identical to themselves.
Pistol Whipping  -  Bludgeoning with your firearm.
Gaias Lament  -  An extremely desolate or uninhabitable turn of a planet that was once verdant and full of life.
Cake Toppers  -  Little bride and groom figures are put on top of a wedding cake.
Fake Period Excuse  -  A woman fakes being on her period so as to get out of a situation surreptitiously.
The Good The Bad And The Evil  -  Good guys, bad guys, and really bad guys all fighting each other.
God  -  Singular almighty being who's often the creator of the universe along with all that's in it and the focus of many religions.
Padding  -  Extra stuff added to a show purely to fill out time.
Dont Make Me Take My Belt Off  -  Spanking a kid, usually with a belt.
Crystal Ball Scheduling  -  Show Within a Show is doing what the show is also doing.
Dire Beast  -  Larger versions of common beasts.
Deliberate Under Performance  -  A character goes out-of-their-way to perform below everyone's standards.
Twenty Minutes Into The Future  -  The near future is just like The Present Day, but with Applied Phlebotinum, and maybe some big social changes.
Aggressive Negotiations  -  It's like a normal negotiation, only with weapons instead of words.
Sex Is Violence  -  Fighting turns me on.
Pre Order Bonus  -  Getting an extra or two when you pre-order a video game.
Universal Ammunition  -  Picking up ammo refills both your pistol and your flamethrower.
Odd Name Out  -  In a group with Theme Naming, one name doesn't fit.
Good Witch Versus Bad Witch  -  Spellcasters of conflicting Character Alignment pitted against one another.
Mermaid Arc Emergence  -  Character leaps out of the water bending backwards as far as possible. Usually an homage to Ariel from The Little Mermaid (1989).
Offer Void In Nebraska  -  Product or service not available in your area.
Luke You Are My Father  -  Character A doesn't know that Character B is their child until Character B reveals it to them.
Acquitted Too Late  -  A character is found innocent after they die.
Fake Pregnancy  -  A female character lies about being pregnant.
Confucian Confusion  -  A character makes up some sage-like phrase and attributes it to Confucius to lend it more gravitas.
Sweet And Sour Grapes  -  Getting what you want when you realize you don't need it.
LGBT Fanbase  -  A work garners a Periphery Demographic among the LGBT+ community.
Shell Backpack  -  An anthropomorphic turtle or armadillo wears clothing that covers only the front of their shell.
Shoehorned First Letter  -  Really pushing to have Fun with Acronyms.
Sleeping With The Boss  -  Person in authority has a sexual relationship with a member of their staff.
Warp Zone  -  Secret Level Hub.
Fairest Of Them All  -  Someone absolutely hates you for being too beautiful.
Heaven Seeker  -  A character whose motivation is to earn a pleasant afterlife.
Healing Checkpoint  -  The Checkpoint or Save Point also fills up your life and/or supplies.
Non Human Sidekick  -  The hero is human but their sidekick is not.
Human Snowball  -  Tumbling down a snowy hill always results in human trapped in a giant snowball.
Invocation  -  Announce your superpower!
Unskilled But Strong  -  What they lack in skill and experience, they make up for in raw power.
Human Cannonball  -  Being shot out of a cannon as a means of transport.
Enemy Civil War  -  It's Evil vs. Evil within the same group of evil.
Frequently Broken Unbreakable Vow  -  Anytime a promise is made, circumstances will force the character to break it. Repeatedly.
Unfortunate Ingredients  -  Renaming evil-sounding ingredients to make them sound more appealing.
Plot Lock  -  A barrier that you ought to be able to bypass using your abilities, but which can only be traversed when the plot allows.
Help Im Stuck  -  A character becomes stuck in one place.
Spider Man Send Up  -  A character clearly designed as an Expy of Spider-Man.
Trope Codifier  -  Work that defines how a trope is used.
Demon Lords And Archdevils  -  Powerful demonic hierarchies.
The Unmasking  -  A superhero (or supervillain) reveals their Secret Identity to someone, willingly or by force.
Canis Latinicus  -  Sounds like Latin, but it isn't.
Dark Horse Victory  -  Alice and Bob are the favorites, but Charlie beat them both?
Nom De Guerre  -  A nickname a character goes by in the armed forces or similar organization.
Loser Team Mascot  -  The team mascot is the loser of the team.
Only Sane Man  -  The one rational character in a group of weirdos.
Scope Snipe  -  Sniper A kills Sniper B with a round through Sniper B's scope.
Dead Guy Junior  -  Name someone after a dead someone.
Day Old Legend  -  Empires fell, civilizations rose, and heroes made their name with that weapon you made the day before.
Breather Level  -  An easier level before and/or after harder ones (often sandwiched in-between).
Accidental Pornomancer  -  A character who can't avoid sex, it just happens for them.
Worthless Treasure Twist  -  The valuable treasure the heroes have longed and striven for is either not there, empty, or something intangible or sentimental.
Superpowered Alter Ego  -  Alternate personality has superpowers the original lacks.
Death By Disfigurement  -  A pretty person who gets disfigured is very likely to die soon thereafter.
Was Too Hard On Him  -  A character feels bad for scolding or punishing another character, even if it was the right thing to do.
Go Into The Light  -  When a person dies, they have a near-death experience which causes them to cross over to the light.
Missing White Woman Syndrome  -  Only young and beautiful white women are worthy of sympathy if they go missing.
Faster Than They Look  -  Just because they're big doesn't mean they're slow.
One Bullet Left  -  That last bullet will always hit its target.
Questioning Title  -  Is that a title that ends in a question mark?
Assist Character  -  A Non-Player Character who appears briefly when summoned to assist the Player Character and retreats immediately.
Flat Character  -  A generic character lacking depth beyond one or two traits.
Have You Tried Not Being A Monster  -  Do you really have to be different? Can't you just be normal?
Took The Bad Film Seriously  -  The movie sucks, but the actor gives it their all anyway.
The Psycho Rangers  -  The Evil Counterparts of a heroic team.
Naughty Tentacles  -  Tentacles + sexual content.
Chest Blaster  -  Shooting things from the chest area.
Power Limiter  -  It limits your power.
Southern Fried Private  -  Southerners in the military are portrayed as xenophobic, gun-toting Blood Knights who disobey orders and aren't trusting of their squad's resident minority or New Meat member.
London England Syndrome  -  Stating the city and country to avoid confusion with another location of the same name.
Dewey Defeats Truman  -  A work set 20 Minutes into the Future has made-up historical events that end up not happening in Real Life.
Parodied Trope  -  A trope is made fun of or played in a satirical way.
Shifting Sand Land  -  Generic Video Game desert level.
Half Human Hybrid  -  Half human, half (insert fantastic or alien creature here), all awesome.
A Hero Is Born  -  The story begins with the protagonist as a newborn.
Speedy Snail  -  Animals known for being slow are fast.
Hub Level  -  The area you visit to go to other areas.
Xylophone Gag  -  That one explosive note on a musical instrument The Mark always misses when playing That Song.
Fauxlosophic Narration  -  Narration that discusses things like "What is the meaning of life?" which has nothing to do with the plot.
Weapon Of X Slaying  -  Weapons that hit certain kinds of target exceptionally hard.
Pep Talk Song  -  A song sung to give someone encouragement about something.
No Fourth Wall  -  A work in which the fourth wall is frequently broken.
No Seat Belts  -  Cool Ships never have seatbelts.
Dark Horse Sibling  -  A sibling that everyone thought was a loser ends up being the most successful.
Loon With A Heart Of Gold  -  A character who is quirky, insane or unhinged is also kinder and more compassionate than the "normals".
Monumental Theft  -  The theft targeted something so HUGE it should be impossible.
Blackmail  -  Do what I say or X finds out something you want kept quiet.
Sympathetic Murderer  -  A murderer's act of homicide has sympathetic circumstances to it.
Really Fond Of Sleeping  -  A character who sleeps for fun.
Turn Off The Camera  -  Stop filming me!
Fairy Devilmother  -  A Fairy Godmother that curses her godchildren instead of blessing them.
Took A Level In Jerkass  -  When a Nice Guy becomes a jerk.
Custom Uniform  -  Distinct uniform that stands out usually means importance.
Thou Shalt Not Kill  -  A character has a moral code that precludes killing.
The Man Makes The Weapon  -  Technical Pacifist uses Line of Sight Improvised Weapon for a duel.
Fluffy Dry Cat  -  When a wet animal is rapidly dried, its fur will dramatically poof outwards.
When Props Attack  -  An actor "fights" a supposed animal, machine or possessed object that is clearly a prop that they are manipulating themselves.
The Ladys Favour  -  An object of value given to someone before they leave, to be returned when the two reunite. A gesture of good luck.
Perspective Magic  -  Generating In-Universe Forced Perspective as a superpower.
Til Murder Do Us Part  -  Somebody plots to kill or has killed their spouse.
Animal Species Accent  -  Animals speak in an animal-esque manner.
This Is Reality  -  Characters in a story say "That may work in fiction, but this is reality here!", as you do.
Education Through Pyrotechnics  -  Stuff Blowing Up can make a lesson stick.
Lost Language  -  A language that is lost due to no way of learning or translating it.
Horde Of Alien Locusts  -  They're bad because they want to consume us and there's lots of 'em.
The One Who Made It Out  -  They managed to rise above their less-than-stellar origins and become a success.
Grappling With Grappling Rules  -  Grappling is way too chaotic to simulate properly in tabletop roleplaying.
Gratuitous French  -  Using French instead of words in your own language, often in a way that seems odd to actual speakers.
Obvious Beta  -  When a "finished" product just isn't.
Sterility Plague  -  For one reason or another, people can't give birth anymore.
Cool Versus Awesome  -  All sides of the conflict are incredibly cool.
Cheese Strategy  -  A strategy that requires minimal skill to surpass when skill is otherwise required.
Huddle Shot  -  People gathered around the viewer and staring down at him.
They Call Me Mister Tibbs  -  A character insists they be addressed by a specific name or title.
Klingon Promotion  -  Kill the boss, get his job.
Apocalypse Maiden  -  An innocent character is destined to bring about The End of the World as We Know It just by existing.
Cerebus Syndrome  -  A gradual shift from comedic to dramatic.
Costume Porn  -  Flamboyant costumes and/or costume descriptions.
Mon  -  Monsters you can collect and fight with.
Brilliant But Lazy  -  Genius/talented slacker.
I Surrender Suckers  -  Faking a surrender in order to catch your foes off-guard.
Love Makes You Dumb  -  Falling in love = Taking a Level in Dumbass.
Mass Monster Slaughter Sidequest  -  Kill X amount of monsters then return to me. No, the ones you've killed already don't count.
Technically Living Zombie  -  Zombie-like living humans.
Tomato Skunk Stink Cure  -  Skunk stink is removed by tomato juice.
History Repeats  -  Something's happening now because it's happened before.
Tomboyish Name  -  Girl has a boy's name to indicate she is a tomboy.
Facial Composite Failure  -  The police try to draw a face from people's descriptions. They fail
Temporary Blindness  -  Losing the ability to see for a short time period.
Combat By Champion  -  The outcome of a conflict is decided by a duel between representatives of each side.
Exceptionally Tolerant  -  A world or vast majority of people who are so open-minded that bigotry is either minimal, fictional or nonexistent.
Ironic Name  -  Sometimes, people just don't live up to the names given to them at birth.
My Grandma Can Do Better Than You  -  A stock insult.
Married Too Young  -  A couple marry at a young age and experience relationship problems as a result.
Ban On Politics  -  Talking about politics in a non-political forum is considered bad form.
On Site Procurement  -  You don't buy your stuff, and must find it in certain places.
Long Lived  -  They have a large lifespan.
Four Eyes Zero Soul  -  A villain with glasses.
Marry For Love  -  Marrying someone out of true, genuine love rather than having it arranged or for anything else.
Lady Of Adventure  -  A high-class lady globe-trotter.
Corporate Sponsored Superhero  -  Superheroes with corporate sponsorship.
Written For My Kids  -  A work written with the author's child or children in mind.
Lost In Transmission  -  Technical difficulties result in a sent message being incomplete.
Promotion To Opening Titles  -  Recurring guest star or extra gets their name in the opening credits.
Our Humans Are Different  -  You can call it whatever you want, it's still a human.
Throwback Threads  -  When a character, for one reason or another, dons a uniform or costume from a previous era or arc.
Hostage Situation  -  Taking captives to use them as bargaining chips.
Ultimate Final Exam  -  Capping an education with an extremely dangerous final test.
Mundane Utility  -  Awesome abilities for everyday applications.
Someday This Will Come In Handy  -  A character knows seemingly useless or irrelevant information that becomes unexpectedly useful later.
Cornered Rattlesnake  -  A weaker character or faction is cornered and forced to fight a seemingly stronger one, becoming unpredictable.
Treacherous Quest Giver  -  When accepting a simple Side Quest nets you nothing but trouble.
Actual Play  -  A genre where real people actually play a Tabletop RPG.
Car Ride Games  -  Characters play a game to pass the time during a car ride.
Running The Asylum  -  Long-running series tend to end up looking like fan fiction after a while.
Palm Bloodletting  -  When a character needs blood for something, he/she cuts his/her hand.
Trickster Mentor  -  A mentor who uses trickery and subversion to teach their students.
Hitman With A Heart  -  Even a cold-blooded assassin has standards.
Three Minutes Of Writhing  -  Fanservice based music video.
One Word Title  -  Works of fiction with titles consisting of only one word.
Badbutt  -  A kid-friendly badass.
Where Did We Go Wrong  -  Stock question for when your kids turn out a little, ahem, different than you hoped.
Dreams Vs Nightmares  -  A conflict where the heroes represent "good" dreams and the villains represent nightmares.
Immortal Immaturity  -  Ancient immortals who look young and act like they look.
Adaptation Explanation Extrication  -  An adaptation keeps a plot point, but not the explanation for it.
Bizarro Elements  -  Forget your classical Four-Element Ensemble, the world is balanced around weird and random elements.
Surrounded By Idiots  -  A character, usually a villain, is annoyed over being surrounded by those who are incompetent.
Scrabble Babble  -  A made-up word played in Scrabble, or some similar game.
Rise From Your Grave  -  A person who is dead and buried turns out to be undead and has to claw his way out of his grave.
Run Dont Walk  -  Why walk in video games when running gets you from point A to point B much faster?
Small Role Big Impact  -  The minor character with little screen time who completely changes the trajectory of a story.
Verb This  -  The hero takes one of the bad guy's words and adds "this" to the end of it.
Hyde Plays Jekyll  -  One personality pretends to be the other.
Hollywood Chameleons  -  Chameleons or other camouflaging animals changing their colors in a way that makes them completely invisible.
Testosterone Poisoning  -  Humorously exaggerated manliness.
Satire Parody Pastiche  -  There's a difference, as follows:
Harbinger Of Impending Doom  -  Character tries to warn everyone about something (s)he barely escaped from, but they just dither until it shows up anyway.
Parental Hypocrisy  -  When it's discovered that the older generation did exactly what the younger is doing.
Roswell That Ends Well  -  The Roswell UFO Incident of 1947 (or at least how fiction thinks it happened).
Legacy Immortality  -  A hero dies, but The Hero never does.
Continuity Rebooter  -  A Continuity Reboot by Cosmic Retcon.
What Measure Is A Non Badass  -  Characters that are not perceived as badass as other characters are treated with scorn and derision.
Maid Corps  -  Figurative and/or literal army of maids.
Synchronous Episodes  -  Two or more episodes that tell different stories taking place in the same period of time.
The Wiki Rule  -  If it exists, there is a wiki of it. No Exceptions.
Taste The Rainbow  -  There's something for everyone when this trope is applied!
Field Power Effect  -  An advantage/disadvantages that affects the fighting ability of one or more characters, strengthening and/or weakening them.
Amnesia Loop  -  When people discover something and get their memories wiped out repeatedly.
Gameplay Roulette  -  The nature of the game changes repeatedly.
Psycho Party Member  -  A party members who is a loose cannon, and a danger to the group, and or mission.
Right Man In The Wrong Place  -  A normal person who becomes the protagonist for no other reason than because one is needed at the time, and there's no one better available.
Twin Threesome Fantasy  -  Fantasy about having sex with twins at the same time.
I Cant Believe A Guy Like You Would Notice Me  -  A Stock Phrase used by a character who is delighted/shocked that their crush actually notices them.
Because You Were Nice To Me  -  ...when no one else was, I will help you any time you need it.
Criminal Doppelganger  -  An evil Identical Stranger.
The Call Has Bad Reception  -  A miscommunication leads to The Chosen One having problems fulfilling their mission.
Large Ham  -  Highly dramatic, pretentious, and over-the-top acting.
Post Grunge  -  Toned down, radio-friendly Grunge.
Star Making Role  -  This is when the actor/actress hit the BIG TIME.
The Face Of The Sun  -  The sun has an anthropomorphic face.
Catching Some Zs  -  When sleeping, characters go "Zzzzz"
Time Delayed Death  -  Someone is unknowingly fatally injured. When he dies, nobody knows why.
Ambiguous Gender  -  Is that a woman or a man? I can't tell...
Damage Sponge Boss  -  Boss with lots of health and little strategy.
Licked By The Dog  -  Everyone might think I'm scary, but this puppy seems to like me...
Forbidden Friendship  -  You want to be friends with someone, but you are not allowed to.
Kamaitachi  -  Sickle-weasel Youkai from Japanese Folklore.
Tactical Reminiscence  -  Characters remind each other of their shared history to communicate a plan.
Non Entity General  -  The player controls a party without necessarily existing in-game as one of its characters.
Just A Machine  -  The moral issues in granting rights to robots.
Bottomless Fuel Tanks  -  Your car goes on and on and on without having to refuel.
Villainous Incest  -  Villains become even more depraved if they engage in incestuous relationships.
Cool Of Rule  -  Something cool is made even more so if it follows a set of established rules.
Three Plus Two  -  Two Sixth Rangers join the Power Trio to make a Five-Man Band.
The Moral Substitute  -  This is not up to our moral standards, so we're making a version that is!
Advertising By Association  -  Work B is promoted based on its connection to Work A.
Correlation Causation Gag  -  A gag where a small action correlates to a bigger action, with the former being mistaken as the cause.
Vancian Magic  -  Prepare now, cast later.
Hentai  -  Pornographic anime or manga.
Named By Democracy  -  A name is used just because many people started using that.
Inner Monologue Conversation  -  Characters talk through their thoughts, without psychic powers, usually for a joke.
Confirmation Bias  -  This guy is brilliant because he agrees with me, and that guy is an idiot because he disagrees with me!
Level In Reverse  -  Level is mirrored or has the route reversed.
Induced Hypochondria  -  A character tries to deceive a (perfectly healthy) acquaintance that they're sick.
Paper Destruction Of Anger  -  Characters destroy a piece of paper to vent their frustration or to show that the document is invalid or does not deserve anyone's attention.
Bond One Liner  -  A One-Liner given by a hero after ending a fight.
Fan Dumb  -  Looks like some viewers really are morons!
Mission Control Is Off Its Meds  -  Mission Control is out of control.
Orwellian Retcon  -  Change the original and pretend it was always like that. No one will notice!
Alone In A Crowd  -  One person stands still while everyone around them moves by, ignoring them.
Nail Em  -  Nail guns used as ranged weapons, whether it is just the power tool or one designed to be a weapon.
Jungle Japes  -  Generic Video Game jungle area.
Loving Bully  -  Bullying someone to hide the fact you have a crush on them.
One Riot One Ranger  -  A One-Man Army is sent in instead of a proper military/police force.
I Want My Beloved To Be Happy  -  If I can't have you, fine. Just smile.
Subverted Suspicion Aesop  -  This supposedly nice person was bad after all!
Animals Not To Scale  -  Non-human animals are weirdly sized.
Vomit Chain Reaction  -  Puking is contagious.
Zen Survivor  -  Gained wisdom through suffering.
The Baby Trap  -  Causing a pregnancy without the other party's consent in order to bind them into a relationship.
A Bloody Mess  -  An innocent substance  always red  is mistaken for blood.
Older And Wiser  -  An experienced, old adventurer who has valuable lessons for the new generation of adventurers.
Horsemen Of The Apocalypse  -  Conquest (or Pestilence) has the white horse; War has the red horse; Famine has the black horse, and Death has the green (or pale, or pale green) horse.
So Much For Stealth  -  Someone's attempt at stealth is foiled, warranting a change of plans.
Dragon Ascendant  -  The Dragon becomes the new Big Bad.
Evil Me Scares Me  -  A character is terrified of an evil version of themselves.
Powered By A Forsaken Child  -  A weapon/machine/other product needs something horrible to be done to someone to make it work.
Gluttony Montage  -  A montage showing someone eating a copious amount of food.
The Spook  -  No one knows who they are or where they come from.
Sequel Difficulty Spike  -  When a game's sequel is harder than the original.
Oddly Named Sequel 2 Electric Boogaloo  -  A sequel with a funny subtitle (or, at least, weirder than its predecessor).
Non Singing Voice  -  A Stunt Double for singing voices.
Ambiguously Human  -  A seemingly human character, but with traits and characteristics that suggest otherwise.
Out Of Control Popcorn  -  The popcorn has popped to the point of overflowing.
Sequel Goes Foreign  -  A sequel is set in a foreign country.
No Tell Motel  -  A sleazy motel that rents rooms by the hour with no questions asked.
You Bastard  -  A character brushes with the Fourth Wall to imply the audience shouldn't be enjoying what they most likely are.
Shrouded In Myth  -  A character's reputation precedes (and often exceeds) them.
Realism Induced Horror  -  A given thing is especially horrifying because it is more realistic than the norm for the work.
Motivation On A Stick  -  Motivating an animal (or sucker) to move by dangling food or another desired item in front of its face.
Ill Fated Flowerbed  -  Fictional flowerbeds are magnets for disaster.
Long Lasting Last Words  -  A character's Final Speech goes on for an improbably - if not impossibly - long time; usually Played for Laughs.
Most Writers Are Human  -  Human characters are the main focus of the story and any non-human characters will have human attributes and/or be kept in the background.
Everything Is Online  -  Anything electronic can be hacked using the internet.
Negative Continuity  -  Nothing sticks. Ever.
Dropped After The Pilot  -  A character that looks to be recurring in a pilot episode is written out or ignored from episode two on.
The Un Favourite  -  The family prefers the sibling over this character.
Hollywood Drowning  -  Drowning is more violent and loud in media than it is in Real Life.
I Am Who  -  The protagonist's heroic destiny is kept secret from them.
Good With Numbers  -  Mathematical prodigy.
Jekyll And Hyde  -  The villain is inside the hero as a separate personality.
Good Old Robot  -  The good guys' Robot Buddy is made from older parts than most.
No Mouth  -  Character does not have an apparent mouth, whether they don't actually have one or it is covered up by another one of their features.
Convenient Enemy Base  -  The heroes easily end up at or close to the enemy base.
No Saving Throw  -  A power that cannot be defended against in any way.
