Hydra Problem  -  Killing an enemy causes it to regenerate faster than you can kill it unless a specific attack is used.
Almost Dead Guy  -  A dying character stays alive just long enough to disclose all he can to drive the plot, then bites it.
Author Tract  -  The author preaches their beliefs through the fiction they write.
Stock Shoujo Heroine  -  Archetypal take on The Heroine: a relatably awkward young girl who comes to embody The Power of Friendship and The Power of Love.
Evil Virtues  -  To be most efficiently evil, one has to possess a lot of "good" qualities.
No One Sees The Boss  -  Nobody sees this character (The Boss), but the character sees everything.
Script Breaking  -  Ways to reach goals in video games without having to go through the intended effort to reach them.
Supernaturally Delicious And Nutritious  -  Supernatural beings think you taste yummy.
Final Battle Induced Shirt Loss  -  Protagonist gets their shirt torn off during the final (or at least an important) confrontation.
I Want Grandkids  -  Parents who really want their kids to have children of their own.
Resemblance Reveal  -  When an unseen/masked character is finally revealed, he looks just like someone important in-story.
Ghost City  -  A big city that's mysteriously deserted.
Get Your Mind Out Of The Gutter  -  Bob makes it about sex. Alice thoroughly reprimands him for it.
Bathroom Brawl  -  A Fight Scene that takes place in a bathroom.
Masculine Feminine Gay Couple  -  A same-gender relationship between a masculine individual and a feminine individual.
Kuleshov Effect  -  A range of emotion can be perceived from a static expression solely due to context.
The Flapper  -  High-spirited and sexually liberated Roaring Twenties girl.
This Way To Certain Death  -  These corpses and skeletons indicate danger just ahead. Better be careful!
Interface Spoiler  -  Examining the game interface reveals spoilers.
Penny Pinching Crab  -  Crabs associated with greed and materialism.
Malevolent Masked Men  -  Villains wearing masks, because creepy masks are never a good sign.
Tome Of Eldritch Lore  -  Old evil book.
The Guards Must Be Crazy  -  Guards suffer from chronic Genre Blindness.
Hypocritical Humor  -  Hypocrisy Played for Laughs. Alternatively, being a Hypocrite for the sake of comedy.
Dandere  -  A character who is quiet with strangers but talkative with people they know well.
I Can See You  -  A phone call to a person far away turns bad when the person make a comment that reveals they are in line of sight to the caller.
Wrong Genetic Sex  -  Character's genetic sex doesn't match their actual gender, throwing off investigators.
Zombie Apocalypse  -  The undead rise up to conquer the earth.
Thriving Ghost Town  -  This established city doesn't have a lot of people in it, yet it still manages to sustain itself.
No Adequate Punishment  -  A crime has no corresponding punishment in the rule of law.
Our Mages Are Different  -  Using magic differently from another person.
Paranormal Episode  -  A story set in the "real" world takes a sudden turn for the weird and unexplained for a single episode.
No Nonsense Nemesis  -  They don't mess around, crack jokes or gloat when it's about this foe.
Villain Protagonist  -  The main character is unambiguously evil.
Im Cold So Cold  -  Character close to death feels cold.
Even The Girls Want Her  -  Chick attracts straight men and straight women.
Public Secret Message  -  Publishing or announcing a coded confidential message in plain sight.
Switched At Birth  -  The trope: Two babies are switched shortly after birth.
Living Ship  -  A ship that's Organic Technology.
Costume Evolution  -  A character's fashion sense changes.
Odd Organ Up Top  -  A being has a different body part in place of its head.
Brain Uploading  -  Downloading your mind into a computer
Incompetence Inc  -  A corporation that's the embodiment of incompetence.
Photographic Memory  -  Character who can remember minute details from their life.
Elective Monarchy  -  Monarchs are elected, rather than born, into their position.
Zonk  -  A joke prize signifying you've lost.
The Team Benefactor  -  Character who provides funding or resources to the team.
Censor Shadow  -  Shadowing over an area for censorship.
Barred From The Afterlife  -  A character has died, but can't enter heaven or hell.
Not Using The Z Word  -  Never calling a supernatural being by its traditional name.
The Omnipresent  -  The being is able to be everywhere.
Realpolitik  -  Being ruthless, manipulative and amoral for "the greater good", self-interest, or both.
Elemental Rivalry  -  Contrasting characters also have contrasting Elemental Powers.
Hate Sink  -  A character designed to be hated by the audience.
Shrinking Violet  -  A discreet and gentle wallflower.
The Tease  -  Enjoys arousing others for fun.
Egypt Is Still Ancient  -  Even in the present, Egypt is the same as it was thousands of years ago.
Please Keep Your Hat On  -  ...What was under it is disturbing everybody.
Fight Woosh  -  Graphic transition from field screen to battle screen.
Light Girl Dark Boy  -  When it comes to Gender Bending and a Distaff Counterpart, the females have lighter hair and skin, while males will be darker in contrast.
Bluff The Impostor  -  Rooting out an impostor by revealing he doesn't know something he should (or does know something he shouldn't), usually by tricking him into repeating an obvious mistake.
Phlebotinum Handling Requirements  -  A piece of Applied Phlebotinum that imposes a particular requirement in order to activate and/or wield it.
Cliffhanger  -  TROPE: The show ends in the middle of a tense situation with no predicted outcome.
Airstrip One  -  Conquered territories are rebranded with a label and a number.
Hidden Disdain Reveal  -  A character reveals their dislike or contempt for another character, usually after a fall out.
First Person Snapshooter  -  Taking pictures in a game for bonuses.
Belated Happy Ending  -  A story's Ambiguous Ending is resolved in the sequel.
Music Is Eighth Notes  -  Music is visually represented as eighth notes.
Whats Up King Dude  -  Commoners have easy access to/informal interactions with their king.
Art Attacker  -  Uses art as a weapon.
The Taming Of The Grue  -  Monsters get less monstrous when they get popular.
Relationship Reveal  -  A simply implied couple becomes official.
Rubber Forehead Aliens  -  Aliens look like humans with prosthetic makeup.
Gambling Brawl  -  A friendly wager or betting game turns violent.
Stage Mom  -  Pushes her kid into show business, whether they want it or not.
Unfazed Everyman  -  Ordinary person surrounded by weirdness. They take it in stride.
Literal Ass Kicking  -  A boot to the butt.
Tattoo As Character Type  -  Tattoo(s) as visual shorthand for characterization.
You Never Did That For Me  -  A character complains that a character they have a significant relationship with never treated them like they treat someone else.
Rejected Apology  -  Sorry is not going to cut it this time.
Story Arc  -  A story told in sequences.
Image Macro  -  A picture superimposed with amusing text.
Written In Infirmity  -  A Real Life injury or illness is worked into a piece of fiction.
Emergency Trainee Battle Deployment  -  Trainees are mustered into battle early out of desperation.
Angry Black Man  -  An African-American character who is eternally angry at The Man.
Obvious Pregnancy  -  When "very, very pregnant" is an acceptable description.
Evil All Along  -  A character believed to be good is revealed to be evil.
Repeating Ad  -  Seeing that one commercial over and over and over again makes you sick.
Absent Minded Professor  -  A scientist who is often lost in thought and a little out of touch with the world around them.
Cassandra Bystander  -  A character, after realizing someone just witnessed something unusual they did, trusts them not to tell anyone because no one will believe them.
Lazy Dragon  -  Dragons spend most of their time either sleeping or curled on their hoards in their lairs.
Golden Translator  -  Someone who's a well-regarded writer in their own right translates a foreign work into their own language.
Last Ditch Move  -  Just when you think you've defeated the enemy, it makes one last powerful attack.
Pillars Of Moral Character  -  Japanese concepts about honor.
Gibberish Of Love  -  You can't form complete sentences when talking with your love interest.
Rock Star Parking  -  In TV land there is always a parking space right outside your destination.
Artistic License Film Production  -  Cinematography is presented inaccurately, in order to make the story work better.
Master Actor  -  A disturbingly perfect In-Universe actor.
Disappointed By The Motive  -  The good guys are disappointed by the bad guy's reason for doing what he did.
Translation By Volume  -  Fluent in yelling at foreigners.
Sycophantic Servant  -  The Big Bad's pathetic bootlicking minion.
Team Killer  -  A character who kills their own teammates.
Gonky Femme  -  An unusually masculine-looking woman is actually quite feminine.
The Munchausen  -  Someone with past experience in pretty much everything. And he's not lying about it.
Inexplicably Preserved Dungeon Meat  -  Conveniently placed food in video games somehow doesn't go bad.
Fun With Palindromes  -  Stuff that's the same backwards and forwards.
The Needs Of The Many  -  When you can't save everyone, do whatever saves the greatest number.
Technological Pacifist  -  For whom technology is great, except for violent ends.
Animal Nemesis  -  Seeking revenge on an animal.
Face Doodling  -  Drawing on someone's face when they are unconscious.
Mac Guffin Turned Human  -  The plot where the object that everyone is looking for turns out to have been transformed into a person.
Murder By Suicide  -  Killing someone by making them kill themselves.
Mouth Flaps  -  The character's mouth just moves up and down in correspondence to what they are saying.
Rewind Gag  -  Everything is funnier when its going backwards.
Whats Inside Plot  -  Mystery surrounds the contents of a container.
Last Day Of School Plot  -  A character, or characters, has their last day of school before the summer starts.
Indecipherable Lyrics  -  Just what the heck is this guy singing, anyway?
Super Sargasso Sea  -  A place where all lost and forgotten objects and beings go.
Sedgwick Speech  -  Character dies trying to give a Rousing Speech.
Sting  -  Dramatic musical sound effect.
Backing Away Slowly  -  Slowly moving away from a person who just said or did something inappropriate, embarrassing, or incredibly strange.
Body Of Bodies  -  A monster compiled of a mass of bodies.
Kick The Dog  -  A gratuitously cruel action that shows how horrible a character is.
Disease By Any Other Name  -  A known disease or disorder in modern times is referred to by a different term in the past or in another universe.
Artistic License Ships  -  An inconsistency involving ships (Not those ones) to make the story better.
Evil Is Visceral  -  If it has guts on the outside, it's evil.
Faux Action Girl  -  She can't really kick your ass, but the show pretends she can.
Fighting A Shadow  -  The opponent that was "killed" was not the entire being, either being an illusion or an incarnation that can return.
Creepy Good  -  The good guys are scary.
Purity Sue  -  The Pollyanna exaggerated to its utmost extreme.
Alpha Bitch  -  The most popular and least bearable girl in school.
Video Game Caring Potential  -  Some games just touch your heart and make you care.
Anime Chinese Girl  -  Female Chinese characters often depicted as cute, and having a variable accent.
Dont Wake The Sleeper  -  Whatever you do, don't wake a sleeping person, or else...
Black Swords Are Better  -  Swords with a black blade are superior to swords with a gray blade.
Crater Power  -  When a character makes a crater under their own power.
Racial Remnant  -  The descendents of a group that is otherwise extinct.
Intrepid Reporter  -  Reporter actively seeks out and gets involved in their stories.
Elite Zombie  -  Zombies + Elite Mooks
Cosmic Horror Story  -  A genre wherein the universe is dominated by destructive, unimaginably powerful and incomprehensible entities which don't care about (and may not even notice) us.
One Dimensional Thinking  -  When confronted by a danger from one direction, no one ever thinks to evade it by moving to the side.
Too Many Halves  -  A description with fractions that don't add up.
Joke And Receive  -  Someone makes a joke that is literally true (or becomes true later on) without them knowing beforehand.
Vice City  -  A Wretched Hive or a Crapsaccharine World in city form.
Rescue Introduction  -  Meeting a new character while rescuing them.
Disneyesque  -  Soft style of animation popularized by Disney.
Background Boss  -  Video Game boss stands in the background behind where the player is, and unleashes attacks into the foreground.
Pent Up Power Peril  -  An ability threatens its user with Power Incontinence if it goes unused enough.
Properly Paranoid  -  Characters suspect that somebody is after them. They're right.
Obliviously Beautiful  -  A person (often a woman) who's totally unaware of how good-looking they are.
Single Issue Psychology  -  There is only ever one problem with a given character's psyche.
Orphaned Reference  -  Some aspect of a work is cut from the final version, but things that made it in still reflect it.
Cool Old Guy  -  Someone for whom awesomeness increased with age.
An Interior Designer Is You  -  A video game feature which allows you to decorate a room.
Your Makeup Is Running  -  Makeup/mascara starts bleeding when you cry.
Adaptation Personality Change  -  Character has a different personality in an adaptation from the original medium.
Pervert Revenge Mode  -  A pervert's victim is out for revenge and probably going to get it!
Theseus Ship Paradox  -  If you replace all the parts of something over time, is it still the original item?
Simple Yet Awesome  -  Elegance in minimalism.
Driven To Villainy  -  Traumatic experiences cause them to be evil.
Good Hurts Evil  -  Good powers are very painful for evil to handle.
Insult Of Endearment  -  Insult becomes a meaningful and embracing nickname.
Gypsy Curse  -  A curse that is usually cast by a wise woman and acts as Laser-Guided Karma.
Heroic Host  -  A heroic person gains powers through something inhabiting their body.
Animate Dead  -  Bringing the dead to life under your command.
Insignificant Little Blue Planet  -  You might think we're essential, try inconsequential, it's a small world after all!
Cloudcuckoolanders Minder  -  The one that keeps the loon in check.
Dragon Lady  -  Asian Femme Fatale or baroness.
Incompatible Orientation  -  One character is in love with another whose sexuality prevents reciprocal feelings.
Tyrannicide  -  Killing the tyrant/ruler.
Temporary Bulk Change  -  A character can change size temporarily.
With Due Respect  -  ...You're not due any.
Adaptational Alternate Ending  -  The adaptation ends differently than its source material.
Creepy Souvenir  -  A character keeps an item, often a human body part, as a morbid trophy.
Mediation Backfire  -  Two characters who were previously quarreling put aside their differences in abusing the peacemaker.
Phantom Thief  -  A thief archetype known for being elusive.
The Resolution Will Not Be Televised  -  A show is wrapped up through means other than its primary medium.
This Is A Work Of Fiction  -  Legalese way of saying "I made this all up, so don't sue me." Often expressed in funny ways.
Never Forgotten Skill  -  A lesson that has been learned once never forgotten despite not practicing for a long time.
Writing By The Seat Of Your Pants  -  Making a story up as you go.
Of Corpse Hes Alive  -  Pretending a corpse is a living person.
Working Title  -  Temporary title used to refer to a work during its production.
Panty Shot  -  Underwear exposure for fanservice.
Didnt See That Coming  -  Unexpected obstacles in your plan.
Convulsive Seizures  -  Seizures are always convulsions.
Incestuous Casting  -  Actors who play romantic partners in a work are related in real life.
Talking Pest  -  RAAAAAAAAID! *explodes*
Verbal Backspace  -  Attempting to "unsay" something that has already been said, often with the intention to say something else.
You Answered Your Own Question  -  A question that contains the answer.
Chairman Of The Brawl  -  A chair is used as an Improvised Weapon in a fight.
Civilians Are Irrelevant  -  The Main Characters decide everything. Everyone else lets them, whether they want it or not.
Explosive Overclocking  -  Increasing power to dangerous levels to boost speed or performance, causing a device to self-destruct (or close to it).
Bar Slide  -  Clever cup-sliding technique
Give Geeks A Chance  -  The geeks get the girl in the end.
Paper Bag Popping  -  Popping a paper bag to surprise someone.
Vegetarian Carnivore  -  Carnivorous animal only eats fruits and vegetables.
Pardon My Klingon  -  Cursing in fictional languages to get past the censors.
You Are Not Alone  -  Even when you feel like you're alone, you aren't—you'll always feel your friends surrounding you.
Unusually Uninteresting Sight  -  Bystanders unfazed by the incredibly unusual.
Antagonist In Mourning  -  Villain mourns their arch-nemesis' demise.
Prefers Proper Names  -  A character insists on using the formal names of other characters, including full given names or surnames, as opposed to nicknames or contractions.
World Tree  -  A really, really, really big tree, serving as a deity or otherwise having some sort of supernatural property.
Abnormal Ammo  -  Gun shoots atypical projectiles.
Bat People  -  Humanoid bats.
Younger Mentor Older Disciple  -  An expert teaches an older person his/her skills and methods. They may form a teacher-pupil relationship.
Stalling The Sip  -  A character takes an inordinate amount of time to consume their poisoned drink/food.
Pinball Projectile  -  A projectile ricochets multiple times before hitting something.
Hit Scan  -  Rather than actually firing anything, a videogame gun is coded such that it just magically injures whatever it's pointed at when the trigger is pulled.
Deity Of Human Origin  -  Mortal becomes a god.
Disabled Deity  -  A Physical God or divine being with a disability.
Bigger Stick  -  The winner is decided by whoever has the better weapon.
Unwanted Gift Plot  -  You got a gift that you hate, but now you have to pretend you like it.
Alien Abduction  -  A human being is kidnapped by extraterrestrial visitors.
Loyal Animal Companion  -  A faithful animal friend.
Our Gods Are Different  -  Common attributes and features of gods in fiction.
Preview Piggybacking  -  Attaching a preview for a much-anticipated work to a relatively unknown one to improve sales of the latter.
Dual World Gameplay  -  Visiting two different versions of the same world as a gameplay mechanic.
Helium Speech  -  Inhaling helium makes your voice high-pitched.
Wormsign  -  Travel underground pushes up the ground.
Hit Points  -  Indicates how much damage a character can take before they die.
What You Are In The Dark  -  A person shows their true colors in private.
Sensual Slavs  -  Slavic woman using her sex appeal to seduce, manipulate, distract or beguile a non-Slavic character.
Hillbilly Horrors  -  Ax-Crazy rednecks.
Morality Ballad  -  A song that tells a story and a lesson of it.
Always Lawful Good  -  An entire race of beings who are always good.
Leslie Nielsen Syndrome  -  A dramatic actor does comedy (sometimes temporarily).
Tinman Typist  -  Robots interacting with other technology via tactile means—as humans do—instead of interfacing with them directly.
Desert Warfare  -  Military conflict takes place in a desert.
Just Here For Godzilla  -  Caring about only one element of a work and consuming it just for that.
Lost Food Grievance  -  A character overreacts to the loss of food (usually their own).
Planetary Parasite  -  A parasite that uses a whole planet as its host as part of its reproduction cycle.
Milking The Monster  -  Making money off of the presence of a monster.
Wild Magic  -  Magic has a mind of its own.
Exploited Immunity  -  Attacking yourself and your enemy, and you're immune to the attack.
Money To Burn  -  Destroying money is cool.
Scarecrow Solution  -  We can't fight this; maybe we can scare it away.
Talking To Themself  -  A character has a conversation with themself.
Fully Dressed Cartoon Animal  -  An anthropomorphic animal who wears a full set of clothes, including shoes.
Ornamental Weapon  -  A weapon that's carried around all the time, but rarely actually gets used.
Crazy Enough To Work  -  It shouldn't work at all; that's why it will.
Rule Thirty Four  -  #34. There is porn of anything. No exceptions.
Talking Is A Free Action  -  Time stops while you chatter on.
Spice Rack Panacea  -  Herbal medicine with possible dangerous side effects.
Squick  -  Something so disgusting and depraved it requires Brain Bleach.
Grappling Hook Pistol  -  A pistol that fires a connected grappling hook.
Two Of Your Earth Minutes  -  Aliens Speaking English use planets as redundant adjectives for things that should be specific to that planet anyway.
Trick Bomb  -  Bomb does something unusual.
Crisis Of Faith  -  A character loses faith in something, then questions it and eventually learns something.
Suit With Vested Interests  -  He's willing to ignore an imminent disaster in order to protect his investment.
Badass And Baby  -  Someone beats up bad guys while holding a baby. May or may not be their own.
Guilty Pleasures  -  Something a character either hates, but is constantly drawn to; or loves, but isn't about to (publicly) admit to loving.
Nighttime Transformation  -  At night, you assume a new form. At least until the sun rises.
Imaginary Love Triangle  -  A love triangle is perceived to be there when in reality it doesn't truly exist.
Man Of A Thousand Faces  -  An actor who is well-known, but frequently unrecognizable due to an ability to radically alter their appearance and mannerisms.
Above The Influence  -  A character refuses to take advantage of the person they have a crush on when they are vulnerable.
Full Health Bonus  -  A special ability or item that works better, or is only usable, when the user is at full health.
I Thought Everyone Could Do That  -  When someone thinks their special talent is something everyone can do.
In Case You Forgot Who Wrote It  -  The name of the writer is constantly brought up in the title.
Nightmare Weaver  -  A character, typically an evil Dream Weaver or Overlord, who rules over nightmares.
Go To Alias  -  Some people use the same name when they're pretending they're someone they aren't.
There Is Only One Bed  -  Two (or more) characters get stuck together in a room with a single bed. Awkwardness ensues.
Wrong Restaurant  -  A character orders a food at a restaurant that doesn't serve said food.
Dismotivation  -  A character takes care to keep up the status quo.
Who Shot JFK  -  Wanna know who really killed John F. Kennedy?
Minion Manipulated Into Villainy  -  A minion learns that his villainous boss was the one behind his Start of Darkness.
Beelzebub  -  Trope
Fallback Marriage Pact  -  If we're both still single when we're forty, let's get married.
The Real Man  -  Plays games to kick ass and take names.
Viewers Are Morons  -  The creators underestimate their average viewer's intelligence.
Twenty Fifth Amendment  -  The list of who gets to be the next President of the United States of America if the current holder dies or is deemed incapable of ruling - to avert a Succession Crisis.
Canon Defilement  -  When a writer of Fanfiction takes their Artistic License too far and angers fans of the source material.
Manipulative Editing  -  So heavily edited, it's hard to tell just where the "reality" begins.
Story Breaker Team Up  -  How do you do a crossover involving works with wildly different tone and setting?
Plot Threads  -  Several separate sequences of events that are all part of one narrative.
The Captivity Narrative  -  Puritan girl captured by savages.
Living Museum Exhibit  -  A character as a museum exhibit.
Spoon Bending  -  Spoons (and the bending of) associated with psychics and the paranormal.
Villain Episode  -  Villain Protagonist for a day.
Forgotten Fallen Friend  -  A friend or relative of the main character dies, is mourned, and is almost never mentioned again.
The Series Has Left Reality  -  A previously more grounded series gains more fanciful elements as it goes on.
Forgot The Call  -  Amnesia derails the plot.
It Only Works Once  -  A technique works once, and only once.
Frog Men  -  Frog-like humanoids.
Basic Instinct Legs Crossing Parody  -  Stock Parody of the iconic leg-crossing scene from Basic Instinct.
Animal Mecha  -  Mecha shaped like animals.
Trunk Shot  -  The camera is looking out of the trunk, up at the actors.
Slow Clap  -  Clapping slowly to show disapproval over something.
Adaptation Deviation  -  Super-Trope for significant changes made by an adaptation.
Hive Mind  -  One mind, many bodies.
Winter Royal Lady  -  Winter-evoking royal titles are more glamorous and mysterious.
Nostalgia Heaven  -  In a dream or the afterlife, two characters with a deep connection are seen together in a particular place that is somehow special to them.
Familiar  -  A witch/wizard's magical pet.
The Grovel  -  Please, please, please, please, please, please, please, PLEEEEAAAASE FORGIVE ME!!!
Knight Templar Big Brother  -  A sibling who would protect/avenge their fellow siblings by any means necessary.
Shallow News Site Satire  -  A fictional website satirizing online media ventures like Buzzfeed by portraying them as fun but shallow.
Not That Kind Of Doctor  -  If you don't know medicine, you don't get to be called "doctor". Conversely, if you are called "doctor", you must know medicine.
Impossible Leavening  -  Too much yeast makes the food swell far too big to be possible, or even explode.
Exasperated Perp  -  Annoying or irritating a suspect into giving you the information you need.
The Can Kicked Him  -  Someone dies in a bathroom either while using the facilities or with the facilities.
Stupid Crooks  -  Idiots who can't even commit a crime right.
New Wave Science Fiction  -  Post-modernism meets and mugs Science Fiction in the Swingin' Sixties.
Girl Show Ghetto  -  The belief that all works aimed towards women, or that have a female fanbase, or a female main character, are of poor quality, and thus should only be enjoyed by women.
Interrupted By The End  -  Exactly What It Says on the Tin.
No Such Thing As Alien Pop Culture  -  Aliens have no pop culture, only high culture.
Viewer Gender Confusion  -  Is that character a he or a she?
Visit By Divorced Dad  -  Separated father visits the family or child visits separated father.
Afterlife Express  -  A train or other vehicle that carries people to the afterlife.
Surfer Dude  -  Stereotypical surfer character, bro.
Bonus Feature Failure  -  Unlockable feature that isn't worth the effort.
Haunted House Historian  -  A character who knows the Backstory of a Haunted House, Indian Burial Ground, Eldritch Location, Abandoned Hospital, or other evil location.
Mandatory Line  -  A character is given a few lines to say just to be included in the story.
Homeschooled Kids  -  A character is taught and educated at home.
The Social Darwinist  -  For them, "survival of the fittest" means "Might Makes Right."
Fallen Angel  -  An angel rebels against Heaven, often becoming evil in the process, and is cast out.
Give Me A Sword  -  Asking for a weapon to aid you in battle.
I Do Not Drink Wine  -  A seemingly human character cannot eat certain human foods. Often used as a Red Right Hand.
Wounded Hero Weaker Helper  -  A hero is wounded and needs help from a comparatively weaker/frailer character.
Ptero Soarer  -  Pterosaurs portrayed as bat-winged dragon-like monsters that carry off people in their claws.
Dumb Dinos  -  Dinosaurs are Too Dumb to Live.
Sorry That Im Dying  -  Character apologizes for their own death.
Would Be Rude To Say Genocide  -  We need to kill a whole bunch of people, but we don't want anyone to notice it's a bad thing.
Spear Carrier  -  A character that shows up, says a line, then is never seen again.
Wimpification  -  A fan fiction version of a male character is greatly softened so that he can be shoehorned into a dominant/submissive relationship.
Utility Party Member  -  The character you keep in your party for their non-combat skills.
Prescience Is Predictable  -  Perfect knowledge of the future makes life boring or depressing.
Fight Dracula  -  A character just goes like "Ya know what? I'm gonna go fight Dracula!"
Accidental Aesop  -  An Aesop that the author didn't intend to be in the work.
Chill Of Undeath  -  Undead creatures with abnormally low body temperatures.
Breathless Non Sequitur  -  A Non Sequitur snuck into the middle of normal-sounding dialogue, without any indication.
Temporary Name Change  -  When a name change is reversed.
Released To Elsewhere  -  When Never Say "Die" is reinforced in-universe.
Magnetic Girlfriend  -  It's hard to pick up chicks. Until you get a girlfriend.
Bottle Episode  -  An episode with deliberately few or no new props, characters, or settings, so as to cost as little as possible.
Well Done Dad Guy  -  A role model longs for the approval of their followers.
Salaryman  -  Stereotypical office worker, generally from Japan.
Estrogen Brigade  -  Female fans of a male character(s) in a traditionally male-oriented media.
The Bluebeard  -  Man repeatedly marries and murders women.
Ridiculous Exchange Rates  -  A currency so worthless that even prices on the cheapest things have a lot of digits.
Non Mammal Mammaries  -  Humanoid breasts on non-human characters to help visually identify their gender.
Fire Breathing Weapon  -  A gun, or other weapon, that shoots fire.
Traumatic Haircut  -  Anguished by forced haircut.
Free Wheel  -  The single wheel that rolls away in the wake of a car crash.
Fallen Princess  -  A privileged and/or wealthy girl loses her power, usually becoming more humble in the process.
Dogs Hate Squirrels  -  When dogs are savage predators for squirrels.
Knights And Knaves  -  Logic puzzle with a liar and a truth-teller.
Intimate Haircut  -  Willingness to let someone cut your hair—and to cut someone else's hair—is a sign of mutual trust.
The Shelf Of Movie Languishment  -  A finished work is not released until much later. Or not released at all.
Agree To Disagree  -  Having different opinions doesn't mean that characters have to be enemies.
Olympus Mons  -  Capturing and controlling cosmic entities.
Cape Busters  -  Normal humans purposed with fighting superhumans.
Ineffectual Death Threats  -  A character makes a death threat they are unlikely to carry out, and never do
Grandfather Clause  -  This Long Runner gets away with playing a Discredited Trope straight because they were using the trope before it was commonplace and it is too ingrained into the formula to abandon it.
Censored Title  -  Using a less offensive title for the sake of advertisement.
Spell Crafting  -  When a setting lets you make up or cobble together spells or powers.
Ghost Extras  -  Implausible non-interacting extras.
Gut Feeling  -  Superhumanly high-level intuition.
Stealth Cigarette Commercial  -  Smoking ads disguised as Don't Smoke ads.
Retraux  -  It looks old because that's cool.
Parting The Sea  -  A body of water is split apart by some fantastic means.
Religious Vampire  -  Vampires that adhere to traditional faiths, whether real or fictious.
Super Team  -  A Ragtag Bunch of Misfits consisting of Differently Powered Individuals.
Resurrect The Villain  -  New villains bring a previously killed villain Back from the Dead in order to teach or serve them.
Mamet Speak  -  Speech that is fast, full of jargon, and almost always vulgar.
The Apunkalypse  -  Thugs with garish clothing and hairstyles rule after civilization collapses.
Soiled City On A Hill  -  The destruction of a corrupt city occurs.
Secret Identity Vocal Shift  -  A character's voice changes when they assume their superhero/supervillain identity.
Yaoi Guys  -  Yaoi-style relationships between side characters to bring in the Yaoi Fangirls.
Intertwined Fingers  -  Intertwined fingers implies a romantic relationship.
Necromancer  -  A mage who raises a gold-encrusted, bony middle finger to the laws of life and death.
Inferred Survival  -  They're probably alive, even if it looks like they croaked.
Bleep Dammit  -  The censoring does jack shi+.
Only Six Faces  -  Everybody has the same face.
Heroes Unlimited  -  Cast expansion, usually by a large amount.
Four Legged Insect  -  Species of animal portrayed with fewer legs than they have in real life.
Elemental Shapeshifter  -  A character can Shape Shift into one of the elements.
Incessant Music Madness  -  Continually loud or annoying sounds that aren't intentional.
Tom The Dark Lord  -  An all-powerful villain with a very simple name.
Scary Scarecrows  -  Scarecrows depicted as evil and vengeful.
Life Drain  -  Deals damage and heals you.
Bizarre Baby Boom  -  Something happens to the world which then makes people get special powers.
Expressive Accessory  -  An item, usually article of clothing, imitates the expressions of the person wearing it.
Star Shaped Coupon  -  A Plot Coupon shaped like a star. It is always stars.
Flowers Of Romance  -  Flowers in the contexts of a relationship.
The Cameo  -  Someone famous makes a brief, plot-irrelevant appearance in another unrelated work.
Old Flame Fizzle  -  Rekindling an old romance ends in flames.
Monster Whale  -  Whales portrayed as Sea Monsters.
Banana Peel  -  Friction's worst enemy, fresh out of its skin.
Space Compression  -  They tell that the lands are vast, yet you can go from one end to other within minutes.
Trophy Child  -  A child (or children) born or raised to aid their parent's social standing, while often being abused in the process.
Crossdresser  -  A person who dresses in clothing generally not associated with their gender.
Lonely Bachelor Pad  -  Unfurnished - or minimally furnished apartment - to some degree showing the loneliness of the resident, especially a single male.
Death Amnesia  -  What do you mean, "I was dead?"
The Red Stapler  -  A work of fiction affects demand for a real product.
Seasonal Rot  -  A dip in quality in a long-running series.
Calling Card  -  Deliberately left evidence for a crime acting as a signature of the perpetrator.
Oracular Head  -  A talking head.
Power Degeneration  -  Power kills you a little more each time you use it.
Turn Based Strategy Real Time Combat  -  Strategic gameplay takes place in turns, but tactical engagements play out in real time.
Artistic License Music  -  Music inaccuracies happen to make a good story.
Angels In Overcoats  -  If angels appear on Earth, they're wearing overcoats.
Godzilla Threshold  -  The point of desperation at which anything and everything becomes a valid option.
The Bermuda Triangle  -  Weird things cause weird events to happen here.
Accent Relapse  -  A character who's been faking an accent to pass off as another nationality goes back to speaking how they speak normally because their cover's been blown.
Shoryuken  -  Jumping uppercut.
Qurac  -  Generic fictional Middle-Eastern country.
Petite Pride  -  Flat-chested and proud of it.
Duels Decide Everything  -  All major conflicts in a work are settled by fair, one-on-one contests.
Combinatorial Explosion  -  The game programmer puts an item in the game intended to be used for one objective when it could be used for several.
Pastoral Science Fiction  -  Science fiction set in the countryside and encompassing themes appropriate to that setting.
Mama Didnt Raise No Criminal  -  After finding out their child is a criminal the family reacts with disbelief or denial.
Villainy Free Villain  -  Antagonist who isn't evil, but is unlikable.
Exactly What It Says On The Tin  -  The name or title is self-explanatory.
Honest Rolls Character  -  Stats are randomized, so PCs get gimped by their player's honesty.
Minor Flaw Major Breakup  -  Can't stand partner's minor flaw.
Phantom Zone Picture  -  2-D images as prisons for 3-D characters.
Pretty Boy  -  A boyish and slender attractive man.
Narm Charm  -  A scene that should be too ridiculous to take seriously but somehow still works.
Entertainingly Wrong  -  Their facts are correct, but their conclusion is wrong.
Memory Wiping Crew  -  The people who wipe the memories of those who might see through the Masquerade.
Adaptation Overdosed  -  This work has been adapted far too many times.
A Saint Named Mary  -  A pure and compassionate woman named Mary (or something similar) to invoke the Virgin Mary.
Minecart Madness  -  Generic Video Game minecart level.
Age Without Youth  -  Immortal who continues aging in appearance.
Chorus Only Song  -  Songs that are only remembered for their chorus or main melody, and little to nothing else.
Playing Cyrano  -  Someone in love relies on a friend for words.
Parenthetical Swearing  -  Cursing in tone, but not in words.
It Seemed Like A Good Idea At The Time  -  A bad idea in hindsight.
Death Mountain  -  Generic Video Game mountain area.
Mistaken For Suicidal  -  A character is thought to be suicidal when they're really not.
Belligerent Sexual Tension  -  Endless fighting equals love.
Hartman Hips  -  An exaggeratedly small waistline and large hips used as a visual cue to denote femininity and/or maturity.
Ageless Birthday Episode  -  A character celebrates a birthday with no mention of their age.
The Men First  -  Boss wants to get his soldiers out of the bad situation.
The Very Definitely Final Dungeon  -  This dungeon is so epic it's clearly the final one.
Skele Bot 9000  -  Robots with a skeleton-like design.
Bust Contrast Duo  -  An Always Female duo composed by a slender girl and a busty girl.
Second Year Protagonist  -  If the lead character(s) happens to be a high school student, they're usually depicted as sophomores, in order to prevent other factors affecting the character.
Doom Troops  -  Extremely imposing and scary-looking mooks.
Suicide By Sunlight  -  Vampires staying out till sun-up as euthenasia.
Lime  -  A Fan Fic with non-explicit sex scenes.
Secret Relationship  -  A couple in a romantic relationship conceal it from others.
Meanwhile In The Future  -  Events in different time periods shown as occurring simultaneously.
Interchangeable Antimatter Keys  -  In video games, keys are interchangeable, but can only be used once per door or chest.
Thunder Beetle  -  Beetles are associated with electricity and/or have actual electric powers.
Turing Test  -  A test to determine whether someone is human (or could demonstrate human-like behavior and emotion).
Gangland Drive By  -  Assassination via shooting a target from a moving vehicle.
X Marks The Hero  -  X-shaped scars are for heroes.
Weredragon  -  A human that can turn into a dragon, or vice versa.
Lethal Lava Land  -  Generic Video Game volcano area.
Wheelchair Woobie  -  They're wheelchair bound, and the audience feels bad for them.
Lonely Together  -  Two people sharing a common bond of loneliness.
Changeling Fantasy  -  Your real parents are much more exciting than your other ones.
Calling The Old Man Out  -  A child gives "The Reason You Suck" Speech to a parent for their mistreatment.
Moving The Goalposts  -  Continually changing a standard so that it can't be met.
Jar Potty  -  Makeshift waste container.
Food Eats You  -  Sentient food products try to kill people.
Sociopathic Soldier  -  A morally questionable or outright psychotic soldier of his/her own country.
Empty Piles Of Clothing  -  A character stumbles upon a pile of empty clothes with no idea of what happened to the original owner.
Informed Species  -  An animal that belongs to an actual species, but looks little like its Real Life counterpart.
Extreme Omni Goat  -  Goats'll eat anything.
Loads And Loads Of Races  -  The 'Verse hosts at least fifteen unique sapient species.
Gone Horribly Wrong  -  Plan or invention goes terribly awry with bad consequences for everyone.
Designated Evil  -  It's evil because I said so.
Silly Love Songs  -  Many songs are really daft ones about love.
Im Not Here To Make Friends  -  Character puts winning ahead of being friendly to their competition.
Ironic Nickname  -  Character's nickname is an intentionally inaccurate description.
Nobody Poops  -  No one needs to use the toilet in fiction unless it's a plot point.
Heroic Willpower  -  Despite being infected with The Corruption, the character has enough willpower to stay good.
Torches And Pitchforks  -  An angry mob taking matters into their own hands.
Time Machine  -  A device that allows travel between different time periods.
Fair Weather Friend  -  An alleged "friend" who disappears when difficulty arises.
A God Am I  -  Delusions of godhood.
Pitbull Dates Puppy  -  A rough and tough character falls in love with someone of a softer, gentler nature.
Community Threatening Construction  -  Constructing a new structure threatens a Close-Knit Community.
Its The Best Whatever Ever  -  A stock phrase for high expectations before an occasion, and for enshrining memories afterwards.
Difficult But Awesome  -  A video game character, technique, etc. that is hard to master, but nearly unstoppable once you do so.
Agent Scully  -  The character who doesn't believe in paranormal and finds contrived scientific explanations for it instead.
Age Gap Romance  -  A romantic relationship where one partner is noticeably older/younger than the other.
Adoptive Peer Parent  -  A person takes responsibility for a child not much younger than them.
Elite Man Courtesan Romance  -  A person of high ranking falls in love with a member of The Oldest Profession.
Born Of Heaven And Hell  -  One parent's origin is from Heaven and the other's is from Hell.
Log Fic  -  A story told in the form of a computer document.
Suicide For Others Happiness  -  A character commits suicide in order to make their loved ones happy.
American Kirby Is Hardcore  -  Work is made Darker and Edgier or Lighter and Softer for an export.
Why Isnt It Attacking  -  An enemy that should be attacking the protagonist(s)...isn't.
Destructo Nookie  -  Sex results in property damage.
Deconstruction Crossover  -  A Massive Multiplayer Crossover done for the sake of Deconstruction.
Sex Dressed  -  Characters dressed up in a hastily manner after sex.
Close Knit Community  -  A setting where people look out for each other.
Graceful In Their Element  -  Nimble and elegant in a certain field; physically awkward out of it.
Dystopia  -  Evil Twin of Utopia: a Crapsack World with serious sociopolitical issues.
Thoroughly Mistaken Identity  -  Someone's so out of touch with reality, they're 100% convinced you're someone else they know.
Serial Killer  -  The Trope: Someone who murders many people in separate incidents.
Touch Of Death  -  One little touch equals instant death.
Excited Show Title  -  A title that ends in an exclamation point! Or more!!
Vampire Vords  -  Vampirez zpeak like thiz.
Doomed Supermarket Display  -  A delicately-designed store display will almost certainly get crashed into at some point.
Duel Boss  -  A one-on-one boss fight.
Dangerous Windows  -  Standing near windows where bad things can get through them to attack you is generally not advised.
Weird Al Effect  -  The parody is better remembered than its subject.
Changing Clothes Is A Free Action  -  Instantaneous costume-changing.
Rapid DNA Test  -  A DNA test takes way less time in fiction than it does in reality.
Bodyguard Babes  -  All-female Elite Mooks.
School Of No Studying  -  In a story that takes place in a school setting, no one ever stops to worry about their grades.
Grenade Tag  -  Planting a bomb on one's enemy without them realizing it.
Reading Tea Leaves  -  Fortune-telling through tea-leaves, coffee grounds and wine pulp.
Gate Guardian  -  You must defeat this enemy to go through this door.
Dark Skinned Blond  -  Dark skin and blond or white hair combine to mark someone as foreign and exotic, yet still somehow "Western".
Nonstandard Game Over  -  Unusual way to lose in a video game.
Tasty Gold  -  Biting into a coin to test its authenticity.
Bare Fisted Monk  -  Master of unarmed combat.
Misfortune Cookie  -  The type of fortune cookie you'd really rather not get.
Love Dodecahedron  -  The Love Triangle has metastasized Up to Eleven.
Fat And Proud  -  A character who is overweight and proud of it.
Pinata Enemy  -  An enemy farmed for experience, money, and other drops.
Filk Song  -  Music about stuff nerds like.
Autopsy Snack Time  -  A character is so jaded, they can eat around a corpse.
Sitting Duck  -  A person, aircraft, vehicle, etc. is unable or unprepared to fend for themselves and/or is caught in a position where they're open to attack.
Attractive Bent Gender  -  Characters who change into or dress as the opposite sex become hot.
Marty Stu  -  A male Mary Sue.
Troperiffic  -  A work that uses many, many, many tropes.
Spell My Name With An S  -  I know how to say this name, but how do I spell it?
Samus Is A Girl  -  Hey, there's a woman under that suit!
Praetorian Guard  -  Powerful Ruler equals Powerful Guards.
The Voice  -  You hear them, but you never see them.
Holy City  -  Religiously-important city.
Magic Countdown  -  30... 29...
Rape And Revenge  -  Rapist rapes victim, victim gets revenge on the rapist.
Expert In Underwater Basket Weaving  -  Exceptional expertise in pointless skills.
Prohibited Hero Saves The Day  -  The character told to stay back ends up saving everyone.
T Word Euphemism  -  Replace taboo words with family-friendly "T-word" instead.
Gorn  -  Gratuitous, over-the-top graphic violence.
So Last Season  -  The abilities that defeated the bad guys of last season aren't enough to defeat this season's villains.
X Days Since  -  A Comedy Trope where a sign denotes the number of days since the last accident or something similar; this number is typically zero.
Time Limit Boss  -  A Boss Battle that doubles as a Timed Mission, or is part of one.
Terms Of Endangerment  -  (Usually) insincere affectionate nicknaming from an enemy.
Myopic Architecture  -  This defense or shelter only seems impenetrable, except there's a stupid-easy way to circumvent it entirely.
Not Quite The Almighty  -  The supreme being isn't actually the supreme being, be they not actually almighty or superseded by an even greater power.
Goldfish Scooping Game  -  A Japanese booth game where you attempt to catch goldfish with a paper net.
Nostalgia Level  -  A video game level remixing level elements from a previous installment.
Fantastic Aesop  -  A lesson with no relevance in Real Life.
Viewers Are Goldfish  -  The creators underestimate their average viewer's attention span.
Human Nature Fallacy  -  Assuming the negative (or positive) actions of a few humans are inherent in all human beings.
My Defense Need Not Protect Me Forever  -  ... It just needs to buy enough time to set up my Instant-Win Condition.
Beat The Curse Out Of Him  -  Exorcism through physical violence.
Wight In A Wedding Dress  -  Apparitions and other undead wearing a wedding dress.
Gayborhood  -  A place specifically for gays.
Star Power  -  Power that comes from the stars.
Ruling Family Massacre  -  The first thing shrewd invaders/usurpers do is to massacre the entire old ruling family.
Scary Musician Harmless Music  -  Their music isn't nearly as freaky as their public persona would have you believe.
Car Song  -  A song about cars.
Ill Never Tell You What Im Telling You  -  Character blatantly states the information they're trying to keep secret.
The Last DJ  -  Values his integrity over advancing his career.
Someone Has To Do It  -  The task is impossible not to do, and if the current person can't continue someone else will be forced to.
Unnaturally Looping Location  -  A place where going somewhere will just have you return to the start.
Matter Replicator  -  Turns one object into another by rearranging its molecules
Blazing Inferno Hellfire Sauce  -  Ridiculously scorching hot sauce. Or pepper.
Chair Reveal  -  A chair revolves and the characters find an unexpected person sitting on it.
Demon King Nobunaga  -  Oda Nobunaga getting a demonic variation of Historical Villain Upgrade.
Extreme Omnisexual  -  A character that has had — or at least would like to have — sex with people, other species and/or inanimate objects.
Respected By The Respected  -  A character's cred is established by other tough characters addressing them with respect.
The Suffragette  -  She fights for women to get the right to vote in political elections.
Housewife  -  Stay-at-home wife who looks after the home and the children.
Draw Aggro  -  Deliberately drawing the attention of a threat to oneself as a distraction tactic.
Research Inc  -  A company that does research in exchange for money.
Overly Nervous Flop Sweat  -  Sweating excessively in nervousness or fear.
Hive Queen  -  The leader of a Hive Mind.
Stock Subtitle  -  A generic subtitle that still speaks volumes about the work it is attached to.
Grave Marking Scene  -  Someone visits the grave of a loved one.
Forced Out Of The Closet  -  Someone reveals another person's sexuality and/or gender, or the person is compelled to reveal their sexuality and/or gender before they want to.
Goshdang It To Heck  -  The use of G-rated swears in order to avoid censors.
Outlaw Couple  -  Romantic couple and partners in crime.
Wiper Start  -  A character turns on the wipers instead of the engine to show their inexperience with the vehicle.
Savvy Guy Energetic Girl  -  In this pair, he's pragmatic; she's genki.
The Pig Pen  -  A person normally covered in filth.
Sprint Meter  -  A meter that indicates how long a character can run before getting tired.
Super Power Meltdown  -  Character breaks the entire area because of their failing/overused powers.
Air Quotes  -  Finger-gesture to mimic quote marks.
Cavemen Vs Astronauts Debate  -  Characters will not stop arguing about a meaningless "A or B" type question.
The Dead Have Eyes  -  Zombies and skeletons will either still have working eyes, or be able see without eyes.
My Master Right Or Wrong  -  A character that is fiercely loyal to a figure of higher authority, regardless of that figure's flaws and actions.
Oktoberfest  -  Where Britain is Only London, Germany is only Bavaria, in the wurst way.
Arrange Mode  -  A mode that rearranges an existing game with new mechanics or rules.
Smoking Is Cool  -  Character who smokes = Badass
Legacy Of Service  -  A character's family has served another character's family for at least a couple of generations.
True Breeding Hybrid  -  Hybrids capable of reproduction to the point of becoming a separate species.
Serendipity Writes The Plot  -  An unavoidable real-life setback is written into the story.
WTH Casting Agency  -  What the hell is that actor doing in that role?
Rubiks Cube International Genius Symbol  -  Being able to solve the Rubik's Cube is a sign of exceptional intelligence.
Furniture Blockade  -  Using furniture to block access to an area.
The Problem With Licensed Games  -  ...is that most of them suck.
Mercy Kill Arrangement  -  A character asks someone else to perform a Mercy Kill if something happens to them.
Grossout Show  -  A very very very very disgusting show.
Unknown Rival  -  You're my opponent?! I'm sorry, who the hell are you?
Daydream Surprise  -  A short scene is revealed to be imagined.
Starfish Language  -  Bizarre languages.
Dynamic Loading  -  Avoiding a Loading Screen via extended gameplay.
It Must Be Mine  -  A character will do anything to obtain an objective.
Good Angel Bad Angel  -  A character's conscience takes on the form of an angel and a devil near said characters head.
Satan Is Good  -  Satan is actually a Heroic Overlord.
Obsessed With Food  -  A character who is often preoccupied with food.
Unending End Card  -  After the end of a video game, the final scene "THE END" stays on the screen with the only way out is if the game is shut off or reset.
Hammer And Sickle  -  Where a literal hammer and sickle are wielded as weapons, usually representing a Russian or Communist character.
White Sheep  -  A character who rebels against an evil family.
Superstition Episode  -  A character does something considered unlucky and has bad luck for the rest of the episode.
Fan Sub  -  Subtitled shows done by the fans, for the fans.
Arent You Going To Ravish Me  -  Rape (or something similar) doesn't ensue, and the would-be victim is offended.
Cutscene Drop  -  You're teleported to a scripted position after a cutscene.
Death Of The Author  -  When the work is ambiguous about something, the creator's interpretation isn't definitive or automatically better.
Skeleton Motif  -  Skulls and skeletons are used as a sinister motif.
Supernaturally Validated Trans Person  -  Supernatural happenings confirm that a trans person is the gender they identify with, beyond all reasonable doubt.
Lighter And Softer  -  When a work that started out as dark and gritty is retooled to be more "family-friendly".
Celebration Miscalculation  -  Everyone thought it was a special occsasion, but it isn't.
Level Map Display  -  A small map of the entire level is displayed.
Hotter And Sexier  -  Garnishing the Story with Fanservice.
Flashback Montage Realization  -  A character's realization is shown with a montage of previous scenes and lines of dialogue.
Soul  -  A musician's soul is separated from his body.
Trope Makers  -  The first full-fledged use of the trope.
Seven Dirty Words  -  George Carlin's list of words you can't say on television: Shit, piss, fuck, cunt, cocksucker, motherfucker and tits.
Capital Letters Are Magic  -  Capitalizing a regular word to distinguish it as the name of some type of phlebotinum.
Jumping The Gender Barrier  -  Romance ensue because one of two people is gender bent to the opposite sex.
The Runaway  -  A child runs away from their parents or guardians.
Villain Forgot To Level Grind  -  A formerly dangerous villain is less of a threat later in the story because of the heroes' improvements.
Orphaned Setup  -  A setup with no punchline.
Strategy Versus Tactics  -  In short: close tactics are used to fight a squad, grand tactics are how to fight an army, operations are how to run a campaign, strategy is how to run a theater of operations, and grand strategy is how to fight a war.
Disproportionate Reward  -  The reward is much greater than the action that the receiver did.
Tower Defense  -  A video game genre where you build attack towers to defend a base from enemy waves.
Diegetic Switch  -  Music played In-Universe transitions into background music.
All Drummers Are Animals  -  The drummer is the craziest member of the band, either in personality or playing ability.
Waif Prophet  -  Psychic ill girl.
Little Useless Gun  -  Small calibers will never get the job done.
All There In The Manual  -  Information only shared in supplemental material.
Unusual Weapon Mounting  -  Holding a projectile weapon where?
New England Puritan  -  An extremely pious New Englander.
Doujin Soft  -  Japanese indie games with limited releases.
Fist Of Rage  -  Clenching your fist as a sign of anger.
Meta Mecha  -  Mecha pilots bigger mecha.
Tampering With Food And Drink  -  Putting a lethal substance into someone's food or drink.
Captain Obvious Reveal  -  A reveal that is completely obvious to the audience.
Elemental Eye Colors  -  Eye color indicates what element a person uses.
Awesomeness Withdrawal  -  A lapse of depression directly caused by the ending of something awesome.
Ethnic God  -  The patron god of a particular species, tribe, or nation.
Forgiveness Requires Death  -  In order for the character to be forgiven of their crimes, they must be killed.
Nerd Nanny  -  The non-nerd girl who puts up with nerd guys.
Three Shorts  -  Three short shows are aired together to make one bigger show.
Sabotutor  -  Mentor who deliberately trains you wrong.
Sealed Badass In A Can  -  A badass has their essence sealed away, usually into another dimension.
Meteor Move  -  Hitting an airborne opponent down to the ground.
Story Breadcrumbs  -  A game forgoes a straightforward narrative, instead leaving pieces for the player to put together themselves.
Oblivious Guilt Slinging  -  Guilt-tripping someone into having second thoughts without really meaning to.
Ghost Invasion  -  Ghosts invade the Earth.
Character Select Forcing  -  Parts of the game are designed to make you pick a certain character/strategy.
Hijacked By Jesus  -  Christianity shoehorned onto other religious/mythical themes.
The Triple  -  Normal thing, normal thing, funny thing.
Dreaded Kids Table  -  An older child longs to sit with the adults instead of the children during big meals.
Good Stepmother  -  A stepmother who is genuinely loving and supportive of her stepchildren.
Distracted From Death  -  Two characters are together, one dies while the other is briefly distracted, and for at least a few seconds the distracted party doesn't realize their friend is dead.
First World Problems  -  Minor problems blown out of proportion because the sufferer is privileged.
Game Over  -  The trope: You lost the game.
Stealing From The Till  -  Stealing money and other goods you're expected to handle as part of your job.
Sickly Neurotic Geek  -  A nerd/geek who is ill but overexcited.
Cast Of Snowflakes  -  All characters are visually distinctive, even minor ones.
Training The Peaceful Villagers  -  The Hero sets up the locals to learn to fight back.
One Song Bard  -  A professional singer only ever performs one song in the scope of the story.
Wish Upon A Shooting Star  -  You saw a shooting star in the sky? Quick! Make a Wish!
Featureless Plane Of Disembodied Dialogue  -  Dialogue in literature sans adequate description of the setting in which it's taking place.
Genius Bonus  -  Esoteric humor only those in that certain field will get.
Good Powers Bad People  -  I have good powers, but I will be evil instead.
Bloody Murder  -  Blood used as a weapon.
Schizo Continuity  -  Connections between different properties of a Shared Universe are inconsistent or one-sided.
One Degree Of Separation  -  Every character is tangentially connected to almost every other character.
Technical Virgin  -  Has never had coitus, but they have achieved sexual satisfaction.
Egocentrically Religious  -  Their faith and opinion in God depends entirely on how prosperous their own life has been.
Adaptation Inspiration  -  The main premise of an adaptation is the same as the original, but differs in presentation.
Toilet Training Plot  -  An episode focusing on someone being toilet trained.
Radish Cure  -  Someone wants something forbidden. Then they're granted it in a way that puts them off of it forever.
Head In A Vise  -  A person's head is put through a screw press as a form of torture.
Did Anastasia Survive  -  The (now discredited) legend that the Grand Duchess Anastasia Nikolaevna Romanova may have survived the Russian Revolution.
Big Eyes Little Eyes  -  You can tell a lot about an animal by looking at the relative size of its eyes to the rest of its body.
Ambiguous Start Of Darkness  -  A once-good character went bad, but no one knows how or when.
Twisted Christmas  -  Christmas being associated with death and horror.
Escaped From The Lab  -  A character who from an early age was raised in a lab as a test subject, but eventually escaped.
Dude Wheres My Respect  -  The anguish a character experiences when their actions don't elicit the reverence they deserve (or at least think they do).
Grand Finale  -  The definite, absolute end of a series.
Dubstep  -  WubwubwUbwuBWubWUBWUB whAB WHub. OK, let's be serious: an Electronic Music subgenre of British origin that quickly became one of the more popular genres in modern music. Rather... Polarizing, to say the least.
Boisterous Bruiser  -  Loud, strong fighter.
Yamato Nadeshiko  -  Traditional Japanese ideal woman: domestic and submissive, but not a pushover.
Unorthodox Reload  -  Ok, these guns don't have Bottomless Magazines, but at least the reloading looks incredibly awesome.
Intergenerational Friendship  -  Two friends have a different age gap.
Clown Car  -  Vehicle that can seat significantly more passengers than it appears to.
One Two Skip A Few  -  When counting, you unintentionally skip some numbers.
Tiny Tim Template  -  Characters who are based off or parody the A Christmas Carol character Tiny Tim.
Super Deformed  -  Artistic style that makes all characters have small babyish forms with large heads and eyes.
Ancient Grome  -  A classical mix-up: is it supposed to be Greek or Roman?
Snowy Screen Of Death  -  Technical difficulties ensue as a result of Camera Abuse cutting off the signal.
Fan Hater  -  Complaining about people liking things that you don't.
Tagalong Chronicler  -  When the reason to go on an adventure is to tell about the adventure.
Herd Hitting Attack  -  Attack that's more effective on tight groups of enemies.
Sinister Whistling  -  Someone whistles before/after doing a terrible thing.
Expanded States Of America  -  While you weren't looking, America grew.
All Witches Have Cats  -  You can't be a witch without a pet cat.
Calling Me A Logarithm  -  I don't know what that word means, but I'll assume it's an insult.
Doom As Test Prize  -  A competition has an amazing reward... that's secretly horrific.
Angry Animalistic Growl  -  The growl of an animal means they're completely ticked off.
Tongue Tied  -  Applied Phlebotinum prevents a character from saying something important that they want to say.
Many Spirits Inside Of One  -  It's crowded with all these ghosts inside one shmuck/shmuckette.
Hates Their Parent  -  A character openly hates their parent(s).
Pounds Are Animal Prisons  -  In fiction, animal shelters are jails for animals, often complete with standard Prison Tropes in effect.
The Butcher  -  If you're nicknamed "The Butcher," it means you're one bad dude.
Please Dump Me  -  A character deliberately acts unattractive to get their significant other to break up with them, or get their Abhorrent Admirer to stop hounding them.
Obviously Evil  -  Looks evil, because it is.
Expansion Pack Past  -  Overly detailed "mysterious" past.
One Normal Night  -  A normally eccentric family is asked to tone it down to make a good first impression.
Wutai  -  Generic Japanese-themed area in a Medieval European Fantasy setting.
Treacherous Checkpoint  -  A trap or enemy disguised as a Checkpoint or Save Point.
Unrequited Love Switcheroo  -  Boy likes girl. Girl doesn't care. Boy gets over girl. Girl then decides she likes boy. Boy doesnt care.
Walk And Talk  -  Walking through a long passage (ie. a hallway) while having a talk with someone aside.
Invisible Stomach Visible Food  -  An invisible person eats something and you can see it going down.
Throw The Sheath Away  -  A symbolic action to demonstrate one's resolve to fight.
Multiple Persuasion Modes  -  When you can use different in-game social skills to coax NPCs into helping you.
The Little Shop That Wasnt There Yesterday  -  Stores appear and disappear as the plot demands.
Dumb But Diligent  -  What they lack in intelligence, they make up in dedication and persistence.
Kinder And Cleaner  -  A work that is less profane than its previous installments.
Creators Apathy  -  The creators admit they weren't even trying.
Ascended To Carnivorism  -  A flesh-eating herbivore.
Sexy Silhouette  -  Using a curvaceous woman's silhouette to imply nudity.
Robot Religion  -  Robots, Androids, AIs, Cyborgs and other artificial automatons having their own religious institutions and belief systems.
Ridiculously Potent Explosive  -  Explosives with more bang for their buck than any real-world counterpart.
Hidden Heart Of Gold  -  A character doesn't want others to know about his benevolent side.
Kilroy Was Here  -  Writing your name on visible surfaces as a memento.
Adaptational Comic Relief  -  A character is made funnier and more cheerful than the original incarnation.
Two Headed Coin  -  A coin with matching sides, often used to rig what should be a game of chance.
Urine Trouble  -  An animal pees on someone.
From A Single Cell  -  Can completely regenerate so long as a single part remains intact.
Vomit Discretion Shot  -  Character throws up off-camera in some shape or form.
Ludd Was Right  -  Making things the old-fashioned way is the best way.
Im Standing Right Here  -  Talking behind the back of someone present within their earshot, particularly insulting them.
Assimilation Backfire  -  A character assimilates something, only to find that they have either gained its weakness or lose control to its will.
Multiple Head Case  -  Individual with multiple heads, each with distinct personalities.
Level Drain  -  Enemy can cause the player to regress levels.
Axe Before Entering  -  Locked door in your way? Smash it open with a weapon!
Expositing The Masquerade  -  Supernatural stuff has gone on since before the protagonist finds it.
Stuck On Band Aid Brand  -  Must use full trademarked name.
Same Surname Means Related  -  Two characters sharing a last name is a solid indicator that they're related.
Twenty Four Hour Party People  -  Living props who appear in party/dance scenes.
Door Judo  -  Opening a door just as someone is about to knock it down.
Teleport Spam  -  A character abuses their powers of teleportation in rapid succession.
Tender Tears  -  A character is prone to cry easily due to being so sensitive and kind.
Wrong Context Magic  -  Magic always obeys strict rules... except when cast by this character.
Quote Mine  -  I said this, but they'll use only portions that will make people think I said that.
Maximum HP Reduction  -  Attacks that reduce the maximum number of Hit Points, not just their current amount.
Suicide Is Shameful  -  Characters consider suicide as a shameful and reprehensible act.
Robosexual  -  Screwing the robot.
Bastard Bastard  -  Born out of wedlock, disgraced by their family and very, very bitter about it.
Fly Crazy  -  Resorting to extreme means to get rid of an insect bothering you.
The Peter Principle  -  Dysfunctionality ensues when a promotion is based on skills no longer useful for the higher job.
King In The Mountain  -  A legendary figure isn't dead, but instead hidden away or asleep.
Drinking Contest  -  A competition to see who can drink the most alcohol.
Screen Crunch  -  Camera Screw caused by a lack of screen resolution.
Cosmetic Award  -  Congratulations! You completed the challenge! You get a gold star. (No, it doesn't do anything.)
Undercover Model  -  A female cop, spy or detective is forced to go undercover as a model, dancer, sex worker or any other job that relies on physical appearance.
Chainsaw Good  -  Chainsaws are cool.
Trapped By Gambling Debts  -  Character who does evil things in order to get out of massive debt.
Is That A Threat  -  Character asks if another character is threatening them.
Apocalypse Wow  -  It's The End of the World as We Know It, and it's AWESOME!
Hockey Mask And Chainsaw  -  Chainsaw-wielder wears a hockey mask.
This Loser Is You  -  Character meant to represent the audience is presented in a negative light.
Relegated Mentor  -  Teacher who proclaims to have outlived their own usefulness.
Pinball Zone  -  Generic Video Game pinball themed area.
Bloody Horror  -  To make a scene scary or otherwise disturbing, just add blood.
Virgin Power  -  Virginity gives powers.
Artificial Stupidity  -  Artificial intelligence making poor situational choices.
Viewer Species Confusion  -  They're not the species you think they are.
Bratty Half Pint  -  A little kid with a BIG attitude problem, and proud of it.
Filibuster Freefall  -  A creator's body of work starts out fairly neutral, but then it turns into a long Author Filibuster about some real-life topic.
Prolonged Prologue  -  A prologue that takes up far more of the work than necessary.
Last Disc Magic  -  Magic/Spell(s) which is/are more powerful than the previous one(s) are only available later in the game.
Creator Cameo  -  Isn't that the author/director?
Deleted Scene  -  A scene filmed for a work that does not appear in the final version for specific reasons.
Teleportation Sickness  -  Teleportation having unpleasant side effects even when it functions normally.
Band Of Brothels  -  Legal organization that oversees/regulates prostitution.
Previous Player Character Cameo  -  Player Character of Game A 1 cameos in Game A 2.
Heroic Build  -  Superpowers = bodybuilder body (male or female) or slim yet curvy body (female).
Color Coded Armies  -  Different sides of a war are Color-Coded for Your Convenience.
Swarm Of Rats  -  Rats that gather together in disturbing quantities.
No Export For You  -  A TV show, movie, video game, etc. was never released to that part of the world.
I Am Song  -  A song where a character's personality or other traits are established.
Invisible Celebrity Guest  -  There's a celebrity here... you just can't see them completely.
Circle Of Friendship  -  Friends form a circle, then beat the villain up.
Pointy Ears  -  Ears with points.
Biography A Clef  -  The biography of an artist living the life of the art he will produce.
Double In Law Marriage  -  A related pair of characters each marry another of a different pair of related characters.
Drop In Character  -  A friend of The Hero who frequently pays visits to their house to hang out.
Inconsistent Coloring  -  The colors used for characters change often, either due to Art Evolution or not.
The Horseshoe Effect  -  Extremism of both Left-wing and Right-wing are Not So Different.
Holding Back The Phlebotinum  -  A useful device or method that could solve the problem is withheld for plot reasons.
Mistaken For Pedophile  -  Hilarity Ensues when a character is mistaken for a child molester (often due to Double Entendre or Not What It Looks Like).
Sunk Cost Fallacy  -  The more resources invested, the harder it is to stop.
Bilingual Dialogue  -  Characters speak different languages but understand each other.
Mister Big  -  The man in charge is definitely not large.
Giant Foot Of Stomping  -  When a huge foot crushes things.
Magic Powered Pseudoscience  -  That inventor isn't a genius, his gadgets run on his superpowers.
Adaptation Decay  -  An adaptation of the work is distorted between media.
Hairy Girl  -  A female character doesn't shave, which is against the norms.
Contrived Coincidence  -  Something really unlikely happens but nobody acknowledges how unlikely it is.
The Complainer Is Always Wrong  -  Not agreeing with the majority will bring scorn on you.
Dem Bones  -  Animated bone constructions.
Identically Named Group  -  A distinct group of characters who all happen to have the same name.
Sorting Algorithm Of Evil  -  Each Big Bad is bigger and badder than the last.
Worlds Strongest Man  -  One who is stronger than any other.
Aspect Ratio Switch  -  The picture width changes in the middle of the story.
Rebuilt Pedestal  -  A Broken Pedestal gets fixed.
Amazonian Beauty  -  A female character that's portrayed as attractive because of or despite being muscular.
Memory Palace  -  Memories represented as locations.
Bioweapon Beast  -  A creature genetically altered or created from scratch for combat.
Reckless Pacifist  -  A character that vehemently refused to kill their assailants but nevertheless tend to endanger the lives of others (enemies, allies, or bystanders) quite often.
Super Gullible  -  A character that's very naive and easy to fool.
Stoic Woobie  -  Needs a hug, but hides it.
Feed The Mole  -  Giving an enemy spy false information.
Faux Symbolism  -  Symbolic imagery that doesn't relate to the themes in the story.
Training The Gift Of Magic  -  Magic is a skill, but not everyone can master it.
Player Guided Missile  -  You, the player, can control a missile.
Trans Equals Gay  -  Transgender people are presented as gay people who have "leveled up".
Non Indicative Difficulty  -  A "harder" difficulty is actually easier.
Volleying Insults  -  Verbal sparring.
Confused Question Mark  -  ?.
Mystery Episode  -  An episode where the characters must solve a mystery.
Faux To Guide  -  The incompetent instructing the ignorant.
Historical Hero Upgrade  -  Fictionalized portrayal of a historical figure as more heroic than their real-life counterpart.
World Building  -  (verb): The act of constructing a fictional world.
Deletion As Punishment  -  A video game threatens to permanently delete your saved data if you make certain choices.
Rule Of Scary  -  It doesn't have to be realistic as long as it's scary.
Too Spicy For Yog Sothoth  -  Victim is so unpleasant that the monster no longer wants anything to do with them.
Homeless Hero  -  This describes heroes who do good...while living in squalor.
Malicious Misnaming  -  Deliberately insulting someone by calling them something other than their actual name (often a derisively modified variation of it).
Suit Up Of Destiny  -  The Hero puts on an important suit/costume for the first time.
Crushing The Populace  -  Ruling a recently conquered territory by brutally repressing it.
Only One Plausible Suspect  -  Due to Mystery Fiction conventions, there's only one character who can turn out to be the culprit.
Precision Crash  -  An object falling uncontrollably from very high up has a disproportional chance of striking an important or heavily-populated target.
Sacrificial Lamb  -  Minor character is there just to be killed early and show that Anyone Can Die.
Cell Phones Are Useless  -  Fictional cell phones often die, break, or lose a signal in situations that can otherwise be easily solved by them.
We Will Not Use Stage Make Up In The Future  -  We'll use surgery instead.
Our Spirits Are Different  -  The original spirit myths couldn't keep all the details straight, either.
It May Help You On Your Quest  -  Irrelevant object that turns out to be useful in the end.
Stop Trick  -  Stop rolling, change/add something to the same shot, then start rolling again with just that.
Logic Bomb  -  Logic errors cause computers to explode.
Adaptational Skimpiness  -  A character shows off more skin in an adaptation.
Spinning Out Of Here  -  Teleportation is achieved via spinning.
Serial Prostheses  -  A character has their body parts progressively replaced by prosthetics.
Talk About The Weather  -  The smallest of talk: talking about the weather.
Genre Shift  -  A series changes from one genre to another, either for a short period or forever.
Disposable Sex Worker  -  Want a murder victim the audience doesn't have to care about too much? Use a prostitute.
Raised By Orcs  -  Born by normal people, raised by evil guys, but they mostly don't turn as bad as those who raise them.
Translation Convention  -  The characters speak in a foreign language, but the audience hears it in their own language for their benefit.
Lawful Neutral  -  A character alignment that values order over freedom, justice, or malice.
One Steve Limit  -  Having two or more characters bear the same name in the same story is usually not recommended.
Apocalypse Not  -  Civilization has survived surprisingly well or has rebuilt itself somewhat After the End.
Real Robot Genre  -  Realistically constructed giant robots.
The Summation  -  The mystery is explained.
Boom Headshot  -  Aim for the head for massive damage!
Spoofing In The Rain  -  Raining is a good time to sing.
Wicked Cultured  -  A smart and classy villain.
Unrated Edition  -  Marketing scheme in some home video markets which promises material not suited for theatrical release.
Cluster Bleep Bomb  -  Lots of swearing with all the swearwords humorously bleeped out.
Glorious Leader  -  A dictator's personality cult.
Snake Charmer  -  A man or woman who controls a snake using a flute.
Severely Specialized Store  -  Stores that only sell one thing.
Percussive Pickpocket  -  It's yours.
Pimp Duds  -  The stereotypical flashy attire of a pimp.
Dinner Deformation  -  Eating something so big that your body takes the shape of the object.
Gay Bar Reveal  -  What appears to be a normal bar just so happens to be a gay bar.
Military Brat  -  The Child of a military person.
Emergency Weapon  -  A weak, but always-functional weapon you can fall back on if you're out of ammo.
This Is For Emphasis Bitch  -  You can't say "exclamation point", but you can say "Bitch", Bitch!
Second Law Of Metafictional Thermodynamics  -  Writers love to kill things. Emotionally unstable writers love to kill more things.
Lover And Beloved  -  An older and younger character of the same-gender (usually male) share a mentoring relationship and overt/implied romantic love.
Player Generated Economy  -  As multiplayer games progress, players find standards on buying and trading items which complement each other.
Mark Of The Beast  -  A physical mark indicating a character is associated with a malevolent being.
Perpetual Frowner  -  A character who rarely, if ever smiles.
Silk Hiding Steel  -  Proper Lady with a steel core.
Useless Boyfriend  -  Badass Decay when you are around your Action Girl/Magical Girl friend.
Close Range Combatant  -  You can handle things up close, but you're useless at a distance.
Power High  -  Superpowers make you feel good (literally).
Burn Baby Burn  -  Destroying something with fire for a dramatic disposal.
Powerful Pick  -  Pickaxe used as a weapon.
Tuck And Cover  -  Covering someone with your body to protect them from an explosion or something similar.
Barbie Doll Anatomy  -  The artist depicts a naked character, but leaves out their genitals and/or nipples to make the nudity age-appropriate.
Audience Awareness Advantage  -  The audience forgets that characters are not always privy to the same information that the viewer is.
Trademark Favorite Food  -  A certain type of food that a character LOVES.
Expressive Hair  -  Change in a character's hair (sometimes small, sometimes significant) reflects their mood.
Not Distracted By The Sexy  -  Someone is showing a lot of skin. No one notices. No one cares.
Gayngst  -  Being miserable because you're gay.
Of Course Im Not A Virgin  -  A character explains that they are, in fact, not a virgin.
Amnesiacs Are Innocent  -  People who lose their memory are as innocent as children.
Beary Friendly  -  Bears are NOT bad news at all. Unless...
Arson Murder And Admiration  -  One villain starts listing the flaws of the other villain, then complimenting their merits.
Kitsch Collection  -  A large collection of objects well maintained by the collector.
Tiny Tyrannical Girl  -  What this girl lacks in height, she more than makes up for in bossiness. Much more.
