Karmic Protection  -  If a villain wasn't outright malevolent in his actions, he'll get off with a gentler punishment.
Juxtaposed Halves Shot  -  A stock pose where half of two characters sides/faces are juxtaposed to or beside each other.
Sdrawkcab Name  -  A character whose name is meaningful when spelled backwards.
Sliding Scale Of Continuity  -  Scale for measuring how much continuity a work possesses, and by extension how easy it is to enter mid-stream.
Femme Fatale  -  A sultry, highly attractive, but rather manipulative woman.
Just Joking Justification  -  It's okay to offend someone as long as it was just a joke all along.
Evil Feels Good  -  An evildoer states that they enjoy doing evil.
So Crazy It Must Be True  -  Nobody could think up a lie that ridiculous.
Awesomeness Is Volatile  -  Explosions from too much awesomeness.
Did You Think I Cant Feel  -  Insults still hurt The Stoic or The Pollyanna, even if they don't show it.
Not Helping Your Case  -  Your response to the accusation makes you look more guilty.
Perpetually Protean  -  A shapeshifter in a constant state of transformation.
Retargeted Lust  -  A has sex with B after being sexually aroused by C.
Giant Mook  -  They may be bigger and tougher, but they're still just a Mook.
Last Plan Standing  -  Only one scheme in a Gambit Pileup goes off without a hitch.
Life Embellished  -  Though basically true to the author's life, the story conspicuously diverges at some points.
Time Passes Montage  -  A montage demonstraing a Time Skip.
That Thing Is Not My Child  -  A character is used to create offspring in a way that makes them refuse to have anything to do with their scion.
Dead Mans Hand  -  A poker hand with two aces, two eights, and any other unmatched card. Usually a Death Signal.
Better If Not Born Plot  -  Wait a minute. Everyone's lives are better because I wasn't born?!
Supernaturally Young Parent  -  A parent(s) looks younger or slightly older than their child due to supernatural causes.
Double Standard Rape Sci Fi  -  Rape isn't considered rape if fantastically impossible means were involved.
The Hero Dies  -  The protagonist dies at the end of the work.
Muggle Foster Parents  -  When someone with powers of any sort is raised by people who don't have such powers.
Dead Sparks  -  A relationship where the love has run dry, but the couple remain together out of complacency.
Lampshade Wearing  -  Wearing a lampshade as a hat. Typically indicates intoxication.
Saving The Orphanage  -  A heartless businessman wants to destroy a wholesome institution to show how evil he is.
Locked In The Bathroom  -  A character locks themselves in the bathroom to avoid a difficult conversation, or to delay their capture by pursuers.
Gorgeous Gorgon  -  The terrifying monster is actually a beautiful woman.
World Of Snark  -  Everybody is a wiseass or a dumbass.
Satanic Archetype  -  Evil character modelled after the Devil.
Creator Recovery  -  A creator becomes happier, and their work becomes less dark as a result
Alien Sky  -  Sky that clearly shows that the action does not occur on earth.
Hospital Paradiso  -  A character is given the opportunity to transfer to a dream version of their job, but feels it would be a breach of integrity to do so.
Haunted Technology  -  A literal ghost in the machine.
Ursine Aliens  -  Aliens with a bear-like body.
Ascended Extra  -  A background or minor character becomes a major character.
Men Of Sherwood  -  A competent support team.
Just Eat Gilligan  -  A very simple action would solve all the story's problems, but they don't do it because there'd be no plot.
Deceased Fall Guy Gambit  -  Pinning the blame on the dead person.
Noble Shoplifter  -  One who takes wares from a store and leaves payment without the seller's knowledge.
Dating Service Disaster  -  Online dating isn't reliable.
Token Nonhuman  -  The only main character who isn't human.
Non Residential Residence  -  A character's dwelling technically doesn't count as a house.
Solve The Soup Cans  -  A bizarre and irrelevant puzzle that has the sole purpose of blocking a player's progress.
I Cant Dance  -  This character thinks they've got all the wrong moves.
Shell Shocked Veteran  -  A war veteran suffering from PTSD.
Bad To The Bone  -  Wanna know exactly what's gonna happen next? This song should tell you.
Re Cut  -  An alternate version of a film.
Casting Gag  -  Actor's role reflects something from their real-life history or previous roles.
Smart Jerk And Nice Moron  -  An intelligent Jerkass gets paired with a Kindhearted Simpleton.
Speed Run Reward  -  Speedrunning gets you something.
Creepy Changing Painting  -  A weird painting that changes when nobody's looking at it.
Emo Teen  -  Most likely to wangst.
Love Confessor  -  X tells Y they're in love with Z. Z is not told.
Sarcastic Clapping  -  Clapping slowly to express sarcasm.
Rod And Reel Repurposed  -  A fishing rod being used for something besides fishing, such as a weapon or non-fishing related tool.
Opinion Myopia  -  How can anyone feel differently about this than I do!?
Pastiche  -  A work done In the Style of... another artist.
Shiny Sense  -  Ooh! Something shiny! I bet it's an item I could use!
High School Rejects  -  People you knew long ago are now working low-end jobs.
Powers That Be  -  Almighty, powerful, and invisible forces.
Innocent Inaccurate  -  A naïve or misinformed character tells what they think is the truth.
Recap Episode  -  An episode that recaps events from the current season.
Tuckerization  -  A fictional character who's named after someone the author knows.
Last Chance Hit Point  -  Attack that inflicted enough damage to kill a character instead leaves them with just one HP.
Behind A Stick  -  A character disappears behind an object that would logically be too skinny for them to hide behind.
Symbolic Serene Submersion  -  A person floats passively upon or underneath the water. It's symbolic!
Moonburn  -  Where one gets a sun tan or sunburn from exposure to things other than the sun.
The World Is Always Doomed  -  There's always something threatening the world.
Adrenaline Makeover  -  Adventure (and falling for the hero) turns a plain girl pretty.
Undercrank  -  Filming at a slower rate so the playback is sped up.
Medieval Prehistory  -  Fantasy settings that contain prehistoric life.
Pink Mist  -  A fine spray of blood, usually signifying someone's death.
Collective Groan  -  Group response to failed attempts at clever or funny.
Not So Forgotten Birthday  -  Character thinks everyone forgot their birthday, only to find out everyone remembered and had a Surprise Party ready.
Kill It With Ice  -  For when frostbite is the best path to dead monsters.
Phlegmings  -  Drool between someone's teeth is scary.
Game Of Nerds  -  Nerds love baseball (if they love any sport at all).
Video Phone  -  A phone with a video screen.
Charlie And The Chocolate Parody  -  An episode that's a parody of Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (usually the 1971 movie version specifically).
Perpetually Shiny Bodies  -  Everyone's skin displays an unusually high luster for eye-candy purposes.
Siblings Wanted  -  A child asks their parents for a younger sister or brother, often to the parents' chagrin.
Judge Jury And Executioner  -  The authority to punish law-breakers on the spot.
Love Epiphany  -  Suddenly realizing you love someone.
Future Me Scares Me  -  Looking at a future version of oneself. Not pretty.
Loads And Loads Of Characters  -  A work has too many cast members to count.
Replay Value  -  Things that can help a game be more replayable.
Shark Man  -  Half man, half shark, all trouble.
Unspoken Plan Guarantee  -  A plan's chances of success are inversely proportional to the amount of detail the audience is given about it.
Bad Guys Play Pool  -  Pool players tend to be evil.
Hypnotic Eyes  -  If you look into this person's eyes you'll be hypnotized.
Punishment Box  -  A shed or box that prisoners are put in to give them extra punishment.
You Already Changed The Past  -  By using Time Travel in an attempt to change the past, a character realizes neither the past nor the future can be changed. Almost always by causing the event they intended to change.
Eunuchs Are Evil  -  Men who are castrated are evil.
Bird People  -  A race of bird-headed humanoids.
Cosmetically Advanced Prequel  -  Work set earlier has a more advanced aesthetic due to improved production technology.
Indestructible Edible  -  The food is quite durable and appears the same way.
Regenerating Shield Static Health  -  When a barrier recovers automatically from damage. Health/hull does not.
Greater Scope Paragon  -  The being/force/ideal that the good guys are fighting for which doesn't have a direct role in the story.
You Fool  -  Use of the word "fool" as a singular insult.
Weapon Of Mass Destruction  -  Weapons of indiscriminate devastation on a major scale.
Wild Child  -  A child that lives in the wild and/or behaves like an animal.
Exhaustion Induced Idiocy  -  A lack of physical energy results in a lack of brain power.
Swallow The Key  -  A character swallows a key to keep what it was used for locked away.
Heroic Neutral  -  A character wants to be left alone, but will jump into to the scene if there is danger aboard.
Frothy Mugs Of Water  -  Alcoholic drinks are (often clumsily) turned into non-alcoholic drinks on kid- or family-friendly media.
Thank The Maker  -  An intelligent being created by a human attributes religious significance to its creator.
Due To The Dead  -  Giving the dead proper funerary rites is virtuous, while the opposite—desecrating their remains—is disgraceful.
Dying Vocal Change  -  A character's voice dramatically changes as they die.
Working On The Chain Gang  -  Chained convicts doing backbreaking work.
Wild Card  -  Character with an unpredictable allegiance.
Biting The Hand Humor  -  Making fun of the people who sign your paycheck.
Foot Dragging Divorcee  -  Only half of the couple wants a divorce.
Heroic Ambidexterity  -  The ability of great warriors to excel in combat with either hand.
Prone To Tears  -  It's easy to make this character cry.
Gift Of The Magi Plot  -  Two people sell one of their own possessions to buy gifts for each other. However, those gifts are useless to the other without the possession that they sold.
Cut Apart  -  Two consecutive shots, believed to be multiple perspectives on the same event, are revealed to be two completely different things.
Video Game AI  -  Video game sub-systems that govern Non-Player Character behaviors.
Doomsday Clock  -  The trope: A clock that counts to nuclear doomsday.
Silent Credits  -  When the credits of an episode with a sad ending are played without music (or even any sound at all.)
From Bad To Worse  -  Thought that was as bad as it got? Guess what...
Ominous Walk  -  Few better ways exist to intimidate the enemy than a slow walk.
The Chessmaster  -  A character who is exceptionally skilled at manipulating events to their advantage using gambits that rely on subtlety and misdirection (much like in Chess).
Why Couldnt You Be Different  -  A parent wants their child to be different from how they are.
Nemesis Weapon  -  A hero and their Arch-Enemy have signature weapons that also contrast one another.
Blood Upgrade  -  Bleeding from being hit serves as a Berserk Button.
Ban On AI  -  We used to make machines that could think and create. We are much wiser now.
That Poor Plant  -  Want to show how nasty a substance is but don't want the moral dilemma of testing it on an animal or human? Use it on a plant!
Two First Names  -  Character's surname is also used as a given name.
Skeleton Key  -  A master key that unlocks any lock or door.
Glamour  -  The magic of illusionary attraction.
Finger Poke Of Doom  -  A seemingly weak attack (such as a finger poke) that does much more damage than you'd think.
Convenient Decoy Cat  -  The hunter is distracted by a cat (or other small animal), getting the hunted away.
Mad Lib Thriller Title  -  A Thriller title which follows a specific pattern of "The + meaningful noun or name + noun with political or symbolic connotations" to represent an enigmatic story.
Cry Cute  -  Tears makes a normally unpleasant character (usually a Jerkass or Tsundere) adorable.
Stood Up  -  Two characters plan a date, but one of them doesn't show up.
Heroic Canines Villainous Felines  -  Good doggy, bad kitty!
Blue With Shock  -  Bluish face symbolizes horror.
Conscription  -  Refusing to join the army is illegal.
Too Clever By Half  -  Insufferable Genius who screws up because they know they're smart.
Blind People Wear Sunglasses  -  Sunglasses used as a visual shorthand for blindness.
Gusty Glade  -  Video game area in which high winds hinder, or help your progress.
Hyperspeed Ambush  -  Using faster-than-light travel to take an enemy by surprise.
Big Sleep  -  A character dies with their eyes closed.
Spiteful Spit  -  A character spits on another, usually on the face, as way of expressing contempt or disrespect.
Everybody Must Get Stoned  -  Most or all of the cast gets exposed to some kind of substance that alters their behavior.
Senior Creep  -  Elderly person with a detestable (and usually age-induced) appearance and/or personality.
It Wasnt Easy  -  Using the sentence "It wasn't easy" as a Hand Wave.
Chaotic Evil  -  A character alignment combining self-interest and freedom to cause harm to others.
Speaks In Binary  -  A character that speaks in binary code.
Black Cloak  -  Conspicuous outfit intended to conceal identity.
Wonder Woman Wannabe  -  A character designed to be an expy of Wonder Woman.
Alas Poor Scrappy  -  The fandom now feels sorry for The Scrappy.
Diseased Name  -  Someone gets named after a disease.
I Was Just Passing Through  -  A rival saves a hero's life and makes an excuse for it.
Bizarre Seasons  -  The Seasons of the setting are... contrary to the predictable pattern.
Third Person Person  -  John Doe refers to himself in the third-person.
In Harms Way  -  Life's boring unless I'm putting myself in danger.
Sympathetic Sue  -  A Mary Sue meant to Appeal to Pity.
Color Blind Confusion  -  Color blindness gets brought up in an important situation.
The Hermit  -  A character who chooses to be alone.
What Measure Is A Humanoid  -  It's not Interspecies Romance if they look human.
In The Future Humans Will Be One Race  -  In the future, humans will be the same shade of brown-ish.
Holler Button  -  Press X to call out for someone.
Pull The Thread  -  Playing along with a lie until the liar can't keep up the act.
Human Focused Adaptation  -  An adaptation of a work that puts little focus on major non-human characters in favor of major or completely new human ones.
Deliberate VHS Quality  -  Usage of VHS quality when digital formats are easily accessible, typically in The New '10s or later.
Poorly Disguised Pilot  -  An episode of a TV show intended to serve as a pilot for a proposed spinoff which, thus, abruptly focusses to the main characters of said would-be spinoff. (Success rates vary.)
Lava Is Boiling Kool Aid  -  Lava depicted as a simplistic red liquid having little more viscosity than regular water.
Do Wrong Right  -  Getting scolded not for doing something wrong, but for doing it the wrong way.
Contagious AI  -  An Artificial Intelligence can easily expand by downloading itself into other computers.
Decoy Protagonist  -  The story begins with someone who's not the actual protagonist, who will appear later.
Clueless Mystery  -  A mystery that the reader isn't given enough information to solve.
Say It With Hearts  -  Seeing this symbol (♥) in a sentence indicates a Squeeish and/or a sing-song tone to the voice.
Antiquated Linguistics  -  Old patterns of speech get a new lease on life.
Jump Physics  -  In video games, jumping is just short of flight.
Street Urchin  -  A poor child who spends most of their time on the streets doing what they can to get by.
And Thats Terrible  -  The author tells you outright that the villain is evil. That's a bad thing.
World Of Chaos  -  This place is weird.
Noticing The Fourth Wall  -  The characters notice they're in a work of fiction.
Intangible Theft  -  A metaphysical concept, like _______, is stolen.
Enter Stage Window  -  Sneaking into a house through an open window.
Chest Burster  -  A nasty creature within one's body leaves it in a nasty way.
Poor Predictable Rock  -  Someone always uses the same kind of tactics/abilities and thus is easily countered.
Fake Guest Star  -  A regularly appearing actor is credited as a guest star.
Everything Is Smashable Area  -  A specific location with a lot of destroyable scenery.
Humans Are Divided  -  Humans don't tend to be as united as other sapients.
Supernatural Is Purple  -  The color purple is associated with magic/the supernatural.
A Real Man Is A Killer  -  Kill something to prove your manliness.
Dishing Out Dirt  -  Elemental Powers over earth/stone.
Wide Eyed Idealist  -  Rose-colored glasses. Jade-colored world.
Twitchy Eye  -  One shaky eye equals one character on the edge.
Gag Lips  -  A character is given oversized lips for humor, to mock European civilization's obsession with plump pouters, or simply to invoke a Gonk.
Did Not Die That Way  -  A character discovers they've been lied to about how a loved one died.
Deconstructed Character Archetype  -  Deconstruction of an Archetypal Character type, e.g. The Hero, The Lancer, Anti-Villain, etc.
God Never Said That  -  A statement about a work is attributed to its creator, even though the creator never said anything of the kind.
Everything Sounds Sexier In French  -  How a foreign language sounds with a specific feel, like how French is seductive.
In Spite Of A Nail  -  Changing one small thing in the past doesn't necessarily mean the entire future will change.
All In A Row  -  You've gained quite the following. And they're all walking behind you in a line.
Cooking Duel  -  An epic duel in some quirky, mundane task.
Performance Anxiety  -  A character is unable to use their abilities under pressure.
Capture The Flag  -  Trope: "The enemy team has your flag!"
Sinister Tango Music  -  Tango music used for creepy characters or scenes.
Orphaned Punchline  -  A punchline with no setup.
Stink Bomb  -  A weapon that releases a nasty odor once it hits something. Or someone.
Dance Of Despair  -  Dancing in an attempt to cope with a distressing situation.
Highly Visible Password  -  Password isn't asterisked out when typed.
The Silent Bob  -  A character who talks a lot, just not with their voice.
Puppet Permutation  -  Transforming into a puppet.
Interquel  -  An entry to a series that takes place between two previous entries or during a Time Skip from a previous entry.
Evil Makeover  -  Hero + Spikes of Villainy = Darker and Edgier
All Powerful Bystander  -  A being with god-like powers doesn't intervene and fix a situation despite being completely capable of doing so.
Cast From Hit Points  -  Superpowers that consume Life Energy.
Shoegazing  -  Dreamy, drone-heavy Alternative Rock.
Sgt Peppers Shout Out  -  A group shot that parodies the titular Beatles album.
Suspiciously Specific Sermon  -  Religious service is oddly plot relevant.
Every Scar Has A Story  -  A character's scar is pivotal to their Back Story.
Wrestling Doesnt Pay  -  Wrestler has another job as part of his gimmick.
Cyber Ninja  -  Ninjas that are robots, have robot-parts or use advanced tech.
Boyfriend Bluff  -  One character rescues another from harassment by posing as their boyfriend/girlfriend.
First Law Of Gender Bending  -  Gender Bender Rule #1: Once you're a girl, count on staying one.
F Minus Minus  -  Your assignment is so bad, a mere F can't convey the lowness of its quality.
Sex With The Ex  -  A character has sex with someone they broke up with.
Doujinshi  -  The Japanese term for independently-published work of all kinds, most prominently manga. Roughly equivalent to the English term "indie".
The Reveal  -  The big dramatic plot twist or revelation.
Love Freak  -  A nutcase that spouts out lovey-dovey nonsense.
Ancient Tomb  -  An old burial chamber.
Crack Is Cheaper  -  Geek hobbies can get addictive. And expensive.
Forensic Accounting  -  Cracking secrets by tracing their finances and paperwork.
Adaptive Ability  -  The clear ability to adapt to certain things after experiencing it once.
Try And Follow  -  Escape by doing something your pursuer won't or can't.
That One Disadvantage  -  One single disadvantage ruins a character or weapon from the game entirely.
Virgin Shaming  -  Virginity is a negative trait.
Settled For Gay  -  A straight girl decides to marry/settle down with her gay male friend.
Sour Prudes  -  A stuffy and self-righteous prude.
Evil Hand  -  A limb (usually a hand) suddenly has the power of possessing someone.
Innocent Soprano  -  In musical theater, the innocent romantic heroine has a high singing voice.
Sympathetic Sentient Weapon  -  A sentient weapon is unhappy with their role.
Have A Gay Old Time  -  Terms that meant something else back then now meaning something that can allow old phrases using it to be taken out of context.
Other Me Annoys Me  -  A character is irritated by an alternate version of themselves.
Must State If Youre A Cop  -  Police officer is under obligation to answer truthfully when asked if they're a cop.
Exposed To The Elements  -  Characters are underdressed for cold weather, but this is ignored.
All Monks Know Kung Fu  -  Christian monks are martial artists.
The Teaser  -  A scene that plays before the opening credits.
Beta Bitch  -  The Alpha Bitch's Number Two.
Marionette Motion  -  Moves like a puppet.
The Philosopher  -  A person who talks about what is true and how to live life.
Celebrity Is Overrated  -  Being famous isn't that great.
Gag Haircut  -  A bad haircut is Played for Laughs.
Everything Except Most Things  -  Any of them, except for an overwhelming amount of them.
Tactical Suicide Boss  -  If the boss didn't do this one particular attack, he'd be invincible.
Position Of Literal Power  -  Your new job gives you superpowers.
Busmans Holiday  -  When characters do the same thing on vacation as they do in everyday life.
Baby Talk  -  Babies make specific sounds when talking.
Creepy Gas Station Attendant  -  The attendant of a gas station is horrifically portrayed as malevolent.
Only One Name  -  Rather than having a first name and a last name, a character has only one name.
Affectionate Parody  -  Parody by the loving fans.
Despair Gambit  -  Ruin everything around the person to indirectly destroy them.
Creepy Cute  -  Adorable and unsettling at the same time.
Fighting Clown  -  A comedic fighter with a humorous, wacky style of combat.
Dracula  -  Seminal vampire and aristocrat from Transylvania tries to settle in London. Opposition ensues.
Lava Adds Awesome  -  Lava makes everything better. Well, for the audience, anyway.
Handicapped Badass  -  Don't poke fun at this cripple. They'll cripple you.
I Can Still Fight  -  A badly injured character insists on joining the battle or continuing to fight.
Not Quite Forever  -  Someone says "forever". They don't mean it. If they do, they don't get it.
Running Both Sides  -  Both sides of a conflict are secretly being run by the same organization or person.
Deus Sex Machina  -  Plot device that requires sex to work.
Tongue On The Flagpole  -  Licking a frozen pole and causing your tongue to get stuck.
Trope  -  The recurring conventions in fiction, and the subject of a moderately obscure encyclopedia website.
Cuteness Overload  -  Something incredibly cute causes you to either explode or freeze in place.
Undistributed Middle  -  A is C and B is C, therefore A is B.
Casualty In The Ring  -  Professional fighter dies or is crippled in the ring.
Inn Of No Return  -  It might not be a good idea to stop here.
Would Harm A Senior  -  The character is willing to harm the elderly.
Civilization Destroyer  -  An entity that brings an entire civilization to its knees.
Chick Magnet  -  He's not trying to attract hordes of women, it's just that they find him irresistible.
Signed Up For The Dental  -  The job sucks, but the benefits compensate for it.
Useless Protagonist  -  The protagonist can't (and doesn't) do anything.
Yes Virginia  -  ...There is a Santa Claus.
Character Outlives Actor  -  Character portrayed by late actor doesn't die, just ceases appearing on-screen.
Wardrobe Wound  -  Alice damages Bob's outfit. Bob does not take it well.
Party In My Pocket  -  No matter how many characters you control, you only see one.
Mentor Ship  -  Shipping a mentor with their protégé.
Genocide Survivor  -  Someone who lived through an attempt to destroy their kind
Mercy Kill  -  Killing someone who is literally better off dead.
Dynamic Character  -  A character who grows, changes, and showcases more layers as the story progresses.
Terror At Make Out Point  -  A couple wanting some romantic alone time are killed by the Monster of the Week.
Wedding Smashers  -  Literal wedding crashing.
Balloon Belly  -  A character gets fat (often in the shape of a balloon) in a short amount of time.
Money Is Not Power  -  Your money can't save you this time!
Shallow Parody  -  A spoof that isn't really an accurate portrayal of the work being spoofed.
Assassination Sidequest  -  A type of sidequest that requires you to kill a specific target stealthily.
Dont Tell Mama  -  A character doesn't want their family to know about their criminal activities.
Two Scenes One Dialogue  -  Two or more characters are talking about the same thing in separate locations.
Sneakers Of Sneaking  -  Shoes or feet which make little to no sound when walking.
Ominous Adversarial Amusement  -  You've won! So, why does your opponent seem so amused?...
Despite The Plan  -  The plan goes horribly wrong, but the heroes achieve their goal anyway.
Ink Suit Actor  -  Animated character looks like their real-life actor.
Assimilation Plot  -  Everyone becomes one entity.
Crappy Holidays  -  A supposedly happy holiday sucks.
Creative Closing Credits  -  Something interesting or fun (or both) happens during the closing credits.
Decade Dissonance  -  Coexisting societies have differing levels of technology.
Deadly Lunge  -  Sudden zombie leaping attack.
Schmuck Banquet  -  It's luxurious! I wonder who left it here?
Big Red Devil  -  The standard depiction of Satan and demons in general. Being large, red-skinned people, with horns. Satyr legs and wings optional.
Sketchy Successor  -  The new (hereditary) leader is far less competent than the old one was.
B Roll Rebus  -  That thing where national news runs a story, and over every noun they show footage of what that noun is, even if it's a metaphor.
Pocket Dimension  -  A tiny "sub-universe" too closely connected to the main one to be considered its own dimension.
Gainax Ending  -  Intentionally confusing ending.
Growing With The Audience  -  Series/Franchise matures as its audience matures.
Gag Series  -  Jokes before all else.
Experience Entitlement  -  Someone's experience with a certain phase contributes to their lack of maturity.
Triple Nipple  -  A man with more than two nipples.
The Fashionista  -  Character's focus is fashion.
Pom Pom Girl  -  Rallies crowds during contests, or at least looks the part.
Water Wakeup  -  Waking someone up by using cold water.
Unrequited Tragic Maiden  -  An unrequited female love interest who often meets a tragic end.
Hash House Lingo  -  Terminology used in a (usually low-end) corner diner.
Unwanted Rescue  -  The Hero saves someone who didn't want to be saved.
Sailor Earth  -  Fan Work Original Character made to fit a canonical character pattern.
Sorkin Relationship Moment  -  Someone gets fed up after their ex and friend hook up and calls them out.
Shake Someone Objects Fall  -  A character is grabbed by someone and shaken repeatedly, causing several things to fall out of their pockets or hiding places.
Ventriloquism  -  Throwing your voice.
Bizarro Episode  -  This episode completely falls out of the series.
Scenery Porn  -  Obscenely detailed and ornate background.
Ladyella  -  The name format "X+ella".
Taxman Takes The Winnings  -  A character receives a large sum of money, only for almost all of it to go to taxes.
Colonized Solar System  -  The rest of the Solar System being colonized by humanity.
Face Stealer  -  Shapeshifter that steals another person's appearance.
Landslide Election  -  A Curbstomp Battle, with ballots!
No Such Thing As HR  -  When you're at work, all bets are off.
Glam Rap  -  Rapping about cars, bling, drugs, money, and whores!
Adjective Noun Fred  -  Short Description Laconic Wiki!
Unblockable Attack  -  You can't block or defend against this attack if it hits you.
Buffy Speak  -  Dialogue indicating the awareness of an element and the inability to put it into words on the spot. Often includes the word "thing".
Hes Just Hiding  -  When fans refuse to accept that a character is dead.
Band Land  -  Generic music-themed area.
Fauxdian Slip  -  Someone disguises what they just said as a Freudian Slip.
Level Grinding  -  Endless battling to gain more XP.
Smart People Play Chess  -  If someone's playing chess, they must be smart.
Did You Get A New Haircut  -  Something is clearly wrong with a character, but another character asks if a completely mundane, unrelated change is whats up.
Giving Up On Logic  -  The situation has become so strange, surreal, or stupid that someone gives up trying to make sense of things.
Big Blackout  -  A large-scale power outage.
Rapid Fire Yes  -  A lot of yes's shot out at a fast pace.
Paper Fan Of Doom  -  Convenient when you need to beat the heat, or other people.
Health Damage Asymmetry  -  A significant difference between the health and damage values for friendly and enemy units.
Mac Guffin Blindness  -  Unable to recognize the MacGuffin for what it is.
Angelic Aliens  -  Aliens are pretty!
Vampire Hickey  -  Two punctures left on the neck of a vampire bite victim.
Artifact Of Power  -  Fabricated Phlebotinum.
Catholic School Girls Rule  -  For instant sexy just add schoolgirl uniform.
The Charmer  -  A decent guy with noble and chivalrous instincts who knows how to treat ladies right; give him five minutes, he'll wrap you around his little finger.
All Lowercase Letters  -  stylistically avoiding capital letters.
Fake Out Fade Out  -  Oh good, the show/song is ending...whoops, not yet!
The Church  -  An organized religious group.
I Didnt Mean To Turn You On  -  A character unintentionally arouses someone they weren't trying to arouse.
The Man They Couldnt Hang  -  Someone who has survived a hanging.
Mixed Ancestry  -  Someone who is descended from two or more different ethnicities/species.
The Scream  -  AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!
Drop In Nemesis  -  An enemy that kills you with little to no warning if you make a mistake.
Love Chart  -  Official relationship chart.
Army Of Thieves And Whores  -  An army made up entirely of the worst of the worst. And badasses, too.
Wolfpack Boss  -  Boss battle with multiple enemies that fight as a team.
Different States Of America  -  The United States, but not as you know it.
Reaction Shot  -  A shot done to show someone's reaction to something.
Big Shut Up  -  Character yells "Shut up!"
Ugly Cute  -  A character with a blatantly grotesque appearance is still found attractive because and/or in-spite of it by fans.
Far Side Island  -  A tiny island with a single palm tree.
Your Approval Fills Me With Shame  -  Villain praises hero; Hero is upset.
Beware Of Vicious Dog  -  This dog is pure evil and hates everyone.
Regular Caller  -  They get a new call frequently.
Like Father Unlike Son  -  Child who is the opposite to their parent.
Overalls And Gingham  -  A character who wears gingham and/or overalls to signify a rural background or upbringing.
Minor Living Alone  -  A child under eighteen seemingly lives alone without an adult for some reason.
Good Is Not Soft  -  A character is presented as good and pleasant, but is harsh when punishing evil.
A Twinkle In The Sky  -  Something tiny in the sky with Audible Gleam.
Model Couple  -  They were paired for this ad because their looks complement each other.
Final Battle  -  If the good guys lose this battle, they lose the war.
No Blood For Phlebotinum  -  Resource war.
Sigil Spam  -  It's fun to put your logo on everything.
Cartoon Juggling  -  The different ways juggling is portrayed in cartoons.
Black Republican  -  A black character that has right-leaning or conservative beliefs.
Loony Fan  -  An obsessive fan, who creeps out even their idol.
Idiosyncratic Difficulty Levels  -  Using labels other than "Easy", "Medium" and "Hard".
Misplaced Names Poster  -  When the names on a movie poster don't line up with the matching actors.
Army Of Lawyers  -  A big group of suited mooks normally used for intimidation.
Bad Guy Bar  -  The Evil Counterpart's go-to hangout.
Min Maxing  -  Only the "important" skills go up; all others get left in the dust.
Casual Kink  -  A character can discuss their kinks with absolute nonchalance, or their kinks are depicted as minor, neutral parts of their personality.
Its The Journey That Counts  -  What is most valuable isn't the goal, but the effort it took to reach it.
Contract On The Hitman  -  An assassin is marked for death by the very people they work for.
Amulet Of Concentrated Awesome  -  This thing is the source of all your powers. Better not lose it.
Alien Animals  -  Aliens that look exactly like Earth animals.
Shoot Your Mate  -  A hero under disguise is tasked with killing his captive friend.
Feet Of Clay  -  Trope: Someone generally believed to be incredibly talented is revealed to be completely incompetent.
Suddenly Obvious Fakery  -  Something that should be obviously fake just by looking at it appears real to the audience until its true nature is revealed to the characters, at which point it changes for no reason.
Scary Librarian  -  Librarians are scary, and freak out if you do something bad to books.
Battle In The Center Of The Mind  -  Internal conflict against a malicious force is presented visually as a physical fight.
Conflicting Loyalty  -  Being loyal to someone or something causes problems with loyalty towards something else.
Klatchian Coffee  -  Drink this and you will go into OVERDRIVE!
Promotion Not Punishment  -  You get rewarded for breaking rules.
Scheherezade Gambit  -  Don't kill me; I'm too entertaining.
Crisis Point Hospital  -  An overwhelmed and under-resourced hospital on the brink of disaster.
Save The Princess  -  Rescuing a Damsel in Distress is the core plot of the story.
Clown Car Grave  -  An absurd or limitless amount of enemies spawning out of a disproportionately smaller area.
Sequel Difficulty Drop  -  The sequel to a Nintendo Hard Game is considerably easier, to appeal to a wider audience.
Underground Monkey  -  Another version of a previous enemy.
Emoticon  -  ASCII characters used to represent emotions/faces.
Privately Owned Society  -  A society where nearly everything is owned by private individuals or groups.
Jeanne D Archetype  -  A young Action Girl in military combat who is viewed as an inspiring symbol of the cause.
Dislikes The New Guy  -  A character doesn't like a new member of the team.
Time Travel For Fun And Profit  -  Exploitation of time travel for personal gain.
Greek Chorus  -  In-story commentators.
Critical Dissonance  -  The audience and critics disagree with each other about the quality of a work.
Age Cut  -  A Match Cut or special effect which cuts/dissolves to a character several ages older.
Wrench Wench  -  Female mechanic.
The Man Behind The Curtain  -  A feeble person hides behind a terrifying persona.
Sorting Algorithm Of Threatening Geography  -  As the characters continue on their quest, the landscape itself gets steadily more threatening and bizarre.
Video Game Sliding  -  Though rarely realistic, sliding maneuvers serve many different purposes in video games.
Weather Control Machine  -  A machine used to control and change the weather. Somehow, they can often cause earthquakes and tsunamis as well...
Armor Piercing Response  -  Answer even more poignant than the question being asked.
Insistent Appellation  -  A character keeps addressing (or not addressing) another in a specific manner, despite alternative suggestions.
Adaptational Abomination  -  Characters are made into Eldritch Abominations in-adaptation.
Mistaken Confession  -  A suspect confesses to the wrong crime.
Hindenburg Incendiary Principle  -  The tendency of a story featuring an airship to also feature an improbably spectacular airship crash.
Good Times Montage  -  Montage where the characters enjoy themselves together.
Clueless Aesop  -  An aesop about a controversial subject isn't handled with enough nuance.
Sweet Home Alabama  -  Come on down to good ol' Southern U. S. of A. and meet down-to-earth, friendly folks who'll play you some nice music and be polite as punch!
Preschool Show  -  Shows geared at the demographic of 1-6 year olds.
Freestate Amsterdam  -  In Hollywood's Amsterdam, you can do whatever the hell you want.
Fartillery  -  FIRE IN THE A-HOLE!
Expy Coexistence  -  An Expy and the character, person, or thing they're based on both exist in the same universe.
New Ability Addiction  -  An urge to use a skill or new piece of kit for the sake of using it.
Mugged For Disguise  -  A character steals someone else's clothes and disguises themselves as that person.
Locked Room Mystery  -  A seemingly unsolvable crime or mystery.
Up To Eleven  -  Exceeding the previous maximum, to an exaggerated degree.
Black Screen Of Death  -  While two or more characters are fighting, the screen goes black (or white, but black is more common).
Railroad Plot  -  Something gets in the way of a big construction project. This something must be destroyed to complete the project.
Blood From Every Orifice  -  Blood coming out of mouth, nose, ears and/or eyes.
Informing The Fourth Wall  -  Video game characters talk to themselves to inform the player.
Synchro Vox  -  Failed pseudo-animation technique that involves putting an actor's mouth over a character's face to save the need of animating lip-syncing.
Never The Selves Shall Meet  -  If you meet up with your future self, the universe explodes.
Weight Taller  -  Gaining weight (via fat or muscle) makes you taller.
Giving Them The Strip  -  Shedding an article of clothing to avoid a decisive attack or escape a normally inescapable grab.
Dreary Half Lidded Eyes  -  Eyes drawn with a horizontal line straight through them, which symbolize boredom, nonchalance, tiredness, and lust.
Tomato Surprise  -  A fundamental fact about the setting or characters is known to the characters, but withheld from the audience till the last minute.
Silver Fox  -  A visibly old character who is portrayed as attractive.
Cheer Up Episode  -  One character is down in the dumps, and the other characters attempt to make them happier.
Anatomy Of The Soul  -  Souls depicted as not a single indivisible thing, but being made up of several components, usually "life force", "mind" and "vessel".
Special Edition Trailer  -  A trailer that is prepared to be shown with a specific movie, sometimes acknowledging the movie you're about to see.
Not Actually His Child  -  A parent learns that their child is not biologically their own child.
Hello Again Officer  -  A character accidentally runs into an antagonistic police officer more than once.
Hire The Critic  -  The creator commissions someone who disliked something they did to participate in a later work.
Fantasy Americana  -  The Americas as a fantasy setting.
Likes Older Men  -  They prefer mature men.
Old Media Are Evil  -  Older media is seen as bad.
Moment Of Weakness  -  A devastating lapse in judgement by an otherwise sensible character.
Cant Get Away With Nuthin  -  Any form of rule-breaking results in Tempting Fate.
Fight Scene Failure  -  Conspicuously faked fight scenes.
Lampshaded The Obscure Reference  -  Someone makes an obscure reference, and then admits that it was obscure.
Now You Tell Me  -  A character isn't given a warning until after they do the thing they were warned against.
Genuine Imposter  -  A character is revealed to actually be the person they supposedly were impersonating.
Sealed Evil In A Teddy Bear  -  An evil entity is sealed within an incongruously cute body.
Watch The Paint Job  -  Expensive, exotic, beloved cars will get damaged — or destroyed.
If It Tastes Bad It Must Be Good For You  -  Yucky food = Healthy food
Balls Of Steel  -  A character is immune to Groin Attacks.
Pushed At The Monster  -  Letting a monster or dangerous animal attack your companions in order to save your own skin.
Headless Horseman  -  A mythical figure who is traditionally depicted as a man upon horseback who is missing his head, either looking for its head, or looking to decapitate others in vengeance.
False Confession  -  Someone confesses to a crime that they didn't commit.
A Little Something We Call Rock And Roll  -  Time-travelers show the people of the past/future how to be hip in the present day.
Ragin Cajun  -  Louisiana Badass (often, but not always, from New Orleans).
No Punctuation Period  -  Absolutely no punctuation is used
Fake Assassination  -  Someone puts a hit out on someone else, but sets it up to intentionally fail.
Defeat By Modesty  -  Winning by disrobing your opponent.
Real Time Weapon Change  -  Switching out your weapons in the midst of a heated battle without pausing.
Cast Incest  -  Actors who play family members in a work also date in real life.
Pretend Were Dead  -  If you act like zombies, real zombies won't attack you.
Literal Minded  -  Not understanding figurative language.
Exotic Backdrop Setting  -  The setting is foreign to the audience, but none of the characters are.
Out Giving Birth Back In Two Minutes  -  Step 1: Go to hospital.Step 2: Make baby.Simple as that.
Win To Exit  -  Characters must win to exit a virtual reality.
Dork Age  -  The commercial and/or critical downturn of a franchise for a period of time, often marked by repeated failed attempts to keep it fresh.
Aside Comment  -  Fictional characters making comments at the Fourth Wall.
Breaking The Glass Ceiling  -  Characters who are the first of their gender/ethnicity/etc to achieve something.
Order Is Not Good  -  In Order Versus Chaos, Order is presented as evil, oppressive anti-freedom tyranny.
Wig Dress Accent  -  Put on a wig, a dress, change your accent—voila! A disguise!
Shotgun Wedding  -  A (usually forced) marriage occurring upon the discovery that the groom impregnated the bride or just had sex with her.
Exposition Already Covered  -  A character is about to explain something but another character beats them to it, much to their frustration.
Bus Crash  -  Character leaves the show and then dies.
Recursive Acronym  -  An acronym in which one of the letters (usually the first) stands for the acronym itself.
Metafictional Title  -  The title of the story is also the title of some in-universe document important for the plot.
Nostalgia Filter  -  The belief that things from the past are automatically better than things from the present.
Battle Harem  -  An Amazon Brigade who follows One Guy.
Geographic Flexibility  -  New locations added as the plot requires them.
Throw Away Guns  -  Screw reloading, I have more guns!
Its A Small World After All  -  Planet equals small town, leading to Contrived Coincidences.
God Modders  -  A blatant cheater in an online video game who thinks that hacking the game, abusing glitches, etc. is fair.
Why Dont You Marry It  -  Character suggests that if other character likes something so much, maybe they should just marry it.
Deadly Bath  -  Someone dies while taking a bath.
Nothing Left To Do But Die  -  An immortal or unaging character kills themselves out of ennui.
Weaponized Ball  -  Someone uses balls as a weapon.
Significant Wardrobe Shift  -  Changes in a character's wardrobe reflect Character Development.
Eat The Bomb  -  A character eats a bomb, seriously.
Animation Bump  -  The animation suddenly becomes better.
Stop Being Stereotypical  -  Stop making the rest of us look bad!
Softer And Slower Cover  -  A Cover Version of a song that is not as loud, usually done more acoustically or as a Dark Reprise.
Couldnt Find A Pen  -  Writing with something besides a writing utensil, such as a message written in blood.
Gentle Touch Vs Firm Hand  -  Harmony Versus Discipline applied to the way we influence and guide others.
Friend Versus Lover  -  A character's Love Interest and friend fight over them.
Primal Fear  -  Trope: Everyone is afraid of this.
Background Music Override  -  The battle, victory or other normal situational music in a video game is overridden with a special theme.
Hold Up Your Score  -  Judges hold up signs bearing scores in response to something a character did.
But Not Too Black  -  The entertainment industry and media favoring and highlighting the lighter skinned/Eurocentric looking members of a racial minority.
Your Head A Splode  -  Heads explode!
Now Its My Turn  -  Wh-What? "You've shown what you can do. Now I'll show you what I can do." KAPOW!!!
Combatant Cooldown System  -  Video game combat system where each combatant is put on a "global" cooldown of varying duration after acting.
Snow Means Cold  -  You can tell how cold the weather is by how much snow suddenly appears.
Not So Small Role  -  A big-name actor plays a minor character, only for the character not be minor after all.
Sealed Room In The Middle Of Nowhere  -  Now, get out of that!
Master Of The Mixed Message  -  Does this character like them or not? No one can tell.
Never Bring A Knife To A Gun Fight  -  Firearms are superior to bladed weapons.
Kiss Kiss Slap  -  Two people kissing turns into two people fighting or having an argument.
Effective Knockoff  -  A competent imitation of a successful product.
Braids Beads And Buckskins  -  All fictional Native Americans wear the same outfit style as if all the 500 nations are the same.
Grenade Launcher  -  Cool Gun that shoots grenades.
Worrying For The Wrong Reason  -  One character expresses some concern about a situation, another corrects them with a new concern.
Solo Character Run  -  A run in which the objective is to win with only one character.
Sprint Shoes  -  Grab this item or use this ability to increase your movement speed.
Zillion Dollar Bill  -  A MacGuffin of huge monetary worth.
Enigmatic Minion  -  An antagonist whose villainy, and true agenda, are ambiguous and never fully known.
Compensating For Something  -  Suggesting that grandiose display means small penis.
Reduced To Dust  -  Something, usually a person, gets destroyed and the only thing that remains is dust.
Trauma Inn  -  Sleep here to completely heal your entire party.
Villainous Friendship  -  Two villains share a friendship.
Perilous Old Fool  -  Too old to fight, but refuses to admit it.
Your Tomcat Is Pregnant  -  Pet confuses owner on what gender the pet is.
Heartbeat Soundtrack  -  Thub-thub... thub-thub... thub-thub...
Oppressive States Of America  -  The United States of America is presented as a brutal dictatorship.
The Loins Sleep Tonight  -  A character (usually a guy) cannot perform in bed.
Finale Title Drop  -  A Title Drop that happens in the finale, or in the final moments of a series.
Possession Burnout  -  Demonic Possession destroys the host body.
Internal Reformist  -  A character who is part of a corrupt system works to improve it or at least refuse to engage in wrongdoing.
Innocently Insensitive  -  Casually offends people without intending to.
Memetic Loser  -  A normally competent character's weaknesses are exaggerated in fanon, to the point where they become a walking punchline.
Why Wont You Die  -  Frustration formed from failure to vanquish one's foe.
The Law Of Fan Jackassery  -  If it's midway between "obscure" and "mainstream", its fans will be more vicious than fans of works at either extreme.
Nothing Up My Sleeve  -  A weapon up your sleeve.
Rock Me Amadeus  -  Sampling classical music for effect.
Spark Of The Rebellion  -  A small act of defiance against The Empire kickstarts a rebellion.
True Sight  -  The ability to perceive the truth, without illusions and subjectivity getting in the way.
Lead Drummer  -  Drummers who are the lead vocalist or notable Face of the Band.
Type Casting  -  Playing the same type of character in other series, films, or media.
Simplified Spellcasting  -  Casting complex spells quickly...sometimes with a caveat or two.
Caps Lock  -  CAPITAL LETTERS ONLY.
Rogue Protagonist  -  An old protagonist becomes the new antagonist in the sequel.
Parrot Pet Position  -  Pet rides on owner's shoulder.
Know When To Fold Em  -  A character who knows that, sometimes, giving up is the best option.
Ordered To Cheat  -  Character is directed to win/lose by underhanded means against their will.
Limb Sensation Fascination  -  A Character explores what their new limb(s) do.
Carnival Of Killers  -  Deadly mercenaries all targeting one character.
Foreboding Architecture  -  You can tell what's going to attack you judging by the level architecture.
Scary Black Man  -  A tall, physically imposing black man who is perceived as intimidating.
Orange Blue Contrast  -  Popular Color Contrast between the colors orange and blue — often used for movie posters.
Heavyworlder  -  Adapted to higher gravity worlds, these characters are stronger than normal
Crippling The Competition  -  Destroying an enemy or rival by physically crippling their ability to do what they are good at.
Newspaper Backstory  -  The background of the story and/or a character's backstory is told via a brief shot of newspaper clippings.
Fully Clothed Nudity  -  A character being seen in their underwear is treated as embarrassing or offensive, even though their body is still mostly covered.
Game Hunting Mechanic  -  A game allows you to hunt animals (Or analogues thereof) for materials or simply for fun.
Ponzi  -  A con that involves taking loans from multiple investors and paying them back with each other's money in order to procure much larger loans that the schemer can eventually embezzle.
Chased Off Into The Sunset  -  The story ends with one (angry) character chasing another.
Its Raining Men  -  Jumping out of a perfectly good (normally) airplane/Drop Ship over enemy territory.
Every Japanese Sword Is A Katana  -  They may be better, but they're not the ONLY Japanese weapons.
Muggle And Magical Love Triangle  -  Will you choose ordinary or magical?
Immune To Drugs  -  Drugs don't affect this guy.
Argument Of Contradictions  -  An argument that involves both sides just restating their opinion over and over, often rapid-fire, without actually providing a real argument or evidence.
Scavengers Are Scum  -  Scavenging animals in fiction are Always Chaotic Evil.
Monstrosity Equals Weakness  -  Being in a monstrous form actually weakens you.
Go For The Eye  -  Monster has one large, obvious eye. Shoot it.
Old Superhero  -  A superhero is old, and not as super as they once were.
Unintentional Period Piece  -  Works that were set in the Present Day when written are now regarded as Period Pieces.
Heel Face Turn  -  Bad guy turns good.
Overturned Outhouse  -  Outhouses and port-a-potties getting tipped over or destroyed, usually when someone is using it.
Pragmatic Villainy  -  A villain won't do something evil because it's against their best interest.
Foster Kid  -  An orphaned/abused kid sent to live with new guardians temporarily, for better or worse.
Jerkass Gods  -  The gods are Jerkasses or The Sociopaths.
Ultra Super Happy Cute Baby Fest Farmer 3000  -  Stereotypical sweet video game.
Smelly Feet Gag  -  Feet stink, and it's Played for Laughs.
Species Specific Afterlife  -  Different species have different afterlives.
Caretaker Reversal  -  After taking care of the patient, the caretaker gets sick and now the patient must take care of them.
Charlie Brown From Outta Town  -  An exiled face returns with a Paper-Thin Disguise.
True Neutral  -  A character alignment that does not lean much into good or evil, nor into order or chaos.
Token Robot  -  The only member of the group who is a robot or is fully robotic.
Embarrassing Last Name  -  Someone's surname embarrasses them.
Big Dam Plot  -  Destruction of a large dam for dramatic effect.
Appeal To Familial Wisdom  -  A character offers advice they say was given to them by their parent/relative.
Ominous Mundanity  -  A short, generic title or name for something is Played for Drama or Played for Horror.
A Taste Of Power  -  You get to Curb Stomp everything, but only for the first five minutes.
Poke In The Third Eye  -  Messing with people who are trying to scry against you.
Hiding Behind Religion  -  A character pretends to be religious to hide their true nature.
Covers Always Lie  -  Inaccurate box art.
Sword Over Head  -  A situation where the hero could finish off the defeated villain...but should he?
Heroic Mime  -  The Player Character never speaks.
Dumb Muscle  -  Almost all brawn. Almost no brains.
Space Jews  -  Aliens, animals, or monsters based on real-world racial stereotypes.
Unsportsmanlike Gloating  -  The character wins and lets the losing character know it in arrogant fashion.
Recurring Dreams  -  A dream (or nightmare) that highlights its importance by repeating itself for a given character.
Weirdness Magnet  -  A tendency to attract the impossible.
Zip Mode  -  An item or other element in a video game that lets you move faster towards your destination.Warp to bottom
Title Theme Tune  -  The title of the show is said in the theme song.
Firehouse Dalmatian  -  Dalmatians in fiction are frequently seen working with firefighters.
Offerings To The Gods  -  Making physical offerings to deities.
Easy Exp  -  The game gives you experience points for mundane tasks.
Something Something Leonard Bernstein  -  A song where the lyrics move so quickly, or are so garbled, that you know only the one phrase that is shouted clearly.
Lotus Eater Machine  -  A dream world meant to trap someone from reality.
Word Salad Humor  -  Humor delivered through nonsense.
Hold Your Hippogriffs  -  Replacing certain words of a common saying with a setting-specific terminology.
Written Sound Effect  -  Onomatopoeia, a.k.a., writing out a sound effect.
Bishie Sparkle  -  Pretty people sparkle, especially in anime.
Mother Nature Father Science  -  Women are nature-oriented and caring, whereas men are science-oriented and industrious.
Insanity Defense  -  The crazier you are, the less likely you'll get the death penalty.
Bayonet Ya  -  A Knife Nut's favourite out of the Gun Accessories.
Tap On The Head  -  K.O.ing others via blunt force trauma to the head, and the victim waking up without any permanent injury.
Shame If Something Happened  -  A nonchalant threat, usually disguised as a casual comment. Or not.
Animation Lead Time  -  It takes a while to make animation, so sometimes they date themselves, or release at an unfortunate date, by the time they air.
The Runner Up Takes It All  -  The person who comes second or worse in a Reality Show gets more out of it than the winner somehow.
No Mac Guffin No Winner  -  The story ends with no one getting the MacGuffin.
My Skull Runneth Over  -  The brain can run out of capacity, and this is bad.
Impoverished Patrician  -  Rich upper class who actually has little money.
Speed Sex  -  When sex only lasts a very short time.
Dodge The Bullet  -  Bullets are fast, but I'm faster.
Final Love Duet  -  A couple admits their love for each other in song towards the end of a musical.
Karma Houdini Warranty  -  Karma Houdini finally gets their comeupeance.
Transhuman Treachery  -  A human transformed into a monster chooses to be a monster.
Courtly Love  -  The old-fashioned, poetic way of pursuing a love interest.
Foolish Sibling Responsible Sibling  -  One sibling is a lackadaisical goofball while the other sibling is a dutiful hard worker.
Villain World  -  A setting controlled by the villains.
No Name Given  -  A person's name is never told.
Double Standard Rape Female On Male  -  Rape is not considered rape if done by a female to a male.
Our Vampires Are Different  -  You can call it whatever you want, it's still a vampire.
Mayincatec  -  Generic ancient Central/South American nation.
Hit Spark  -  A stylistic visual effect used for kinetic impacts, cuts, etc.
Girliness Upgrade  -  A tomboy becomes girlier as time goes on.
Post Kiss Catatonia  -  A kiss that leaves the kissee unresponsive and uncomprehending to their surroundings.
Gratuitous Japanese  -  Unnecessary usage of Japanese, desu.
Starter Equipment  -  Basic gear available at the start of the game.
Space Battle  -  Dogfights and Naval Battles in space!
The Alleged House  -  A dilapidated, borderline-unlivable residence.
Standard Sci Fi Fleet  -  Space Navy ship classification.
Pro Human Transhuman  -  The more-than-human still cares about the regular humans.
Unreliable Illustrator  -  Accompanying illustrations don't match what's described in the narrative.
Guardian Of The Multiverse  -  The being who makes sure that The Multiverse is neither conquered nor destroyed.
Useless Item  -  This item apparently has a use for something. Too bad the developers didn't put that "something" in the actual game.
Regime Change  -  One government forcibly removes another government's leader to install their own proxy.
A World Half Full  -  Crapsack World, say hello to Earn Your Happy Ending.
Spider People  -  Spider-human chimeras; rarely very pleasant people.
Power Gives You Wings  -  Powerful characters have wings.
Whos Watching The Store  -  Even when a store should logically be open, all its employees can be away simultaneously.
All First Person Narrators Write Like Novelists  -  The first-person narrator relates more detail than an ordinary person casually relating a story would ever give.
Artificial Limbs  -  An artificial arm or leg that's just as good as the real one.
If Youre So Evil Eat This Kitten  -  A test to see if a character really is evil.
Wonder Child  -  A childless older person or couple receives a baby through supernatural means.
Misery Builds Character  -  Bad things can actually do you good. Even if you dont yet think so.
In The Back  -  Getting stabbed or shot from behind.
Rose Haired Sweetie  -  A girl with pink hair has a sweet and cheerful personality to match.
Bodyguard Betrayal  -  You're betrayed by the people who were supposed to protect you.
Hulk Speak  -  Character uses brutish speech pattern to illustrate a lack of intelligence.
All Is Well That Ends Well  -  Once things have ended well for a character, s/he's not bothered by all the hardship and suffering s/he went through to reach the happy ending.
Police Brutality  -  Bullies with badges.
God Save Us From The Queen  -  Evil and/or royally incompetent woman in charge.
Mana Shield  -  Using your Mana Meter to block damage.
Kicked Upstairs  -  Promoted to a higher position where you'll be out of the way.
Difficulty Spike  -  A game abruptly becomes much harder.
Handsome Lech  -  An attractive Casanova Wannabe.
Uplifted Side Story  -  When a concept originally intended as a side story is instead turned into the next mainline entry of the series.
Hopeless Suitor  -  Character likes someone whose love is either unrequited or ignored due to already being taken.
Befriending The Enemy  -  Being friends with an evil or antagonistic character in order to turn them good.
Explosive Stupidity  -  Mishandle explosives and get blown up.
Instant Waking Skills  -  Waking up from sleep with none of the grogginess that goes with it.
Never Give The Captain A Straight Answer  -  There's a problem that someone needs to know about, and that someone is asked to see it for themselves when giving a description would be more convenient.
Right Behind Me  -  One character insults or mocks another — with the other right near him.
Multiboobage  -  A woman with more that 2 mammary glands.
Soaperizing  -  When a series other than a Soap Opera takes time to develop character relationships rather than anything else.
Enmity With An Object  -  Hatred towards something that is unable to hate you back due to lack of consciousness and liveliness.
Catapult  -  A cat used as a projectile.
Rip Van Tinkle  -  How long was I asleep? I gotta go wee-wee!
Slow Transformation  -  A Metamorphosis that unfolds over an extended period of time and often between scenes.
Ancient Tradition  -  Benevolent ancient organization.
Franchise Zombie  -  The show continues on well past what the creator intended.
The Only One I Trust  -  The only trustworthy one.
Non Giving Up School Guy  -  That teacher will go through hell itself to make sure you don't miss class.
On The Next  -  A montage at the end of a work that shows scenes from the next that will be shown after it.
Bohemian Parody  -  A parody of Bohemian Rhapsody
Dramatic Gun Cock  -  *Gun cock* Shit's gonna get real.
Homemade Sweater From Hell  -  This cheesy, tacky sweater makes Baby Jesus cry.
False Flag Operation  -  Pretending to be from another country or organisation while fighting.
Snipe Hunt  -  Go find this non-existent thing.
Blackmail Backfire  -  A blackmailing attempt turns out badly for the blackmailer.
Harsh Vocals  -  Growled or shrieked singing, often in Extreme Metal bands.
Dungeon Punk  -  A heavily magical world where spells, enchanted artifacts, and magitek take the place of modern technology.
Big Breast Pride  -  A woman has (usually naturally) large breasts and is proud of them.
Zeppelins From Another World  -  Alternate histories produce zeppelins.
Nature Is Not A Toy  -  It's not nice to abuse Mother Nature.
Allegedly Free Game  -  If it's a free game, why do I have to pay real money for all this stuff?!
Rush Boss  -  A boss that hits hard and dies fast; the inverse of Marathon Boss.
Patrick Stewart Speech  -  A speech about humanity's strengths.
Inherited Illiteracy Title  -  A misspelling in a work's title reflects an in-universe misspelling.
Resource Gathering Mission  -  A mission where the primary goal is to gather resources rather than destroy the enemy.
Spin To Deflect Stuff  -  Spinning a rod to deflect projectiles.
Calling Parents By Their Name  -  For one reason or another, a child calls their parents by their names instead of "Mom" and "Dad" or something similar.
Conqueror From The Future  -  I have come to conquer you filthy past-lings.
Polly Wants A Microphone  -  Parrots in fiction that actually speak, instead of just meaninglessly repeating things.
The Reason You Suck Speech  -  A character delivers a speech to a second character that is designed to dissect that second character's flaws, weaknesses or failures.
Distant Duet  -  Two or more separate characters sing the same song in different places far from each other.
Germanic Efficiency  -  The Germans are very good at anything they do.
The Man Behind The Man  -  A bigger villain is revealed to be behind the actions of the original villain.
Ridiculously Long Phone Hold  -  A phone hold that literally lasts for hours or even days.
Self Defenseless  -  Self defense products are useless.
Periphery Hatedom  -  Something that gets a Hatedom from people it wasn't meant to appeal to.
Black Sheep  -  A character who doesn't fit in a fairly upright family.
He Went That Way  -  Distracting a pursuer by intentionally giving them bad directions.
Grand Theft Me  -  Person forced out of their body by someone who wants it for themselves.
Co Dragons  -  Villain's multiple right-hand men.
The Voiceless  -  A character who is capable of speech and presumably does speak is never shown doing so onscreen.
Foreign Language Tirade  -  Character starts angrily yelling in another language.
Instant Win Condition  -  Final Rule: If you do X, you win, regardless of all other rules.
Womb Horror  -  Horror with themes of parenthood, reproduction and childbirth-based Body Horror.
Holiday Mode  -  Video Game features that depend on the actual calendar date.
Ill Take Two Beers Too  -  When one character orders for two, so does the second.
Headache Of Doom  -  A headache is a symptom of something terrible.
Senior Sleep Cycle  -  Old people sleep randomly, usually when they're not supposed to.
Straw Feminist  -  A caricature of feminism who exists to be proven wrong.
Thinking Out Loud  -  A character expresses their though out loud, usually for the spectator's comprehension.
Aliens Made Them Do It  -  A couple hook up, at least temporarily, for bizarre external reasons.
One Last Field Trip  -  When a group of characters come of age or are about to come of age, they go back to somewhere important to them (or perform a childhood ritual) for the last time.
Eat Dirt Cheap  -  A character or species eats earthen materials.
Personal Raincloud  -  Sad characters have rain clouds above their heads.
Recurring Boss Template  -  Different game, same boss battle.
Dark Skinned Redhead  -  Red hair and dark skin indicate an exotic, energetic, and unpredictable character.
Pro Wrestling Episode  -  An episode involving wrestling.
Dumb Dodo Bird  -  Dodo birds are Too Dumb to Live.
Video Review Show  -  Online videos expressing opinions on a work (whether optimistically or not).
Gratuitous Russian  -  Inaccurate use of the Russian language.
Will Talk For A Price  -  Pay me and I'll talk.
Child Soldiers  -  Children made into soldiers
Training Stage  -  A stage in a Fighting Game or similar competitive game made to practice moves and combos in.
Hurricane Kick  -  Multiple, consecutive roundhouse kicks. Sometimes in the air.
Preemptive Shut Up  -  Telling someone to shut up even though they didn't get to talk.
Cassette Futurism  -  A future built on late 20th century analog technology.
Love Is In The Air  -  Mass Love Potion, usually airborne and with a touch of free love.
Personality Chip  -  Giving a robot or machine a computer chip capable of simulating emotions.
Gentleman And A Scholar  -  The intelligent expert who's attuned to the nuances of social etiquette.
Magical Girl Genre Deconstruction  -  Analyzing the Magical Girl genre and the common tropes to show up in it to expose its realistic assumptions, flaws, consequences and/or origins.
Lower Class Lout  -  A character who embodies negative stereotypes of the working class.
Mafia Princess  -  A mafioso's pampered daughter, niece or consort.
Psycho For Hire  -  Loves killing and torturing people, and getting paid for it.
Hypocrite  -  Espousing an ideal but not practicing it.
Siege Engines  -  War machines specifically built to tear down the wall.
Shockwave Clap  -  A clap that causes a shockwave.
Niche Network  -  A channel focused on one specific thing.
Reckless Gun Usage  -  A character unfamiliar with gun safety does something unsafe with a firearm.
Academy Of Adventure  -  A school of weirdness.
Mexican Standoff  -  Anyone uses their weapon, everyone dies.
Sukhomlinov Effect  -  Flashy outfits army loses to simple outfits army.
Vaudeville Hook  -  Hooked cane-like stick used to yank someone off the stage.
Animeland  -  The Theme Park Version of Japan, usually with tropes from Anime and Manga, or the occasional Sentai series or Kaiju movie.
Genetic Fallacy  -  Judging something by their origins rather than their contexts.
Living Relic  -  An ancient piece of history that just so happens to be a healthy living being.
Stiff Upper Lip  -  Brits are stoic in the face of danger.
Boy Meets Ghoul  -  A living being falls in love with an undead monster.
Were Still Relevant Dammit  -  Obvious, desperate, and frequently misguided attempts at keeping trendy, hip and young using Long Running media, especially if it's outdated.
Built With LEGO  -  It's made with plastic bricks and minifigures.
Ghostly Glide  -  Ghosts who float rather than walk, with their feet not touching the ground.
The Adjectival Superhero  -  A superhero gets an adjective to their name.
Virtual Soundtrack  -  Song cues embedded in a fanfic simulate a real soundtrack.
Dance Off  -  You. Me. Dance floor. We duel.
Surprisingly Improved Sequel  -  A follow-up is considered superior to the original, when the original was bad or mediocre.
Dont Fear The Reaper  -  Friendly personification of death.
Promoted To Love Interest  -  A platonic relationship between characters in a work is changed to romantic in an adaptation of the work.
Evil Sounds Raspy  -  The villain has a coarse, gruff voice.
Dueling Messiahs  -  Two heroes are at odds with each other due to their different views on how to save the world.
High Heel Hurt  -  Wearing high heels is painful and/or cumbersome.
No Infantile Amnesia  -  A character can remember events from before the age of three, sometimes even their own birth.
Action Film Quiet Drama Scene  -  A quiet scene in an action episode that gives it substance.
All Your Powers Combined  -  The powers particular to different characters exist within a single character.
Wicked Weasel  -  Weasels are sneaky, evil cowards.
Bamboo Technology  -  Characters cobble together modern technology out of improbably simple materials.
Xenofiction  -  Fiction that attempts to believably portray the thoughts, feelings and experiences of non-human characters.
Token Heroic Orc  -  A member of an Always Chaotic Evil race joins the heroes.
Morphic Resonance  -  No matter what form the shapeshifter takes, they still retain some identifiable traits of the original form.
Hannibal Lecture  -  Turning the tables on your interrogator via psychologically clever speech.
Mascot Mook  -  A Mook ends up as a Series Mascot.
Drop In Landlord  -  Landlord as a device to insert a wacky older character into a younger ensemble cast.
Triang Relations  -  13 permutations of the Love Triangle, for all your narrative needs.
Matricide  -  Character kills their own mother.
Takes One To Kill One  -  An entity's only weakness is a similar entity.
Dude Looks Like A Lady  -  A male character gets mistaken as female despite putting no effort to look feminine.
Title Please  -  A TV series's episode title(s) are never shown.
Dreaming Of A White Christmas  -  Snow at Christmas.
Energy Beings  -  Lifeforms not made out of matter.
Fantastic Fireworks  -  Fireworks can be shaped into anything the writers want. Why? Because it looks cool.
Heaven  -  Good afterlife place.
Muggle Best Friend  -  The supernatural protagonist has an ordinary sidekick.
Multiple Demographic Appeal  -  A work whose target demographic is "everyone".
Viler New Villain  -  A more evil villain to contrast with a more Likable Villain.
We Will Have Euthanasia In The Future  -  The right to die is a given 20 Minutes into the Future.
Tragic Mistake  -  One mistake leads to the character's downfall.
Phonymon  -  A parody of Pokémon and other such Merchandise-Driven Gotta Catch Them All To Be a Master Mons franchises.
Reincarnation Identifying Trait  -  A physical or personality trait is used to identify someone as the reincarnation of another character.
Domestic Appliance Disaster  -  An attempt at doing household chores goes horribly wrong.
Restart The World  -  This world sucks. Let's burn it all down and start over.
Red Eyes Take Warning  -  Red eyes mean that a character is evil or, at least dangerous.
Wacky Homeroom  -  Everyone in this classroom is just plain weird.
Narrative Profanity Filter  -  Stating that a character used profanity without saying the actual word(s) they used.
Shes A Man In Japan  -  A translation of a work changes a character's gender.
Literal Ass Kissing  -  Kissing someone else's buttocks to demonstrate humiliation and submission.
Picky Eater  -  Kids are fussy about their food.
All Love Is Unrequited  -  The romantic feelings of most or all characters are never reciprocated.
Mayfly December Friendship  -  A friendship between two people with very different lifespans.
Only Has Same Sex Admirers  -  A character who is hit on by people of the same gender, and never by the opposite gender.
Call Forward  -  Referencing events already shown to the audience but that haven't happened yet chronologically.
The Freelance Shame Squad  -  Someone does something embarrassing and everyone else immediately points at it and laughs.
Dead Guy On Display  -  The body of a dead character is put on display for others to gawk at.
Squish The Cheeks  -  When a character gets their cheeks squished against their face by a person or object.
Big Heroic Run  -  A character runs really, really fast to do something important.
Innocuously Important Episode  -  Subtle developments in one episode which lead to a big payoff later in the series.
The Mountains Of Illinois  -  Mountains in settings that don't have mountains in Real Life.
Brought To You By The Letter S  -  Associating someone with a letter.
Dance Battler  -  Is he fighting or dancing? (Both.)
Special Effect Failure  -  Obviously fake effects.
Documentary Of Lies  -  A documentary that uses verifiably false information to make its point.
World Wrecking Wave  -  A global-scale wave of magic that leaves destruction in its wake.
Spontaneous Weapon Creation  -  A character has the ability to materialize their weapon instantly when the situation calls for it.
Not Making This Up Disclaimer  -  Something sounds so ridiculous that the author has to state it's not made up.
Snicket Warning Label  -  A warning to stop viewing this story while it still looks like it has a Happy Ending. Now!
Lifes Work Ruined  -  A character spends years working on a goal/project, only for it to be completely ruined.
Bring My Brown Pants  -  A character soils themselves in fright.
The Living Dead  -  An actor failing to properly appear as a lifeless corpse on camera.
Batman Parody  -  A character clearly designed as an Expy of Batman.
Consuming Passion  -  Eating people has sexual undertones/is heavily sexualized.
Enemy Summoner  -  Enemy summons other enemies to fight.
Dehumanization  -  These are not really people, they are therefore disposable.
Rocket Tag Gameplay  -  Everyone is a Glass Cannon.
Silent Majority  -  The majority of people who consume a media don't actively talk about said media.
Riches To Rags  -  A person who was once rich and/or famous loses or gives up all their wealth and becomes simplistic or fades to obscurity.
Fairy Dragons  -  Small dragons with fairy-like insect wings.
Who Names Their Kid Dude  -  Character has a weird name and other characters often remark on it.
Zoom  -  The series: Kids do fun stuff requested by viewers. The trope: Moving the camera closer or farther away as the scene dictates it.
Springs Springs Everywhere  -  Video games are full of springboards.
Cannot Talk To Women  -  Men are unable to talk with the women of their dreams.
Teleportation Rescue  -  Someone teleports in-and-out to rescue someone quickly.
Beware My Stinger Tail  -  Tail with something dangerous on it.
Empowered Badass Normal  -  A Badass Normal gains superpowers later on.
Combination Attack  -  Multiple characters perform a more powerful attack by using two of their attacks at the same time or in unison.
Thats What She Said  -  A joke claiming that the sentence said before it is a praise during sex.
Be All My Sins Remembered  -  Character believes that they're unworthy of praise because of misdeeds.

Dumb Jock  -  Great athlete, but not the brightest bulb in the box.

Eye Glasses  -  Glasses that behave like actual eyeballs.

Sharpened To A Single Atom  -  An Absurdly Sharp Blade which is precisely one molecule or one atom wide.

Animal Talk  -  A separate language for Nearly Normal Animals.
Canon Name  -  Character without a given name is given one in a newer installment of the series.
Uncommon Time  -  Most songs have three, four, or sometimes two or six beats in a measure. Some don't.

Planet Heck  -  Using Hell as a video game level.

Vicariously Ambitious  -  A character chooses to be the kingmaker rather than the king.
I Just Want To Be Normal  -  This character thinks that whatever makes him different is a curse.

Roaring Rampage Of Revenge  -  Revenge with quite the body count.
Armies Are Evil  -  All military factions are bad guys.
Anonymous Ringer  -  A Historical Domain Character who is never explicitly identified by name as the person they're obviously supposed to be.
Bad Santa  -  Trope: Santa is evil.
Kaleidoscope Hair  -  A character's hair changes color repeatedly.
Empty Shell  -  Alive on the outside, dead on the inside.
Three Amigos  -  For the trope: The Hero has two best friends of different genders.
Golem  -  Magical constructs created and powered by magic.
Jesus Taboo  -  A work of fiction uses religious imagery but otherwise has nothing to do with that religion.
Crate Expectations  -  Video games are full of crates. Break them.
Sleep Mode Size  -  Characters look cute and Super-Deformed when they're depowered.
Sim Sim Salabim  -  The Theme Park Version of India.
Funny Foreigner  -  A character hailing from another continent, planet, or galaxy, is a source of comedy.

Acronym And Abbreviation Overload  -  TMSWEC* Too many shortened words equals confusion.
Enemy Without  -  Evil force inside someone escapes.
Remember That You Trust Me  -  A character is reminded that he trusts his friends.

Facial Profiling  -  Artist exaggerates facial features endemic to races besides their own.

Love Is A Drug  -  Love is treated like a drug addiction.
Shining City  -  A city so perfect that it usually glows.
Empty Room Until The Trap  -  The room looks empty... Until you investigate further to reveal the danger.
Role Reprise  -  Actor is called on to play one of their old characters in a new series.
Ride The Lightning  -  Using electricity as means to travel.
Settle For Sibling  -  A character marries the sibling of their unrequited Love Interest
Hair Of Gold Heart Of Gold  -  A blonde person that is pure and innocent.
Thud And Blunder  -  Heroic Fantasy with the emphasis on the action and the fighting, lots of artistic license, and... not a lot else.
Honorary Princess  -  Princess In Name Only.
Creepy Stalker Van  -  Stalkers, pedophiles, and serial killers drive vans.
Gun Accessories  -  You can add stuff to your gun to make it more awesome.
Teenage Wasteland  -  A world where the children rule over the adults, if they exist.
Late For School  -  A character is seen running late for school.
Monster Threat Expiration  -  The more often a given enemy appears, the less of a threat they become.
You Cannot Kill An Idea  -  Man is mortal, but ideas live on.
The Snark Knight  -  A world-weary character finds everyone worth snarking at, themselves included. Dishes out barbed quips with a poker face.
Spaceship Girl  -  A feminine spaceship avatar.
Manic Pixie Dream Girl  -  An upbeat young woman whose love gives the brooding male hero a new lease on life.
Five Man Band  -  One leads, one contrasts, one thinks, one lifts, and one keeps the four others from killing one another.
