I Want You To Meet An Old Friend Of Mine  -  A guest appearance by an actor who previously worked with a regular cast member.
What Would X Do  -  Asking yourself what someone else would do in a certain situation.
Cosy Catastrophe  -  The world ends, but life goes on without angst.
Pretender Diss  -  When a wannabe tries to fit in, they're bound to be scorned by the REAL thing at least once.
Totally Not A Werewolf  -  Not everyone who transforms into a wolf is actually a "werewolf".
Its The Only Way To Be Sure  -  It's gotten out of control! Destroy the entire area!
Acquired Poison Immunity  -  Taking poison over time to become immune.
Arms Dealer  -  The one about someone who sells guns.
The Tokyo Fireball  -  A city (usually Tokyo) is annihilated horribly. Then it gets rebuilt in a short period of time.
No Biological Sex  -  A creature that has no defined gender or sex.
One Up  -  Grab this item for another chance if you fail in a Video Game.
Reminder Of Impossibility  -  Telling someone they can't logically do something immediately causes them to fail.
Historical Character Confusion  -  A character gets one Historical Domain Character mixed up with another.
Opening The Sandbox  -  After the first, linear portion of the game, the game finally lets you go wherever and do whatever you want.
Injury Bookend  -  An injury causes a debilitating condition which is soon "cured" by a similar injury.
Big Damn Heroes  -  A dramatic rescue by the heroes.
Mobile Fishbowl  -  An aquatic character brings water with it when traveling out of water.
Only Electric Sheep Are Cheap  -  We cannot afford natural goods in the future.
Long Title  -  The story has a really long title.
Agony Beam  -  An ability that directly induces pain in the victim.
Living On Borrowed Time  -  Character prolongs life via artificial means.
Power Metal  -  Thrash Metal's Lighter and Softer and more energetic sister genre, often talks about heroes, legends and myths.
Door Handle Scare  -  Close-up on a turning door handle to build up suspense
The Power Of Creation  -  The magical power to create physical objects from other material or nothing at all. Or a super-science equivalent, etc.
Mook Horror Show  -  Bad-guy-fighting scene plays out as though the hero is a horror-movie monster.
Far East Asian Terrorists  -  Terrorists who live in The Far East.
Nerves Of Steel  -  Calm and collected at all times.
Had To Come To Prison To Be A Crook  -  Sending someone to prison makes them more of a criminal than they were before.
Beautiful Void  -  Oddly empty, yet somehow peaceful location.
Replacement Scrappy  -  Old favorite is replaced. Fans are pissed.
Historical Domain Character  -  People from history that show up in a lot of works.
Kryptonite Is Everywhere  -  Almost everyone has access to your Kryptonite Factor, severely damaging Willing Suspension of Disbelief.
Circus Synths  -  Synth/electronic music associated with circuses, carnivals, clowns, etc.
Mandatory Unretirement  -  Character has to do the job they gave up.
Napoleon Delusion  -  An insane character thinks he's Napoléon Bonaparte or some other famous person.
Rings Of Death  -  Weapons shaped like hula hoops.
Anticlimax Boss  -  A boss that ends up much easier than expected, despite anything the plot may imply.
Et Tu Brute  -  Betrayal hits hardest when it's someone you love.
Instant Thunder  -  Thunder is heard at the same time as the lightning strikes.
Upside Down Blueprints  -  A building is made wrong by following the instructions... which are backwards
Tailor Made Prison  -  A prison made specifically for a single person.
Tragic Dream  -  A character has a dream that can never come true.
Darwinist Desire  -  Choosing a mate based on the genetic fitness of your potential offspring.
Dyson Sphere  -  Genuinely enormous spherical objects.
Resurrected Romance  -  Deceased Love Interest comes Back from the Dead.
The Generalissimo  -  The tinpot military ruler of a third-world dictatorship.
Appliance Defenestration  -  A character chucks their broken/annoying tools out the window.
Readings Are Off The Scale  -  Power equivalent to Infinity minus one.
Landmark Of Lore  -  A location that is filled with lore or places that have been the center of lore
Two Decades Behind  -  A work that is set in the present day comes across as anachronistic through the inclusion of out-of-date elements.
Faux Paw  -  Imitating a cat by gesturing with your hand like a cat paw.
The Computer Is Your Friend  -  AI is a Knight Templar.
CIA Evil FBI Good  -  Federal police force = good guys; national intelligence agency = bad guys.
Dark Fic  -  Fan Fic with much darker tone and content than its source material.
Hula And Luaus  -  The Theme Park Version of Hawai'i
Broken Tears  -  Crying indicates emotional breakdown.
Ridiculous Future Sequelisation  -  In-Universe long runner runs for really long.
Cool Cat  -  Cats portrayed as hip.
Genre Turning Point  -  A work redefines the genre it occupies.
Token Minority  -  Adding a character of a different ethnicity, gender or age to the cast in order to make the piece of media more diverse.
Anomalous Art  -  Works of fine-art with supernatural properties.
Rival Final Boss  -  After dealing with the real threat, the protagonist finishes things with their rival.
Linked List Clue Methodology  -  Each clue hints to where the next clue is until the solution is found.
Seemingly Profound Fool  -  If you don't know he's The Fool, you'll think he's a genius.
Carpet Of Virility  -  A hairy chest, either meant to create a sense of disgust or masculine awe.
Crisis Crossover  -  A crossover that involves all the characters and locations in The 'Verse in a single storyline.
Good Old Fisticuffs  -  Your average Joe can beat up people with just his streetwise, unwavering two fists.
Reference Overdosed  -  A work loaded with Shout Outs and homages.
Plucky Comic Relief  -  A character whose main purpose is comedy.
GIRL  -  The pesky stereotype that girls on the internet are actually men.
Defiant Captive  -  Just because they've been captured doesn't mean it's too late to put up a fight.
Psychic Nosebleed  -  Powerful psychic abilities cause epistaxis.
Paparazzi  -  A media worker (most often a photographer) who will go to any lengths to get a story about someone, no matter how underhanded their methods or how life-ruining the story may be.
Silly Rabbit Idealism Is For Kids  -  Growing up equals becoming cynical.
In Case Of X Break Glass  -  A gag where a glass case contains something for a specific emergency, and a character breaks it when that emergency occurs.
You Get What You Pay For  -  The cheaper the item, the worse it is.
Written By The Winners  -  History is biased in favor of the victors.
Detention Episode  -  An episode with the (school-aged) main characters stuck in detention. Hilarity Ensues.
Cast From Stamina  -  Bodily energy that usually used in physical activities.
The Lopsided Arm Of The Law  -  Police Are Useless except when going after The Hero.
The Mockbuster  -  Nothing spells "blatant knockoff" like one of these movies.
Animal Reaction Shot  -  Even the dog reacts.
Inflating Body Gag  -  A character's body inflates like a balloon, usually Played for Laughs.
Single Minded Twins  -  Twins act as one.
Ding Dong Ditch Distraction  -  Doorbell/knocking prank.
Romantic Runner Up  -  The third wheel of the Love Triangle.
Hollywood Kiss  -  Inaccurate fictional portrayal of kissing as overly simple.
Now Let Me Carry You  -  Alice is usually dependent on Bob, but now Bob is dependent on Alice.
Just Desserts  -  Major villain gets eaten alive, preferably by a massive monster.
Evil Sorcerer  -  Black Magic-using wizards and witches.
The Hard Hat  -  A hat concealing some form of head protection.
Table Space  -  A small number of people sit at a very large table as far apart as possible.
Superman Substitute  -  A character clearly designed as an Expy of Superman.
Rationalizing The Overkill  -  A character sees their extreme punishment on another character as justified.
Failure Hero  -  A hero defined by their constant failures.
Talking Down The Suicidal  -  Talking a character out of killing themselves.
The Kid With The Remote Control  -  Someone has complete control over some hulking monstrosity.
Allohistorical Allusion  -  Some version of a big event in our timeline, also happened in alternate timeline.
Drill Sergeant Nasty  -  I WILL TURN YOU INTO REAL SOLDIERS EVEN IF IT KILLS YOU, MAGGOTS!
Floating In A Bubble  -  Character in an actual bubble, for any number of reasons (but usually for travel).
Love Obstructing Parents  -  Parents who interfere with their children's personal romantic relationships.
Eat That  -  Eat something gross, such as a bug, and (maybe) get rich!
Un Paused  -  When someone gets interrupted in the middle of something, they resume right where they left off when they continue, from the part where they were interrupted at.
Beam O War  -  Sustained energy attacks meeting in the battle like a super-powered arm wrestle.
A Birthday Not A Break  -  A character goes through a terrible event, even though it's their birthday.
Unscrupulous Hero  -  An exceedingly ruthless, yet otherwise well-meaning, Anti-Hero.
Searching The Stalls  -  Systematically searching for someone hiding in a bathroom stall.
Middle Eastern Terrorists  -  Terrorist who are based in the Middle East.
Small Taxonomy Pools  -  Only well-known organisms, especially animals, show up in fiction.
Survivorship Bias  -  Lots of people had the same start as the protagonist, took the same chances, and failed. Their stories don't get told.
Smart Bomb  -  A consumable item or other limited-use action that wipes out all onscreen enemies.
Fourth Wall Mail Slot  -  When fictional characters communicate with their real-life fans.
Nepotism  -  If a character is the boss' relative, they get hired, often with a good position.
The Ace  -  Character that is great at something and is highly respected.
Pint Sized Kid  -  Young children in media are unrealistically small.
All The Good Men Are Gay  -  Searching for love in all the gay places.
Animal Eye Spy  -  A character who can experience the world through senses of other animals.
The Bogan  -  A cartoonishly crass Australian character.
Photoprotoneutron Torpedo  -  Add random scientific terms to a name to make it sound hi-tech.
The Perils Of Being The Best  -  Being the best often comes with a price.
Ninja Brat  -  Like a Ninja, but only more smaller and younger, and sometimes immature.
Cram School  -  School where you have to study reeeeeally hard to pass the Achievement Test of Destiny.
Moment Killer  -  Romantic moment ruined.
General Failure  -  Top brass is missing some braincells.
God Of Thunder  -  A deity that embodies electricity and storms.
No Womans Land  -  You don't want to be a woman here.
True Blue Femininity  -  Using blue to represent femininity.
Loyal To The Position  -  He'll be of service to whoever holds the reins of power.
Affair Blame The Bastard  -  Taking out your anger from your spouse's infidelity on the bastard child born of said infidelity.
Cringe Comedy  -  Comedy that evokes awkwardness for humor.
Excalibur In The Stone  -  Excalibur = The sword in the stone.
Killed Mid Sentence  -  Character unexpectedly dies before finishing a statement.
Non Sequitur  -  Comes out of nowhere and stops the traffic in the sea.
Operation Jealousy  -  Dating someone new to get back at your ex.
The Bus Came Back  -  A character returns after not appearing for some time.
ET Gave Us Wi Fi  -  Imported Alien Phlebotinum is where cellphones and stuff come from.
Mystical Waif  -  A fragile young woman infused with magical power.
Guile Hero  -  A smart hero who uses wits to gain victory.
Border Patrol  -  Hey, you're straying too far from the game world! Get back there before I end your game!
Put The Laughter In Slaughter  -  They find murder hilarious.
Luckily My Powers Will Protect Me  -  A character explains his/her powers, while using them, to no-one in particular for the benefit of the audience.
I Lied  -  Villain makes deal with someone, then goes back on their end of the deal.
Adam Westing  -  A creator who parodies themselves and/or something involving them.
Creation Myth  -  A story regarding the creation of a universe and its inhabitants.
Space Is Noisy  -  According to fiction, sound is possible in the vacuum of space.
Old Dark House  -  A spooky old house cut off from the rest of the world, often serving as the setting for murder mysteries.
Workaholic  -  They live primarily for their job.
Apocalypse Hitler  -  Hitler coming back = The End of the World as We Know It.
Conflict Ball  -  The character randomly starts a Conflict for the sake of the plot.
Punny Name  -  Character's name is a joke.
First Law Of Resurrection  -  If the writer wants them back, they will be back.
Comm Links  -  Simple ranged communication device
Scienceville  -  A settlement well-known for its professional thinkers.
Endless Daytime  -  The sun doesn't set.
Cowardly Boss  -  A boss that runs off when you damage it, then stops a distance away until you hit it again, and repeats.
Combat Parkour  -  Utilizing parkour with physical combat.
Fast As Lightning  -  Lightning or electricity is associated with high speed.
In Universe Catharsis  -  A character relieves some long pent-up inner tension.
Have I Mentioned I Am Sexually Active Today  -  Of course I'm not a virgin! Nope, definitely not!
Lightning Reveal  -  A flash of lightning illuminates something in the dark.
Club Stub  -  New student must save a school club with a dangerously declined membership.
Shakespeare In Fiction  -  Shakespear himself showing up in works of fiction.
This Means War  -  A character has gone too far and royally pissed someone off, and ooh, boy, now are they gonna get it.
Suicidal Cosmic Temper Tantrum  -  Well, if I have to die, then everyone else should die! And right now!
Save Point  -  You must approach this point to save your game.
Purple Prose  -  Intrusively ornate prose.
Technicolor Science  -  Rule of Cool applied to portrayals of science.
Screw The Rules I Have Connections  -  Character uses connections to avoid punishment.
Reverse Mole  -  A good guy who pretends to be on the villain's side.
Sidequest  -  A mission you don't have to complete to finish the game.
Bungled Hypnotism  -  Hypnotism backfiring in the most hilarious way possible.
TV Telephone Etiquette  -  Nobody says "goodbye" at the end of a call.
Redemption Equals Death  -  HeelFace Turn followed by death.
Deus Ex Machina  -  A miracle that saves the heroes at the last minute.
The Dog Was The Mastermind  -  A completely unlikely suspect (such as a seemingly unimportant background character) turns out to be the Big Bad, The Mole, or some other major villain.
Disney Creatures Of The Farce  -  A scene spoofing how Disney princesses always seem to attract and be friendly with woodland creatures.
Beauty Equals Goodness  -  Beauty = Good, Ugliness = Bad.
Two Words I Cant Count  -  Someone tries to use Two Words: Added Emphasis, but gets the number of words wrong.
Glasses Curiosity  -  Characters needing or wanting to wear the glasses of others.
Dies Differently In Adaptation  -  A character dies differently in an adaptation than they did in the original work.
Dog Kicking Excuse  -  I don't want to Kick the Dog... So I'll find a reason to.
Ending By Ascending  -  A story or character arc ends with someone going up a staircase, ladder, etc.
Knotty Tentacles  -  Tying up an opponent with their own tentacles, long stretchy limbs, or snake-like features.
Sentry Gun  -  Automatic gun turret.
Cop Hater  -  This character hates law enforcement.
Knight Templar Parent  -  An extremely overprotective and/or vengeful parent.
Heads Or Tails  -  Flipping a coin to decide an action.
Malevolent Architecture  -  The architecture is trying to kill you.
The Three Faces Of Eve  -  A cast dynamic of three women: one who is innocent, one who is sensible, and one who is sexy.
Earpiece Conversation  -  Bob is talking to Alice, while his friend Charlie is nearby discreetly telling him what to say through an earpiece.
Made Of Temptation  -  A prize that a character really REALLY wants.
Shrink Ray  -  Applied Phlebotinum that is a device used to shrink (or grow) things.
Back Story  -  The story that happened before the story.
Not Even Bothering With The Accent  -  Clearly, the actor wasn't even trying to do an accent that would suit the character.
Shoddy Shindig  -  This party is boooring and SUCKS!
Absurdly Sharp Claws  -  A Natural Weapon that is much sharper than it would realistically be.
Toyota Tripwire  -  A pedestrian or cyclist gets hit unexpectedly by an opening car door.
Power Makes Your Voice Deep  -  Your voice gets deeper based on the amount of power you wield.
Chaos Is Evil  -  Bad guys like invoking the term "chaos".
Roger Rabbit Effect  -  Real live actors are filmed alongside cartoons.
Moebius Neighborhood  -  Someone has only one set of neighbours.
Healing Hands  -  Being able to heal someone else.
Fairy Godmother  -  A character who magically helps the protagonist find their Happily Ever After.
Misplaced Wildlife  -  These animals do not live here.
Big Ego Hidden Depths  -  There's more to the arrogant Jerkass than you thought.
N Plus One Sequel Title  -  When the second title in a series doesn't include the number 2, but instead adds one to a number found in the first title.
Gaias Vengeance  -  Earth itself fights back.
Too Good To Be True  -  A character suspects that an improbably favorable situation is a scam.
Short Range Long Range Weapon  -  Weapons that are normally suited for fighting at a range are best used up close.
Motionless Chin  -  When the mouth moves and the jaw doesn't follow.
Overzealous Underling  -  An underling who interprets and carries out their boss's orders in an extreme manner.
And Your Little Dog Too  -  I'll threaten your loved one, just to show how evil I am.
Inspirational Insult  -  A character draws inspiration and motivation from an insult hurled at them.
Throwing Off The Disability  -  A character who was disabled regains their mobility (at least temporarily).
More Expendable Than You  -  Someone else takes the sacrifice in place of someone else, usually The Hero.
Tin Can Telephone  -  Cans or cups on a string used as phones.
Fighting With Chucks  -  Using nunchucks as a weapon.
Offscreen Moment Of Awesome  -  An "awesome" scene takes place offscreen, often for comedic effect.
Think Twins  -  Twins as the Smart Guys.
Door Fu  -  A character uses a door as a weapon and/or shield.
Almost Holding Hands  -  Almost holding hands with your crush, but not quite.
Meta Origin  -  A retroactive Origin Story that ties the fates of several characters together.
Good Is Old Fashioned  -  A cynical character holds the attitude that codes of honor are outdated.
First Contact  -  Humanity encounters an intelligent alien species for the first time.
Brooding Boy Gentle Girl  -  A brooding, angst-ridden, but normally good-hearted boy is paired with a gentle, cheerful, kind-hearted girl.
Worthless Yellow Rocks  -  Valuable currency is disregarded as worthless by those not in-the-know.
Evil Redhead  -  Redheads are mean.
Irritation Nightmare  -  A bad dream that's more annoying than scary.
Claustrophobia  -  Fear of confined spaces.
Weaponized Headgear  -  Armed with a dangerous hat.
Signpost Tutorial  -  Signs and scenery that offer playing tips.Like this one To view the full trope page, click here.
Our Graphics Will Suck In The Future  -  Depictions of future computer graphics are worse than they are today.
Steam Never Dies  -  No matter how modern the society is, when a train shows up, it will be powered by steam.
Caped Mecha  -  Humongous Mecha + Badass Cape = Awesome
Artistic License Religion  -  Factual inaccuracies about religion or religious beliefs or practices in a work of fiction.
Watch It For The Meme  -  I heard the in-jokes, now I want to see where they all came from...
Gangsta Rap  -  The prime time news set to poetry, beats, samples, and loops.
Posthumous Narration  -  The story is told by an already dead character.
Im Okay  -  Demonstrating that a character has survived an apparently fatal injury simply by having them state as much after the fact.
Yiddish As A Second Language  -  Characters pepper their speech with Yiddish.
Heroic Bastard  -  The hero's parents never married.
Combos  -  A sequence of skills (and possibly special moves) that chain together, increasing in power.
Stumbled Into The Plot  -  The protagonist is the one who finds the Inciting Incident instead of being chosen or summoned.
Right Through The Wall  -  Noisy neighbors...especially in the bedroom.
God Is Neutral  -  God is neither benevolent nor malevolent.
I Dont Know Mortal Kombat  -  Possessing skills for real life situation that do not transfer into entertainment media that simulate them.
Twisted Ankle  -  A fleeing character is slowed due to injury.
Exponential Plot Delay  -  The plot advancement slows down exponentially, the closer it gets to the resolution.
Dream Intro  -  A short scene at the beginning of the episode turns out to be just a dream that a character is having.
Mate Or Die  -  Have sex or you're dead.
Sacred First Kiss  -  Who kisses you first is Serious Business.
Minored In Ass Kicking  -  I don't like to kick ass, but I can and I will.
King Kong Copy  -  Stock Parodies of King Kong.
Systematic Villain Takedown  -  The hero goes up against a group of major villains one by one.
Psychological Torment Zone  -  An Eldritch Location that preys upon your deepest, darkest fears and secrets.
Cold Sniper  -  A marksman who is both physically and psychologically distant.
Luke I Might Be Your Father  -  Character A may or may not be Character B's child. Neither of them know for sure.
Overlord Jr  -  The next generation of the Evil Overlord.
Common Tactical Gameplay Elements  -  Rules that add a tactical dimension to video/tabletop game combat.
Everythings Better With Penguins  -  Penguins make everything better. It's Exactly What It Says on the Tin.
Comic Trio  -  A Power Trio of Schemer, Dumb Muscle carrying out the scheme, and No Respect Guy powerless to stop it.
Serious Business  -  Treating something more seriously than necessary.
Sure Lets Go With That  -  Going along with someone else's misunderstanding because it's better/less embarrassing than them knowing the truth, or simply easier than trying to correct them.
Lovable Rogue  -  A character who breaks the law but the audience still likes them.
Hell Is That Noise  -  Terrifying ambient sounds.
Menagerie Of Misery  -  The animals are caged in unsuitable conditions.
Improv Fu  -  Tricks, traps, the environment, and improvised weapons: The Fighting Style.
Double Date  -  Two couples go on a date together.
Epic Launch Sequence  -  Big dramatic launch scenes for big dramatic ships.
I Know What We Can Do Cut  -  A Cut to the characters going through with Bob's harebrained idea (and wondering why they went with it).
Awesome Dear Boy  -  The actor's doing it because it'll be AWESOME!
Guerrilla Boulders  -  A type of obstacle that attacks until approached, all without reason.
Sherlock Can Read  -  Person A makes a conclusion. Person B is astounded by their powers of deduction—but it was just Person A noticing the obvious.
Dumbass Has A Point  -  The idiot is right for a change.
Actor IS The Title Character  -  The film's poster portrays the main or a major character with the phrase stating the actor playing them is that character.
Close Enough Timeline  -  It's not quite the normal timeline, but it'll have to do.
Half Breed Discrimination  -  A mixed-race character (human or otherwise) is discriminated against by one or both of their parental races.
Sad Clown  -  Acts comedic, but depressed inside.
Pretty Little Headshots  -  A headshot leaves a bullet-shaped hole in the victim's head, and nothing more.
Voices Are Not Mental  -  During a "Freaky Friday" Flip, minds swap bodies, but voices do not.
Stuck On A Ski Lift  -  Help me, I'm stranded on the ski lift!!
Dead Fic  -  Fanfiction that was prematurely ended.
Gaslamp Fantasy  -  Steampunk with fantastical magic instead of technology.
Recursive Creators  -  Artificial life that creates artificial life.
Priceless Paperweight  -  A priceless or important artifact or object is being used for an incredibly mundane purpose.
Revealing Continuity Lapse  -  An in-universe continuity error, meant to signify something about the story, setting or characters.
Anywhere But Their Lips  -  Sure, I'll kiss you on the cheek, forehead, nose, hand, ear, stomach, neck, foot, jaw, or eyes, but let's stay away from the lips, okay?
A Boy A Girl And A Baby Family  -  Family contains a son, a daughter, and a baby.
You Nuke Em  -  The player gets to Nuke 'em.
Slaying Mantis  -  Mantises are badass and scary.
A Pupil Of Mine Until He Turned To Evil  -  A mentor's formerly good student turns evil.
Resurrected For A Job  -  A third party resurrects The Hero and sends him on a Quest.
Torture Technician  -  The guy in charge of torturing people. Often For the Evulz.
That One Sidequest  -  A sidequest that's by far the hardest in the game, preventing players from reaching 100% Completion.
Machiavelli Was Wrong  -  Rule by fear doesn't work.
Pragmatic Hero  -  A hero who's willing to go the extra mile to achieve his goals for the greater good.
High School Hustler  -  The Mister Fixit of high school.
Hot Paint Job  -  Flames look cool on vehicles.
Dojikko  -  Clumsy is Cute and/or Sexy.
Recursive Translation  -  Translating from one language to another and back again, often with disastrous results.
Lunacy  -  The moon is supernatural.
Drowning My Sorrows  -  Depression-caused alcoholism.
Everybody Hates Mathematics  -  Math is dreadfully difficult. And boooriiing.
Uncoffee  -  A beverage that has all the qualities of coffee without actually being coffee.
Binary Suns  -  Planetary system with two stars.
Uncanny Family Resemblance  -  The members of one's extended family look similar to each other.
Finale Season  -  A season that is planned and advertised in advance as being the show's last.
Conspicuous Gloves  -  Gratuitous glove-wearing.
No Hero Discount  -  Recognized heroes still pay full-price for equipment.
Everything Fades  -  Everything fades away leaving no trace when it's not needed anymore.
Knuckle Cracking  -  Showing off by cracking your knuckles.
No Dub For You  -  A series is released overseas, but in its original language. No dub of the language of region imported to is used.
Forbidden Chekhovs Gun  -  Something is never supposed to be used... which foreshadows the fact that it will eventually get used.
Gravity Is Only A Theory  -  Gravity is only a theory: Don't trust it or those who believe in it!
Excellent Judge Of Character  -  A character who is good at using their instincts to tell if someone else can be trusted or not.
Double Consciousness  -  The internal conflict of a person whose ancestry and/or upbringing are on two different sides.
Classical Music Is Cool  -  Bob discovers that rather than being stuffy, classical music rocks!
Break The Badass  -  A badass goes into a mental and emotional breakdown.
Magikarp Power  -  Goes from really weak to really powerful after a lot of work.
Theme Music Power Up  -  When you hear this music, somebody's about to do something badass.
Vampires Harem  -  Polyamory is commonplace when Vampires Are Sex Gods.
Strapped To An Operating Table  -  Mad scientists tend to keep their victims strapped to operating tables
Victory Guided Amnesia  -  Victory comes at the price of one's memories.
Grim Up North  -  The North is cold and scary!
Moral Sociopathy  -  Character has a near or total Lack of Empathy but still has their own sense of right and wrong.
Karmic Twist Ending  -  Twist Ending enforces An Aesop.
Marijuana Is LSD  -  Marijuana causes hallucinations and/or violent behavior because Drugs Are Bad.
A Form You Are Comfortable With  -  A naturally disturbing-looking being uses a normal-looking form to communicate.
Oddly Common Rarity  -  Even though only the chosen one is supposed to be unique, there are many like them.
Trivial Title  -  A work gets its title from something unimportant in it.
Little Known Facts  -  Sharing useless eccentric trivia which isn't even true.
Secret Legacy  -  Hero's parents turn out to be special, and they take after them.
Terror Hero  -  A hero who targets the fear of villains.
No Time To Explain  -  TROPE: Stock Phrase; someone has to do something really fast, and can't explain.
Chart Displacement  -  An artist's best-known song is one that didn't do well on the sales charts.
Boats Into Buildings  -  Marine vessels converted into land-based structures.
Shows Damage  -  Sprites/models show visible damage as the battle goes on.
Extremophile Lifeforms  -  Organisms native to extreme environments.
Its Always Sunny In Miami  -  Sunny or clear skies, perpetually.
Family Extermination  -  A family that gets purged, whether happening in the present (or is attempted) or in the past
Honest Axe  -  Telling the truth gives you a reward.
Starstruck Speechless  -  Someone average gets Emotionally Tongue-Tied trying to speak to someone of higher status.
Boredom Montage  -  A montage that shows the character getting more and more bored as it goes on.
Weakness Turns Her On  -  Females find introverted or sensitive personalities in men attractive.
Famous Famous Fictional  -  Listing fictional examples along with real historical ones for comparison.
Spinoff Babies  -  Spin-off where the characters are all babies or young children.
Caper Rationalization  -  Don't worry, these thieves have a good reason for committing robbery.
Space Whale  -  Whales in space are surprisingly common in media.
Resolved Noodle Incident  -  The Noodle Incident gets explained.
A Million Is A Statistic  -  Audience sympathy is emphasized over the body count.
Harmful Healing  -  It is supposed to be a helpful medical procedure, but the side- and after-effects are outright horrible.
Premature Eulogy  -  Eulogy delivered for a still living character.
Sheep In Sheeps Clothing  -  Nice Guy is suspected to be not-so-nice, but turns out to be exactly as advertised.
Goggles Do Nothing  -  Your goggles do nothing except look cool.
Porky Pig Pronunciation  -  Try to say a wo-wo-wo- something, fail, simplify.
Sad Battle Music  -  A tune played during a Fight Scene or Boss Battle that is saddening rather than climactic, but it can be both.
Never Wake Up A Sleepwalker  -  The misconception that waking up someone while they're sleepwalking is dangerous.
Dad The Veteran  -  A retired military person who has a family.
The Unchosen One  -  Self-made hero.
Gold Colored Superiority  -  If something is gold-colored or has a gold-colored version, it will often be stronger than others.
Command And Conquer Economy  -  Your subjects don't build anything unless you tell them to.
Roguelike  -  A Role-Playing Game subgenre defined by Dungeon Crawling aspects, randomized playthroughs, and a you-have-to-start-a-new-game-from-scratch-every-time-you-die factor.
Rebel Prince  -  Prince who does not want to be king and actively tries to escape his birthright
Annoying Video Game Helper  -  An ally's attempts to help the player turn out to be more annoying than anything else.
Piecemeal Funds Transfer  -  Electric funds transfer programs transfer money gradually.
Sauna Of Death  -  An intentionally hot room killing someone by becoming TOO hot.
Watsonian Versus Doylist  -  Watsonian means internal to the story; Doylist means Real Life.
Its Always Spring  -  Green trees and blue skies, all year round.
Cue The Rain  -  Just when it seems things can't get worse, it starts to rain.
Preemptive Declaration  -  Character declares a future action as if done in past tense, before actually doing it.
Bitch In Sheeps Clothing  -  Sweet and harmless on the outside, horrible and cruel on the inside.
Butlerspace  -  Servants appearing out of nowhere when needed.
Conveniently Cellmates  -  Two main characters that end up in prison are jailed in the same cell.
Character Action Title  -  Title of a work composed so: [Name of character][Verb] etc.
Ambidextrous Sprite  -  Game art is mirrored to save data, positioning normally static features incorrectly.
Robot Girl  -  Artificially-created attractive girl.
Its A Wonderful Failure  -  The game reveals the terrifying consequences of your failure.
Scifi Ghetto  -  The belief that speculative fiction cannot be "true art."
I Broke A Nail  -  A woman becomes really upset because she broke a finger nail.
Only Sane Employee  -  Your job: Keep everyone from acting stupid.
Grandfather Paradox  -  Alice would not exist without Bob. Alice goes back in time and kills Bob before he creates Alice. What happens to Alice?
Freaky Is Cool  -  A character finds another character to be cool because they're weird rather than in spite of it.
Unhappy Medium  -  Having Psychic Powers can suck.
The Unintelligible  -  Lsnsknvsdnasdnfmd, bkfjgsjksskn sopfnekfkf demnwkjxnj (They can speak, but no one knows what they're saying).
Dramatic Thunder  -  Intense thunder and lightning in the atmosphere set an intense atmosphere.
Crocodile Tears  -  Crying not out of genuine sadness, but a plea for attention.
Water Is Womanly  -  Water is associated with femininity.
Ditzy Genius  -  A brilliant person who lacks common sense.
Not That Kind Of Mage  -  One type of spellcaster is easily mistaken for another.
Pronoun Trouble  -  Great care is taken using pronouns when a character's gender is a spoiler or of undetermined gender.
Patient Childhood Love Interest  -  They have known each other all their lives, grown up together, and one has always been in love with the other.
Contrasting Replacement Character  -  A character fills a void with a different trait.
Jerkass Has A Point  -  The Jerkass gives a valid argument.
The Cowl  -  Superhero who works in the shadows, codified by Batman.
Shoe Size Angst  -  A character is ashamed of the size of their feet.
Dramatic Half Hour  -  Exactly What It Says on the Tin.
Concepts Are Cheap  -  Words with positive connotation are thrown around without any meaning behind them.
Mentor Mascot  -  A small Talking Animal or creature who acts as the hero's mentor and grants them with their powers.
The Neidermeyer  -  An insane military leader who treats his own troops as disposables, who loathe him intensely right back.
Mobile Menace  -  The villain will always be just a little faster than the hero.
Thin Line Animation  -  A highly simplistic art-style known for rounded and soft shapes.
Civil War  -  Trope: A country fights amongst itself.
Creepy Monotone  -  Talking without inflection makes you scary.
Breaking The Fourth Wall  -  Hi, readers!
Arson Murder And Life Saving  -  Rattling off a list of things a character did wrong, summing up with what all those things ended up doing right.
The Order  -  An exclusive organization whose members are sworn to promote and/or to enforce their shared ideals.
Conviction By Counterfactual Clue  -  The evidence that supposedly proves guilt is factually incorrect.
Passed Over Promotion  -  A character isn't promoted upon opportunity, regardless of how qualified they may be.
Inspector Javert  -  A Lawful Neutral Knight Templar who believes "once a criminal, always a criminal."
Puff Of Logic  -  When it's pointed out something shouldn't exist or happen, it stops existing.
Cast From Sanity  -  When a powerful ability costs you your sanity.
Signature Style  -  You can recognize the creator just by the style they use.
Redundant Parody  -  Hey, let's put this in our parody!... wait, they did that themselves?
Challenge Gamer  -  Someone dead set on mastering their video games in order to be the very best.
Mighty Whitey  -  Outsider, usually from a more advanced nation, becomes a better tribesman than any of the natives.
Stealth Expert  -  Can sneak up on anyone.
I Love You Vampire Son  -  Of course I turned you into a monster! I love you like that.
Bigger On The Inside  -  Small outside, impossibly spacious within.
General Ripper  -  A high-ranking military leader who is a warmonger consumed with paranoia and hate for a specific foe.
Playing With Syringes  -  Unethical experiments to create something.
Eager Rookie  -  A young and inexperienced character wants to join a battle, but their older and more experienced peers refuse to let them.
With Or Without You  -  I don't care if you come with me.
Bumbling Henchmen Duo  -  An inseparable pair of Laughably Evil minions.
Distinctive Appearances  -  Certain nuances make the individuality of a character. Even if they all look remarkably similar.
Bolivian Army Ending  -  An unresolved cliffhanger with the characters facing impossible odds.
El Spanish O  -  Soundo like el Spanish, pero it isn't.
Unexpected Virgin  -  You'd be surprised to find out this character has never actually had sex before.
Absurdly Elderly Mother  -  A woman older than 50 gives birth to a child.
Four One Nine Scam  -  A scam in which a big reward is promised if you pay money upfront, but instead the scammer takes your money and runs.
X Ray Sparks  -  Electrocution makes your skeleton visible.
Cuckoo Nest  -  Was I (the narrator) hallucinating all of that?
Counting To Potato  -  Replacing numbers with other items when counting.
Not So Different  -  Two opponents realize they're not so different.
Childhood Home Rediscovery  -  A character stumbles upon the place they grew, opening up the floodgates for old memories.
Everything But The Girl  -  Gaining immense power can get you anything except the love of the Romantic Interest
Multishot  -  Your bow shoots multiple arrows at once.
Toad Licking  -  The fresh taste of toad venom will take the edge off real nice
Anime First  -  Anime series out before other adaptations.
Untitled Title  -  A work has a title which claims it lacks a title.
Dying Declaration Of Love  -  Dying while confessing your final words to the one you truly love.
You Need To Get Laid  -  You need sex. Badly.
Sticky Situation  -  Misadventures with adhesive.
Clamshell Currency  -  Shelling out in seashells.
Sorry I Fell On Your Fist  -  The victim apologizes for being attacked. To the attacker, naturally.
How Did You Know I Didnt  -  The Hero is asked how they knew their action would avoid disastrous collateral damage and/or not kill them. They didn't know.
Disco Dan  -  Character holds on to a fad that others have abandoned.
I See Dead People  -  Either a person or people see ghosts but not shown.
Fighting For A Homeland  -  Character or group is motivated to fight by their desire for a new homeland.
Privacy By Distraction  -  Making up something (usually a fool's errand) for an unwanted third party to go somewhere else.
Science Is Wrong  -  Science doesn't prove anything
Blithe Spirit  -  An unusual stranger who subverts the status quo, teaching others to think differently about themselves.
The Story That Never Was  -  To resolve the plot's overall conflict, a twist ending reveals that the events of the plot must be erased such that it might as well have been All Just a Dream.
Supervillain  -  Villain that possesses superhuman abilities.
Skeptic No Longer  -  The Agent Scully becomes an Agent Mulder.
Mistaken For Pregnant  -  A character falsely thinks a woman is pregnant.
Sky Consuming Dogfight  -  Big Badass Battle Sequence with many, many aircraft shooting at each other in close proximity.
Motive Misidentification  -  The villain's master plan is not what someone else suspects.
Wing Pull  -  Yeah, he pretty much pulled those wings out of his ass.
Sturdy And Steady Turtles  -  Fictional turtles being portrayed as preposterously slow, but patient, determined and/or well-defended.
Junior Counterpart  -  A character that serves as a younger, less experienced Foil to an older character.
Lint Value  -  Offering a small amount of money for something expensive, and getting something much cheaper in return.
Thirty Seconds Over Tokyo  -  Trope: Hollywood's idea of Japan, a hybrid of futuristic and old.
Hopeless Auditionees  -  Talent show auditionees with no talent whatsoever.
Instant Cosplay Surprise  -  Someone doesn't react to clothing he's made to wear until it's all the way on.
An Astral Projection Not A Ghost  -  A "ghost" turns out to be a living person's Astral Projection.
The Archmage  -  Powerful and learned wizard.
Settling The Frontier  -  Moving to new lands or worlds provides new opportunities and dangers.
Trailer Delay  -  Development Hell causes a gap in the release dates of a trailer and a film, maybe with no film coming at all.
Marry The Nanny  -  A single parent gets involved with someone employed to watch the kids or the house.
Briefer Than They Think  -  Event lasting shorter than many assume.
Villainous RROD  -  When a villain has physical breakdown from overexerting themselves.
Hands Go Down  -  Leading question: everybody raises their hands.
Shapeshifting Seducer  -  Shapeshifters use their ability to seduce someone by taking on a form that will please them.
Angel Devil Shipping  -  An innocent, heroic character is shipped with a dark, morally ambiguous/evil/anti-heroic one.
Some Anvils Need To Be Dropped  -  The moral is heavy-handed, but the story works better that way.
Warmup Boss  -  First, easy boss early in the game that lightly introduces players to the game's mechanics.
Intangible Time Travel  -  You only can observe the past/future, but you're invisible, intangible and inaudible to those who are in the past and future.
Hollywood Acid  -  Green, flows like water, and dissolves nearly everything. It's acid.
The Coats Are Off  -  This coat is definitely going to get in the way of my asskicking, so it's getting off.
Balance Between Good And Evil  -  For good, there must be evil and for evil, there must be good.
Secular Hero  -  A hero who isn't quite vocal about their religious faith (or lack thereof).
Insectoid Aliens  -  Aliens look like or are insects.
The Performer King  -  A monarch who likes to perform for their subjects.
There Are No Therapists  -  Therapists are inexplicably absent from the story's universe, when a character is still struggling to cope with both psychological or emotional issues that would require more therapy in Real Life.
Peggy Sue  -  Character finds themselves back in time with the chance to change history.
Calacas  -  Skeletons representing the dead in Mexican culture.
Teach Him Anger  -  Giving the Nice Guy a backbone by pushing his buttons... or making him violently snap if that goes wrong.
Excrement Statement  -  Shitting or peeing on something or somebody to show disrespect.
Puzzling Platypus  -  Platypuses are so weird that it bears mentioning and investigation.
Gemstone Assault  -  Gems are made into lethal weapons.
Loads And Loads Of Sidequests  -  Do stuff, get stuff. Repeat 100 times.
Gambit Pileup  -  Everybody is manipulating everybody else.
Speech Bubble Censoring  -  When a nude character's naughty bits are covered by a speech bubble.
Malicious Slander  -  Hurtful lies.
Artificial Zombie  -  Dead people brought to life by scientific means that don't involve viruses.
Fake American  -  An actor sounds American when they really aren't.
Wrap It Up  -  A short-notice Finale for a soon to be cancelled work.
Needle In A Stack Of Needles  -  Something is hidden amongst a slew of its duplicates.
This Was His True Form  -  Shapeshifters and Virus victims return to their original form upon death.
Running Gagged  -  The end of a recurring joke after it's become old.
Themed Party  -  A party centred around a theme with matching decor, music and dress code.
Video Games And Fate  -  Video games where the strictly linear gameplay is justified in-story, by way of reference to fate, destiny or mind control.
The Blank  -  No eyes, no mouth, no nose, no nothing.
Dreamworks Face  -  Smirking with a raised eyebrow in marketing and promotional material.
Cat Dog Dichotomy  -  Cats and dogs are treated as counterparts.
Princeling Rivalry  -  Removing competitors to the throne, by any means necessary.
Chase Fight  -  A Chase Scene in which both parties are also shooting at each other in transit.
Kawaiiko  -  Overdoing Japanese Cuteness.
Primate Versus Reptile  -  A primate and a reptile throw it down, King Kong-style.
Retraux Flashback  -  A flashback to a previous time is presented in that time's visual style.
Messy Pig  -  Pigs are dirty, messy animals fond of mud and muck.
Identical Grandson  -  An ancestor so similar to their descendant that they can be played by the same actor and/or have an identical character design.
Gollum Made Me Do It  -  Hyde bullies Jekyll into cooperating.
Fastball Special  -  Throwing a (usually) willing teammate as an attack.
Julius Beethoven Da Vinci  -  Several historical figures are the same person.
Former Child Star  -  This troubled adult used to be a performer as a child.
The Klutz  -  A character whose defining trait is clumsiness.
Jailed One After Another  -  Multiple characters get arrested, being imprisoned in close proximity.
Death Ray  -  A Ray Gun that kills.
Doomed New Clothes  -  That new outfit you just spent a fortune on? Won't last five minutes.
Cain And Abel And Seth  -  A late introduced sibling complicates an established family dynamic.
Rockstar Song  -  A song about being a rock star.
Doorstopper  -  A book so big it can keep a door open.
Wraparound Background  -  Reuse of background images in a single scene to show movement.
Black Bra And Panties  -  Seeing black lingerie puts up warning flags that the wearer may not have the best intentions.
Misblamed  -  Blaming the wrong person(s).
Shabby Heroes Well Dressed Villains  -  The good guys' clothes are dirty, tattered, or just plain messy. The bad guys' clothes are clean, smooth, and fully neat.
What Happened To Mommy  -  People refusing to properly dispose of Zombie Infectee family members. Usually to disastrous results.
Automatic Level  -  The level plays without the player.
Writer Induced Fanon  -  Writers hint at an idea that's not canon yet, but is already accepted by most of the fandom.
Acrophobic Bird  -  A character capable of flight doesn't want to fly for some reason.
Darkness Equals Death  -  Darkness as a sign of impending doom or horror.
Lonely At The Top  -  They got what they wanted, at the cost of everything else.
Cry For The Devil  -  The villain is shown from a sympathetic viewpoint, and the audience comes to pity them.
Evil Counterpart Race  -  An entire species who's hat is that they're Evil Doppelgangers of another species.
Past Life Memories  -  When you remember what you did in an earlier life.
Evil Plan  -  The villain's plan that the heroes try to stop.
Halloween Costume Characterization  -  A person's choice of costume represents their personality.
You Dirty Rat  -  Rats are portrayed as disgusting creatures.
Ethnic Scrappy  -  This character is hated for being either based on racist stereotypes, or for simply being of a given race to begin with.
Rise Of Zitboy  -  What is this?! I HAVE A ZIT! WORST DAY EVER! THIS IS THE END OF THE WORLD! AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!
Character Alignment  -  So, what moral and ethical values do you believe in?
Ad Hominem  -  To the man. Refuting an argument by attacking some aspect of its presentation or presenter and not its content.
Epic Battle Boredom  -  A One-Man Army who's incredibly blasé about it.
Killer Teddy Bear  -  Monstrous living plush animal.
Duck Season Rabbit Season  -  Switching sides of an argument subtly to make your opponent do the same without realizing it.
Invading Refugees  -  They only invaded because they were fleeing from a Doomed Hometown.
Fatal Flaw  -  The ultimate problem with a character.
Hikikomori  -  Extreme shut-in lifestyle enabled by the peculiarities of Japanese society and culture.
Those Wily Coyotes  -  Coyotes are portrayed as tricksters, clowns and crafty bastards.
The Baroness  -  A badass, frigid, sadistic, and dominant villainess.
Working Through The Cold  -  Hero is sick but still has to go kick ass.
Edible Ammunition  -  Why eat it? Shoot it!
Disc One Final Dungeon  -  A supposedly final mission happens early in the game.
Massive Multiplayer Scam  -  Everyone but the victim was in on this con.
Human Furniture Is A Pain In The Tail  -  Different species have different needs when it comes to what they sit on.
Refusal Of The Second Call  -  The hero from the original work nopes out of world-saving in the sequel.
Disappointing Older Sibling  -  An older sibling lets down their younger sibling(s).
Care Bear Stare  -  An attack composed of pure niceness.
Puny Earthlings  -  Compared to other sentient species, humans suck.
Cards Of Power  -  Cards are magical, often used for spells or summoning.
Unreveal Angle  -  Something secret is shown on camera in a way that it still doesn't reveal anything that matters.
Nested Ownership  -  My X has its own X.
Counterpart Combat Coordination  -  A team fights another according to the theme or common trait, especially to cause or avoid confusion.
Guest Host  -  A substitute host.
Hollywood Hype Machine  -  Hollywood's newest media darling.
Witty Banter  -  In which some characters trade witty remarks.
Radio Song  -  A song about the radio medium.
Martial Arts Headband  -  Any fighter worth their sword have bands on their foreheads.
Shipper With An Agenda  -  A couple is being shipped for selfish reasons for the shipper.
Dangerous Deserter  -  Those who abandon their post are not only evil, but also extremely dangerous.
Princess Classic  -  An innocent, good and kind princess.
Wrongful Accusation Insurance  -  A wrongly accused character isn't charged for crimes they committed to prove their innocence.
God Is Dead  -  The creator of the universe is dead.
Yowies And Bunyips And Drop Bears Oh My  -  Our Cryptids Are More Mysterious in the Land Down Under!
Bluenose Bowdlerizer  -  Wiki Vandals deleting profanity.
We Dont Suck Anymore  -  We learned from our mistakes.
Tested On Humans  -  A villain tests his weapon on live humans.
Tail Slap  -  Flailing or whipping with a tail.
Put Their Heads Together  -  Two enemies or more are taken down by having their skulls knocked into each other.
Faceship  -  A vehicle with a character's face built on it.
Playful Hacker  -  Hacks computers for fun.
Episode Title Card  -  The title of the episode is displayed here.
Amoral Afrikaner  -  Evil white South Africans, generally mercenaries and almost always racist as hell.
A Cup Angst  -  She's self-conscious about her own itty-bitty titties.
Flaying Alive  -  Torture by removing someone's skin.
Ass Kicks You  -  Rear End Attack!
Victory By Endurance  -  I will exhaust you.
Percussive Prevention  -  I'm gonna be stupid...
Friendly Fireproof  -  Attacking only hurts enemies and doesn't affect allies.
Southern Fried Genius  -  Smart person from the Deep South
Splash Damage  -  Damages over an area, decreasing with radius.
Gale Force Sound  -  Noise so loud, it has the same effect of wind.
Does Not Like Men  -  Misandry.
Euphemism Buster  -  Someone says a euphemism, and someone else says what the first person's euphemism meant.
Law Of One Hundred  -  Collecting 100 common items grants bonuses.
Big Damn Movie  -  The Movie always has a more dramatic plot than the series.
Genre Savvy  -  Character is aware of the conventions of the genre they are participating in, and uses this knowledge to draw correct conclusions about their own situation.
Finger Suck Healing  -  Sucking a finger wound to help ease the pain.
Sound Of No Damage  -  A sound effect indicates that an attack did nothing.
Idiot Savant  -  Mentally challenged, except when it comes to a certain ability.
Slippy Slidey Ice World  -  Generic Video Game icy level.
Absurdly Powerful Student Council  -  Student organisation? More like independent political government.
Drought Level Of Doom  -  A level that takes a very harsh toll on your resources with few or no ways to replenish them.
Chekhovs Gun  -  A plot device that isn't significant until later in the story.
Sickly Green Glow  -  Green light is evil.
How Unscientific  -  The story makes a temporary break from its usual place between mundanity and fantasy.
Merlin And Nimue  -  A Student and Master Team of magic users made up of (sometimes) one male, one female. Often they have a personal relationship, and just as often one betrays the other.
Shapeshifter Default Form  -  A shapeshifter has a true form that they appear as most of the time.
Psycho Lesbian  -  A psychotic lesbian.
True Final Boss  -  If you finish the game with a perfect run (a certain sidequest, post-game Boss Rush mode, 100% Completion, etc.) you get another Final Boss after (or instead of) the usual one.
Swiper No Swiping  -  Getting a villain to cease their villainous plot by just telling them to stop.
Element Number Five  -  A special elemental type after the 4 famous ones.
Pity The Kidnapper  -  The kidnap victim is too much for the kidnappers to handle.
Two Roads Before You  -  Being presented with a choice between two or more mutually exclusive options.
Invisibility Cloak  -  Something that makes you invisible when you wear it.
Names To Run Away From Really Fast  -  Evil people have evil names.
Defective Detective  -  A competent investigator with a terrible personal or social life.
One Word Vocabulary  -  A character can only say one word.
Menace Decay  -  A troublesome kid becomes or comes across as less of a menace as a series goes on.
Raw Eggs Make You Stronger  -  Raw eggs improve your toughness and strength.
Personal Dictionary  -  Well, I say 'inconceivable' means 'uh-oh!'
Action Insurance Gag  -  Lampshading the rampant destruction of property in action-oriented works by way of reference to insurance.
That One Achievement  -  A hard-to-get achievement that is the bane of achievement hunters.
Extremely Protective Child  -  Mess with this kid's/these kids' parent(s), and you are in deep trouble.
Good Is Not Dumb  -  A character who is good gets underestimated because of it.
Blind Idiot Translation  -  An overly literal or grammatically incorrect, but still comprehensible, translation.
Humans Are Special  -  Humanity is more unique than other species in Speculative Fiction.
Rat Men  -  Humanoid Rodents.
Bandage Wince  -  Cleansing wounds is painful.
Lost In Imitation  -  An adaptation of a work relates more to a previous adaptation than to the original.
Dragon Rider  -  People riding dragons are awesome.
Starfish Robots  -  Robotic beings of alien origin, shape and functionality.
Voices Are Mental  -  Character has the same voice in different bodies.
Shower Scene  -  The most common form of fanservice: a sexy character taking a shower.
Jesus Was Crazy  -  Jesus from Nazareth, portrayed as a nutjob.
Adaptational Diversity  -  A character is changed in an adaptation to be part of a marginalized group.
Gun Fu  -  Gun play with acrobatics.
Meddling Parents  -  Even after you've grown up and no longer need them, they keep helping you.
Sturgeons Law  -  90% of anything sucks.
Glad To Be Alive Sex  -  WE SURVIVED!!! Let's celebrate with sex!
The Magic Touch  -  Touch-activated Phlebotinum.
Fourth Reich  -  Re-establishing Nazi Germany.
Merit Badges For Everything  -  In fiction, scouts can earn a merit badge for absolutely anything!
Gender Equals Breed  -  Sons are like daddy and daughters are like mommy, especially if they're really different.
Spelling Bee  -  A competition where the characters try to spell words, usually long and/or obscure ones.
Shooting Superman  -  Using a weapon that you know someone's invulnerable to against them.
Chastity Couple  -  A romantic but celibate Official Couple.
Church Of Saint Genericus  -  A church's denomination is unmentioned to avoid audience alienation/distraction.
Dont Split Us Up  -  Siblings try to avoid being separated.
Santa Clausmas  -  A special which is about a religious holiday (usually Christmas), but has no religious content.
Nuns Are Mikos  -  Nuns who do stuff that Mikos do but real nuns do not.
Wouldnt Hit A Girl  -  Male heroes never hit females.
Feather Fingers  -  Animals' limbs are used like their human equivalents, regardless of whether it's possible.
Becoming The Costume  -  It's not real, it's just a costume. Until now, that is.
Taught By Television  -  TV can be educational.
Name From Another Species  -  A human given a name by nonhumans or a nonhuman given a name by nonhumans of a different species.
Even Evil Can Be Loved  -  When a villain is humanized by the attachment a virtuous character feels for them.
Environmental Narrative Game  -  An adventure game sub-genre, which de-emphasizes gameplay and challenges in favour of story.
Everyone Owns A Mac  -  Real people don't actually use this as often as fictional characters do.
Polka Dot Disease  -  A fictional disease that makes you break out in polka-dots.
Cycle Of Revenge  -  Revenge begets revenge.
River Of Insanity  -  A journey into the wild goes really, really bad.
Thememobile  -  A vehicle based on a character's theme.
Vehicular Assault  -  The villain attacks the hero with a machine.
Literary Agent Hypothesis  -  Speculation that a work is an interpretation of something that "really" happened.
Cut Song  -  A song that doesn't appear in the work itself, but can be found through hacking, the Sound Test, or on the original soundtrack.
Sheath Strike  -  Using a weapon's sheath as a weapon.
Old Money  -  Families who have been able to maintain their wealth over multiple generations.
Emotionless Girl  -  A girl who shows no emotion.
Battle Interrupting Shout  -  It's easy to stop a battle by just shouting at it. (Or not.)
Five Moves Of Doom  -  Professional wrestlers using the same five moves to end all matches.
Acrofatic  -  An overweight character with surprising agility.
Bodyguard Crush  -  A bodyguard falls in love with the charge, or vice versa or both.
Cozy Voice For Catastrophes  -  A character or narrator's voice is soothing, even though the events surrounding them aren't.
Would Hurt A Child  -  Character has no qualms about using violence against children.
Sacrificial Planet  -  The plot-driving threat destroyed another planet first.
Beauty Is Best  -  A character's beauty is valued more than their other attributes.
Game Of Chicken  -  Two vehicles drive toward one another. First to swerve loses.
Dawn Of An Era  -  It's not the end—it's a beginning.
Twenty Bear Asses  -  In this quest, you must collect many copies of something that monsters Randomly Drop.
Villainous Glutton  -  Self-indulgent villain.
Exotic Extended Marriage  -  Polygamy emphasizes the foreignness of a culture or species.
Making A Spectacle Of Yourself  -  Flamboyant glasses.
Unreliable Expositor  -  Non-narrator expositor who is indicated to not be telling the truth.
Revenge SVP  -  A person seeks revenge because they were not invited to a party.
Future Loser  -  Successful in youth, failure in adulthood.
Delegation Relay  -  Higher ups passing the buck down the chain of command to the lowest member.
You Mean Xmas  -  Holidays by another name.
Villain Opening Scene  -  A work opens by introducing the antagonist.
International Coproduction  -  Works that were made by two or more countries.
Detournement  -  Repurposing an existing work to reverse or counter its own message.
Script Fic  -  A Fan Fic written in the form of a script.
Armoured Closet Gay  -  He hates gays... but he's gay himself.
Swiss Army Appendage  -  Various prosthetic extremities with special utility attached as and when required.
Im Not Hungry  -  A prisoner spurns their captor's hospitality.
Secret Final Campaign  -  After you complete every campaign, you unlock a new one.
Gender Reveal  -  Surprise! I was the gender that you didn't expect me to be!
Breakout Character  -  An Ensemble Dark Horse becomes a main character.
Something Else Also Rises  -  Visual metaphor for arousal.
Big Applesauce  -  Everything important in America, if not the whole world, happens in New York City.
The Medic  -  The one that heals the others.
Prophetic Names  -  With a name like that, you were pretty much fated to live up to it.
Overt Rendezvous  -  Covert meetings that happen in public.
The Dinnermobile  -  Weird vehicles.
Fixer Sue  -  Mary Sue whose sole purpose is to railroad the plot.
Visible Sigh  -  A little white cloud that appears near and moves away from the mouth of a person sighing.
Flaming Devil  -  Satan is FABULOUS!!
Aquatic Mook  -  An underwater mook.
Samaritan Syndrome  -  Heroes feel guilty for every time they might have saved someone, but didn't.
Organic Bra  -  Female humanoids have thick scales or other irregular skin patterns over their breasts. Often a handwave to not show nipples.
Ungrateful Townsfolk  -  Civilians constantly screw over the protagonists.
Flatline  -  When a EKG line on a screen goes flat, it means the patient is dead or dying.
Perfection Is Addictive  -  It's hard to enjoy normal things once you've had a taste of the best possible thing.
Good Weapon Evil Weapon  -  Character Alignment depends on what weapons you use.
The Killer In Me  -  Surprise! The protagonist is the killer!
A Mech By Any Other Name  -  A Humongous Mecha that's not called a mecha.
Black Magic  -  Evil Functional Magic.
Wins By Doing Absolutely Nothing  -  Sit back and let the enemy self-destruct.
Cultural Rebel  -  An individual who has a major preference and/or hobby outside of what is culturally expected of them.
Standard Female Grab Area  -  Women held by the upper arm are rendered powerless.
Hot Gypsy Woman  -  Romani are stereotyped as exotic temptresses.
There Will Be Toilet Paper  -  Shaving cuts are always stanched with TP.
Rewriting Reality  -  Want to change reality? Just get a notebook and write!
Power Glows  -  Might makes bright.
Five Rounds Rapid  -  The military uses rifles instead of heavier weapons on the Monster of the Week.
One Woman Wail  -  Ethereal, haunting, wordless singing by one woman.
Sock It To Them  -  An Improvised Weapon made by placing something heavy in a sock.
Scenery Gorn  -  Horrific, lovingly detailed landscapes.
Interactive Fiction  -  A fancy name for Text Adventures.
Bad Guys Do The Dirty Work  -  Villain does the morally ambiguous action the hero will not do, but benefits from.
Unfriendly Fire  -  Passing off a murder as just a casualty of war.
Overly Preprepared Gag  -  Man, they put a lot of effort into that one joke.
Face Palm Of Doom  -  Grabbing someone by the face and blasting/crushing them at point-blank range.
I Am The Band  -  Solo artist goes by a Stage Name that makes it sound like he or she is a group of people.
The Mad Hatter  -  Crazy, and loving every second of it.
Lets Meet The Meat  -  Food is anthropomorphized. Moral dilemmas ensue.
Angst  -  Anxiety and inner worries.
Wikipedia Updater  -  If The Other Wiki is the technician, than This Very Wiki is the performer, so please try to loosen up just a little.
Direct Line To The Author  -  Fictional conceit that a work of fiction is drawn from Real Life events.
Samurai  -  Members of the feudal military class that hailed from Japan, wielded swords and had a strong code of honor.
Japanese Politeness  -  Japanese people are ridiculously polite.
Home Alone Antics  -  A kid sets traps in a house/hotel/castle/whatever for bad guys to trip on. Hilarity Ensues.
Mouth Of Sauron  -  Does the talking for their unseen master.
Straw Misogynist  -  Extreme chauvinist who hates women, existing to be proven wrong and ridiculed for it.
Fan Preferred Couple  -  They're not an Official Couple, but a lot of people wish they were.
Running Away To Cry  -  A character makes an exit to hide their tears.
Dean Bitterman  -  The stereotypical nasty school principal.
Does Not Like Spam  -  A character has a trademark least favorite food.
A Minor Kidroduction  -  A work starts with a brief scene of the protagonist as a child.
Chekhovs Armoury  -  A whole bunch of unknown Plot Devices present.
God And Satan Are Both Jerks  -  Satan may be evil, but the Big Guy isn't any better.
Bit Part Bad Guys  -  Lesser criminals unrelated to the main antagonists who are encountered briefly, usually to demonstrate a typical example of what the hero regularly deals with.
Story Difficulty Setting  -  A difficulty setting in a video game, which is specifically intended for players who just want to experience the story.
The Paladin  -  Holy knight with healing and defensive powers and light based magic.
South Of The Border  -  Stereotypical portrayals of Mexico.
Chippendales Dancers  -  Shirtless, well-built Spear Counterparts to the Playboy Bunny.
One For The Money One For The Art  -  A creator does Project "A" to get the money and creative freedom to do Project "B".
Stylistic Suck  -  Intenshonally por kwality.
Anti Structure  -  Effective against structures and buildings.
Moniker As Enticement  -  Making something mundane and routine seem exciting for kiddies by giving it a fancy name.
Pluto Is Expendable  -  Nobody cares about small planets such as Pluto.
The Rich Have White Stuff  -  Rich people are likely associated with white objects.
Ram Scoop  -  Starship that harvests hydrogen directly from space to perpetually fuel itself.
Ambiguously Trained  -  May or may not have been in some form of military or law enforcement service.
Gang Up On The Human  -  Free for all vs. computer opponents = everyone else vs. you.
Formerly Fit  -  A character used to be perfectly healthy, but now is overweight or obese.
I Know You Know I Know  -  If you know a plan, you can foil it— even plans that account for that.
Exploding Barrels  -  Highly explosive barrels.
At Arms Length  -  Holding back someone with an arm when they try to come for you.
Sword Plant  -  Stabbing a sword into the ground.
Brief Accent Imitation  -  Alice mocks Bob's voice and style of speech.
Well Intentioned Extremist  -  A character who commits horrid acts for good causes.
We Have To Get The Bullet Out  -  In fiction, the first thing you need to do to treat shot wound is to get the bullet out.
Not Quite Flight  -  It's like flying, but not directly.
All Crimes Are Equal  -  Punishing all crimes, no matter how minor, with the same harsh penalty.
Naming Your Colony World  -  Stock naming conventions for planets in science fiction stories.
Ominous Obsidian Ooze  -  Oily or tarry black substances mean nothing but trouble.
Share Phrase  -  A universally used Catchphrase.
Knockback  -  A game mechanic where colliding into certain things knocks you backward.
Gone To The Future  -  Traveling to the future causes a person to completely disappear from the world in the meantime.
Celebrity Voice Actor  -  Popular, well-known, actors or singers doing voice work, often for publicity points.
Immortality Inducer  -  A magical or technological device that grants immortality.
Old Beggar Test  -  If a fairy-tale character meets an old beggar asking for help, it's guaranteed the latter is a powerful entity or a noble.
Hiding In A Hijab  -  Hide by disguising yourself as a Muslim woman.
Mysterious Past  -  A character's backstory is extremely vague and seldom mentioned.
Mellow Fellow  -  The character is easy going and never loses their cool.
Subspace Ansible  -  Faster-than-light communication.
Russian Roulette  -  A game of chance where winning has no reward and losing means death or some other punishment. Named after the original Russian Roulette game.
Foot Bath Treatment  -  A sick or hypothermic character soaks their feet.
Reaching Towards The Audience  -  You can practically touch the poster's frontmost hand, it's so close!
List Of Experiences Speech  -  A character gives a speech listing all their experiences/accomplishments, often as a Badass Boast.
This Isnt Heaven  -  You think you've gone to Heaven, but you're really in Hell.
Palatial Sandcastle  -  A sandcastle big enough to enter it.
Killed To Uphold The Masquerade  -  Someone discovers the existence of the supernatural, and is killed to keep it secret.
Censored For Comedy  -  Mixed-up censors give dirty connotations for humour.
Cute And Psycho  -  Cute, sweet, Ax-Crazy. Often at the same time.
Instant Death Radius  -  An enemy attack radius large enough, or packing enough power within it, to make any attempt at melee suicide.
Badass Fingersnap  -  Pull the switch and lower the drawbridge (i.e. "snap your fingers"), and allow epicness to occur. note  See the Quotes page for more info about where this expression came from.
Bloody Hilarious  -  Ultraviolence Played for Laughs.
Offscreen Afterlife  -  There's definitely an afterlife in this world, but the audience don't ever see it.
Note To Self  -  Leaving yourself a message in case you lose your memories.
Fille Fatale  -  An underage girl who is unusually sexually precocious.
Cradling Your Kill  -  The dying person dies in the arms of their killer.
Mohs Scale Of Science Fiction Hardness  -  The level of realism and unrealism in a Science Fiction story.
Theme Tune Cameo  -  The theme tune gets whistled, hummed, sang, or played on a musical instrument In-Universe.
Slime Snails And Mutant Tails  -  Toys for boys are gross!
Defiled Forever  -  Inappropriate sexual contact destroys the soul.
Vacation Dear Boy  -  A work is produced in an exotic location simply as an excuse for the actor/producer/director to spend a holiday at said exotic location.
Puppet Gun  -  A gun used for aiming a much bigger weapon.
Badass Decay  -  A character becomes less "badass" over a period of time.
Phlebotinum Du Jour  -  Sexy new science does magic.
The Climax  -  When tension slowly builds up in a story, the climax is the highest point of it all.
Handbag Of Hurt  -  Being hit with a woman's purse.
Randomized Damage Attack  -  This particular attack's damage is completely random.
Retractable Appendages  -  The ability to retract any part of the body.
Powersuit Monkey  -  Non-anthropomorphic animals taking on human jobs.
Lecherous Licking  -  A character licks another in a perverted and sexual manner.
Clear Their Name  -  A character has been accused of a crime that they didn't commit, and another tries to prove their innocence.
You Get Me Coffee  -  Rather than the important stuff, you get stuck with the useless/random and/or trivial task.
Whatevermancy  -  Magic using X = "Xmancy"
Hitbox Dissonance  -  When the visuals and the collision detection in video games don't match up.
Visible Boom Mic  -  The boom microphone intrudes into the shot.
Pirate Song  -  Scurvy sea dogs singing of swashbuckling.
Southern Gentleman  -  A polite and proper guy from the American south, typically with a few unpleasant traits.
Internet Counterattack  -  If you do something wrong, the Internet will find out about it.
They Fight Crime  -  Two oddball characters are buddy cops.
Girls Love Stuffed Animals  -  Girls love to carry around or store stuffed animals.
Image Song  -  A song specifically about a character, usually performed by that character's voice actor.
Standard Police Motto  -  A catch phrase and slogan for cops.
Equipment Upgrade  -  Enhance your equippable items instead of replacing them!
Bride And Switch  -  The girl whom the groom is going to marry is not who she seems.
Under The Truck  -  A motorcyclist sliding underneath a truck blocking his way.
Abandoned Hospital  -  Abandoned hospitals are spooky.
In A Single Bound  -  Characters jump really high, way higher than normally possible.
Fusion Dance  -  Mixing many characters into one... Literally
Beast And Beauty  -  She's beautiful and brings out the best in monstrous(-looking) him.
Call That A Formation  -  Armies fighting out of formation when they really shouldn't be.
Famous Ancestor  -  A character is descended from someone famous.
Casual Competitive Conflict  -  If you spend too much time in front of the screen, someone will kill you. If you don't spend enough time in front of the screen, someone will kill you.
Instant Humiliation Just Add You Tube  -  Total humiliation, only a video upload away.
Squirrels In My Pants  -  Animal enters clothing, dance parties ensue.
Temporarily Exaggerated Trait  -  Someone has a trait that always applies to them but is amplified for one episode or part of an episode or whatever.
Pink Girl Blue Boy  -  Girls wear pink, boys wear blue.
Hollywood Thin  -  Hollywood: Impossibly underweight = somehow average.
An Insert  -  A scene that only shows a close-up of hands doing something on a table.
Fish Eyes  -  Crossed eyes look in separate directions away from each other.
Blind Date  -  A date between two people who never have met each other before said date.
Overtook The Manga  -  An adaptation of an ongoing work quickly catches up with, or bypasses, the unfinished narrative of the original. Filler or a Gecko Ending may ensue.
Gone Swimming Clothes Stolen  -  A character's clothes are stolen whilst they swim/bathe.
Frazetta Man  -  The stereotypical "ape man", generally stupid, violent, and Always Chaotic Evil.
Insult Comic  -  A comedian whose style is based on the misfortunes and character flaws of others.
Physical Scars Psychological Scars  -  Scars symbolically represent mental trauma.
Ascended Fanboy  -  Promoted Fanboy, In-Universe: a fan of the heroes becomes part of their group.
Rainbow Speak  -  Plot-important words are highlighted.
Mr Exposition  -  He explains the plot.
The Quiet Game  -  A character tries to get someone to be quiet by turning it into a game.
Debt Detester  -  A character who always repays their debts, regardless of whom they owe.
I Am Spartacus  -  The Big Bad asks who's The Hero. The hero's allies all start claiming such in order to protect him.
So What Do We Do Now  -  An ordinary character is thrust into adventure. Then the adventure ends. Life suddenly becomes more unexciting.
Ominous Owl  -  Owls are creepy.
OOC Is Serious Business  -  They don't always act out of character. But when they do... something's wrong.
Money Spider  -  Defeated monsters inexplicably leave behind currency.
I Have A Family  -  Character begs for mercy by saying they have a family to take care of.
Increasingly Lethal Enemy  -  The longer the fight lasts, the more dangerous this character gets.
Buddy Picture  -  A story about buddies.
Invisible Monsters  -  A monster that you cannot see.
Holiday Ceasefire  -  A temporary truce for the holidays.
A Glass Of Chianti  -  The villain has a drink while lounging on his throne.
Noble Savage  -  People are better without civilization.
Blood Splattered Innocents  -  Nothing says "Break the Cutie" like getting covered in blood.
Good Is Boring  -  In Balance Between Good and Evil stories, people confuse Good with Order.
Advert Overloaded Future  -  Ads will be everywhere in the future.
Conspiracy Theorist  -  Sees conspiracies behind everything.
Let Her Grow Up Dear  -  A mother encourages her husband to let their "little girl" grow up.
Monstrous Germs  -  Pathogens look like monsters up close!
Earth Is A Battlefield  -  The whole Earth is used for battle.
Even Better Sequel  -  A follow-up is considered superior to the original, when the original was already good.
The Bear  -  A rugged, burly, usually very hairy gay guy.
Batman In My Basement  -  Child has to hide a character from people looking for them and their parents.
Matchlight Danger Revelation  -  Never light a match in the dark to find out exactly where you are. The results will not be pretty.
Sucks At Dancing  -  This character thinks they've got all the right moves. They're the only one.
Attack Animal  -  A non-human attacks for their master.
Love Doodles  -  A character in love absentmindedly draws symbols of love and scribbles their crush's initials or their names together.
Putting The Medic In Comedic  -  A comedy set in the medical profession.
Color Coded Elements  -  Elemental game entities with a characteristic color.
Gecko Ending  -  An ending of an adaptation that cleans up all the loose ends of the unfinished original.
Chainsaw Grip BFG  -  An oversized man-portable gun is wielded using a top-mounted foregrip and buttstock-mounted rear grip.
Homesickness Hymn  -  A depressed character far from home sings about their homesickness.
Regional Bonus  -  Extra content added to a later release in another country.
Not So Above It All  -  When the serious-minded, no-fun Straight Man who has maintained dignity with a straight face suddenly relaxes and joins in the fun.
Horrible Housing  -  A small, messy, cramped home that emphasizes the poverty of its inhabitants.
Why Cant I Hate You  -  Person finds themselves unable to dislike someone despite having multiple reasons to.
Love Triangle  -  In love, two's company; three's a crowd.
One Head Taller  -  Common height difference between fictional couples.
Fire Ice Duo  -  One controls fire and one controls ice
Personality Powers  -  Superpowers align to thematically appropriate personalities.
Country Music  -  Genre of music known for usage of acoustic guitars, lyrics centering around Southern things and other things, and cowboy hats.
Artistic License Physics  -  The creator of a work of fiction plays with the basic laws of physics in order to make the story work better.
Hot Springs Episode  -  Using resorts as an excuse for Fanservice.
The Movie  -  A work is given a film adaptation.
Godiva Hair  -  Her hair keeps her modest.
You Are Too Late  -  ...to stop the villain.
Healing Magic Is The Hardest  -  Magic makes everything easy—except healing a living body.
Obstructive Bureaucrat  -  A bureaucrat who hinders others with paperwork, for better or worse.
Promotion To Parent  -  The oldest child takes it upon themselves to parent their younger siblings.
Mythology Gag  -  Reference to another work from the same franchise.
Historical Villain Upgrade  -  A work's portrayal of a historical villain is heavily modified from the real-life figure the character is based on.
Improperly Paranoid  -  Instead of living with a mild fear, a person makes very bad decisions.
Role Reversal Boss  -  A Boss Battle where the player controls the boss character instead of the normal Player Character.
Bigger Is Better In Bed  -  Large penis = amazing sex.
Only Shop In Town  -  There's only one shop in a town.
Unexpected Inheritance  -  Someone is shocked they'll get a massive inheritance from someone they never met in person or in some cases, even knew existed.
Victory By First Blood  -  A duel's victor is the first one to make their opponent bleed.
I Am Not Weasel  -  An anthropomorphic character is mistaken for something similar.
Appeal To Consequences  -  This would be terrible if true, so it must be false.
Death Or Glory Attack  -  A move that will win the fight... or lose it.
Died In Your Arms Tonight  -  Cradling a dying person in your arms.
Non Lethal Bottomless Pits  -  This pit sends you back should you fall in it, with no cost to your lives.
