Barsetshire  -  A generic rural portion of a given place where generally nothing really happens.
Superhero Paradox  -  Do superheroes cause as many disasters as they prevent?
Pivotal Wakeup  -  A character (usually a vampire) wakes up by levitating up at a 90 degree angle.
Astro Clone  -  An expy of Astro of Astro Boy.
Big Ol Eyebrows  -  Really big eyebrows.
Bratty Food Demand  -  Demanding food in a rude way.
Nice Job Breaking It Hero  -  The hero does something and it turns out they shouldn't have.
Stingy Jack  -  A character in Irish folklore who tricked himself out of Heaven and Hell alike and was doomed to wander the world forever with a jack-o-lantern to light his way.
Hearing Voices  -  A character hears voices talking to them. The voices may be good or bad.
Plotline Death  -  Cutscene deaths are permanent, and cannot be undone in game.
Perma Shave  -  For some reason, this guy is always clean-shaven.
Black And Nerdy  -  A nerd who's black.
Let Me Get This Straight  -  Stock Phrase used to summarize an explanation.
Death Of A Child  -  Stories dealing with child death.
Water Is Dry  -  When a character gets out of water, they are still dry.
Reinventing The Wheel  -  Those upgrades you researched don't carry over between campaign missions.
Skill Scores And Perks  -  How RPG characters' skills work in terms of Game Mechanics.
Crashing Dreams  -  A dream and the situation simultaneously occurring to the dreamer (in the real world) coincide by copying each other.
Delightful Dragon  -  A nice, friendly dragon.
Made In Country X  -  Geographical stereotypes applied to manufacturing and entertainment quality.
You All Meet In An Inn  -  The adventure begins by the heroes meeting in an inn.
Advantage Ball  -  One side holds an absolute advantage temporarily, usually because of higher morale.
Completely Unnecessary Translator  -  When a translator is around but not really needed.
Farm Life Sim  -  Games about the life of a farmer.
We Can Rule Together  -  The villain tells the hero to ally with him.
Sexy Whatever Outfit  -  It doesn't matter what the clothes are — you can turn them into fanservice.
Air Jousting  -  Jousting - a duel where two people crash into each other - IN THE SKY!
Beige Prose  -  Few words.
Nailed To The Wagon  -  Someone is forced to abstain from their addiction by others.
Epigraph  -  A quote of some (usually) great work that appears right before the book starts.
Check Please  -  The Trope: A comedic phrase said in dinners or similar when the character either wants to get the hell out of dodge or is about to get lucky.
Do You Want To Copulate  -  Outright asking someone to have sex with you as a way of greeting.
Book Burning  -  Destroying books to destroy free thought.
In And Out Of Character  -  Time stops when RPG players chatter over game mechanics.
Jousting Lance  -  The heavy lance associated with European knights, or weapons based on the same.
Unsound Effect  -  Non-sounds shown as sound-effects in print.
Good Samaritan  -  A person does a good deed simply for others' well-being.
Shared Universe  -  Different works, same setting.
Evil Phone  -  A phone that should not be answered.
The Woman Wearing The Queenly Mask  -  She forsakes her individuality to become the perfect, distant, ruthless leader her people need her to be.
Scooby Stack  -  A group peeks around a wall with all their heads inexplicably in a column.
Surrender Backfire  -  Surrendering when you were better off fighting on.
Battle In The Rain  -  A fight takes place in the rain.
Better Manhandle The Murder Weapon  -  An innocent person is incriminated when they're found holding the murder weapon.
Privateer  -  A Pirate employed by the government to prey on its enemies.
Living Motion Detector  -  It can only see you when you're moving.
Finders Rulers  -  I possess the Macguffin, therefore I'm in charge.
Radial Ass Kicking  -  Enemies surround you.
Excuse Question  -  Competitions that only involve a very easy question to answer for entry.
Player Exclusive Mechanic  -  Player-exclusive game actions.
Just Woke Up That Way  -  Undergoing a sudden physical transformation while asleep.
G Rated Drug  -  Something that isn't a drug is treated like one.
Jurassic Farce  -  A parody of Jurassic Park, specifically the 1993 film adaptation thereof.
Good Bad Translation  -  Poor translation reaches memetic status.
Socially Awkward Hero  -  A character who is more afraid of social situations than of actual dangers to life and limb.
Empathic Healer  -  Taking others' wounds to heal them.
Nature Abhors A Virgin  -  If a character is stated to be a virgin, the plot will try to change that.
The Quarterback  -  Character archetype - the effective captain who is usually nicer than his teammates.
Tomboy With A Girly Streak  -  A rough-and-tumble tomboy has a (usually unexpected) feminine side.
Outside Genre Foe  -  An antagonist that really doesn't fit the genre of the medium it's featured in.
Hero Does Public Service  -  Hero helps out in the community when not busy with their day job.
Golf Clubbing  -  Using a golf club as a weapon.
Dirty Rap  -  Rap about pornographic sex, in explicit detail.
Exhausted Eye Bags  -  A character is shown with eye bags after lacking some sleep.
Proportional Aging  -  Living beings gradually grow and develop physical signs of aging across their entire lifespans at respective rates to other species/races.
Predator Prey Friendship  -  Two species who normally share a predator-prey relationship make friends with one another.
Crafted From Animals  -  Non-food based materials, such as clothing or weapons, made from animal parts.
Pseudo Crisis  -  A threat that seems big but is easily resolved.
Monster Lord  -  The betitled Leaders of a race of monsters.
Rewarded As A Traitor Deserves  -  A traitor is rewarded with betrayal in turn.
Creator Thumbprint  -  The "signature" of a particular creator.
The Lethal Connotation Of Guns And Others  -  Throw around swords and axes all you like, bullet wounds are lethal.
Sea Mine  -  A stationary explosive device used against naval units.
Firemen Are Hot  -  Hot firemen: Classic female fantasy.
Good Bad Girl  -  A good-hearted woman who unapologetically enjoys promiscuous sex.
Meeting The Parents Sequel  -  The sequel introduces the parent or parents of a main character.
Thanks For The Mammary  -  Accidental breast groping.
Duality Motif  -  Mismatched elements of appearance foreshadow/reinforce a dual nature.
And Here He Comes Now  -  An absent character someone talks about immediately enters not even a few seconds after mention.
Fake Mixed Race  -  The character is of mixed race, but their portrayer isn't.
Lawful Pushover  -  They have authority, but they'll break some rules for you if you intimidate them enough.
Obsessive Love Letter  -  A disturbing love letter.
The Nth Doctor  -  New actor playing the same character is explained in-universe.
Honey Trap  -  An attractive character who seduces others to gain some advantage over them.
Giant Eye Of Doom  -  A giant eye staring at someone.
Depraved Homosexual  -  A psychotic and predatory gay man.
A Darker Me  -  You, Darker and Edgier.
Internal Affairs  -  In law enforcement, they're the watchers' watchers.
Death Seeker  -  A character wishes to die but isn't willing to actually commit suicide, instead welcoming any "opportunity" to be killed.
Balkanize Me  -  A larger country splits into multiple smaller ones.
Gate Of Truth  -  A gate that holds the knowledge and secrets of the universe
Stepping Stone Sword  -  Sticking bladed weapons into a wall and using them as platforms.
Gravity Is Purple  -  Gravity is associated with the color purple.
Import Filter  -  When countries import only things that will sell, and as a result, are usually of good quality.
Depth Deception  -  OBJECTS IN TROPE ARE CLOSER/FARTHER THAN THEY APPEAR
Stalked By The Bell  -  A Timed Mission where a great threat becomes active once time runs out.
Selling The Show  -  The cast and crew praise the show and their coworkers, no matter how they actually feel.
Good Cannot Comprehend Evil  -  A hero who doesn't understand what makes the villain evil.
First Contact Math  -  Trying to establish First Contact with aliens by using math.
Black Metal  -  Rock Me, Asmodeus! personified.
What Do You Mean Its Phlebotinum  -  It's a form of Applied Phlebotinum. And not only do we not know how to use it, we consider a pretty normal substance
The Scapegoat  -  Someone is blamed for something they didn't do.
Human Sacrifice  -  A human is sacrificed for a greater good (e.g. pleasing a god, powering a Living Battery). Usually depicted as evil.
Falling In Love Montage  -  A montage that shows the process of falling in love.
Morality Dial  -  When a being's morality depends on a literal switch.
Anonymous Benefactor  -  An aid given to a character by an unknown identity (At least at the moment).
Master Apprentice Chain  -  As Alice was Bob's instructor, Bob is Charlie's instructor, and Charlie will be Debbie's instructor.
No Gear Level  -  Why make it continuously stronger enemies when you make a temporarily weaker protagonist?
The Dog Is An Alien  -  An alien disguises itself as someone's "ordinary" pet.
Time Loop Trap  -  A character is intentionally placed into a stable time loop to defeat/trap them.
Counter Attack  -  An attack that won't start until you get hit first.
Emergency Broadcast  -  Oh, Crap! Life just got worse for someone out there, possibly you if you're hearing this.
Death By Despair  -  Intense sadness affects someone's health to a point they just die outright.
Democracy Is Bad  -  Voting doesn't get anything done.
V Sign  -  V for "Victory".
Kneel Before Zod  -  Villain forces or demands a hero to bow/kneel before them.
Clueless Detective  -  This detective is useless.
Big Beautiful Woman  -  A fat woman portrayed as attractive.
Dont Shoot The Message  -  A good message is brought down by a bad delivery.
Smurfette Breakout  -  The female character becomes really popular.
Good Is Not Nice  -  A character is heroic in nature, but still rather intolerable.
Gone Horribly Right  -  A huge success with unfavorable consequences.
Being Evil Sucks  -  Being evil isn't cool. Instead, it just makes your life worse.
As Himself  -  Bob the Actor is actually playing Bob the Actor.
Guy On Guy Is Hot  -  Straight women are turned on by male homosexuality: It's the gender they like, plus some more of the gender they like.
Silent Treatment  -  Punishing someone by ignoring them.
Functional Genre Savvy  -  Knowing just enough about what type of a story you're in to actually advance the plot.
Never Live It Down  -  Defined by one past action or mistake.
Apocalypse How  -  A catastrophe occurs on a scale anywhere between localized and the destruction of reality itself.
Skip The Anesthetic  -  A person chooses not to have painkillers before a procedure.
Your Television Hates You  -  Someone is unhappy and they try watching the TV but everything that's broadcasting reminds them of their reason for the unhappiness.
Useless Without Powers  -  Remove their powers and they're useless.
People Farms  -  Farming humans in a barn.
Contemporary Caveman  -  A caveman in a modern-day setting.
Secondary Color Nemesis  -  Green, orange, and purple. The Color Motif of villains.
Vestigial Empire  -  The Empire is long past its prime.
Rules Spiel  -  A scripted explanation of a game show's rules, often said each day.
Artifact Of Doom  -  An artifact which contains powers that are purely evil.
Field Promotion  -  A character achieves a higher rank while on deployment.
Creator Preferred Adaptation  -  A creator prefers another's rendition of his work over his original version.
Milholland Relationship Moment  -  Something that one character thinks would ruin their relationship turns out to not be a big deal for the other, at all.
Early Adaptation Weirdness  -  The older adaptations look much different than the newer ones.
Id Tell You But Then Id Have To Kill You  -  Someone has a secret that's so great, that if he told anyone, he'd have to kill them.
Not So Abandoned Building  -  Abandoned outside, active inside.
Ledge Bats  -  Enemies that try to knock you into pits.
Cue The Flying Pigs  -  A verbal put-down Tempts Fate.
Unlimited Wardrobe  -  Never wearing the same thing twice.
Covered In Gunge  -  Getting a face full of gunk.
Unfinished Untested Used Anyway  -  An untested tool is put to use at the insistence of higher-ups.
Concealment Equals Cover  -  In fiction, being hidden from sight by whatever obstruction always means you're safe from weapons fire.
Throwing Out The Script  -  Preparing a big speech for some sort of ceremony, but at the last minute tossing it aside and deciding to speak from the heart.
Time Travel  -  Traveling through time.
Person With The Clothing  -  Someone is referred to as the X with the Y, where the Y is a piece of clothing.
Break Up Demand  -  I forced you to break up. Hmmph!
Angst Coma  -  A character is filled with so much Angst the completely lose consciousness.
If You Taunt Him You Will Be Just Like Him  -  Getting back at bullying characters leads the character in Jumping Off the Slippery Slope.
The Last Title  -  Having the word "Last" somewhere in the title of a work.
Elemental Powers  -  The ability to control the elements of nature.
Really Seventeen Years Old  -  A minor pretends to be an adult.
Morph Weapon  -  Weapon can change form.
Permanently Missable Content  -  Content in a video game that you can't access past a certain point. Usually requires starting over to get it.
Innocent Beta Bitch  -  A friend of the Alpha Bitch who isn't as mean as the alpha.
Elvis Impersonator  -  Someone who imitates the King of Rock and Roll, either for fun or a living.
Forgotten Theme Tune Lyrics  -  Wait, this song had lyrics?
Platform Hell  -  Nearly unwinnable fake difficulty-ridden Platform Game subgenre designed to continuously troll the player.
Feel No Pain  -  A person doesn't feel pain.
No Sense Of Personal Space  -  Character gets way too close for comfort around others.
The Casanova  -  The often heartless "love 'em and leave 'em" seducer.
Mistaken For Cheating  -  A character is mistakenly thought to be cheating on their partner.
The Captain  -  The person in charge of and responsible for a vessel, its crew, passengers, and everything that happens with it.
Episode Of The Dead  -  A single episode or Story Arc of a series with zombies as the Monster of the Week.
Innocent Swearing  -  A character uses a swear word without realizing it's offensive.
Die Chair Die  -  You can interact with your environment, but only by smashing it.
Spiders Are Scary  -  Nope! Spiders in my media? Nope!
Armchair Military  -  Military leaders who lead from behind. Really far behind.
Names The Same  -  Two characters from different works (or even franchises) happen to have the same name by coincidence.
Adoring The Pests  -  A character loves rats, spiders, termites, anything that's normally an unwanted house guest.
Fear Song  -  Someone sings about their fears or anxieties.
Aerosol Flamethrower  -  A lit up aerosol that's surprisingly effective.
First Girl After All  -  A character's love interest introduced after a perceived "first girl" turns out to have met them first after all.
Inelegant Blubbering  -  Blatant, often gross sobbing.
The Comically Serious  -  Serious-minded person is put into non-serious situations and Played for Laughs.
Consequence Combo  -  The hero is both offered a reward for going on adventure and threatened with punishment for not doing so.
Fight Off The Kryptonite  -  Overcoming Kryptonite Factor with Heroic Willpower.
Straw Critic  -  An obnoxiously subjective critic.
Downer Beginning  -  The story starts off by bumming you out with a sad or depressing note.
Forging The Will  -  A character tampers with the content of a will to get a more favourable portion of the inheritance.
Bequeathed Power  -  Passing your power onto another at death.
Not Quite The Right Thing  -  Doing the "right thing" sometimes has unintended consequences.
Screening The Call  -  A character prevents the hero from answering the Call to Adventure by hiding it from them.
Nom De Mom  -  A character uses their mother's maiden name as their own last name, despite being allowed to use the father's name.
Unrealistic Black Hole  -  A black hole with strange properties.
Butt Monkey  -  Things very rarely go right for this character.
While Rome Burns  -  The End of the World as We Know It? Might as well spend my last days having fun.
Aloof Dark Haired Girl  -  An aloof or composed, attractive female character with dark hair. She's usually tall, has long hair and is popular among her peers.
Spit Out A Shoe  -  A character is Eaten Alive, and the thing or person that ate them spits out their Iconic Item.
Circus Of Magic  -  This circus is magic.
All Gays Are Promiscuous  -  The stereotypical gay man Really Gets Around.
We Interrupt This Program  -  A program getting interrupted by an Emergency Broa-
Inevitable Waterfall  -  When floating down a river, the danger of falling off a waterfall is a certainty.
There Is A God  -  A phrase when something happens that can only point to the existence of a deity.
Trauma Button  -  One character inadvertently triggers another character's emotional trauma.
Kindness Button  -  Certain things that make a character pleasant.
Thug Dojo  -  A martial arts school that teaches its pupils to maim people at whim.
Fence Painting  -  Tricking others into making something mundane look awesome.
Slave Market  -  A place where people gather to buy and sell slaves.
Theme Song Reveal  -  Chekhov's Gun in the form of music.
Single Episode Handicap  -  A character suffers a handicap that only lasts for one episode.
Hybrid Monster  -  Monster is a hybrid of other monsters.
A Planet Named Zok  -  Pronounceable alien planet (and other) names that use high-scoring consonants in Scrabble.
Armed Farces  -  Military humor.
Our Giants Are Bigger  -  Large beings that resemble humans.
Legacy Boss Battle  -  Boss fight from one game appears in another game as a bonus boss.
Non Elemental  -  A "neutral" element that often falls outside of Elemental RockPaperScissors.
Eye Of Newt  -  Unusual ingredients for creating magical recipes.
Heartwarming Orphan  -  Audiences tend to like onscreen orphans just for being orphans.
Trapped In TV Land  -  A group of characters are trapped inside the world of a Show Within a Show.
Pointless Civic Project  -  Government project that develops something useless.
Master Forger  -  A master at creating counterfeit objects.
The Mc Coy  -  The emotional and sentimentalistic character. Logic be damned.
Foreign Queasine  -  National dishes that don't look/taste so great from outside their home country.
Destination Defenestration  -  Someone is thrown through a window, often from a great height and to their death.
Twist Ending  -  Subversion of presupposed ending.
Frames Of Reference  -  Type of glasses tells about the personality of the wearer.
Everybody Do The Endless Loop  -  Looping frames of characters in an animation and calling it "dancing".
Delivery Not Desired  -  An emotional letter someone writes but never sends
Face Fault  -  An instantaneous collapse as a reaction to something absurd.
All Genes Are Codominant  -  All traits mix 50/50 in fiction.
Mister Sandman Sequence  -  Iconic cultural references are shown to indicate the action is set in a given historical period.
Formerly Fat  -  A character who's in shape now reveals they used to be overweight.
Childhood Friends  -  Childhood friends are more special than normal ones.
Entitled Bastard  -  Jerkass who made The Hero's life a living hell, yet expect him/her to help them.
Word Of God  -  The creator personally sets the record straight.
Stylish Action  -  Dare to Be Badass action games that want you to master their combat and reward you when you do.
Chronic Villainy  -  Villain always reverts to evil ways, despite numerous attempts to reform.
Squishy Wizard  -  With great magical power comes low physical endurance.
Embarrassing Damp Sheets  -  A character has a Potty Failure in bed, bleeds in bed, or has a Wet Dream.
Dramatic Irony  -  The audience knows something the characters don't, and this is Played for Drama or Laughs.
Bold Explorer  -  A Seeker in search of new vistas, new lands and new worlds.
Hallucinations  -  Seeing surreal environments as a cause of madness, hunger, etc.
The Diss Track  -  A targeted insult in song form.
Western Samurai  -  Samurai of partial or full non-Japanese descent.
Ghetto Name  -  Odd names associated with low-income black Americans.
Doppelganger Spin  -  Creating multiple illusions that are clones of the spellcaster.
Flashed Badge Hijack  -  Carjacking is okay if you're a heroic authority figure.
Bizarre Taste In Food  -  When a certain character regularly makes food choices that seem... odd.
Bullfight Boss  -  A boss that keeps charging at you.
Unlockable Difficulty Levels  -  You've beaten the game... now you've gained the right to do it on a harder difficulty setting.
Archangel Raphael  -  One of the archangels, usually depicted with a water flask.
Tired Of Running  -  It's time to stop running and start kicking ass.
Humans Are Diplomats  -  Humanity's hat is being mediators.
Mental Story  -  What's going on in someone's head is the focus of the plot.
Improbable Parking Skills  -  A character can park a vehicle in an usual way or place with little effort.
You Make Me Sic  -  People sideline their current discussion or actions to correct grammar.
Excited Title Two Part Episode Name  -  A descriptive Anime episode title! With two phrases and some exclamation points!!
Episode Zero The Beginning  -  0 = shorthand for a prequel work, a prologue work, or a remake of a first installment. Basically, the beginnings of something.
Guinea Pig Family  -  A Mad Scientist experiments on their own family.
Death Metal  -  (Usually) Gorn-eriffic Heavy Metal that makes use of grunts, growls, screams, and pigsqueals. A very polarizing subgenre, and possibly the biggest thing amongst metalheads since thrash metal. Also what people think about heavy metal and what concerned parents hate.
More Dakka  -  Drowning your enemy in bullets.
Pregnant Reptile  -  A non-mammal bears live young.
America Won World War II  -  America is framed as the heroes of World War II, usually to lord it over everybody else.
Unknown Relative  -  The identity of a close relative of a major character is unknown to the characters and/or audience.
Mayor Of A Ghost Town  -  The only person in town After the End.
Chimney Entry  -  A character uses the chimney to enter or leave a building.
Pushover Parents  -  Parents who don't discipline their children for certain reasons.
Healing Winds  -  Healing abilities associated with air/wind.
Sick And Wrong  -  The human response of finding something to be incredibly disturbing.
The Singularity  -  Accelerating change goes asymptotic, things get crazy.
Crying After Sex  -  Two characters have sex, and afterwards one or both of them cry.
Cat And Mouse Boss  -  Boss chases you around until you get something to beat him.
Everyone Meets Everyone  -  The series' main cast first meet each other in the first episode.
Barehanded Blade Block  -  A character is able to stop a moving blade by catching it with their bare hand(s) without sustaining any serious injuries.
Government Conspiracy  -  The government is evil (or dangerously pragmatic) and wants to do something secret.
Fly At The Camera Ending  -  End the movie or whatever with a frame of someone/something flying right at the camera.
Breaking The Fellowship  -  All the members of a team go their separate ways.
Right Way Wrong Way Pair  -  A teaching setup, where one character does things the wrong way and one does things the right way.
Contralto Of Danger  -  The deeper a female character's voice is, the more threat she can pose.
Toxic Friend Influence  -  A friend who has a negative influence on another friend.
The Hero Sucks Song  -  A song that disses the hero.
Deconstruction  -  Story explores a trope's realistic assumptions, flaws, consequences, and/or origins.
Weaponized Exhaust  -  As long as a spaceship has functional engines, it is never truly unarmed.
Female Monster Surprise  -  Finding out a monster is female and being surprised.
The Dark Side Will Make You Forget  -  A good guy uses the powers of The Dark Side for good ends, but over time becomes a villain.
Popularity Polynomial  -  Something once considered a fad is now popular once more.
Adorably Precocious Child  -  A young child who is considered cute because they try to act mature and responsible beyond their years.
Bear Hug  -  A character (usually The Big Guy) gives a hug to another character.
Serial Romeo  -  He's not The Casanova, he just falls in love with every girl he meets.
Shoot The Money  -  We spent lots of money on this thing, so we're gonna use it as much as possible!
Cranium Chase  -  A character's body chases after their severed or separated head.
Brownface  -  White actors pretending to be brown people.
Ad Break Double Take  -  Characters feel the need to repeat themselves after a commercial.
The Simple Life Is Simple  -  Farming is much easier to learn in fiction than it is in reality.
Slave Collar  -  A character wears a collar to show they're a slave.
Badass In A Nice Suit  -  A badass showing his professionalism by wearing a nice suit.
Our Alebrijes Are Different  -  Alebrijes (of Mexican Folk-Art) as portrayed in fiction.
Winged Unicorn  -  Equine life form with wings and a horn.
Slipping A Mickey  -  Putting a knockout chemical into someone's drink.
Political Correctness Gone Mad  -  Overly obsessed with not being offensive.
Widget Series  -  A series that doesn't make much sense outside of the culture of its country of origin, and is used in other countries as indicative of that culture's strangeness.note "Widget" comes from the acronym Weird Japanese Thing.
Im Not Afraid Of You  -  A character empowered by faith or fear is defeated when another resolves to quit believing in or fearing it.
Subterranean Index  -  An index of tropes about underground environments.
Badass Normal  -  He doesn't have powers, but can keep up with those who do.
Asbestos Free Cereal  -  An inconsequential trait is treated by the advertising as if it was something awesome and unique.
Legendary Weapon  -  Weapon of Yore Lore.
Retroactive Idiot Ball  -  A plot development introduced in a later installment of a series accidentally makes the actions of a character in an earlier installment, which were sound before, now seem illogical.
Heroic Heelization Speech  -  The hero admits that he doesn't care if his actions are evil.
Accidental Innuendo  -  It actually isn't what they meant.
Rabble Rouser  -  The guy who stirs a mob up to act with his words and/or actions.
You No Take Candle  -  Us talks good but no have complex grammar.
Latino Is Brown  -  Everyone from Central and South America has brown (but not black) skin and hair.
Witch Doctor  -  The tribe's resident shaman, healer and badass wizard!
Lord Of The Ocean  -  Gods, spirits and other powerful entities holding dominion over the seas, oceans and/or other territories with bodies of water.
Longing For Fictionland  -  It's not real, but someone, really wishes it was.
First Law Of Tragicomedies  -  Tension ∝ Drama; Tension ∝ 1/Comedy.
Birthday Party Goes Wrong  -  Someone's birthday goes horribly wrong.
The Unsolved Mystery  -  The story ends without giving the clear answer/explanation for something mesquite that happens in plot.
Taking The Fight Outside  -  Two character who are fighting or about to fight in a building are demanded by a bystander to continue their brawl outside.
Drool Deluge  -  Excessively productive saliva glands.
Meaningful Name  -  You don't have that name for nothing.
The Power Of Rock  -  Nothing can defeat a mad guitar riff!
Fan Boy  -  A boy who is a fan of something. Can be used in a neutral or pejorative sense. The main page is about stereotypical fanboys.
Money Sink  -  Expensive goods for soaking your extra money.
Reviewer Stock Phrases  -  The sophomoric cliches in the reviewers writing in attempt to transcend the boundaries of writing.
Scry Vs Scry  -  When dueling Seers start trying to counter each other's plans.
Mohs Scale Of Lyrical Hardness  -  A scale used to determine how child-friendly or ugly a song or artists' lyrics are.
Encouraged Regifting  -  Giving someone a gift specifically so it can be regifted to another person.
Flowery Elizabethan English  -  Non-Elizabethan characters speak like they stepped out of a Shakespearian play.
Cheek Copy  -  Photocopying one's own buttocks.
Fox News Liberal  -  Opposing opinions as Informed Attribute.
Equal Opportunity Evil  -  Evil organization that doesn't discriminate based on race, gender, or creed.
Unable To Cry  -  A character is incapable of crying in response to a tragedy.
Bloodier And Gorier  -  Tone Shift increasing the Gorn.
Her Code Name Was Mary Sue  -  A character in the story creates a Mary Sue character for themselves.
And I Must Scream  -  A never-ending Fate Worse than Death from which there is no escape, not even suicide.
Poison Is Evil  -  The use of poison is seen as a villainous trait.
Popular History  -  When a piece of fiction focuses on one, or several, popular aspects of a decade.
Lovable Traitor  -  A character with a likable personality and a penchant for betrayal.
Rock Bottom  -  Well, it can't get any worse. (Wanna bet?)
Sadist  -  A character who enjoys the pain and suffering of others.
The Kingslayer  -  Ruler murderer.
Actually I Am Him  -  That person you're looking for? You're talking to them.
Themed Stock Board Game  -  A well-known board game gets a special edition based on a work of fiction
Chekhovs Exhibit  -  If attention is called to a well-protected valuable object on display, it's gonna get stolen before the end of the episode.
Teleport Interdiction  -  Screwing with and exploiting Teleportation at the expense of those who use them.
Deadly Environment Prison  -  Prison where the surrounding's area is more dangerous and impassable than any guards or walls.
Order Reborn  -  A disbanded organization is reestablished.
Randomly Generated Loot  -  Equipment is made with random stats, though still within what was programmed.
Cave Mouth  -  The entrance to a cave looks like a big mouth.
Durable Deathtrap  -  Ancient deathtraps still work perfectly despite going thousands of years without maintenance.
Cozy Mystery  -  A sub-genre of Mystery Fiction where an Amateur Sleuth solves crimes in a small community.
A Taste Of Defeat  -  The Born Winner loses for once.
Hegemonic Empire  -  The Empire persuades other nations to join it instead of forcing them to.
Lightning Gun  -  Shock and Awe in handgun-form.
Surreal Horror  -  Strange images that are portrayed as a means to frighten the audience.
Thrown From The Zeppelin  -  You don't like my plan, you say? Then you can just die.
Shiksa Goddess  -  Jewish boy meets non-jewish girl.
Scary Teeth  -  A character with nasty or disturbing teeth.
Science At The Speed Of Plot  -  Science, engineering, and even building technological wonders don't take any time, because taking time is boring.
You Shall Not Pass  -  Character sacrifices himself to hold back an enemy.
A Simple Plan  -  ...that never goes as smoothly as you thought it would.
Character Filibuster  -  A character just can't stop talking.
Hero With An F In Good  -  Great intentions, they just suck at being good.
Permanent Placeholder  -  Something intended as a temporary placeholder during production is kept for the final thing.
You Were Trying Too Hard  -  Trying really hard at something, then succeeding only after giving up.
Canis Major  -  VERY BIG DOG.
Kuudere  -  Aloof and apathetic on the outside, sweet and kind on the inside.
Hacked By A Pirate  -  Hackers using pirate imagery as their Calling Card.
Riddle For The Ages  -  A more serious Noodle Incident or What Happened to the Mouse? moment that is meant to never be answered, discussed, or resolved.
Lets Just Be Friends  -  During the relationship, one of the people in a couple tells the other they should just be friends.
Sexy Secretary  -  The secretary who's a hottie.
Recurring Boss  -  A boss who keeps coming back in this one game.
High Pressure Blood  -  Blood does not shoot out of people like that.
Adults Dressed As Children  -  Adults disguise themselves as children to fool the audience.
The Roadie  -  A person employed by a touring band of musicians to set up and maintain equipment.
Literally Loving Thy Neighbor  -  Someone's crush lives next to them.
Art Reflects Personality  -  An artist's work shows what's going on in their head and/or heart.
Screams Like A Little Girl  -  A person (mainly male) gives a girly scream out of joy or fear.
Losing Your Head  -  Non-fatal decapitation.
Exposition Fairy  -  Expository sidekick.
Pet The Dog  -  A kind act reveals that an outwardly mean character is tender and caring inside.
No Song For The Wicked  -  Though it's a musical, the villain doesn't get a Villain Song.
Caught With Your Pants Down  -  Someone gets caught doing masturbation.
Terraform  -  A planet's enviroment is artificially changed to better suit a species, human-like or otherwise.
The Ugly Guys Hot Daughter  -  An ugly guy has an inexplicably attractive daughter.
Clueless Contributor  -  A Clueless Contributor might make the Laconic page longer than the unabridged article.
Christmas Cake  -  An adult single woman from Japan worried about not being married at her relatively young age.
With Lyrics  -  Songs that don't need lyrics, but they added them, anyway.
Deadline News  -  A news reporter dies on the air.
Dateline  -  News program on NBC that is mostly known for To Catch A Predator.
Canned Orders Over Loudspeaker  -  Broadcasting propaganda wherever possible, however possible.
Top Wife  -  In polyamory, the one spouse to rule them all.
Credits Pushback  -  Compressing or editing the credits of a show to show promos.
Super Robot Genre  -  Through the Rule of Cool, I am a Humongous Mecha.
Playing A Tree  -  Someone plays as a prop.
Meta Sequel  -  A work gets a sequel that treats the original as a piece of in-universe fiction.
The Jeeves  -  Impeccable and hypercompetent manservant.
The Chosen Wannabe  -  The character is envious of the actual The Chosen One and wants to replace them.
Has A Type  -  A character who shows consistent preferences in their choice of romantic partners.
One World Order  -  A species / planet answers to a single government.
Incongruously Dressed Zombie  -  A zombie stands out because of its unusual clothing (or lack thereof).
Significant Green Eyed Redhead  -  An important character has green eyes and red hair that is meant to make them stand out.
Nice Day Deadly Night  -  Day is (at least relatively) peaceful and safe. Come nightfall though, you better be armed.
Living Hat  -  Why exactly is my hat acting like a human?
Mind Screw  -  Weirdness driven by symbolism, surrealism or absurdism, often lacking a clear explanation.
Suicide Not Murder  -  It wasn't murder, it was suicide.
Multi Animator Project  -  Reanimating scenes with over different artists using types of animation styles.
Lovable Sex Maniac  -  A character who has sex on the mind but is likable. Often Played for Laughs.
Emote Command  -  Self-expression actions in video games.
Gyaru Girl  -  Japanese subculture involving Western fashion trends, tanned skinned, and makeup.
Artistic License Martial Arts  -  Martial arts doesn't work that way. It still looks cool though.
Friend Or Foe  -  Wait, you're on my side? Uh...sorry about the ear....
Recruiting The Criminal  -  The heroes need one bad guy to help fight another bad guy.
Peaceful In Death  -  When someone is dying, they're left in peace.
Regretful Traitor  -  A traitor who is regretful.
The Sneaky Guy  -  Finds out things without being noticed.
Reverse Polarity  -  Techno Babble solves everything.
Society On Edge Episode  -  The characters have to deal with a recent specific disaster or threat to wherever they are living for the episode.
Returning The Wedding Ring  -  Giving back the ring = The relationship is over.
Recoil Boost  -  Propel self by firing gun.
Bickering Couple Peaceful Couple  -  One couple gets along great while another argues all the time.
Bat Out Of Hell  -  Monster bats.
Genetic Adaptation  -  Outsiders adapt to a hostile environment by genetically modifying themselves.
Wise Old Folk Facade  -  The seemingly helpful elder is secretly villainous.
Mage Killer  -  Badass Normal who specializes in killing practitioners of Functional Magic, usually via Anti-Magic or Power Nullifiers.
Mother Of A Thousand Young  -  A monster whose defining feature is that it spawned most of the different monsters in a setting.
Great Big Book Of Everything  -  A book with unlimited information.
Undermined By Reality  -  When something in the real world contradicts something (e.g, a moral message) in a (related) work of fiction.
Humble Parent Spoiled Kids  -  Rags to Riches parent remains a humble, down to earth person despite their money, while their kids are Spoiled Brats.
No Ontological Inertia  -  Something disappears because whatever brought it into existence disappears, even though it makes no sense.
Deliberately Distressed Damsel  -  A female character intentionally allows herself to be captured.
Right Hand Cat  -  Villain's sinister on-hand, non-fighting pet.
Money Fetish  -  An excessive love for money.
This Billboard Needs Some Salt  -  Giant monsters eating scenery they think is food.
Kids Play Matchmaker  -  A plotline in which children set up a parental figure with a love interest.
Torture Always Works  -  Torture as a reliable source of good information.
Nominal Importance  -  Names equal worth.
Life Or Limb Decision  -  Cutting off your limb to escape a trap that otherwise will take your life.
Winning Over The Kids  -  Stranger meets a single parent and wins their approval by getting along well with their child(ren).
Romantic Fake Real Turn  -  A faked romantic relationship becomes real.
Kid Appeal Character  -  A character whose existence relies on appealing to children.
Shock And Awe  -  Electricity-based (fire and air) Elemental Powers.
Politically Incorrect Villain  -  Kicks The Dog by being racist/sexist/Fantastic Racist/etc.
Single Issue Landlord  -  A landlord that obsesses over a tenant committing a specific violation, often nonsensical, and goes to ridiculous lengths to try to catch them at it.
Hitler Ate Sugar  -  If a bad person likes or does it, then it must therefore be bad, regardless of what it is.
Dragon Their Feet  -  The showdown against the Villain's right-hand man only happens after the villain falls.
Dream Match Game  -  Fighting Games whose roster include absolutely everyone from a series at the time, at the expense of canonicity.
The Band Minus The Face  -  A band tries to continue on without its most important member, to greatly variable results.
Nephewism  -  Raised by Grandparents but with an aunt and/or uncle in lieu of grandparents.
Jobber  -  Professional wrestler whose role is to lose to other wrestlers, to make them look good.
Officer And A Gentleman  -  A cultured, refined, polite, and honorable military officeholder.
Brains And Brawn  -  Someone with great intelligence teams up with someone who has great strength.
Kraken And Leviathan  -  Massive sea monsters.
Herbivores Are Friendly  -  Plant-eating animals are depicted as being peaceful, because obviously the only reason animals might be aggressive is because they want to eat you.
Kissing Discretion Shot  -  Off-screen kiss.
Best Woman  -  A female best man.
Chunky Salsa Rule  -  Even if you've got hit points left, the game rules acknowledge certain kinds of extreme trauma as instant death, possibly impeding revival as well.
Full Frontal Assault  -  Kicking ass while nude.
Censored Child Death  -  Child deaths are always offscreen.
Patient Zero  -  The original Zombie Infectee.
A Girl In Every Port  -  An adventurer has numerous romantic affairs throughout the world.
Eiffel Tower Effect  -  Sometimes the signature landmark is all you need to establish what location you're depicting.
Misanthrope Supreme  -  A (human) character who hates humanity and really means it.
The Power Of Love  -  Love conquers all. Literally.
Hilariously Abusive Childhood  -  Child abuse is Played for Laughs.
Cosplay  -  Dressing up as a fictional character.
Never Needs Sharpening  -  A major flaw with a product is spun to appear positive.
Conspiracy Placement  -  Fictional conspiracies want to be discovered.
Hellish Copter  -  If you see a helicopter in an action movie/game, chances are it's going down.
Let Off By The Detective  -  The detective figures out who committed a crime, but lets them off because they sympathize with their motive.
Babysitter From Hell  -  An abusive or incompetent babysitter.
Trainstopping  -  A moving train must be stopped as soon as possible.
Deadly Game  -  The rules of the game: You lose, You die.
Adaptation Origin Connection  -  Adaptation gives a villain a connection to The Hero.
Constructed World  -  A completely fictional setting with no connection to our world.
Dump Stat  -  Stat you skimp on so you can use the points elsewhere.
Five Aces Cheater  -  Cheating by doing something that is clearly not allowed or impossible.
Nameless Narrative  -  No characters in this story have proper names.
Impossible Item Drop  -  Enemies randomly drop items or loot that they could not plausibly have.
Crosses The Line Twice  -  Tasteless and funny at the same time.
Not So Badass Longcoat  -  Not all trenchcoats kick ass.
Memetic Psychopath  -  A character who's friendly, or sometimes a Harmless Villain, in canon, depicted as a vicious villain/psycho in fanon for laughs.
Artificial Afterlife  -  An afterlife created by mortals where either their souls or their minds can continue to exist after death.
Portmanteau Couple Name  -  Referring to a relationship by a mixture of the couple's names.
Dude Not Ironic  -  Calling out the wrong usage of Irony.
Thread Necromancer  -  One who resurrects the dead thread.
Only Idiots May Pass  -  If you know the way forward, you still must pretend you don't.
Gang Initiation Fight  -  Someone looking to join a gang is put into a fight to earn their place.
The Caligula  -  A dangerously insane ruler.
Soul Power  -  The power to literally manipulate souls.
With My Hands Tied  -  Even without getting out of his restraints, he can still mop the floor with you.
Reusable Lighter Toss  -  Wasting a perfectly good Zippo.
Fury Fueled Foolishness  -  Picking up the Idiot Ball out of pure anger, with inevitable consequences.
Some Dexterity Required  -  When player input in video games becomes too much for your fingers and/or hands to handle.
Dying To Be Replaced  -  A character is killed off so another can assume his/her role in the story.
Paintball Episode  -  Episode's plot is based on a paintball match (or something similar)
Author Avatar  -  A character representing the creator.
Inciting Incident  -  The event that sets the plot in motion.
Mysterious Stranger  -  A character with unclear alliances and goals.
The Rest Shall Pass  -  One good guy takes on an opponent alone, telling the rest to keep moving.
A Dog Ate My Homework  -  A kid explaining (whether or not it's true) why they didn't do their homework by saying their dog ate it.
Call A Smeerp A Rabbit  -  Giving made-up things real names.
Cool Big Sis  -  An older (usually) female is seen as cool to a younger person.
Superhero Speciation  -  No two superheroes will have the exact same powers.
Spirited Competitor  -  Character who loves competing, not just winning.
Repetitive Name  -  Given names are repeated.
Abandoned Warehouse  -  Big empty warehouses are good places for plot events to happen.
Hes Okay  -  A character correctly assesses that an injured character is okay despite having no medical training or supernatural way of knowing.
Surprise Vehicle  -  A vehicle that you should have been able to hear coming doesn't make any noise until it's in the frame.
Beware The Mind Reader  -  People with mind-reading powers aren't very selective with how they use them.
Ironic Echo Cut  -  The conversation cuts to someone addressing the same subject but in a different manner.
Troubled Production  -  A work that ran into major obstacles in getting made.
Dirty Harriet  -  A character poses as a sex worker to solve a case.
Barrier Maiden  -  She (or he) is the human key to the world's safety.
Power Stable  -  A gang of wrestlers.
Liminal Being  -  Not fully one thing, not fully another.
Mangled Catch Phrase  -  When an impostor can't get the character's Catchphrase right.
It Makes Sense In Context  -  Some story events can sound ridiculous if you didn't see the setup.
Dead Foot Leadfoot  -  Should someone get indisposed behind the wheel, their pedal foot involuntarily sends their ride careening on.
Multi Part Episode  -  An episode that is split into multiple parts.
Best Friend  -  The protagonist's closest associate and confidante.
Doomed Autographed Item  -  Autographed items are prone to being lost or destroyed.
Mook Lieutenant  -  A visually distinctive Mook who leads other mooks.
Demoted To Extra  -  Main character turned into a background object.
Divided States Of America  -  America's states split into independent territories.
Neverending Terror  -  A looming sense of ever-present doom with no sign of relenting.
Raging Stiffie  -  A boner for no good reason.
Sympathy For The Hero  -  A villain, morally grey character, or Innocent Bystander feels and expresses a moment of sympathy or pity for The Hero.
Badass Crew  -  Don't mess with this team.
Desolation Shot  -  A camera swoop over a once populated, now destroyed area.
The Noseless  -  A character doesn't have a nose at all.
Watch Out For That Tree  -  Trees (or similar large, immovable hazards) as primary obstacles for fast-moving characters.
One Drink Will Kill The Baby  -  Pregnant women shouldn't drink alcohol.
Unfinished Episode  -  An episode that was planned and sometimes produced, but never got its production concluded and shown on TV.
Aristocrat Team  -  A team comprised of nobility.
Angels Devils And Squid  -  The Armies of Heaven vs. The Legions of Hell vs. Eldritch Abominations (or any combination of the three)
Deliberately Jumping The Gun  -  Someone tries to get an advantage in a competition or fight by starting before the signal to go.
Monster Progenitor  -  This monster originally created its own bloodline.
Intimate Hair Brushing  -  A character's having their hair brushed as a sign of closeness
Threesome Subtext  -  Vague impressions of OT3.
Roadside Wave  -  Car drives on puddle and splashes a character.
Prince And Pauper  -  When two identical people meet it is compulsory for them to swap roles for a day.
Ferris Wheel Of Doom  -  A Ferris wheel breaks free and rolls away.
Force Field Door  -  A door made out of a force field.
Colorblind Casting  -  Characters are cast irrespective of race or age.
Rich Idiot With No Day Job  -  ...makes for a good Secret Identity, don't you think?
Unstoppable Rage  -  When anger turns deadly.
Beauty Is Bad  -  Beauty = Badness.
Master Archer  -  Someone noted for being an extremely good archer.
Anti Humor  -  Humor derived from the absence of a punchline, subverting the expected joke.
Power Copying  -  Obtaining enemy's powers by copying.
Just The Introduction To The Opposites  -  The roles in a stock situation are reversed without explanation.
Hired To Hunt Yourself  -  A person sent to hunt down The Mole actually is The Mole.
Unbroken First Person Perspective  -  The use of a continuous first-person perspective (particularly in video games), even in situations where using a third-person perspective is the norm.
Vignette Episode  -  An episode that consists of several mini-episodes.
Word Sequel  -  Sequels follow, Name, Name II, Name III, Name: Word.
Shameful Shrinking  -  A character shrinks due to embarrassment and shame.
Only Mostly Dead  -  A hero that appeared to die is actually in a near-death state from which they can recover.
Eldritch Starship  -  Spacecraft with the characteristics of eldritch entities.
The Aesthetics Of Technology  -  Fallacy that if something looks advanced, it's high tech.
This Banana Is Armed  -  A seemingly harmless pretend weapon that actually works as a real one.
Wallbonking  -  Bonking into a wall repeatedly.
Grapple Move  -  A videogame attack done by grabbing an enemy and usually throwing them after.
Lost In Medias Res  -  A story that starts in the middle gets no elaboration for what came before it.
Sanity Ball  -  When the role of Only Sane Man is passed around the cast.
Bystander Action Horror Dissonance  -  An action sequence shifts to a much darker tone when we see how it's affecting those who aren't part of the fight.
Big Guy Fatality Syndrome  -  When crap hits the fan, The Big Guy is the most likely one to die.
Moses In The Bulrushes  -  A baby is abandoned by their natural parents and sent away, but others find and adopt him.
Bare Your Midriff  -  Show your bare midriff and/or navel for Fanservice.
Video Arcade  -  The kids' favorite hangout of the past with arcade games.
Won The War Lost The Peace  -  The conflict didn't actually end when they won the war.
Toon Transformation  -  A live-action character becomes a cartoon.
Mickey Mousing  -  The action of the show is solely represented through music and chords.
Humans Are Cthulhu  -  Non-humans view us as an Eldritch Abomination.
Xanatos Gambit  -  Any predictable outcome leads to a victory of some sort for the planner.
I Was Just Joking  -  Character A makes a joke. Character B takes it seriously. Character A is surprised.
Doublethink  -  Believing in contradicting ideas, often for the purpose of convenience.
Big Stupid Doodoo Head  -  Insults used by adults that make them sound like children.
All Psychology Is Freudian  -  All psychological problems are caused by trauma and all psychological treatment is Character Development. And everyone is obsessed with sex, specifically incest.
Twincest  -  Twins are sexually and/or romantically involved with each other.
Unwitting Muggle Friend  -  The supernatural character has a human friend who doesn't know their secret.
Extra Extra Read All About It  -  Those newspaper boys that used to inform people about breaking news stories.
Incredibly Obvious Bomb  -  A bomb no one went through the trouble of disguising.
Chaste Hero  -  The Hero is clueless about love or lust.
Crazy Cultural Comparison  -  A visitor from a faraway place demonstrates bizarre "normal" behavior.
Bedsheet Ghost  -  A white bedsheet with eye holes to make it look like a ghost.
Added Alliterative Appeal  -  Multiple words start with the same letter/pronunciation for added coolness.
No Hoper Repeat  -  The re-run in the same time slot as the new episode or event guaranteed to win that slot.
If You Wont I Will  -  The hero doesn't want to do it, but his friend will, which leads to bad results.
Leaked Experience  -  Characters who did not take part in fights do get (some) Experience Points nonetheless.
Zombie Puke Attack  -  Some zombies are able to projectile vomit on you. And their puke is deadly.
Coincidental Dodge  -  Assassination attempts that fail comically through chance.
Insane Equals Violent  -  If you're insane, you're Ax-Crazy.
Dry Docking  -  Wanting characters to stay single only so someone can freely imagine hooking up with them.
Its Been Done  -  Someone describes some new idea, but is informed that somebody else already got it before him.
Ballistic Discount  -  Stealing a weapon by using it to kill the seller.
The Rain Man  -  Autism gives people... strange abilities.
Drop In Drop Out Multiplayer  -  You can join and leave a multiplayer game at any time.
Raised As The Opposite Gender  -  Someone is raised as if they were the opposite gender.
Rules Lawyer  -  A character who knows all the rules — backwards, forwards, sideways, and upside down — and uses that to their advantage.
Savage Wolves  -  Wolves are nasty, vicious, and rapacious predators.
Unsympathetic Comedy Protagonist  -  The main character is a jerk, but who cares? Hilariously bad things happen to him.
Easily Overheard Conversation  -  Two characters talk about a secret. A third one overhears them.
Its Snowing Cocaine  -  Unrealistically huge amounts of narcotics.
Out Of Genre Experience  -  A temporary (and jarring) switch in genres.
No Such Agency  -  A government agency whose existence is denied by said government.
Stunned Silence  -  Shocked speechless.
During The War  -  Stories about wars, usually ones the creators took part in.
Bodyguarding A Badass  -  Someone has one or more bodyguards around them when in public but they don't really need it.
It Has Been An Honor  -  A character facing certain death states they are glad to have had the pleasure to work with an ally.
Back Stab  -  A surprise attack that deals massive damage.
Day Of The Week Name  -  A character is named after one of the days of the week.
Aborted Declaration Of Love  -  A character plans to confess their love, but decides not to.
Speech Centric Work  -  Works which are composed primarily of speech (whether dialogue or monologue).
Musical Nod  -  A piece of music makes a cameo appearance.
Addiction Powered  -  Gaining superpowers by consumption of a drug that doesn't have the same effects on anyone else.
Ghostly Gape  -  Ghosts (and other supernatural entities) have large, black, hollow eyes and mouths.
Safe Zone Hope Spot  -  The place rumored to be safe turns out to be definitely unsafe.
Insult Backfire  -  Your insult isn't one. At least not to your target.
Abnormal Limb Rotation Range  -  The ability to rotate body parts beyond their normal limits.
Blade Brake  -  Plant sword into a solid surface to cease movement.
Men Are Generic Women Are Special  -  Being male is the "default" form of a character, while being female automatically makes them unique.
Heir Club For Men  -  Only sons can be heirs.
Homoerotic Subtext  -  Two characters of the same gender depicted in a similar way to romantic relationships.
Infernal Retaliation  -  The only thing worse than a monster is a monster on fire.
The Friends Who Never Hang  -  In a tight-knit group of friends, two specific characters rarely interact in a meaningful way.
Villainous Face Hold  -  The villain cradles their victim's face in their hand while taunting them.
Jive Turkey  -  A character who uses supposedly hip and funny slang.
Dissonant Serenity  -  Person is eerily calm even in the worst situations.
First Church Of Mecha  -  Humongous Mecha worshiped as deities.
Moe Couplet  -  Non-romantic pairing brings out the best in both.
Rediscovering Roots Trip  -  A character who was raised in another culture returns to their family's motherland in a quest for self-identity.
Gay Aesop  -  The Aesop that being gay is A-Okay.
Not Allowed To Grow Old  -  When adults don't seem a year older even after a Time Skip when younger characters have aged years.
Goth Rock  -  A genre of music featuring dark subject matter and gloomy, monotonous vocals.
Foreshadowing  -  Vaguely hinting at upcoming events.
Atop A Mountain Of Corpses  -  You've just beaten a bunch of bad guys, and can't resist putting your foot on them.
Unfortunate Implications  -  Potentially offensive accidental aesops.
Sinister Subway  -  A spooky train tunnel.
Non Human Undead  -  A Fantastic creature that's been turned (or merely looks) undead.
False Rape Accusation  -  Someone is falsely accused of rape despite being innocent.
Mage Marksman  -  A magic user who fights with ranged weaponry.
The Power Of Blood  -  Blood is powerful in a way.
Feelies  -  Replicas of video game items or other relevant props that come packaged with the game.
In The Doldrums  -  A place that is actively dull, featureless and dead, and takes steps to keep itself that way.
Badass Beard  -  Having a beard means you can kick ass!
Mortality Ensues  -  Losing your immortality sucks, doesn't it?
Pregnancy Makes You Crazy  -  Pregnancy hormones result in a woman becoming extremely weird or emotional.
Obfuscating Disability  -  Faking a disability.
Monster Fangirl  -  The villain's biggest fan, usually a female.
Eyes Do Not Belong There  -  This guy has eyes there? Freaky, baby.
Mini Game  -  A smaller and simpler game within a game used to change up the gameplay.
Portal Slam  -  Smacking into something solid while attempting to enter a magic portal, because it is not there.note Or it's technological equivalent. Which isn't there either.
What The Hell Is That Accent  -  An accent that confuses the audience.
Dump Months  -  The months that see the release of movies that aren't expected to be successful (usually August/September and January/February in America).
New Game Plus  -  Starting over with a bonus for having cleared the game.
The Smurfette Principle  -  All the main characters are male... except for one.
My Suit Is Also Super  -  A superhero's equipment isn't damaged by their powers.
Make Wrong What Once Went Right  -  A time traveller try to changes the past as part of their evil scheme.
Revival  -  A show that ended its run some time ago is renewed for more episodes.
Weird Science  -  Science that is weird.
Empty Room Psych  -  There isn't anything here. Seriously. Stop looking.
Workout Fanservice  -  Hot, muscular people working out.
Takes Ten To Hold  -  When it takes a literal army to hold down the One-Man Army.
Mundane Horror  -  Horror can be done in a regular setting by changing some things to make them seem odd.
Hornet Hole  -  Beehive levels in Video Games
Mind Probe  -  Evil mind-reading device.
Thwarted Escape  -  A character comes within inches of escaping their captor, only to be caught at the last minute.
Eyebrow Waggle  -  The power of wiggling your big ol' eyebrows.
Story Branch Favoritism  -  There are multiple story branches but one has more content and/or gameplay incentives than others.
Art Deco  -  A decorative visual arts movement during The '20s and The '30s, that is lavishly famous for its use of modernistic designs, rich colours, smooth textures, and geometric lines.
Temporal Duplication  -  When time travelling to the same place multiple times, copies remain.
Big Screwed Up Family  -  Where family matters are serious business.
First Blood  -  The film: Dirty Cops pick the wrong Shell-Shocked Veteran to hassle.
Take Over The City  -  The "junior" version of Take Over the World, when a villain's primary goal (or at least, the first step of their Evil Plan) is to dominate their home city.
Shed Armor Gain Speed  -  Taking your armor off reduces your protection but increases your speed.
The Pirates Who Dont Do Anything  -  A character is rarely, if ever, seen engaging in the job they claim to have.
God Test  -  Someone challenges someone else to do something extraordinary as proof that they're extraordinary.
Aloha Hawaii  -  When the cast goes to Hawaii for a vacation.
Space Base  -  A base for the heroes or villains in spaaaaaaaaace.
Phlebotinum Killed The Dinosaurs  -  Something very fictional and implausible is revealed to have caused the dinosaurs' extinction in-universe.
Insane Admiral  -  Unstable Flag Officers cause problems.
Sympathetic Magic  -  You need a part of a person to affect them.
Sexy Walk  -  She's got Hartman Hips and she's not afraid to use them.
Not Just A Tournament  -  A tournament with a sinister ulterior purpose.
It Is Pronounced Tro PAY  -  Insisting on a foreign/exotic pronunciation to make it sound classy.
They Wasted A Perfectly Good Character  -  A character doesn't get nearly as much exposure as you think they deserve.
High Class Glass  -  Monocle = instant sophistication
Wall Run  -  Running along a wall.
Big Bad  -  The ultimate villain of the story, who's causing the problem the heroes must solve.
Twelfth Night Adventure  -  Crossdressing/Gender-bending is a very important plot point in this story.
William Telling  -  Attempting to shoot an object off of another character's head without harming them.
Quoting Myself  -  Character shares an aphorism of their own devising.
Gag Censor  -  A Censor Box Played for Laughs.
Unholy Ground  -  This accursed land is haunted by malevolent forces and offensive to all that is good.
Colour Coded For Your Convenience  -  Indication through coloring.
Ridiculously Photogenic  -  A character with an uncanny aptitude to look great on photos.
With Us Or Against Us  -  The fallacy where not openly supporting a group implies that you oppose them (or vice-versa).
Hitodama Light  -  Ghosts and possessed people, chiefly in Japanese media, depicted as having lights or flames floating around them.
Big Brother Bully  -  Your big brother/sister is a Jerkass to you.
Paused Interrupt  -  An unintentional beat that occurs between someone's line of dialogue being cut off mid-sentence and the interruption.
Character As Himself  -  Character-A plays the role of Character-A
Why Fandom Cant Have Nice Things  -  When someone who is involved in a work is forced to use drastic measures against their fans.
Use Your Head  -  A headbutt (that somehow never hurts the user).
I Love You Because I Cant Control You  -  A character who is easily able to control/manipulate/seduce other people falls in love with the one person they can't.
Brain Food  -  Brains taste delicious!
Chick Flick  -  A romantic movie made to appeal to women.
The Cavalier Years  -  The 17th century is the period of pirates, explorations and cavalry.
Freak Out  -  The trope: A moment of shock induced by trauma resulting in major short-term personality change; may affect permanent personality change.
Feet First Introduction  -  The first time we are introduced to someone, we see their feet.
Hollywood Apocrypha  -  Misusing or making up Biblical quotes.
Ground Pound  -  When you go down from a jump with special moves for extra strength and energy.
Cultured Badass  -  A badass who is also a gentleman/lady.
Special Snowflake Syndrome  -  Going out of the way to make oneself distinct and unique from the rest.
Protection From Editors  -  Writers exempt from constructive criticism can suck.
Skull For A Head  -  No, that's not a mask. His head is an actual skull.
Beneath Notice  -  Disguise via hiding in plain sight, emphasis on the plain.
Four Man Band  -  The four types of people who are in a four-people-are-the-main-characters movie.
Construct Additional Pylons  -  In Real-Time Strategy games, you gotta keep building buildings to survive.
Right Makes Might  -  The hero believes that justice will prevail, and so it does.
What Is One Mans Life In Comparison  -  A character is asked to sacrifice his/her own life for the greater good.
Hobbling The Giant  -  The easiest way to take out a giant enemy is by restricting its leg movement.
Hope Spot  -  A character finds hope, but it doesn't last long.
Kryptonite Factor  -  An Achilles' Heel where the weakness is a substance or state that only affects the Super Hero.
Kibbles And Bits  -  Transforming robot with residual parts from its alternate form.
Breaking The Cycle Of Bad Parenting  -  A character whose parents were abusive, incompetent, or otherwise dysfunctional does their best to do a better job with their own kids.
Absurdly Spacious Sewer  -  Sewers in fiction are ludicrously large, well-lit, and breathable.
Serial Killer Killer  -  A serial killer who preys on serial killers.
Fans Prefer The New Her  -  When fans prefer the character's new, usually temporary, look to their old one.
Soft Glass  -  A person breaks through or is thrown through glass with little harm.
Spaghetti Kiss  -  A couple eating spaghetti or noodles end up slurping down the same piece, causing them to accidentally kiss.
Artist Disillusionment  -  Creator dislikes their job and even their fanbase.
Magical Camera  -  A camera imbued with magic-or-whatever-else powers.
Power Fist  -  Weapon that improves punches.
Furries Are Easier To Draw  -  Furries are easier to draw, because they are more cartoony.
Face Death With Dignity  -  A doomed character accepts their death with serenity.
Total Eclipse Of The Plot  -  Eclipses behave like they shouldn't, but who cares? It advances the plot.
Florence Nightingale Effect  -  Someone nursed another back to health. Romance ensues.
Casual Interstellar Travel  -  Interstellar flight that is taken by normal people regularly in a short amount of time
Warm Milk Helps You Sleep  -  Drinking warm milk makes you sleepy.
Title Drop Chapter  -  When a chapter in a work bears the same title as the work itself.
Amnesiac Hero  -  The protagonist suffers from Identity Amnesia when they are introduced.
Euroshlock  -  (Mostly) European films that emphasize boundary-pushing material, especially in regards to sex.
Master Of Illusion  -  Makes you see what isn't there.
Faux Affably Evil  -  A villain with a fake, mocking veneer of niceness that only highlights their monstrosity.
West Coast Team  -  Superhero team's far-away equivalent/affiliate/subsidiary.
Easing Into The Adventure  -  A prologue that covers the protagonist's ordinary life before going on the adventure.
Adaptational Angst Upgrade  -  A character(s) is more angst-ridden than they were in the source material.
Stellar Station  -  A space station placed in very close orbit around its star.
Either Or Title  -  A work that has multiple titles for itself that are in the title.
Suicidal Sadistic Choice  -  A person is offered a choice between killing themselves and something equally terrible, or worse.
Bystander Syndrome  -  People ignore a crisis because it (apparently) doesn't affect them.
Genocide Dilemma  -  To Kill 'Em All, or not to Kill 'Em All? That is the question.
Lady Of Black Magic  -  A hot, Femme Fatale Black Mage.
Pajama Clad Hero  -  Heroics in sleepwear.
The Dandy  -  Fashion-obsessed, flamboyant fops.
Mordor  -  The dark, hellish wasteland of evil.
Chaotic Stupid  -  A chaotic character refuses to follow any code of conduct, even — no, especially common sense.
Born Under The Sail  -  Cultures that revolve around sailing, though not limited to waterborne boats.
Battleaxe Nurse  -  Jerkass nurse.
Camera Perspective Switch  -  Switching from first-person to third-person (and vice versa).
Anti Climactic Unmasking  -  An ordinary-looking face is revealed underneath that complex mask.
Strawman Fallacy  -  A Logical Fallacy consisting of misrepresenting an opponent's argument in such a way that it can be easily countered.
Referenced By  -  Work mentioned in another work.
Ethnic Magician  -  A magic-user from a non-Western Fantasy Counterpart Culture.
Thumbtack On The Chair  -  A prank involving a thumbtack being placed on a chair for an unsuspecting victim to sit on it.
Take That Scrappy  -  An unintentionally hated character gets their comeuppance within the actual work.
Would You Like To Hear How They Died  -  I killed someone you love in a horrific way, and here's all the gory little details about it.
Mockumentary  -  Fiction In the Style of... a Documentary.
Flip Screen Scrolling  -  A video game mechanic where the screen does not scroll; it just cuts to the next screen once you reach a boundary.
Blasphemous Praise  -  A character giving praise to someone(s) or something(s) else favorably given to a deity.
Immediate Self Contradiction  -  A character states something that goes against what he has said before.
Academic Athlete  -  A character is both athletic and academically successful.
Shocking Swerve  -  A plot twist that comes out of nowhere and is not only impractical, but impossible given the facts observed.
Fed To Pigs  -  A body is disposed of by feeding it to pigs.
Informed Real Life Fame  -  Bob is famous because the TV show he's guest-starring tells us he is.
Load Bearing Boss  -  If boss dies, its habitat/cave/building collapses.
Raised As A Host  -  A person who was brought up solely so their body could be taken over by someone else.
Flushing Edge Interactivity  -  Toilets that can be flushed, but not used or cleaned.
Flies Equals Evil  -  Bugs are bad-news bears!
Gendercide  -  Something happens, and all individuals of a gender are killed off.
Comically Invincible Hero  -  Invincible Hero Played for Laughs.
Easter Egg  -  Hidden bonus content. note Egg.
Awful Wedded Life  -  Marriage is a Fate Worse than Death.
Does Not Know How To Say Thanks  -  A character doesn't know how to express their gratitude for someone.
Utopia Justifies The Means  -  A situation where the goal of the Big Bad is the creation of a better world for everyone as a whole, no matter what the cost.
Super Intelligence  -  Extreme smarts as a super power.
Railing Kill  -  If you get shot near a railing, you'll fall to the other side of said railing, to your death.
Arrows On Fire  -  Lighting your arrows on fire is cool, whether or not it makes tactical sense.
A God I Am Not  -  A character is seen or treated as a god by many people, but the said character doesn't see him/herself that way (or prefers to be treated as a normal being).
Take Away Their Name  -  Magically taking someone's name away from them.
Girls Are Really Scared Of Horror Movies  -  When a straight couple watches a horror movie, the female (and only her) is really scared.
Power Equals Rarity  -  In a game, the more powerful something is, the harder it is to acquire.
Number Two For Brains  -  So stupid you wonder how and why they're second-in-command.
Auto Revive  -  Automatic Back from the Dead item.
Prehistoria  -  Generic prehistoric themed level.
Heros Muse  -  The Hero is inspired or led by an idealized woman.
Freefall Romance  -  Falling in love. While falling.
Reasoning With God  -  A mortal convinces higher powers to help or at least not to harm.
Interrogated For Nothing  -  Someone is tortured for information they don't have.
Portal Network  -  The setting/world/universe/multiverse allows travel through interconnected portals.
No Delays For The Wicked  -  Villains are unhindered by logistical or bureaucratic concerns.
Glurge Addict  -  Tastes Like Diabetes, personified.
Walk Into Mordor  -  One can only enter the Evil Overlord's domain on foot... but the poor infrastructure is the least of your worries.
Magic Ampersand  -  Alliteration & Ampersand = fictional RPG.
Alice And Bob  -  Two hypothetical characters used to exemplify things (as well as tropes on this very wiki).
Nerf Arm  -  Toy or training weapons wielded with the lethality of their real counterparts.
Retronym  -  A series was named after its first part, so the name of the first part is changed so that it won't be confused with the series.
Ominous Hair Loss  -  Hair loss as a sign of disease or worse.
Fighting The Lancer  -  A disagreement between The Hero and The Lancer leads to a fight.
One Episode Fear  -  A character is afraid of something but only for one episode.
Batman Grabs A Gun  -  The situation gets so serious that The Hero breaks their own rules.
Onion Tears  -  Peeling onions in fiction makes you cry a lot.
Renaissance Man  -  Character with a variety of talents.
Fighting Back Is Wrong  -  If you retaliate against your attacker, you are as bad, if not worse, than them.
Muse Abuse  -  A creator bases their work on people they know without respecting their feelings on the matter.
Action Survivor  -  The Hero of the story is an Average Joe.
Caught On The Jumbotron  -  An embarrassing moment or damning evidence is broadcasted on the Jumbotron for everyone to see.
Puppy Love  -  A canon couple is young enough to still think the other gender has cooties.
Face Full Of Alien Wing Wong  -  A creature reproduces by impregnating another species - usually us.
Carnivore Confusion  -  Ethical issues arise from having carnivores and meat products among anthropomorphic animals.
Full Boar Action  -  A big pig that's capable of fighting.
City Planet  -  A city that covers an entire planet.
Talented But Trained  -  A character has great innate talent in something, but trains anyway in order to achieve their true potential.
Small Annoying Creature  -  The small critter sidekick that gets on everyone's nerves.
Villain Based Franchise  -  The villain's the star of the show.
Eat Me  -  Let the monster eat you so you can attack it from its insides.
Commitment Issues  -  A character doesn't want to settle down with a love interest.
Royal We  -  Monarchs refer to themselves in plural form.
Lip Lock  -  A dub where the dialogue is changed to match the lip movements in the new language.
Sci Fi Bob Haircut  -  Science fiction characters (usually heroines) have bob haircuts.
Vampire Musicals  -  Musicals about, well, vampires.
Creepy Awesome  -  That's just scary... but the scariness makes it epic.
Formally Named Pet  -  A pet with Mister or Missus as its first name.
Multiple Choice Future  -  There are multiple, equally-probable futures.
Ow My Body Part  -  Someone complaining a body part hurts.
Fanon  -  Fan Wank that's accepted by a fandom as Canon.
Bizarre Sexual Dimorphism  -  The males and females look like completely different species.
God Eating  -  Gods eating each other, or being eaten.
Cardboard Prison  -  An easily escaped prison.
Granola Girl  -  All-natural, idealistic, free-spirited hippie chick.
Pyrrhic Victory  -  Victory so costly it feels like a defeat.
Powder Keg Crowd  -  One spark away from a riot.
Too Upset To Create  -  Sadness and depression takes your creativity away.
Weight Loss Horror  -  Weight loss, voluntary or not, goes horribly wrong.
Wrestler In All Of Us  -  Unlikely characters with wrestling moves, for the sake of Rule of Cool.
Intentional Engrish For Funny  -  Ungood English deliberate for making laugh.
Does This Make Me Look Fat  -  Character wants to know how they look, so they ask if they look fat.note And there is no right answer.
Cognizant Limbs  -  Bosses with individually labeled limbs.
Meet The In Laws  -  A character formally meets the parents of their significant other for the first time. Tension ensues.
Wings Do Nothing  -  Has wings. They're useless.
Fragile Speedster  -  Agile but fragile.
Abandoned Laboratory  -  Abandoned science laboratories are spooky, usually because there's something dangerous present.
Recursive Adaptation  -  An adaptation gets adapted for the original's medium.
Foo Fu  -  Everything's Better With "Fu".
Human Popsicle  -  One-way Time Travel via cryonics.
Scrap Heap Hero  -  Washed up hero gets back in the game.
Baleful Polymorph  -  A character is transformed into a shape that renders him powerless or impairs his ability to pursue his goals.
You Said You Couldnt Dance  -  A character is called out for demonstrating an ability or skill they claimed not to have.
Kiss Diss  -  Denial of an intimate action.
Screw The Rules Im Famous  -  Characters using their popularity to get away with anything.
Adaptation Relationship Overhaul  -  The characters' relationship is different from the original adaptation.
Expendable Clone  -  It doesn't matter if you kill a clone because they can be replaced.
Energy Ball  -  Pure, destructive energy, usually launched from your hands, in the shape of a ball.
Gratuitous Greek  -  Instant Techno Babble, just add Greek.
As The Good Book Says  -  Quoting The Bible for effect.
Javelin Thrower  -  Throwing Your Blade on a Stick Always Works.
Mutually Fictional  -  There are two shows, Show A and Show B. In Show A, Show B is fictional and vice versa.
The Coroner Doth Protest Too Much  -  Murder reported as an accident/suicide/natural causes with little actual coverup.
Calling Your Orgasms  -  Character announces when they're about to climax during sex.
Put Down Your Gun And Step Away  -  The villain tells the hero to get rid of his weapon, or else.
World Of Buxom  -  Most every female in a work has larger than average breasts.
Razor Wind  -  Slicing with air.
That Reminds Me Of A Song  -  Song in a musical that doesn't have anything to do with the story or characters.
Abridged Arena Array  -  There's a 100 maps to play on, but people only ever play on 2 or 3 of them.
Charlie Brown Baldness  -  An illustrated character is ostensibly not bald, but has only two or three visible strands of hair on their head.
Black Comedy Animal Cruelty  -  Animal cruelty Played for Laughs.
He Was Right There All Along  -  The boss is hiding in the Boss Room, and won't reveal itself until you do something.
Genius Ditz  -  An otherwise pretty stupid character is amazing at particular activities.
Everyone Is Satan In Hell  -  Finding morally objectionable content where it may not actually exist.
Took A Level In Cheerfulness  -  A gloomy character becomes cheerful over time.
False Dichotomy  -  Believing that only two (often conflicting) options exist, when many other options exist.
Conspiracy Kitchen Sink  -  Every conspiracy theory is true.
Continuous Decompression  -  After a hole is opened in a space ships outer structure, it has about the same effects as a nearby tornado.
Affair Letters  -  Blackmail using letters exchanged by two lovers having an affair
Sufficiently Advanced Alien  -  Advanced aliens pose as gods/magical.
Enough To Go Around  -  Items that are one-of-a-kind in-universe but can be obtained multiple times and/or by multiple players.
Goths Have It Hard  -  A character with a dark aesthetic that appears depressed, troubled, self-destructive, etc. with the implication that they like morbid things because of their psychological issues.
Screen Tap  -  Breaking the Fourth Wall by tapping it.
Golden Super Mode  -  You get strong by being plated with gold!
All Work Vs All Play  -  One character is focused on working while the other wants to have fun.
Superhero Movie Villains Die  -  A character suffers Death by Adaptation despite having Joker Immunity in their source material.
Eerily Out Of Place Object  -  An out-of-place object as a sign of something wrong.
Dude Wheres Our Car  -  Forgetting where you parked.
Lesbian Vampire  -  She drinks blood and likes ladies.
Lonely Among People  -  A character who has friends or is social, but feels lonely.
Insignia Rip Off Ritual  -  Either a boss demotes a worker by ripping the insignia off the worker's uniform or a worker quits by taking off the insignia themselves and giving it to the boss.
There Is No Higher Court  -  Insane government decisions, laws and judges can do whatever they want.
Un Sorcerer  -  The one Muggle in a world of superhumans.
Final Death  -  If you die in the gameplay, you die in the story.
Our Lawyers Advised This Trope  -  Any message included in a work for (usually) legal reasons.
Unique Pilot Title Sequence  -  Pilot episodes have unique title sequences.
Building Is Welding  -  A scene of someone building something primarily consists of welding.
