Artistic License Geology  -  Geological processes or phenomena are presented inaccurately, in order to make the story work better.
Fisticuff Provoking Comment  -  Bob argues with Alice and says something insulting. Alice reacts by punching Bob.
Height Angst  -  Character thinks they are too short or too tall.
Keep It Foreign  -  Changing an element of foreign language into another foreign language to retain a sense of otherness about it in a new market.
Description Porn  -  Descriptions are awesome.
Hypochondria  -  Characters who think they are coming down with diseases based on vague symptoms.
Hey You Haymaker  -  Turn around, mister! I have something to tell ya... [cue punch]
Last Episode Theme Reprise  -  The theme song plays in the Grand Finale of a work.
The Magic Poker Equation  -  The more dire the situation and the more skilled player you are, the better your hand will be.
Kung Fu Wizard  -  Physically powerful magic user.
Artistic License Politics  -  Politics in fiction often works far differently and more cleanly than in real life.
Plot Coupon  -  You need this many MacGuffins to continue the storyline as it is.
Dragon Hoard  -  A dragon guards treasure.
Crosshair Aware  -  Aiming reticles display onscreen for the benefit of the player.
Reluctant Warrior  -  Only fights when it's absolutely necessary.
A Father To His Men  -  The leader really cares about their followers.
Politically Motivated Teacher  -  Teacher who goes on political rants.
Viral Transformation  -  A transformation that can be spread virally and physically changes humans to non-humans.
Stock Shonen Rival  -  Archetypal take on The Rival: an aloof jerkass who acts as the Stock Shōnen Hero's equal and opposite.
Ambiguously Brown  -  Brown skinned characters of indeterminable racial background.
My Nayme Is  -  Typical stock names get spelled differently for individuality.
Italians Talk With Hands  -  Italians gesticulate a lot.
Expospeak Gag  -  Describing something mundane or normal, using really technical language.
Pan And Scan  -  Cropping a movie to a narrower aspect ratio, while panning left and right to show all the important details.
Military Alphabet  -  Using words to deliver messages over the radio to avoid repeating them or delivering wrong info.
Narrative Beats  -  Events, decisions, or discoveries that induce a change in emotional direction of the story, whether positive or negative.
Justified Title  -  The title has a literal meaning in-universe separate from its meaning out-of-universe.
Jaded Washout  -  A cynical, washed-up loser.
Thats An Order  -  Character reminds another one of their authority over them when demanding something.
A Lizard Named Liz  -  An animal whose name is related to their species.
Unwinnable Joke Game  -  A game deliberately programmed to be impossible to win, despite instructions to achieve the goal.
I Was Having Such A Nice Dream  -  A character has a wonderful dream. but then suddenly something wakes them up.
Schrodingers Butterfly  -  Stories where it's never completely clear whether everything is "real" or not.
Pet Monstrosity  -  The character owns a pet that is highly dangerous in the real world.
Only I Can Kill Him  -  Only The Hero can defeat the Big Bad — anyone else who tries will fail.
Deus Ex Nukina  -  Nuking is the only solution.
Nothing Is The Same Anymore  -  The Status Quo is no longer God.
Horrifying The Horror  -  A monster is scared by an even worse monster.
Determined Defeatist  -  I'm probably going to fail... But I'm going to give it my best shot anyway.
Sizeshifter  -  The power to change in size.
Introductory Opening Credits  -  Opening credits showing characters with their names beside them.
Pants Free  -  The parts of someone's body that are out of sight are un(der)dressed.
Somebody Set Up Us The Bomb  -  A Time Bomb is cleverly snuck into enemy territory.
Restored My Faith In Humanity  -  A character learns that humanity isn't so bad after all.
Starring Smurfette  -  The main character of a work is one sex, with all of their supporting cast being the opposite.
Sapient Pet  -  Pet Funny Animals, Aliens, and other intelligent species.
Latex Perfection  -  A character's disguise makes them look exactly like someone else.
Stuka Scream  -  When something falls at high speed, it somehow sounds like an old World War II dive bomber.
Closest Thing We Got  -  We need X! "There's only Y." "It'll have to do."
Beast Of Battle  -  An animal becomes a weapon.
Skunk Stripe  -  Dark hair with light-colored or white streaks running through it, just like a skunk.
Kneel Before Frodo  -  If the King/Queen kneels or bows to someone, then so do you.
Language Fluency Denial  -  When you pretend you don't speak a language.
Indo European Alien Language  -  Alien words, English grammar.
Speedrun  -  Completing the game as fast as possible.
Socialization Bonus  -  Benefits from playing video games with others.
Ho Yay  -  Fans enjoy homoerotic subtext and shipping.
Black Eyes Of Crazy  -  A characters' eye sclera is black, which shows their insanity.
Hyperaffixation  -  Where some words just can't be said by a character without adding a specific prefix or suffix to it.
Spotting The Thread  -  The one subtle flaw in an otherwise perfect deception.
Enemy Eats Your Lunch  -  Asserting dominance by eating an enemy's food.
Honest Advisor  -  The advisor who doesn't sugarcoat the truth.
Curious Qualms Of Conscience  -  A character feels qualms about something he thinks his duty.
You Wanna Get Sued  -  A half-explicit reference to another work, worded or expressed in a way that barely dances around trademark law.
Fake Ultimate Mook  -  Powerful-looking, but very weak monster or enemy unit.
Think Of The Children  -  Things should be banned because children might see it.
Hostage Mac Guffin  -  The hostage is the MacGuffin, the thing the heroes are searching for.
Military Mage  -  Spellcaster Super Soldier
Discriminate And Switch  -  What appears to be prejudice turns out to be something more innocent or trivial.
Science Related Memetic Disorder  -  Mad Science as a medical disorder.
Lady In Red  -  A seductress wearing a red dress.
Party Scheduling Gambit  -  A character schedules a party to conflict with another party.
Dwindling Party  -  Everyone sequentially dies as the story progresses.
Dying Declaration Of Hate  -  Dying while confessing your hatred for another character.
Irrational Hatred  -  I hate him because I don't have a good reason to hate him!
Generation Ships  -  A slow starship equipped for generations to live and die on the way.
Free Love Future  -  In the future, everyone Really Gets Around.
Accidentally Correct Zoology  -  A real species that resembles a fictional one is discovered later on.
Forever War  -  A war that goes on...forever.
Delusion Conclusion  -  Stock Epileptic Tree claiming that the supernatural or unrealistic elements of a work are due to it being All Just a Dream.
The Cake Is A Lie  -  A promised reward isn't given and was never going to be.
Ancient Keeper  -  An old creepy, lonely, long-robed, tea-guzzling version of Mr. Exposition.
The Swear Jar  -  A mild punishment for every time you swear.
Nazi Grandpa  -  That old man in your neighborhood? He used to be a Nazi!
Funny Animal  -  Animal in appearance. Human in everything else.
Tiny Guy Huge Girl  -  A couple where the dude is way smaller than the chick.
I Take Offense To That Last One  -  Objecting to only one of a series of insults, usually at the least offensive one
Recycled The Series  -  When a movie's premise is turned into a weekly television series.
Asteroid Thicket  -  Asteroid belts in fiction are MUCH more dense than in real life.
Go Among Mad People  -  Sane man in the asylum. No one believes him.
Death By Newbery Medal  -  The lovable sidekick of the child protagonist is killed off as a part of their Coming-of-Age Story.
Weapon Stomp  -  A battle ends by one battler's weapon getting stomped on and crushed by the other.
Zany Scheme Chicken  -  A Zany Scheme gets hatched and countered, and then someone else counters it, etc.
Fade Around The Eyes  -  Everything on the screen fades away around a character's eyes or other facial features for dramatic effect.
Everyone Is A Super  -  Everyone has some sort of superhuman power.
I Product  -  Putting a lowercase "i" in front of the name of your product makes it trendy.
Twisting The Words  -  Someone says something innocent, someone else twists what they said, and now that someone is in trouble.
Shield Surf  -  Shredding with a shield.
Harassing Phone Call  -  Phone call from a stalker full of weird sounds.
Kill It Through Its Stomach  -  A hero Swallowed Whole will cut their way out.
Failure To Save Murder  -  A hero is blamed for the death of someone he couldn't save.
What A Piece Of Junk  -  Mode of transport is a lot cooler than it looks.
V 8 Engine Noises  -  Every car sounds like it has a V8 engine.
Bar Brawl  -  A big, destructive fight in a bar.
Pirate  -  A seafaring thief who terrorizes the oceans.
Cunning Like A Fox  -  Foxes are crafty, clever and cunning.
Never Suicide  -  A murder victim is covered up by making it look like a suicide.
Bread Eggs Milk Squick  -  A list of mundane things ends with something weirder.
Sleeper Starship  -  A slow spacecraft that puts the passengers in hibernation until they arrive at their destination.
Inherent In The System  -  Sometimes "the way things are" is the problem.
Cartoonish Supervillainy  -  Card-Carrying Villain cranked Up to Eleven to the point of Parody.
Verber Creature  -  Creatures tend to be named after verbs with the format (verb)-er.
Necessary Fail  -  Your failure now leads to greater things in the future.
Living Lava  -  A creature made out of molten rock.
Weak Boss Strong Underlings  -  The boss is significantly weaker than their minions.
Bubbly Clouds  -  Video Game level set on Solid Clouds.
Tragic Bigot  -  A character who hates a group because of a painful/traumatic experience a member of the group inflicted upon them.
Helping Granny Cross The Street  -  I'll help this frail old lady to show everyone how awesome I am!
With Friends Like These  -  Friends... or so they're called.
Orphanage Of Love  -  An orphanage that treats its orphans well.
Growling Gut  -  Tummy noises indicate hunger or digestive issues.
Character Level  -  A numeric representation of the character getting better at their job in discrete leaps.
Chekhovs Party  -  If a party is mentioned, whether on- or offscreen, you can guarantee something important happened there.
Heteronormative Crusader  -  Homophobic/Heterosexist Knight Templar.
EMP  -  A burst of energy that takes out only electronics. ...According to fiction.
Making A Splash  -  Water-based Elemental Powers.
Fishing For Sole  -  Hooking junk such as boots and tin cans while fishing.
Battle Thralls  -  Conscripts taken from an empire's conquered people.
The Unpronounceable  -  Someone or something whose name cannot be pronounced in an obvious way.
Jitter Cam  -  Wobbly camera angle, usually for dramatic effect.
Warrior Heaven  -  The place where all proud warriors want to go when they die.
Cleanup Crew  -  Character(s) whose job it is to clean up incriminating evidence.
I Cant Reach It  -  So you, the player, want me, your video game character, to do something clearly within my means? No, thanks.
With Great Power Comes Great Perks  -  Character uses powers primarily or solely for personal convenience.
White Guilt  -  Somebody feels guilty because they perceive themselves, rightfully or not, to be part of a priviliged class and hold themselves personally responsible for the plight of the less fortunate.
Letterbox  -  Bars (usually black) used to fit an image of one aspect ratio in a screen of another without cropping or distortion.
Voluntary Vampire Victim  -  Someone voluntarily agrees to feed someone's Horror Hunger or satisfy their need to feed on human energies.
Three D Comic Book  -  A comic book that requires 3-D glasses to view properly.
Stereotypical South Asian English  -  South Asian (i.e. Indian, Pakistani, Bangladeshi) people speak using English in an odd accent and misusing tenses.
Evil Duo  -  A Red Oni, Blue Oni pair of villains, their contrast often played against each other.
Big Dumb Object  -  Big sciencey thing in space that does plot stuff.
Easy Sex Change  -  Unrealistically fast and easy sex change.
Prophetic Fallacy  -  A prophecy that is incomplete or otherwise doesn't give those who see it all the information.
Forced Perspective  -  Adjusting the apparent size of an object or person by moving it closer or further away from the camera.
Imaginary Friend  -  A friend that is not real.
Kindly Housekeeper  -  A kind housekeeper.
Merchant Prince  -  Entrepreneur who uses own skills to acquire political power.
Magic Realism  -  Magic elements are blended in an otherwise mundane, realistic atmosphere, and treated just as mundanely.
Zeerust Canon  -  The sequel sticks with the original's now-outdated future.
Colon Cancer  -  Titles: two or more colons: can be really annoying.
Lady Looks Like A Dude  -  She's female, but certainly does not look like one.
Indirect Kiss  -  A kiss without any means of physical contact.
Faceless Eye  -  The eye lacks a nose, ears, mouth and second eye to become a face.
Cruel Mercy  -  Sparing an enemy to make them suffer.
Advertising  -  Media with the primary purpose to sell a product or service.
Caught In The Ripple  -  Reality has been altered, and the viewers notice but the characters don't.
DIY Disaster  -  Button A should perform function A, and button B should perform function B, but when button A is pressed, it performs function B.
Equipment Spoiler  -  Finding an unusable piece of equipment means that someone able to use it will join the party at some point.
Decisive Battle  -  A huge, grandiose battle that, while not necessarily the last one, turns the tide permanently and ultimately decides who wins the war.
The Little Detecto  -  Device that detects something related to Speculative Fiction.
Space Is Cold  -  In fiction, you'll probably freeze to death with unprotected exposure to outer space.
We Suck Less  -  Use our product! We're not better; they're just worse!
Spicy Latina  -  A Hot-Blooded, sexy Latin American woman.
Hair Of The Dog  -  Attempting to alleviate a hangover by drinking more alcohol.
Beware The Nice Ones  -  Make this Nice Guy angry and they'll retaliate. Hard.
Eagleland Osmosis  -  Non-Americans mistakenly think aspects of their own nation work similarly to America.
Thanking The Viewer  -  A dedication to the consumer by a medium's creator for their support.
Breakfast Club  -  A group of misfits who stick together, especially because they have no one else.
Planet Eater  -  A character who eats planets, whether that's sucking out their "life-force" or literally taking bites out of the crust.
Farce  -  A case of misunderstandings/deceptions played either for laughs or drama.
Thunderbolt Iron  -  Extra useful metal from meteors.
The Master  -  The Trope: The definitive name to run away really fast from.
Russian Reversal  -  A common joke in which subject and object are reversed.
Superhuman Transfusion  -  You get his blood, you get his powers.
Dining In The Buff  -  A character eats or drinks something while naked.
Humanoid Aliens  -  Aliens with basic human shape but different physiology.
Race Lift  -  A character's race/ethnicity is changed in a derivative work.
War Gaming  -  A war-themed tabletop game.
I Thought It Was Forbidden  -  A Dangerous Forbidden Technique that isn't really, or an unethical act said to be justified by the ends.
Smoky Gentlemens Club  -  An upper-class gentlemen's club, often used as a venue for fiendish plotting.
Fuku Fic  -  Ranma Saotome becomes a Sailor Senshi.
Only The Author Can Save Them Now  -  A situation where Deus ex Machina is the only conceivable way for the heroes to defeat the villain.
Scenery Censor  -  Using something from the scenery to cover up someone's private parts.
Senseless Violins  -  The practice of concealing deadly arms in musical instrument cases.
Birth Death Juxtaposition  -  When a new life is born or introduced shortly before or after the death of another person.
Advertised Extra  -  A character or actor who was prominent in advertisements turns out to only have a minor role.
Amateur Sleuth  -  A character that solves mysteries, despite solving mysteries not being what they're usually expected to do.
Not Brainwashed  -  In a world of Brainwashed victims, this character's FaceHeel Turn was of their own volition.
Destructible Projectiles  -  Projectiles that can be destroyed by players or Non Player Characters before hitting their intended target.
The Flatwoods Monster  -  A creature said to be encountered in/around the area of Flatwoods, West Virginia, USA.
I Am Becoming Song  -  A character sings about their own psychological changes.
Flipping The Bird  -  Extending the middle finger in irritation.
Darker And Edgier  -  When a work that started out light and humorous is Retooled to be more "adult".
Snarking Thanks  -  Thanking someone in a sarcastic or insulting manner.
Lost Love Montage  -  Someone reminisces about their past love shortly after a break-up.
Redemption Equals Sex  -  A "special" benefit for turning good.
Space Cossacks  -  Space-faring outcasts existing on the fringes of galactic authority.
Artistic License Gun Safety  -  Somebody who should know better fails to follow safe handling instructions for firearms.
Bigger Is Better  -  Food, Buildings, Weapons, Machines, Body parts, everything is better when it's big.
Saved By The Fans  -  A character dies, gets Put on a Bus, or suffers Chuck Cunningham Syndrome, but the fans complain to the writers, who bring the character back.
Door Dumb  -  The door doesn't open that way.
Proud Peacock  -  Peacocks are depicted as vain or arrogant.
Gift Shake  -  Wonder what's in the gift package? Shake it and hear!
For Great Justice  -  The good guys' motive is "justice", "goodness", etc.
Extremely Dusty Home  -  An extremely dusty home.
Date Rape Averted  -  An averted Date Rape.
Attack Attack Attack  -  Offense is the only (acceptable) form of combat and/or warfare.
Purely Aesthetic Era  -  Anachronism Stew, Played for Laughs.
De Power Zone  -  An area where powers and abilities don't work.
Necessarily Evil  -  Sometimes, you gotta be evil for the greater good.
Creepy Gym Coach  -  A gym coach/teacher acts perverted or lecherous towards their students.
Anti Human Alliance  -  Genocidal non-humans
No Self Buffs  -  Magically adept person can't work magic on themself.
Designated Victim  -  This character gets defeated by the villains almost every time.
Spell My Name With A Blank  -  Removing or blanking names to avoid lawsuit.
Dinosaur Doggie Bone  -  Dogs love dinosaur fossil bones just as much as regular bones.
Nerds Are Virgins  -  Being a nerd automatically means you've never had sex.
Clocks Of Control  -  Clocks and clockworks are associated with strict, authoritarian characters.
Jesus The Early Years  -  The unknown life of Jesus between his birth and last few years of life.
Electric Black Guy  -  A black person with electric powers.
She Is The King  -  A woman reigns under a masculine title.
Bomb Throwing Anarchists  -  Ax-Crazy Anarchists.
The Legend Of Chekhov  -  When somebody tells you an ancient legend, chances are it's based on actual events and will be important later.
Deader Than Dead  -  He's not coming back from this one this time, folks. In theory, at least.
Telephone Polearm  -  Pillar-sized object used as a weapon.
It Is Beyond Saving  -  A place so corrupt the only solution is to destroy it.
Friendship As Courtship  -  Friends-turned-lovers skip over the 'getting to know each other' stage and go straight for marriage
Twenty Four Hour Trope Clock  -  The tropes that relate to different times of day.
Cool Gate  -  Walk-through teleporter.
Plot Archaeology  -  A story arc which is started, goes unmentioned for a long period, and is revived much later for a conclusion.
Hyperspace Mallet  -  Hammerspace used for Slapstick.
You Just Told Me  -  Tricking someone into blowing their cover by eliciting a knee-jerk reaction from them.
Black And White Insanity  -  Characters who have an extremely hard time understanding moral ambiguity.
Bait And Switch  -  Subversion as humor.
NGO Superpower  -  Non-state groups capable of confronting governments.
Doomed Upgrade  -  A piece of machinery meant to replace the current model is destroyed or otherwise rendered unusable because Status Quo Is God.
Leave The Two Lovebirds Alone  -  Characters who are attracted to each other are given some privacy by others in hopes that they'll talk and get officially together.
Elective Mute  -  A character chooses not to talk in spite of being physically capable of speech.
Infinity Plus One Element  -  A power that transcends Elemental RockPaperScissors.
Short Cuts Make Long Delays  -  When shortcuts aren't.
Accent Depundent  -  A work uses a pun that works better when said in a particular accent.
Stupidity Is The Only Option  -  The game railroads the player into doing something stupid.
Dying Smirk  -  Character grins, smirks or laughs ironically before dying.
Its All My Fault  -  This character blames themselves for something, whether they could have prevented it or not.
The Champion  -  A character who is a hero to another character.
Little Green Man In A Can  -  Alien lives inside of a mechanical device that they control.
Out Of Clothes Experience  -  Your soul/mind doesn't have clothes, so in out-of-body experiences you're naked.
Point And Click Map  -  A video game world map that functions like a menu: click on a location to go there.
Explicit Content  -  Some viewers may be too young to watch this.
Anti Infantry  -  Weapon that is effective at killing large numbers of enemy infantry.
Shoot The Dog  -  A good guy does something morally gray or even reprehensible for the greater good.
Lovable Jock  -  The Jock is a Nice Guy.
Naked In Mink  -  I'd rather wear fur than go naked.
Nebulous Evil Organisation  -  A large organization that does and promotes evil things across a vast area in the name of a common goal.
Because I Said So  -  A character comes up with shallow justifications for their actions; usually if they are in authority.
Doomed Protagonist  -  This guy is effed, and we are going to make you watch his slow demise.
Mistaken For Dog  -  This is NOT A DOG. And yet they're treating it like it is.
Filth  -  The Trope: Porn Played for Laughs.
Super Loser  -  The superpowers are cool, the owner isn't.
Buy Them Off  -  Character tries to escape their misdeed by paying their victims.
One Hero Hold The Weaksauce  -  The hero gets all the good powers without any of their drawbacks.
The Necrocracy  -  The Undead rule this kingdom.
Justice Will Prevail  -  A character confirms his/her commitment to justice.
Daddy Had A Good Reason For Abandoning You  -  A character was abandoned by their parent, but later learns they had a justifiable reason for doing so.
Powerup Letdown  -  A Power-Up that isn't.
Train Problem  -  That ridiculously hard math problem involving two trains.
Magical Database  -  A database of magical or otherwise abnormal stuff.
Segmented Serpent  -  A serpentine character or object with visible segments.
Instant Runes  -  Runes, formulas, magic circles and other trappings of ritual magic are scribed with suspicious quickness or spontaneously appear in midair when someone casts a spell.
Retroactive Wish  -  Character wishes for one thing, unexpectedly gets it, and wishes for something else in the vain hope it happens again.
Christmas In July  -  The characters observe Christmas out-of-season.
Interfaith Smoothie  -  A religion made by combining other religions.
Make Me Wanna Shout  -  Sound-based Elemental Powers.
Strangers On A Train Plot Murder  -  Two people make a deal to commit each other's heinous crime/difficult task.
Renegade Splinter Faction  -  Evil, crazy or fanatical subsect that separated from a more decent organization.
Hanahaki Disease  -  Unrequited love makes you cough up flower petals.
Our Elves Are Different  -  The different depictions of elves in fiction.
Ditto Fighter  -  Character who can only copy their opponent's abilities.
Impractically Fancy Outfit  -  An outfit so fancy it defeats its own purpose.
Poisoned Chalice Switcheroo  -  Two or more enemies have a drink. One of the drinks is poisoned and the glasses get switched around.
Too Many Belts  -  Character wears too many belts.
Dead End Room  -  A room with no exits.
Viewer Name Confusion  -  Part of the audience have a mistaken impression of what a character's name is.
Power Creep  -  Newer content is blatantly stronger than old ones.
Artifact Mook  -  A video game enemy appears in places and quantities that defy its original context.
Psychic Static  -  A victim bars a psychic from reading his mind by thinking irrelevant thoughts.
Our Mermaids Are Different  -  The original mermaid myths couldn't keep the details straight, either.
Kid Sidekick  -  Adult hero, very young sidekick.
Stationary Wings  -  Their wings don't move while they're flying.
Wizard Beard  -  Long beards are standard for those who specialize in magic.
Power Strain Blackout  -  A character using their special power causes them to faint, especially if it's the first time.
Escalating Brawl  -  A fight between two characters ends up in a complete brawl including everyone in sight.
Tragic Villain  -  A villain by circumstance, not by choice.
Still Wearing The Old Colors  -  A character wears a uniform associated with a group, despite the fact they are not in it anymore.
Jack Of All Stats  -  A member of the Competitive Balance who's good at everything, but the best at nothing.
Stealthy Cephalopod  -  Cephalopods as stealthy and sneaky spies.
Punch Punch Punch Uh Oh  -  Character punched many times with almost no effect.
Parabolic Power Curve  -  Leveling up decreases your effectiveness when done too much.
Your Eyes Can Deceive You  -  Sight can, and will, hinder your chances at winning this fight.
Deliberate Injury Gambit  -  Letting an attack hit you to let you use an attack of your own.
The Maker  -  The creator(s) of a/the world/universe/multiverse/species/etc.
The Original Darrin  -  An actor who is replaced by another actor returns to the role in later installments.
Literally Laughable Question  -  A person answers a question with a completely obvious answer by laughing hysterically.
Elemental Rock Paper Scissors  -  Some Elemental Powers have different strengths and weaknesses against other elements.
By Wall That Is Holey  -  A wall falls on you, but doesn't hurt you because you pass through a hole or window on it.
Token Wholesome  -  The modestly-dressed character out of a cast of fanservice.
Thirteen Is Unlucky  -  The number thirteen is a bad sign.
Citizenship Marriage  -  Marriage to allow legal immigration.
Violence Really Is The Answer  -  The violent response works, even if the character didn't want to use it.
My Future Self And Me  -  A time-traveler meets up with their future or past self. They fight crime.
Faux Flame  -  Supernatural flames that only look like fire.
Canon  -  The author said so and so it is.
Incredibly Lame Fun  -  A character finds a game highly amusing when it would commonly seem deathly dull.
Sai Guy  -  Sais used as bladed weapons.
Battle Rapping  -  A type of rapping to see who has the better rhymes
Lonely Piano Piece  -  A melancholic piano piece for sad moments.
Ankle Drag  -  Character dragged to their doom by their ankles.
Musical Episode  -  An episode full of musical numbers.
Mega Maw Maneuver  -  A vehicle gets captured by a much larger vehicle through a maw-like opening.
High Class Gloves  -  Gloves use as a sign of high class, regardless if they're actually of high class or not.
Marry Them All  -  The final answer to a harem is polygamy.
Intelligent Gerbil  -  Aliens who are sapient versions of Earth animals.
Middle Child Syndrome  -  If you're neither the eldest nor the youngest, you're The Un-Favourite.
Xenafication  -  Female character inexplicably gets more actiony.
Evil Is Bigger  -  Evil characters tend to be larger in size than good characters.
Might Makes Right  -  The strongest/richest/most influential decides what is fair.
Selective Memory  -  Player Character has important information the player has no access to.
Roswell That Ends Well  -  The Roswell UFO Incident of 1947 (or at least how fiction thinks it happened).
Ashes To Ashes  -  Elemental Powers over ash.
Discount Lesbians  -  Relationships that are obviously presenting as same-sex but technically aren't, usually due to a partner being non-human.
Joe Sent Me  -  Tell the bouncer you "know a guy" and they'll let you in.
I Never Told You My Name  -  Someone reveals they're more than they seem when they know someone's name without being introduced.
Produce Pelting  -  Fruits and vegetables thrown in response to a letdown performance.
Cross Dressing Voices  -  Voice actor plays opposite-gender role.
Screw The Rules I Have Supernatural Powers  -  Character uses superpowers to get away with breaking laws.
Animal Metaphor  -  Animals symbolize humans.
The I Love You Stigma  -  Using the word "love" to express affection for a person who is not related to you implies that you're in a relationship or will be in a relationship with the person, and should thus be used wisely.
Sudden Sequel Death Syndrome  -  They survived the first installment, only to die early or suddenly in the sequel.
Taking You With Me  -  Killing your enemy in your final moments.
Flashback  -  The characters' reminiscence of past events are relayed to the audience through another scene.
Thirty Day Free Trial  -  You can try it for free, but only for a limited amount of time; after that, you'll have to pay.
Dented Iron  -  A tough character's exploits lead to them receiving many injuries over the course of their adventures.
Nurse With Good Intentions  -  Someone tries to care for their sick or injured friend, but causes more problems than success.
Cat Scare  -  Yipe! *pause* Oh, whew; just the cat.
Forehead Of Doom  -  Character's forehead is a noticeable physical feature.
Call A Pegasus A Hippogriff  -  Giving a mythical creature the name of another mythical creature.
Have You Seen My God  -  God is currently unavailable. He may be coming back. He may not.
Honest Johns Dealership  -  A merchant or vendor who has what you need, as long as you don't care too much where or how he got it.
Redemption Promotion  -  A harmless or incompetent character Took a Level in Badass post-HeelFace Turn.
Animated Adaptation  -  The animated version of a pre-existing, usually live-action, franchise.
Fake Boobs  -  Breasts that are fake.
The Vamp  -  An irredeemably evil and completely exploitative seductress.
Unexplained Recovery  -  A character comes Back from the Dead with little to no explanation as to how.
Die Or Fly  -  Dormant superpowers come to light under extreme circumstances.
Interrogating The Dead  -  Interrogating someone who died.
Henshin Hero  -  He only has superpowers when in Super Mode.
Unconventional Wedding Dress  -  A bride wears something other than the traditional white, whether circumstance or choice.
Villainesses Want Heroes  -  The Villainess has an unrequited crush on The Hero.
Desert Skull  -  An animal's skull, usually bovine, in the desert.
Repeatable Quest  -  Quests that can be repeated.
Censor Steam  -  Steam/Smoke conveniently conceals the naughty bits.
Inevitable Tournament  -  If there's a tournament/competition of any sort, the protagonists will have to compete in it eventually.
Monstrous Seal  -  Seals, often big species such as leopard seals, portrayed as brutish, terrifying, and usually predatory.
Force And Finesse  -  Contrasting approaches in combat.
Compilation Rerelease  -  Multiple titles bundled together as a single product.
Amazon Chaser  -  A guy who is attracted to an Action Girl specifically because of that.
Pintsized Powerhouse  -  Little body, plenty strong.
Destination Host Unreachable  -  Someone is brought back from the dead, but has no way to meet up with the ones who resurrected them.
Cast From Calories  -  Calories can be used as an energy for supernatural powers.
Character Narrator  -  Onscreen character doing the narration.
Kryptonite Proof Suit  -  Wearing a suit or immunity device or trinket that protects you from your weakness.
British Rockstar  -  Rock musicians from Britain all indulge in Sex, Drugs and Rock & Roll.
The Graduate Homage Shot  -  Banging on the church windows and shouting the bride's name to try and stop the wedding.
Idealized Sex  -  Fiction inaccurately portrays sex.
The Worst Seat In The House  -  There's an exciting event going on, but you've picked a really bad spot to watch it.
Death By Racism  -  Racist character suffers a Karmic Death.
Reduced To Ratburgers  -  A desperately starving character eats rats just to survive.
The Eponymous Show  -  Shows that are named after the main character.
Token Good Teammate  -  A good person whose group consists of jerks at best, pure monsters at worst.
Nude Colored Clothes  -  Wearing clothes that has the same color as your skin.
Sand Blaster  -  Sand-based Elemental Powers.
Steel Ear Drums  -  HEARING LOSS DOES NOT EXIST IN FICTION!!!
The Fettered  -  Limitations bring strength, not weakness.
Rewatch Bonus  -  I didn't notice that the first time I watched it!
Anti Anti Christ  -  A character "destined" to become the Antichrist doesn't.
Allergic To Routine  -  Character gets bored very easily and desperately seeks entertainment.
Chirping Crickets  -  A visual or audio to represent silence or emptiness.
Royally Screwed Up  -  A royal family that produces more than its share of loony, evil, or maladjusted rulers.
Sworn In By Oath  -  Someone joins an organization by reciting an oath.
Cable Satellite Mudslinging  -  Cable's ads try to convince you that satellite is the pits and vice versa.
Surveillance Station Slacker  -  Someone who's meant to watch something is lazy and goofs off.
The Obstructive Love Interest  -  A love interest who misunderstands her lover's behavior and treats him terribly until the ending where they hook up.
Its Always Sunny At Funerals  -  The weather is inappropriately good for a funeral.
Urban Segregation  -  Dividing a city by sections for each social class.
Never Smile At A Crocodile  -  Alligators, crocodiles, caimans: they will probably eat you.
Saw Star Wars Twenty Seven Times  -  A devoted Fanboy has enjoyed a work over and over again many times.
Revealing Coverup  -  Hiding something in such a way that just draws attention to it. I don't know what you were smoking, but it must have been pretty good stuff.
Liquid Courage  -  Drinking alcohol makes you feel more confident.
Blasting It Out Of Their Hands  -  Shooting a weapon off someone else's hand.
Truth In Television  -  When a trope actually does happen in Real Life.
Building Of Adventure  -  All of the series' plots take place within this one building.
Worst News Judgment Ever  -  Unimportant (but often plot-important) news story somehow becomes the front page headliner.
Unconventional Learning Experience  -  A work can be used for educational purposes, even though that isn't the point.
Friend Or Idol Decision  -  Choosing between your friend or your heart's desire.
You Will Not Evade Me  -  Your opponent makes sure you're always within range, no matter what.
Joke Character  -  Purposely UNDERpowered.
Absurd Phobia  -  A character has an unusual fear that's Played for Laughs.
Chevalier Vs Rogue  -  Two opposing characters/factions, one with with a knightly theme and another with roguish one.
Clarkes Third Law  -  Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic to those who don't understand it.
The Heartless  -  Monsters born from negative emotions.
Psychosomatic Superpower Outage  -  Loss of confidence results in loss of superpowers.
Girlfriend In Canada  -  Fictitious significant other who allegedly lives so far away his or her existence conveniently cannot be verified.
Dual Mode Unit  -  A unit-type in Real-Time Strategy that is able to switch between multiple functions.
Made Of Incendium  -  Objects catch fire and burn much faster than they would in real life.
The Famine  -  Mass Starvation = Crapsack World
Storming The Beaches  -  Landing troops on the beaches, usually with an enemy force defending from prepared positions trying to stop the former.
Hello Insert Name Here  -  The game lets you name its protagonist and/or other important character(s).
Killed Off Screen  -  A character dies outside of the audience's view.
Conveniently Seated  -  In scenes that take place in the classroom, the main character will be sitting where it's convenient for the writer.
Player Punch  -  Something makes the player feel stupid/horrible.
Im Mr Future Pop Culture Reference  -  Time traveler uses the name of a present-day fictional character or popular figure as an alias.
Original Man  -  The first human species was not the homo sapien we are.
You Said You Would Let Them Go  -  The villain breaks a promise he was never going to keep. The hero, outraged, says this.
Plucky Middie  -  The nickname for a young soldier.
Power Is Sexy  -  Power is attractive.
Here We Go Again  -  The story ends the same way it started.
Accidentally Correct Writing  -  The writers didn't care about getting their facts right, but by pure fluke they got them partially or completely right anyway.
Eats Babies  -  Eating children is extremely evil.
Flowers For Algernon Syndrome  -  Character improves but reverts by the end of the story because the improvement was only temporary.
Baseless Mission  -  Mission without a base in a strategy game about base management.
Do It Yourself Plumbing Project  -  Plumbing is weird.
Not His Sled  -  A plot twist in an adaptation resulting from tweaking the source material.
Damned By A Fools Praise  -  A Take That! in the form of a dumb or sleazy character liking something.
Board To Death  -  Villain kills people at a meeting.
Eating Machine  -  A machine that consumes human food.
God Of Order  -  A god that creates and/or maintains order.
Superpower Russian Roulette  -  A chance of having superpowers also means a chance at death or similar unpleasantness.
Story Branching  -  The level/objective/choice progression changes depending on the player's decisions or performance in any given playthrough.
Uranus Is Showing  -  Heh heh, astronomers said "ur anus".
Luck Based Mission  -  Whether you win or lose is based entirely on luck.
Outdoorsy Gal  -  A girl who loves the outdoors.
Crystal Ball  -  Crystal balls are used for magical purposes, typically for seeing things.
Deadly Disc  -  Circular throwing weapon.
Erotic Eating  -  Eating made sexy.
Final Death Mode  -  A game mode in which blacking out truly means Game Over.
Design Students Orgasm  -  Artsy and confusing visuals.
The Heckler  -  Every comedian's worst nightmare.
Books That Bite  -  Troublesome sentient objects.
Desperate Object Catch  -  A dramatic catch of a falling object (usually something that means bad news if it hits the floor).
Reality Breaking Paradox  -  The fabric of reality is destroyed because someone did something impossible.
Deus Ax Machina  -  In Case of Plot Convenience, Break Glass
Undead Child  -  Children who happen to be an undead creature like a vampire, ghost, zombie, mummy or Frankenstein's monster.
Weak To Magic  -  Weak against magical attacks.
Sonic Stunner  -  A weapon that blasts sound.
Good Wings Evil Wings  -  Wing type/color indicates Character Alignment.
Dark Mistress  -  A Love Interest for the villain.
Pass Fail  -  When trying to live life as another demographic proves unsuccessful.
Burial In Space  -  Body is disposed in space.
Doppelganger Gets Same Sentiment  -  A person projects their feelings about someone they know onto an Identical Stranger that "is" (or used to be) that person.
Troubled But Cute  -  They're a dysfunctional loner, but damn if they aren't hot, and they're good guys at heart in most cases.
Cultural Cringe  -  When people consider their own country and its culture inferior to other countries and their cultures.
Always A Bigger Fish  -  Big threat is taken out by bigger threat.
Portal Picture  -  Picture or painting acts as a Cool Gate, transporting people somewhere. Usually another world or dimension.
Colonel Kilgore  -  Military officer gets a kick out of warfare.
Dysfunctional Family  -  This family only shares blood and mutual enmity.
Poor Communication Kills  -  Characters do not communicate with each other when needed, causing problems.
Animated Armor  -  An empty suit of armor that moves on its own.
Intrepid Merchant  -  Half explorer, half merchant.
The Nudifier  -  Machine that strips people.
Large And In Charge  -  The leader is the largest.
Raptor Attack  -  How Deinonychus and similar theropod dinosaurs as portrayed in media, not quite as paleontologists know them.
Fetch Quest  -  I got a mission for you: get me a Plot Coupon.
Fourth Wall Portrait  -  Realistic illustration in cartoony settings.
Elevator Action Sequence  -  Fight in an elevator.
The Phoenix  -  Trope: A bird of flame that is revived upon dying.
Goofy Print Underwear  -  Showing a character's childish or just plain stupid-looking underwear as a gag.
Cant Move While Being Watched  -  An enemy that can only move while unseen.
Came From The Sky  -  Something that falls from the sky that looks like a meteor and leaves a large crater.
The Spiny  -  Your Goomba Stomp won't work on this enemy.
Droste Image  -  An image which contains a copy of itself, which contains a copy of itself, and so on.
What Do They Fear Episode  -  An episode where every character has to face their fears.
Warm Water Whiz  -  Putting a sleeping persons hands in warm water makes them wet the bed.
Men Are Uncultured  -  Males have no taste in culture.
Fandom Specific Plot  -  It seems that every fanfic writer in the fandom uses this basic plotline.
Cain And Abel  -  Sibling rivalry turns into bitter hatred with murderous intent.
Recorded Spliced Conversation  -  Passing off a modified recording of an individual as genuine.
Improvised Training  -  You don't have state-of-the-art training equipment: but these trees, wrenches, and almond hills will do.
Literal Metaphor  -  A statement that is literally meant in a non-exaggeration manner.
Just A Kid  -  A child is underestimated or doubted due to their age.
Shared Dream  -  Two sleepers have the same dream, or are together in the same dream.
Take This Job And Shove It  -  A character angrily quits their job.
Super Breeding Program  -  Making "better" people by breeding them.
I Dont Like The Sound Of That Place  -  Place-names that sound like really bad places, whether they are or not.
Hypnotize The Princess  -  Brainwashing a hostage or Damsel in Distress to make that character cooperative for the kidnapper's plans.
Powers Do The Fighting  -  Powers allow someone to fight while barely moving.
Complaining About Complaining  -  A character complains about another character's complaining.
Rescue Romance  -  Two people fall in love after one saves the other's life.
Goofy Feathered Dinosaur  -  Feathered dinosaurs are seen as silly and harmless.
Xenomorph Xerox  -  A character clearly designed as an Expy of the Xenomorph from Ridley Scott's Alien.
Afterlife Welcome  -  The character is greeted on their deathbed by those already in the afterlife.
Hey Wait  -  An infiltrator who's just gotten past the guards in disguise is called back for what turns out to be something mundane.
Relieved Failure  -  A character is actually grateful to have failed in their struggle.
Shoe Phone  -  Nifty gadgets disguised as mundane objects.
Alien Space Bats  -  Supernatural intervention caused the Alternate History.
Sorry Im Late  -  Lucky I found you in the nick of time, though.
They Were Holding You Back  -  The villain kills the hero's loved one/ones, due to believing they are holding him/her back from reaching his/her full potential.
Mono No Aware  -  All good things must come to an end.
Friend To All Children  -  Anyone who's good with kids can't be all that bad.
Disguised Hostage Gambit  -  The villain disguises hostages as his minions in hopes of getting them killed by The Cavalry.
Noble Demon  -  A self-serving villain with a Code of Honour.
Bias Steamroller  -  Critics let personal biases impact their reviews.
Wealths In A Name  -  Character's name is related to their financial status.
One Two Three Four Go  -  Wordplay involving how the English word "go" is a homophone for the Japanese word for "five".
Sounding It Out  -  Characters reading words aloud when it's unnecessary.
Gratuitous Princess  -  A work has more princesses than needed by the plot or setting, just because.
Anthropomorphic Food  -  Food that is able to walk, talk, and think like a person.
Tablecloth Yank  -  Trying to pull a tablecloth off of a table without disturbing the objects on it.
Villain Of Another Story  -  Someone who is not a villain in the main story, but is a villain somewhere else in the setting.
Skilled But Naive  -  A Naïve Newcomer who is nonetheless a fledgling badass.
Resurrection Revenge  -  Coming Back from the Dead to avenge your own death.
Americans Are Cowboys  -  You can tell he's American because he wears a cowboy hat.
Metropolis Level  -  A video game level that takes place in a bustling city.
Undercover When Alone  -  Undercover character keeps the facade up for the audience, too.
Heel Face Return  -  The Villain gets Put on a Bus and returns as a Good Guy.
Series Fic  -  A series of fan fics share their own continuity.
Hurt Foot Hop  -  Hopping around on one foot while clutching the other one after it was hurt.
Ear Notch  -  A piece of flesh from a character's ear is missing to denote their personality temperament.
Cigarette Of Anxiety  -  Cigarette. Now.
Short Range Guy Long Range Guy  -  One fights up-close; the other fights from a distance.
Vulgar Humor  -  Vulgarity Played for Laughs.
Blame Game  -  If something goes wrong, everyone starts blaming everyone else back and forth.
Television Geography  -  Things the average viewer won't notice, but a person familiar with the area will.
We Are Not Going Through That Again  -  Just finished one Call to Adventure, not interested in another.
California Doubling  -  A specific location is used as scenery for different places all over the world.
Purposely Overpowered  -  Yes, it's supposed to be that ridiculously strong.
Armored Villains Unarmored Heroes  -  You can tell who the bad guy is because he has heavier armor.
Too Long Didnt Dub  -  Leaving words or phrases in the original language in a translation.
Trapped On The Astral Plane  -  Someone is stuck in a ghostly reality on top of our own.
Rapunzel Hair  -  Very long hair indicates femininity and/or being of high status.
Profiling  -  The police use a suspect's ethnicity to determine their guilt.
Cant Use Stairs  -  When a character (usually a robot) that will often be faced with stairs is unable to navigate them.
Where Does He Get All Those Wonderful Toys  -  How does this guy pay for all the gadgets and fortresses he owns without compromising his Secret Identity?
Absurdly Short Level  -  A level that's much shorter compared to others in the game.
Mental Monster  -  A monster that is a symbolic manifestation of one's psyche.
Little Green Men  -  Stereotypical aliens are small and green.
Master Of Unlocking  -  There's no lock this character has met that they can't open.
I Was Never Here  -  This never happened.
Weapons That Suck  -  Weaponized suction.
Invaded States Of America  -  The United States is invaded and/or occupied by another power.
Eviler Than Thou  -  One villain defeats another, usually easily, to demonstrate how much of a threat they are.
I Reject Your Reality  -  Character cannot accept any other way than theirs, facts be damned.
Bling Bling Bang  -  A weapon which also serves as jewelry.
Straight Edge Evil  -  Villains who say no to drugs, alcohol and other unhealthy habits.
Kosher Nostra  -  Jewish gangsters.
Incredibly Obvious Bug  -  A "concealed" listening or tracking device that's large and blinking.
Perfectly Arranged Marriage  -  Arranged marriage leads to true love.
Burn The Witch  -  Burning a suspected witch at the stake.
Stern Chase  -  The Chase with fighting every step of the way.
Evil Chef  -  Villain skilled in the culinary arts.
Hes Back  -  Character recovers from Heroic BSoD and makes an epic comeback.
Clothes Make The Maniac  -  An evil set of clothes or item that takes over its wearer/user.
Video Game Geography  -  The world map is realistically impossible, but it's easier than coding spheroid topology or forcing travel over Real Life distances.
Funny Bruce Lee Noises  -  Someone making exaggerated martial arts poses and sounds indicates that person does not know how to fight.
The Inquisitor General  -  A general who has unrealistic expectations on making their soldiers perfect.
Comics Rule Everything Around Me  -  Many rappers are nerds.
Last Second Chance  -  A hero offers a villain one last chance to change his ways.
Aimlessly Seeking Happiness  -  A character wants to be happy... but doesn't know how.
Weather Manipulation  -  Power to control the weather.
Bow Chicka Wow Wow  -  A Stock Phrase used like That's What She Said, imitating 1970s porn music.
Battle Couple  -  Lovers that kick ass together.
Shoulder Teammate  -  When one character cares another on their shoulder.
Death Throws  -  You fall offscreen when you die.
Eyes Always Averted  -  Never looking directly at anyone.
Adaptational Consent  -  A romantic or sexual encounter is changed in a future adaptation to either be consensual or non-consensual.
They Look Just Like Everyone Else  -  When a villain looks like a normal person.
Video Inside Film Outside  -  On a TV show, filmnote typically 16mm is used when shooting outside and/or on-location, while video camerasnote Between The '50s and the early '80s, video tape recorders were not portable at all are used on sound stages.
Time Bomb  -  Three...
Oh And X Dies  -  When the writer or narrator tells you that a specific person will die.
All Adult Animation Is South Park  -  The belief that Western Animation can only appeal to adults when it's full of offensive humor.
Lost Toy Grievance  -  A character, usually a young child, becomes extremely upset over their favorite toy going missing.
Wreathed In Flames  -  Man on Fire utilized as a superpower.
Prove I Am Not Bluffing  -  I'll do this on principle. Don't push me to what I'll do for gain.
No Intelligent Life Here  -  Characters from other areas view their hosts as idiots.
Treachery Is A Special Kind Of Evil  -  Betraying others is treated as an especially morally reprehensible act.
This Is My Story  -  The Protagonist provides How We Got Here Narration.
Romance Sidequest  -  An optional Romance Arc between a video game's Player Character and an NPC.
Immortality Begins At Twenty  -  If you're immortal or very Long-Lived, you'll age at a human rate until reaching adulthood. Then you'll stay looking like that.
Hair Color Dissonance  -  An impossible hair color is used to represent a plausible one.
We Will Not Use Photoshop In The Future  -  There's no way this can be fake! It's a photograph!
Video Game Time  -  Fake use of a time scale means that empires rise and fall in the time it takes to take the trash out.
Missing Steps Plan  -  A plan without any middle steps.
Brave The Ride Plot  -  An amusement park plot that centers around characters surviving and riding around the park.
Pacifism Backfire  -  The "violence is not the answer" principle only leads to more violence.
Royal Harem  -  Monarchical polygamy makes part of the aristocratic court.
Face Your Fears  -  Confronting the thing that scares you most.
Social Deduction Game  -  A game where players have to root out each others' allegiances before the villainous player/team achieves their goal.
Aggressive Categorism  -  A character associates specific groups such as gender or race, with disparaging attributes, and denies their status as members of their groups if they are superior to or not part of those associations.
You Cant Handle The Parody  -  Stock Parodies of Jack Nicholson's Signature Line in A Few Good Men.
Cow Tools  -  A bunch of useful-looking things that are just there for show.
The Shangri La  -  Hidden Elf Village in the Far East.
Adventure Guild  -  An organization that enables adventurers to be hired to go on quests.
Ditzy Secretary  -  A secretary who is unintelligent and unsuited for the job.
Hollywood Dreamtime  -  Australian Aboriginal concept "the Dreamtime" portrayed inaccurately in fiction.
Africa Is A Country  -  Africa generalized as a single country with a single culture.
Bullet Time  -  A visual effect to depict super dodging.
Kill The God  -  Killing God(s).
Morality Pet  -  A character whom a villain or jerk is consistently nice to and has a soft spot for.
Bourgeois Bumpkin  -  Someone who suffers from First World Problems so much that they think they're marginalized and destitute.
Death Is The Only Option  -  The only way to achieve victory is to die; revival optional.
The Death Of Death  -  A being embodying death dies.
You Have Researched Breathing  -  Unlocking or learning the ability to do things you should already be able to do.
Aloof Ally  -  An ally who has better things to do than to participate in team spirit.
Over The Top Roller Coaster  -  An rollercoaster build in a way that is absurdly unrealistic
Parents Know Their Children  -  Parents can identify their children no matter what.
Improvised Diaper  -  Using something thats not a diaper as a diaper.
Returning Big Bad  -  Major antagonist who was already defeated and went away comes back as the main threat again, often stronger than before.
Clock Punk  -  Punk Punk version of The Renaissance era, or if Leonardo da Vinci's unused inventions actually changed the world.
Transhuman Aliens  -  The "aliens" turn out to be enhanced humans.
Sacrificial Revival Spell  -  This spell kills you, but it brings someone back to life.
Two Plus Torture Makes Five  -  Torture makes someone believe or admit Blatant Lies.
Animal Stampede  -  Tons of animals, all running in one direction, and plowing through anything in front of them.
Serial Killings Specific Target  -  A person kills multiple people to hide the significance of his primary target.
Wave Motion Gun  -  A weapon or technique that fires a massive devastating laser beam.
Poison Ring  -  A wearable accessory or item of clothing that conceals poison.
Scale Of Scientific Sins  -  Secular vices to be very, very wary of.
Action Girl  -  A Badass fighter who just happens to be female.
Old People Are Nonsexual  -  The belief that old people don't have sex, and those that do are gross or funny.
Sand Is Water  -  When sand moves, feels, and acts like water.
Nice Jewish Boy  -  A Jewish Nice Guy (who may or may not be a Geek).
Hero Antagonist  -  The good guys oppose the main characters.
Trrrilling Rrrs  -  I always rrrrrrrroll the Rrrrs when I speak.
Scary Impractical Armor  -  The armor is terrifying, but that's about it.
The Original Series  -  The original work and the entire franchise share the same title.
Local Hangout  -  A public place where the True Companions regularly meet up.
Bishonen  -  A delicate, androgynous man and boy in East Asian media.
Cop And Scientist  -  Cop is Street Smart and Book Dumb; scientist has next-to-No Social Skills or fighting skills. They Fight Crime!
Sitting On The Roof  -  Need a good place to be alone with your thoughts? The top of your house should do!
Angry Dance  -  Dancing to show your anger.
I Will Punish Your Friend For Your Failure  -  A villain motivates an underling by threatening the underling's loved ones.
Silly Reason For War  -  Waging war for the dumbest reasons possible.
Bavarian Fire Drill  -  Acting with authority fools others into thinking that you have it.
Get Into Jail Free  -  A character needs to talk to or rescue someone in jail, so they get in trouble to get into jail with them.
The Secret Of Long Pork Pies  -  Cook kills people to put into best selling meat products because for some reason people just taste 'better than pies'.
Hero Must Survive  -  If this guy dies, Game Over.
Talking The Monster To Death  -  Kill 'em with words.
Epic Ship On Ship Action  -  Surface warships engaging one another in epic gun duels between point-blank and minimum visual range.
Rushed Inverted Reading  -  A character pretends to read a book to avoid drawing attention, but accidentally picks it up upside down.
Hashtag For Laughs  -  Using hashtags in a comedic and/or parodic manner.
The Mourning After  -  A character never fully recovers from a particularly intense relationship that ended traumatically.
Who Wants To Live Forever  -  Immortality Sucks.
Grotesque Gallery  -  Group of creatures who appear ugly or gross.
Bishonen Line  -  The point at which an evil creature transforms into a more human form instead of getting increasingly monstrous.
Brotherhood Of Funny Hats  -  A benign, non-threatening fraternal order.
Revenge Myopia  -  Avenging someone who was killed by accident or for the sake of self-defense.
Armed Legs  -  Shoes that double as weapons or have weapons mounted on them.
Small Town Boredom  -  Bored with the ordinary place they live in.
Triumphant Reprise  -  An dark or downbeat song is reprised with a triumphant or more lighthearted motif.
Big What  -  Giving a big, dramatic "What?"
One Book Author  -  A creator who has released one work, and almost nothing else.
Epic Movie  -  Big. Fucking. Movie.
Conditioned To Accept Horror  -  A person is or gets used to accepting horrible things around them.
Draw Sword Draw Blood  -  If a weapon is pulled from its scabbard, you might as well use it before you put it away.
Reluctant Ruler  -  The person who doesn't want power is most suitable to receive it.
Supergroup  -  A music project formed by members from other famous acts.
Nice Mice  -  Mice portrayed as good guys.
Rebellious Rebel  -  A person who rebels against a group of rebels.
All According To Plan  -  No matter how bad it looks like things are going for the villain, he doesn't care because it's all just a part of his master plan.
Born In The Theatre  -  Breaking the Fourth Wall in a movie theater.
Stock Lateral Thinking Puzzle  -  An oft-repeated puzzle that requires you to think outside the box.
Always Murder  -  Nine times out of ten, the crime on a crime show will be a murder.
Year Zero  -  Trope: A specific event in the continuity is the start of an arbitrary calendar.
Reforged Into A Minion  -  A character is rebuilt as one of the Big Bad's minions.
Dig Your Own Grave  -  For some reason someone must dig their own grave before immediate death.
Youthful Freckles  -  Freckles use as an indicator of youthfulness.
Beeping Computers  -  Computers make a lot of sounds.
Tough Armored Dinosaur  -  Stegosaurs and ankylosaurs portrayed as tough and war-like.
Argentina Is Naziland  -  Nazi fugitives are still out there.
Necessary Drawback  -  Advantages require disadvantage.
Insecure Love Interest  -  A love interest who feels unworthy of their significant other's affection.
Love Can Make You Gonk  -  Love elicits cartoonish reactions.
Disaster Relief Game  -  A game genre where the players must prevent or contain a major disaster.
Venturous Smuggler  -  An adventurous scoundrel who transports illegal cargo for a living.
Narm  -  When something is meant to be dramatic but it's instead just funny.
Pest Episode  -  The main characters spend the episode trying to catch a pest.
Heart Drive  -  A part of a person's body that contains their consciousness.
Chivalric Romance  -  The original romance genre in the Middle Ages.
Stock Footage Failure  -  When using Stock Footage (to save time and money) results in continuity errors.
Removed Achilles Heel  -  A character missing a weakness or limitation that should have.
Symbiotic Possession  -  Something possesses someone's body, but both work together without the invader forcing control over the host.
Canon Character All Along  -  A "new" character is actually a guise for an old, already established character.
Bile Fascination  -  It's horrible... But you want to see how horrible it is.
Uncatty Resemblance  -  Pets who tend to resemble their owners.
Concert Kiss  -  Kissing in front of a live audience.
Poison And Cure Gambit  -  I've poisoned you. If you do X for me, I'll give you the antidote.
Coming And Going  -  A sex act and someone's death are framed together in the story without being directly correlated.
Optional Stealth  -  A video game mission where stealth is encouraged, but not vital to win.
Noisy Guns  -  Guns always have to click and cock even when not being fired.
Event Flag  -  An in-game condition that, if met by the player's earlier actions, alters the story progression in some way.
Intimate Telecommunications  -  Salacious conversations over the phone or other long-distance communication device.
Came Back Strong  -  A person comes Back from the Dead and takes a level in badass.
Black Blood  -  Changing the color of blood from red to something else for censorship reasons.
Pyramid Power  -  Pyramids tend to possess unique power, or house something that does.
Tastes Like Diabetes  -  It's ADORABLE! And not much else!
Hero Killer  -  A character who specializes in killing heroes and/or has a reputation for doing so.

Mad Oracle  -  Can see the future. Can't relate to the present.
Hug And Comment  -  Two people hug, then one of them makes an unexpected comment.
Woobie Species  -  An entire race or species is made up of woobies.

Red Baron  -  A badass character has a badass nickname to match.

Metaphorically True  -  A lie that gets excused as a "truth" by shaky justification.

Endearingly Dorky  -  An awkward character elicits positive feelings in others.
Impersonating An Officer  -  Passing oneself off as an officer of the law.
Peek A Boo Corpse  -  Dead bodies show up when and where they're not expected.
Informed Equipment  -  You can't see your character's BFS and Stylish Protection Gear, but trust us, they're there.
Yawn And Reach  -  A character yawns and, while stretching, puts one arm around another character's shoulders.
Ambiguous Disorder  -  A character who has a vague mental disorder.
Not Screened For Critics  -  No reviews after a major release usually means the product isn't that good anyway.

Constantly Changing Name  -  Something or someone whose name is always changing.
Im Dying Please Take My Mac Guffin  -  You're given an object by a dying man. It's a Plot Device!

Breakaway Pop Hit  -  Extremely popular song from a movie nobody remembers.
Purely Aesthetic Glasses  -  Wearing glasses solely to look smart.
Interactive Narrator  -  Narrator: The fourth wall between the characters and the narrator is missing.

Cicadian Rhythm  -  Hearing cicadas means it's summer.

Super Serum  -  Some manner of chemical is injected or ingested and gives the character superpowers.

Growing Muscles Sequence  -  A scene where a character's muscles grow exponentially large very fast.
Transplant  -  Character from the old series shows up in the new series.
Multiplayer Difficulty Spike  -  The multiplayer mode(s) are significantly more challenging than the single-player campaign.
Ideal Hero  -  A morally upright hero.
Lovecraftian Superpower  -  Body Horror, WEAPONIZED!
Minnesota Nice  -  People from Midwest America are nice and polite.

Cherry Tapping  -  Defeating someone with a weak attack to humiliate them.

Royal Rapier  -  Rapiers are the Weapon of Choice for people of noble birth and/or a sophisticated personality.
Event Title  -  This work is titled after an event (or series thereof) that took place, is taking place, or is about to take place in the story.
Went To The Great X In The Sky  -  Where characters claim the dead go In-Universe, in reference to what defined them in life.
Secret Identity  -  Character (usually a Super Hero) hides their real identity.
The Butler Did It  -  The crime (usually theft or murder) was committed by the butler (or some other member of the household staff). (Maids and valets also count.)
Astro Turf  -  Viral Marketing by an organization disguised as grassroots, word-of-mouth support by ordinary people.
Spared By The Adaptation  -  A character dies in the original work, but not in the adaptation based on it.
Exit Pursued By A Bear  -  Unsympathetic character is finished off by a large, vicious animal.
The Pearly Gates  -  The Gates of Heaven.
Strangely Specific Horoscope  -  Your horoscope for the day literally predicts what's going to happen to you.
Hostage Spirit Link  -  Shooting innocents somehow causes you to take physical damage.
Black Tie Infiltration  -  The Infiltration takes place at a formal social event.
The Paranoiac  -  Paranoia personified.
Dualvertisement  -  An advertisement that's a cross-promotion for more than one product or service, often as part of a larger marketing campaign.
Benevolent Precursors  -  The Precursors are actually pretty decent folk.
Then Let Me Be Evil  -  If everybody's going to treat me like the villain, then I'll be the villain.
Lurid Tales Of Doom  -  A newspaper or magazine story of, at the best, extremely questionable truth, or at the worst, total fabrication.
King Of Thieves  -  The leader of a criminal faction.
Marathon Boss  -  A boss that takes forever to kill.
Trip Trap  -  Stretching a rope across a path to trip someone up.
Directionally Solid Platforms  -  You can jump on this platform from below as if it was immaterial, but then can stand on it as if it wasn't.
Ambiguous Time Period  -  Time period work takes place in is left vague, with old times with "futuristic" elements or modern times with retro elements.
Rubber Band AI  -  The better you are at the game, the harder it gets.
Rhyming Names  -  A character has rhyming first and last names.
Black Comedy Cannibalism  -  Cannibalism is played for (dark) laughs.
Vast Bureaucracy  -  A bureaucratic system of epic proportions, possibly seeming far too large and complex for the job they're supposed to do.
Emotion Bomb  -  Mind Control that works on people's emotions.
City Of Canals  -  A city with lots of small man-made rivers
Pivotal Boss  -  A Stationary Boss battle in a circular arena.
Magic Is Mental  -  Magic requires a sharp mind, not a sturdy body.
The Chikan  -  Japanese subway molesters.
Hand Hiding Sleeves  -  Sleeves that are so long, they cover the wearer's hands.
Jagged Mouth  -  Instead of proper teeth, a creature seems to have jagged continuations of (whatever passes for) the skin on its face.
No Just No Reaction  -  Don't even think about it.
To Be Continued Right Now  -  A reveal is set up to be explained in the next episode, but is then immediately explained.
Junk Rare  -  Your odds of finding it are low... and it's totally worthless.
Skintone Sclerae  -  The sclera (white part) of the eye is the color of the skin.
Death Takes A Holiday  -  The Grim Reaper, for whatever reason, stops making people die.
Lost Him In A Card Game  -  Gambling about people.
Convenient Miscarriage  -  Pregnancy storyline without a baby.
Not Afraid To Die  -  A character who isn't afraid of death without being a Death Seeker.
All Encompassing Mantle  -  Someone wearing a long, body-enveloping cloak emanates mystery, power, and authority.
Ultra Super Death Gore Fest Chainsawer 3000  -  Stereotypical violent media.
Badass Pacifist  -  This character can kick ass... peacefully.
Addiction Displacement  -  Replacing an unhealthy addiction with another, usually healthier one.
Over 100 Percent Completion  -  A game allows you to complete it with more than 100% status.
Razor Sharp Hand  -  A person's hands are deadly and sharp weapons, such as swords are somewhat inconvenient compared to them.
I Die Free  -  I die, but I die a free man and not a slave.
One True Threesome  -  Fans shipping 3 characters together in a triadic couple.
Divergent Character Evolution  -  Similar character becomes different.
Changeling Tale  -  Fairy Abduction.
God Of Evil  -  A deity who is the ultimate embodiment of evil.
Secret Identity Change Trick  -  A plot device where the hero with a Secret Identity must improvise a way to get out of sight to change identities.
Unobtainium  -  It's rare, hard to find, and powers your stuff.
Half Identical Twins  -  Twins who look identical except for their genders.
Red Alert  -  An organization is put on its maximum active status in response to an emergency.
Crossing The Desert  -  The hero must cross a desert.
Wake Up Go To School Save The World  -  The Kid Hero has to juggle heroics with their personal life.
Not So Invincible After All  -  A supposedly Invincible Hero or Villain turns out to not be invincible.
Filler Villain  -  Villain created for filler material.
Breast Expansion  -  Breasts get bigger.
Giggling Villain  -  The villains Evil Laugh is a giggle.
Only The Chosen May Ride  -  A horse or other rideable creature which can only be tamed and ridden by the one it chooses.
Redshirt Reporter  -  Being a journalist can be a deadly job.
Accessory Wearing Cartoon Animal  -  A character neither wears a shirt nor pants, but still wears some kind of clothing (Like hats or shoes).
Harmless Freezing  -  Frozen in ice, but still somehow alive and well.
Die Hard On An X  -  A plot where a location is taken over by bad guys and The Hero uses guerrilla tactics to stop them.
Self Backing Vocalist  -  When a vocalist overdubs their own voice to simulate backing vocals.
Butt Cannon  -  Using your butt as a weapon.
Scanlation  -  Fans translate manga.
Everythings Better With Rainbows  -  Everyone thinks rainbows are pretty
Cool But Inefficient  -  It's cool, but something less cool might be better.
Magic Knight  -  Skilled in swords and sorcery.
Bedmate Reveal  -  Waking up next to someone else in bed, and not expecting it.
Spontaneous Generation  -  Living thing is born from a non-living thing.
Vampire Doctor  -  A character whose chosen profession is directly contrasted by their Horror Hunger.
Revisiting The Roots  -  Series reboot or followup that reuses more aspects of the series' earliest entries than other followups did.
Gender Inverted Trope  -  An Always Female, or Always Male, trope that is applied to the opposite gender.
Prongs Of Poseidon  -  The huge fork used by devils and sea gods.
Symbol Swearing  -  Using symbols to censor profanity and other obscenities in text.
Perfect Poison  -  It's undetectable, fast-acting, and you only need a small dose of it to kill.
Campfire Character Exploration  -  Characters open up to each beside a campfire.
Blow You Away  -  Wind-based Elemental Powers.
Fingore  -  AHHHHHH! MY FINGERS!!!
Master Of Disguise  -  Character is adept at posing as someone/thing else.
Metaphorgotten  -  The analogy breaks down and stops making sense.
Companion Specific Sidequest  -  A Side Quest given to you by a Non-Player Companion.
Forgotten Phlebotinum  -  Useful power or device revealed in one episode that would be useful in later episodes but never used again.
Living Crashpad  -  When a character lands on another character.
Oh Crap There Are Fanfics Of Us  -  Characters react to the fanbase's works.
Most Writers Are Adults  -  Fictional kids acting too much like adults.
Team Rocket Wins  -  The consistently failing villains win.
Adaptational Explanation  -  Something that didn't make sense in the original work is given a proper explanation in a adaptation.
Artistic License Explosives  -  Explosives are presented inaccurately in fiction for the sake of telling a better story.
Divine Parentage  -  One or more of a person's parents happens to be a god.
Right Through His Pants  -  Even when a man and woman are both having sex, there will be far more female nudity than male nudity.
Revenge Romance  -  Dating someone for revenge.
Captain Space Defender Of Earth  -  Parody of space opera heroes.
Preserve Your Gays  -  Protect LGBT+ characters at all costs.
Weirdness Coupon  -  If you're odd, you can do as much odd stuff as you wish.
Souls Like RPG  -  A very difficult RPG sub-genre which emphasizes maneuverability and reflexes.
Pun  -  Humor based on wordplay.
Plot Triggering Death  -  A character's death at the outset of a story puts its main plot into motion.
Reporting Names  -  Codenames used for identifying enemy units.
Falling Damage  -  When a Player Character in a video game takes damage from a fall.
Amnesiac Liar  -  Character lies, forgets everything, then accepts the lie as truth.
You Killed My Father  -  Murdered family member provides the impetus for revenge.
No Harm Requirement  -  A character must defeat, outwit, or capture another character or object without causing excessive harm, if any.
Magical Asian  -  Wise Asian mentor.
Heavenly Blue  -  The color blue is associated with the heavens and other heavenly things like angels.
Canon Foreigner  -  A new character in a franchise created outside of the original Canon.
Funny Background Event  -  A dramatic situation hides (or shamelessly shows) a comedic situation in the background.
Quarreling Song  -  An argument in song form.
Truly Single Parent  -  Through the magic of Applied Phlebotinum or something similar, a child has only one biological parent.
Speech Impeded Love Interest  -  When a character's love interest can't speak properly. Usually serves to make them endearing through vulnerability.
Make Way For The New Villains  -  A previous villain is either removed, or made less significant, by the next villain.
Multiple Government Polity  -  A political unit that encompasses multiple countries with varying forms of government.
Can Not Spit It Out  -  When someone tries to say the one important thing, but can't.
Living Battery  -  A (sentient) being serves as fuel.
Ambiguous Gender Identity  -  So... are they transgender or not?
Prince Charmless  -  A Prince Charming who... isn't.
Temporal Suicide  -  A character uses Time Travel to kill their future or past self.
Hurting Hero  -  Being Good doesn't always feel good
Dada Comics  -  Surreal, non-sequitur comics.
Birthday Episode  -  An episode dedicated to celebrating someone's birthday.
Rage Against The Mentor  -  The moment when the student finally has had enough of The Mentor's shit.
Diplomatic Impunity  -  Villain abuses diplomatic immunity to get away with committing crimes.
Invisible Subtle Difference  -  These things all look the same, but someone insists they're all subtly different.
Set A Mook To Kill A Mook  -  Make your enemies fight each other.
Standard Hero Reward  -  Marriage to the princess and dominion over the kingdom.
Nobodys That Dumb  -  A character will acknowledge that while they are dumb they're not that stupid.
Meadow Run  -  A couple romantically runs towards each other, usually in slow motion.
Immortality Immorality  -  Committing heinous crimes just to obtain Immortality
Sore Loser  -  Someone who doesn't take losing well.
Unbelievable Source Plot  -  A plot where the protagonist relies on a supernatural source of information to solve crimes but must do so without revealing their supernatural power.
Going Critical  -  Equating a nuclear meltdown with a nuclear explosion.
Brain Bleach  -  What has been seen cannot be unseen.
Cool Teacher  -  An educator who actually seems to make learning fun, serving as an unambiguously positive influence in their students' lives.
Reality Changing Miniature  -  A mininature version of an object that affects the larger counterpart when touched.
Breakup Song  -  Songs about breaking up.
Dub Name Change  -  One, or several characters have their name drastically changed once their work gets translated.
Cast As A Mask  -  Different actors play a character's different identities.
Hair Trigger Sound Effect  -  A Running Gag sound effect with a specific trigger.
Friendly Target  -  Those closest to the hero are prime targets for villains.
The Thing That Would Not Leave  -  Guest will not leave.
Bored With Insanity  -  Even insanity can get boring.
Action Duo  -  Capable badass meets ordinary person.
Big Little Man  -  A short character is introduced in a way that makes them seem taller than they really are.
The Dulcinea Effect  -  Risking your life defending someone you just met.
Punch Clock Hero  -  They're not good, heroism is just a job for them.
No Periods Period  -  Fictional women never menstruate.
All Planets Are Earth Like  -  The plot-relevant planet conveniently supports life.
Will Not Tell A Lie  -  The character chooses to always be honest.
Lonely Rich Kid  -  Rich Kids are sad and friendless.
Betrayal Insurance  -  Keeping some Kryptonite Factor in reserve in case your ally goes bad.
Harmless Lady Disguise  -  Women are seen as harmless, so men of action can avoid suspicion by putting on a dress.
Our Demons Are Different  -  The original demon myths couldn't keep the details straight, either.
Honesty Is The Best Policy  -  I cannot tell a lie; I did it. Wanna make something of it?
Tracking Device  -  A device that lets others know its location.
Lowest Cosmic Denominator  -  Using different names for religious/moral themes in the story to avoid offending others.
Zorro Mark  -  Someone's engraved their Calling Card into someone else's effects.
Gory Deadly Overkill Title Of Fatal Death  -  Painfully over the top horror movie titles.
Elaborate University High  -  Big Fancy High School.
Autobots Rock Out  -  An epic battle accompanied by rock music.
Terrifying Pet Store Rat  -  Animals used as movie monsters end up looking obviously tame and domesticated.
Cant Hold His Liquor  -  Extremely low tolerance of alcohol.
Obvious Object Could Be Anything  -  Either a Cloudcuckoolander makes an illogical guess about what a present wrapping/mystery box/package contains when the answer is extremely obvious, or vice versa.
Remake Cameo  -  Actor from original work has a cameo in the remake.
Chewbacca Defense  -  Winning a debate through methods other than logic and reasoned argument.
Who Are You  -  A set-up for a Badass Boast.
Property Of Love  -  I am yours~ ♥
Melee A Trois  -  Three or more factions want to kill everyone else.
Heroic Rematch  -  The protagonist loses against an important enemy early on, but wins against them when it counts the most later.
Law Of Chromatic Superiority  -  Certain colors are better than other colors.
E Equals MC Hammer  -  Incorrect or nonsensical equations to look like real math.
Agonizing Stomach Wound  -  A shot in your gut is a slow, painful death.
Rocket Powered Weapon  -  A melee weapon with some form of propulsion system built in.
Sliding Scale Of Idealism Versus Cynicism  -  Right Makes Might vs. Might Makes Right.
Magic Enhancement  -  Something or someone enhanced by magic or a magic-equivalent.
