First Name Ultimatum  -  I'm saying your name in a certain annoyed tone. That means I've had enough with you.
Doom Metal  -  Slow, heavy, and long metal.
Know Your Vines  -  Mistaking a poisonous plant with a harmless one.
Storyboarding The Apocalypse  -  Here's how you all die if you fail.
Everybody Laughs Ending  -  An episode ends with everyone laughing.
Empathic Shapeshifter  -  A character who involuntarily changes form to match his surroundings according to the thoughts of others.
Invisible Streaker  -  Invisible person wearing no clothes.
Bad Vibrations  -  Small shakes and ripples to show a threat coming.
Word Salad Lyrics  -  Snapping fish on Monday's tower Rainfall heighten wing tip hour Meddle bunny chomp the fence Lyrics make no friggin' sense.
Suddenly Always Knew That  -  Character reveals they'd long had a specific aptitude with something they'd never shown before.
Cast Full Of Pretty Boys  -  A series with a main cast of pretty boys for girls who like them.
Love Is A Weakness  -  A character believes that love is a negative influence on them
Tradesnark  -  Trademarks and copyright claims as Comedy.
Abandon Ship  -  Evacuating a ship after it has suffered critical damage.
Amazing Technicolor Population  -  Abnormal skin colors.
Fake Relationship  -  Two people who may or may not have UST together pretend to be a real couple for some reason.
Clucking Funny  -  Chickens are inherently funny.
Pop Up Video Games  -  Games where you can click on random stuff and (usually bizarre) animations will be shown.
Urban Legend Of Zelda  -  Video game rumors (about hidden content and such) that persist beyond contrary proof or denial.
Evolving Weapon  -  Weapon gets stronger with use.
The Scrappy  -  The fans hate this character for ruining the story.
I Suck At Summaries  -  Common excuse given by fan fiction writers to explain an absence of summary for their work.
Pinocchio Nose  -  A specifically conspicuous sign a character is lying.
Seduction Proof Marriage  -  Being married makes a character immune to seduction.
Translate The Loanwords Too  -  Attempting to translate words which didn't originate from the language being translated from.
All Guitars Are Stratocasters  -  When in doubt, use a Stratocaster as the guitar in your story.
Bad Ass Santa  -  Santa's coming and he's gonna kick your ass!
Genius Slob  -  A slovenly, but intelligent character.
Macho Latino  -  Mexican and Latino cultural attitude in which men are hypermasculine.
Dont Make Me Destroy You  -  I don't want to fight you. If I do, I will mop the floor with you.
Like A Duck Takes To Water  -  A Fish out of Water who adapts to his new environment.
May The Farce Be With You  -  Whole Plot Reference to Star Wars.
Alarm SOS  -  Deliberately setting off an alarm to signal that you need help.
Partially Civilized Animal  -  An animal that's civilized, but not civilized enough to be a Civilized Animal.
Invisible To Normals  -  Something that can't be seen by Muggles.
Emo  -  A genre of music and subculture that are both emotional.
Cover Blowing Superpower  -  Does a superhero really want to get out of this jam by using their powers and blowing their Secret Identity?
Celestial Paragons And Archangels  -  The highest, most powerful angelic good guys (usually) around.
Punny Headlines  -  Extra! Extra! The writer of these newsprints is Chuggaaconroy himself!!
Solo Class  -  Classes capable of going alone where others are forced to team up.
Exotic Equipment  -  Unusual sex organs.
Linear Warriors Quadratic Wizards  -  Warriors are Crutch Characters, but wizards have Magikarp Power.
One Character Multiple Lives  -  A character is living multiple lives at the same time by alternating between them.
The Operators Must Be Crazy  -  A telephone operator is incompetent, abusive, or just plain out there.
Shower Of Love  -  Having sex in the shower.
Look On My Works Ye Mighty And Despair  -  A proud civilization builds spectacular things to prove their superiority, setting them up for an eventual karmic undoing.
Phone Word  -  Phone numbers being partially rendered as words to make them easier to remember.
Open The Door And See All The People  -  Someone opens their front door to meet a whole mob of people, which takes the person by surprise.
Reformed But Rejected  -  Everyone else refuses to acknowledge a character's HeelFace Turn.
Different For Girls  -  Men have no idea how to act like women when they have to.
Themed Cursor  -  A program gives your cursor a custom appearance.
Room Full Of Crazy  -  Writing on walls shows insanity/obsession.
Non Mammalian Hair  -  Non-mammalian animals have hair, despite the fact they're not supposed to.
Hot Drink Cure  -  Giving someone a hot drink to cure them of their ills.
True Art Is Incomprehensible  -  Art should be impossible for ordinary people to understand.
Imagine Spot  -  A brief cut to a Fantasy Sequence and back.
Throw Away Country  -  Made-up place is destroyed or ravened.
Big Budget Beef Up  -  Bigger Budget = Suspiciously Stronger characters.
Wunza Plot  -  One is an A. One is a B. They do C.
Cavalry Of The Dead  -  Summoning an army of undead soldiers to fight a mutual enemy.
The Bad Guy Wins  -  Good always triumphs has exceptions.
The Corruptible  -  Characters that have suceptible weaknesses are vulnerable to The Corrupter or The Corruption.
Flaw Exploitation  -  Taking advantage of a character's weakness for advancement.
Voluntary Shapeshifting  -  A character can change their form at will.
Willing Suspension Of Disbelief  -  The ability to overlook nonsensical aspects of a creative work in order to appreciate it regardless.
Love Overrides The Law  -  It doesn't matter if I broke the law, because I'm in love!
Face Realization  -  A character realizes on their own that they're not as evil as they thought they were.
Tree Cover  -  Hiding behind a tree.
Interrogation Flashback  -  The story is told via a character being pumped for information.
Ghost Amnesia  -  Beings in the afterlife forget their former life.
Second American Civil War  -  The American Civil War 2: Electric Boogaloo
Obi Wan Moment  -  A veteran character embraces imminent death gracefully.
Greed  -  Wanting wealth more than anything else.
Still Fighting The Civil War  -  Someone still fights a war their side lost long ago.
City On The Water  -  A city that floats on the water like a boat.
Burning The Flag  -  A flag is set on fire for symbolic reasons.
Patchwork Fic  -  The writer uses particular characters from different adaptations of the same single story.
Ghibli Hills  -  The great outdoors is right around the corner. And they are great.
Virgin Tension  -  Virginity is a trait that must be protected.
Sexless Marriage  -  A couple is no longer having sex indicates that their relationship is in trouble.
Combat Aestheticist  -  Style-over-Substance Kung Fu
Adaptational Self Defense  -  A scene where a hero kills someone not currently attacking them is changed to be in immediate self-defense.
Bookworm  -  A character enjoys books and reads very often.
Soldiers At The Rear  -  Active-duty military personnel whose jobs don't involve regular combat.
Spinning Piledriver  -  Spinning is spectacular. Especially Wrestling Moves.
Badge Gag  -  A character pretends their fake badge is real. Or a character pretends another object is a badge.
Non Sequitur Thud  -  Nonsense sputtered by someone on the verge of unconsciousness.
Magic Mirror  -  A mirror that does more than reflect.
Physical Attribute Swap  -  A specific physical trait is exchanged between two characters.
Historical Beauty Update  -  Historical figures being depicted as being more handsome or beautiful in media than what they really look like in real life.
World Of Weirdness  -  Superpowers, ghosts, and what have you are just another fact of life.
Black Box  -  You know what it does, but not how it does it.
Ghost Town  -  A town where no one lives.
Parody Episode  -  A show takes a break from its usual format to parody something else.
Bunnies For Cuteness  -  Something's made cuter by adding a bunny rabbit to it.
Soap Opera Disease  -  Vaguely-defined, deadly, chronic disease.
Gas Mask Mooks  -  Villains and goons wear gas masks to make themselves appear more intimidating. The gas mask is usually just for show.
Collapsed Mid Speech  -  Someone poisoned collapses during speaking.
Noob Bridge  -  Techniques expected from advanced players are required to pass this part of the game.
The Un Reveal  -  All is set up for The Reveal - and it never happens.
Vapor Wear  -  The outer clothes make it clear that there are no underclothes.
Love Revelation Epiphany  -  A character falls for another character after hearing that the latter has feelings for them.
Electric Jellyfish  -  A Jellyfish's sting is treated as electrical rather than venomous in nature.
Platonic Co Parenting  -  Characters raise children together, but aren't romantically involved.
Color Me Black  -  A bigot is turned into that which they hate.
Open The Iris  -  Emotions are shown by having the Iris expand as well as the pupil.
Dog Walks You  -  Dog owner takes dog for a walk, gets walked instead.
Human Doorstop  -  A still-living being has their body used as a simple inanimate tool, often as a punishment.
My Rules Are Not Your Rules  -  When a game invokes Screw the Rules, I Make Them!.
British Brevity  -  British shows are intentionally shorter than American ones.
Artistic License Cars  -  Factual errors involving motor vehicles.
Fight Unscene  -  The animators use tricks to skimp on having to animate all of the costly fight scenes.
Interplay Of Sex And Violence  -  Violence and sex happening around the same time as each other, or even using violence as foreplay.
Tulpa  -  Living being created from thoughts.
Maniac Tongue  -  Villain exposes their tongue in Squicky way to show they're crazy.
Brainwash Residue  -  Some effects of a brainwash still linger within the body.
Terrible Ticking  -  That repetitive sound in your head that only you can hear, wearing away at your sanity...
Perishing Alt Rock Voice  -  Vocalist sounds like they are gonna pass out.
Success Through Insanity  -  A character's inability to handle reality is essential to their ability to protect reality.
I Can Rule Alone  -  The villain offers the "hero" a chance to rule alongside him. One of them decides they'd rather not share power.
Two By Fore  -  A piece of wood with a standard format, that is useful for building, repairing, and smacking stuff with.
Gratuitous Iambic Pentameter  -  Using verse or poetic meter for no particular reason.
Nouveau Riche  -  Rich, yet tacky and tactless.
Adaptation Sequence  -  A long chain of adaptations of a work.
Trend Aesop  -  It's not a good idea to instantly join a fad.
Reunion Revenge  -  A class reunion stages revenge for old scorns.
Phlebotinum Induced Steampunk  -  Fictional power-source for fictional technology.
Stereotype Flip  -  A character has traits that contrast stereotypical traits that apply to the character.
They Copied It So It Sucks  -  Unoriginal means suck.
Single Stroke Battle  -  A duel where two fighters stake everything on one strike.
Smile Of Approval  -  A character smiles at another character they initially disliked as a sign of admiration or respect.
Water Source Tampering  -  A plot where either villains tamper with the water supply or a character is paranoid about that happening.
Unwanted Assistance  -  Attempts to help only make the situation worse.
Mistaken From Behind  -  Alice sees Bob from behind, he turns around...and it's not Bob.
Not Actually Cosmetic Award  -  An award that has the signature characteristics of a Cosmetic Award, but turns out to have practical benefits.
Disney Villain Death  -  Character dies by falling off-screen to their death.
Hyperspace Arsenal  -  A character possesses more objects at hand than they can realistically carry.
The Web Always Existed  -  No matter where you go in time, the Internet exists. Even when it isn't plausible.
Too Cool To Live  -  Another character is more awesome than the hero and, therefore, has to die.
Leaving You To Find Myself  -  Soul searching of oneself which causes a relationship or marriage to end, often to the distress of the partner being left.
Now Where Was I Going Again  -  Playing a game after a really long time of absence can make you forget your destination or goal.
Gatling Good  -  Rotary cannons are always cooler than their single-barrelled counterparts.
Ephebophile  -  Someone with a sexual preference for mid-to-late teenagers (usually aged 15-19).
Armor Is Useless  -  All weapons can easily injure or kill people wearing armor.
Smelly Skunk  -  Skunks always stink.
Speech Impaired Animal  -  An otherwise normal animal that can talk, albeit with a speech impediment.
But Not Too Evil  -  A villain's evilness is toned down because Moral Guardians are worried that kids might imitate the villain or think Evil Is Cool (and sexy in some cases)
No Bisexuals  -  Gay or straight. Pick one.
Idol Singer  -  A young, cute girl sings and dances to pop music, and is adored throughout Japan.
Suicide Not Accident  -  A character arranges their suicide to look like an accident.
Take It To The Bridge  -  Bridges as important plot points, and usually symbolism as well.
Fulton Street Folly  -  Lower Manhattan is always the center of stories taking place in NYC.
Its Hard So It Sucks  -  This game sucks, it's too hard!
Straightforward  -  An ad that says what the product does. No more, no less.
Modern Stasis  -  In the distant future, culture still hasn't changed.
Afrofuturism  -  Speculative fiction exploring the black experience.
Heist Episode  -  A caper-style episode where the characters are involved in a robbery or heist.
Wrong Genre Savvy  -  This character is Genre Savvy, but they're wrong about their role in the story and/or the type of story they're in.
Conveniently Interrupted Document  -  A Fictional Document which gets interrupted (either via damaged or by the character reading it stopping partway through it) in a way which is convenient for the plot.
Refitted For Sequel  -  Things that aren't in the original work get shown in the sequel.
Last Note Nightmare  -  The song seems normal, but at the very end—WHAM!
Reverse Psychology  -  Manipulating someone by telling them the opposite of what you want them to think or do.
Dude Not Funny  -  Something is intended to be funny, but other characters find it insulting or offensive.
Foreign Ruling Class  -  The ruling class of a given polity is of a foreign ethnicity compare to their subjects.
Evil Is Not Well Lit  -  Areas where evil lurks have little to no light.
Combat Sadomasochist  -  Pain is pleasure. Their own, and others.
Do Not Go Gentle  -  Even if Your Days Are Numbered, despair is for losers.
Model Dissonance  -  Assets in a game are fudged to look right or make the game run better, which looks weird if you peek behind the scenes.
Shut Up Hannibal  -  Defying Break Them by Talking.
Well Excuse Me Princess  -  The Magical/Action Girlfriend calls out her love interest's shortcomings.
New Media Are Evil  -  Newer technology is seen as bad.
The End Or Is It  -  An Ending Trope that casts doubt on the heroes' victory (thus creating a Sequel Hook).
Food Chain Of Evil  -  Monster-eating monsters.
Platonic Life Partners  -  Very close, but not romantically interested, different-sex friends.
Crossing The Burnt Bridge  -  Character must return to where they were a jerk when they left.
Platonic Declaration Of Love  -  One character tells their non-Love Interest they love them.
Very Punchable Man  -  A Bit Character whose only purpose is to deserve a beating and gets it en masse.
God Is Love Songs  -  Supposed love songs that are actually about the lyricist's faith in God.
Played For Drama  -  Meant to be played seriously, not for laughs.
Blood Splattered Warrior  -  A combatant covered in the blood of their victims or their own.
Fleeting Demographic Rule  -  Your audience isn't likely to remember your story forever, so feel free to reuse content whenever they forget.
Better The Devil You Know  -  It is better to handle a bad situation that you know about than to face the potentiality of a new and possibly worse one.
Japandering  -  Western celebrity does advertising in Japan (or any country far-removed from their usual habitats), often using silly gimmicks.
Einstein Hair  -  If the character has Einstein-like hair, he is most likely a scientist.
Only The Leads Get A Happy Ending  -  Main characters get a good ending. Minor characters get a bad one.
Burying A Substitute  -  A character's body isn't available for funeral rites, so something else is buried in their place.
Fang Thpeak  -  Trying to speak well while having fangs.
Hellgate  -  The literal gate to Hell.
Construction Zone Calamity  -  Terrible event that happens in a construction site.
Kill It With Water  -  If fire and ice fail, use water.
Cast Calculus  -  Choosing the right cast size and splitting traits between them.
Angry Guard Dog  -  That "BEWARE OF DOG" sign? Yeah, you'd better listen.
Black And White Morality  -  Two sides in a conflict: one is pure good, the other, pure evil.
Interrupted Cooldown Hug  -  A Cooldown Hug is often used as an opportunity to attack.
Thousand Yard Stare  -  An empty stare usually done by characters after a traumatic experience.
Fist Pump  -  Characters, determined to accomplish something or proud of their achievement, pump one or both fists.
Double Double Title  -  A title consisting of one or more repeated words.
Persona Non Grata  -  Something went real bad. Someone is told in no uncertain terms never to return. Ever.
No Plans No Prototype No Backup  -  One-of-a-kind inventions in fiction tend to be impossible to recreate.
First Person Ghost  -  Models of your character in first-person games tend to not be fully rendered.
Sleeping Dummy  -  Someone hides a body-shaped mass under their blanket to trick others into thinking they're sleeping while they sneak out.
Conveniently An Orphan  -  A character is an orphan so the plot can move along more easily.
Abuse Mistake  -  Type A: Something not abusive is mistaken for being abusive.
Daddys Little Villain  -  The villain's equally evil daughter, niece or granddaughter.
Longest Song Goes Last  -  The longest song goes at the end of the album.
But I Digress  -  Let me stop that tangent and get back to the point.
Everyone Loves Blondes  -  A blonde character is sexually attractive.
Kidnapping Bird Of Prey  -  When in doubt, send one to whisk one of your characters into trouble.
Humanity Is Superior  -  Humanity's hat is being better than you.
Faked Rip Van Winkle  -  A character is presented in a Rip Van Winkle situation, but Plot Twist, he isn't.
Kingpin In His Gym  -  The villain training on his off-time.
Happy Circus Music  -  Genuinely cheerful circus-y music that sets a fun mood
Extremity Extremist  -  Fights solely with either kicks or punches.
Crazy Survivalist  -  I've prepared for this nightmare. Screw you.
Entry Pimp  -  I'm sharing this entry with everyone, bitch!
Leave Behind A Pistol  -  Giving the option of suicide before dishonour.
Creepy Pasta  -  Scary stories, or attempts at same, transmitted via the internet.
Wistful Amnesia  -  Amnesic people have some vague knowledge that something's missing.
Parasol Parachute  -  Using an umbrella as a parachute.
Arbitrary Minimum Range  -  Weapon is less effective when used from too close of a distance.
Assassination Attempt  -  Hotshot public figure(s) are publicly killed, or at least almost killed.
Make It Look Like An Accident  -  A murder made to look like an accidental death.
Xylophones For Walking Bones  -  Xylophone music used in sequences featuring skeletons.
Evil Wears Black  -  If the character's wearing black, they're almost certainly the bad guy.
Suddenly Blonde  -  Certain appearance details that were not implemented originally due to technical restrictions are retconned back in the later installments.
Fish Out Of Temporal Water  -  Somebody finds themselves out of their time period.
Friend To Bugs  -  Somebody who likes minibeasts.
Skinship Grope  -  It's not sexual harassment if it's two friends in a bathtub!
Torture Chamber Episode  -  A character gets physically and/or emotionally tortured for 22 minutes.
Soul Fragment  -  Person A passes on part of their soul to Person B.
Rapid Fire But  -  Repeatedly saying "But!" in quick succession to protest something.
Xeno Nucleic Acid  -  Alien DNA has a different structure than terrestrial DNA.
Remote Body  -  A body that an individual can control from a general range.
Bait And Switch Tyrant  -  New leader appears bad but is actually good.
Novelization  -  The Book of the Film (or other media).
Mission Control  -  Assists the agent on their objectives via long-distance communication.
Family Drama  -  Conflicts within the family.
Point Of No Return  -  Pass this part of the game, and you can never go back.
Corrupt Hick  -  A rural cop who is corrupt and evil.
Smash The Symbol  -  Characters destroy a symbol to express their disdain for what it is believed to represent.
Broke The Rating Scale  -  The normal scale just won't do.
Fantastic Underclass  -  The lowest and most disadvantaged level of a fictional society.
Did They Or Didnt They  -  Whether or not characters had sex is left ambiguous.
Humble Hero  -  A champion who does not brag.
End Of Series Awareness  -  Characters know the end of the series is upon them.
Fixing The Game  -  Cheating in a game of chance so that winning is the only option.
Amnesia Episode  -  An episode in which someone gets amnesia.
Sir Swearsalot  -  A potty-mouthed character who swears more frequently and/or intensely than the rest of the cast.
Marionette Motion  -  Moves like a puppet.
Orgasmic Combat  -  People fighting each other groan, grunt, gasp, wheeze, and moan as if they're having sex instead.
Reclining Venus  -  Stock Pose of reclining female nudes (in varying states of nudity).
Kevlard  -  The fatter you are, the more resilient you are.
Women Drivers  -  Women drivers = no survivors.
Jerkass To One  -  A Jerkass who treats one person particularly bad compared to others.
The Chris Carter Effect  -  Too many unresolved plots will drive away the audience.
Reviewer Standard Comparisons  -  Critics always use these works/artists as codifiers for the genre.
Stepford Consumer  -  A consumer in an advertisement who is seemingly excited for an item, no matter how mundane.
Swipe Your Blade Off  -  Swiping the blood off your sword with a cutting motion after felling an opponent.
Invincible Minor Minion  -  Nigh-Invulnerable Mooks.
Ghost Ship  -  Abandoned boats are creepy and/or haunted.
Vanilla Edition  -  An incredibly standard and bland release.
Industrialized Evil  -  Why bother with a personal touch when evil deeds can be committed via assembly line?
Waking Up At The Morgue  -  A character, either because they were mistaken for dead or came Back from the Dead, wakes up in a location where dead bodies are kept.
Legacy Of The Chosen  -  The Chosen One is part of a long line of succession with a rich history and background.
Missing Backblast  -  Rocket-propelled projectiles don't damage anything behind them when launched.
The Missus And The Ex  -  The protagonist's husband/wife/significant other meets the protagonist's ex-girlfriend/ex-boyfriend/ex-something. Hilarity Ensues
Enslaved Elves  -  A once proud and powerful race forced into squalor and servitude.
Big Prick Big Problems  -  Guess a big penis isn't better after all.
Allegory  -  A work that's meant to be a metaphor for something else.
Raster Vision  -  Deliberate usage of analog TV scan lines
Evil Luddite  -  People who think New Technology is Evil.
Tiger Versus Dragon  -  Something representing a Dragon VS Something representing a Tiger.
Extremely Overdue Library Book  -  A character has a library book that is months, or even years, overdue.
Putting The Pee In Pool  -  Someone pees in a pool.
Earth Is Young  -  Present-day Earth turns out to be young... on a cosmic scale, that is.
Instant Awesome Just Add Mecha  -  Large robots make everything awesome
Almost Kiss  -  Two characters are about to kiss before suddenly being interrupted by something.
As You Know  -  Character explains the plot to people who already know it so the audience can hear it.
Show Some Leg  -  A character provides a distraction by showing skin or acting sexy.
Geek Reference Pool  -  All geeks are fans of the same works.
Always On Duty  -  The heroes are the only ones who do anything important, even when that doesn't make sense.
We Dont Need Roads  -  A car so technologically advanced that the use of roads is unecessary.
Grievous Harm With A Body  -  Using a person to beat up another person.
Minimalism  -  Minimum detail given to work, intended to highlight its idea instead.
Bald Black Leader Guy  -  The man in charge is bald and black.
Queer Flowers  -  Certain flowers symbolizing homosexuality, such as lavender, violets, lilies, and green carnations.
Romanticism Versus Enlightenment  -  In logics: Team Emotion vs. Team Reason
You Gotta Have Blue Hair  -  Characters have otherwise unnatural hair colors which makes it easier to tell them apart.
Record Needle Scratch  -  Stock sound effect of a phonograph record being scratched, used to represent surprise or shock.
The Coroner  -  Character in the Police Procedural that looks for cause of death.
Foreigner For A Day  -  A character's home temporarily is considered a country on its own.
Punishment Detail  -  Being forced to perform unpleasant tasks as a form of punishment.
Black Hole Belly  -  A character's stomach has seemingly unlimited capacity, making them capable of ingesting anything.
That Liar Lies  -  The stock phrase "You liar!" and variants.
How Is That Even Possible  -  The usual response to things that shouldn't happen...happening anyway.
Refrain From Assuming  -  They keep singing something that's not the title.
Merchant City  -  Where else could you go to buy crap?
Swiss Army Gun  -  One big gun full of a bunch of little ones.
Disturbing Statistic  -  The kind of statistic that makes you pause and think about how much trouble it means for you.
Guilt Based Gaming  -  A game's text appeals to the players' sense of guilt or shame to get them to play in a certain way.
It Amused Me  -  Character does something merely for amusement.
Misapplied Phlebotinum  -  Magic or technology not being used to its full potential.
Snowball Lie  -  A small lie grows bigger and bigger over time, dragging others along with it.
God Of Good  -  A deity who is the ultimate embodiment of goodness.
Schizo Tech  -  Anachronism Stew done to invoke Rule of Cool.
Disposable Fiance  -  Either the main character or love interest's partner, who gets dumped to make way for the main character and love interest getting together.
Eternal Hero  -  Legends become anthropological oddities. Heroes live forever.
Spell Book  -  Tomes filled with rituals, incantations and instructions for your garden-variety wizard.
White Bunny  -  All bunnies are New Zealand White Rabbits.
Standard Sci Fi Setting  -  Laser guns, mecha, spaceships, alien babes.
When The Clock Strikes Twelve  -  Midnight is the deadline for something.
Our Monsters Are Weird  -  Monsters with surreal design.
An Adventurer Is You  -  Adventurers and typical adventuring classes.
Fallout Shelter Fail  -  A refuge intended to withstand the apocalypse... doesn't.
Spit Take  -  Allow me to forcibly expel whatever was in my mouth to show you how shocked I am.
Beleaguered Boss  -  The boss only has rank incompetent subordinates and can't endure it anymore
Technologically Advanced Foe  -  An enemy that completely outclasses its opponents on a technological level.
Breaking The Bonds  -  These bonds cannot hold a character forever.
Tutu Fancy  -  Ballet outfits with embellishments which would logically make it very hard to dance in.
Magnetism Manipulation  -  The power to control magnetic fields.
Stop Copying Me  -  Person 1: "Stop copying me!" Person 2: "Stop copying me!"
The Engineer  -  The guy on the team who builds and fixes your equipment.
Murder By Mistake  -  The attack meant for someone killed someone else instead.
Musical Theme Naming  -  Characters are named after things related to music.
Stink Snub  -  Body odor insults.
Used To Be A Tomboy  -  A Girly Girl who was a Tomboy in the past.
Puppet King  -  A person who is supposedly at the head of control secretly takes orders from someone else.
Girls Night Out Episode  -  An episode where all the characters of a specific gender are absent.
Green Around The Gills  -  Nausea depicted in fiction as a character's face turning green.
Restrained Revenge  -  Someone takes a lesser revenge on someone else in lieu of forgiving them entirely.
Hong Kong Dub  -  A dub with horrible lip syncing.
Tautological Templar  -  I'm good, so everything I do is good too.
After Boss Recovery  -  Lots of items appear after a big battle.
Lecture As Exposition  -  A character teaches another one about plot elements.
Shoujo Demographic  -  Manga and anime marketed toward pre-teen and teenage girls.
Hunting The Most Dangerous Game  -  Humans hunting humans.
Asskicking Equals Authority  -  If you're strong, you lead.
Artificial Hybrid  -  Someone is born fully one species, but later in life becomes a hybrid.
Tomboy And Girly Girl  -  A duo consisting of boyish girl and a girlish girl.
Edible Theme Naming  -  People/things named after foods.
Critical Status Buff  -  When the going gets tough, the Player Character gets going.
Square Race Round Class  -  Member of a race has a job at odds with their racial traits.
Occidental Otaku  -  A western Otaku who loves Japanese culture to the point of adopting it as their own.
Com Mons  -  Weak Mons found early in the game.
Misspelling Out Loud  -  Spelling a word out loud and clear and hilariously wrong.
What Have You Done For Me Lately  -  Seriously?! Name me one time you actually did something for me! And the last twenty times don't count.
Player Character Calculus  -  How many characters does the player control in a single-player video game?
The Treachery Of Images  -  Playing on the ambiguity between an image of an object and the object itself.
Sissy Villain  -  A male antagonist with blatantly effeminate qualities.
Ick Barrier  -  Something important is guarded by something gross.
Please Put Some Clothes On  -  ...seeing you naked disturbs me.
A Pirate 400 Years Too Late  -  Pirates in modern times.
Almost Out Of Oxygen  -  Characters' air supply is rapidly depleting.
Prison Riot  -  Prisoners get fed up with the place of their incarceration and start rioting.
Operation Blank  -  General naming scheme for military operations.
One Track Minded Hunger  -  A character who is constantly searching for and will do anything for food, to the point where it dictates their life.
Content Warnings  -  WARNING: This Story Contains. Intense Violence. Nudity. Sexual Content. Strong Language.
Bee People  -  Fantastic races with a eusocial hive-like society similar to real-life bees and ants.
Exploitation Film  -  A film with excessive violence or sex for no real reason.
Complaining About People Not Liking The Show  -  If you don't like what I like, you're wrong.
No Badass To His Valet  -  It doesn't matter how badass you are. There's one person that you can not scare.
Wingman  -  The guy flying the other warplane beside the hero.
Creators Pest  -  A character disliked by the creator of the work.
Monster Clown  -  Clowns can be creepy or scary, if not outright evil.
Empathic Weapon  -  Your weapon, whatever it is, has a mind and will of its own.
Dirty Old Man  -  Elderly men are perverts.
Primary Color Champion  -  Red and blue (and sometimes yellow). The Color Motif of heroes.
Hermaphrodite  -  An individual who is intersex, whose body doesn't fit within classical definitions of male or female. Usually human; alien genders are a different trope.
LOL 69  -  69 as an inherently funny number for its Double Entendre value.
Literal Cliffhanger  -  You better hang on. It's a long drop to the bottom...
You Wake Up In A Room  -  Character regains consciousness and discovers they have somehow ended up in an unfamiliar room/place. Bonus points if they have amnesia.
Brake Angrily  -  Slamming the breaks out of anger.
Rollerblade Good  -  Badass Rollerskating.
Hot Men At Work  -  Shirtless, beefy men working and sweating attract the Female Gaze.
Mouse Trap  -  A device that traps rodents.
Dirty Old Monk  -  A monk/priest/vicar/man of some religious status who acts in a sexual or perverted manner not expected of such a person.
You Cant Get Ye Flask  -  Text-based adventure games accepting only oddly-worded commands.
Hammy Herald  -  Incoming Ham by proxy.
Killer App  -  The game everyone buys the console for.
Female Flatfoot And Snarky Guy  -  A female cop teams up with a male savvy civilian to solve cases.
Two Person Love Triangle  -  A character loves one person and not another; yet they are both the same person.
Parking Garage  -  Quiet location to park vehicles underground. And fight.
Sequel Displacement  -  A sequel completely eclipses the original.
Totalitarian Gangsterism  -  Organized criminals, (Gang Bangers, Cartels, syndicates, etc.) treat the inhabitants of their controlled areas horribly.
Early Bird Cameo  -  A character makes an appearance before being properly introduced later in the same work, in a sequel or in their own series.
Video Game Remake  -  An old Video Game remade using new technology.
Is This Thing Still On  -  Someone did/said something they wouldn't have if they knew the camera/mic was still on.
Invoked Trope  -  A character sets up a trope on purpose.
Criminal Convention  -  A Fan Convention for supervillains, Serial Killers, terrorists and other criminals.
Undeath Is Cheap  -  People turned into monsters by The Virus can be cured.
Suddenly Voiced  -  A character who can speak finally has an audible voice.
Metallic Motifs  -  Characters associated with metals or alloys and their physical and symbolic properties.
Hot God  -  Beautiful deities.
Thin Dimensional Barrier  -  Location where the wall between dimensions can be easily passed through.
Laughably Evil  -  A villain that makes you laugh.
Wishplosion  -  Defeating the Genie through wishes.
Timey Wimey Ball  -  How Time Travel works is inconsistent within a single fictional universe.
Item Crafting  -  A video game mechanic in which you combine items to make other items.
Super Title 64 Advance  -  Platform-indicative video game title.
The Worlds Breast Tropes  -  Tropes about boobs
Nosebleed  -  Nosebleeds equal sexual attraction.
Megaton Punch  -  A punch that sends the receiver flying.
War Is Glorious  -  War does not suck!
Not Wearing Pants Dream  -  Bob dreams that he's in his boxers in public; and his dream-self is thoroughly embarresed.
Hospital Epilogue  -  A work ends with at least one character in recovery room, healing from injuries sustained during the story.
Commander Contrarian  -  The Complainer who's always against it, no matter how logical it is.
Blinded By Rage  -  Intentionally making your opponent angry so that their performance suffers.
Live Item  -  Sentient video game item.
Telepathy  -  Mind reading and mental communication.
Coy Girlish Flirt Pose  -  A pose for a female character to show how she is interested in someone.
Always Camp  -  If you have this profession, you're either Camp Gay or Camp Straight.
School Play  -  Teenaged or younger characters put on a play, which is typically quite terrible.
Denied Food As Punishment  -  Punishing your children by giving them no food.
But Not Too Bi  -  Character is stated to be bisexual but we never see it.
Sea Aping  -  Bland Name Sea Monkeys
Angrish  -  Character is too mad to speak coherently.
Rummage Fail  -  Character searches for something in a container, throws out everything else inside before finally finding it.
Robo Cam  -  See the world through the eyes of a robot.
Dueling Dubs  -  A show is debated over its multiple language dubs.
Railroading  -  The plot is a one-way street, and the Game Master is keeping you on the road.
Homeless Pigeon Person  -  A homeless person has an animal companion, usually a pigeon.
Asian Airhead  -  Fictional Asian women are sexy but pathetically dumb.
Walking Swimsuit Scene  -  A character who spends most of their screentime wearing swimwear, regardless if the situation logically calls for it.
The Promise  -  If a character makes a promise to another character in the story, expect the promise to be called in before the end.
Apocalyptic Logistics  -  No infrastructure, no problem.
Solemn Ending Theme  -  The show's Ending Theme sounds bittersweet or wistful.
Red Green Contrast  -  Popular Color Contrast between the colors red and green — Christmas and otherwise.
Protagonist Without A Past  -  The main character has no backstory.
Legacy Launch  -  A last ditch effort to keep a superhero popular.
Anti Air  -  Effective against flying targets.
Death By Pragmatism  -  A character dies even when they're the only one who isn't Too Dumb to Live.
It Will Never Catch On  -  ...history will prove that statement so very wrong. It is huge now.
Evil Welcomes Defectors  -  Evil factions are happy to accept defectors from other sides of the conflict into their ranks.
Best Is Average Better Is Best  -  Everyone can say their product is the best, making every product of that type average, but you need proof to say yours is better.
Battle Discretion Shot  -  We don't get to see the fight.
Arrogant Kung Fu Guy  -  All power with no discipline, but he still thinks he's the best.
The Tyson Zone  -  When your life as a celebrity is so weird, nothing you do surprises anyone.
The Piano Player  -  A pianist that is just there to provide background music, with no actual personality.
Accidental Marriage  -  Oops! I got married!
Worthy Opponent  -  A character shows their respect for an adversary.
Hyperspeed Escape  -  Using faster-than-light travel to make your getaway.
The Big Rotten Apple  -  New York is a Vice City.
Borrowed Biometric Bypass  -  Getting past biometric security by using the (sometimes dismembered) body parts of those with access.
Comic Books Are Real  -  The characters in the Show Within a Show are actually real within the universe that watches it.
Shocking Defeat Legacy  -  A shocking military defeat that leaves a lasting legacy.
Second Law My Ass  -  Robots refuse to obey their creators.
Messiah Creep  -  Hero becomes a Messiah via Character Development
Unperson  -  All record of a person's existence is erased.
The Anti Nihilist  -  Life is sad, cruel, and without meaning, but it's still worth something!
High On Catnip  -  Catnip affecting feline characters like how drugs or alcohol affect humans.
Did Not Get The Girl  -  The Protagonist doesn't get together with their Love Interest.
Not So Abandoned Building  -  Abandoned outside, active inside.
Warts And All  -  Legendary ≠ infallible.
Ethical Slut  -  A moral and righteous character who enjoys having sex a lot.
The Revolution Will Not Be Vilified  -  The revolutionaries hold a clear moral high-ground over those they oppose.
Obligatory War Crime Scene  -  The "good guys" and "bad guys" commit war crimes on the other.
Cat Fight  -  A fanservice fight between two women.
Straw Fan  -  A character created to mock the fans of a work or creator by ramping their characteristics up to parody levels.
Hybrid Power  -  An offspring always inherits the special abilities of their parents, and these often enhance each other.
Fowl Mouthed Parrot  -  A parrot or other animal that mimics people swearing.
Raised By Dudes  -  Had a father but no mother = Men Can't Keep House or be a parent.
Ugly American Stereotype  -  Americans on foreign soil are portrayed as rude and uncouth.
Black Spot  -  A mundane or cryptic thing signaling that one is marked for death.
Lies To Children  -  It's not the truth, but a lie you can understand.
Brainwashing For The Greater Good  -  Brainwashing people for a great, justifiable cause.
Two Lines No Waiting  -  Two or more plots are interwoven into one story.
Universe Bible  -  A basic guideline for a project, be it a TV series, movie, etc. Has nothing to do with the one you're thinking about.
Late To The Realization  -  A character realizes something very late.
Decadent Court  -  Deadly, depraved throne room politics.
Pyrrhic Villainy  -  The Bad Guy Wins... but at a huge price.
The Omnipotent  -  A character that is (virtually) all powerful.
Anti Climax  -  Suspense is killed when it would normally be at its highest.
Keet  -  A cutesy, hyperactive guy.
Landfill Beyond The Stars  -  Planet used as garbage fill.
Screw Destiny  -  I don't believe in destiny nonsense, so screw it!
Men Dont Cry  -  The proper response for a man to a tragic situation is a grim, determined stare into the camera, nothing more.
Tailfin Walking  -  A cetacean, fish, or pinniped walking upright on its tailfins.
Police State  -  You know you live in a Dystopia when law enforcement has no regard for the rights of the populace.
Just One Second Out Of Sync  -  Something is always a second before or a second after the current time.
Trapped In Containment  -  A person is trapped when their area is sealed off for safety.
Listing Cities  -  Songs with a lot of places' names in the lyrics.
Victim Of The Week  -  Someone gets killed or otherwise messed with every week.
Feudal Future  -  A sci-fi setting with a medieval-style social hierarchy ruled by a hereditary noble class.
Cross Melting Aura  -  A monster with an immunity to traditional holy weapons.
Kidfic  -  A fan-fiction where one, two, or several characters (whether by sex, adoption, finding a baby/child, someone else turning into a baby/child, e.t.c), is/are somehow given a child to raise.
Feminine Women Can Cook  -  Cooking makes you acceptably feminine.
Hazmat Suit  -  A suit that protects the wearer from Hazardous Materials.
Leaving The Nest Song  -  Songs dealing with leaving home and/or the familiar behind.
Horrifying Hero  -  A hero who looks scary.
Evil Is Burning Hot  -  Fire is associated with evil.
Weapons Understudies  -  Dressing up whatever military equipment is available to make it look like another, similar piece, because the real deal couldn't be obtained for filming.
Conservation Of Competence  -  If the boss is smart, the minions are dumb, and vice versa.
Genius Bruiser  -  The Big Guy (or The Brute) + The Smart Guy (or Evil Genius) traits = This trope.
Radiograph Of Doom  -  Take a look at this film, the patient is going to die!
Circular Reasoning  -  It's true because it's true.
Quest To The West  -  Journeys to the west are associated with exploration, adventure, discovery and heading into the great unknown, as well as braving peril for a better life.
Soviet Superscience  -  Soviets with technology noticeably more advanced than their historical counterparts.
Crowded Cast Shot  -  Many characters shown in a single, cramped shot.
Looks Like Jesus  -  A character has a similar look to that of Jesus.
Prefer Jail To The Protagonist  -  Prison isn't half as bad as the protagonist.
Cargo Cult  -  A group worships an inanimate object.
The Walls Have Eyes  -  Eyes in places that don't belong (like walls), staring at a character. Often played as a result of a mental breakdown.
Fantasy Helmet Enforcement  -  Remember kids, always wear appropriate safety gear no matter what!
Everyone Is Bi  -  A large percentage of the cast of a series is either bisexual or bi-curious.
Genre Adultery  -  A radical departure from what is normal for a creator.
Beast Of The Apocalypse  -  A monster that kick-starts The End of the World as We Know It.
Geometric Magic  -  Draw geometric figures to channel various powers.
Gotta Have It Gonna Steal It  -  Has to have this thing, going to take this thing.
Cosmic Keystone  -  An artifact that regulates the Universe.
Sliding Scale Of Linearity Vs Openness  -  Rail Shooters, Quicksand Boxes, and everything in between.
Make The Bear Angry Again  -  The entire nation of Russia being villains again after the Cold War
Super Reflexes  -  Reacting really, really fast.
Dissonant Laughter  -  Laughing when you absolutely have no reason to.
Humanoid Female Animal  -  Female anthropomorphic animals tend to be higher up the Sliding Scale of Anthropomorphism than the males.
The Magic Versus Technology War  -  Technological faction and magical faction at war.
Cannot Convey Sarcasm  -  Sarcasm is improperly used.
Empty Cop Threat  -  Cop threatens witness with warrants unless they talk.
Love Interest Traitor  -  The Love Interest turns out to be a villain.
Mauve Shirt  -  Red Shirt with enough characterization to make them less expendable.
Sequel The Original Title  -  The previous installment's title becomes the subtitle of the next one.
Blunt Metaphors Trauma  -  Has trouble using and understanding metaphoric language.
Genre Blindness  -  Characters make mistakes common for the genre of story they're in.
Sexual Karma  -  He had it coming, if you know what I mean.
Deliver Us From Evil  -  Evil person gets a kid, stops being evil.
Chalk Outline  -  Chalk where the dead guy once was.
Maybe Ever After  -  An ending to a Romance Arc that only leaves a hint that the characters may become a romantic couple or not.
Oddly Shaped Sword  -  Swords with a bizarre blade shape.
I Was Named My Name  -  An animal's new name happens to be what it was already calling itself.
Sex Equals Love  -  Characters who are in a solely sexual relationship will have it become a romantic one.
Elevator Going Down  -  Making out and/or having sex in an elevator.
Long Pants  -  When separate articles of clothing on a character seem to be drawn as one garment.
First Installment Wins  -  The first installment of a series is the most well-known or considered the best.
Dying Alone  -  Dying alone is really tragic.
Saved By The Coffin  -  A character survives a bad situation thanks to a vessel meant for a dead body.
Gadget Watches  -  A watch with lots of tools built into it.
Super Empowering  -  The power to give others powers.
Sudden Game Interface  -  Character's life is turned into a RPG-Mechanics Verse and they have become a Fourth-Wall Observer.
The Rival  -  Character who clashes with the protagonist, but isn't the main antagonist.
Recollection Sidequest  -  A side objective to recover an amnesiac player character's lost memory, piece by piece.
Enthralling Siren  -  She sings, you crash to your doom.
Humor Dissonance  -  The characters find something hilarious; the audience begs to differ.
Hippie Jesus  -  Jesus not only looks like a hippie, he also acts like a stereotypical one.
Canada Eh  -  Canadians are weird, eh? Les Canadiens sont étranges, ostie?
Bumbling Sidekick  -  An annoying, incompetent sidekick.
Food Fight  -  Trope: A scene in which anything edible is a weapon.
Slap Slap Kiss  -  Two characters in love with each other get in a heated argument that ends with them kissing.
Authority In Name Only  -  Someone who holds a position—possibly made-up—that has no authority or power.
Torch Song  -  Songs about lost loves.
Fate Worse Than Death  -  Death isn't the worst thing to happen to you.
Dont Think Feel  -  Rely on intuition, not logic.
Answer Song  -  A song written as a response to an earlier song by a different artist
Inverse Law Of Utility And Lethality  -  More power = less practicality.
Glowing Flora  -  Glowing plants. (And sometimes mushrooms.)
Please Subscribe To Our Channel  -  A website's stuff is free, but they ask you to donate money. Or vote for them. Or something else along those lines.
Cooldown  -  A fixed and usually independent recovery time for an ability.
The Firefly Effect  -  Not getting into a new show because you fear it will be canceled quickly.
Magical Romani  -  Romani people are stereotyped as having magic powers.
And This Is For  -  This is for destroying my village! *punch* And this is for killing my father! *kick*
Evil Colonialist  -  An exploiter of the poor and ignorant communities.
Artistic License Law  -  Law and legal proceedings are presented in a way that isn't factually accurate.
Head Turning Beauty  -  The other characters drool over her.
Academy Of Evil  -  A school where it's cool to be cruel. Classes include World Domination and organized crime.
Teeny Weenie  -  A man with a small penis can expect to be made fun of.
Two Keyed Lock  -  Requires two or more people to unlock.
Pedophile Priest  -  A holy man with an entirely unholy interest in children.
Funny Aneurysm Moment  -  A light-hearted moment is made awkward and/or offensive by later in-story or real-world events.
Torch The Franchise And Run  -  Destroying a work so severely that it can't be used by anyone, including the original creators.
Fire And Ice Love Triangle  -  A Love Triangle where one suitor is warm and passionate (Fire) and the other is cold and aloof (Ice).
Ominous Crack  -  A crack shows that an apparent barrier or protection won't hold.
A Protagonist Shall Lead Them  -  Hero, take these troubled people and lead them to greatness.
What Do You Mean Its Not For Little Girls  -  What a saccharine cutesy girl's show! Wait, this isn't aimed at little girls!?
Slapstick Knows No Gender  -  Amusing Injuries are equal-opportunity.
And Then John Was A Zombie  -  The protagonist is literally transformed into the monsters they fight.
Official Kiss  -  The kiss that signals a couple's Relationship Upgrade.
Pre Sacrifice Final Goodbye  -  A hero bids their loved one(s) farewell before making a Heroic Sacrifice.
Dressed To Heal  -  Doctor's coats and nurses suits used to show that people are doctors and nurses.
Halloween Episode  -  An episode taking place on (or at least around) Halloween.
We Work Well Together  -  Characters work together to solve a common crisis, succeed, and decide to continue working together in the face of future problems.
Continuity Porn  -  Excessive references to a series' previous installments.
Hanging Judge  -  If you're on trial before this guy, you're as good as guilty.
Nepharious Pharaoh  -  Pharaohs are evil!
Ominous Pipe Organ  -  Pipe organ can be loud and scary enough to be used for ominous settings.
Indian Burial Ground  -  There's one underneath everywhere supernatural stuff happens.
Broken Masquerade  -  A person discovers the truth behind the Masquerade.
Magical Abortion  -  A pregnancy is ended supernaturally.
Four Point Scale  -  When reviewers can't find the heart to grade under a 7 out of 10 (unless they pan it).
Shock Site  -  Sites that will make you reach for the Brain Bleach.
Wag The Director  -  When actors think they can do better than their directors.
Symbol Motif Clothing  -  That outfit has a pattern. Something's fishy here...
Eye Awaken  -  A shot of a character's eyes opening when they are waking up.
Canon Invasion  -  That universe is now canonically a part of our own.
Decapitation Strike  -  An attack meant to kill or otherwise incapacitate multiple leaders at once, permanently crippling their organization.
Gay Guy Dies First  -  Being something else than heterosexual tends to place you higher up on the Sorting Algorithm of Mortality.
Demon Of Human Origin  -  Mortals descend into demons.
Tattooed Crook  -  Tattoos = dubious morality.
Bag Of Spilling  -  The hero loses all his special items/powers for the sequel.
Critical Research Failure  -  A blatantly obvious factual error concerning common knowledge.
Love Is A Weakness  -  A character believes that love is a negative influence on them
Hedge Trimmer  -  Editors who clean out clutter and other dirtiness from the wiki, such as Word Cruft and Conversation in the Main Page.
Race Fetish  -  A character is expressing a sexual attraction to people of a certain group.
Nuclear Family  -  Husband, wife, son, daughter, Anyville-type house and a dog.
The Singing Mute  -  Characters who never talk but still sing or otherwise vocalize non-verbally.
Green Eyed Monster  -  Envy elicits evil.
From The Mouths Of Babes  -  A child makes observations that you wouldn't expect for their age, often of a sexual nature.
What Happened To The Mouse  -  A minor plot point or character disappears from the narrative without resolution.
Slave Brand  -  A mark showing you're a slave.
Lens Flare Censor  -  A lens flare hides something from sight.
Weird Moon  -  Uh, that moon isn't behaving like a moon should...
Hungry Weapon  -  The sword wants your head!
Going Commando  -  Not wearing underwear.
Moustache De Plume  -  A pen name used to conceal gender.
Evil Cripple  -  Someone evil suffers from a debilitating physical condition.
Homing Projectile  -  Missiles that follow their target.
Unexpected Successor  -  Character who isn't expected to get the position... does.
Sword And Sandal  -  Epic tales set in the days of the Greeks, the Romans, and the Hebrews.
Dimension Lord  -  Entity, often evil, placed in charge of a parallel universe.
Infinite One Ups  -  A trick that lets you accrue infinite lives.
Braids Of Action  -  An action girl with braided hair.
Truth Serums  -  Substance used to make someone tell the truth.
Real Life Relative  -  When two or more characters in a show are played by actors who have some form of real-life relationship.
Face Revealing Turn  -  If you see a character facing a wall, watch out.
Simpsonwave  -  Vaporwave with video footage from The Simpsons.
Broken Ace  -  The Ace has issues.
Noble Bigot  -  Someone who holds prejudiced beliefs, but still tries to be a good person.
Police Are Useless  -  Security authorities either don't help to solve problems or makes them worse.
Schoolgirl Lesbians  -  Girls who like other girls IN SCHOOL!
Common Tongue  -  The language nearly everyone speaks.
Sinister Shades  -  Sun never sets on an asshole.
Facing The Bullets One Liner  -  Character gives a badass One-Liner when he knows he's about to die.
And Call Him George  -  Dangerously smothering something with affection.
Soap Box Sadie  -  She has a cause, and she will lecture you all about it.
Time For Plan B  -  If the first plan fails, you'd better have another plan ready.
Evil Is Petty  -  Not just a villain, but a total dick.
Slower Than A Snail  -  Something traditionally considered slow speeds past something else to emphasize how slow the latter is going.
Space Marine  -  Hardware-heavy spaceborne elite troops paralleling the US Marine Corps.
Absence Of Evidence  -  It's a clue because it's not there.
Sextra Credit  -  A student has sex with a teacher for a better grade.
Prison Rape  -  Rape in prison, usually male on male.
Yes No Answer Interpretation  -  A character doesnt outright say yes or no, but their actions make it obvious what their thoughts are. Another character will then reply with some variant of Ill take that as yes/no.
Create Your Own Hero  -  A villain's actions lead to the rise of a hero who rises against him.
Four Legs Good Two Legs Better  -  Some animals stand on two legs compared to those who walk on all fours.
Deadly Gaze  -  Killing someone by looking at them, often in the eyes.
Leader Forms The Head  -  The leader of a combining mecha team forms the head and/or torso for thematic purposes.
Catch Phrase  -  A character says a specific sentence many times.
My Significance Sense Is Tingling  -  A character senses, somehow, that a major event is currently underway somewhere else.
Playing The Victim Card  -  A villainous or unsympathetic character claims victimhood to avoid responsibility for wrongdoing.
Thirty Sue Pileup  -  Multiple Types of Mary Sue in one work.
Naive Newcomer  -  You don't know anything 'cause you just got here.
Oxygenated Underwater Bubbles  -  Inhale large bubbles to avoid drowning.
The Good Guys Always Win  -  In the end, The Hero's side comes out on top.
New Rules As The Plot Demands  -  Breaking established rules for narrative convenience (or from ignorance).
Animal Is The New Man  -  Animals rule over the earth after humanity falls.
Award Bait Song  -  That epic, sappy song in a movie that wins all the acclaim.
Creature Hunter Organization  -  Plot revolving around an organization of hunters versus a race of malicious monsters.
Christmas Episode  -  An episode set on Christmas.
Shell Game  -  They both look the same, so which is which?
Final Dungeon Preview  -  The player visits the final level before the actual end of the game.
Fan Myopia  -  Fans think the work is more popular than it actually is.
Hand In The Hole  -  Go ahead, stick your hand in there. What could possibly go wrong?
Mc Ninja  -  Not all Ninja are Japanese.
Vampire Bites Suck  -  When some vampires feed, it gets downright ugly.
Undeathly Pallor  -  The undead with pale skin.
No Animosity In The Afterlife  -  Enemies in life make up after death.
Giving The Sword To A Noob  -  C-List Fodder ends up fighting the bad guys because the Chosen One isn't around to help.
Weaksauce Weakness  -  A really stupid Achilles' Heel.
Soup Is Medicine  -  Soup is associated with sickness/ being given to sick people.
Aristocrats Are Evil  -  The upper-class are always bad.
Littering Is No Big Deal  -  Disposal bins do not exist; toss anything anywhere.
Barefoot Captives  -  Prisoners and slaves forced to go without shoes.
Video Mode  -  A video game embedded in a pinball table.
One Woman Song  -  A song that's named after a woman.
Wretched Hive  -  Crapsack Town.
Combat Referee  -  This person makes the rules of the battle.
Villainous Mother Son Duo  -  A villainess is assisted by her son.
Unreliable Voiceover  -  Voiceover's narration doesn't match what's being shown.
Ridiculously Cute Critter  -  An animal that has deliberately been made as cute as possible.
Stompy Mooks  -  The mooks make noisy footsteps, so it's easy to hide from them.
An Economy Is You  -  The game setting's economy revolves solely around the player.
Future Badass  -  A loser in the present day becomes a badass in the Bad Future.
Dramatic Spotlight  -  Everything is dark, save for a light that shines down on something/someone. Very effectively creates a dramatic mood.
Midas Touch  -  Transforming everything you touch into something valuable is great until it sucks.
Broken Echo  -  Someone shouts and the echo that comes back isn't what they said.
Badass Back  -  Can kill enemies without having to look at them.
A Hell Of A Time  -  Nothing says "damn hell of a good time" like a good time in damn Hell!
Death And The Maiden  -  The personification of Death is accompanied by a maiden.
Upgrade Artifact  -  Instantly learning a skill just by holding an object.
Luckily My Shield Will Protect Me  -  A character using a shield for protection.
Gonk  -  An incredibly ugly character whose design is different from most other characters.
Superhero  -  Stories where The Hero has superhuman abilities.
Exploding Fish Tanks  -  Aquariums are common victims of collateral damage.
Deface Of The Moon  -  A villain tells everyone how powerful they are by carving his name or likeness onto a giant landmark.
Relationship Upgrade  -  They're finally an Official Couple.
Farmers Daughter  -  An innocent-looking rural girl.
Riding Into The Sunset  -  Riding into the sunset is symbolic for stories ending.
Comically Small Demand  -  A person makes an underwhelmingly small, simple request. Bonus points if they went through great lengths to negotiate in the first place.
Name Of Cain  -  If a character is named after Cain, he's a bad guy.
Fusion Dissonance  -  When the mergers of a Fusion Dance are not easily recognizable in the result.
Armor Piercing Question  -  Question that forces a character to consider their actions.
Land Down Under  -  Australia, as seen on TV.
Online Alias  -  An identity a person creates and uses on the Internet.
There Are No Tents  -  You can sleep to heal only at certain buildings; sleeping anywhere else is not an option.
The Good King  -  A king who is good at his job and beloved by the people.
Our Centaurs Are Different  -  Even the centaur myths couldn't be kept straight, but modern portrayals sure can.
Late To The Tragedy  -  Something bad has happened in the location, and the character arrives too late.
Alternate Aesop Interpretation  -  Interpreting An Aesop in a different way.
Adaptation Name Change  -  Different name, different medium, but same great entity!
Patriotic Fervor  -  Super love for your country.
Making Use Of The Twin  -  Share a uterus, share a part, or do other tricks.
Dream Tells You To Wake Up  -  In Soviet Russia, dream wakes YOU!
The Internet Is For Porn  -  Internet is portrayed in the media as an overblown porn provider.
Gentle Giant Sauropod  -  Sauropod dinosaurs are generally docile and won't harm you.
Happy Ending  -  An ending with nothing bad happening in the end.
Punch Parry  -  When punches collide.
Gold Fever  -  Gold drives you crazy.
After Action Report  -  Fan Fic retelling the author's experience playing a (strategy) game as a coherent narrative.
Trapped By Mountain Lions  -  Plots that are concurrent to the main one, but have nothing to do with it.
Nuke Em  -  When nukes are used excessively or too eagerly.
Announcer Chatter  -  The announcer at the sports talks a bit too much.
Horrible History Metal  -  Metal song about historical events.
Sword And Sorcerer  -  A fighter can do stuff a magic-user can't, and vice versa, so they team up and complete each other.
Mr Fixit  -  The guy who can fix anything.
All Hail The Great God Mickey  -  Future Imperfect people mistake our cultural icons as gods.
Coins For The Dead  -  Coins left for the dead to pay their way to the afterlife.
Boobs And Butt Pose  -  A character twists their spine to face the camera with their back turned.
Gaslighting  -  Driving someone insane by making them think they are already insane.
Hollywood New England  -  Bad drivahs who love lobstah and chowdah and can't pronounce the lettah "AH".
All Stereotype Cast  -  A cast where all its characters are stereotypes of some sort.
The Red Mage  -  A magician capable of casting spells from multiple schools of magic.
Shonen Demographic  -  Manga and anime marketed towards teenage boys.
Men Are The Expendable Gender  -  Male death and suffering is less important than female death and suffering.
Massive Race Selection  -  A game lets you play as a bunch of different races.
Satchel Switcheroo  -  2 characters who own the same kind briefcase or any other container get it mixed up with one another.
Rookie Red Ranger  -  The Newbie is The Hero.
Blast Out  -  A Mexican Standoff goes to hell and everyone starts blasting.
Multi Disc Work  -  One work is spread over multiple discs or casettes.
Canines Primary Felines Secondary  -  Dogs are the main cast; cats are the supporting cast.
Twinkle Smile  -  Teeth with Audible Gleam.
False Friend  -  Someone you thought was your friend actually wasn't.
Inner Thoughts Outsider Puzzlement  -  A character has an inner monologue/flashback/whatever which looks weird to outside parties.
Fantastic Slurs  -  Fictional slurs against fictional races.
Underrated And Overleveled  -  A "weakling" who joins your party that is much stronger than the story makes them out to be.
Strictly Formula  -  Main plotline of every episode is basically the same.
Double Standard Rape Male On Male  -  When a guy rapes another guy, either it's not considered rape or it's supposed to be funny.
I Owe You My Life  -  A character feels obligated to help one who helped them.
Levitating Lotus Position  -  Person/being levitates while in Lotus Position.
Serendipitous Survival  -  Luck keeps you from being where you would have died.
Simple Staff  -  A simple stick makes for a pretty good weapon.
Poes Law  -  Parodies of extreme views presented without outward mockery will be confused with sincerely held extreme views because of their similarities, while authentic extreme positions will be confused for parody.
Quacking Up  -  Humorous or lighthearted portrayals of ducks.
Not My Driver  -  When someone gets in a vehicle and does not realize that there is something evil driving.
Beauty Inversion  -  Attractive actor/actress purposely makes themselves ugly for a role.
What Are Records  -  Current generations are completely unfamiliar with past technology.
Pinocchio Syndrome  -  A non-human character wants to be human.
Driving A Desk  -  Projecting a recording on the wall behind the actors to imply that they are driving.
Easy Logistics  -  Wargamers don't care about ammo.
Mid Development Genre Shift  -  A work is retooled into another genre while it's still in its development phases.
Real Men Love Jesus  -  A badass character that is devoutly religious.
Fantasy Conflict Counterpart  -  Fictional conflict parallels a Real Life conflict.
Ultimate Job Security  -  It doesn't matter how skilled they are, they should've been fired a long time ago!
Turns Red  -  An enemy/boss that suddenly gets really tough once he's on the verge of death.
Scapegoat Ad  -  Blaming the company's employees for its product's shortcomings.
Cartwright Curse  -  Any Love Interest of this character won't last long.
Blue Blood  -  Aristocrats, below Royal Blood but above them pesky peasants.
A Noun Referred To As X  -  A Title Trope where "[a something] [is referred to as] [a word]".
Grew A Spine  -  Learning to make your own choices, and sticking to them.
Distinct Double Album  -  One album, two discs, two concepts.
Downloadable Content  -  Extra video game content available for download that wasn't originally there. Usually has a price, but cases of free content also exist.
Team Switzerland  -  In a group with much infighting, this is the portion that insists on staying neutral.
Fog Feet  -  Ghosts and genies have wispy tails instead of legs.
Horrible Camping Trip  -  Camping outdoors is a nightmare.
Title Drop  -  When the name of a work is spoken in-universe in a particularly epic fashion.
Frightening Power Usage  -  Normal or "good" superpowers Played for Horror.
Goofy Suit  -  A "funny"/ridiculous costume that you have to wear at work.
Must Be Invited  -  Monsters can only enter your home if you let them.
Brought Down To Badass  -  Even after losing their powers, they can still kick your ass.
Your Favorite  -  A character gives another character their favourite food or treat to show how much that character cares about them.
Imageboards  -  A site where you just post messages and images.
Bad Powers Bad People  -  I have evil powers, ergo I will be evil.
The Main Characters Do Everything  -  The lead does more than their job description should allow them to do; no other characters seem bothered by this.
Mandatory Twist Ending  -  Too many twist endings ruin the plot.
Eyeless Face  -  A face that hasn't got eyes or even eye sockets. It's pretty creepy.
Buxom Is Better  -  When characters in a work view having large breasts as an attractive feature.
Classical Music Is Boring  -  Classical music is depicted as tedious and soporific.
Fur Bikini  -  A scanty, two-piece outfit made of fur.
Sinister Shiv  -  An improvised dagger created by sharpening an item that's not normally able to be used as a weapon.
Ignorant Of The Call  -  Everyone considers the hero to be The Hero except for them.
Magic Is Evil  -  All magic is Black Magic.
Self Abuse  -  Portraying masturbation as unhealthy.
Fire Water Juxtaposition  -  Fire and water (or ice) motifs are used to contrast two characters, places or events.
Appeal To Authority  -  Forgetting that expertise in one's chosen field does not necessarily carry over into others.
Nothing But Hits  -  Period Pieces only play the really well-known stuff.
Droit Du Seigneur  -  I can have sex with whomever I damn well please in my kingdom because I am the king.
Weirder Than Usual  -  Stock Phrase about a normally strange character acting even stranger.
Creepy Camel Spider  -  Camel spiders depicted as far more aggressive, dangerous, and venomous in fiction than they are in reality.
We Have Ways Of Making You Talk  -  Phrase commonly spoken by interrogators to sound menacing.
Hormone Addled Teenager  -  All Teens Are Perverts.
Nonstandard Skill Learning  -  A skill in video game that is obtained through non-standard means.
Play The Game Skip The Story  -  A well-detailed plot... which everybody ignored in favor of gameplay or the metagame.
Species Equals Gender  -  A certain animal species is portrayed predominantly as one specific gender.
Lethal Eatery  -  Uuhhh, better not eat at this place if you want to live.
The Slow Path  -  In a story with time travel, traveling forward in time just by waiting.
Serkis Folk  -  Characters created with computer graphics over a motion-captured performance.
Bokukko  -  A girl who uses grammatically masculine pronouns to refer to herself.
Gravity Sucks  -  Turn off the engines and you fall straight down, regardless of lateral velocity.
Non Heteronormative Society  -  Where being queer is the norm.
Authentication By Newspaper  -  Identifying someone with the newspaper.
Playing With Character Type  -  A type-casted actor playing with, subverting or deconstructing their character type.
Bad Moon Rising  -  Red moon.
Thunder Drum  -  Drums being connected to thunder and lightning in some form.
Horror Doesnt Settle For Simple Tuesday  -  Horror plots happen on holidays.
Bargain With Heaven  -  Making Faustian Bargains with gods, angels, and other benevolent/neutral Cosmic Entities.
Crusading Widower  -  A vengeful character is motivated by the death of their spouse.
Signature Headgear  -  Distinctive headgear that hints at a character's personality.
History With Celebrity  -  A celebrity appearance is justified by them having a history with one of the characters.
Small Girl Big Gun  -  A little girl wielding an absurdly large gun.
Eco Terrorist  -  Saving the Earth with their guns and bombs.
My Girl Is Not A Slut  -  If a man has a lot of sexcapades he's a badass. If a woman has a lot of sexcapades she's a dirty whore.
Puzzle Pan  -  The camera pans over the route you should take before you begin.
Zeerust  -  A conspicuously outdated vision of the future.
Deep South  -  How Hollywood portrays the Southern United States outside of Atlanta: home of many rednecks and miles of farmland, backwoods, mountains, and bayous.
Serial Numbers Filed Off  -  The only thing distinct about a knockoff is its name and façade.
Mysterious Watcher  -  Someone who watches the events unfold for a personal agenda, unknown to the other characters.
Kiss Of The Vampire  -  Getting bitten by a vampire, and liking it.
Human All Along  -  An apparently nonhuman character is revealed to be human.
Im A Man I Cant Help It  -  Men have no self-control when it comes to sexual arousal.
Brainy Brunette  -  An intelligent person who happens to have black or brown hair.
Tyrant Takes The Helm  -  Reasonable Authority Figure replaced by despot.
Knows A Guy Who Knows A Guy  -  Someone mentions they've heard something from a long chain of relations.
Eye Scream  -  A character's eyes are severely injured or harmed, usually for gruesome effect.
Angry Chef  -  A hot-tempered, perfectionist chef.
Cultural Cross Reference  -  Making a reference to something popular in another country.
Kitsune  -  Fantastic Foxes from Japanese Mythology.
Starter Mon  -  The very first Mon every player recruits at the start of their adventure.
Tragic Bromance  -  Two heroes are friends. One dies.
Metaplot  -  An overarching plot in The 'Verse which is not limited to a linear series of books.
Cover Identity Anomaly  -  They remembered to think up the little details for their Cover Identity. Unfortunately, they did NOT think up a certain BIG detail.
Land Of One City  -  The city is the country and vice versa.
Get Thee To A Nunnery  -  Words that were raunchy then are not so raunchy nowadays.
Fantastic Flora  -  Bizarre, fantastical plant life.
Futile Hand Reach  -  When a character grabs towards another character who is far away and in danger, and thinking that this will somehow help the latter.
Dub Text  -  The edited version is more suggestive than the original, whether done intentionally or not.
Boldly Coming  -  Screwing aliens.
The Magocracy  -  Magical Society has its own form of government.
Summon Bigger Fish  -  Trying to stop a big threat by introducing an even bigger threat.
Ominous Fog  -  Fog makes everything creepy.
Terminally Dependent Society  -  A society that will go bye-bye if it should ever lose a certain function/technology/resource/Hive Mind/etc that it is VERY dependent on.
All Cavemen Were Neanderthals  -  Cavemen are depicted in a manner associated with Neanderthals such as being dumber and stronger.
Make Out Kids  -  Getting physically affectionate in public is no problem for this couple.
Otokonoko Genre  -  A Japanese genre for men, focusing on romantic or erotic situations involving Attractive Bent-Gender male Crossdressers.
Pulling Themselves Together  -  After being blown apart, a being pulls him/her/itself back together and is usually just fine.
Digital Piracy Is Evil  -  Why did you download that torrent? Shame on you, you horrible person.
The Pawns Go First  -  A villain waits for their minions to be defeated before battling the hero.
Goroawase Number  -  Numbers in Japanese are used for puns.
Unsafe Haven  -  Valuable thing is kept in unprotected location.
Designated Driver  -  One character remains sober throughout a party in order to drive his drunk friends home safely.
Caught Coming Home Late  -  Character spends long night out, sneaks into house, is caught by somebody waiting up for them.
Death By Origin Story  -  If you died as part of a hero's Backstory, you're never coming back.
I Meant To Do That  -  A character claims a mistake was deliberate.
Mind Hive  -  One body, many minds.
Summer Campy  -  Summer camp as a rundown setting for hilarity or horror for youth.
Disney School Of Acting And Mime  -  Cartoon characters have exaggerated, sweeping body language.
Sneeze Cut  -  You sneeze when you are mentioned/talked about elsewhere
Something We Forgot  -  Just after all is taken care of, the characters realize something they neglected and the scene shifts to such.
Replay Mode  -  Menu feature to repeat story or gameplay parts of a video game (battles, cutscenes, minigames, etc.).
Mob Boss Suit Fitting  -  An important, usually villainous, person continues conducting his business while being fitted for a suit.
Summon Everyman Hero  -  An average person from our world is brought into another for a wacky adventure.
Love Bubbles  -  An anime technique showing a bunch of bubbles in a love scene.
Ninja Prop  -  You ignore it because it's part of the medium... except it's not.
Disguised In Drag  -  A man disguises himself by dressing up as a woman.
Revolvers Are Just Better  -  A revolver proves more effective than other guns.
Hollywood Darkness  -  It's dark, but the audience can see and the characters aren't bumping into anything.
Shoddy Knockoff Product  -  A poor quality imitation of a successful product. Tries to ride its coattails.
Burning With Anger  -  Character gets so angry they burst into flame.
Gangsterland  -  American cities are full of criminals, especially gangs.
Good Morning Crono  -  Wake up, Protagonist—it's time to start your story!
Sorcerers Apprentice Plot  -  A young ward's attempts to be like his boss becomes too much for him to handle.
If We Get Through This  -  A jarring reminder that there's a future in a situation where characters are preoccupied with the present.
Its All About Me  -  Extreme or ultimate self-centeredness.
Reluctant Fanservice Girl  -  Whether she likes it or not, she's Ms. Fanservice.
Plot Driving Secret  -  If they knew the truth, we wouldn't have a plot.
Spork  -  A particularly bad work.
Unscaled Merfolk  -  Merfolk whose nonhuman half is an aquatic animal besides a scaled fish.
Toilet Seat Divorce  -  A marriage or relationship breaks up over something minor.
Badass On Paper  -  A character does amazing things despite lacking some skill.
Walking The Earth  -  Everything is within walking distance, and you never have to go home.
Dork Knight  -  A dorky Ace.
Truer To The Text  -  A new adaptation is closer to the original material than the previous one(s).
Marquee Alter Ego  -  An actor gets to fully show their face when playing a character who ordinarily doesn't.
Verbal Ticked  -  A character gradually begins to have trouble maintaining their Verbal Tic.
Wanted A Gender Conforming Child  -  A parent wishes their daughter were more feminine or son were more masculine.
Aliens Steal Cable  -  Aliens learn about Earth from TV and radio broadcasts.
The Profiler  -  They catch criminals by figuring out how they think.
Fat Bastard  -  An overweight character who is an unpleasant and/or bad person.
That Was The Last Entry  -  Sudden diary discontinuation means death of the writer.
Alternate Timeline  -  Same Backstory, different continuities.
Energy Donation  -  My energy is now your energy!
The Conscience  -  The voice that guides a character.
Shoot Him He Has A Wallet  -  A character is attacked because something mundane is mistaken for a weapon.
Spin Off  -  An element from a successful series (characters, location, organization, etc.) gets another series set in the same 'verse focussing on it.
All Abusers Are Male  -  The idea that men are inherently more evil and abusive than women to the point that there are no successful female abusers.
Non Human Non Binary  -  Sapient nonhuman races that don't generally consider themselves male or female.
Alternative Rock  -  Catch all term for rock music that is different or unique in some way.
Flat Joy  -  Expressing a moment of joy in a deadpan manner.
Technologically Blind Elders  -  Elders have a hard time understanding modern technologies.
Kingmaker Scenario  -  You cannot win, but you decide who does.
Food As Bribe  -  Food is used to bribe a character.
Transformation Conventions  -  The outside fits the inside via Animal Stereotypes.
Gayngster  -  Gay criminal.
Forgot Flanders Could Do That  -  Wait a moment, a Flanderized Character being more like their old self!?
Backstory Of The Day  -  Bob was always like that... this week.
Bold Inflation  -  Speech with unusual emphasis.
Old Shame  -  Work the artist would prefer was forgotten.
Vampire Dance  -  Vampires really know how to get down on the dance floor, be it club dance or aristocratic style ball rooming.
Chopper On Standby  -  There's a helicopter ready when they need one.
Convenience Store Gift Shopping  -  Last minute, useless, thoughtless gifts.
Hilarity In Zoos  -  Something unfortunate happens at the zoo.
I Kiss Your Hand  -  A man kisses a woman's hand as an act of flattery.
Prejudice Aesop  -  When the moral of the story is "don't be prejudiced."
You Would Make A Great Model  -  A woman is lured into a trap (usually involving rape) under the pretense of a model shoot.
Humans Are Average  -  Humanity's hat is being the Jack-of-All-Stats.
