Seinfeld Is Unfunny  -  A once-innovative work seems derivative after its original tropes become commonplace.
Smash Mook  -  A big, strong, tough Mook with an incredibly simple combat strategy.
The Grunting Orgasm  -  He comes like an animal. In other words, "Hrrrrgh- (splooge)".
Big Brother Mentor  -  A character acts as both a parent/older-sibling figure/mentor to their younger teammate(s).
Invention Pretension  -  Boldly misattributing credit for an invention.
Flying Firepower  -  Character with the ability to fly and fire energy beams.
Scaled Up  -  Trope: A character transforms into a more reptilian state.
They Call Him Sword  -  Nicknaming someone after a weapon.
My Blood Runs Hot  -  Hot-Blooded in a literal sense.
Cartoon Bomb  -  An explosive in the form of an iron ball with a fuse in it.
Fun With Flushing  -  Flushing legal items down the toilet, usually for fun.
The Most Dangerous Video Game  -  A video game that haunts or harms the player using it.
Abandon Shipping  -  New information causes shippers to abandon a pairing.
Divorce Assets Conflict  -  We're divorced! You can take this, I'll have that...
Token Lesbian  -  The one homosexual girl in a Cast Full of Gay men.
Dogs Love Fire Hydrants  -  Dogs love fire hydrants, whether for peeing on or not.
Sequel Episode  -  Non-sequential episodes that deal with the same plotline.
Violence Is Not An Option  -  You can't punch your way out of this problem.
Nintendo Hard  -  Really, really difficult games.
Genocide From The Inside  -  A people/clan/culture are completely wiped out, (or at least reduced to a tiny remnant) by one of their own.
Corporate Warfare  -  Businesses using military force.
Slowly Slipping Into Evil  -  A character gradually becomes more evil after committing an evil act.
Faith Heel Turn  -  Loss of faith = Start of Darkness.
Blood Oath  -  Drawing your own blood to illustrate commitment to a vow.
Revival By Commercialization  -  A relatively obscure or once-popular song becomes popular again after it was used in a movie, TV show, or commercial.
All Gays Love Theater  -  If you guessed that, according to fiction, musical theater's biggest fans are gay men, you're right.
Super Drowning Skills  -  Swims like a brick.
Asshole Victim  -  A character (usually a villain) suffers a horrific, but well-deserved death or punishment that they didn't cause.
School Bullying Is Harmless  -  A bully is portrayed as a sympathetic character and/or their victim doesn't suffer any lasting harm from their bullying.
The Anti Grinch  -  A character that loves Christmas, but somehow screws up when attempting to celebrate it.
Dying Race  -  A species of creatures that are on the brink of being put on the extinction list.
Informed Small Town  -  A supposedly small town has an unrealistically wide range of facilities.
Bizarre Alien Sexes  -  An alien species' sex system is very bizarre in comparison to terrestrial ones.
You Are Better Than You Think You Are  -  You are better than you think, and here's why.
Covered In Kisses  -  Multiple kisses on your face. Especially when lipstick is involved.
Accent Adaptation  -  Dialect in the work's original language is changed to a comparable one in the translation.
Friendly Neighborhood Spider  -  Who says spiders can't be cute and friendly?
Cranium Ride  -  Riding an enemy's head for transportation.
Just Add Water  -  Crafting takes only two items and trivial time.
Benevolent Conspiracy  -  The Conspiracy as a force for good.
Break Up Bonfire  -  A broken relationship ends with one party burning the stuff their ex left behind.
Burn The Undead  -  Fire is effective at destroying undead.
Otaku Surrogate  -  She's a cute girl that loves all the nerdy guy stuff you do! Isn't that hot?
Sticky Fingers  -  Compulsive stealing by a character, usually played for laughs.
Breath Weapon  -  Shooting stuff from your mouth.
Compensated Dating  -  Dating older men for pay.
Cloudcuckooland  -  Odd place with odd people.
Hard Coded Hostility  -  A faction which cannot be negotiated with and is perpetually at war with every other faction.
Baguette Beatdown  -  Hitting people up with French bread.
Love Cannot Overcome  -  Even though you love them, being in a relationship with them is too much to handle.
Back Alley Doctor  -  The Medic, minus the professionalism and plus the crudeness.
Infinity Plus One Sword  -  It's the best equipment in the game, but it requires significant effort to obtain.
We Have The Keys  -  Bypassing or breaking down a door that you had the key for or wasn't even locked.
Attractive Bent Gender  -  Characters who change into or dress as the opposite sex become hot.
Giant Scrap Robot  -  A Humongous Mecha made out of scrap parts.
Police Brutality Gambit  -  A Wounded Gazelle Gambit on the police.
Excalibur In The Rust  -  Cool Sword looks poorly maintained, but still is good.
Our Angels Are Different  -  Different works portray angels differently.
Space Filling Path  -  Getting from point A to point B involves a gratuitous amount of sidetracking.
Darkness Von Gothickname  -  Characters intended to be dark and edgy have an equally dark and edgy Awesome McCoolname.
Escaped From Hell  -  A character ends up in hell and somehow escapes.
Break Up Make Up Scenario  -  Protagonists have a falling out and are separated, but meet again and reconcile in the end.
Lie Back And Think Of England  -  Women can't enjoy sex, they can only have it to get pregnant and/or please their husbands.
Clock Roaches  -  Messing with the timeline causes Eldritch Abominations to come after you.
Victory Is Boring  -  A character defeats his opponent, and is now at a loss on what to do afterwards.
Face Heel Double Turn  -  A HeelFace Turn and a FaceHeel Turn that both occur at the same time.
Immortality Bisexuality  -  Immortals play for both teams.
Whodunnit To Me  -  The character has at least sort of survived their own successful murder, and now needs to solve the crime.
Motivational Lie  -  A lie is used to motivate a character so they can more effectively deal with a hardship or opponent... and perhaps become the Unwitting Pawn of the one telling the lie.
Transplanted Character Fic  -  Taking famous characters, altering their roles, and using them in an original story.
Bait And Switch Accusation  -  A character hiding something thinks they've been found out, but this is not the case.
Ubermensch  -  Lives by personal code rather than societal.
World Gone Mad  -  A world where everyone and everything is Denser and Wackier.
Not Now Kiddo  -  People aren't listening because of lack of common sense or business with less important activities.
No Need For Names  -  A person/group doesn't have name, and doesn't see the point of choosing one.
Pike Peril  -  Pike used as the freshwater equivalent of the Threatening Shark.
Non Player Character  -  You don't play as this character.
Memory Jar  -  Memories kept in an object for safekeeping and viewing.
How Do I Shot Web  -  A character must learn how to use their (usually new) abilities.
Pass Through The Rings  -  Going through (literal) hoops in order to proceed with the game.
We Will Meet Again  -  The villain is defeated. He promises to return.
Sarcastic Confession  -  Telling the truth in a way so people don't believe you.
Retroactive Legacy  -  The real-life history of a story element is actually a more recent fabrication.
Stock Shonen Hero  -  Archetypal take on The Hero: a Hot-Blooded Book Dumb embodiment of Japanese Spirit.
Vertebrate With Extra Limbs  -  Most land animals have four limbs. These have more.
Giant Spider  -  A big spider.
Gemini Destruction Law  -  You have to destroy both of them at once, or they'll just get better.
One Nation Under Copyright  -  Mega-Corp runs the government, too.
Crossover Alternate Universe  -  A universe is created for a crossover.
Drunken Master  -  The more you drink, the more competent you become.
Hostage For Mac Guffin  -  Hand over the Phlebtonium or your friend gets it!
What A Drag  -  Torture or death by dragging.
Hey You  -  Addressing someone with less respect than would be expected, often without actually identifying them.
Nerd In Evils Helmet  -  These villains might seem cool and dark, but they're actually pretty darn nerdy.
Incredibly Conspicuous Drag  -  A crossdresser doesn't look convincing.
Hanlons Razor  -  Probably not evil, just stupid.
Dishonored Dead  -  A deceased character is denied a funeral due to their crimes or how unlikable they were.
Deadly Upgrade  -  Character gets an enormous power boost, at the eventual cost of his/her life/sanity/free will.
Im Going To Disney World  -  Saying that one will go to Disney World after accomplishing something.
Loophole Abuse  -  Blatant cheating through semantics.
Humans Are Insects  -  The Master Race views humans are insignificant, worthless, and unintelligent.
Dangerously Close Shave  -  Shaving someone with the threat of killing them.
Natural Spotlight  -  You know it's important because the sunlight is shining on it.
Sharp Dressed Man  -  Fashionable male character.
Marathon Level  -  Really long level.
Gold Makes Everything Shiny  -  How do you make an object better or more luxurious? Just make it out of or cover it in gold.
Little Brother Is Watching  -  Older, more sinful character balks when younger character starts innocently imitating them.
Cast Speciation  -  Two characters who serve a similar role in the story are differentiated by their contrasting personalities.
Death Of Personality  -  Erasure of the mind equivalent to death, even if the body is still alive.
Alternate History Wank  -  A country or faction that is overly successful in an Alternate History story.
Scary Dogmatic Aliens  -  Single-minded alien antagonists used as allegories of real-life ideologies (usually ones the author dislikes).
A Team Firing  -  Lots of lead, no one's dead.
Critic Proof  -  Critics tear it apart and demand people to stay away from it, but it's a huge success anyway.
Defictionalization  -  Fake product + real demand = real product.
Heli Critter  -  When a living being can fly naturally, but through spinning a part of its body like a helicopter propeller.
Low Level Advantage  -  The player has some reason to not level-up.
Swiss Army Superpower  -  A power with defined limitations is applied to multiple unconventional uses.
Stage Magician  -  Practitioners of fake magic tricks that performs for an audience.
Perspective Flip  -  Story is retold from another character's subjective perspective.
Raising The Steaks  -  Zombie animals.
Good Girl Gone Bad  -  A female character who was once sweet and kind becomes nasty or downright villainous due to some tragic or traumatic event.
Violently Protective Girlfriend  -  Mess with her significant other, and you are going down.
Five Token Band  -  The cast contains one person each from several races, to either appeal to wider audiences or promote diversity.
Recessive Super Genes  -  Superpowerful Genetics may skip generations.
Ship To Ship Combat  -  Fans go to war over who ends up with who.
Male Might Female Finesse  -  Force and Finesse, applicable to men and women, respectively.
Universal Drivers License  -  For no apparent reason, the hero knows how to drive any vehicle he happens upon.
Foreboding Fleeing Flock  -  A swarm of animals fleeing away from impending danger.
Anti Armor  -  Armor only makes things worse against those moves.
Dead To Begin With  -  The story starts with the main character dead, and follows some manner of afterlife.
Bastardly Speech  -  A monologue that's nothing but Blatant Lies.
Beardness Protection Program  -  Growing (or shaving off) a beard for the purpose of disguise.
Ocean Madness  -  Insanity that comes from either being at sea or drinking seawater.
Killer Robot  -  Non-living automaton designed for ending life.
The Morality Mortality Equation  -  The more evil a villain is, the greater the odds that their loved ones will not survive. The more moral the hero is, the greater the odds that their own loved ones will survive.
Outside Joke  -  The joke is only funny if you don't know too much about the subject.
Common Knowledge  -  Something that is believed by the public to be part of a work or genre, but isn't.
Dark Action Girl  -  An evil (or morally dark-shaded grey) Action Girl
Behind The Black  -  If you can't see it, neither can the characters.
No Pronunciation Guide  -  I know how to spell this name, but how do I say it?
Testosterone Brigade  -  A male sub-fandom of some traditionally female-oriented media.
Telescoping Robot  -  Show off all of your weapons at once.
Spread Wings Frame Shot  -  A character stands in front of something that gives them the appearance of having wings.
The Lifestream  -  Fantasy afterlife. Usually a soul goes there between two reincarnation cycles.
Lord Error Prone  -  A clumsy or incompetent hero or quest-doer.
Cardboard Box Of Unemployment  -  When a character is fired, they leave with a cardboard box full of their personal items.
Why Did It Have To Be Snakes  -  Someone's crippling phobia.
Fantastic Science  -  Fantastic elements studied scientifically.
Crimefighting With Cash  -  Using financial resources to deal with the forces of evil (not as an Improvised Weapon).
Never Recycle A Building  -  No matter how useful its location might be, an abandoned building will stay undisturbed for a long time.
One True Pairing  -  A group of fans' preferred ship.
Royals Who Actually Do Something  -  Royals who work.
The Merch  -  Selling things related to the product so that you can pay for it.
Beauty Contest  -  A contest in which people are judged by their appearance and social grace.
Relationship Reset Button  -  An in-universe explanation for a couple suddenly falling apart and having to re-start their relationship from scratch.
Pacifist Run  -  Don't kill anything that moves at all.
Your Terrorists Are Our Freedom Fighters  -  Even if La Résistance has committed excessive evil, they are idolized if they are fighting against the evil government, but are dreaded when attacking the people.
Upgrade Vs Prototype Fight  -  Two machines fight. One of them is a prototype, the other is its sleek new successor.
Throw It In  -  An accident or improvisation gets left in because it fits.
The Magic Goes Away  -  The magic that used to be stops working.
Critic Breakdown  -  Exaggerate negative reaction after reviewing something.
AI Roulette  -  Video game AI that runs on pure RNG.
Lost Voice Plot  -  A plot that involves someone losing their voice, whether through natural or artificial means.
Fanime  -  Fan-made anime. Generally poorly made (with some exceptions) and not all of them produced by Japanese people.
College Is High School Part 2  -  College works a lot like high school and/or college students act immature.
Casual Car Giveaway  -  Don't need your vehicle anymore? Just give it to the first guy you see!
Dead Unicorn Trope  -  Parodies of a cliché that never existed in the first place.
Save The World Climax  -  A plot that initially wasn't about saving the world is so by the end.
Pater Familicide  -  A male character kills his entire family and then kills himself or escapes his crime.
Menstrual Menace  -  Someone has their period. Weirdness ensues.
Post Apocalyptic Gasmask  -  People in the apocalypse tend to wear a gas mask.
God Is Inept  -  Cases in which The Lord Almighty is — quite literally — not suited for his job.
Everyone Knows Morse  -  All the heroes know Morse code.
Delivery Stork  -  Storks who deliver babies.
Chandlers Law  -  Breaking a lull in the plot with a spontaneously chaotic event.
Plethora Of Mistakes  -  An absurd amount of things go wrong when executing a plan.
Accidental Kiss  -  Oops! I kissed you!
Instant Sedation  -  Giving someone a sedative instantly knocks them out.
Dancing Pants  -  Clothing that moves on its own.
Weird West  -  The Wild West meets the supernatural.
Limited Special Collectors Ultimate Edition  -  The bigger, longer, uncut, and more expensive Ace Custom release of a work.
Audience Participation Failure  -  The audience doesn't participate (in a way that the performers intended).
Paper Master  -  A character uses paper or paper-based powers to fight.
In Universe Factoid Failure  -  Critical Research Failure made In-Universe.
Adventure Towns  -  The characters travel to a new setting every episode.
Glurge  -  Inspiring, emotional, and conniving stories.
Switch Out Move  -  A move or technique that lets the user swap the positioning of themselves, an ally, or enemy.
Alien Invasion  -  Aliens (try to) take over the world.
The Dark Side  -  Evil is addictive and corruptive.
Ominous Save Prompt  -  The game prompts you to save your progress right before things get worse.
Emotion Suppression  -  When someone suppresses or erases their emotions with drugs, special training or other phlebotinum.
Sheet Of Glass  -  You see that perfect, clean sheet of glass? It's about to become perfect clean shards.
Where It All Began  -  Your journey ends at where you began your journey.
Head Swap  -  A character sprite that is identical to another safe for the head.
Not The Intended Use  -  The developer's intention for a game mechanic differs completely from the actual players'.
When Trees Attack  -  The trees are out to kill you.
Wanted A Son Instead  -  An unborn child's relative, usually a parent, hopes that the child will be one sex, but they end up being the other.
Throw The Book At Them  -  Using a book to inflict physical harm.
Derailed For Details  -  When a character is trying to tell something, but is constantly interrupted for more details about what they're telling.
Proud Beauty  -  A character is proud of the fact that other characters find them attractive.
In My Language That Sounds Like  -  When the pronunciation or spelling of something has a completely different meaning in another language.
Bury Your Gays  -  Gay characters are killed off disproportionately often.
Slow And Steady Wins The Race  -  A character loses a race for most of the story, but wins at the end.
Fan Service Pack  -  Character becomes more Fanservice worthy over time.
Megamix Game  -  A game with content from all over its series.
Humans Are Ugly  -  Aliens find humans unpleasant-looking.
Critical Existence Failure  -  Perfectly healthy until death.
To Create A Playground For Evil  -  Villain wants to reduce the world into an anarchistic Crapsack World.
The Love Slap Of Epiphany  -  A male character slaps an abusive female character, resulting her to become more affectionate.
Arc Villain  -  Standalone Big Bad of a single story arc in a much longer story.
Unwanted Glasses Plot  -  Coping with Nerd Glasses.
Ron The Death Eater  -  Fandom treats a morally good/neutral character in a work as evil or a jerk due to biases.
Shoo The Dog  -  A character sends anotherusually an animalaway, for one of many reasons.
Unintentional Backup Plan  -  Something unrelated completes the same goal of the original plan.
Earth Shattering Kaboom  -  An entire planet explodes.
All Nations Are Superpowers  -  The world is made of only a few large, powerful nations instead of being mixed with smaller ineffective states.
The Right Of A Superior Species  -  Their race is most advanced, so they treat every other like animals.
Town Girls  -  Three characters in a story who can be compared to the geographical location of uptown (femme), downtown (neither) and out of town (butch).
Adaptational Nice Guy  -  A Jerkass becomes nicer in an adaptation.
Personalized Afterlife  -  An individual's own personal afterlife.
A Dungeon Is You  -  The MC is a Genius Loci in charge of building a Dungeon.
Finding Judas  -  A character willingly betrays the protagonists for benevolent reasons.
Sudden Soundtrack Stop  -  Making the music stop for the purpose of being jarring.
Planet Spaceship  -  Truly enormous spaceships that rival planets or moons in size.
Mouthful Of Pi  -  Reciting pi. note 3.... Hey, you asked for it.
Little Miss Snarker  -  The Deadpan Snarker as a young girl.
Old Friend New Gender  -  An old friend you haven't seen for a while has now transitioned.
Youre Just Jealous  -  Blaming someone else's opinion or criticism on them being jealous.
Introduced Species Calamity  -  A new species is introduced to an environment with nothing to keep it in check. Disaster follows.
Opposing Combat Philosophies  -  Two or more clashing sides of a conflict have different ways to win a battle.
Moveset Clone  -  Two or more characters with similar or identical fighting moves.
Being Good Sucks  -  Doing right is hard and no fun.
Creepy Loner Girl  -  Socially awkward, disheveled girl with a gloomy disposition.
Discredited Meme  -  Everybody's getting real sick of this meme...
Neutral No Longer  -  A character who spent the series avoiding conflict finally chooses a side.
G Rated Stoner  -  Character who fits the stereotypes of The Stoner, but whose drug use is only vaguely implied or totally absent.
Tyrannosaurus Rex  -  Tyrannosaurus rex in fiction.
Out Of Character Alert  -  An out-of-character action or statement serves to let others know that something is not right.
Alternative Comics  -  A genre of comics that evolved from the Underground Comics of the 1960s and 1970s.
Accidental Nightmare Fuel  -  It's scary at the time it happens. But it wasn't supposed to be.
The Shadow Knows  -  A character's shadow doesn't match their body, hinting at their true, concealed nature.
The Not Love Interest  -  A partner who is not romantically involved with the main character, despite fulfilling the usual role of one.
Bleached Underpants  -  The author or creator of a book, movie, or TV series willingly tones down their work.
Revenue Enhancing Devices  -  It serves little purpose to the media it's tied with, other than to make money for the company that made it.
Boom Stick  -  A staff that can also fire magical or high-technology range attacks.
Hates Small Talk  -  A character hates the idea of Talking About The Weather.
Wizard Needs Food Badly  -  Eat to keep your hunger at bay so you can beat the game before starving to death.
Character Shilling  -  The plot goes out of its way to convince the audience how awesome a character is.
Emotions Vs Stoicism  -  Feelings vs Reasoning.
Have You Told Anyone Else  -  Hero finds big secret and tells trusted ally, who asks hero if they told anyone else; trusted ally is actually villain looking to silence anyone who knows the secret.
Curse Of The Pharaoh  -  Ancient Egyptian ruins are, without exception, cursed.
Eternal Recurrence  -  The Apocalypse happens every x thousand years.
For Your Own Good  -  A character rationalizes their questionable deeds out of their care for another character.
The Trope Without A Title  -  Something nameless is only referred to by a description.
Nonhumans Lack Attributes  -  Humans seem to be the only beings that possess genitals.
Rape As Drama  -  Nonconsensual sex used as a serious and dramatic plot element.
Glass Eye  -  A character who wears an eye made out of glass in place of an eye that they lost... somehow.
I Let You Win  -  One character won a contest because the loser allowed them to for some reason.
May Contain Evil  -  That super-popular new product has evil side-effects.
Footnote Fever  -  Generous use of footnotes in media that don't usually have them.1
I Know Karate  -  Hero warns an adversary that they know martial arts.
Rhetorical Request Blunder  -  Someone asks for something, not meaning it. Someone misinterprets them and does it.
Voice Changeling  -  A character that can perfectly mimic someone else's voice.
April Fools Day  -  A traditional day of fun and pranking.
Uncertain Audience  -  What's the target audience again? The work certainly doesn't know.
Nice Mean And In Between  -  A trio consisting of a nice character, a mean character, and a character who is the composite of both.
Alpha Strike  -  Everyone fires at the same target.
Race Against The Clock  -  The heroes have to do something to stop the countdown, or else the consequences will be catastrophic.
Relatively Flimsy Excuse  -  Claiming somebody is a relative as an excuse for them being around. Even though s/he clearly isn't.
Rule Abiding Rebel  -  For someone that's edgy, their attitudes are surprisingly conventional.
Point Of Divergence  -  A specific event or point in time where a single timeline has split into two or more.
Hijacked Destiny  -  Character manages to steal The Chosen One status away from the proper chosen one.
Cheerful Child  -  Sweet little kid.
Perpetual Storm  -  A storm that lasts for an unusually long time.
That Old Time Prescription  -  Primitive healers only ever use universally recognizable primitive medicines.
Impostor Exposing Test  -  A test that determines which of two or more claiming to be the real thing is telling the truth.
Sex Is Cool  -  Sex and things related to it are portrayed as cool.
Pair The Dumb Ones  -  Dumb characters in a relationship.
Smack On The Back  -  A backslap hurts.
The Big Board  -  It contains maps and plans for easy plotting. And it makes a great exposition device.
Color Failure  -  Character goes monochrome from shock.
Escape From The Crazy Place  -  The world has gone mad. It's your job to escape it.
Lust Object  -  A character who is actively lusted over by another.
What Do You Mean Its Not Didactic  -  Just try to not read too much into this.
Strip Buffer  -  Comics drawn in advance to be posted in the event of a Schedule Slip.
Human Shield  -  Forcibly using someone as a shield to get others to not shoot at you.
Level Editor  -  Make your own levels!
Immune To Bullets  -  They are literally bulletproof and can't just be shot by using standard ammo.
Bright Is Not Good  -  Bright colors are evil or dangerous.
Differently Dressed Duplicates  -  Time travel duplicates dress differently.
Brand Name Takeover  -  One specific brand becomes synonymous with the product itself.
Transformation At The Speed Of Plot  -  All pathogens progress according to Rule of Drama.
Mistaken For Disease  -  An inexplicable mishap is incorrectly assumed to be the result of a disease.
Improvised Cross  -  Two sticks form into a cross to kill a vampire.
Dragon With An Agenda  -  Villain's Dragon has goals differing from his own.
Identification By Dental Records  -  ...because there's nothing else left of the body to use.
Collective Identity  -  Several people share the same public identity.
Mother Russia Makes You Strong  -  Being raised in Russia makes one tough.
Shadow Pin  -  A power that allows to pin someone's shadow to the ground.
Familial Foe  -  Villain victimizes an entire family/bloodline of characters.
Sex Is Liberation  -  Sex portrayed as liberating.
Spell Blade  -  Putting a spell on your sword.
The Pin Is Mightier Than The Sword  -  Badges that give you superpowers.
Cheap Heat  -  HELLO, TV TROPES!note Pro wrestlers addressing the crowd by name.
Improbable Piloting Skills  -  Good piloting lets vehicles outperform others of the same model, or even break the laws of physics.
Love You And Everybody  -  Platonic love gets misinterpreted as romantic love.
Post Punk  -  The Darker and Edgier version of New Wave Music.
Brutal Bonus Level  -  An extra level that's not part of the main game but noticeably harder than the rest of the set.
Carousel Kidnapping  -  A carousel is the site of an abduction or related offense.
Venus Is Wet  -  Venus is a lush, Earth-like planet free for colonization (instead of the Lethal Lava Land Death World that it really is).
The Oath Breaker  -  They broke a promise, and that's all anyone remembers them for.
Throat Light  -  A character so full of power that light shines out of their mouth.
Unstable Equilibrium  -  Winning more is easy, losing less is hard.
Character Tics  -  Behavioural quirks and other idiosyncrasies unique to each character.
Mean Boss  -  The boss is a bit of a prick.
Elegant Gothic Lolita  -  A young woman appearing in frilly, doll-like attire which mostly has flavors of Victorian and early Gothic clothing era designs.
Going Down With The Ship  -  A captain stays aboard a sinking ship, while others leave it.
Superpower Silly Putty  -  A person who gains extremely volatile superpowers that come and go frequently.
Zero Effort Boss  -  A Boss Battle so easy, you'd either have to try to lose or can't lose even if you wanted to.
Nothing Can Save Us Now  -  A Stock Phrase someone says in the face of failure right before the arrival of a Deus ex Machina.
What Is Evil  -  The concept of good and evil is meaningless to the villain.
Magic Mushroom  -  Mushrooms in fiction tend to be magic in nature, be it for the better or worse
Vain Sorceress  -  Uses magic to make herself beautiful.
Off The Shelf FX  -  Special effects aided with products you can buy at your local store.
The Lost Woods  -  Deep magic forest.
Inertia Is A Cruel Mistress  -  Conserved momentum can really be a pain for Super Speed situations where some control would come in handy.
Ammunition Backpack  -  Backpack full of ammunition.
Prepositional Phrase Equals Coolness  -  Lame or boring name + prepositional phrase = awesome name!
Instant Illness  -  A disease that takes an unrealistically short time to develop.
Enraged By Idiocy  -  Character is angered by others' stupidity.
Ching Chong  -  When a Western person starts to speak Chinese-sounding gibberish as a form to mock Chinese people or other East Asians.
The Bait  -  A person is used to lure someone else into a situation.
Magical Library  -  Libraries are guaranteed to be supernatural or have supernatural content.
Back For The Dead  -  Character returns to be killed off.
Call It Karma  -  Do good things, good things happen to you. Do bad things, bad things happen to you.
Homemade Inventions  -  Gadgets on a budget.
Death Of A Thousand Cuts  -  Killing with many weak attacks.
Where Everybody Knows Your Flame  -  All gay bars in fiction are wild, colorful places with camp techno music and Camp Gays.
Magical Queer  -  Closer to Earth Gay Best Friend.
Trapped In Villainy  -  A villain performs villainous acts only because, if he doesn't, he'll die.
Lipstick Lesbian  -  A feminine lesbian, as opposed to a Butch Lesbian.
Aloof Big Brother  -  A character's older brother is very impressive but treats his siblings coldly.
Dressing As The Enemy  -  Wearing the uniforms of the Evil Army to sneak around their base.
Decompressed Comic  -  Comics that focus more on visuals and less on dialogue.
Visionary Villain  -  A villain with a vision for something huge.
Fake Special Attack  -  This attack looks powerful. It really isn't.
And Some Other Stuff  -  The writer/creator cannot tell you the active ingredients of this dangerous compound lest some impressionable fool get hurt or commit a crime trying to do this.
Power Perversion Potential  -  Special abilities turned to sexual or lecherous purposes.
Get It Over With  -  If you're going to kill me, just do it already. Do it!
Bait And Switch Comment  -  Subversion in dialogue.
Expressive Ears  -  When a character's moods can be read by looking at their ears.
Villainous Underdog  -  A villain that is physically weaker than the hero.
Easily Conquered World  -  This place doesn't offer much resistance against would-be rulers.
Incest Yay Shipping  -  Shipping characters that are related to each other.
Coming Straight Story  -  When a straight character has an inverted Coming-Out Story after pretending to be gay.
Bunny Ears Lawyer  -  Eccentric (and possibly crazy) yet extremely competent character.
Bad News In A Good Way  -  Delivering negative news in a positive manner.
Promptless Branching Point  -  When Story Branching occurs without explicit prompts, through gameplay alone.
Curious As A Monkey  -  They're as curious as it gets. Hilarity Ensues
Cant Act Perverted Toward A Love Interest  -  Decency means being romantically serious.
Breakthrough Hit  -  The creation of this work leads its creator's successful career.
Real After All  -  Something thought to be fake turns out to be real.
Idiot Houdini  -  Someone who by all rights should be Too Dumb to Live, suffers no consequence for their stupidity and prospers instead.
Staring Down Cthulhu  -  When a badass stares hard enough into the abyss, the abyss blinks first.
No One Gets Left Behind  -  Even with imminent danger closing in, one character puts themself at risk to help get the other out alive.
Alternative Joke Interpretation  -  A secondary reason as to why a joke is funny.
Roofhopping  -  In a city setting, traveling by jumping across roofs.
Infinity Minus One Sword  -  A powerful weapon that's technically not the best, but is considerably easier to get or use.
You Should Have Died Instead  -  When X dies, Y thinks Z should have died instead of X.
Trope Trigger  -  Short foreshadowing that a Trope is about to occur.
Expy  -  This character was deliberately crafted to be very similar to another character in a different work, but is not intended to be the inspiration.
Conveniently Timed Distraction  -  Someone or something that unintentionally creates a distraction that occurs at a crucial moment that a character takes advantage of.
Actually Thats My Assistant  -  The assistant looks more distinguished and important than the guy he works for.
Humans Are The Real Monsters  -  Humans are viewed as bastards by other species.
Immortal Breaker  -  Something or someone able to kill being normally immortals.
Cue The Sun  -  Sunrise signals something good.
Useless Useful Stealth  -  The game gives you the option to get by through stealth, which turns out to be more trouble than it's worth.
Evil Counterpart  -  A character who has similarities to a good or not as evil character, but is evil(er).
AI Cronym  -  An artificial intelligence, robot, or advanced computer system whose name is also an acronym pertaining to their purpose.
To Unmasque The World  -  Someone's goal is to remove the Masquerade.
We Were Your Team  -  The Five-Man Band splits when The Heart or The Leader is no longer around to hold them together.
Cats Are Snarkers  -  Either Deadpan Snarkers tend to be cats, or cats tend to be Deadpan Snarkers.
Cowardly Mooks  -  Mooks that will try to run away when they see you or when you harm them.
The Hedonist  -  One who pursues luxury and lustful desires, often at the expense of others.
Dutch Angle  -  Scene(s) filmed on a slight angle.
Reassignment Backfire  -  The Hero bites their Bad Boss in the behind as a direct result of being moved out of the way.
Pick On Someone Your Own Size  -  An adult villain has enmity towards a character half their age.
Wood Chipper Of Doom  -  If there's a wood chipper around, more likely than not someone is getting thrown in there, with messy results.
Archived Army  -  Warriors from different points in time form an army.
Flashback With The Other Darrin  -  An existing scene is refilmed with the character's new actor.
Morning Routine  -  Establishing the protagonist's "normal" by showing us their daily routine.
Discredited Trope  -  A cliché or obsolete trope that should never be played straight in modern works.
Power Of The Void  -  Non-elemental powers based on nothingness.
Apologetic Attacker  -  I'm sorry for beating you up!
Isnt It Ironic  -  People didn't bother to listen to all the lyrics.
Charged Attack  -  Storing energy before unleashing it all at once on a single attack.
The Prima Donna  -  Overbearing, egotistical actor/actress.
Trading Bars For Stripes  -  A prisoner does military service in exchange for avoiding prison time, or for their freedom.
One Person One Power  -  In a fictional setting, individuals are limited to only one ability unique to them.
Potion Brewing Mechanic  -  Mechanics associated with brewing potions in video games.
Wizard Classic  -  Stereotypical Wizards.
Kishotenketsu  -  Traditional East Asian four-act plot structure without a driving conflict.
Enlightened Antagonist  -  The bad guy is an enlightened being or entity.
Seadog Peg Leg  -  Sailor or pirate with a prosthetic leg.
Hates Being Called Cute  -  A cute character hates being called cute.
Underground City  -  An underground city.
Your Other Left  -  Alice tells Bob to go left, Bob goes right instead. "Your Other Left!"
Shovel Strike  -  Shovel used as a weapon.
Superhero School  -  An institute that teaches young superheroes how to use their powers properly.
Good Parents  -  Parents who are good to their children.
The Commandments  -  A short list of simple rules that must be followed.
Orc Raised By Elves  -  Born by evil people, raised by good guys.
Welcome To My World  -  The Trope: Whenever a character experiences what another character has to deal with most of the time.
Heres Johnny Homage  -  A scene or shot made in homage to the famous "Here's Johnny" line from The Shining.
Slippery As An Eel  -  Eels are sly, conniving and untrustworthy creatures.
It Came From Beverly Hills  -  Beverly Hills is so cool that mentioning it in a work's title automatically makes it cooler.
In Medias Res  -  Begin in the middle.
No You Go First  -  Character is about to reveal something important to someone else, but stops after hearing what the other has to say.
Sons Of Slaves  -  A race/culture/ethnicity where slave ancestry is a defining element of their culture.
Unholy Holy Sword  -  An Evil Weapon disguised as a weapon of Good.
Bizarre Alien Psychology  -  Alien minds are weird.
Dialogue Tree  -  Answering others in video games becomes multiple choice, with each answer leading to different dialogue.
Blind Obedience  -  I will obey my superior unconditionally, uncomplainingly, unquestioningly, silently and mindlessly.
Scary Shiny Glasses  -  Character's eyes are intimidatingly obscured by light reflected in their glasses.
Defeat Equals Explosion  -  Enemy is defeated, then explosion ensues.
Poverty For Comedy  -  When Poverty Tropes are Played for Laughs.
Post Modern Magik  -  How would supernatural creatures and magic work in relation to modern technology and scientific understanding of the universe?
Detachment Combat  -  Characters who fight by separating themselves into sections.
POV Sequel  -  A sequel where the previous story is retold from another character's perspective.
Natural Weapon  -  People with claws, stingers etc. don't need an extra-weapon.
No Campaign For The Wicked  -  You can't play as the enemy.
Jigsaw Puzzle Plot  -  This story's pretty complicated; let's feed it to the audience a little bit at a time.
Anxiety Dreams  -  Dreaming that something the dreamer worries will happen, happens.
Swirlie  -  A Bully sticks another kid's head in the toilet for fun.
Fat Slob  -  Fat characters are conveyed as lazy, gluttonous, sloppy, or all three.
Last Kiss  -  The final (if not only) kiss someone makes before their deaths.
Our Zombies Are Different  -  You can call it whatever you want, it's still a zombie.
Murderous Thighs  -  Legs that crush people.
Summoning Artifact  -  Ancient Artifacts that can summon powerful entities.
Religion Is Wrong  -  Humans should Outgrow Such Silly Superstitions and move on to greater, more material things.
Magic Or Psychic  -  Is there a difference between magic and psychic powers?
Schoolyard Bully All Grown Up  -  Former school bully is now a villain.
Insane Proprietor  -  Sellers claiming to be mentally insane as an explanation for their low prices.
Surprise Jump  -  A character is so frightened by something that they jump 10 or 20 feet in the air.
California University  -  A convenient fictional (but real-sounding) college attended by the main cast.
Mood Ring Eyes  -  Character's eye color changes according to mood.
Crystal Spires And Togas  -  A very highly advanced civilization that resembles an elegant ancient civilization, plus technology.
Makeover Torment  -  A masculine guy is humiliated through a girly makeover.
All Deaths Final  -  Even magic or super-science can't bring back those who died.
Already Met Everyone  -  A prequel tries to fit in everything that the original supposedly introduced first.
Snow Means Love  -  Romance in a snowy setting
Absurdly Sharp Blade  -  Absurd Cutting Power achieved just by using a blade that's sharp enough.
Advertisement Game  -  Video games made for the purpose of selling another product.
Pre Rendered Graphics  -  Graphics and cutscenes that are rendered outside the game's own engine, often of a higher-quality.
Bishonen Jump Syndrome  -  Works aimed at males attempt to appeal to girls by making Pretty Boy male protagonists.
Half The Man He Used To Be  -  Victim gets sliced in half.
Pulled From Your Day Off  -  Character has to work on his day off.
Darkest Africa  -  Stereotype where everyone in Africa is uncivilized or a warlord.
Geisha  -  Traditional Japanese female entertainer.
Starter Marriage  -  A first marriage that fizzles within five years.
Flames Of Love  -  Romance represented with a burning passion.
Anger Born Of Worry  -  Being angry at those who put themselves in danger right before being happy that they're unharmed.
Personal Space Invader  -  Enemy that attaches itself onto the player.
Runaway Bride  -  The bride abandons her groom and leaves her own wedding.
Heal Thyself  -  An apply-it-yourself Healing Factor.
Marked Change  -  Visual shorthand for a character tapping into their full power.
Bit By Bit Transformation  -  Transformations change them one body part at a time.
Translation With An Agenda  -  Willful mistranslations used for an ideology.
Step Up To The Microphone  -  Someone else in the band is the lead vocal for this song.
Nocturnal Emission  -  A man ejaculates in bed as a result of an Erotic Dream.
Wreaking Havok  -  When developers like to showcase physics of the game a lot.
Anti Hero Team  -  A group of people consisting of anti heroes.
Long Distance Relationship  -  Relationships that are less close and more far, far away.
Black Is Bigger In Bed  -  Black men have bigger penises than men of other races/ethnicities.
Non Powered Costumed Hero  -  A character that dresses up in a non-standard costume to fight crime/evil or to save people, but has no special powers.
Grin Of Audacity  -  A bold smirk when performing a risky task.
No Bikes In The Apocalypse  -  The characters After the End eschew the world's most common and reliable vehicle for more complicated and less reliable vehicles.
Shape Shifter Showdown  -  A duel between two Shape Shifters.
Soundtrack Dissonance  -  The soundtrack doesn't fit the rest of the scene.
Juggling Loaded Guns  -  Mishandling of guns Played for Laughs.
Dirty Old Woman  -  Elderly women are perverts.
Tattered Flag  -  A tattered flag, the owner is usually a patriotic veteran.
Living Lie Detector  -  Character can tell if someone is lying.
Intended Audience Reaction  -  Deliberately aiming for what are usually unexpected reactions.
Ret Gone  -  A character and all evidence they ever existed was erased from existence.
Repeating So The Audience Can Hear  -  A character repeats unheard or incomprehensible dialogue for the convenience of the audience.
Inspiration Nod  -  A detail in a work that alludes to the source of inspiration. Usually doesn't affect the work's story in any significant way.
Ojou  -  A non-royal princess.
Europeans Are Kinky  -  A sexually liberal European character is contrasted with a less liberal character from somewhere else in the world.
Parental Neglect  -  Parents who don't seem to care about their kids.
Blocking Stops All Damage  -  Blocking literally negates damage, even if it's physically nonsensical.
Deadly Force Field  -  A Force Field that is used for offensive purposes.
You Called Me X It Must Be Serious  -  They called you that just now? Something's wrong.
You Squared  -  Two characters shout "You?!" at the same time.
When All You Have Is A Hammer  -  If you only have one thing (hammer or otherwise), it can do everything.
Papa Wolf  -  Mess with his loved ones, and he will end you.
I Cant Look Gesture  -  Motion made to avoid seeing something unpleasant which provokes fear, anguish, and/or disgust.
I Can Live With That  -  A character admits that they can accept a negative situation (Type 1) or accepts that things aren't as bad as they are (Type 2).
Colorblind Mode  -  Anti-Frustration Feature that adds visual aids designed for colorblind players.
Love It Or Hate It  -  A work is equally loved or hated by people.
Saying Too Much  -  Oops, I accidentally told you something I shouldn't have.
Floral Theme Naming  -  Names that follow a theme from flowers.
Always Close  -  Real-time: You defuse the bomb with two minutes to spare. In the cutscene: You defused the bomb with two seconds to spare.
Garden Of Eden  -  Allusions to the Garden of Eden story, often as a symbol of temptation and paradise lost.
Twilight Of The Old West  -  The Wild West fades away.
Virtual Paper Doll  -  You can customize your character's outfits.
Phony Veteran  -  Character who fabricates or greatly embellishes a history of military service.
Its The Principle Of The Thing  -  A misfortune that's not a big deal to a person becomes a massive injustice to another.
A Dick In Name  -  When a character is named "Dick", he's certainly a jerk, vulgar or perverted person.
Abilene Paradox  -  A group decides to do something that none of them really want, because each person incorrectly thinks it's what everyone else wants.
Fatal Attractor  -  Why does everyone I like always have something wrong with them?
Level 1 Music Represents  -  The music for level one becomes known as the main theme of the game.
Hollywood Spelling  -  No one ever needs to ask "How do you spell that?", unless it's plot-relevant.
Hollywood Jehovahs Witness  -  Really stereotypical Jehovah's Witnesses for entertainment purposes.
Heroic Russian Emigre  -  Anti-bolshevik Russian expats are portrayed positively.
Kid With The Leash  -  The Kid with the Remote Control's servant has a mind of its own.
No Dress Code  -  Characters in High School get away with ridiculously revealing or inappropriate clothing.
And You Thought It Would Fail  -  A work that people expect to flop becomes a smash hit instead.
The Bartender  -  The person who serves drinks and sound life advice to bar patrons.
Hand Of Death  -  Only the killer's hand is seen prior to the reveal of their identity.
Spy Satellites  -  It watches you from space.
Theme Music Withholding  -  Save the glory that is the true theme song for the right moment.
The Paragon Always Rebels  -  The guy leading by example rebels, dragging a whole bunch of others with him.
Spoiler Title  -  Dammit, title, did you really need to spoil what happens this chapter/episode?!
All Or Nothing  -  Either you win something big, or nothing at all.
Hollywood Old  -  A young and attractive actress plays the part of an old woman without alterations to look the character's age.
Last Disrespects  -  Funerals are a place to pay dues to the dead, yet the attendees do anything but.
Continuity Drift  -  Things change as details are filled in.
Not So Stoic  -  The Stoic shows emotions.
Cheaters Never Prosper  -  Those who cheat are always victim to Laser-Guided Karma.
Worst Aid  -  Things you should never do when administering first aid in real life.
Fuuma Shuriken  -  Giant throwing star.
Hates Baths  -  A character hates taking a bath.
High Heel Face Turn  -  When a villainous group has just one woman, then she's the one who will turn good in the end.
Bad Girl Comic  -  Comics about highly sexualised and morally ambiguous female protagonists, with large amounts of fanservice.
Glowing Eyes  -  A character's eyes glow.
Eerie Arctic Research Station  -  A remote lab in an icy cold location as a tension-filled setting.
Signature Mon  -  When one Mon is more iconic to a character then their other Mons.
Recruited From The Gutter  -  Rescuing someone from a crappy life by recruiting them to your cause or organisation.
Amplified Animal Aptitude  -  Unrealistic intelligence presented by domesticated or wild animals.
Geeky Turn On  -  Attraction to nerdiness.
You Cant Fight Fate  -  Being unable to prevent what's been foretold.
Unwanted Spouse  -  Just because you're married to them, doesn't mean you love them.
Queens Puzzle  -  Put eight queens on a chessboard so they can't capture each other.
Ride The Rainbow  -  Rainbows used as transportation.
Eternal Engine  -  Generic Video Game's industrial nightmare level.
Alice Allusion  -  A character named Alice/someone referring to an Alice is/makes a direct or indirect Shout-Out to Alice in Wonderland.
Tinkle In The Eye  -  A baby pees on someone.
The Alcatraz  -  The inescapable prison that characters have to escape from.
Disposable Woman  -  A female character who is killed off purely to justify a male character's quest for Revenge.
Bathing Beauty  -  A character that bathes a lot.
Living Aphrodisiac  -  A character that can control hormones and pheromones, using them to seduce and manipulate others.
Impersonation Exclusive Character  -  All or almost all knowledge about a person is gained through what is shown of their impersonator.
Disadvantageous Disintegration  -  An attack that's impractical because it destroys the loot as well as the enemy carrying it.
Chromosome Casting  -  The characters are either all male or all female.
Great Detective  -  An expert who solves crimes using the power of deductive logic.
Everything Is Racist  -  Anything and everything can potentially be misconstrued as racist or otherwise offensive.
Random Encounters  -  Standard RPG battles you don't see coming.
My Country Right Or Wrong  -  Fighting for and supporting one's country regardless of whether or not one agrees with its actions.
Trauma Induced Amnesia  -  Someone gets amnesia due to either mental or physical trauma.
Keep Circulating The Tapes  -  Good luck trying to get your hands on this work without resorting to legally questionable means.
Already Done For You  -  Your objectives, which you were on your way to do, turn out to be completed by someone else.
Accidental Proposal  -  Alice does something which Bob mistakenly interprets as a marriage proposal.
Theme Serial Killer  -  This Serial Killer has a predictable gimmick as part of their modus operandi.
Apologises A Lot  -  I'm sorry, I'm so sorry...
Music Soothes The Savage Beast  -  Monsters and animals are tamed by music.
Zip Me Up  -  A love interest zips up a woman's dress for her.
Human Ladder  -  A group of people stands on each other so they can climb.
Apron Matron  -  Kneel before mom.
Noob  -  Series: French-made comedy about a Ragtag Bunch of Misfits playing a fictional MMORPG, with 1000% more Deep-Immersion Gaming than the American webseries with a similar premise.
Airplane Arms  -  Look at me! I'm an airplane! WHHHOOOOOOOOSSSSSSSHHHHHHH...
Background Magic Field  -  Magic is treated as a raw natural phenomenon or a kind of atmosphere enclosing a planet or permeating the universe.
Pop Cultured Badass  -  A badass openly fond of and knowledgeable in modern-day entertainment.
Warring Natures  -  A child whose parents are members of different factions currently at war with each other.
Grande Dame  -  Dignified old lady.
Depending On The Artist  -  Multiple artists draw this character, none of them can make a consistent design.
Molotov Cocktail  -  The poor man's incendiary bomb.
Bowling For Ratings  -  An episode where the characters go bowling.
This Is Going To Be Huge  -  History proves this to be false. It fails big time.
From Nobody To Nightmare  -  A character evolves from humble beginnings to terrifying infamy.
Ending Theme  -  The song that plays during the final scene or closing credits of a series.
Freudian Trio  -  One emotional and instinctual character and one impassionately logical character, mediated by a third, balanced character.
Dark Is Evil  -  Dark colors, styles, and themes are often used in the style and appearance of bad guys.
Packed Hero  -  The Hero gets boxed up from fumbling inside machines.
Color Coded Characters  -  Characters with characteristic colors.
Which Restroom Dilemma  -  A character can't decide to use the men's or the women's restroom, or doesn't know which is which.
Ash Face  -  Explosion in the character's face leaves it covered in soot or ashes.
Nobody Can Die  -  Despite the high possibility for death, somehow no character—major or minor—dies in this story.
Placebotinum Effect  -  The Applied Phlebotinum turns out to be a placebo, while the actual power comes from another source.
Feigning Intelligence  -  Someone pretends that he's much smarter than he really is.
Lying Creator  -  Word of God is a lie.
Humanity Ensues  -  A non-human character turns into a human.
Perfect Solution Fallacy  -  If it isn't 100% effective, it's useless.
Let The Past Burn  -  The story ends with a fire destroying the house, along with all it represents.
Neutral Good  -  A character alignment involving goodness. Especially charity (in the Seven Heavenly Virtues sense.)
Evil Matriarch  -  A malevolent and unloving mother.
Climactic Battle Resurrection  -  Previously-incapacitated characters are brought back into action for a final battle.
Two Guys And A Girl  -  A Power Trio with The Hero versus The Lancer, mediated by (and sometimes fighting over) The Chick.
Unprovoked Pervert Payback  -  You weren't being pervy and everyone else knows you weren't. So why'd you still get pummeled?
Extra Y Extra Violent  -  Having an extra Y chromosome makes men aggressive.
Chinese Vampire  -  Or, "jiangshi" for short.
Sex Is Evil And I Am Horny  -  Sex Is Evil, but I want it anyway and you will give it to me!
Ninety Percent Of Your Brain  -  Humans use 10% of their brains. Any more and they'll have superpowers!
Freudian Excuse Is No Excuse  -  A character is told that their past doesn't justify what they're doing now.
Cult Classic  -  A work that may not be commercially popular, but manages to attract a perpetually small fanbase by its ambition, quirks, or the world it created.
Go To Your Room  -  A character, usually a little kid, gets sent to their room for bad behavior and possibly "to think about what they've done."
Achievement Test Of Destiny  -  The test to end all tests.
Ignoring By Singing  -  La la la la la, I'm not listening!
Riddling Sphinx  -  Sphinxes ask riddles.
I Am Very British  -  All non-cockney Brits speak Posh.
Self Sacrifice Scheme  -  When a character planned to sacrifice himself.
The Man  -  The highest worldly authority personified.
Sweater Girl  -  A busty lady in tight sweaters provides Fanservice, without really showing anything.
I Need You Stronger  -  The Big Bad's secret plans require The Hero to be as strong as possible before the endgame.
Doctor Doctor Doctor  -  Multiple people with the same rank greet each other by their title.
Cool Uncle  -  A kid thinks their aunt/uncle is cooler than their real parent.
Back In The Saddle  -  A Retired Badass comes out of retirement.
The Big Race  -  The plot is about a race/races.
Non Lethal Warfare  -  Warfare without explicit death.
Non Answer  -  A dodgy reply to a question.
Bugs Herald Evil  -  The presence of invertebrates indicates a greater evil.
Entropy And Chaos Magic  -  Magic based around probability and destruction. Often primordial and very dangerous.
Panty Thief  -  A character who steals girls' and women's underwear.
Let Me At Him  -  A detective is restrained from attacking the smug guy who did it.
Reality Subtext  -  When Real Life issues mirror the production, but don't significantly affect it.
Lamprey Mouth  -  Jawless mouth.
Attack Pattern Alpha  -  Code word or phrase used to direct forces in battle.
Flying Seafood Special  -  Flying sea creatures
Badass In Distress  -  Wait, did you just kidnap the badass?
Slasher Smile  -  An evil, bloodthirsty grinning Nightmare Face.
Wizards From Outer Space  -  Fantasy Elements in a predominantly Science Fiction setting.
Teacher Student Romance  -  The teacher and student develop a romantic relationship.
Scratch Damage  -  Minimal damage applied on each attack.
Just The Way You Are  -  Turns out they like you better just being yourself and nothing else.
Cradle Of Loneliness  -  A character tenderly holds a treasured keepsake of someone who isn't around to show how sad and lonely they are.
Please Select New City Name  -  A location's name is changed, usually due to political or cultural changes.
Wacky Americans Have Wacky Names  -  Over-the-top names are attached to comedic American characters.
The Syndicate  -  Sinister omnipresent criminal organization.
Win Back The Crowd  -  A series/film has lost its fandom due to Seasonal Rot/Sequelitis or They Changed It, Now It Sucks!, but they were able to do something that made their fandom return.
Slut Shaming  -  Personal attacks over promiscuity.
Law Of Cartographical Elegance  -  The geography of a setting is obviously designed to be map-friendly.
Creator Backlash  -  A creator comes to dislike or even hate a work they created despite its popularity.
Jiggle Physics  -  Simulation of non-rigid objects in a computer.
Cartoon Cheese  -  Cheese in cartoons is yellow, triangular, and full of holes.
Addictive Magic  -  Magic that is addictive.
Every Man Has His Price  -  People will do basically anything if you pay them enough.
Best Of All Possible Worlds  -  A world that's different from the original reality will either suck or morph to match the original reality.
Waddling Head  -  Character is just a head on feet.
The Bore  -  This character can get others bored.
Historical Detective Fiction  -  A detective story which dugs into its time period historically.
Eagleland  -  Foreign impressions of the United States:
Contested Sequel  -  Is the sequel better or worse than previous installments, or at least good in its own right? Fan reactions vary.
The Tape Knew You Would Say That  -  Pre-recorded messages that seem to know what the viewer is thinking before they say it.
You Know Im Black Right  -  Character A casually insults a certain demographic. Character B coldly responds that they are a member of said demographic.
Day Hurts Dark Adjusted Eyes  -  The sunlight hurts your eyes if you've been in the darkness long enough.
Gentleman Snarker  -  He can be very snarky, but so elegantly that it makes him no less of a gentleman.
Animal Themed Superbeing  -  Animal-based superhero or supervillain.
Geek  -  One who overspecialises on a certain subject.
Endless Running Game  -  A genre where the player is always moving forward, and must dodge obstacles for as long as they can.
Inflationary Dialogue  -  Verbal Backspace in numerical reverse.
Wiki Walk  -  Following links on a wiki, ending up far away from your starting place.
Lame Rhyme Dodge  -  Hiding a phrase or insult with something that sounds like what they really said.
Rocket Jump  -  The trope: Firing a rocket at your feet while jumping to propel you higher.
Genetic Engineering Is The New Nuke  -  Genetic engineering replaced radiation as the new Phlebotinum du Jour.
The Consigliere  -  The leader's most trusted advisor.
Word Of Saint Paul  -  Word of God doesn't (or can't, or failed to) confirm this, so someone with close connections does.
Facial Dialogue  -  Communication through facial expression.
Take The Wheel  -  The co-pilot is forced to take control of the vehicle so the pilot can perform a crazy stunt.
No Poker Face  -  A character who sucks at hiding their true emotions.
Emancipated Child  -  A child legally "divorces" from their parents.
This Is My Boomstick  -  Show modern technology to people of the past, usually in a threatening manner of some description.
Make Games Not War  -  Sporting events as a replacement for conventional warfare.
Olympic Swimmer  -  Character is inexplicably able to swim like a pro the moment they get in the water.
Eight Deadly Words  -  If your audience doesn't care about the characters, they won't care about the story.
Cranial Eruption  -  Conspicuous bumps on the head due to a concussion.
Long Hair Is Feminine  -  The longer the hair, the more feminine the character. And vice versa.
Lovable Lizard  -  Lizards are seen as cute and heroic among reptiles.
Only The Chosen May Wield  -  You're The Chosen One? That means this MacGuffin belongs to you!
Enhanced On DVD  -  A movie or TV show gets improved for the home video release.
The The Title Confusion  -  Something has confusion as to whether or not its name/title begins with the word "the"
Adventure Friendly World  -  A setting tweaked to justify the gameplay mechanics and the high adventurer-per-capita ratio.
Hospital Hottie  -  Attractive medical personnel.
Credit Card Plot  -  Standard sitcom plot where a character learns a lesson in excessive spending when he or she obtains a credit card and either gets slapped with debt or maxes the card out when he or she needs it the most.
Arcade Perfect Port  -  An arcade game gets a consumer port that plays exactly like the original.
Exact Eaves Dropping  -  A character happens to eavesdrop right when someone's mentioning crucial information.
Noblewomans Laugh  -  Rich, booming laugh that characterizes a noblewoman or a bitch.
Fantastic Honorifics  -  Honorifics and titles invented for the sake of the story.
Energy Absorption  -  Your energy is now my energy!
Deep Immersion Gaming  -  Gamer characters "become" their avatars.
Dung Fu  -  Poop is your greatest weapon.
Chrome Dome Psi  -  Bald and psychic
Egging  -  The act of throwing eggs at not only houses, but also cars.
Ultraterrestrials  -  A race of aliens supposedly from outer space, who turn out to be from far closer to home...
Porn Names  -  Someone goes by a nickname as a sex worker.
Mad Libs Catchphrase  -  Catchphrase differs slightly each use yet maintains its meaning.
Detachable Lower Half  -  Separate one's lower body.
Kill The Cutie  -  A sweet, lovable character suffers from Character Death.
Parallel Conflict Sequence  -  When a big battle sequence is comprised of 2 or more smaller, less significant fights and/or conflicts all occurring simultaneously.
Meta Fic  -  Self-referential fanfiction with No Fourth Wall.
Amen Break  -  Funky "boom boom cha, boom-cha-boom-cha-boom cha" breakbeat that modern music samples a lot.
Urban Legends  -  An old story people say is true that often turns out false. Usually.
Fighting Fingerprint  -  Fighting style exposes a Secret Identity.
Self Made Orphan  -  Character killed their own parents.
A Storm Is Coming  -  An incoming storm Foreshadows the progress of the plot.
Kubrick Stare  -  Head down, eyes up, wicked smile or grimace.
Disc One Final Boss  -  A character who seems to be the main antagonist, but is not actually the final enemy.
Karl Marx Hates Your Guts  -  Market prices are the same everywhere, so you'll never make a profit by selling goods you bought.
Human Pincushion  -  When a person is ran through with various (usually pointy) objects. Whether or not this is gruesome or kinky depends.
Shaped Like Itself  -  Tautologies that describe themselves as tautologies.
Fighting Down Memory Lane  -  Character uses the opponent's memory as a weapon.
Rules Are For Humans  -  In a video game based on another type of game, the computer ignores the rules.
Attractiveness Isolation  -  A woman is so beautiful that no man dares to ask her out.
No Water Proofing In The Future  -  No futuristic technology is waterproof.
Nasal Trauma  -  Something unpleasant happens to a character's nose.
Vacuum Mouth  -  Extremely powerful inhalation of objects, enemies, etc. Basically Weapons That Suck but with your mouth.
Devil Complex  -  Delusions of devilhood.
People In Rubber Suits  -  Monsters played by humans in costumes, sometimes quite obviously.
Shared Family Quirks  -  Two otherwise different family members share a habit or personality quirk.
Maligned Mixed Marriage  -  Two people of different races/religions/etc. become romantically involved, and friends, family, and/or society don't like it.
The Un Smile  -  A smile that evokes anything but joy.
Athens And Sparta  -  Two locations that contrast each other, with one being peaceful and stable, while the other is grim and harsh.
Toy Disguise  -  A small, non-human character being passed off as a toy of some kind.
Daddy Didnt Show  -  A child expects his or her parent(s) to show up at a major event, but they don't.
Endgame Plus  -  Returning to the penultimate save point after having cleared the game, often to access a new Bonus Dungeon.
Outlived Its Creator  -  An old franchise continues to live on after the death of its creator.
Apple Of Discord  -  One little thing causes arguments among normal friends, for whatever reason.
Newcomer Saves The Day  -  The new member ends up saving everyone on their first adventure together.
Golden Ending  -  The "best" possible outcome in a game with Multiple Endings.
Department Of Child Disservices  -  Social Services exists, but they are either so incompetent, apathetic or downright malicious that it would be better if they didn't.
Band Toon  -  Exactly What It Says on the Tin, and usually centers around popular music bands around a time period.
Literal Disarming  -  A character's arm or arms are cut off to prevent them from being able to wield weapons.
Lyrical Cold Open  -  Songs that start with the lyrics kicking in, sometimes before the rest of the music itself.
Rashomon Style  -  Multiple accounts of the same event disagree with each other.
Official Couple Ordeal Syndrome  -  Life in the Official Couple is hell.
Exposition Break  -  Stop playing the game, there's Exposition to hear!
Barefoot Cartoon Animal  -  An anthropomorphic animal who is barefoot, but otherwise fully-dressed.
Living Prop  -  A character who appears frequently solely as scenery.
Hastily Hidden Mac Guffin  -  Action revolves around the search for something initially hastily hidden in some innocuous object
Magical Girl Warrior  -  Magical Girl meets Super Hero(ine).
Flipping The Table  -  When a character says something really stupid, ridiculous or morally contradictory, so the other flips the table in an awesome fashion as a response of anger to the first character's comment.
Ex Big Bad  -  The Big Bad survives his defeat and stops being the Big Bad.
That Was Objectionable  -  Objecting for no valid reason.
Sparse List Of Rules  -  An apparently long list of rules or similar that the audience only ever learns sections of.
No Indoor Voice  -  ALWAYS YELLING!!
Exposed Extraterrestrials  -  Otherworldly beings don't need clothes.
Enhanced Interrogation Techniques  -  Psychological torture.
Conservation Of Ninjutsu  -  Threat per enemy = 1 / # of Enemies.
Planet Terra  -  In Science Fiction, "Earth" is called "Terra."
Create Your Own Villain  -  It was the hero's fault that a villain became evil in the first place.
Victorious Loser  -  The protagonist loses everything around him/her (even his/her life), but the protagonist's spirit isn't broken and achieves his/her goal.
Humans Are Flawed  -  Humanity's hat is attempting to overcome its own vices so it can Earn Its Happy Ending.
Shot In The Ass  -  The buttocks takes a bullet.
One Hit Kill  -  Immediate death/defeat with a single action.
Glory Hound  -  A Glory Seeker that's willing to use questionable or underhanded methods to get the fame they desire.
Hellhole Prison  -  A penitentiary institution that takes punishment Up to Eleven.
That Makes Me Feel Angry  -  Let me tell you exactly what emotion I'm feeling right now rather than expressing it!
Mundane Afterlife  -  The afterlife is no different from life on Earth, with the exception that it's eternal.
Easy Come Easy Go  -  A character strikes fortune only to give it all back by the end of the episode.
We Have Become Complacent  -  Life has become too comfortable and unprepared for tragedy.
Bounty Hunter  -  A private contractor rewarded by the authorities for killing or capturing those wanted by the law.
Wipe That Smile Off Your Face  -  Someone's mouth is literally removed from their face.
Mainlining The Monster  -  Creating profit from the captive monsters.
The Ending Changes Everything  -  A Twist Ending that changes the very nature of the story, and often makes the viewer confused about what was real and what not.
Tall Dark And Handsome  -  The quintessential description of a (white) man who is supposed to be attractive — tall, dark-haired, and good-looking, often with dark eyes and a healthy (not too pale) complexion.
Bee Afraid  -  Chased by a swarm of angry stinging insects.
Beat Bag  -  A bogus item hawked as something more valuable than the real deal.
One Million BC  -  The time of cavemen and dinosaurs.
Woman Scorned  -  Do your significant other wrong, and you will know Hell.
Gun Nut  -  A character who really likes guns.
Adaptational Intelligence  -  A character is made smarter in an adaptation.
Rich Boredom  -  Being rich sucks and it's boring.
Invincible Incompetent  -  Invincibility equals Incompetent
Chronically Crashed Car  -  A vehicle that keeps getting wrecked as a Running Gag.
Im Taking Her Home With Me  -  Character wants another character because they're cute.
Spiteful Will  -  A person's will consists of one last post-mortem middle finger to their hated peers.
Eleventy Zillion  -  The number's so big, we had to invent a new word.
Sticky Bomb  -  Trick Bomb + Sticky Situation
Amazing Technicolor World  -  It's a colorful world after all.
Better Than A Bare Bulb  -  Extensive Lampshading.
Meta Fiction  -  A work of fiction discussing fiction (including itself).
Get Out Of Jail Free Card  -  The good guys cut the defeated bad guy a break and forgo his punishment.
All Issues Are Political Issues  -  Mundane or irrelevant problems being treated as serious political or social issues.
Narrator All Along  -  The narrator is revealed to actually be one of the characters in the story.
Spy School  -  A training program for spies or assassins.
Hyperventilation Bag  -  A character breathes into a brown paper bag during a panic attack.
The Cutie  -  A sweet, lovable and innocent character.
Balloon Bursting Bird  -  A bird breaks your balloon/inflatable, usually when you're in the air.
So Bad It Was Better  -  When a newer version of a So Bad, It's Good work (be it a remake, sequel, or follow up) ends up becoming So Okay, It's Average.
Meat Moss  -  Flesh growing on walls.
Master Of All  -  A character that excels in all categories, to the extent that specialists are redundant.
One Line Anxiety  -  Character makes a big deal out of an extremely minor role in an in-series production.
So Bad Its Good  -  A work that despite (or because of) its poor quality, manages to be entertaining.
Identifying The Body  -  A relative is asked to identify a body as confirmation of the deceased's identity.
Elixir Of Life  -  An elixir with the ability to restore lost vitality, or even grant true immortality.
British Nazis  -  Nazis (both overtly and in-overtly) played by UK actors.
Ultimate Life Form  -  The perfect being!
Acting Your Intellectual Age  -  Intelligent children act a lot like adults.
Surrogate Soliloquy  -  Conversing to an inanimate object.
Sink The Life Boats  -  Attacking the escaping crew of an already-disabled/destroyed vehicle.
Cypher Language  -  A made-up language that's just like regular English with every letter replaced by a new one.
City Of Spies  -  A city with a high concentration of active and retired secret agents.
Opinion Override  -  People who aren't a part of group X react to an offensive comment or portrayal of that group. Members of group X don't care.
Too Good For This Sinful Earth  -  Kind, pure character dies in a Crapsack World.
Painful Body Waxing  -  Body waxing is excruciatingly painful. Mostly Played for Laughs.
Living Emotional Crutch  -  A character whose presence another character relies on to remain emotionally stable.
Countryside Index  -  Tropes related to farmland and the country.
Flesh Golem  -  A living being made of spare body parts.
Coffin Contraband  -  Hiding things in coffins not intended for them.
Loot Drama  -  Rare, awesome item that players will kill each other to obtain.
Berserk Board Barricade  -  Blocking a door with lots of boards and nails to keep a hostile person out.
Kissing The Ground  -  When a character is so happy to be on the ground, they kiss it.
You Have Failed Me  -  You screwed up, now die.
Sneaky Spider  -  Spiders and spider-themed characters are tricksters or schemers.
Let No Crisis Go To Waste  -  Characters take advantage of a crisis in some way.
Opening The Flood Gates  -  Someone opens a door and is hit by a wave of water from inside.
Company Town  -  A town that is essentially run by a company.
My Hair Came Out Green  -  Hair dye goes wrong!
Fantasy Counterpart Culture  -  Supposedly non-Earthly culture acts suspiciously like a specific one from Real Life.
Windmill Crusader  -  A character fighting against something that doesn't really exist.
Offscreen Teleportation  -  He can get anywhere if he's off-camera for even a split-second.
Series Fauxnale  -  An installment of a TV show, book series, or film franchise that served as a Grand Finale prior to getting uncanceled.
Forgiveness  -  An Aesop about ceasing to hold resentment against a wrongdoer.
Saw It In A Movie Once  -  A character does something odd before explaining that they saw it in a work before.
The Witch Hunter  -  A person who hunts witches.
Feghoot  -  An entire story meant to lead up to one joke, usually a pun.
Popcultural Osmosis Failure  -  Character fails to catch pop culture reference.
Classic Video Game Screw Yous  -  The building blocks of Nintendo Hard.
Four Fingered Hands  -  Four fingers means less time for the artists to draw.
Shooting Lessons From Your Parents  -  A character is or was taught how to shoot by a parent or Parental Substitute.
Moment Of Lucidity  -  A brief moment of sanity in someone who has otherwise lost their mind completely.
In Name Only  -  The only thing tying the adaptation to the original source is the name.
Pitiful Worms  -  Comparing your less-powerful enemies to small, lowly creatures.
Noble Male Roguish Male  -  Two characters portray different aspects of masculinity: the ruggedly manly rogue and the honorable gentleman.
Actually A Good Idea  -  Open acknowledgment In-Universe that an idea is actually brilliant.
Strip Poker  -  Poker where, every time you lose a hand, you lose one of your clothes.
Only Bad Guys Call Their Lawyers  -  The suspect who called his lawyer is a bad guy.
Mirror Self  -  The antithesis of the hero. Often wears black.
Shaking The Rump  -  A character shakes their buttocks for sexual arousal, cockiness, or celebration.
Posthumous Credit  -  A person is credited on a movie or TV show released after their death.
Four Element Ensemble  -  A group of four (or five) units, each associated with a distinct element.
Quality Over Quantity  -  Better stuff over more stuff
Right For The Wrong Reasons  -  His facts are wrong, but the conclusion is correct.
Cowardly Lion  -  Characters that manage to accomplish daunting tasks despite their own fears and doubts.
I Just Want To Be Free  -  A character longs for freedom.
Dogged Nice Guy  -  Persistent friendliness used in the hopes of making the object of a character's affections fall in love with them.
Hairpin Lockpick  -  Picking a lock with a bobby pin.
Royal School  -  A school where someone goes to learn about the ways of royalty.
Sleep Deprivation  -  A lack of sleep either by choice, or because of external factors.
New Job As The Plot Demands  -  Frequent job changes by a character to fill a plot purpose.
Ninja Maid  -  Ass-kicking maid.
Schedule Fanatic  -  A character is obsessed with scheduling everything.
Disabled Character Disabled Actor  -  A character with a disability is played by an actor that actually has that disability.
Aw Look They Really Do Love Each Other  -  Characters who dislike each other share a heartwarming moment.
Faustian Rebellion  -  Someone grants another great power, which the latter eventually uses against the former during a rebellion.
Boss Game  -  No levels, only bosses.
Holier Than Thou  -  A character who is haughty about their morality.
Fetish Fuel  -  Any element of a story that turns someone in the audience on.
Crippling Castration  -  Groin Attack with the explicit purpose to mutiliate or destroy the reproductive organs and/or the ability to procreate.
All Cloth Unravels  -  An accident or something different causes clothes to rip off.
Sheep In Wolfs Clothing  -  Human-turned-monster still keeps enough humanity to work against the monsters.
Crisis Catchand Carry  -  Want to get someone away from danger? Grab them and run away!
Must Make Amends  -  A character makes a huge mistake and then tries to fix things.
Slice And Dice Swordsmanship  -  Hacking and slashing with a thrusting weapon, or vice versa.
Oh My Gods  -  Invoking (a) God's/multiple Gods' name(s).
Theiss Titillation Theory  -  The possibility of Wardrobe Malfunction makes an outfit very sexy.
Scoundrel Code  -  A code of conduct for pirates, thieves and other scoundrels.
Thing O Meter  -  A meter that (supposedly) measures something that usually can't be measured.
Tantrum Throwing  -  Throwing objects around during a tantrum.
Suspiciously Idle Officers  -  It's easy to spot a Dirty Cop in fiction...they're the ones doing the least amount of actual police work.
Our Genies Are Different  -  The original Genie myths couldn't keep the details straight, either.
Inverse Law Of Complexity To Power  -  Simple powers are stronger.
Tainted By The Preview  -  *Sees the preview* ..."ew!"
The Morlocks  -  A race of ghoulish, depth-dwelling humanoids.
Childhood Marriage Promise  -  Two kids promise to marry each other when they grow up.
Griefer  -  They play the game to piss you off.
Giant Space Flea From Nowhere  -  A completely unexpected Boss Battle with little context preceding its arrival.
Ludicrous Precision  -  Ridiculously precise percent estimations.
The Air Not There  -  The physical properties of air are not taken into account when applied to superpowers or technology that would be affected by it.
Obvious Second Choice  -  Something in a work is clearly used due to being the only thing the creator could get.
Babysitter Friendship  -  A relationship in which both the child and the caregiver see each other as pals who greatly look forward to seeing each other.
Shy Shelled Animal  -  Animals with shells are depicted as timid or cowardly.
Eating The Enemy  -  Looks like the best way to beat the enemy is to EAT him!
Hungry Jungle  -  The jungle will literally eat you alive!
Thinly Veiled Dub Country Change  -  The dub says it takes place in the dubbed country. The numerous unedited foreign set pieces say otherwise.
Vader Breath  -  Labored and/or wheezy breathing added to make a character creepier.
Fanservice Extra  -  A very minor character whose single appearance was simply for Fanservice.
The Reptilians  -  Aliens that look like humanoid reptiles.
Stating The Simple Solution  -  Why do it that over-complicated hard way, when we can do it this easy way?
