Train Station Goodbye  -  Two lovers say goodbye as one is about to board a train.
Historical Badass Upgrade  -  Historical Domain Character gets turned into a Memetic Badass because rule of Cool/Funny.
Cop Criminal Family  -  Two characters related by blood with contrasting personalities, where one works in law enforcement, and the other is a criminal.
Romancing The Widow  -  Falling in love with a widower.
Broke Episode  -  A character is temporarily forced to live on little or no income, usually for exactly one episode.
Hollywood Cop Uniform  -  When law enforcement officers in a real place are shown in incorrect uniforms.
Fauxrrari  -  Vehicular lookalike with Serial Numbers Filed Off.
Heroes Prefer Swords  -  When The Hero can be easily identified by being the only one with a sword.
Animal Wrongs Group  -  Prevention of cruelty to all animals (except humans for some) is their number-one priority.
Not His Blood  -  Blood on a character turns out to be somebody else's blood.
Animate Inanimate Object  -  An animated object that is otherwise realistic.
Body Horror  -  Grotesque body structures, human or not.
Advancing Wall Of Doom  -  A gigantic level hazard that you have to flee away from.
Clingy Jealous Girl  -  This is MY man, bitches!!!
Fingerprinting Air  -  In fiction, it's unrealistically easy for the police to find the fingerprints they need for their investigation.
Non Serial Movie  -  A non-canon movie of a TV Series.
Toxic Phlebotinum  -  Phlebotonium that brings great power at great cost.
Redemption Rejection  -  A character is offered a chance to turn from villainy, but refuses.
Redemption Failure  -  Circumstances force a repentant bad guy away from redemption and towards evil again.
Mind Game Ship  -  Manipulative Bastard shipped with the person they screw with.
Empathic Environment  -  Weather reflects the mood.
Unabashed B Movie Fan  -  Liking old B-movies is used to establish a character as having unconventional interests.
Obligatory Swearing  -  Using swear words in an attempt to sound mature.
The Metaverse  -  An explorable internet-ish system.
Mission Pack Sequel  -  Sequel with identical or very similar gameplay to the original, but featuring new levels.
Infinite  -  Mislabeling something that's really big as being limitless.
You Are In Command Now  -  A character is unexpectedly thrust into a position of leadership.
Stripping Snag  -  A piece of clothing gets stuck somewhere, character ends up naked.
Arm Cannon  -  Arm-mounted gun.
Staircase Tumble  -  Falling downstairs. Literally.
Outdated By Canon  -  Once-unexplained element popular in fanfics that gets a definitive, contradicting canon answer much later on.
The Family For The Whole Family  -  A villain who might otherwise be a Knight of Cerebus is too incompetent to be anything more than ineffectually sympathetic.
Mistaken For Undead  -  A character thought to be dead is accused of being The Undead despite not being so.
Navel Window  -  A character's outfit has an opening that only exposes their belly button.
Wedding Episode  -  A work that isn't about weddings has its characters attend a wedding as the premise of an installment.
Smart People Wear Glasses  -  Corrective eyewear signals cognitive prowess.
Flirtatious Smack On The Ass  -  A character flirts with someone by smacking/fondling their rear end.
Oddball Doppelganger  -  A clone or a lookalike of a character who's just a bit...off.
It Cant Be Helped  -  Shit happens.
Dirty Coward  -  A character who selfishly flees at their fears, usually at the expense of others.
Like A Surgeon  -  A non-surgery situation is treated like an actual surgery.
Staged Populist Uprising  -  La Résistance was orchestrated by the Rich and Powerful.
Cherry Blossom Girl  -  Characters (usually female) whose appearance, name, symbolic themes and/or attributes make references to Cherry Blossoms.
Caused The Big Bang  -  In-universe revelation of the Big Bang's origin.
Baby Language  -  Babies have their own language.
Nap Inducing Speak  -  Someone is so boring that people around them can't stay awake.
Vigilante Execution  -  Vigilante Man taking the law into his own hands by killing the suspect in cold blood.
Die For Our Ship  -  How dare you stand in the way of my OTP?! You. Must! DIE!!
Super Move Portrait Attack  -  A close-up shot of the character's face is shown when they are about to use their special attack.
Sitcom Character Archetypes  -  Sitcom characters often tend to be...
Last Wish Marriage  -  The last thing a dying character would do is get married if they still live.
Flashback B Plot  -  A linear secondary story is told through a character's flashbacks alongside their present-day story.
Men Are Better Than Women  -  Men portrayed as the superior sex.
Posthumous Popularity Potential  -  When a creator receives a boost in recognition after their death.
Glasses Pull  -  Remove glasses (or put them on) to emphasize a line of dialogue.
Starfish Aliens  -  Really alien aliens.
Megane  -  A handsome guy who wears glasses.
Dream Apocalypse  -  If everything is somebody's dream, what happens if that somebody wakes up?
Token Human  -  The one and only human in the main cast.
Happiness In Slavery  -  Someone is enslaved, but is perfectly happy that way.
Character Name And The Noun Phrase  -  [Character name] + "and" + [insert noun or Adverbly Adjective Noun here]
First Day Of School Episode  -  A character has their first day of school in some way.
Unsuccessful Pet Adoption  -  Something goes wrong with the pet you just adopted; thus it has to go.
Unicorns Are Sacred  -  Harming a unicorn is a sign of great evil.
Expectation Lowerer  -  You're better than this loser.
Overarching Villain  -  A villain who is around for a major portion, if not all, of the series.
Lipstick Mark  -  Lipstick on your collarbone or cheek reveals unfaithfulness.
Devils Advocate  -  Arguing in defense of the opposing side for the sake of objectivity.
Floorboard Failure  -  The floor gives way under someone or something.
Adopt The Food  -  Turning something you had intended to eat into a pet or adopted child.
Endangered Species  -  Nearly extinct species, usually thanks to over-hunting.
Sleep Cute  -  Two or more close people are sleeping in close proximity innocently.
Foe Romance Subtext  -  Romantic subtext between enemies.
Psychopathic Manchild  -  A crazy person with all the strength/intellect of an adult and the innocence of a child.
Dug Too Deep  -  A mining operation shouldn't be mining there.
Stupid Statement Dance Mix  -  Taking an insignificant line from a story and making a song out of it.
Escaped Animal Rampage  -  Wild animals escape from zoos, laboratories, or other places, and go on a rampage.
Action Hero Babysitter  -  Super Manly Action Hero placed in a traditionally feminine job or situation. Usually Played for Laughs.
Black Cap Of Death  -  God help you if the judge puts on a black hat. Say high to Kevinnote the guy with the hood and the noose on your way out for me.
Stepford Smiler  -  Happy on the outside. Unhappy on the inside.
The Watcher  -  Advises and observes, but does not interfere.
Cutscene Boss  -  When a Boss Battle is replaced with a cutscene or a "Press X to Not Die".
Edge Gravity  -  The invisible force keeping players from making their character walk off edges that would spell certain death.
Living In A Furniture Store  -  Sitcom houses are always squeaky clean.
Retcon  -  Previously established story events and/or facts get removed or rewritten.
Stepping Out For A Quick Cup Of Coffee  -  Da Chief "accidentally" helps a third party break procedure.
Vindicated By History  -  Something that was unpopular when it originally came out, but has become more popular as time went on.
Crazy Prepared  -  Ready for anything. ANYTHING.
Goddamned Boss  -  This Boss Battle isn't hard, but incredibly annoying.
Go Through Me  -  Weak character steps between a powerful attacker and his foe.
I Just Knew  -  Someone already knew something before being told beforehand.
Sphere Of Power  -  A circle or sphere that shows lots of power.
The Real Remington Steele  -  The false alias a character creates turns out to be a real person.
Gratuitous Ninja  -  Ninja inserted in any situation just for the Rule of Cool.
Bang Bang BANG  -  Handguns have BASS!
Beady Eyed Loser  -  Beady Eyes / Black Bead Eyes = Social Outcast.
Ominous Visual Glitch  -  Wait, why'd the screen just... oh shit.
Pet Interface  -  A sidekick (usually a pet) is used as a guide in the virtual world.
Third Wheel  -  One character is hanging around a couple.
Ludicrous Gift Request  -  A character (usually a Spoiled Brat) wants something that is impossible to get.
Blatant Lies  -  Lies so obvious they lack even a shred of plausibility.
Hero On Hiatus  -  The main character is temporarily out of action.
Slave Race  -  An entire race of people are Made a Slave.
Machine Worship  -  Worship of a machine.
Appeal To Force  -  Character can ignore the rules, since they have coercive force on their side.
Sincerest Form Of Flattery  -  Word of God admits Leader-Following.
Robotic Psychopath  -  Ridiculously Human Robots with a thirst for blood.
Girly Bruiser  -  The Girly Girl can be just as much of an Action Girl as the Tomboy!
You Have GOT To Be Kidding Me  -  You're doing WHAT? Seriously?
Supporting Harem  -  Boy Meets Girl. They fall in love. (And there are also some other girls who fall in love with him.)
Christmas Creep  -  Christmas gets advertised too early in the year.
Iconic Sequel Character  -  Iconic characters who weren't in the first installment.
Evil Brunette Twin  -  The Evil Twin has darker hair.
The Scrooge  -  Rich cheapskate.
In The Name Of The Moon  -  Excuse me while I spout this Catchphrase before I kick your ass.
Secret Test Of Character  -  To pass the test, do this bad thing!
Hard On Soft Science  -  You call that science? HA!
Best Served Cold  -  A character who was originally unable to take revenge against their enemy bides their time until their chance arrives.
Hollywood Police Driving Academy  -  Cops can't drive.
Sports Dad  -  Father who wants his children to play sports instead of their other hobbies.
Inkblot Cartoon Style  -  Cartoon style prevalent in the 1920s and 1930s.
Some Call Me Tim  -  Somebody with a crazy name has a simpler name to call them by.
MST 3 K Mantra  -  Complaining about minor inconsistencies ruins the show for everyone.
Curiosity Is A Crapshoot  -  Being curious is going to end up either really bad or really good for you.
Emergency Presidential Address  -  Leaders address the public during emergency situations, for better or worse.
New Era Speech  -  Villain talks about how amazing everything is going to be.
Vice President Who  -  The political second-in-command is considered a nonentity.
Karmic Jackpot  -  No good deed goes unrewarded.
Internal Deconstruction  -  The work starts deconstructing its own signature tropes.
Mana Drain  -  Siphoning magic from the enemy to the user.
Recurring Extra  -  A character who is in no way important to the plot or the other characters, but they keep popping up anyway.
Lady Drunk  -  An older woman whose alcoholism symbolises how bitter, jaded and worn down from life she's become.
Take That Tit For Tat  -  When a work offhandedly insults another work, and then that work insults back.
Gender Neutral Writing  -  A clever way to hide gender.
Press X To Die  -  A gameplay mechanic that only and blatantly exists to have the player harm themself.
Nobody Here But Us Birds  -  Character makes animal noises as a signal or in an attempt to hide.
Mundane Mac Guffin Person  -  A Living MacGuffin sought after for some mundane ability or quality they have.
Instant Roast  -  An animal killed via incendiary means will instantly turn into cooked meat.
Sexy Scandinavian  -  A hot, exoticized Scandinavian.
Scripted Event  -  Cutscenes minus the cut.
Eldritch Location  -  Really, really, really weird place.
Not Safe For Work  -  Trope: Viewing this could get you in trouble in mixed company.
Self Made Superpowers  -  A scientifically gifted character gives themselves innate powers on purpose.
Disgusting Public Toilet  -  No one who used that toilet owned it, so no one who used it cared if they made it disgusting.
No Yay  -  When Subtext leads to Squick.
Rule Of Personification Conservation  -  If characters aren't human, there's usually a reason why.
Hot Sub On Sub Action  -  Submerged submarine battle.
Blind Weaponmaster  -  They can't see you, but they can still kick your ass.
Second Person Attack  -  An attack shown through the eyes of the victim.
Archive Binge  -  Going through an entire series in a short period.
Battle Chant  -  The troops or team start chanting before a battle or competition.
Hesitant Sacrifice  -  Faced with dying for the greater good, the hero breaks down emotionally.
Rich In Dollars Poor In Sense  -  Rich people can't even grasp simple concepts like lower class people would.
Powers As Programs  -  Superpowers made equippable, replicable and/or transferable.
Super Persistent Missile  -  Homing missile that absolutely will not stop, ever, until you're dead.
Hover Bike  -  A motorbike that floats off the ground.
He Knows About Timed Hits  -  Video game characters explain the game's controls.
Superpower Disability  -  Character with a super power is given a disability as a result.
Thoughtcrime  -  Even if you don't physically do anything, simply engaging in subversive thought is a punishable crime.
Common HTTP Status Code  -  References to HTTP codes, like 403 Forbidden or 404 Not Found, often as Genius Bonus.
Crossover Combo Villain  -  A crossover between two franchises means their villains will crossover and combine, too.
Sampling  -  Using part of someone else's music in your own.
The Nicknamer  -  Someone who gives nicknames to other people.
Beware The Silly Ones  -  The Plucky Comic Relief can kick your ass.
I Am A Monster  -  A self-loathing character believes themself to be a monster.
Deus Exit Machina  -  Prolonging the plot by writing the most powerful character out of the story for the duration of the episode or story arc.
Sliding Scale Of Gameplay And Story Integration  -  How well do the gameplay rules get along with the story rules in a video game?
Technician Versus Performer  -  Accurate play vs Fun play.
The Unmasqued World  -  Hidden abnormal events become apparent to the world.
Rotten Rock And Roll  -  Rock music tends to be associated with villains.
Adaptational Villainy  -  A character is more of a villain in an adaptation than they were in the original material.
Hero Tracking Failure  -  Hero is always one step ahead of villain's gunfire.
Affirmative Action Legacy  -  The next to take up the mantle will be female or a minority.
A Fete Worse Than Death  -  A party is held for the killing of someone.
Convicted By Public Opinion  -  The public has already decided that a suspect is guilty.
An Ass Kicking Christmas  -  Epic Battle occurs during Christmas Time.
Shape Dies Shifter Survives  -  Significantly damaging someone in an altered form undoes their transformation and (at least temporarily) prevents them from taking that form again.
Cops Need The Vigilante  -  Sometimes superheroes are better equipped to deal with the situation than law enforcement.
Rule Fifty  -  Crossovers are inevitable for any series.
Flip Flop Of God  -  The creators can't make up their mind.
Toast Of Tardiness  -  You're running Late for School, so without time for a proper breakfast you run to school with breakfast toast in your mouth.
Shaggy Frog Story  -  Moral of the story: this story makes absolutely no sense. And the frog? Wasn't so shaggy.
Living With The Villain  -  The hero and the villain spend a lot of time under the same roof, usually due to Secret Identities.
Third Person Seductress  -  A third-person player character who is also designed for sexual titillation.
Sophomore Slump  -  Season 1 rules. Season 2 sucks. Season 3 rules again.
Equipment Based Progression  -  The player in a game becomes more powerful by finding or being given items rather than earning XP.
Randomly Gifted  -  A character gets Magic and Powers with seemingly no genetics or any outside influence involved.
I Am Not Left Handed  -  I was holding back. Now I won't.
Comatose Canary  -  A key witness who cannot talk because they are in a coma.
Ambiguous Situation  -  Putting a trope into play, but keeping the audience guessing as to which one.
Adrenaline Time  -  The scene changes speed as the action progresses.
What Did I Do Last Night  -  You do some weird things when you're drunk, and you usually don't remember it.
Gayngst Induced Suicide  -  Committing or at least attempting suicide over Gayngst.
Shoot The Dangerous Minion  -  Villain kills his strongest and most competent minion.
Bastard Understudy  -  Seems to serve villain loyally; actually biding his time.
Vlog Series  -  Fictional video blog.
What Measure Is A Non Human  -  When the line between human vs. non-human life — and the value thereof — starts to get blurry.
Nemesis As Customer  -  Problems arise when a worker's next customer is someone they hate.
Surveillance As The Plot Demands  -  The bad guys have cameras everywhere.
Worlds Smallest Violin  -  Your sorrow is exaggerated, let me point this out.
Separated At Birth  -  Twin siblings meet again after being separated from each other when they were born.
Power Nullifier  -  Something that turns off superpowers, or otherwise renders them useless.
Stock Yuck  -  Eeew, what is this green stuff? I'm not eating it!
With Catlike Tread  -  Improbably loud and noisy stealth.
Suppressed Rage  -  When someone is angry but shows it through subtle ways.
Blood Splattered Wedding Dress  -  A womans wedding dress becomes stained
Big Fun  -  Big, fat, likable character.
Stock Dinosaurs  -  Dinosaurs (and other prehistoric beasts) that appear in fiction more often than the others.
The Maiden Name Debate  -  A soon-to-be married woman has a hard time deciding whether to keep her own last name or change to her new spouse's last name.
Continuity Snarl  -  Conflicting plot lines running at the same time.
Put Them All Out Of My Misery  -  A villain wants to end his misery by killing everyone.
Fantastic Arousal  -  An erogenous zone is somewhere else besides the obvious.
Chekhovs Volcano  -  If a volcano is shown, it will erupt. Otherwise it would've been just an ordinary mountain or island.
The Exile  -  A character is forced to leave the city, state, or county and never return as punishment.
Short Run In Peru  -  A work that is shown outside of its home country first.
Fast Roping  -  When elite soldiers slide down a rope from an aviation vehicle, to join in a simple, millitary-themed battle.
Weak Willed  -  Easy to brainwash.
Little Miss Con Artist  -  Cute little girl who is also a thief.
Elite Army  -  A small army composed of really powerful soldiers.
Omega Ending  -  An ending in a video game that is only unlocked after you clear all other endings.
Loving A Shadow  -  Being in love with the idea of someone rather than the actual person.
Enslaved Tongue  -  You no longer have any control over your voice. Someone else does.
Antidisestablishmentarianism  -  A long word meaning "opposition to separation of church and state", often used as an example of a very long word.
Trigger Happy  -  GUNS! GUNS! AHAHAHAHAHA! I LOOOOOOOOOOVE GUNS!!!!!
Protagonist And Friends  -  A title that consists of "[Main character's name] and Friends".
Bully Brutality  -  Bullies who want to severely injure their victims.
Monty Haul  -  Loot is plentiful and easy to grab.
Reconstruction  -  Making a trope valuable again after learning the lessons from Deconstruction.
Railroad Baron  -  The owner of a large railroad.
Sibling Yin Yang  -  Siblings who have opposite traits to each other.
What The Heck Is An Aglet  -  The plastic or metal (usually plastic) tip on a shoelace.
Clickbait Gag  -  Parodying attention-grabbing techniques used on sensationalistic content.
Promotional Powerless Piece Of Garbage  -  A useless Revenue Enhancing Device solely valued for its rarity.
Sky Face  -  A character's face is shown in the sky.
Doorstop Baby  -  A baby is abandoned on a doorstep.
Extended Disarming  -  Holy...where were you hiding all of those weapons?!
Ignorance Is Bliss  -  Somebody uses someone to make or do something by lying about what exactly it is that they're doing.
Platonic Kissing  -  Two characters kiss on the mouth for platonic reasons.
Alternate Self  -  It's the same person, but in a different timeline or alternate universe and leading a different life.
Screw Your Ultimatum  -  A villain's ultimatum gets thrown back in his face pretty much the instant it leaves his mouth.
Genre Roulette  -  The story is a mixture of different genres.
When You Snatch The Pebble  -  A final test that looks easier than it really is.
Mobile Shrubbery  -  Sneak around by carrying your hiding spot with you.
Improbable Aiming Skills  -  A demonstration of ludicrous accuracy with ranged weapons.
Fake Nationality  -  An actor of one nationality is playing a character from another one.
Our Sphinxes Are Different  -  The original Sphinx myths couldn't keep the details straight, either.
Contagious Cassandra Truth  -  When the Cassandra Truth is subverted, the person who believes it now has the same problem.
Wizarding School  -  A school where people learn magic.
Coconut Meets Cranium  -  Coconuts will have an unusually high chance of falling upon people's heads, often played for laughs.
Have A Nice Death  -  The game plays your death for laughs. Losing is fun!
Be Careful What You Wish For  -  A character's wish is granted, and character regrets making it.
An Axe To Grind  -  Using an axe as a weapon.
Klingon Scientists Get No Respect  -  Someone who doesn't follow the quirk of their people is looked down upon, despite their job being essential to society.
Bait And Switch Lesbians  -  You think it's a lesbian relationship, but really it's just friendship.
Balanced Harem  -  No Official Couple, many girls have the same prominence.
Impossible Task  -  An exceedingly-difficult, if not impossible, task given by someone simply because they don't expect it to be completed.
Blood On The Debate Floor  -  A physical fight during legislative meetings.
Who Needs Overtime  -  Climactic sports games in fiction usually end just before going overtime per The Law of Conservation of Detail.
Second Coming  -  Trope: Jesus returns as prophesied.
Lying To Protect Your Feelings  -  Making up a lie to make sure a loved one does not lose hope.
Pose Of Supplication  -  On your knees, slouched over, with palms on the floor: The pose of hopelessness.
Furry Webcomics  -  Furry Comics ON THE INTERNET!
Penultimate Outburst  -  One more outburst like this, and the judge will clear the courtroom. Usually there aren't any more.
Shirtless Scene  -  A scene featuring a man without a shirt, especially for manservice.
Love Before First Sight  -  Falling for someone you've yet to meet.
Closer Than They Appear  -  That mirror that makes things look like they're further away? It's reflecting something you wish was further away.
Living Is More Than Surviving  -  A character learns that there is more to life than just surviving.
Living Drawing  -  Paintings, drawings, or other forms of two-dimensional art that are alive.
Space Is An Ocean  -  Space travel is treated like sailing an ocean.
Back To The Early Installment  -  In a series with time travel, the main characters eventually go back to the events of the first installment.
Impossibly Compact Folding  -  A large object folds up to be much smaller, or a small object expands to be much larger, than is possible.
Full Potential Upgrade  -  The Hero is too powerful for normal weapons.
Cavalry Betrayal  -  Apparent rescuers attack the heroes.
Do Unto Others Before They Do Unto Us  -  If we don't use this weapon, someone else will get their hands on it and use it.
Sidequest Sidestory  -  Sidequests with their own Story Arcs.
Unfolding Plan Montage  -  The scene of the hero explaining the plan is interpliced with flash-forwards to the team enacting the plan.
The Radio Dies First  -  In order to increase dramatic tension, long-range communications equipment will be put out of commission early in the story.
Death By Adaptation  -  A character who survives in the original work dies in the adaptation.
Your Little Dismissive Diminutive  -  Dismissing an opponent by referring to them (or their accomplishments) as "little".
Plot Mandated Friendship Failure  -  Just before the third act after losing everything else, the protagonist's best friend leaves him/her.
Get Out  -  Out. Now.
Typewriter Eating  -  Eating and making sounds like a typewriter.
Funny Character Boring Actor  -  Hilarious onscreen, not so exciting offscreen.
Jumping On A Grenade  -  A character performs a Heroic Sacrifice by landing on top of a thrown grenade.
Our Slashers Are Different  -  A work that explains the "rules" of immortal Slasher Movie villains.
Instant Death Bullet  -  One bullet makes you drop dead.
From Stray To Pet  -  People adopt a stray animal.
Sand Worm  -  A giant worm that "swims" underground.
Embarrassing First Name  -  A first name that causes embarrassment for the holder.
Ignored Aesop  -  A character summarizes what they've learned and follows up with something that showed that they never learned anything at all.
Native Guide  -  A local who serves as a guide to an area for an outsider.
Locked Door  -  Stock Video Game Puzzle where a locked door blocks your path and you need to get a key to open it.
Deleted Role  -  An actor's scenes are cut out in the final edit of a film.
Queer Character Queer Actor  -  An LBGTQ character is played by an LBGTQ actor.
Up Up And Away  -  Superheroes put their arms out forward while they fly because it looks cool.
Sentient Vehicle  -  Vehicles as living beings.
No Sex Allowed  -  Enforced sexual abstinence.
Medium Awareness  -  Characters know they're in a game/movie/comic/website/etc and take advantage of it.
Artistic License Military  -  Inaccuracies in military training, procedures, command structure, or practices are ignored in favor of telling the story.
Wheel O Feet  -  Rapidly moving feet depicted as an ellipse under the torso.
Cock A Doodle Dawn  -  When the sun rises, a rooster crows.
Widow Witch  -  Old women that live alone are seen as witches to everybody else.
A Good Name For A Rock Band  -  A strange name that would fit a band.
I Am X Son Of Y  -  Someone boasts "I am [their name], son/daughter of [one or both their parents' names]!"
Vague Age  -  Just how old is that guy?
Pressure Plate  -  A switch that requires someone (or something) to stand on it to work.
Hellish Horse  -  Totally scary horses.
Chaotic Neutral  -  A character alignment involving freedom and individuality.
Princess In Rags  -  Princess has to run with the commoners against her wishes.
Grapes Of Luxury  -  Grapes — along with other small foods — as a shorthand for luxury and hedonism.
Am I Just A Toy To You  -  Alice confronts Bob whether their relationship is serious or not.
Duck  -  Use of the homonym "duck" for humor value.
Prayer Of Malice  -  A character prays to a deity to be cruel and petty.
White Gang Bangers  -  Gangs that have a white background.
Hit The Ground Harder  -  Avoiding falling damage by accelerating to faster than terminal velocity.
Hollywood Atheist  -  Atheists are portrayed as jerkasses who hate religion and its adherents.
Not Too Dead To Save The Day  -  Dead or "dead" person comes back just in time to save the day.
Our Hippocamps Are Different  -  Equines with mermaid-like fish tails, and potentially other piscine traits.
Designer Babies  -  Children are born whose embryo was altered or designed for particular (usually "better") traits.
Evil States Of America  -  The United States as an antagonist.
Attack Backfire  -  An attack used against a character turns out to have positive effects for the character.
Tragically Misguided Favor  -  Doing an uncalled-for favor for your loved one leads to a disaster.
Still The Leader  -  Someone insists they're the leader despite someone else in the group doing more leader-like things.
Clothing Reflects Personality  -  A character's clothing perfectly suits their personality.
Fresh Clue  -  A clue that someone was here not too long ago.
Depleted Phlebotinum Shells  -  Our bullets work better on monsters. MUCH BETTER!
Five Races  -  Five 'stock' races of sapient beings frequently found in fantasy works: the robust race; the mystical race; the human analogue; the idealized human analogue; and the lighthearted race.
Sophisticated As Hell  -  Characters who mix highbrow and lowbrow language.
Babysitting Episode  -  An episode where a character babysits someone.
Tempting Apple  -  Apples are used to symbolize temptation.
Cowboy Bebop At His Computer  -  An official source gets very basic facts wrong about a work.
Elvis Lives  -  Elvis Presley in fiction isnt dead, hes actually alive.
Forced Tutorial  -  An unskippable tutorial level.
Thin Dimensional Barrier  -  Location where the wall between dimensions can be easily passed through.
Not So Extinct  -  A species originally thought to be extinct turns out to not be extinct after all.
Low Angle Empty World Shot  -  Shooting from below to save from having to clear out the background.
Beard Of Sorrow  -  Stubble/beard means sadness.
Slippery Skid  -  A person slips on something laid out to slip on.
Gods Need Prayer Badly  -  A god's power is proportional to the strength of the belief in him.
Ice Palace  -  A castle that either froze over, or is made of ice to begin with.
Parody  -  A mockery of some other artistic work, sometimes affectionate.
Self Referential Track Placement  -  A song's placement in the tracklist corresponds or alludes to its title.
Flaming Meteor  -  Meteors depicted as being fiery boulders.
Earthquake Machine  -  A machine that causes earthquakes.
Off Bridge Onto Vehicle  -  Someone who's on the run jumps off a bridge at the right time so that they land on a passing vehicle and escape.
Meta Casting  -  An actor portrays a character that has similar qualities to the actor in Real Life.
Indy Escape  -  Your only option is to run straight away from an unstoppable threat.
Common Law Marriage  -  A couple live together for years and may have children together but aren't formally married for one reason or another.
Bad Ol Badger  -  Badgers portrayed as violent, ferocious, or straight-up foul-tempered.
Cerebus Call Back  -  It was cute or funny before, but in this situation it's serious.
Macho Masochism  -  I WILL CHOP MY OWN ARM OFF TO PROVE WHAT A BADASS I AM!
Career Revealing Trait  -  A character has a distinctive feature or habit that gives away their profession (former or current).
Delayed Diagnosis  -  A character has some sort of illness or disorder, but they aren't initially diagnosed until later.
Mistaken For Romance  -  When the love between two people is mistaken by others for romantic love.
Asian Cleaver Fever  -  When a character, often of East Asian descent, incorporates knife acrobatics and general theatrics into the process of cooking and serving patrons.
Real Time Timeskip  -  The amount of time passed between the release of two installments of a work is the same that passed in-universe.
Walk The Plank  -  An old-fashioned pirate punishment.
Malfunction Malady  -  Superpowers go crazy, don't work, or do something different if the person is sick/injured/pregnant/whatever.
Super Doc  -  A Do-Anything Doctor.
Token Wizard  -  The only spellcaster in a team of Muggles, Badass Normals and Science Heroes.
Archaeological Arms Race  -  An arms race involving the use of Lost Technology from past civilizations.
Timeline Altering Mac Guffin  -  The MacGuffin that causes an Alternate Timeline.
Murder In The Family  -  Killing someone you happen to be related to, aka Familicide.
What Do You Mean Its For Kids  -  Works marketed towards children may contain content or subject matter that's considered more adult (whether intentionally done or not).
Save Your Deity  -  It is you who have to save your God, not the other way around!
Fratbro  -  College-aged male who loves drinking, partying, and sex.
Beware The Living  -  A Zombie Apocalypse story where Humans Are the Real Monsters and a bigger threat to each other than the zombies.
Alan Smithee  -  A pseudonym a director/producer/actor goes under to avoid being associated with a work.
Tim Taylor Technology  -  Broken? Just give it MORE POWER!
Guys Are Slobs  -  A real man should be vulgar, slovenly and repulsively dirty.
Everyone Is Jesus In Purgatory  -  Everything can be seen as symbolism.
Nuclear Candle  -  A light source provides far more illumination that it logically would.
Evil Poacher  -  Villain illegally hunts wildlife.
Trope Enjoyment Loophole  -  When a use of your Pet-Peeve Trope doesn't hit your Berserk Button... or when your Favorite Trope does.
Author Phobia  -  The author's fears take form in their fiction.
Everytown America  -  A generic-looking, and often close-knit town, with as many features as the plot requires.
Fighter Launching Sequence  -  See your planes scramble for visual appeal.
Agents Dating  -  When agents (secret agents, police agents, etc.) go on a date.
Fanservice Faux Fight  -  Characters (usually female) engage in a fight for the sole purpose of being Ms. Fanservice.
Too Fast To Stop  -  Just can't brake.
Villain In A White Suit  -  Villain's sophistication and managerial position is emphasized by wearing all-white formal clothing.
Revenge Before Reason  -  Getting your vengeance, even if it's detrimental to you and/or those you care for.
Muggles Do It Better  -  Mundane technology beats phlebotinum.
Massive Numbered Siblings  -  A character has a remarkably large number of siblings—there are typically five or more kids in the family.
Accuse The Witness  -  A witness in a court case is accused of perpetrating the crime.
In Your Nature To Destroy Yourselves  -  Humans will drive themselves extinct.
Our Liches Are Different  -  Undead sorcerer, phylactery may or may not be included.
Cuteness Equals Forgiveness  -  A person does something bad, but gets away with it because they're cute.
Deconstructive Parody  -  Parodying a work by taking its tropes, plot devices, and character traits to their logical conclusion, showing them realistically, or exaggerating them to laughably ridiculous levels.
Scary Flashlight Face  -  Shining a portable light source upwards from under your chin makes a scary face.
I Just Want To Be Loved  -  A character wants to be loved by others more than anything.
Ships That Pass In The Night  -  Shipping characters who haven't really had much contact with each other in canon.
Digital Destruction  -  Remastering that damages visual and audio quality of a work rather than improving it.
Overly Long Hug  -  A hug that goes on a little too long.
Tar And Feathers  -  Covering someone with tar and feathers in some manner.
Fantastic Voyage Plot  -  A plot that involves a character travelling within somebody else's body.
Not Allowed To Grow Up  -  In Long Runner stories, child characters don't ever age.
Cutlass Between The Teeth  -  Holding or even wielding a bladed weapon between one's teeth.
Janitor Impersonation Infiltration  -  Getting into the place disguised as a maintenance employee.
Distress Call  -  An emergency message sent so the crew can be saved; used as a plot structure where the heroes must respond to the call.
Step Into The Blinding Fight  -  The tactical use of blinding your enemy to shroud one's attacks.
Now What  -  The premise is resolved without a satisfying conclusion.
Dangerous Sixteenth Birthday  -  Turning sixteen puts the character in danger.
Ret Canon  -  Elements from the adaptations of a work start to make their way into official canon.
Phosphor Essence  -  A character innately glows to emphasize their power or their purity.
Meatgrinder Surgery  -  Flagrantly careless surgery that still manages to get positive results (mostly).
Morally Ambiguous Doctorate  -  An evil or otherwise morally questionable character has the title "doctor."
Enemy Mime  -  When mimes are portrayed as villains.
For Want Of A Nail  -  One small change starts a major event.
Touched By Vorlons  -  Character gains special powers via contact with a Sufficiently Advanced Alien.
Wall Master  -  An enemy that remains hidden until you're within its vicinity.
The Theocracy  -  The church (or similar religious institution) basically runs the nation.
Stealth In Space  -  How characters in space go undetected.
That Satisfying Crunch  -  There's just nothing as satisfying as smashing something (even and especially a skull) to bits.
Impossible Insurance  -  An insurance with conditions which seem impossible to fulfill.
Applied Mathematics  -  Any statement, usually involving multiple objects + Mathematics = This trope
This Is My Human  -  A pet acting like they're the one who owns the human.
Salt The Earth  -  Destroying a city/country so completely that rebuilding it becomes almost impossible.
Male Frontal Nudity  -  OMG, PENIS!!! Call the police!!!
Battle Of Wits  -  Contests and feats of intelligence, deception, planning and manipulation.
The Bro Code  -  A set of unspoken rules between guys.
Oddly Small Organization  -  An organization, heroic or villainous, with far fewer members than one would think.
Bros Before Hoes  -  Putting friends before a love interest.
Floating Water  -  When water defies gravity, usually taking various shapes.
Candlelit Ritual  -  Ritual Magic set to candle light for added spookiness.
Motherly Scientist  -  A scientist who's motherly/fatherly to the subject(s).
All Gays Are Pedophiles  -  The assumption that a gay person is attracted to children of the same sex.
Actionized Sequel  -  For the next installment, the action is amped up.
Accidental Athlete  -  Someone discovers their athletic ability while doing something else.
Disabled Love Interest  -  The love interest is disabled.
The Empath  -  Someone who can sense others' emotions.
Half Remembered Homage  -  A parody, homage, or adaptation whose creator deliberately avoided (re)watching the original work so they'll be more different.
Original Character  -  A completely new character in a fan-based work.
Brand Names Are Better  -  Bigger companies make any given product better, right?
Hundred Percent Heroism Rating  -  Fame earning game mechanic that makes the Non Player Characters in a game respect you.
The Jail Bait Wait  -  Waiting until someone is of a given age before marrying or sleeping with them.
Super Smoke  -  A character has the power to turn into cloud of smoke or other gas.
Big Good  -  Most valuable member of the good guys.
The Journey Through Death  -  A character who has died finds themselves in another place, a land through which they must journey in order to fully pass on.
Hordes From The East  -  Barbarian invaders from somewhere in the east. Horse archers optional.
Omniglot  -  Unnatural fluency in many languages.
Kids Are Cruel  -  Children are stereotyped as prone to bullying others.
Semantic Superpower  -  A power based more on interpretation than anything more logical.
Princess Phase  -  All women want to be princesses at some point.
Origins Episode  -  Installment of a series that explains the origin of a previously established character.
Dashed Plot Line  -  A plot with large (over a year) time gaps between individual chapters.
Refuse To Rescue The Disliked  -  A character refuses to save someone they don't like.
Paper Cutting  -  Weapons grazing their targets, causing superficial wounds.
Majority Share Dictator  -  Owning 51% (or a similar small majority) of a company's stock gives you absolute power in the organization.
After The End  -  Story takes place after civilization falls.
Evil Sounds Deep  -  Deep voices just scream villainy.
Roaring Rapids  -  The part of the game where you get dragged through fast water at top speed.
Name And Name  -  Title follows the format "Main Character A and Main Character B".
Spin Offspring  -  Children get their time in the limelight.
Cry Laughing  -  One's laughter degrades into crying.
Atrocious Alias  -  Character's self-chosen name inspires laughter.
Maybe Magic Maybe Mundane  -  Ambiguously supernatural occurrings.
Tragic Ice Character  -  An emotional, sympathetic, and/or tragic character who's associated with cold, ice, and snow.
Empty Promise  -  Saying things are OK when the situation is black to keep someone going rather than breaking down.
Public Domain Character  -  Nobody owns these characters, so anyone can use them.
Invulnerable Attack  -  You cannot be interrupted while performing this move.
Sexbot  -  A robot, often Always Female, and often used for sexual purposes.
Philosophical Choice Endings  -  Multiple endings where the player takes a stand on a tricky philosophical or ethical issue.
Not Completely Useless  -  An item that's useless... Except in one specific situation.
War For Fun And Profit  -  Instigating a war for one's own material benefits.
Villain Takes An Interest  -  The Hero's Arch-Enemy tries for a Mentor role.
Smite Me O Mighty Smiter  -  Challenging a higher power to actually do something.
Death March  -  Captives are transported on foot to a new location, and survival is optional.
Precision Guided Boomerang  -  Boomerangs or projectiles with similar properties will always come back to you, no matter what.
Mommas Boy  -  1. Positive portrayal: A man that dearly loves his mother.
Mythpunk  -  Punk Punk Fairy Tales in modern day.
Adaptational Nonsapience  -  A sapient character is turned nonsapient in an adaptation.
Fun Size  -  Smaller = Cuter
Cut His Heart Out With A Spoon  -  Odd, humorous threat.
Humble Beginnings  -  The surprisingly simple origin of a Cash Cow Franchise.
Made Out To Be A Jerkass  -  Calling out an unsympathetic character will label you as a bad guy.
Against My Religion  -  One's faith forbids certain activities.
Mighty Roar  -  Big animals have big roars
Endless Winter  -  A winter...that lasts forever.
Horns Of Barbarism  -  Barbarians wear helmets with horns and antlers on them.
The Glorious War Of Sisterly Rivalry  -  Two sisters, a smart one and a pretty one, often quarrel with each other.
Moe Stare  -  Wide-eyed gaze and a small gaping smile = cute.
Taking Over Heaven  -  Heaven is under new management now!
Wacky Cravings  -  Pregnant women crave strange things.
Naughty Is Good  -  Kid Heroes are mischievous and ill-behaved.
Hero Protagonist  -  The Hero serves as The Protagonist of the story.
Villainous Harlequin  -  Clown-like villain who is too harmless and silly to qualify for Monster Clown status.
Happily Adopted  -  A person who knows they're adopted, and is happy with their adopted family.
Heroes R Us  -  Organized hero groups.
Different In Every Episode  -  In-universe Couch Gag.
Borrowing The Beatles  -  Stock Parodies of The Beatles.
Dead Drop  -  Secret communication Hidden in Plain Sight.
Like Goes With Like  -  Two characters of the same race go out with each other.
Royalty Superpower  -  Descendants of royalty get exclusive supernatural abilities.
Opening A Can Of Clones  -  If there's a possibility that these characters might turn out to just be expendable duplicates, why should we care about them?
Stab The Salad  -  Doing something mundane in a frightening way.
New Friend Envy  -  A character's best friend makes a new friend and gets jealous, theorizing that they may replace them.
Invisible Advertising  -  A work that receives very little, if any, advertising from the company or network that is supposed to promote it.
Comeback Mechanic  -  A video game balancing mechanic that grants advantages to losing players.
Extremely Short Timespan  -  A story that takes place in an unusually short amount of time.
Ear Trumpet  -  A conical hearing aid, occasionally used to show that a work took place a while ago, but usually used for Rule of Funny.
Pretend Prejudice  -  A person claims to be prejudiced against some group(s), but really isn't.
Dancing Theme  -  Characters dance to the Theme Tune.
Caged Bird Metaphor  -  A repressed character is compared to a bird in a cage.
Personal Effects Reveal  -  A character's personal belongings shed some more light on their personality.
Tangled Family Tree  -  An extremely convoluted and utterly confusing family tree.
Kiddie Kid  -  A child character acts younger than their stated age.
Sergeant Rock  -  A tough non-commissioned officer, usually serving in a position of leadership.
Apocalyptic Gag Order  -  The powers that be try to keep the imminent apocalypse a secret.
The Problem With Pen Island  -  Improperly spaced words spell something different.
All Animals Are Dogs  -  Potentially dangerous and/or wild animals interact with humans like harmless pet dogs.
Throwing The Fight  -  Being paid to lose a game or a match.
Cursed With Awesome  -  Undesired quality is useful.
Luck Based Search Technique  -  Finding something important. By accident.
Keywords Conversation  -  A video game dialogue implementation where the player inputs keywords to elicit a response.
Unbalanced By Rivals Kid  -  The Romantic Runner-Up in a Love Triangle meets the couples kid; drama ensues due to lingering resentment.
Diagnosis From Dr Badass  -  Someone diagnoses themselves/someone else with anatomical accuracy, even if they don't have medical experience.
Zombie Infectee  -  The Virus-infected character tries to keep this a secret.
Denying The Dead Parents Sins  -  A character refuses to believe that their deceased parent had a dark past.
Informed Deformity  -  The story tells us this character is deformed, but they look normal to the audience.
Balls Gag  -  Jokes about the word "balls".
The Centerpiece Spectacular  -  The middle part of the story is the most exciting.
Ode To Family  -  A song about familial relationships.
Slippery Swimsuit  -  A character losing his/her swimsuit after diving in.
The Team Normal  -  The one Badass Normal on a team of supers.
Alternative Foreign Theme Song  -  A localization of a foreign work replaces the original opening/ending theme song with an entirely different one.
I Have No Son  -  Disowning of a family member.
All Lesbians Want Kids  -  Lesbians want children as much—if not more—than straight women do.
Mook Debut Cutscene  -  A Mook gets a cutscene the first time it shows up, typically designed to show how scary and dangerous they are.
GIS Syndrome  -  Using stock images as backgrounds.
Mock Millionaire  -  Someone is not rich, but pretends to be.
Adaptation First  -  An adaptation is released before the original work finally gets localized in a certain region.
Badass Driver  -  They're really, really good at driving.
Genetic Memory  -  An ability to record personal memories/skills into their genes and pass them onto their offspring.
Time Zones Do Not Exist  -  Time of day is the same in multiple far-apart places when it should logically be different.
Reviews Are The Gospel  -  The reviews prove that "insert game/movie/book/etc here" is good/bad/whatever!
Tinfoil Hat  -  A hat made of tinfoil as a sign of paranoia.
Failed A Spot Check  -  How the hell did they not notice that?!?
Naughty By Night  -  A character who is reserved and conservative in public but sexually liberated and proactive in private.
Better Than New  -  It's not just new; it's new and improved!
Who Would Want To Watch Us  -  The characters wonder who would watch their adventures.
Hand Puppet  -  A puppet entirely operated by hand.
Used Future  -  Stuff in the future has gone through a lot of wear and tear.
Sesquipedalian Loquaciousness  -  Vocalizing in extensive, complicated words and sentences.
Expressive Shirt  -  Shirt changes appearance in accordance with its wearer's emotional state.
WPUN  -  Pun-based radio station callsigns.
Panicky Expectant Father  -  A man panics while his wife is in labor with their child.
Androids Are People Too  -  Artificial lifeforms are treated as people.
One Dose Fits All  -  A single drug affects different people in exactly the same way, despite differences in size, body mass, constitution etc.
Do You Trust Me  -  In a critical moment, demanding if someone trusts you enough to trust you know what you're doing.
Exalted Torturer  -  A character who uses torture is presented as the good guy.
Society Of Immortals  -  A species or civilization where all members are immortal.
Heroes Fight Barehanded  -  The protagonist fights with his hands instead of a weapon.
Starring Special Effects  -  Animated or puppet character is one of the stars of the movie.
Appointment Television  -  Someone must watch a TV show the first time its aired.
Set Right What Once Went Wrong  -  Going back in time to change an error, or undo mistakes
The Theorem Of Narrow Interests  -  The narrower your search is, the harder it is to find something good.
Think Nothing Of It  -  Being a hero isn't that big a deal...
Mysterious Parent  -  The identity of a characters Disappeared Dad / Missing Mom is revealed, making a significant impact upon the plot.
Threatening Shark  -  Sharks are generally considered threatening. Sometimes even to other sharks.
Dancing Royalty  -  A character that's great at dancing is popular enough to be treated like royalty.
Dinner With The Boss  -  The boss comes over for dinner.
Enemy Roll Call  -  Showing the names of the enemies during or after the credits of a game.
Color Contrast  -  Colors contrasting with each other on the wheel, often used for clear differentation.
Token Houseguest  -  Someone who isn't part of the immediate family, but still lives with them.
Age Inappropriate Dress  -  You're too old/young to wear that outfit!
Voiced Differently In The Dub  -  A character's voice in a foreign dub sounds completely different from their original voice.
Immortality  -  Living forever.
Badass Bookworm  -  The Smart Guy (or The Evil Genius) + traits of The Big Guy (or The Brute) = this trope.
Shall I Repeat That  -  Hoot hoot! Do you want to read the abridged version again?
Defacement Insult  -  A character's property is vandalized with an insult.
Mustache Vandalism  -  Drawing a moustache on the face of a portrait with any medium.
Abusive Precursors  -  Their ancestors were major assholes.
Animals See In Monochrome  -  Misconception that dogs (and sometimes other animals) only have black-and-white vision.
Homegrown Hero  -  There is trouble in a country far away, but thankfully someone from your country happens to be just there.
Eleventh Hour Costume Change  -  A character changes their outfit right before the climax.
Cute Clumsy Girl  -  A female character's clumsiness is played as an attractive trait.
Shouldnt We Be In School Right Now  -  Kid Heroes skip school for plot reasons.
Rising Conflict  -  The tendency for the conflict between protagonist and antagonist to escalate over story-time.
Awkward Silence Entrance  -  Eating, drinking, and activity stops upon seeing a newcomer, outsider or outcast enter.
There Should Be A Law  -  A character wants to illegalize something because they don't like it.
Decapitated Army  -  Killing the commander defeats his army.
Death Glare  -  If looks could kill, you'd leave in a bucket.
Wealthy Yacht Owner  -  Wealthy person owns a luxury boat, not despite it being Awesome, but Impractical but because of it, just to show how filthy rich they are.
Blind Jump  -  Spacecraft warping to a random location as a last evasive resort.
Sentient Cosmic Force  -  A sentient Background Magic Field of universal scale.
Sizable Snowflakes  -  Snowflakes that are big enough to see all their details from even far away.
Bilingual Bonus  -  Knowing a foreign language gets you a little something extra.
Wicked Witch  -  Creepy cackling old woman who rides a broom.
Canon Identifier  -  Player Characters without distinguishing features have specific titles so you can be clear which one you're talking about
Insistent Terminology  -  I say X, not Y.
And There Was Much Rejoicing  -  Someone dies, and the characters around them react with happiness.
Warm Bloodbags Are Everywhere  -  Character tries to live in peace with their natural food.
Mathematicians Answer  -  A technically correct answer that tells you absolutely nothing about what you were asking.
Twice Shy  -  Two characters who have feelings for each other but both of them are too shy to admit it.
The Artifact  -  A story element or character that is no longer important to the plot, but it's still there.
Primordial Tongue  -  The first language from which all other languages are derived.
Power Fantasy  -  Living out your ideal life vicariously through escapism.
Compound Title  -  Different episode titles form one statement.
Literal Music Video  -  Changing the lyrics of the song to describe the video (or vice versa).
Space Elves  -  Aliens are fay and elvish.
Flunky Boss  -  Battling a boss and their goons simultaneously.
Villainy Discretion Shot  -  They're not evil until we see it.
Platform Battle  -  Boss Battle whose difficulty relies on not falling off Floating Platforms.
But That I Would Believe  -  That: a better and more believable explanation or excuse that Bob can give.
The Anti God  -  There's another, often opposing deity who's on par with the one true God.
Jack Bauer Interrogation Technique  -  Need information fast? Torture Always Works.
Friendly Fandoms  -  Two works have an overlapping fanbase.
Hold The Unsolicited Ingredient  -  Don't put this unexpected and unusual ingredient in my food, please.
Catch A Falling Star  -  Catching something or someone falling from a great height.
Ground Shattering Landing  -  A superhuman character is more durable than the surface they land upon.
Tournament Arc  -  An arc, volume or series involving a tournament.
Bluffing The Murderer  -  Tricking a murderer into panicking and proving his own guilt.
Oxymoronic Being  -  Paradoxical beings.
Willing Channeler  -  Come and share your body with a spirit of some sort! You'll get superpowers! Warning: may cause side effects.
Three Plus Five Make Four  -  Stock Lateral Thinking Puzzle: can you distribute this liquid between differently-sized containers and come up with a specific amount?
A Load Of Bull  -  Minotaurs and other bovine humanoids.
Not Staying For Breakfast  -  Leaving a lover in bed before they wake.
Filler  -  Meaningless episodes in an arc based show.
Dyeing For Your Art  -  Actor undergoes long-term physical changes for their role.
So Was X  -  A stock phrase used to compare things with the ones that happened in the past.
Real Fake Wedding  -  Tricking someone into marrying them by staging a fake wedding with their partner, then replacing the false celebrant with the real one.
Macho Disaster Expedition  -  Separately engaged in an activity considered masculine, the chicks do well while the dudes do not-so-well.
Removable Animal Markings  -  An animal's natural markings, such as spots or stripes, are removable.
They Changed It Now It Sucks  -  Some changes are not always welcome by the fanbase. Especially if that fanbase refuses to be open-minded.
Deaf Composer  -  A talented person with a handicap preventing them from experiencing what they create.
Girlish Pigtails  -  Pigtails = Youthfulness.
Handy Remote Control  -  Remote control with one button. Does anything.
Piggybacking On Hitler  -  Bad guys who work under historical dictators for personal gain.
Good Costume Switch  -  Change appearance to show HeelFace Turn.
World Of Action Girls  -  Every major female character is an Action Girl and they outnumber the men.
Follow The Plotted Line  -  The game is laid out for you to always end up at the Plot, even if it's not clear how.
Crapola Tech  -  Complex inventions that don't work.
Con Lang  -  An artificially-created language.
You Just Ruined The Shot  -  It was All Part of the Show after all.
Briefcase Blaster  -  Briefcase is / holds a firearm.
Stat Sticks  -  Weapons that are only equipped because they increase the user's statistics or provide other passive bonuses, and are never used to actually attack with.
Saved By The Platform Below  -  Someone falls off a building to their death, then is shown to have landed on a ledge
Achey Scars  -  A scar hurts when a villain is around.
Ice Cream Koan  -  Something that seems deep but is actually meaningless.
Our Archons Are Different  -  Archons come in all shapes and sizes.
Anthropic Principle  -  Things that must happen or there would be no story otherwise.
Helping Would Be Killstealing  -  In the long run, you are better off without my help.
Street Samurai  -  A Ronin in a world of Corporate Samurai.
Uncleanliness Is Next To Ungodliness  -  Evil or otherwise unpleasant people have poor personal hygiene.
Alphabet Soup Cans  -  A bizarre, irrelevant puzzle... in an edutainment game!
King Kong Climb  -  Stock Shout-Out to King Kong climbing the Empire State Building.
Freudian Excuse Denial  -  A character denies having a Freudian Excuse, or says that their upbringing didn't affect them.
Bridge Logic  -  Knocking down a tall structure for a makeshift bridge.
Time Dilation  -  Time is relative, based on the speed and acceleration of who experiences it.
Very False Advertising  -  Whatever you heard in the promotion for this was totally untrue.
Aesop Amnesia  -  Characters learn an important lesson, and then forget it to maintain the status quo.
Epunymous Title  -  The title refers both to the protagonist's name and the premise of the story.
Its Not Porn Its Art  -  Defending works of nude depictions not as pornography, but as art.
Bag Of Sharing  -  Inventory space is shared by all Player Party members.
Sound Effect Bleep  -  A sound drowns out the *BEEEEP* expletive.
Injured Limb Episode  -  A character's limb gets an injury that's worse than a scrape but not enough to lose it.
In The Blood  -  Evil is inherent.
Parent Service  -  Fanservice used in works aimed at families or kids.
Herding Mission  -  A video game quest where you corral animals into a pen.
Fractional Winning Condition  -  You win the game by completing most of its available objectives (rather than all of them).
I Feel Guilty You Take It  -  If a character feels guilty for their victory, they'll reject the prize.
Massive Multiplayer Crossover  -  A Crossover between three or more continuities you'd never think would ever meet. Ever.
Perfectly Cromulent Word  -  A made-up or messed-up word used in casual conversation.
Sanity Slippage Song  -  A song where a characters sanity slips away
Science Fantasy  -  When Science Fiction and Fantasy love each other very much...
Semantic Slippery Slope Fallacy  -  There is no difference between X and Y if there are any similarities between them.
Van Helsing Hate Crimes  -  Killing monsters because they're monsters, with no regard to good or evil.
The Law Firm Of Pun Pun And Wordplay  -  A law firm with a silly combination of names.
Cactus Cushion  -  A character gets injured, sometimes comedically and sometimes not, on a cactus' spines.
Trans Atlantic Equivalent  -  The same product, but made in another country.
Free Range Children  -  Where are these kids' parents?
Bluffing The Advance Scout  -  A trope where the people of Earth tell some lie to trick an alien scout into leaving us alone.
Bits Of Me Keep Passing Out  -  Body parts falling asleep.
Did I Mention Its Christmas  -  It's set at Christmastime, but nothing particularly festive is going on.
Never A Self Made Woman  -  Behind any woman's achievements, whatever they are, there's the expertise or role of a man.
Psi Blast  -  Psychic Powers manifesting as energy blasts.
Constantly Lactating Cow  -  Cows and other livestock in fiction can always be milked.
Hereditary Homosexuality  -  If your parent(s) are gay, chances are you are too. It's In the Blood.
Newbie Boom  -  Fandom gets a sudden influx of new members.
Reverse Telescopic Vision  -  Holding a telescope or binoculars the wrong way, making what is in their perspective appear far away.
Unsuspectingly Soused  -  A drink turns out to not only be filled with alcohol, but also plastered with it.
Three Approach System  -  One game, three gameplay styles.
Magnetic Hero  -  A protagonist who tends to attract friends along their journey.
Karmic Thief  -  A Thief who only steals from people who have it coming.
No Matter How Much I Beg  -  Someone is told to keep something with them.
We Will Use Wiki Words In The Future  -  The future loves CamelCase.
Out Sick  -  Someone is sick, injured, or otherwise physically compromised and can't do something they were going to.
Council Of Angels  -  Heaven is run by angels.
Kill On Sight  -  A person or group have open season declared upon them.
Chessmaster Sidekick  -  A subservient Chessmaster.
Altitis  -  People just can't stop making alternates in video games.
Shapeshifting Failure  -  A character tries to shapeshift and it backfires to some degree.
Rule Of Pool  -  Swimming pools exist for people to fall or land in.
Not So Omniscient After All  -  They don't know everything, to the great surprise of themselves or people around them.
Kappa  -  Monkey/turtle river-goblin Youkai from Japanese Folklore.
Career Building Blunder  -  You have to screw up to move up.
Perverse Sexual Lust  -  Real Life attraction to a fictional character.
Wartime Wedding  -  Characters get married just before, during, or right after a war.
Cincinnatus  -  A character who gains a vast amount of political power and willfully gives it to someone else later on.
Carrying A Cake  -  If a cake (or similar fragile plot item) needs to be taken to another location, expect everything to go wrong.
Breaking And Bloodsucking  -  Vampires break into bedrooms to attack women.
Dont Make Me Take My Belt Off  -  Spanking a kid, usually with a belt.
Path Of Inspiration  -  An evil church disguised as a good church.
Attack Of The 50 Foot Whatever  -  A giant version of something runs amok and must be stopped.
Automatic New Game  -  The game goes from initialization to gameplay with little to no menu interaction in-between.
Off Model  -  Animation errors due to budget constraints or an admitted case of Creator's Apathy (either overseas or domestic).
Archnemesis Dad  -  Evil and antagonistic father.
Place Worse Than Death  -  A Real Life location is talked up as a Crapsack World.
Extra Parent Conception  -  A child was conceived by more than two parents, metaphorically or literally.
The War Has Just Begun  -  Stock phrase foreboding future conflict.
Hidden In Plain Sight  -  Hiding by fitting in with the surroundings.
Dont Like Dont Read  -  If you don't like the story, then don't read it!
Mix And Match Weapon  -  Two weapons combined to form a new weapon with elements of both.
Paperworkaholic  -  Menial paperwork is their greatest joy.
Home Of The Gods  -  The place where the gods live.
Elemental Tiers  -  Elemental weapons (and sometimes spells) are drastically different in power level.
New Look Same Great Taste  -  New package, but don't worry, it's the same stuff inside!
No Swastikas  -  All Nazi symbols and references are absent, but it is still obvious that Nazis are present.
Erudite Stoner  -  When The Stoner is also The Smart Guy.
Just For The Heli Of It  -  Someone thinks he has to use a helicopter to get somewhere. Someone else thinks that's ridiculous.
Scooby Dooby Doors  -  A chase scene involving running in and out through a hallway of doors.
Deceptively Simple Demonstration  -  The task is much easier for this product than it looks, or it's easy because it wasn't meant to do it.
Cavalry Refusal  -  Supposed rescuers aren't interested in rescuing.
Zipperiffic  -  Normal clothing. With extra zippers. Lots of them.
Raise Him Right This Time  -  A villain is turned into an infant in hopes of raising him/her to not be evil.
Gesundheit  -  A character responds to another character saying a funny or unusual word by pretending as if they sneezed.
Art Shift  -  Temporary change in artstyle.
Fourth Date Marriage  -  Deciding to get engaged or married after an extremely short period of courtship.
Fingerless Gloves  -  Gloves which are missing the tips of the fingers. (The rest of the fingers may or may not be included.)
Dead Star Walking  -  A character who seems to be the main character gets killed off, and surprisingly soon to boot.
No Mere Windmill  -  Windmill Political is Real After All.
Grows On Trees  -  This tree grows something that isn't fruit. Or even a food. Or even organic.
Raiders Of The Lost Parody  -  An Indiana Jones parody.
The Cast Showoff  -  An actor's talents other than acting are worked into the plot.
Violation Of Common Sense  -  The player does something stupid, and the game rewards them for it.
Womb Level  -  Generic Video Game world of living flesh.
Easy Amnesia  -  Amnesia is easy to give, easy to get, and sometimes easy to recover from.
Fire Keeps It Dead  -  Burning a corpse prevents resurrection.
Repeated Cue Tardy Response  -  You expected an event to happen, but the spoken cue fails and you vainly keep saying it.
Persuasion Minigame  -  NPC persuasion framed as a Mini-Game.
Revival Loophole  -  Death is predicted, but getting revived afterwards is not.
Exaggerated Trope  -  Trope taken to extremes.
Fountain Of Expies  -  Popular character, imitated by several others.
Spirited Young Lady  -  A young woman in a period piece who rebels just enough against being a perfect Proper Lady.
Forgot I Could Change The Rules  -  An authority figure forgets that they can change the rules.
Where Do You Think You Are  -  Somebody implies that what another character is talking about does not happen where they are.
Big Why  -  A character shouts out the word "why?" when they are sad as if they want to know why the bad thing happened.
Does Not Know His Own Strength  -  Someone with super strength has trouble toning it down to normal strength.
Resentful Guardian  -  Suddenly having to raise a child = LIFE RUINED.
Mosquito Miscreants  -  Mosquitoes being portrayed as either evil or annoying
I Know Youre In There Somewhere Fight  -  A character has been turned to the dark side through mind control, brainwashing, or other methods. Their former friend must now fight them and persuade them that they still have good within them.
Its Popular Now It Sucks  -  The more mainstream something is, the more critical people are at it.
Rank Inflation  -  If you start at D and go backwards, you'll have to make up better letters when you run out of alphabet.
Food End  -  A feast ends a work.
Chemically Induced Insanity  -  A character is given drugs to make them seem insane.
Elevator Failure  -  An elevator malfunctions while people are in it.
You Will Be Spared  -  The villain offers to let the hero live, or at least kill him painlessly, for whatever reason.
Improbably Low IQ  -  A character manages to get an unbelievably low IQ score.
Middle Grade Literature  -  Books aimed at 8 to 12 year olds.
Extreme Omnivore  -  A character can eat anything. Even things that aren't edible for a normal human.
Talking Lightbulb  -  A visual indicator that someone is speaking in a case where the speaker's mouth is unseen or nonexistent.
Everybody Smokes  -  A disproportionately high number of people are smokers, usually to show a Noir setting.
Chaotic Good  -  A character alignment involving good and freedom.
Ridiculous Future Inflation  -  Future inflation rates will be completely unrealistic.
Pointless Band Aid  -  An adhesive bandage strip worn solely for aesthetic reasons.
French Jerk  -  Frenchies can be such merdes.
Idle Rich  -  More money, less problems, little to do.
Matchmaker Crush  -  The Matchmaker falls in love with one of the couple they are trying to pair up.
Food Songs Are Funny  -  Singing about food is funny for some odd reason.
Middle Name Basis  -  A character is reffered to by their middle name.
Suspicious Videogame Generosity  -  See lots of items? Expect a big fight.
All Are Equal In Death  -  All are treated or shown as equal in death, no matter their looks or their status.
The End Is Nigh  -  This guy thinks that The End of the World as We Know It is close.
Diabolical Mastermind  -  The Underground Evil Overlord: no legal country, but kept immune from national/international law through minions and blackmail.
Doing It For The Art  -  Creators who create their work for its own sake, without regard to the profit motive.
B Movie  -  A low-budget movie, characterized by a cheesy plot and usually being So Bad, It's Good.
Lesser Star  -  Performer prominence does not equal performer importance.
Body Surf  -  Switch bodies sequentially.
Meaningless Lives  -  Screw the importance of lives, we've got saving!
Older Than They Look  -  Someone looks younger than they really are.
Undead Laborers  -  Using mindless undead as a cheap labor force.
We All Live In America  -  When foreign culture in fiction is written exactly like the author's.
Spousal Privilege  -  One spouse cannot be forced to testify against the other.
Rapid Fire Comedy  -  The jokes comes one-after-another, and very fast.
Hard Mode Perks  -  Choosing higher difficulties is actively rewarded in a gameplay-affecting way.
The Speechless  -  Cannot speak at all.
You Have No Idea Who Youre Dealing With  -  You're actually going to take that guy on? SERIOUSLY???!!!
Snakes Are Sinister  -  Snakes are evil.
Consolation Award  -  Content-creator makes highly acclaimed content, but eventually gets their award for one of their less acclaimed works.
Villains Out Shopping  -  Villains are shown taking a break from evildoing to engage in harmless, mundane activities.
Sheathe Your Sword  -  Non-violence is the only answer.
Strong Empire Shriveled Emperor  -  A powerful empire led by an old, feeble or ill emperor.
Three Point Landing  -  Hitting the ground with two legs and one hand.
Non Human Head  -  A being with a human or humanlike body but a non-human head.
Pursue The Dream Job  -  A character quits their boring day job to pursue their dream career, often something in the arts.
Fantasy Aliens  -  Extraterrestrial beings in a fantasy setting.
Hello Sailor  -  Men in the Navy go gay due to lack of female options.
Alchemy Is Magic  -  Alchemy as Functional Magic.
Rose Tinted Narrative  -  Work idealizes some of its real-life bases, with expense to accuracy.
Danger Takes A Backseat  -  The killer hides in the backseat of someone's car waiting to strike.
Space Suits Are SCUBA Gear  -  Spacesuits with exposed air tubes.
Never Trust A Title  -  The title has little or nothing to do with the work.
Copiously Credited Creator  -  One person is credited for most if not all things in the work.
Dumb Is Good  -  Stupid characters are always nice.
Suspiciously Specific Denial  -  To specifically deny something, even when you shouldn't know it if you did not do it.
Barefoot Suicide  -  When one takes off their shoes before killing themselves. It's only polite.
Suspend Save  -  A save game that is good for a single use.
To Be Continued  -  A common caption inserted at the end of an episode or work that ends on a Cliffhanger.
Blah Blah Blah  -  Blah blah blah placeholder words blah blah blah.
Punch A Wall  -  Someone takes their rage out by punching something inanimate.
The Leader  -  A character who is good at organizing and directing others; the main member of any team.
Perma Stubble  -  Action Heroes and other gritty protagonists have perpetual 5 o'clock shadow.
Mechanical Lifeforms  -  These machines are ALIVE!
Pizza Boy Special Delivery  -  Having sex with the delivery person.
Family Theme Naming  -  A Fantastic Naming Convention for family members.
Sequel Non Entity  -  A character from the previous movie doesn't return for the sequel for whatever reason.
Death Song  -  A character sings a song right before death.
Not So Remote  -  A seemingly isolated location is much closer to civilization than it initially seems.
Horns Of Villainy  -  Character has or gains horns as a sign of evil.
The Dark Arts  -  Morally questionable professions and/or disciplines.
Hit Me Dammit  -  Begging someone to punch you.
Hot Blade  -  A really hot blade.
The Coconut Effect  -  If it's entirely false, but firmly ingrained in the minds of viewers, you have to include it.
Parental Incest  -  Sex between parent and child.
Self Poisoning Gambit  -  A person lures someone else into consuming something that is poisoned by eating some of it themselves. (Or appearing to do so.)
The Last Dance  -  I am going to die soon, I might as well kick some serious ass.
Retconjuration  -  The power to change history for the sake of the plot.
Dada Ad  -  A strange and/or frightening ad that doesn't even make sense when the product is revealed.
Only A Flesh Wound  -  A character is unrealistically functional after being severely injured.
Blown Across The Room  -  Enhanced ballistics and physics can send a person flying into the air via force.
Camp  -  Exaggerated, theatrical style.
Brought Down To Normal  -  A person or creature with magic or other powers temporarily loses those powers for an episode or more.
Limited Loadout  -  The game places a restriction on how many weapons the player can carry at once.
Refused By The Call  -  You want The Call, the Call doesn't want you.
Vasquez Always Dies  -  When two Action Girls share a screen, the tougher tomboy dies.
Grayscale Of Evil  -  If it's devoid of colour, it's villainous.
Mining For Cookies  -  Mines are full of ANYTHING.
Happy Ending Override  -  The sequel starts out with the previous installment's happy ending undone and things much worse than when they began.
Troubled Backstory Flashback  -  A Flashback to the exact moment when a character's previously happy life turns into a living hell. Usually involves the death of somebody's close one.
Wasnt That Fun  -  After a harrowing escape, someone says they enjoyed it.
Life Imitates Art  -  Something that happened in fiction eventually happens in Real Life.
Feed It A Bomb  -  Kill an enemy by throwing stuff into its open mouth.
Frictionless Reentry  -  Objects enter the atmosphere without burning up.
Hit And Run Tactics  -  Wear down a strong enemy via attacking from outside their attack range.
Late Export For You  -  A TV show, movie, video game, etc, which finally arrives overseas after a really long wait.
Cover Album  -  An album made of Cover Versions.
Teeth Clenched Teamwork  -  Teammates who don't exactly get along.
Irish Priest  -  The (not-so) stereotypical Oireland churchman.
Fantasy World Map  -  Map showing off the non-earth land masses.
Back For The Finale  -  Absent character returns in the final episode.
Awesome Ego  -  A character's gigantic ego, especially when they can back it up, makes them more charming.
Idiotic Partner Confession  -  You are smart enough to be discreet... your friend is not.
Strawberry Shorthand  -  Everything's better with strawberries!
Camp Unsafe Isnt Safe Anymore  -  We're supposed to take a character's word for it that an unsafe place that was apparently safe has become unsafe.
White Mask Of Doom  -  How do you make a Cool Mask extra scary/even cooler? Just add white.
Dramatic Disappearing Display  -  The HUD disappears during a tense moment.
Enemies List  -  A character likes to make a list of his or her enemies.
Queer Romance  -  A story that includes romance between two or more LGBT characters as a major theme
Magic Missile Storm  -  A spell consisting of a swarm of magical projectiles.
Almighty Janitor  -  Low in rank, but high in power.
When She Smiles  -  A plain or unremarkable person's smile makes them lovely.
Welcome To Hell  -  Darth Wiki: What would Hell be like for you?
Own Goal  -  He shoots, he scores... NOT!
Sentenced To Down Under  -  Exile to Australia as a punishment.
Genius Book Club  -  Making characters read books, usually classics or heavy scientific stuff, as a way of showing that they're exceptionally smart.
Impossible Genius  -  A genius whose intelligence transcends the normal and able to do things that are otherwise literally impossible.
Token Super  -  The only Differently Powered Individual on a team of Badass Normals.
Gaydar  -  The ability for a gay character to tell whether others are gay.
You Have No Chance To Survive  -  Villain gloats that the hero(es) will not survive much longer.
No Punctuation Is Funnier  -  not having punctuation makes sentences funnier for some reason
Head Turned Backwards  -  Someone who's head ends up backwards by any mean other than capable rotation.
Good All Along  -  A character that is thought to be one of the bad guys turns out to have always been on the side of good.
Mighty Lumberjack  -  Lumberjacking being portrayed as an extremely manly, often badass, profession.
Light Is Not Good  -  Light is presented as evil.
Bigot With A Crush  -  A character has feelings for a person from a group they are prejudiced against.
Circling Vultures  -  Vultures (and occasionally other scavengers) watching a character is a signal that said character is doomed.
Hate At First Sight  -  One character instinctively hates another upon first meeting them; often, it's mutual.
Mook Maker  -  Summons enemies, may or may not fight.
The Marvelous Deer  -  Deer are elusive, mystical and wondrous animals.
Villain Exclusivity Clause  -  The villain always does the same thing in the plot.
Cassandra Truth  -  A truth that no one believes.
Restraining Bolt  -  An object or spell that forces a character to follow its ethical code.
The Kirk  -  The balancer/combination/mix of logic and emotion.
Gentle Giant  -  The trope: An imposing and scary but kind-hearted Big Guy.
Actually Four Mooks  -  The Mook version of Party in My Pocket.
Language Barrier  -  When a character can't communicate with others due to them not speaking their language.
Temporal Paradox  -  Dimensional inconsistencies achieved through time travel.
Animated Outtakes  -  Already animated scenes reanimated specifically to act as bloopers.
CAT Trap  -  Going into a CAT tube is scary and claustrophobic.
Sleeping Their Way To The Top  -  Character uses seduction, sex appeal and sexual or romantic relationships to further their career.
High Speed Hijack  -  Hijacking a moving vehicle.
Detonation Moon  -  Blowing up the moon.
Phlebotinum Girl  -  Female lead character with a special power or ability, which makes her a target of one or more factions.
Phallic Weapon  -  Weapons as phallic metaphor.
Captain Patriotic  -  Superhero serves the ideals of his nation.
As Long As It Sounds Foreign  -  Gibberish that resembles a foreign language.
Signature Series Arc  -  The Work's most famous and/or well-known Story Arc.
Newspaper Dating  -  A Time Traveler uses a newspaper to determine the date they're in, rather than asking, "What Year Is This?".
Or Was It A Dream  -  May not have been a dream after all.
Beyond The Impossible  -  Breaking (what seemed to have been) the rules set by the story's internal logic.
Either Or Prophecy  -  One of these things will happen.
