Proto Superhero  -  Superheroes from before the Golden Age Of Comic Books.
Clown Species  -  A nonhuman species that physically and/or culturally resemble clowns, jesters and fools.
Mercy Lead  -  The hero's escaping! Luckily for him, the villain's a good sport and gives him a head start.
Sticks To The Back  -  Weapons remain on the wielder's back until needed, without anything to physically hold them there.
Rock Opera  -  Concept Albums that are told and arranged entirely from the main character(s) point of view.
Arbitrarily Serialized Simultaneous Adventures  -  Video game characters have simultaneous adventures. You have to play through all of them, in any order.
Butter Face  -  Everything about this girl is beautiful... but her face.
Just A Stupid Accent  -  Someone speaking a foreign language is represented by speaking the audience's language with an accent.
They Wasted A Perfectly Good Plot  -  A potentially interesting plot point is underdeveloped or not touched upon.
Disabled Means Helpless  -  People think that disabled people are way more helpless than they really are.
Breakout Villain  -  A villain intended to have a limited run becomes a bigger, long-lasting villain through popularity.
Conspicuously Light Patch  -  Elements in the background which move or are interactive look distinctly different from the rest.
Sidetracked By The Gold Saucer  -  A minigame or side-mode that overshadows the main game.
Exergaming  -  A video game that encourages exercise from players.
A Threesome Is Hot  -  Having sex with two other people (mostly, but not necessary, both girls) at once is awesome!
Pretty Fly For A White Guy  -  Hilarity Ensues when a white guy acts like another race (usually African-American).
Doesnt Like Guns  -  A character won't (or can't) use guns.
Apathy Killed The Cat  -  Muggles don't ask about the Phlebotinum, not even simple questions.
Grass Is Greener  -  People are always discontent with their own circumstance; they think others have it better.
Backtracking  -  Returning through places previously visited.
One Gender Race  -  All male/female species.
Drop The Hammer  -  Weaponized hammers.
Preemptive Apology  -  Apologizing for something before you do it.
Boot Camp Episode  -  Episode where civilian characters undergo military (or similar) training.
Glorious Mother Russia  -  Это Советский Союз, товарищ.
Said Bookism  -  Going out of your way to use any word other than "said", even if the word is obscure and out-of-place.
Graffiti Of The Resistance  -  La Résistance engages in Sigil Spam graffiti.
Grief Song  -  A musical number where a character's loved one has disappeared and/or died, and are upset about it.
The Killer Becomes The Killed  -  A murderer or similarly heinous criminal gets killed themselves.
Superpowers For A Day  -  A muggle gets superpowers temporarily.
Wild Take  -  A highly exaggerated take that couldn't possibly happen in real life.
The Power Of The Sun  -  Power that comes from the sun.
School Setting Simulation  -  A video game level with a school setting.
The Bard On Board  -  A work is based on the plot of a Shakespeare play.
Outliving Ones Offspring  -  A parent genuinely survives their children's death.
Good Eyes Evil Eyes  -  Character Alignment depends on how your eyes dilate.
Courtroom Antic  -  Breaking every law of court etiquette in the pursuit of a desired verdict.
Everythings Louder With Bagpipes  -  Bagpipes' sheer loudness bolsters allies' courage, frightens ennemies, and obliterates everyone's eardrums.
Non Standard Character Design  -  One character (or more) is designed differently from the rest.
Not Proven  -  We know you did it, but we can't prove it.
Arbitrary Mission Restriction  -  A mission requires or rewards special conditions without any in-universe reasons to do them.
Delayed Causality  -  There's an inexplicable Dramatic Pause between an action and its result.
Streamer Friendly Mode  -  A video game gives options meant specifically to help streamers.
Defecting For Love  -  A non-evil (usually female) character who works for the villains but defects to the good guys, usually after falling in love with The Hero.
NINJA  -  Japanese assassins who utilize stealth, swift movements, and sometimes magic and martial arts, to kill.
Dont You Dare Pity Me  -  Has too much pride to welcome sympathy.
Bag Of Holding  -  How the hell does that fit in there?
Ye Olde Butcherede Englishe  -  Thou hast no clue what thou art saying, thee just seemeth olde.
Jacob Marley Warning  -  That road you're planning to go down? I did. If you do, you'll end up like me.
Stomach Of Holding  -  Character holds items in his stomach without digesting them.
Poorly Lit Pareidolia  -  A character is alone, at night (or otherwise in the dark), and starts imagining monstrous faces in inanimate objects.
Pac Man Fever  -  Shallow stereotypes of video games as depicted by other media.
Aliens And Monsters  -  A new enemy has appeared. Destroy it!
Not So Innocent Whistle  -  Characters seem to think whistling is equivalent to saying "I DIDN'T DO IT."
Gretzky Has The Ball  -  Someone who knows very little about the sports/game they're involved in and constantly mixes up the jargons.
Alternative Dance  -  Alternative Rock meets Electronic Dance Music.
Take Up My Sword  -  The Hero Dies and must be replaced.
Dinner Bath Or Sex Offer  -  The breadwinner arrives home and is immediately offered comfort of 3 things: food, bath, or sex.
Barrier Change Boss  -  A boss that can change which attacks it's weak to and/or strong against.
Not Quite Dead  -  You thought they were dying/dead. Not so.
You Tuber Apology Parody  -  Parody of a video creator apologizing for creating controversy.
Human Subspecies  -  Human variants resulting from evolution or science.
Modern Major General  -  Can do anything well except their actual job.
Pretty In Mink  -  Furs are glamorous, show wealth, and help pretty up a scene.
Cats Have Nine Lives  -  Cats portrayed as being able to survive being killed, but only eight times.
Disregard That Statement  -  Saying something unconventional to change the views in the courtroom.
Children Are A Waste  -  Children are not worth the trouble.
Cereal Induced Superpowers  -  In order to sell a food product, the ad has it give someone superpowers.
Never Mess With Granny  -  The old lady is a badass.
Dainty Little Ballet Dancers  -  Ballet dancers are portrayed as delicate little flowers of femininity.
We Do Not Know Each Other  -  Acquaintances pretending to be strangers in public.
Self Mutilation Demonstration  -  I can heal from anything. *CHOP!* See?
Just Toying With Them  -  The only reason I haven't finished this battle yet is that you're so much fun.
The Wicked Stage  -  All professions that involve performing on stage are disreputable.
Kick The Morality Pet  -  A character hurts the one and only person to whom they routinely show kindness.
NPC Roadblock  -  An NPC that won't let you pass.
Hollywood Voodoo  -  Fictional voodoo portrayed inaccurately.
Canon Marches On  -  A later main installment directly contradicts what happened in an earlier spinoff, rendering it non-canon.
You Must Be Cold  -  If a woman is cold, a man will give her a coat.
Disproportionate Restitution  -  Compensation far less than what is deserved.
I Do Not Own  -  Putting a disclaimer on fan works saying that you don't own the original work, characters, etc.
Disappointing Last Level  -  Bad final level to an otherwise good game.
More Popular Spin Off  -  A spinoff eclipses the original.
Rare Candy  -  Consumable item that gives a permanent status increase.
Rule Of Perception  -  As far as the audience is concerned, if you can't perceive it, it doesn't exist.
Album Filler  -  Songs that exist on an album for the sole purpose of adding length to the album.
The Case Of  -  A title template for works of mystery and curiousity.
No Place For Me There  -  The world I want can't have me in it.
Encounter Repellant  -  Apply to prevent non-scripted enemy battles.
Reptiles Are Abhorrent  -  Reptiles associated with evil.
Education Mama  -  A parent who cares about their child's grades above all else, often punishing them harshly for anything less than perfection.
Cold Ham  -  What they lack in loudness, they make up for in gravitas.
Lifelines  -  For when you're REALLY stuck on a question.
Training Montage  -  A montage showing someone preparing for a fight to some epic music.
Pooled Funds  -  Swimming in lots of wealth like water.
Personal Horror  -  When a painful betrayal of one's self image, self-loathing, internal conflict, personal failing/flaw or guilt is Played for Drama.
Interrupted Intimacy  -  Someone walks in on a couple having, or about to have sex.
Dead Hat Shot  -  A character is killed, leaving a shot of their Iconic Item (Usually a Nice Hat)
Electronic Speech Impediment  -  Damaged AI have glitchy voices.
Superhero Capital Of The World  -  One location has a surplus of Superheroes and superhero activity.
Armored Coffins  -  A vehicle with no safety or escape features, so that being disabled almost always kills the pilot.
Knitting Pregnancy Announcement  -  Knitting = pregnancy.
Orbital Shot  -  The camera circles around something or someone.
Mama Bear  -  Mess with her kids, and she will kill you.
Man In The Iron Mask  -  A character is held prisoner by another, even though the captive threatens the captor by his very existence.
Easter Bunny  -  Hippity, hoppity bunny who hides eggs (sometimes chocolate) to find on Easter.
Hyperactive Metabolism  -  Video Game Food = Instant health.
Extra Ore Dinary  -  Elemental Powers over metals.
Jail Bait  -  Do not date or sexualize underage characters!
Imported Alien Phlebotinum  -  Applied Phlebotinum collected from aliens or other advanced beings.
Cliche  -  Overused trope or phrase.
Seen It All  -  Nothing surprises me anymore.
Currency Cuisine  -  Money you can eat.
Improperly Placed Firearms  -  Guns that do not fit the setting or how they are used in a work.
Final First Hug  -  A character (especially a parent) only truly expresses affection for someone else when that someone is dying.
Everybody Was Kung Fu Fighting  -  World of Badass: The Martial Arts Edition.
Crack Defeat  -  Losing to someone despite a clear superiority.
Murder By Remote Control Vehicle  -  Hacking a vehicle to kill people remotely.
Proud Scholar Race  -  A race/species that is full of very smart people, or at least culturally values intellectualism and the pursuit of knowledge.
Bifauxnen  -  A masculine-presenting woman who resembles a Pretty Boy.
Mouth Full Of Smokes  -  Why smoke just one cigarette at a time when you can put a whole bunch in your mouth at once?
Totally Radical  -  DUUUUUDE, this is, like, using outdated slang in an attempt to look most excellent!!!
Eject The Loser  -  If you get eliminated, you don't walk out, you get thrown out. Or dropped.
Punchline  -  Trope: The part that ends the joke and makes it funny.
Its Easy So It Sucks  -  Easy games are considered bad.
The Doll Episode  -  Dolls Played for Drama.
Brooklyn Rage  -  Violent and/or badass New Yorker.
The Squadette  -  The Squad has a female soldier in their ranks.
Mage Born Of Muggles  -  Character with ordinary parentage has supernatural abilities.
Level Scaling  -  Higher Character Level = tougher enemies.
Chekhovs Gag  -  That joke was funny! It's also important later on!
Filming Location Cameo  -  Filmed in L.A. + set in New York + characters go on trip = characters visit L.A.
Everyone Is Related  -  Ludicrous levels of main characters being revealed as related to each other.
Mid Review Sketch Show  -  Internet reviews including and/or derailed by storylines.
Bathroom Search Excuse  -  A character claims to be looking for the bathroom as an excuse for being in a restricted area.
Pauper Patches  -  A character living in poverty is wearing clothes that are patched up.
Names To Trust Immediately  -  A character's name displays that they are a good person.
Primal Scene  -  Kid(s) walks in on their parents having sex — awkward.
Medusa  -  Snake-haired woman that you'll get petrified by looking at.
Ate His Gun  -  People putting guns in their mouths and blowing their brains out.
American Gothic Couple  -  Art Imitates Art with Grant Wood's American Gothic.
Classy Cane  -  A cane to look fancy.
Mukokuseki  -  Japanese cartoon characters don't look very Japanese or the characters are Japanese in name only.
Shoot The Television  -  Don't like what's on the tube? Just take the ol' trusty .44 and blast it to pieces!
Just Pennies A Day  -  For just pennies a day, you can help charity for months (when you buy this $100 product now)!
Action Initiative  -  An RPG system that establishes who acts when, particularly in combat.
Archer Archetype  -  A skilled, analytical ranged combatant who doesn't let emotions get in their way.
Like Reality Unless Noted  -  The fictional world is exactly like the real world except where noted otherwise.
Bail Equals Freedom  -  Paying or pledging bail is treated as a fine, leaving you free.
Scared Of Whats Behind You  -  You didn't scare them. Whatever was behind you did.
In Mysterious Ways  -  God does things that don't make sense but (usually) work out right.
The B Grade  -  The Smart Guy gets a less-than-perfect grade for the very first time. Oh, the Humanity!
Death Is A Sad Thing  -  A child/innocent person's first experience with death.
Boss In Mook Clothing  -  A "regular" enemy who is just as hard as a boss.
Guardian Angel  -  Angels that protect you.
Noisy Nature  -  Animals in fiction-land tend to be unnecessarily and unrealistically noisy.
Not A Mask  -  Someone is requested/forced to take off their mask. Except, they're not wearing a mask.
Robot Soldier  -  Robot built for military usage.
Look Both Ways  -  ...Or you'll get hit by a vehicle and die a gory death!
Corrupt Corporate Executive  -  A villain who runs a corporation.
Oddly Visible Eyebrows  -  When eyebrows have maximum priority in visibility.
Widescreen Shot  -  A shot composed to show off its medium's widescreen format
Did I Just Say That Out Loud  -  Speaking aloud when you don't mean to.
Anchors Away  -  Using an anchor as a weapon.
The Tragic Rose  -  The usage of roses to represent a combination of beauty and tragedy.
Keep The Home Fires Burning  -  The story of the hero's lover, friends and/or family back on the home front. Typically has loneliness, worry, courage and sometimes infidelity.
Anti Rage Quitting  -  Ways in which video game developers discourage players from leaving early in multiplayer games.
The Almighty Dollar  -  God(s) of wealth, money, trade, prosperity/abundance, or fortune/luck.
Stock Parody Jokes  -  Okay, we got it, you're a parodist! Now think of something new!
Spin The Earth Backwards  -  Reversing the spin of the Earth.
Our Hero Is Dead  -  Killing the protagonist as a Cliffhanger. He'll get better, though.
Obnoxious In Laws  -  The In-Laws are not friendly people.
Cant Live Without You  -  Kill one and the other dies.
Plug N Play Friends  -  Close friendship is instantaneous. No relationship-building required!
Cop Killer  -  The murder of a law officer is deadly serious business.
Kid Anova  -  A real ladies' man —... er, boy.
Insurance Fraud  -  Cheating the insurance company to get money.
Public Service Announcement  -  TV Tropes Will Ruin Your Life unless you go out and get some fresh air and exercise. This message brought to you by The Fresh Breeze Movement.
Relationship Writing Fumble  -  Accidental subtext makes a platonic relationship come off romantic.
Ronin  -  In feudal Japan: A master-less samurai. In modern Japan: An underperforming student or businessman.
Pompous Political Pundit  -  Politically biased talking head. Frequently a parody or satire of the ones on the Fox News Channel.
Suddenly Fluent In Gibberish  -  Someone can suddenly, inexplicably, communicate with something like an alien or an animal.
Spared But Not Forgiven  -  A character refrains from revenge, but still refuses to forgive their offender.
Rogue Juror  -  One member of a jury votes against the remaining eleven and attempts to convince them to change their minds.
Do Anything Soldier  -  Soldiers taking on multiple roles in combat, sometimes to the point of being a literal One-Man Army.
Protocol Peril  -  Turns out that minor thing you did was a deadly insult in this culture.
Animorphism  -  A human turns into an animal.
The Rant  -  Text underneath a webcomic page/strip that the author can use to give the readers updates.
Hands On Approach  -  Ship Teasing via physical instruction.
I Work Alone  -  A character declines an offer to work with other characters.
Fictional Province  -  A fictional state, province, or similar subdivision of a real-world country.
Girl Of My Dreams  -  Meeting your future Love Interest in a dream.
No Antagonist  -  There is a conflict, but no antagonist or villain that causes it.
Meal Ticket  -  They own what the Gold Digger yearns for.
Theory Of Narrative Causality  -  In the fictional universe, tropes exist as fundamental laws of nature.
Are You Pondering What Im Pondering  -  Long buildup to an obvious conclusion takes a sharp left turn right before the end.
Post Rape Taunt  -  A rapist taunts the hero by gloating (and lying) about how his victim "loved it."
That One Player  -  Player who is too good for anyone else's good.
Organ Theft  -  Stealing people's organs via surgery.
Orphaned Series  -  A work ends prematurely because the creator doesn't want to or can't work on it any longer.
Hands In Pockets  -  Some artists just don't bother drawing certain things that should be there.
The Talk  -  Parent talks to their child about reproduction.
Immortal Assassin  -  An assassin who just can't die... until their target is dead.
Treasure Chest Cavity  -  Hiding a treasure inside a person.
Stage Whisper  -  Conveniently loud enough for the audience to hear.
Shapeshifting Squick  -  A shapeshifting lover opens up a lot of Power Perversion Potential, Unfortunate Implications, or Fridge Horror for you in romantic/sexual situations.
Space Master  -  A character has the ability to control the three spatial dimensions of length, width, and height, to a certain extent.
Upsetting The Balance  -  You upset a universal and/or global balance and are promptly punished for it.
Cannibal Clan  -  Hey Mum, guess who I brought home for dinner?
Bouncing Battler  -  A character who fights by bouncing off walls, ceilings, and other surfaces.
Secret Public Identity  -  Superhero uses their real name.
Credits Gag  -  A joke based on the credits to a program.
Vocal Minority  -  A small group, or group within a group, with a great deal of attention, often negative.
Tech Demo Game  -  A game that shows off a system's capabilities or a new engine the devs are trying out.
Pre Mortem One Liner  -  Something you say to someone before you kill them.
Frozen Fashion Sense  -  Immortal beings don't update their fashions.
Undead Author  -  A story (usually an urban legend) that logically should not be because everyone in the story died and thus no one should be able to pass the tale on.
Jacob Marley Apparel  -  The appearance of a ghost matches exactly what their corporeal form looked like the moment they died.
Warrior Prince  -  A prince that goes into battle.
The Real Spoofbusters  -  Stock Parodies of the Ghostbusters.
Safety Worst  -  Safety precautions taken to such an extent that they're impractical and/or no fun.
Righteous Rabbit  -  Rabbit characters tend to be good-aligned.
Misogyny Song  -  A song made to hate on a gender; usually women.
Playing Doctor  -  Children playing games based on their curiosity about what the opposite sex looks like without clothes on.
Bragging Rights Option  -  Not many choose this option, but those who do and succeed earn mad props.
Tsundere  -  Sour exterior, sweet interior, or vice versa.
Fandom Nod  -  Author adds a scene to confirm or deny a fan theory.
Solid Gold Poop  -  Highly valuable biological waste material (spit, tears, urine, fecal matter, vomit, etc.).
Unlockable Content  -  Content you get by playing the game, but don't need to win the game.
Unaffected By Spice  -  Minimal reaction, if any, to spicy stuff.
Popular Is Dumb  -  All popularity and no brains
Bland Name Product  -  The brand names you see in fiction that seem oddly familiar.
Spinosaurus Versus T Rex  -  Whenever a Spinosaurus and a Tyrannosaurus rex appear in the same work, they always have a fight, in a Shout-Out to Jurassic Park III.
Weird Historical War  -  A fictional version of a real war with fantastical elements.
Dynamic Entry  -  A previously unseen character makes themself known with a dramatic attack.
Advanced Ancient Humans  -  Humans had an advanced technological society long before our current one.
Shoot The Shaggy Dog  -  A tragic ending where the protagonist's efforts are All for Nothing.
Break The Cutie  -  A sweet, lovable character is put through hell.
No Sense Of Direction  -  Characters get lost going through doorways.
Family Friendly Mature Content  -  Content, usually a Show Within a Show, that bears a higher maturity rating than the content it's in.
Neon City  -  Bright city lights used to characterise a setting.
Out Of The Ghetto  -  A work within a normally niche interest/genre finds success among a broader general audience.
Description Cut  -  Someone mentions another person will do something, and they do the complete opposite of that.
Hollywood Dress Code  -  Characterization = Clothes.
Sibling Rivalry  -  Two siblings have a rivalry.
In Their Own Image  -  A character tries to destroy the world and remake it on very self-serving terms.
Paranoia Gambit  -  Inducing frenzied paranoia on someone through false promises of retribution.
Proactive Boss  -  The boss personally impedes/attacks you even before you reach the actual Boss Battle.
Killer Game Master  -  This GM is out to kill you.
Religion Rant Song  -  A song that criticizes religion.
Sapient Eat Sapient  -  A sapient creature eats another despite that it is of equal sapience to it.
You Go Girl  -  A girl proves that she's as good as the boys in athletics.
Ostrich Head Hiding  -  An ostrich with its head stuck under the ground.
Bash Brothers  -  A team of two who kick major amounts of ass together.
Memory Gambit  -  Temporarily sacrificing your own memories for tactical advantage.
Colonel Badass  -  Badass military leader.
Will They Or Wont They  -  Characters are constantly the targets of Ship Tease, but they keep dancing around the point.
Betty And Veronica  -  Two love interests in a Love Triangle: one a sweet, "familiar", down to earth Girl Next Door, and the other sensually "exotic", who can be aloof or hot-tempered on the outside, but sweet on the inside.
Prison Changes People  -  A character goes to prison. It changes them.
Nominal Hero  -  A character who advances a heroic cause, but doesn't have any heroic motivations.
Cloning Blues  -  Being a clone leads to character angst.
Virginity Makes You Stupid  -  Virgins are dumb.
Explosive Decompression  -  A sudden shift in pressure makes your everything asplode.
The Body Parts That Must Not Be Named  -  A work uses euphemisms to avoid mentioning, uh, the bathing suit area.
Counterpoint Duet  -  Separate characters unknowingly sing a duet.
Fully Embraced Fiend  -  A vampire, werewolf or similar creature embraces their monstrous nature rather than fight it.
Censor Box  -  We can't show that on TV! Put an obvious censor over it!
Quantity Vs Quality  -  Quality and quantity are inversely related.
Limited Use Magical Device  -  A magical item that allows a spell to be cast a limited amount of times before being consumed.
Beleaguered Bureaucrat  -  A public servant with more work than they can handle.
Corrupt Quartermaster  -  The person in charge of a unit's supplies is a swindler.
Fully Absorbed Finale  -  A series receives an ending in another series.
Bothering By The Book  -  Subversive compliance.
Unexplained Accent  -  Character has an accent that the actor does not naturally have even though other characters with the same background do not have it.
A Weighty Aesop  -  A lesson where characters learn to eat healthier foods.
Prefers Rocks To Pillows  -  A character used to sleeping on hard surfaces has difficulty adjusting to a real bed.
Axes At School  -  Someone brings a weapon to class. What Could Possibly Go Wrong?
Labcoat Of Science And Medicine  -  Labcoats use as an indicator that someone is a scientist and/or medical doctor.
Highly Visible Ninja  -  Ninja have no need for stealth!
Fantasy Keepsake  -  Someone returns from an adventure in a Magical Land that they think may have been All Just a Dream and then they find a souvenir proving the adventure was real.
Bill Bill Junk Bill  -  Quick series of voiced snap judgements.
Ancient Astronauts  -  Sufficiently Advanced Aliens have had contact with humanity in the past, shaping Earth's myths and ancient civilizations.
See Thru Specs  -  Glasses that break the Weirdness Censor.
Not In Front Of The Kid  -  One character censors themselves or others for in-universe reasons.
Raven Hair Ivory Skin  -  Pale skin, black hair, beautiful.
All Your Base Are Belong To Us  -  A major attack on the good guys' home base.
Bedlam House  -  An old-fashioned and horrifying madhouse.
Reports Of My Death Were Greatly Exaggerated  -  No, I'm not dead.
Bumbling Dad  -  This family man is kind of a moron.

The Door Slams You  -  Accidentally hitting someone with a door.
Blonde Republican Sex Kitten  -  Attractive, female, conservative to show that they're not all old white men.
Playboy Bunny  -  Rabbit-inspired suit for Fanservice.
Generic Doomsday Villain  -  A villain without coherent motivation, goals, or personality, defined solely by the threat they pose.
Broken Aesop  -  A story's narrative defies its message.
No Romantic Resolution  -  A romantic arc occurs, but is not resolved.
Trap Is The Only Option  -  An incredibly obvious trap that someone willing triggers for the sake of advancing.
Believing Their Own Lies  -  A Consummate Liar tells Blatant Lies so passionately and so often, even they start to fall for it.
Kind Restraints  -  Restricting a character in order to prevent them from harming themselves or others.
Rape And Switch  -  Rape victims become homosexual.
PG Explosives  -  Explosions that kill, but in a non-graphic fashion.
Crisis Makes Perfect  -  A character masters a skill during intense, life-threatening pressure.
Tan Lines  -  Where some parts of the skin are tanned while other parts (usually where clothes were worn) are not.
One Scene Wonder  -  A minor character's sole scene is also one of the most memorable.
Do Not Adjust Your Set  -  Somebody takes over all TV channels for a special message.

Savage Setpiece  -  If you don't bother this powerful enemy, it won't bother you.

Dress Hits Floor  -  A woman strips down and we get a shot of her legs as her clothing hits the floor.
Rising Up The Food Chain Game  -  Eat smaller creatures to grow.

Sibling Murder  -  Sibling killing sibling.
Baby Be Mine  -  A woman fixated on having a child turns to theft.
Memetic Hand Gesture  -  A hand gesture has become iconic, a meme, or a running gag.
Going Native  -  The Trope: Character becomes part of a culture that was foreign to them.
Astral Checkerboard Decor  -  A checkerboard floor indicates otherworldly locations.
Freaky Funeral Forms  -  Being disturbed by another culture's funerary customs.
Instant Death Stab  -  Immediate demise follows being penetrated or slashed with a bladed weapon.
Constrained Writing  -  A Self-Imposed Challenge by a writer.
Mountaintop Healthcare  -  A hospital, sanatorium or health resort built on a mountain.
Mary Tzu  -  A Mary Sue who is an unrealistically effective tactician.
Gothic Country Music  -  Dark, macabre Country Music.
Moonwalk Dance  -  Walking forward while moving backwards.
Genius Loci  -  The setting itself is sentient.

Friend On The Force  -  A character's friend is a police officer
Artistic License Biology  -  Inaccuracies in biological fact in a work of fiction, in the service of the story.
Cerebus Rollercoaster  -  A story that keeps shifting from dramatic periods and light-hearted periods.
Domino Mask  -  You call this a mask? All it covers is the skin around your eyes!
Final Boss New Dimension  -  The last battle is in another dimension.
Chocolate Baby  -  The child looks nothing like their supposed parents, implying infidelity.
Clue From Ed  -  The editor of a publication cites other works from the same continuity.
Fictional Currency  -  A currency that does not exist outside of a work.
Race Name Basis  -  Someone is referred to solely by their race.
Holy Halo  -  Halos over your head make you angelic-looking!
Mayan Doomsday  -  December 21, 2012. The End of the World as We Know It...which didn't happen, but that doesn't stop it from being a popular topic in fiction.
Gag Nose  -  A weird and funny-looking nose used for comedy.
Sword Of Damocles  -  A really big weapon to keep everybody in line.

The Key Is Behind The Lock  -  The key is inside what it unlocks.
Going To Give It More Energy  -  Disabling a target by giving it more power than it can handle.

Villains Want Mercy  -  Villains who beg for mercy upon defeat.

Visual Kei  -  A genre of music based on visual artistry and stagecraft being as important as the music, which originated in Japan but can be and is used by non-Japanese musicians.
Non Nazi Swastika  -  There may be a Swastika on an ancient Buddhist temple; that Swastika has nothing to do with Nazism.
My Hovercraft Is Full Of Eels  -  A character's dialogue is comically mangled by a poor grasp of the language he or she is speaking.
Joisey  -  America's other Butt-Monkey.

Insult To Rocks  -  No standard negative comparison can convey accurately how bad this is.

Jungle Jazz  -  Jungle settings are associated with jazz music.

Infinite Supplies  -  Characters can't run out of what they need, ever.

Jet Pack  -  A jet powered backpack that allows flight.

Animal Gender Bender  -  An animal has sexually dimorphic traits that don't apply to their gender.
Fluffy Cloud Heaven  -  Theme Park Heaven.
Batter Up  -  Using a baseball bat as a Weapon of Choice. Three strikes and you're out.

Open Says Me  -  Kicking or smashing a door in.

Likes Older Women  -  They prefer more mature women.

Bad Bad Acting  -  Bad actors in a Show Within a Show don't resemble what actual bad actors are like.

High Speed Train Reroute  -  When someone has to redirect their ride (usually something on rails) while it is moving.

See Water  -  Underwater visibility is perfect in fiction.

Faking The Dead  -  A character fakes their own death for specific reasons.
Heart In The Wrong Place  -  Because you feel your heartbeat strongest of the left side of your chest, some fiction portrays it as actually being on the left side, where your lung actually is, instead of the center.
Black Boss Lady  -  A Black woman in charge of mostly men in a normally male-dominated area or position.

Stealth Parody  -  When a parody is set-up to be taken seriously by the people it's mocking.
Your Mime Makes It Real  -  Objects mimicked by a mime work as if they were real.
One Person Birthday Party  -  No one is attending the character's birthday party.
Peerless Love Interest  -  A Love Interest who is heavily idealized by their admirer, often to the point of being romantically unobtainable.
Common Crossover  -  Crossovers that fans wish were real.
Very Loosely Based On A True Story  -  While based on true events, the story is heavily fictionalized from the real one.
New Powers As The Plot Demands  -  Conveniently gained abilities.
Doctors Orders  -  Doctors agree: even authorities must obey doctors.
Legendary Carp  -  Carps in media, especially ones that pay homage to Japanese history, tend to have mystical properties.
Losing Horns  -  Wah-wah-wah-waaaaaaaaaaah...
Censor Suds  -  A character has their naughty bits covered up by suds, usually after bathing or showering.
Playing Gertrude  -  Actress's character is much older than the other characters, but the actress isn't.
Circling Monologue  -  Villain walks circles around the hero during negotiations.
Amusing Injuries  -  Rule of Funny means slapstick injuries don't have lasting consequences.
Plot Armor  -  Character survives mortal perils despite extreme odds with the main reason being they are significant to the plot.
Nobody Here But Us Statues  -  A character hides by pretending to be a statue or something similar.
Dan Browned  -  He claimed it was true and accurate. It's not.
Sexy Coat Flashing  -  Opening up a coat to show a character's wearing very little.
Contamination Situation  -  A main character gets exposed to some deadly disease and gets contaminated, allowing for character development.
The Stinger  -  A scene after the end of the program.
Beastly Bloodsports  -  Animals fighting humans or other animals to the death for sport.
Russia Takes Over The World  -  Amid World War III, either a Cold War Soviet Russia or The New Russia manages to take over the world.

Player Data Sharing  -  Integrating user-generated parts of one player's single player campaign into another's.
Wake Up Call  -  A complacent or apathetic character goes through an event that convinces them to get their act together.
Ab Urbe Condita  -  Time measured from the founding of the city of Ancient Rome.
Critical Hit Class  -  A class or character's strategy is based on getting critical hits.
Flower Pot Drop  -  A flower pot falls and hits you on the head.
The Teetotaler  -  Doesn't drink alcohol.
Functional Magic  -  Different views of magic.
Extreme Graphical Representation  -  TV computers use large visual effects so the audience knows somethings happening.
Scenic Tour Level  -  A scenic entrance.
Two Act Structure  -  A piece of media switching tones halfway through
Pain To The Ass  -  Pain and violence applied to the ass makes great comedy
Knight Templar  -  Villain who thinks they're the hero.
Yin Yang Clash  -  What happens when undefeatable absolutes come into conflict?
Amphibious Automobile  -  Vehicles that can be driven on land and water.
Sabotage To Discredit  -  Sabotaging an invention or any new technology to turn the public against it.
Fallen Cupid  -  Cupid imagery Played For Evil.
Magical Seventh Son  -  The seventh son of a seventh son has magical powers.
Road Sign Reversal  -  Flipping a road sign. Or two.
Questionable Consent  -  Situations where it is uncertain consent is given, or where consent is given on shaky grounds.
Cynic Idealist Duo  -  A duo consisting of one character who sees the world negatively and the other who sees the world positively.
Psycho Psychologist  -  A psychiatrist who uses psychology to hurt people.
Misplaced Kindergarten Teacher  -  Someone who talks to teenagers or fully-grown adults as if they were kindergartners.
Did You Just Flip Off Cthulhu  -  Taunting an enemy even though you know they're MUCH more powerful than you.
Capepunk  -  Everyone is a Super played foe-realz.
Plucky Girl  -  Optimistic female Determinator.
Fallacy Fallacy  -  Declaring a conclusion to be incorrect just because the argument for it is fallacious, even though the point being made could simply be Right for the Wrong Reasons.
Planet England  -  The name of the part of the setting we're familiar with eventually becomes the name of the setting in general.
Like That Show But With Mecha  -  A show that doesn't contain Humongous Mecha has its premise recycled to include them.
Fur And Loathing  -  Villains wear fur.
Horse Of A Different Color  -  Creatures that can be ridden like a horse.
Spiritual Crossover  -  A crossover with actual characters on one side, and Captain Ersatzes in the other.
Inexplicable Treasure Chests  -  Who put that box full of benefits here?
Engineered Heroics  -  Someone fakes a dangerous situation so they can conveniently solve it.
The Points Mean Nothing  -  Points don't really matter.
Fake Faith Healer  -  A Phony Psychic / Sinister Minister who cheats the sick and injured.
Inherently Attractive Profession  -  Characters find people with certain jobs attractive in part because of the jobs themselves.
Viewers Are Geniuses  -  The creators overestimate their average viewer's intelligence.
From Camouflage To Criminal  -  A former member of the military turns to a life of crime, putting the lethal skills they learned in the military to use in doing so.
Higher Understanding Through Drugs  -  Drugs help someone understand things better.
Dread Zeppelin  -  Airships are associated with bad guys.
Innocent Bystander  -  Character unluckily thrust into peril with no prior intention to do so. Usually a minor or extra character.
Anvilicious  -  An Aesop is enforced excessively.
She Is All Grown Up  -  Puberty turned him or her into a very nice-looking adult.
Boarding Party  -  Attacking a boat by jumping/swinging overboard in cool, pirate style.
Period Piece  -  Stories that take place in the past.
By The Eyes Of The Blind  -  Creature/character can only be seen by certain people.
Unsettling Gender Reveal  -  A character's sex turns out to be different than what someone who was romantically attracted to them thought it was, squicking out that suitor.
Engineered Public Confession  -  A private confession is secretly made public.
Losing A Shoe In The Struggle  -  A physical altercation causes a non-titillating loss of a piece of clothing.
Small Name Big Ego  -  Character who thinks they're better than they really are.
Uncanny Valley  -  An unsettling grey area between realism and stylization.
A Tankard Of Moose Urine  -  This beer tastes like piss.
Tanks For Nothing  -  When tanks are useless in media.
Art Style Dissonance  -  An Art-style that doesn't match the story and setting.
Crapsack Only By Comparison  -  Dystopian only to the characters, but not really that bad.
R Rated Opening  -  Making the opening family-unfriendly to make sure from the beginning that the audience doesn't think it's for kids.
Digital Head Swap  -  Placing one character's head on another character's body via special effects.
Human Hummingbird  -  Their limbs flail so fast, you can barely see them.
A Deadly Affair  -  Infidelity leads to murder.
Straw Hypocrite  -  Someone pretending to follow a cause, but does not actually believe in it and uses it as a cover to another end.
Corruption By A Minor  -  A child tricks an adult into committing a crime.
Professor Guinea Pig  -  Experimenting on oneself.
Wacky Marriage Proposal  -  Proposing marriage to the one you love in the most over-the-top way possible.
Job Stealing Robot  -  Advances in technology replacing labor-heavy jobs with robots.
My New Gift Is Lame  -  A character gets a pretty disappointing gift, usually when everyone else gets something cool.
Busmans Vocabulary  -  Someone using their profession's jargon outside of the profession.
Art Evolution  -  Artist's drawings change as the series goes on.
Booby Trap  -  An elaborate and usually hidden trap that activates via trigger.
Raiju  -  A lightning-based Youkai of Japanese Folklore.
They Would Cut You Up  -  Innocent people captured for dissection and other experiments.
Informed Flaw  -  When a character's flaw does nothing for the plot.
Nice Guys Finish Last  -  Women will always reject nice guys in favor of Jerkasses.
Gendered Insult  -  Gender-based insults.
Cynical Mentor  -  The mentor of the hero who is pessimistic and doesn't care about him.
Critical Annoyance  -  Annoying sounds that play when your health is low or you're screwing up your mission.
Master Of Delusion  -  Constantly stops short of finding the truth.
Punished With Ugly  -  Losing your physical beauty can be A Fate Worse Than Death.
Struggling Single Mother  -  A single mom who struggles to provide for her child or children.
Rule Of Funny  -  Laughter suspends disbelief.
Sinister Minister  -  A morally bankrupt clergyman.
Tabloid Melodrama  -  The lives of celebrities are exploited for melodrama by the press.
The Worf Effect  -  A supposedly powerful fighter is easily defeated for the purpose of showing how strong his opponent is.
Amplifier Artifact  -  Boosts already existing powers, without creating new ones.
MRS Degree  -  A woman goes to college to find a husband.
Monster From Beyond The Veil  -  Resurrected person becomes a monster.
Competition Freak  -  No matter how small the challenge, winning is everything for this character.
Toplessness From The Back  -  A topless or naked woman seen only from the waist-up from behind.
Three Act Structure  -  A narrative structure used to divide a story into three parts: a beginning (introduction), a middle (rising action and crisis), and an end (falling action and dénouement), with the last two being usually divided by The Climax in the story.
Half Witted Hillbilly  -  When characters from rural areas are portrayed as being backward, ignorant, or outright stupid.
Tis Only A Bullet In The Brain  -  Sometimes, it takes more than one Boom, Headshot! to kill someone.
Going To See The Elephant  -  They weren't trying to start the plot, they were just going on a meaningless trip.
Mighty Whitey And Mellow Yellow  -  Mighty Whitey and his docile Asian female.
Heroic Second Wind  -  The protagonist gets new strength to continue the fight.
Their First Time  -  Two people engaging in their first ever sexual intercourse.
Do Not Call Me Paul  -  A character disregards their given name for personal reasons.
Bird Poop Gag  -  That moment when the birds go splat.
What Cliffhanger  -  A Cliffhanger which promises that something exciting will happen in the next installment, but gives no details whatsoever.
Nerds Speak Klingon  -  Ability to speak fictional languages as a trait of geeks.
Sidekick Graduations Stick  -  The Sidekick becomes a hero in their own right.
Smart Mark  -  A section of the Professional Wrestling fandom that has some actual (if limited) understanding of the business' inner workings.
Uncle Sam Wants You  -  USA Propaganda using Uncle Sam
Psychic Strangle  -  Telekinetic strangulation.
Badass Israeli  -  Citizens of Israel are a special kind of badass.
Sphere Of Destruction  -  Explosives are portrayed as having an Arbitrary Maximum Range.
Greater Need Than Mine  -  Doing deeds for someone else since they're more important than yours.
Meat Sack Robot  -  A reverse cyborg: A remote or non-biological AI operated robot with biological components incorporated into itself.
Dice Roll Death  -  Bad luck or random chance means you die.
Ultimate Universe  -  A modernized remake in the same medium as the original, which takes place in its own universe.
Placebo Eureka Moment  -  Someone figures out a solution by themselves just by explaining the problem aloud to another, yet still gives the listener credit.
Supporting Leader  -  A leader who isn't The Protagonist.
Brown Note  -  Some sort of sensory input (such as a sound or image) that has a physical or psychological effect on anyone who sees or hears it.
Piano Drop  -  Anvils are hard to find. Dropping a piano on someone's head works just as well.
Crush The Keepsake  -  A villain Kicks the Dog by destroying someones prized keepsake.
Throw Em To The Wolves  -  The hero decides to leave a villain for less merciful forces.
Recycled Trailer Music  -  Music in a trailer that is from another work.
Deceptively Human Robots  -  A robot that is less human-like than it outwardly appears.
First Person Smartass  -  Snarky first-person narrator.
These Hands Have Killed  -  Character looks down at his hands the first time he has killed.
Dilating Door  -  A large mechanical iris used as a door.
Gas Leak Coverup  -  People with the power to do so cover up an unnatural incident with an imagined gas leak or something similar.
Matzo Fever  -  A character is attracted to Jews.
Backup Twin  -  A character is killed off, but the actor returns as that character's hitherto unseen (usually twin) sibling.
Fire Purifies  -  Fire is very effective against evil.
Scooby Doo Hoax  -  Reportedly paranormal activity turns out to be faked as a cover for some other goal.
Do Well But Not Perfect  -  The game requires a B-grade performance, but nothing higher, to complete an objective.
Cant Argue With Elves  -  A race that's always right. Always.
Video Game Delegation Penalty  -  Why are NPCs so bad at this?
Absence Makes The Heart Go Yonder  -  When a couple is separated, one of the pair starts a new relationship with someone else.
The Meddling Kids Are Useless  -  You watch the characters watch someone else solve everything.
May December Romance  -  An Age-Gap Romance where one partner is younger than 40 while the other one is 60 or older with at least a 30 years age difference between them.
The Fatalist  -  Fate says so, so no point in trying to fight it.
Uncertain Doom  -  The audience (and often the creators) can't confirm whether a character died.
Ten Little Murder Victims  -  People are dying and the killer is laughing at us. One of us is The Mole! But who?
Conversation Cut  -  When the scene changes during a conversation, to reveal more information about the setting, etc.
Hates Being Touched  -  Tactile input disturbs this character.
Chronic Hero Syndrome  -  An extreme urge to help everyone; villain optional.
Fat Best Friend  -  Best friend of the main character is overweight, and also either proud, shy, or weird.
Tank Tread Mecha  -  Mechas with tank treads in place of legs. Alternatively, tanks with arms.
Rapid Fire Name Guessing  -  Character swears they remember someone else's name, but repeated attempts to recall it fail.
So Okay Its Average  -  Works of completely average quality.
Reverse Escort Mission  -  Escort Mission, except the player is the escortee of an NPC.
Sanity Meter  -  Going Mad From The Revelation as a gameplay mechanic.
Boobs Of Steel  -  The best female physical fighter on the team or a work's cast has the largest breasts.
Rack Focus  -  Focusing on something from the foreground to something in the background or vice versa.
Hot Coffee Minigame  -  Hot sex as a minor mission in a video game.
Talker And Doer  -  One makes things, the other sells them.
Whip Sword  -  Sword that extends into a whip.
Glad Hes On Our Side  -  ...Because if he was our enemy, we'd be screwed.
Slobs Versus Snobs  -  A conflict involving arrogant aristocrats and the unrefined slackers.
Kill And Replace  -  A character murders another and takes their identity, usually by adapting their own appearance.
The Anticipator  -  No matter how hard you try to get the drop on them, this character is always expecting you.
Incestant Admirer  -  When someone clearly wants a very inappropriate relationship with their relative, who doesn't return the sentiment.
I Hate You Vampire Dad  -  You turned me into a monster! I HATE YOU!
Cloak And Dagger  -  Trope: Espionage is exciting and dangerous.
Danger In The Galactic Core  -  The center of the galaxy is bad news!
Great Gazoo  -  Eccentric, possibly immature character with incredible powers.
Southern Belle  -  A Dainty Nice Girl from the American South.
Overly Long Fighting Animation  -  The animators get a little too carried away when a character unleashes their Limit Break.
Asinine Alternate Activity  -  The lame alternative to the cool thing a character wants to do.
Narcissist  -  An extremely arrogant and self-centered character who lacks empathy yet is obsessed with possessing others' unwavering devotion and respect.
Recursive Fanfiction  -  A Fanfic based on a Fanfic.
The Trickster  -  For all things conventional and orderly, this character isn't.
Ice Magic Is Water  -  In media where characters have elemental affinities, ice and water are interchangeable.
Magical Clown  -  A clown or jester with magical powers.
Feed By Example  -  Tasting food in front of another person or animal, in order to get them to eat it.
Plot Relevant Age Up  -  Young characters age as the plot demands.
Shoot The Rope  -  You have to shoot the rope.
Creepy Cave  -  Caves are portrayed as scary, dangerous, and home to evil things.
Baby Morph Episode  -  An episode where a character or characters turn into babies.
Cure For Cancer  -  A miracle cure for a super disease.
Screw Yourself  -  Character gets intimate with a copy of themself.
Instant Birth Just Add Water  -  The baby's ready to come out right after the water breaking.
Hollywood Natives  -  An outdated and derogatory depiction of natives in a faraway land, complete with facepaint, crude clothing, and bestial behavior.
My Eyes Are Up Here  -  A woman tells a man to stop looking at her breasts.
Hit Stop  -  As something hits, the time slows down to show impact.
Dressed Like A Dominatrix  -  An evil or antiheroic woman wears a costume inspired by dominatrices, while not actually being one.
Readings Blew Up The Scale  -  A measuring device gets destroyed because the thing it's measuring is so high.
Rhyming Episode  -  An episode that is in rhymes.
Older Is Better  -  Things built in ages past are better than modern stuff.
God Is Displeased  -  The gods withdraw their protection over a slight.
Wanted Poster  -  Poster bearing information about a fugitive whom the authorities wish to apprehend.
Not So Episodic  -  Seemingly self-contained early episodes actually set up a strong myth arc.
Last Lousy Point  -  100% Completion is much harder than 99.9% Completion.
High Collar Of Doom  -  High collars just scream villainy.
Bigot Vs Bigot  -  Two bigots oppose each other.
Comic Book Movies Dont Use Codenames  -  A film adapted from a comic book never or rarely uses the colorful codenames of the heroes/villains.
Evil Old Folks  -  Elderly villains.
Fake Wizardry  -  Stage-based smoke-and-mirrors "magic" passed off as real sorcery in Standard Fantasy Setting.
House Rules  -  Player-created rules for a game as opposed to the rules the game comes with.
Murder By Cremation  -  Burning someone, alive or dead, in a cremation oven.
Gun Struggle  -  Two characters fighting over control of one gun.
No Inner Fourth Wall  -  Elements of a show and its Show Within a Show interact with each other.
One Episode Wonder  -  Shows that only last one episode.
Rhymes On A Dime  -  Character(s) loves to speak in rhyme,
Racist Grandma  -  A racist elder.
Hidden Depths  -  Character has more to them than meets the eye.
Bad With The Bone  -  Using a bone as a weapon.
Once Done Never Forgotten  -  A character will be constantly reminded of something they did that they'd rather forget.
Significant Anagram  -  A scrambled name or phrase reveals something important.
Villain Reveals The Secret  -  A character's or a group's secret is revealed by the villain.
Authors Saving Throw  -  A change made to a work in response to negative fan reception, in an attempt at making things better.
Gum In Hair  -  A character gets gum stuck in their hair.
The Ditz  -  A character whose defining trait is being dumb.
Introdump  -  The main characters all get introduced right at the start.
Merger Of Souls  -  Two or more souls fuse into a single soul.
House Husband  -  Daddy stays at home doing the house chores.
Trojan Gauntlet  -  It's embarrassing to go buy condoms!
The Nose Knows  -  Just follow your nose for the fruity taste that shows.
Headbutting Heroes  -  Good guys who hate each other.
The Plague  -  A widespread contagious disease.
Publicity Stunt  -  Scheme to promote one's products or services.
Man On Fire  -  People burn very easily.
Woobie Destroyer Of Worlds  -  He wants to bring The End of the World as We Know It ... and you sympathise with him.
Adaptational Late Appearance  -  A character or plot device appears later in the adaptation than they did in the source material.
Screw The Rules They Broke Them First  -  Once broken, rules are invalid.
Blood Brothers  -  Two people don't need to be biologically related to call each other brothers or sisters.
Amnesiac Villain Joins The Heroes  -  A villain working for the heroes and is in the good side only because they forgot their own identity and their past.
Suck Sessor  -  A seemingly superior successor to someone is actually even worse.
The Stoic  -  A character who shows little to no emotion.
Wowing Cthulhu  -  A lesser being is able to surprise or impress a being far greater or bigger than them. Often godly ones.
Information Wants To Be Free  -  Heroes want to share vital information even if others try to stop them.
Creepy Doll  -  Dolls used as creepy characters or props.
Infernal Paradise  -  My religion's idea of Heaven is most people's idea of Hell.
Became Their Own Antithesis  -  A character ends up becoming someone that completely contradicts their own former values.
Modesty Bedsheet  -  Bedlinen as a cure for nudity.
Rope Bridge  -  If you have to cross a rope bridge over a deep chasm, it will collapse or threaten to collapse.
The Mentally Disturbed  -  Mental illnesses are treated as just character flaws instead of the debilitating condition that it is.
Inconvenient Attraction  -  Someone who doesn't want to fall in love falls in love.
Night Of The Living Mooks  -  Undead henchmen with no personality.
Constellations  -  Hey, that group of stars look like...
The Grotesque  -  Ugliness so extreme it elicits pity instead of disgust.
Naked Freak Out  -  An attractive character is publicly stripped down naked.
Mundane Ghost Story  -  Horror story centered on mundane, rational fears.
Age Is Relative  -  The more competent or mature you are, the older you look.
The Pornomancer  -  As opposed to those looking for sex, sex always seems to find this character.
Too Good To Last  -  A well-received series suddenly gets cancelled after only a short run.
Eaten Alive  -  A character is eaten while still alive.
Only Smart People May Pass  -  Only folks who can figure this out may pass.
Vagina Dentata  -  Vertical mouth that looks like a vagina with teeth.
Frills Of Justice  -  With great power comes great accessorizing.
But Wait Theres More  -  An extra offer for an infomercial product.
I Have Brothers  -  Female characters learn "male" skills from brother(s).
Internalized Categorism  -  I'm one of those people? I must be worthless, evil, stupid, or whatever it is that people think about people like me!
Americans Hate Tingle  -  Something popular in the country of origin is hated somewhere else.
Showdown At High Noon  -  That epic gunslinger showdown, western style.
Recursive Crossdressing  -  Man dressed as woman dressed as man, or vice versa.
Real Men Cook  -  Cooking as a manly skill.
Game Of The Year Edition  -  A re-release of a video game with all the add-ons preinstalled.
Bug Buzz  -  Insects that make hideously annoying buzzing sound- *swats fly*
Felony Murder  -  If someone dies because you committed a felony, that's murder.
The Namesake  -  What? Why do they call it that? This story has nothing to do with the title!
Leaf Boat  -  A boat...that's actually a leaf.
Volcanic Veins  -  Supernatural powers make your veins glow.
Shadow Archetype  -  A character that embodies something another character does not like about themselves.
You All Meet In A Cell  -  Story begins with characters in captivity.
Secondary Character Title  -  The character of a self-titled work is really a Deuteragonist of sorts.
Was Actually Friendly  -  A group of people that appears scary and/or evil is actually nice.
Heel Face Mole  -  The villain fakes a HeelFace Turn in order to infiltrate the hero's side.
Transgender Fetishization  -  A gender-nonconforming character is hypersexualized by the story.
Demoted To Satellite Love Interest  -  A prominent character becomes a Satellite Love Interest.
Lilliputians  -  People whose height can be measured in inches (or centimeters).
Theme Deck  -  Out of an expansive combat move set, only a select few see regular use.
Dead Man Writing  -  Writing a last message meant to be delivered after your death.
Everyone Is Christian At Christmas  -  Non-Christians (who are also generally not agnostic either) celebrating Christmas.
Schrodingers Cast  -  A character who was Spared by the Adaptation or suffered Death by Adaptation later becomes a plot point in the original work, and the adaptation has to figure out how to work around it.
Anti Magic  -  A power that negates other powers.
File Mixup  -  Important records (like bills or medical papers) get mixed up.
Sex As Rite Of Passage  -  Intercourse turns you into an adult.
Meido  -  Moe-ified female domestic servant.
Ghost Reunion Ending  -  Ghosts reunite in the afterlife.
Dracolich  -  Undead Dragons.
Flechette Storm  -  Throwing a bunch of pointy/sharp projectiles at once, often rapidly.
No Cure For Evil  -  Bad guys don't get healing powers.
Move Along Nothing To See Here  -  Somebody lies that there is "nothing to see here" to cover up something interesting.
Not So Safe Harbor  -  Harbors are dangerous, usually because of pirates or boisterous sailors.
Not Available In Stores  -  During a commercial, it is said the item advertised is not available in stores.
Why We Are Bummed Communism Fell  -  The "wind of change" came with major downsides.
Window Love  -  Love cannot be separated by glass windows in a prison.
Writing Around Trademarks  -  What do you mean this name was already trademarked!? Oh well, I'll just change it a bit!
Mistaken For An Imposter  -  You've been mistaken for someone else — someone who is disguised as you.
Plot Based Voice Cancellation  -  It is important that the audience know the context of some dialogue, while not knowing the content.
More Popular Replacement  -  Opposite of Replacement Scrappy where the replacement character is more popular than the original.
Troubled Child  -  This kid has issues.
Closet Geek  -  They're a geek, and they try their hardest to hide that fact.
Basement Dweller  -  A comical loser who lives with his parents.
Distinction Without A Difference  -  Pretending two things differ when they're functionally the same.
You Call That A Wound  -  In video games, important characters can be revived if killed.
Meet Your Early Installment Weirdness  -  Characters in a Long Runner meet themselves the way they looked when the run first began.
Worth It  -  A character decides that the payoff was worth the cost of the ensuing disaster and/or chaos.
Southpaw Advantage  -  A character's left-handedness gives him an advantage.
Driving Question  -  The big mystery.
Spikes Of Villainy  -  Spikes on a costume indicate evil.
Garden Of Love  -  Romance expressed in lush gardens.
Being Human Sucks  -  A character believes being human is worse than being some other sapient lifeform.
Shameless Fanservice Girl  -  Character knows and understands the nudity taboo, but doesn't care about being naked.
Both Order And Chaos Are Dangerous  -  This work goes into why picking either extreme of Order Versus Chaos is not a good idea.
Self Destruct Mechanism  -  Something that turns into a bomb when necessary.
Buried Alive  -  Exactly what it says on the tin. Or tombstone, rather.
Hermetic Magic  -  Magic can do literally anything but you must create a unique ritual for it.
Cluster F Bomb  -  Fucking frequently fucking repeated fucking expletive fucking.
Anvil On Head  -  Character is comically hit by a weighty falling object (usually an anvil).
No Man Of Woman Born  -  A seemingly impossible condition is ultimately met in an unexpected way.
Previews Pulse  -  A chord used in trailers to build up mystery and suspense.
Periphery Demographic  -  Fans of a work that are outside its primary target demographic.
Jewish Smartass  -  Jews are stereotyped as being more sarcastic than other demographics.
Ensemble Darkhorse  -  A relatively minor character becomes unexpectedly popular among fans.
Tournament Play  -  Hard Core gamers duke it out, for real.
The Gimmick  -  A character that uses unconventional means to stand out from the crowd.
Deja Vu  -  The odd sensation of already having experienced the current moment.
Jump Off A Bridge Rebuttal  -  Snappy comebacks for the suggestion that you're just a conformist.
Fossil Revival  -  Fossilized dead creatures brought Back from the Dead.
Princess Protagonist  -  A princess as the heroine or main character in a story.
Forgotten Birthday  -  No one notices a character's birthday.
Not Playing Fair With Resources  -  The computer gets extra resources for nothing.
Bring Help Back  -  Someone is asked to go and bring back help for the rest of the group in trouble.
The Prophecy  -  A prophetic vision that drives the plot.
King Of Games  -  A character renowned for their skill at games or gaming.
Insult Misfire  -  Person thinks insults directed at them are for someone else.
Punctuated For Emphasis  -  JUST! LIKE! THIS!
Extranormal Prison  -  Jail specialized to contain people/entities with special powers.
Fell Asleep Standing Up  -  Characters fall asleep while standing up.
Voice For The Voiceless  -  This character speaks on behalf of another character.
Unaccustomed As I Am To Public Speaking  -  Practiced orator claims to have no skill at public speaking.
Creepily Long Arms  -  A monster looks odd with really long arms.
Not That Kind Of Partner  -  When I say "partner", I mean that in the most professional sense of the word. Not...you know.
Fake Memories  -  What you remember from the past didn't actually happen.
Forgets To Eat  -  Someone who forgets to do normal things like eat.
Eye Beams  -  Frickin' Laser Beams that are fired from one's eyes.
The Lancer  -  The Hero's foil and The Leader's trusted companion.
Bedsheet Ladder  -  A ladder made out of bedsheets.
Pelican Package Pouch  -  A pelican's throat pouch is used to hide and/or carry things.
Unexpectedly Dark Episode  -  An unusually dark episode of a light-hearted series.
The Outside World  -  The wide, open world around someone living in isolation.
Running Over The Plot  -  A character is hit by a car, and that begins or restarts the plot.
Corrupted Character Copy  -  An Expy meant to be an Evil Counterpart or twisted version of the character they're based off.
Shifted To CGI  -  A work switches from traditional animation to CGI.
Fake Shemp  -  The Other Darrin meets He Who Must Not Be Seen.
Clothes Make The Superman  -  Clothes give you super powers.
Campy Combat  -  Camp characters who are just as, if not more, campy in a fight.
Raised By Wolves  -  A human orphan is adopted and raised by animals.
Finger Tenting  -  Manipulative characters tend to cover their faces or chests with their fingers tip-to-tip or interlocked.
Hairstyle Inertia  -  Characters age but their hairstyles don't.
AI Is A Crapshoot  -  Artificial Intelligence has an extremely high tendency to become evil and/or turn against its creator's plans.
Ruder And Cruder  -  A work that is more profane than its previous installments.
The Magnificent Seven Samurai  -  A Whole Plot Reference to Seven Samurai: A helpless community under attack hires heroes (usually seven) to protect them.
Adorable Evil Minions  -  Cute Mooks.
Awesome Mc Coolname  -  A character, thing, or place is given an awesome name to make it seem more awesome.
Orifice Evacuation  -  Something nasty tries to escape from one of your holes... One way or another.
Regal Ruff  -  Wearing a ruff collar indicates aristocracy or association with aristocracy.
Nightmare Fuel Coloring Book  -  A child draws pictures of something very disturbing that either happened or is about to happen.
Musical World Hypotheses  -  So... how do you explain all these musical numbers?
Malt Shop  -  A popular diner where the cool kids go.
Small Steps Hero  -  The Hero who does immediate good and worries about evil later.
Lysistrata Gambit  -  Women can control men by controlling access to sex.
Icon Of Rebellion  -  A symbol of La Résistance.
Anti Advice  -  That dumbass (and/or bad guy) suggested I do something, so I should do the opposite of that!
Museum Of The Strange And Unusual  -  Weird, creepy museum.
Awkwardly Placed Bathtub  -  Bathtub in a place baths aren't usually taken.
Beer Goggles  -  Seeing someone differently and hitting on them while you're drunk.
Meet Cute  -  When two characters' romance begins completely incidentally.
Magi Babble  -  Meaningful-sounding but (usually) meaningless magical jargon.
Magic Genetics  -  Gene mutations = SUPERPOWERS! What? Any disabilities? Nope, none here!
Redheads Are Uncool  -  Social outcasts tend to have red hair.
Unimpressive Progress Reveal  -  The end of a montage reveals that a character has only made minimal progress toward an otherwise impressive(-sounding) goal.
Adaptation Expansion  -  Adding stuff to the adaptation to take up more time or otherwise complexify.
The Chosen People  -  A specific civilization or nationality is chosen by a higher power as its favorite, often for a higher purpose.
Jerkass  -  A mean, cruel, and insufferable person.
Gothic Punk  -  The Punk Punk version of Gothic Horror or Supernatural Fiction.
Guns Akimbo  -  The Trope: A gun in each hand.
Saved By Canon  -  You can't kill this character! They exist in the sequels!
Two Girls To A Team  -  In any work with a Team Shot, all but two characters have a Y chromosome.
Harsher In Hindsight  -  A certain event that is worsened when future events are taken into consideration.
Matryoshka Object  -  A container holding a smaller version of itself.
Blue Link  -  A non-red link.
Brainwashed  -  A character's mind is enslaved by someone or something.
Unnecessary Combat Roll  -  Roll and come up shooting, for no apparent reason other than Rule of Cool.
In Vino Veritas  -  Alcohol as a Truth Serum.
Pubescent Braces  -  Character wears braces to portray them as approaching or in the stage of puberty.
Moe Greene Special  -  A character is shot in the eye.
Birthmark Of Destiny  -  The Chosen One has a mark that means he's the Chosen One.
Sensitivity Training  -  A program at work, school, a place of worship, etc. intended to teach political correctness.
We Come In Peace Shoot To Kill  -  First contact with aliens ends badly.
Lighting Bug  -  Glowing bugs used as a light source.
More Than Three Dimensions  -  The idea that length, width, and height are not the only spatial dimensions.
Subsystem Damage  -  Breaking a limb or other body part.
A Wolf In Sheeps Clothing  -  Character hides their true self by pretending to be nicer or more harmless than they truly are.
Singing Voice Dissonance  -  Person's singing voice sounds way different from their speaking one.
Angelic Transformation  -  Mortals ascend into angels, or angels becoming humans.
Two Negative Premises  -  If A is not B, and if B is not C, then A is C.
Parallel Parking  -  When fictional characters try to parallel park a vehicle, Hilarity Ensues.
Icy Blue Eyes  -  Pale blue eyes representing coolness or coldness, either in personality or in nature. (Or both.)
Character Witness  -  You are vouched for by the Innocent Bystander whom you helped earlier.
Not A Zombie  -  Characters take quite a while to realize a zombie when they first see one.
Good Prosthetic Evil Prosthetic  -  Character Alignment depends on Artificial Limbs, life support and other false body parts.
Early Bird Boss  -  An early boss that's difficult due to player's lack of equipment and powers.
Evil Inc  -  An evil corporation.
Prehistoric Monster  -  If you are prehistoric, you are surely a non-cute.
Space Brasilia  -  Fictional cities are extremely uniform and show no variation in architectural styles.
Cartoon Creature  -  A drawn character of an indeterminate species.
Son Of An Ape  -  When a human is insulted by being called an ape or a monkey.
Insult Friendly Fire  -  Someone makes insulting remarks about another person, completely unaware that they're insulting their friend.
Parts Unknown  -  We don't know where this person is from.
Tempting Fate  -  Don't say it—that's just asking for it.
Economy Cast  -  Using about one actor to fill a role that would usually be used by several in order to save money.
Home Of Monsters  -  The place where monsters and/or other fantastic beings come from.
Which Me  -  Referring to your double as "me" or "I".
Putting The Band Back Together  -  After a seemingly permanent split, a group of characters assembles once more.
Batty Lip Burbling  -  People who are crazy or confused bat their lips with their fingers.
Daycare Nightmare  -  A daycare center with poor management and /or abusive caretakers.
Banned In China  -  You won't be seeing/reading/playing/listening to this in our country.
With This Herring  -  Heroes embark on epic adventures...while painfully ill-equipped.
Wetware CPU  -  Plug directly into brain to activate.
Hype Aversion  -  The more people tell you you should check it out, the less you want to.
Love Confession  -  One character makes a declaration of love to another.
Sanity Slippage  -  A character slowly grows insane throughout the story.
Trash Of The Titans  -  Rooms filled with garbage.
Black Comedy Burst  -  Sudden dark Black Comedy in a work that otherwise doesn't get that dark.
Gunship Rescue  -  The Cavalry arrives in the form of one or more armed vehicles.
Redundant Rescue  -  The Big Damn Heroes find out that they didn't need to rescue their target anyway.
Rockers Smash Guitars  -  This guitar has seconds to live.
Temporal Mutability  -  How easy is it for you to change the past?
Do They Know Its Christmas Time  -  Characters learn to become better people for Christmas, but of course, Status Quo Is God.
Personal Gain Hurts  -  Using superhuman powers for profit will bring grief to a hero.
Dismissing A Compliment  -  A character responds to a compliment by minimizing its sincerity.
Shrunk In The Wash  -  A piece of clothing gets smaller when it gets splashed by water.
Sunshine Noir  -  A variation of City Noir that emphasize on the brighter side of it.
Elite Tweak  -  Tweaking a character or item to be much more effective than they are by default.
Plot Allergy  -  Allergies used as a plot point.
Our Pixies Are Different  -  Different works portraying pixies in drastically different ways.
Magical Eye Streamers  -  Character have a streaming-like effect on their eyes.
Fed To The Beast  -  Villains feeding heroes to a monster or wild animals, frequently a key moment of Bond Villain Stupidity.
All Trolls Are Different  -  You can call whatever you want a troll.
Palmtree Panic  -  A beach or seaside area in a Video Game.
Monochrome Apparition  -  Ghosts of people who died are in various shades of any color of glowing vapors.
When All Else Fails Go Right  -  In most video game levels, you start on the left side of the map and must progress to the right.
To The Batpole  -  Before we get to headquarters, we must go through a sequence of cool maneuvers getting there.
Season Finale  -  The last installment of a series' group of episodes, to finish off its Story Arc.
What Beautiful Eyes  -  A character's comely eyes are a defining character trait.
Same Character But Different  -  An old character returns with a different personality.
Doomed Hometown  -  The Hero's hometown gets destroyed early on, committing them to the adventure.
Ironic Echo  -  Quote or scene repeated in an ironic context.
Punk In The Trunk  -  A body placed into a trunk of a car, willingly or not.
Captain Obvious Aesop  -  A blindingly obvious and popular Aesop treated as controversial.
Symbolic Mutilation  -  A character is mutilated in a symbolic way.
Engaging Conversation  -  Suddenly proposing to someone almost immediately after meeting them.
Contractual Purity  -  Family-friendly actors can't do normal adult stuff.
Lets See YOU Do Better  -  The belief that you're only allowed to criticize a work if you've made one yourself.
Contemplate Our Navels  -  Character(s) spend a while lost in thought.
Cynicism Catalyst  -  A traumatic event that makes a character more cynical than before.
Creepy Physical  -  A medical examination that demonstrates oddities in the doctor, the patient, or both.
The Eyes Have It  -  Objects that are normally inanimate suddenly move as though alive and it can be scary.
Murder Inc  -  A group of Professional Killers.
Unrelated In The Adaptation  -  Characters who were related in the source material are unrelated in the adaptation of a work.
Sex Magic  -  Casting spells by having sex.
The Boxing Episode  -  An episode structured around boxing.
Space Pirates  -  Pirates in space.
Evil Costume Switch  -  Change clothes to show FaceHeel Turn.
Hesitation Equals Dishonesty  -  ... ... ...Um, er... er... no, wait, I'm telling the truth! Really!
Copied The Morals Too  -  An Evil Knockoff of a hero fails to complete its purpose because it also has some of the hero's morality/personality/etc.
MST  -  Critical commentary (usually of a terrible work) as the story progresses.
Written In Absence  -  Actor's unavailable; so's the character.
Nature Hero  -  Heroes with an affinity to nature and the wilderness or derive their powers from such.
Character Model Karma Meter  -  Your character's direct appearance reflects your Karma Meter.
Product Displacement  -  If a logo is shown on TV, but that logo's company doesn't get paid for it, expect it to be edited out.
Its The Same Now It Sucks  -  Fans complain that they didn't change the sequel enough.
Hysterical Woman  -  Women are too emotional to act rationally.
Bury Me Not On The Lone Prairie  -  A person has difficulty carrying out someone's last request.
Evil Pays Better  -  Get rich by being a villain.
The Strongman  -  Trope: Exhibitors of strength for the entertainment of others.
Grave Clouds  -  It's always overcast at cemeteries.
Secret Stab Wound  -  For some reason, a character hides the fact that they've received a serious blow.
Death Is Not Permanent  -  A Video Game's story justifies why death doesn't mean Game Over.
Everythings Better With Sparkles  -  Sparkles = Beauty.
Pick Your Human Half  -  Robots must seem robotic, either by behaviour or appearance.
Epistolary Novel  -  Fiction written in a mailing-letter format.
Cargo Ship  -  Shipping inanimate objects.
Marth Debuted In Smash Bros  -  A character's first appearance in another country is in a cameo.
Pistol Whipping  -  Bludgeoning with your firearm.
Those Two Animals  -  Two animals are seen with each other at almost all times.
The Needless  -  They don't need what we need.
Guide Dang It  -  You'd never figure this out if you didn't have a walkthrough.
Immune To Slapstick  -  Something slapstick-y happens, but one character is not part of it.
Defied Trope  -  A character is aware of a trope and tries to avoid it.
Enemy Within  -  Evil force inside someone struggles for control.
Paint It Black  -  A costume suddenly gets Darker and Edgier with a change of alignment.
Rule Of Two  -  Villains always have a right-hand.
Mundane Fantastic  -  Fantastical things portrayed as though they were mundane and normal.
Rouge Angles Of Satin  -  Write spilling, wrung ward. (Right spelling, wrong word.)
Leitmotif  -  Something/someone's theme music.
Feuding Families  -  Families that hate each other and keep fighting.
Legacy Character  -  Identities passed down from person to person.
Smug Super  -  They know they're powerful, and they have the ego to show.
Cathartic Chores  -  Doing mundane, repetitive work like cleaning, cooking, gardening, carpentry etc. as a mechanism to redirect frustration at something uncontrollable.
The Couch  -  In a TV show, there is a couch in which often everybody sits on at once.
Complacent Gaming Syndrome  -  When players select the same character/strategy over and over.
Interrupting Meme  -  Using memes in mid-sentence.
Media Watchdog  -  Enforcers of the Moral Guardian's commands.
Spooky Painting  -  A painted image that seems normal at first. It probably isn't.
Authority Equals Asskicking  -  The higher in a hierarchy, the higher the fighting skill.
Spread Shot  -  You shoot a wide spread of shots, allowing you to cover a wider area of Mooks. May be obtained via power-up.
Lyrical Dissonance  -  Lyrics and Music don't fit together; A.k.a. Stepford Smiler in song form.
Joke Item  -  Item so worthless, it's a joke.
Sleeping With The Bosss Wife  -  Sex with Mrs. Boss.
Messianic Archetype  -  A savior who endures great sacrifices, up to and including death, to help others. Alternatively, a good or heroic character modeled after Jesus Christ.
Car Cushion  -  When falling from a great height, you're almost guaranteed to land on a car.
Brain In A Jar  -  A living brain floating in a jar.
This Is No Time For Knitting  -  The seemingly irrelevant activity a person is doing during a serious matter turns out to have a definite point.
Begging The Question  -  An argument where the conclusion is assumed in one of the premises.
Heroic Resolve  -  Can't give up...RRAAAUUUUGGGHHH!
The All Seeing AI  -  Computer-controlled units have perfect knowledge of everything in the game world.
Humans Through Alien Eyes  -  Humans are as odd to extraterrestrial beings as they are to them.
Our Werewolves Are Different  -  The original werewolf myths couldn't keep the details straight, either.
Appeal To Ridicule  -  Claiming an argument as false by presenting it as stupid or laughable.
Atlantis Is Boring  -  There's not much to do under the sea.
Ladykiller In Love  -  The Casanova genuinely falls in love.
Music Is Politics  -  The music industry isn't just Music, but a business with A LOT of political machinations.
Eureka Moment  -  Random phrase causes inspiration.
Loser Son Of Loser Dad  -  A character is scorned by their peers for the actions of their parent(s).
Game Night Fight  -  When game night leads to bad arguments and (sometimes) broken relationships.
Beard Of Evil  -  A character's villainy is signified by the presence of a beard.
Ammunition Conservation  -  One or more characters exercise restraint regarding how much ammunition is used to neutralize a threat.
Single Line Of Descent  -  Lineage only has one key living descendent.
Obvious Stunt Double  -  When a stunt double looks nothing like the actor they are filling in for.
The World Is Just Awesome  -  Whoa, this new location is spectacular!
Double Aesop  -  The main moral is learned by two characters rather than just the central one.
Ground Punch  -  A move or attack that punches the ground.
Up The Real Rabbit Hole  -  Fantasy worlds and their inhabitants are of no consequence because they're not really "real".
Bandit Clan  -  Disorganized crime as a family business.
Villainous Breakdown  -  When their Evil Plan is foiled, a calculating villain loses their composure, if not their sanity.
Dead Character Walking  -  Your videogame character dies, but you can still control him somehow.
Hostility On The Set  -  Two (or more) actors are hostile to each other during filming.
OC Stand In  -  Fanfic writer ascends an extra.
Color Coded Wizardry  -  Spellcasters with characteristic colors.
Useless Useful Spell  -  A spell or ability that sounds useful in theory, but isn't worth the effort in practice.
