Human Traffic Jam  -  Groups of characters impeding, colliding, or piling up in ways similar to vehicular traffic.
Redemption Earns Life  -  A villain avoids certain death by joining the cause of good.
Actually A Doombot  -  Defeated villain was just a decoy.
Nocturnal Mooks  -  Enemies that appear at night.
Abandoned Mine  -  Deserted mine shafts are spooky and/or dangerous.
Tragic Dropout  -  A good student winds up having to drop out of school.
Chicken Joke  -  A long-running joke involving a little chicken crossing a big road.
Artificial Script  -  When a work uses an alphabet invented specifically for it (though not necessarily a Conlang, too).
Scifi Writers Have No Sense Of Scale  -  Sci-Fi writers make measurements much more different than they realistically would be.
Death By Flashback  -  Before a character dies, you get to know his backstory.
Sealed Army In A Can  -  Army sealed away for a very long time.
Roboteching  -  Projectile attacks swerve in mid-air to hit their target.
Dueling Player Characters  -  Boss fight pitting two Player Characters against one another in a single-player video game.
In Working Order  -  Alien technology can instantly and easily be used by humans.
Hollywood Heart Attack  -  All acted heart attacks are dramatic.
Rule Of Three  -  The number three used as a Plot Device or as a gag.
Monumental Damage Resistance  -  Identifiable landmarks stand through destruction.
Surprisingly Good English  -  Natural-sounding English in a non-English voice track.
The Mel Brooks Number  -  A would-be dramatic piece drops all dramatic feelings by adding some comedy.
The Murder After  -  Someone wakes up to find their bedmate's been murdered and they're now the prime suspect.
Once A Season  -  Something in a series that happens at least once every season.
Those Wacky Nazis  -  They were very bad guys. But really crazy ones.
What A Senseless Waste Of Human Life  -  The people sympathize a person and wished they lived for the better after they died.
Rock Of Limitless Water  -  An object that endlessly generates water.
Mechanically Unusual Fighter  -  A playable video game character that has a different set of rules compared to what the other characters adhere to.
Muggle Born Of Mages  -  Ordinary character with supernatural ancestors.
Left Fielder  -  Internet Cloud Cuckoolander derails thread.
Love Makes You Uncreative  -  Love causes a character's artistic work to decline.
Not Me This Time  -  Heroes accuse a recurring villain of a crime he did not commit.
Lawyer Friendly Cameo  -  Lawsuits are avoided by using an obvious parody of a copyrighted character or disguising them by obscuring the most recognizable aspects of their appearance and/or avoiding naming them.
Stargazing Scene  -  A quiet scene where one or more characters are admiring the night sky.
Fiendish Fish  -  Sharks and piranhas are not the only dangerous fishes out there.
Wangst  -  Shallow, melodramatic angst that makes a character seem annoying and self-pitying.
Martyrdom Culture  -  A community full of people willing to die for it.
Dramatically Missing The Point  -  Someone fails to realize the reason behind a dramatic event.
Laser Guided Amnesia  -  Being made to forget very specific things.
A Rare Sentence  -  A speaker remarks on the oddity of what they (or someone else) just said.
Informed Wrongness  -  The story presents a character being in the wrong, despite Fridge Logic making that characters position make sense.
Nice Job Breaking It Herod  -  A villain fails to kill a child who is destined to defeat him.
Traveling At The Speed Of Plot  -  Any vehicle travels as fast or as slowly as the plot demands.
Hollywood Tactics  -  Military tactics don't work that way.
George Jetson Job Security  -  No job security whatsoever; you can get fired for any (or no) reason at all.
Monumental Damage  -  When the bad guys blow up a big building, it is gonna be one we all recognise.
Differing Priorities Breakup  -  A couple breaks up due to wanting different things out of life (usually marriage and/or children).
Trampled Underfoot  -  Bad character is established by stepping on something and breaking it.
Accomplice By Inaction  -  A character is out to get the other character for just doing nothing to save them.
Pair The Smart Ones  -  Great minds attract.
Sins Of Our Fathers  -  Children are punished for what their parents have done.
Imagine Spotting  -  Dude—Your imagine spot's showing.
My Way Or The Highway  -  You do this my way or you're out.
Separate Scene Storytelling  -  Reading or telling a story gets played out as though it was a scene in the show.
Mistook The Dominant Lifeform  -  Aliens mistake a nonhuman for a dominant life form
Delivery Guy  -  A man assists in delivering a baby.
Melodrama  -  The drama factor of a scene is turned Up to Eleven.
Super Speed Reading  -  The ability to finish a thousand-page book in less time than it takes to boil an egg.
People Jars  -  Preserving something...or someone...in a glass case full of who-knows-what.
Thanksgiving Episode  -  An episode which focuses around celebrating Thanksgiving.
Suspiciously Apropos Music  -  Source Music that coincidentally relates to the situation it's played in.
Off The Rails  -  Doing whatever the DM is least likely to want you to do.
My God What Have I Done  -  A character commits a heinous act. A massive guilt trip follows.
Toontown  -  A place where cartoon characters live.
Out Of Continues  -  A character who has died repeatedly is killed for good.
Spoiled By The Merchandise  -  Promotional merchandise for a work reveals an upcoming plot twist.
Chronic Evidence Retention Syndrome  -  Criminals holding onto evidence with no other function than incriminating them, while it's easy to dispose it.
Crutch Character  -  Good now, sucky later.
Humanity Is Insane  -  Humanity's hat is being completely nuts.
Sex For Solace  -  A character has sex with another character because they're grieving.
Troll Bridge  -  A bridge with a troll on it that won't let others pass until they clear a test of something.
Spot Of Tea  -  All British people like tea.
Vengeance Feels Empty  -  There is no satisfaction in revenge.
The Milky Way Is The Only Way  -  When Speculative Fiction works that can leave this galaxy still won't.
Abnormal Allergy  -  A character having an oddball allergy, most of the time not even existing in real life.
Posthumous Character  -  This character is dead, but still somehow part of the story.
Sugar Bowl  -  Bright, colorful, happy world.
Huge Guy Tiny Girl  -  She's very small next to him.
Garrulous Growth  -  Character grows a sentient talking boil (or pimple, zit, wart, tumor) on their body. The protrusion is usually very annoying and antagonistic.
Waking Non Sequitur  -  When a character wakes up from a coma or sleep, they say a Non Sequitur.
Unluckily Lucky  -  They get out of trouble as easily as they get in said trouble.
Flat What  -  Whatever you just witnessed, whatever the reason, the result is a deadpan expression of disbelief. And a simple "What."
Subtext  -  Underlying messages left unsaid.
Proverbial Wisdom  -  Wise or spiritual characters tend to speak in an extremely flowery, metaphoric, and cryptic way, often citing proverbs and aphorisms.
Jumping To Conclusions Diagnosis  -  Someone is said to be sick but don't show any symptoms except for one tiny thing like a sneeze.
Good Girls Avoid Abortion  -  Abortion doesn't happen in fiction, or is treated as a bad thing.
Dancing Bear  -  A work focused on a specific gimmick.
Never Found The Body  -  Unless you actually have a dead person's corpse or see them die in front of you, the odds are they're still alive.
Unwilling Roboticisation  -  Being turned into a cyborg/robot against your will.
Conjunction Malfunction  -  Sentence being started with conjunctions.
This Index Knows What Its Talking About  -  An index of tropes about experts and expertise.
Showing Off The New Body  -  Got a new body? Get thee to a mirror!
By The Power Of Grayskull  -  Voice-activated phlebotinum.
Plank Gag  -  Someone carrying a long, horizontal object turns around and inadvertently smacks others with said object.
Extracurricular Enthusiast  -  Someone (usually a schoolkid) who's involved in loads of extracurricular activities (or at least activities outside of school).
Lawful Evil  -  A character alignment combining self-interest and order.
Always Night  -  Setting is a place that is always night time.
Angst Aversion  -  Avoiding depressing, morbid works of art by not taking the bait.
Start To Corpse  -  Time in a mystery/crime story from the start to when the dead body is discovered or someone is killed.
Strictly Professional Relationship  -  Characters treat each other as colleagues to mask romantic attraction.
Hauled Before A Senate Sub Committee  -  Someone has to publicly answer questions to a major governing body.
No Talking Or Phones Warning  -  Don't talk or use your phone in the cinema, please.
Accusation Fic  -  What the Hell, Hero?: The Fanfic
Smashed Eggs Hatching  -  It's okay to break the egg, it just means it will hatch like it was always supposed to!
Meaningful Background Event  -  Something plot-relevant happens onscreen, but not as the focus
Wild Goose Chase  -  Making the guys that are tracking you down follow the wrong track, so they will stray even farther away from you.
Never Given A Name  -  Character doesn't have a "real name" because their parents never gave them one.
Sex Slave  -  A slave whose main service is sexual labor.
Dirty Bomb  -  Conventional explosives used to scatter radioactive materials over a large area.
Prop Recycling  -  A prop created for one work is reused in many others, often in wildly different contexts.
Kneecapping  -  Immobilizing someone by attacking the knee.
Spock Speak  -  The lack of slang and other informal linguistics in one's vocabulary.
Start My Own  -  You won't let us do it our way? Fine, we'll start our own!
Hell  -  Bad afterlife place.
The Law Of Conservation Of Detail  -  Every detail is important.
Virtual Celebrity  -  The celebrity is fictional, but their in-universe fandom is real.
If I Were A Rich Man  -  Dreaming of great wealth.
Im Thinking It Over  -  A (usually) trivial decision, isn't.
Name That Unfolds Like Lotus Blossom  -  A person's name is a multi-word description — more a phrase than a name.
Export Save  -  Exporting the save file as a long string of text in a clipboard or text document.
Guilt By Association Gag  -  Everyone gets punished regardless of individual guilt.
Egomaniac Hunter  -  He hunts the rarest, most exotic, most dangerous game, just to prove that he can.
We ARE Struggling Together  -  The masses have trouble fighting a mutual enemy because they're too busy fighting each other.
Card Carrying Villain  -  He's a villain and proud of it.
Isometric Projection  -  Objects are shown as 3D, but they're located in 2D, and they're displayed on a weird axis.
Circle Of Shame  -  A character is put in a humiliating position and everybody laughs at them.
Extradimensional Power Source  -  Energy that comes from somewhere outside normal spacetime.
Teaser Equipment  -  Shopkeepers sell powerful equipment early on, but you won't be able to actually afford it until later.
Countrystan  -  A Fictional Country whose name ends in "-stan."
Chaste Toons  -  Cartoon characters never have children, only young relatives.
Belly Dancer  -  Typically, a female dancer who wears a midriff-revealing outfit and a lot of jewelry.
Sssssnaketalk  -  Sssssibilant ssssspeech.
The Ten Commandments  -  The Book of Exodus: The Epic Movie.
In Character Commentaries  -  When the DVD Commentary of a movie is performed as a character from the movie.
Hates The Job Loves The Limelight  -  An entertainer or actor who enjoys but is cynical about their job.
Good Hair Evil Hair  -  Character Alignment depends on how you keep your hair.
Precautionary Corpse Disposal  -  A setting or situation where anyone who dies will become a monster, or otherwise dangerous
A Taste Of The Lash  -  Getting whipped as punishment.
Speed Stripes  -  Moving colored lines behind a character to indicate intensity or speed.
Born Of Magic  -  A living creature created by magic.
Distant Prologue  -  A prologue that shows events that have happened from a very long time before (or after) the main plot.
Digging Yourself Deeper  -  Stumbling on explaining a comment that came out too offensive.
Cub Cues Protective Parent  -  Finding a baby animal means its parent(s) are nearby.
Beat Still My Heart  -  Ripped-out heart still beats.
Development Gag  -  A reference to a unused and/or scrapped concept during production.
Shifting Situation Duel  -  A fight where the location or conditions are constantly changing.
Melancholy Musical Number  -  A disheartened character sings about their sadness.
Dangerous Forbidden Technique  -  Powerful ability, serious drawbacks.
Heartwarming In Hindsight  -  Retroactive Heartwarming Moments.
Predator Pastiche  -  An alien based on the stealthy alien hunter from Predator.
Filming For Easy Dub  -  When lips aren't shown, dialogue is easier to add in.
Cuffs Off Rub Wrists  -  A character who has been handcuffed rubs their wrists when they're taken off.
Cheated Death Died Anyway  -  Narrowly avoiding death in one incident, then getting killed by something else shortly thereafter.
Critical Backlash  -  This wasn't nearly as bad as everyone says.
Different World Different Movies  -  A different universe has a different version of an existing work.
False Prophet  -  A savior or religious figure lying for selfish reasons.
I Know Kung Faux  -  Artistic License  Martial Arts played for laughs.
The Anime Of The Game  -  A Video Game is made into an Anime.
Vacation Episode  -  A plot involving the cast going on a vacation.
They Died Because Of You  -  A character is told a loved one's death is their fault.
Weddings For Everyone  -  Multiple couples get married at the end of the story.
Invisible Wall  -  Invisible walls in video games that keep the player in the gaming area.
Race For Your Love  -  Someone is about to leave the city/state/country forever, but their lover runs to the train station/airport to convince them to stay.
Corpsing  -  Cracking up while trying to keep a straight face.
Men Get Old Women Get Replaced  -  Male characters get older after a Time Skip, but women must disappear.
Only The Pure Of Heart  -  You must be pure to use/do this.
Seeking Sanctuary  -  Seeking refuge from evil forces in a holy site or place of worship.
Multigenerational Household  -  When two or more adult generations share the same living unit.
Combat Diplomacy Stealth  -  The three classic paths to victory in (role-playing) video games. Which one path will you pick?
Aliens In Cardiff  -  Supernatural and/or world-changing events occur in small non-fictional locations.
Thick Line Animation  -  Animation style characterized by visible heavy black borders around characters and objects.
Animals Fear Neutering  -  Animals are scared of having their reproductive organs removed.
Character Check  -  Attempting to hide Characterization Marches On by having a character briefly act in their original persona.
Video Game Dashing  -  The sprint/running ability in video games.
Magical Accessory  -  An enchanted, magical accessory.
Dated History  -  Changes in our understanding of history make old works inaccurate.
Air Guitar  -  Invisible guitar solo!
Acting In The Dark  -  Actors aren't told about the nature of the work or their character to prevent it from affecting their performance.
Better To Die Than Be Killed  -  Someone commits suicide to avoid falling into enemy hands.
Heart Container  -  An item that increases a character's maximum hit points.
Toyless Toyline Character  -  A character not based on a toy when everyone else is.
Old Flame  -  Old love never dies.
Monster Misogyny  -  Women are the predominate or only ones killed in a work.
Mind Screwdriver  -  Now it all makes sense!
Cool Code Of Source  -  if (rule_of_cool) { WallOfText code = new TechnoBabble(); while (code.on_screen) { code.scroll(); } }
Walls Of Tyranny  -  The presence of walls is used as a symbol of oppression.
Despair Event Horizon  -  The point where a character loses all hope.
Curse Escape Clause  -  There's a seemingly built-in way out of this magic spell. It just takes some time to find it.
California Collapse  -  Local cataclysm causes California to disconnect from the mainland or sink.
The Unapologetic  -  A character who isn't willing to apologize for their misdeeds.
Whateversaurus  -  A fictional prehistoric creature.
Shape Shifter Swan Song  -  A shapeshifter shows all of the forms they used as they die.
Lovable Alpha Bitch  -  She's spoiled, egotistic, shallow... but, deep down, she's actually a good person.
Stolen By Staying Still  -  Make something that's barely been moved look like it's been stolen to allow it to actually be stole afterward.
Metalhead  -  Long hair, metal, ech.
Legend Fades To Myth  -  Details of distant history are forgotten, misremembered, or now considered fiction.
Dating Catwoman  -  The protagonist and the antagonist are explicitly in love with each other.
Escape Battle Technique  -  A move or technique that guarantees escape from a RPG random encounter.
Asteroids Monster  -  Monster which splits into smaller independent versions when killed.
Double Standard Abuse Female On Male  -  Abuse or slapstick of men by women is Played for Laughs or just not taken seriously while it is considered unacceptable if their roles were switched.
Reality Ensues  -  When characters find out Real Life doesn't work That Way.
The Usurper  -  Someone who intentionally eliminated those ranking higher to get the throne for themself.
Ordered Apology  -  A character insists that another character apologize to a third character.
Abdicate The Throne  -  Someone of royalty decides to give up the throne and hand it down to someone else.
Sixth Ranger Traitor  -  New character joins established team, then betrays them.
Talk To The Fist  -  Striking opponents while they're talking.
Rambunctious Italian  -  Fictional Italian characters are often hot-tempered and loud.
Satellite Love Interest  -  Character whose personality revolves around their love towards another character.
The Millstone  -  A member of The Team that actually makes things worse than if they weren't there.
Cocky Rooster  -  Chickens(nearly Always Male) depicted as violent, show-offy, and obnoxious, as opposed to funny.
Spoken Word In Music  -  Music that makes use of people speaking normally, as opposed to singing.
Rags To Royalty  -  A commoner is elevated (or restored) to the nobility.
Breath Holding Brat  -  A bratty character threats to hold their breath until you meet their demands or they suffocate.
Stranger In A Familiar Land  -  Coming home and not fitting in anymore.
Cats Are Magic  -  Cats, or a cat, has powers.
Our Dark Matter Is Mysterious  -  Nobody in real life knows what dark matter is, so writers use it in many ways.
Some Of My Best Friends Are X  -  ...therefore I'm not prejudiced against X.
Ax Crazy  -  Deranged characters prone to random acts of violence.
Trial And Error Gameplay  -  You can only learn how to win by dying.
Screen To Stage Adaptation  -  See the tv show or movie as a stage play.
Overly Long Gag  -  The length of the joke becomes the joke.
Mega Maelstrom  -  Humongous whirlpools.
Technology Marches On  -  Technology has changed a lot since the work was produced.
Self Fanservice  -  No matter how attractive they are, they are always better-looking in the Fan Art.
Two Way Tapping  -  Surveillance bugs are revealed when the eavesdroppers start answering.
Would Rather Suffer  -  Character says they would rather do something ridiculous (and usually painful) instead of what they've been asked.
Shana Clone  -  An abrasive, youthful-looking Tsundere.
Happy Fun Ball  -  WARNING: DO NOT BE FOOLED BY ITS INNOCUOUS APPEARANCE; THIS THING IS DANGEROUS
Out Of Context Eavesdropping  -  Someone overhears a conversation and lacking the full context misinterprets it for someting more serious.
The Short Guy With Glasses  -  The bespectacled boy is the smart one.
Walking Disaster Area  -  This guy attracts trouble and disaster to him like a magnet.
These Are Things Man Was Not Meant To Know  -  Something that human beings cannot safely observe, discover, or otherwise know about without dire consequences.
Sex Is Evil  -  Sex is portrayed by Moral Guardians as a ridiculously heinous act.
Noisy Shut Up  -  Shutting up a noisy crowd by any means verbal or nonverbal.
Tentacled Terror  -  Octopuses, squids, and other cephalopods Played for Horror.
Keeping The Enemy Close  -  Rather than keep distance from a known enemy, one spends as much time as possible around said enemy to keep tabs on them.
Open Mouth Insert Foot  -  Someone didn't think it through about what they just said.
Redemption In The Rain  -  I was bad, but in came the downpour. And suddenly, BOOM! I was all nice, no naughty!
The All Solving Hammer  -  One solution offered for all problems.
Girls Vs Boys Plot  -  Boys and girls battle for supremacy.
Percent Damage Attack  -  An attack that always deals damage proportional to the target's current HP.
Write What You Know  -  The creator bases the story on their own experiences.
Oblivious Janitor Cut  -  a Character who is blissfully unaware of events happening while working.
Antidote Effect  -  Keeping an item because it might be useful in a very specific (and very annoying) situation.
Gamer Chick  -  A girl who is into video games, and is usually much better at them than her male counterparts.
There Are No Girls On The Internet  -  Character assumes (sometimes correctly) every single person on the internet is male.
The Nondescript  -  Character considered so ordinary in-universe that other characters can't remember what they look like.
El Cid Ploy  -  The army's leader is dead, but their enemies don't know that and the army takes advantage of it.
Attending Your Own Funeral  -  Why are you guys at my funeral? I'm not dead yet!
Convenient Weakness Placement  -  What moron would put their own weakness in their territory, anyway!?
Worf Had The Flu  -  Character loses to someone they would have beaten normally due to an illness or some other handicap.
Good Smoking Evil Smoking  -  How one smokes says a lot about their Character Alignment.
Mars Needs Women  -  Non-human males think human females are hot.
Easy Communication  -  In Video Games, you don't need to worry about how your orders get relayed to the troops.
Journey To The Sky  -  A plot in which a character, or characters, wish to literally and physically reach the sky.
Socialite  -  A young, attractive woman (sometimes man) who indulges in elite pleasures and a patrician lifestyle.
The Cassandra  -  Prophet is always right, but never believed.
Find The Cure  -  A character gets ill or poisoned. Some others look for a cure for them.
Yuri Fan  -  Someone who pairs girls together.
Holy Pipe Organ  -  Pipe organ will always be associated with holy subject matter.
White Mans Burden  -  A well-to-do white character selflessly works to help an unfortunate person of color.
Nazi Hunter  -  One who hunts Nazis.
Anti Metagame Character  -  When a game's Character Tiers result in a character low on the tier list countering a character at the top.
This Is Something Hes Got To Do Himself  -  When It's Personal, a character's companions stay back and let him settle a fight one-on-one.
Remember The New Guy  -  A new character who is treated like they've always been a regular character.
Exponential Potential  -  The number of abilities you've acquired throughout the game becomes a tad overwhelming.
The Film Of The Play  -  The adaptation of a theatre play into a film.
Sailor Senshi Send Up  -  Characters inspired by the protagonists of Sailor Moon.
You Rebel Scum  -  An authoritative villain insults the lower-ranking hero.
Bratty Teenage Daughter  -  A selfish, whiny, demanding and ungrateful teenage girl.
Wrong Time Travel Savvy  -  Time Travel exists, but a character is mistaken about how it works.
Overly Narrow Superlative  -  Being the best/worst/whatever at something doesn't mean much if you're the only one doing it.
Fantastic Drug  -  A fictional drug.
We Are As Mayflies  -  Humans are the shortest-lived intelligent race.
Chunky Updraft  -  Chunks of debris float up into the air to demonstrate the character's overflowing power.
Badly Battered Babysitter  -  The babysitter never gets their way.
BFG  -  A gun so powerful and/or huge, it's amazing that it's usable.
Sadist Show  -  A TV show, movie, or other work in which every character is The Chew Toy.
Stable Time Loop  -  The cause is the product of the effect, and vice-versa.
The Great Wall  -  A medieval Fantasy film in which the Great Wall of China was built to repell a horde of monsters.
Comically Lopsided Rivalry  -  A rivalry that tends to favor one side.
A Winner Is You  -  Bare bones ending to an elaborate game.
Orchestral Bombing  -  Orchestrated music as a battle theme.
As Lethal As It Needs To Be  -  Weapons or attacks that kill in one scene, knock out in another, with identical attacks.
This Is The Part Where  -  The Genre Savvy deliberately tells the Genre Blind that they're supposed to invoke a trope.
A Glass In The Hand  -  Fists clench, glassware broken.
One Winged Angel  -  The Big Bad takes on a new form or unleashes the real form when the chips are down.
Badges And Dog Tags  -  Police officer with a military background.
Swans A Swimming  -  Swans in fiction are elegant, gentle creatures.
Evil Living Flames  -  When fire comes alive and tries to kill you.
Gaiden Game  -  A stand-alone entry to a series with few or no ties to a Story Arc.
Court Mage  -  Token Wizard in the Standard Royal Court.
Succession Crisis  -  Who's supposed to be king now?
Expecting Someone Taller  -  Someone meets a famous character and is disappointed by their looks.
Tomboy Angst  -  Tomboy that actually hates being a tomboy.
Comical Angry Face  -  Anger expressed in a funny way.
Commercial Switcheroo  -  You think it's advertising one product, but it's really about another!
Super Mode  -  A state where a character's abilities and skills are temporarily boosted. Often done by technique or with special items.
Asian Drivers  -  Stereotypical Asians are terrible drivers.
Actually Not A Vampire  -  When a character is thought to be a vampire, but isn't a vampire.
Virginity Flag  -  A trait that allows you to quickly identify a virgin from a non-virgin.
Quintessential British Gentleman  -  Stereotypical proper British Nice Guy.
Piss Take Rap  -  Someone without lyrical skills tries to rap... with hilarious results.
Not Really Married Plot  -  A married couple find out that due to technicalities, they are not legally married.
Descending Ceiling  -  The ceiling tries to crush you.
Line Of Sight Alias  -  A disguised character is pressed for a fake name, and improvises one by looking around him.
Dystopian Edict  -  The Mary Suetopia possesses an absurdly draconian law.
Shaming The Mob  -  A character calls out the mob and the mob feels guilty.
Drinking On Duty  -  Boozing instead of working.
AMFM Characterization  -  A character's personality is revealed not so much through words, but through what they put on the radio.
I Want My Mommy  -  When a character is scared, they want their mother.
Animal Assassin  -  The animal did it!
Bruce Lee Clone  -  A character that is unambiguously based on Bruce Lee.
Profane Last Words  -  A character's last words are a profanity/insult/curse.
Powerful But Inaccurate  -  It's not often, but if this attack does hit you, you'll be in for a world of pain.
Lemon Stu  -  The Casanova who can and will sleep with anyone he likes.
Cheeky Mouth  -  The mouth mysteriously migrates to the visible cheek when the character is viewed in profile.
Now Which One Was That Voice  -  When a show either doesn't credit the voice actors, doesn't show which characters they voiced, or only credits the main cast.
Enhance Button  -  Impossible image enhancement.
Slow Doors  -  The door to your bunker is made of Unobtainium and will surely save you from the missiles heading towards your location. The problem? It takes thirty seconds to close.
Troublemaking New Pet  -  A new pet causes trouble, blaming the old for its actions.
Dramatic Ellipsis  -  Using three periods to indicate... A DRAMATIC PAUSE!
Cloning Body Parts  -  Manufacturing replacement body parts by cloning.
Amazingly Embarrassing Parents  -  A child finds their parent(s) incredibly embarrassing.
Pony Express Rider  -  A horse-based mail delivery relay.
Mr Alt Disney  -  Fictional expy of Walt Disney, usually mixed with traits from his more eccentric peer Howard Hughes.
Game Face  -  A character unleashes their inner monster through the look on their face.
Blasting Time  -  Charging your hand-based energy attack with your arms raised upward before firing.
Diesel Punk  -  *punk translated to an early to mid-20th century setting.
Selfie Fiend  -  A person completely obsessed with selfies.
Welcome To Corneria  -  NPC repeats dialogue.
Commercial Break Cliffhanger  -  Watch the adverts or you might miss what happens at the start of the next segment.
Broken Smile  -  Creepy smile indicates near-insanity.
Rude Hero Nice Sidekick  -  A compassionate/polite sidekick is a foil to the less well-adjusted hero.
Goodies In The Toilets  -  Toilets in a video game that have good things inside them which give you points.
Present Absence  -  This character isn't here, and that's important.
Sigh Of Love  -  A character sighs to indicate they're in love.
Crawl  -  A Daddy-Daughter duo (and their dog) end up trapped in their house during a hurricane with some alligators.
Hamster Wheel Power  -  Machinery that is powered by living beings that walk or run on a wheel.
Expendable Alternate Universe  -  Who cares whatever happens to the other 'alternate' universe?
The Power Of Legacy  -  I don't care what Bob did; let Alice remember him fondly. Lie if you need to.
Locards Theory  -  When two things touch there is always a small amount of each left behind.
Sadistic Game Show  -  A game show where the contestants are put through torture and humiliation for entertainment.
Just Before The End  -  The work takes place right before The End of the World as We Know It.
Superheroes Stay Single  -  Authors prefer their superheroes single and available.
Teenage Mutant Samurai Wombats  -  A team of heroic non-humans fight crime in a modern setting. Feared by all but a few human friends, they must stay in hiding.
Miles To Go Before I Sleep  -  One last task before death.
Signature Line  -  Line everyone associates with the work.
Burping Contest  -  Proving one's superiority through gas.
Pain Powered Leap  -  Injuries, especially to the butt, cause characters to leap into the air.
The Schlub Pub Seduction Deduction  -  Attractive women flirting with unattractive schlubs are often after something other than a good time.
Ship Tease  -  Teasing the fandom with some Will They or Won't They subtext.
Freemium  -  You can pay to upgrade your Free account to a Premium account with more perks.
It Can Think  -  Objects or animals are hinted to have intelligence and will.
Tricked Out Time  -  Time Travel changes the past while making it look like nothing changed at all.
Non Indicative First Episode  -  When the pilot stands out from the rest of the episodes, for the better or worse.
Celibate Eccentric Genius  -  Eccentric genius who's uninterested in sex and/or romantic love.
Caffeine Bullet Time  -  Hyperactive character + caffeinated beverage = go very fast
Ancient Conspiracy  -  Ancient, powerful, secret organization.
Sequel Hook  -  A very obvious hint at a sequel.
Runs With Scissors  -  A pair of scissors should NEVER be carried if you're moving! NEVER NEVER NEVER NEVER! OH GOD NEVER!!!
We Do The Impossible  -  A person or group of people who do things considered impossible or improbable by those who tell them to do so.
Left Handed Mirror  -  The opposite dexterity of your identical twin.
Defanged Horrors  -  Scary stuff toned down for kids.
Lethal Diagnosis  -  Once a disease is diagnosed, the symptoms get much worse.
Pride  -  Excessive self-importance, regardless of it being deserved or not.
Always Save The Girl  -  Saving my friends, family, or Love Interest is more important than saving the world!
Necromantic  -  Villain's motive is to revive a dead loved one.
Minor Insult Meltdown  -  A character hurts another character more than they had intended with their choice of words.
One Letter Name  -  Character's name is a single letter.
Ordinary High School Student  -  High school student who appears normal at the start of the series.
Girly Skirt Twirl  -  To show off one's beautiful dress via spinning at least 360 degrees.
Bait And Switch Boss  -  It looks like you're going to fight a particular boss, but then another, usually more powerful boss takes its place.
Inescapable Horror  -  Its horrifying, it cant be stopped, and IT. IS. EVERYWHERE!
Two Faced  -  Part of the character's face is different, or the character has more than one interchangeable face.
Lilliputian Warriors  -  Tiny but violent.
Guilt Ridden Accomplice  -  An accomplice starts to feel guilt ridden about the crime they help commit.
Norse By Norsewest  -  That cold country up north with promiscuous liberal blondes, free health care, IKEA and horned helmets.
Youkai  -  Various supernatural creatures from Japanese Mythology.
Textless Album Cover  -  An album that lacks text on the front or the front and back of its album cover.
Everybody Owns A Ford  -  Thanks to Product Placement, everyone drives the same brand of car.
Yank The Dogs Chain  -  Good turns rarely last, and something will happen to undo it.
Freudian Threat  -  Intimidating someone by threatening them sexually, usually along the lines of castration.
A Glitch In The Matrix  -  A hint that it's All Just a Dream.
Cutting The Electronic Leash  -  A character throws away their cell phone rather than be bothered by people calling them.
Deadly Closing Credits  -  Life-threatening circumstances, sudden cliffhanger cut to black/credits.
Failed Audition Plot  -  If at first you don't get the part, try, try again.
Realistic Humans Cartoony Animals  -  Humans are illustrated realistically, while animals look cartoonish. Inversions are also common.
Divorce Is Temporary  -  Divorced couples or ex-lovers hook up again.
An Odd Place To Sleep  -  These places to take a snooze tell you weird things about the character who's catching Zzz's.
Techno Wizard  -  This character can do anything with a computer.
Diner Brawl  -  An action sequence takes place in a diner.
Non Linear Sequel  -  The sequel doesn't take place directly after the last one.
Blood Bath  -  Taking a bath in nothing but blood.
Maternally Challenged  -  She's no good at child care.
Godwins Law Of Time Travel  -  Changing the past makes the Nazis win.
Social Ornithopod  -  Ornithopod dinosaurs are nice and/or live in herds or other social groups.
Troll  -  They exist/post to piss people off.
Jack Of All Trades  -  A person with numerous, often completely unrelated skills.
Woobie Family  -  When fate (and the writers) take every opportunity to screw with members of a particular bloodline.
Thirty Minutes Or Its Free  -  If your pizza arrives late, you don't have to pay for it anymore.
Kavorka Man  -  A physically unattractive man who, for reasons no one can explain, is a serious Chick Magnet.
Big Fat Future  -  In the future, when everyone is fat, nobody is!
Infallible Babble  -  NPCs always speak the truth.
Evil Versus Evil  -  Two or more villains fight each other.
Garnishing The Story  -  Let's use X to improve our show and make it more awesome!
Straight Gay  -  A gay male with no stereotypical gay traits or mannerisms.
Horny Devils  -  Demons that feed through sex.
Achilles In His Tent  -  A powerful team member quits, but returns to save the day just as the team needs their specific talents.
High Hopes Zero Talent  -  A character who is passionate about doing something, but has no aptitude for it, and never will.
Working Class Werewolves  -  Werewolves tend to have low incomes.
Spoiled By The Format  -  The nature of a medium gives away the fact that a character survives, or that the climax has not occurred.
We Didnt Start The Fuhrer  -  Hitler was not a normal human.
Madonna Archetype  -  Character modeled after the Virgin Mary.
Limited Social Circle  -  The main characters only seem to spend time with each other.
Hero With Bad Publicity  -  A heroic character is hated by the public.
Early Installment Character Design Difference  -  The early design of a character is vastly different than in later installments.
Chivalrous Pervert  -  A character (usually male) who's a total pervert, but is still a good person who always tries to do what's right in the end.
Namedar  -  Able to know the name of someone or someplace without them telling you.
Critical Psychoanalysis Failure  -  Driven mad by your psychiatric patient.
Shapeshifting  -  The ability to change from one physical form to another.
Liars Paradox  -  Stating that you are lying, when the statement itself is a truth.
Melting Pot Nomenclature  -  Names of characters in a setting have inexplicably diverse origins.
Epic Tracking Shot  -  A long, uninterrupted shot of the camera flying through various landscapes, even in the most impossible places to shoot.
Self Plagiarism  -  Ripping off your own work.
Immunity Disability  -  Supposedly helpful immunities have unwelcome side effects.
Broomstick Quarterstaff  -  Using a mop or broom as a weapon.
Butt Dialing Mordor  -  Unintentionally contacting evil beings in a supernatural way.
Mascot Villain  -  The most recognizable villain of the franchise.
Perpetual Smiler  -  Can't wipe that grin off their face.
Dumbass Teenage Son  -  The teenage son is stupid.
Wrench Whack  -  Using a wrench as an Improvised Weapon.
Chained Heat  -  Two characters chained together must cooperate.
The Burlesque Of Venus  -  Art Imitates Art with Sandro Botticelli's The Birth of Venus.
Nun Too Holy  -  A character that looks and is treated like a nun (or a priestess, shrine maiden, etc), but acts nothing like you'd expect.
Snake Versus Mongoose  -  Mongooses and snakes are depicted as enemies, or opposing motifs.
When Elders Attack  -  An elderly character provoked into violence, often utilizing objects already on their person.
Nothing But Skulls  -  Piles of skulls and skulls alone, no other type of bone.
The Wonka  -  A strange figure of authority who is (usually) successful because of their weird kind of logic.
Adopt The Dog  -  Neutral character does something nice and becomes a good guy.
Driver Faces Passenger  -  Looking at the person next to you or behind you rather than the road.
Raised Hand Of Survival  -  A person believed to be dead raises their hand onto the screen to show that they're alive.
Nothing Is Funnier  -  Sometimes, leaving things to the viewers' imagination is the funniest way to go.
Made Of Bologna  -  When flesh is cut deeply, the innards are simplified to a solid, uniform substance.
Faked Gift Acceptance  -  Appearing to accept a gift only to discard or destroy it later.
Theatrics Of Pain  -  When a professional performer exaggerates the impact of an attack for show.
Body Double  -  A character gets a lookalike for dangerous situations.
Karmic Nod  -  A character accepts their karmic punishment.
Mutual Kill  -  Taking each other out with one attack.
Enemy Chatter  -  Game enemies talk to each other with the same language as the hero.
Fag Hag  -  Straight woman who prefers the company of gay men to that of straight men.
Impossibly Delicious Food  -  Food that shouldn't taste THAT good, but it does.
Water Is Air  -  Life underwater is pretty much like regular life. Even physics agrees.
The Power Of Cheese  -  The advertised product seems to be better than it actually is.
You Have Outlived Your Usefulness  -  An associate of the villain no longer has any role in the villain's plan and is killed.
The Gambling Addict  -  Someone who is obsessed with gambling their money, usually to poor results.
Recursive Canon  -  One work in The 'Verse claims that another work in the same universe is a work of fiction.
You Tube Kids Channel  -  Those weird channels with Spider-Man, Elsa, and the like doing odd things. Totally educational.
Midair Repair  -  Repairing the ship/plane in the middle of the flight.
Spaghetti Western  -  Deconstructions of The Western made in Europe (mainly Italian productions).
Everybody Hates Hades  -  The god of death or the dead is portrayed as evil even if they weren't in the original mythology.
Sink Or Swim Mentor  -  This mentor won't go easy on you just because you're a novice.
Exploiting The Fourth Wall  -  A character uses elements from beyond the fourth wall to achieve an In-Universe goal.
Bribing Your Way To Victory  -  Paying real-world money for in-game advantage.
Older Than The Demographic  -  The protagonist of a Preschool Show of sorts is a teen or adult.
Self Applied Nickname  -  A character gives themselves a cooler-sounding nickname.
Offscreen Breakup  -  A couple is stated to have broken up, but we don't actually see it go down.
Rock Trio  -  A guirtarist, a bassist and a drummer.
Fetus Terrible  -  A genuinely, innately evil fetus.
Standing Between The Enemies  -  A third character stops a fight between two groups and gets them to resolve things peacefully.
Blush Sticker  -  Blushes that look like stickers.
Sliding Scale Of Unavoidable Versus Unforgivable  -  Is the action morally questionable or morally reprehensible?
If I Had A Nickel  -  If you hear a particular phrase or see a particular element long enough, you believe you'd be wealthy.
Strapped To A Bomb  -  A character gets tied up and fastened to some sort of explosive device.
Trope Namers  -  Source of name for a trope.
Taxonomic Term Confusion  -  A group of related organisms is referred to with a noun which seems generic, but it actually has a specific use in biology.
Two Gamers On A Couch  -  Two gamers sit on a couch, play games and talk to each other.
Idiosyncratic Ship Naming  -  Referring to a couple using a regular word (suffixes optional).
Porn Without Plot  -  A work that exists to showcase porn instead of telling a story.
Hot Blooded Sideburns  -  Large sideburns used to indicate a character is Hot-Blooded.
Donut Mess With A Cop  -  Police officers love donuts.
Single Biome Planet  -  A planet with only a single climate.
Sirens Are Mermaids  -  All mermaids are half-woman, half-fish hybrids who kill sailors with their song.
Misaimed Realism  -  An attempt at making a game's mechanics more "realistic" that backfires and ends up damaging Willing Suspension of Disbelief instead.
The Perfect Crime  -  A crime where it's impossible for the criminal to NOT get off scot-free.
Moffs Law  -  There's nothing wrong with critiquing a work of art.
Thieving Pet  -  A pet steals human things.
Technically A Smile  -  Baring one's teeth in what looks like a smile, but does not work in expressing joy or friendliness.
Busby Berkeley Number  -  Musical numbers with elaborate sets and intricate choreography.
Weaponized Car  -  Vehicle equipped for battle, usually on the open road.
Alphabetical Theme Naming  -  Names that have a certain letter or group of letters in them.
The Fighting Narcissist  -  A badass Narcissist who will kill you if you tarnish his beauty.
Knight Knave And Squire  -  The Knight Errant, the Lovable Rogue, and the Naïve Newcomer.
Bridal Carry  -  Man carries woman in his arms in front of him.
Meaningful Funeral  -  A character's funeral brings out things about him and the mourners that would not have surfaced otherwise.
Enormous Engine  -  Vehicle has a notably large and bulky engine.
Tribute To Fido  -  Character is based on Real Life pet.
Robeast  -  Cyborg Kaijus. Natural prey of Humongous Mechas.
The Gadfly  -  Someone who likes to make fun of or annoy others just for laughs.
Memetic Bystander  -  A character who becomes absurdly popular, despite solely being in the background.
Pretty Princess Powerhouse  -  A princess who is graceful, beautiful and likely a better fighter than her soldiers.
Sequel Number Snarl  -  The numbering of sequels gets complicated.
Romanticized Abuse  -  Abuse made out to be sexy, ignoring the fact that in reality it isn't.
Bullet Sparks  -  Bullets make sparks when they hit metal.
Slippery Slope Fallacy  -  Anything is a slippery slope if you are an idiot. (e.g.Speed limits mean they are coming for our cars!!11!!!!)
Forgot The Disability  -  Reminder moments for characters (and sometimes the audience) that a character is disabled.
Informed Obscenity  -  Weird nonsense words that people think are dirty.
Fold Spindle Mutilation  -  A living body is forced through a threshold it could not fit in without injury, deforming it.
Childhood Memory Demolition Team  -  A construction team destroys a character's childhood memories when the character grows up.
Webcomic Time  -  The timeframe of a work of serial media is much smaller than the time it took to publish it.
Rabbit Magician  -  Rabbits know magic.
Parental Substitute  -  An older character acts as a parental figure for another.
Badass Long Robe  -  Medieval robes which make the wearer look badass.
Evil Eyebrows  -  Arched eyebrows as a sign of villainy.
The War Of Earthly Aggression  -  Off-world colonies declare independence from the mother planet.
Flying Car  -  A car that flies.
Plausible Deniability  -  Denial of something that can be easily backed up by justifiable circumstances.
Dark Chick  -  The Evil Counterpart of The Chick.
Religious Stereotype  -  A stereotype made about a religion.
Like Is Like A Comma  -  Like, excessive use of, like, the word "like."
Stand In Parents  -  In the absence of suitable parents, a child (or children) find two people to pretend to be their parents when the situation calls for it.
Mentors New Hope  -  Training a new student inspires an old mentor.
Expospeak  -  As You Know, people in Science Fiction stories talk funny.
The Bully  -  That person who always picks on you.
Planet Destroyer  -  A being or object that could easily destroy one or more worlds.
Big Eater  -  Eats loads and loads of chow.
Fair Cop  -  An attractive police officer (often times a woman).
Brick Break  -  Martial artists break bricks with their bare hands.
Suck E Cheeses  -  Crappy kids pizza/playground themed restaurant. May be Popular with Furries.
Abduction Is Love  -  Kidnapping the one you love results in them loving you.
Justified Trope  -  A trope that usually defies logic is supported by a logical in-universe explanation.
Popular Saying But  -  A character subverts a popular idiom for funnies.
Tears From A Stone  -  It's physically unable to cry, and yet manages to at least appear to do so.
Fatal Family Photo  -  Showing family photo to others = certain death.
Rule Sixty Three  -  #63: For every character there is a gender flipped version. No exceptions.
Minor Crime Reveals Major Plot  -  Initial investigation leads to something bigger.
The Power Of Hate  -  Hatred gives power or strength.
Executive Excess  -  Depictions of CEOs and other important businessmen as hedonistic, grotesquely extravagant and self-indulgent.
Champions On The Inside  -  So close to grandeur, yet they lost... but their efforts are what count and won't go unnoticed.
Pillow Pregnancy  -  Pillow-stuffed shirt passes for pregnancy.
Unexpected Gameplay Change  -  Suddenly, the nature of a game changes.
Hold The Line  -  Defend the fort, stand your ground, have a strong defense to win it; otherwise, Game Over.
Walking Techbane  -  Character is destructive to technology.
Too Much Alike  -  Two characters don't get along because of their similarities.
Conveniently Unverifiable Cover Story  -  A fake background, but it can't be disproven.
Really Gets Around  -  A character who has a disproportionate number of sexual partners compared to everyone else.
Amoral Attorney  -  He's an evil lawyer, and that's no joke.
Absurdly Youthful Mother  -  When you subtract the age (or apparent age) of a child from that of their parent, Fridge Logic results.
Tron Lines  -  Technology with gratuitous glowing lines.
Font Anachronism  -  That typeface you're seeing didn't exist in the time the work was set.
Hollywood Homely  -  From our viewpoint: they're average or better. From the characters' viewpoint: they're hideous.
Rain Rain Go Away  -  An episode about the characters not liking a rainy day.
Chilly Reception  -  Everyone's mean to the new guy for no reason.
Cosmic Plaything  -  The universe literally has it in for this character.
Beta Test Baddie  -  A villain is motivated by his inferiority complex.
Precursor Worship  -  Viewing The Precursors as gods.
Power Levels  -  Systems used to precisely quantify a character's strength.
Acquired Error At The Printer  -  A small mistake made by a printing service leads to large embarrassment for the customer.
Contemptible Cover  -  A misleadingly lurid cover illustration.
Over And Under The Top  -  Two characters share a trait. One overplays it, the other underplays.
Space Cadet Academy  -  The Sci-Fi equivalent of a Wizarding School.
Romantic False Lead  -  A character brought in to serve as a decoy Love Interest and get in between the eventual Official Couple.
Gag Dub  -  Inaccurately dubbing a show for laughs.
Turn To Religion  -  A character becomes devout after a dramatic event.
Commercialized Christmas  -  The Christmas holiday used for MONEY!
Hostile Terraforming  -  Making a planet less suitable for native life and more suitable for alien life.
Sinister Geometry  -  Objects/creatures with geometrically simple shapes are weird and/or bad.
Beta Outfit  -  A superhero's first outfit before they decide on their final costume.
Post Apunkalyptic Armor  -  Improvised armor used after The Apunkalypse.
Achilles Heel  -  Character or object has one weak point. Time to hit.
Insurmountable Waist Height Fence  -  An obstacle that should be easy to get past, but the game won't let you.
Canada Does Not Exist  -  Shows filmed in Canada deliberately obscure their setting's location.
That One Rule  -  Complex rule in a straightforward game.
He Who Must Not Be Seen  -  Recurring Character who never appears on-screen.
Bungled Suicide  -  Someone tries to kill themself and ends up still alive.
Bulletproof Human Shield  -  Grab some poor sap and let his body block bullets.
The Need For Mead  -  ISO standard Medieval European Fantasy tavern, with ale and barmaids aplenty.
What Could Possibly Go Wrong  -  Everything is juuuust fine, despite a very obvious potential for catastrophe. A common phrase on many "Famous Last Words" joke lists.
The Unfair Sex  -  In a heterosexual relationship, every problem is the man's fault. Even when it's the woman's fault.
Adventure Rebuff  -  Sorry, hero, but you may not help me save the world.
Alternate Identity Amnesia  -  A character suffers from amnesia when changing form or self.
All Flyers Are Birds  -  Non-bird flying animals are treated as and/or act like birds.
Parrying Bullets  -  Melee weapons are used to parry projectiles.
Magical Negro  -  Unrealistically perfect Token Black character who exists only to dispense down-to-earth wisdom to the (usually) white protagonist.
Surprisingly Good Foreign Language  -  They speak the foreign language quite well.
Elegant Classical Musician  -  Women (and men) playing musical instruments are hot.
All Just A Dream  -  Framing device where the story was just a dream.
Clothesline Stealing  -  People are in need of clothing and steal from a clothesline.
Odd Couple  -  A friendly (sometimes romantic) relationship between completely different people, usually the main characters.
Practically Different Generations  -  Wide age gap between siblings.
The Musketeer  -  A character wields both a firearm and a melee weapon, but not at the same time.
The Hilarious Table  -  A group of people laughing heartily at nothing in particular, in order to show they are having a good time.
Big Bad Friend  -  The protagonist's friend has been working with—or is—the Big Bad the whole time.
Nightmare Fetishist  -  People who are turned-on and/or fascinated by things that others find frightening.
Senseless Sacrifice  -  A Heroic Sacrifice that changes nothing.
Scam Religion  -  A religion that only exists to trick the believers into "donating" their possessions and to enrich their leadership.
Missed The Recital  -  A character is delayed on their way to a performance and by the time they get there the show is over.
Evil Lawyer Joke  -  Amoral Attorney Played for Laughs.
I Do Not Like Green Eggs And Ham  -  Hating something until you actually try it, and then loving it.
Dawson Casting  -  Teenage or younger characters are portrayed by markedly older actors.
Anecdotal Fallacy  -  Proposition Q is suggested to be true. Event R is counter to Proposition Q. Therefore, Proposition Q must be false.
Red Pill Blue Pill  -  Choosing either the Adventure or a normal life.
Leaning On The Fourth Wall  -  A character makes a statement that makes sense in-universe, but can easily be interpreted as the character acknowledging that they are in a work of fiction.
The Big Easy  -  Trope: New Orleans through the lens of pop culture.
Pretend To Be Brainwashed  -  Someone fakes being under mind control.
Token Black Friend  -  The Token Black friend of The Hero.
Mailer Daemon  -  Villainous Online Stalker with a Crush.
Didnt Need Those Anyway  -  Losing bits of itself as it takes damage.
Recruit Teenagers With Attitude  -  Instead of trained adults or the average superheroes, random teenagers are asked to save the day.
Spooky Photographs  -  The pictures are in, and you're DOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOMED!!!
Mermaid Problem  -  How does one have sex with a mermaid?
Smug Straight Edge  -  Acts self-righteous for not doing drugs.
Timmy In A Well  -  What's that, Lassie? You say Timmy fell down the well?
Belly Scraping Flight  -  An aircraft or flying creature brushes the ground or a terrestrial obstacle in a close call.
Superhero Prevalence Stages  -  Early: The protagonist is the only superhero the general public is aware of.
Ghost Pirate  -  A pirate who kept on piratin' long after he died.
Pile Bunker  -  A pile driver - like melee weapon.
Clam Trap  -  Clams and other bivalves can bite people or trap them in their shells.
Always Over The Shoulder  -  The camera in third person video games are directly behind the player character, to make looking and aiming easier.
One True Love  -  The love of your life who you were destined to spend eternity with.
Unknown Item Identification  -  Part of a game's challenge is collecting, identifying, and using unknown items.
Drop Dead Gorgeous  -  A nude corpse (usually of a woman) used to titillate the audience.
Sealed Evil In A Six Pack  -  One entity, multiple containers.
Clone Army  -  An army composed of clones.
Snap Back  -  Events return to the status quo between episodes and without explanation.
Through His Stomach  -  Winning a man's heart by cooking for him.
Super Zeroes  -  Incredibly lame and ineffectual superheroes.
Heinous Hyena  -  Fictional hyenas are almost always evil, cowardly, vicious and/or disgusting animals.
Emotional Regression  -  An adult or teenage character reverts back to a younger mental state.
Gang Of Bullies  -  Bullies travel in herds.
Disappointed In You  -  Disappointment is worse than anger.
Hero Secret Service  -  The people who protect the important one.
No Honor Among Thieves  -  Villains are not loyal, even to each other.
The Exit Is That Way  -  When a character intends to exit but ends up going the wrong way and needs to correct themselves.
Electric Love  -  Romance felt by electricity upon touch.
Home Porn Movie  -  Ordinary people record themselves having sex.
Trust Password  -  A specific word or phrase meant to show that whoever speaks it is trustworthy.
The Chooser Of The One  -  The one that decides who The Chosen One is.
Trend Covers  -  When a book series becomes famous, other books try to emulate that cover as a way to cash in on the original's popularity.
Happy Birthday To You  -  The Happy Birthday To You song was under copyright until 2015, so media had to find alternatives.
Polished Port  -  Video game conversions gone awesomely, awesomely right.
Sexposition  -  Making exposition more interesting by combining it with a Sex Scene.
Bat Scare  -  A bunch of bats(or similar small flying creatures) emerges from a seemingly-vacant area, providing a Jump Scare.
I Am Legion  -  WE ARE ONE.
Who Needs Enemies  -  The hero's ally fights for their own reasons and their own agendas.
Civvie Spandex  -  Using civilian clothes combined with a superhero costume.
Inhuman Human  -  Their soul is fine. Their body... Eh, we'll get back to you.
Undeath Always Ends  -  Undead characters eventually either die (again) or have their humanity restored.
IKEA Erotica  -  Boring descriptions of sex scenes.
Domino Revelation  -  A single revelation of a secret leads to a larger chain of revelations.
Good Shepherd  -  A good priest.
Master Swordsman  -  A character noted for their mastery of the sword.
Stairway To Heaven  -  A literal staircase leading to Heaven.
Stupid Sacrifice  -  Character sacrifices themself needlessly.
Marital Rape License  -  The idea that it is not rape if you're married.
Forgot About His Powers  -  Previously-established ability could solve the problem. Let's ignore it!
Alcohol Is Gasoline  -  An alcoholic beverage is presented as capable of being used to fuel a vehicle.
Only Child Syndrome  -  All characters are shown and/or assumed to be only children unless something in the plot says otherwise.
Diabolus Ex Machina  -  Suddenly, unanticipated tragedy strikes.
Weather Report Opening  -  The first line to establish a setting is to note the weather.
All Animals Are Domesticated  -  The animal sidekicks are creatures that shouldn't be kept as pets.
Non Malicious Monster  -  A monstrous creature, who, while wreaking havoc, isn't actually evil; just acting out of animal instinct with no concept of morality.
Rummage Sale Reject  -  Clothing that is possible, but seems to have been designed randomly.
Evil Has A Bad Sense Of Humor  -  Bad guys either don't understand jokes or tell really bad ones.
Lensman Arms Race  -  Yesterday, spears; today, cannons; tomorrow, nukes!
Fine You Can Just Wait Here Alone  -  ...ah, on second thought? Wait for me~!
Extreme Melee Revenge  -  Extreme physical violence in vindication.
Groundhog Day Loop  -  Time always repeats itself... but-
Science Foils  -  A two-scientist team with opposing personalities and views on science.
Something Only They Would Say  -  Wanna figure out if Jack's really Jack? Know what only he would say.
Lesbian Jock  -  A female jock who also happens to be a lesbian.
Mirror Reveal  -  Someone who undergoes a transformation of some sort is unaware of what happened until they get a look at their own reflection.
King Of All Cosmos  -  The Almighty is a bit... eccentric.
Explosive Cigar  -  When having a smoke results in a literal blast.
One Shot Character  -  This character is seen once and never again.
Welcome To The Big City  -  Antics in the city.
Grey And Gray Insanity  -  A character gets so caught up in the moral nuances they're utterly unable to see unambiguous Right or Wrong.
Magnum Opus  -  A character's most ambitious and laborious creative undertaking.
Time Passage Beard  -  A beard is grown to show that lots of time has passed.
You ALL Share My Story  -  All the seemingly unrelated characters share a connection, after all.
Bathroom Stall Of Overheard Insults  -  Hearing bad stuff from inside a bathroom stall.
Sick Captive Scam  -  A captive fakes illness or injury to get the drop on his captor.
Incorrect Animal Noise  -  An animal in fiction emits the vocalization of a different animal.
Power Misidentification  -  When one power is assumed to be another power.
Genre Throwback  -  Bringing back antiquated elements in a particular genre to current works in order to appeal to nostalgia.
No Backwards Compatibility In The Future  -  Old hard/software will be straight up unusable as Technology Marches On.
Good Princess Evil Queen  -  A heroic princess is contrasted against a villainous queen.
Mythopoeia  -  A fictional mythology for a fictional world.
Future Foil  -  An established character working off a future incarnation of themselves
Fake Longevity  -  Padding game length with monotonous activities.
First Episode Resurrection  -  Hero dies and is brought back to life at the beginning of the story.
Sisterhood Eliminates Creep  -  Multiple women team up on one man.
Truman Show Plot  -  A plot in which the main character is unknowingly on Reality TV.
Continue Your Mission Dammit  -  Hurry up, or else I'll tell you to hurry up again!
Monster Delay  -  We don't see the monster...until halfway through the movie.
Dynamite Candle  -  Oh, Crap!, I just lit a stick of dynamite because I thought it was a candle!
Mistaken For Misogynist  -  Someone is mistakenly thought to be sexist against women.
Raygun Gothic  -  The Future as told by the 1950s, 1960s or early to mid-1970s.
Amicable Exes  -  A split couple still on good terms.
Kung Fu Kid  -  Youngster that does martial arts like the pros.
Second Episode Morning  -  After major events in the first episode, the second episode begins with someone waking up to start a new day.
Cope By Creating  -  The character creates something as a coping mechanism.
Running Gag  -  Repeat because it's funny.
Eye Recall  -  A flashback sequence that starts with the camera zooming inside the pupil of the character recalling the memory.
Absurd Altitude  -  A character is flung to a ridiculous height which may or may not involve space.
Monster Munch  -  A character whose entire purpose is to be killed by the Monster of the Week in the course of its normal activities, typically to demonstrate how scary said monster is.
Well This Is Not That Trope  -  I'm gonna describe something in detail, then tell you that's not what I'm talking about.
Calling Your Bathroom Breaks  -  When a character needs the bathroom, they say "I have to pee" or something similar, instead of being polite.
Ivy League For Everyone  -  Fictional characters have a much easier time getting into prestigious schools than real people.
Gold Is Yellow  -  Yellow as a shorthand for gold.
There Can Be Only One  -  A group of characters have to kill each other until only one remains.
Tennis Boss  -  Deflect the boss' attacks to win.
Femininity Failure  -  The Girly Girl tries to teach the Tomboy to be more feminine with disastrous results.
On One Condition  -  To inherit my fortune or get me to go along with you, you must agree to these terms. Even if you hate them.
A Tragedy Of Impulsiveness  -  Characters suffer horribly because they act before thinking.
Stupid Scientist  -  A supposedly intelligent person says something really stupid and possibly Hilarious in Hindsight.
What Kind Of Lame Power Is Heart Anyway  -  A character's power is so specific as to be useless.
Crush Filter  -  Bob has a crush on Alice, and he sees her as more attractive than she actually is, sometimes even breaking the art style.
Instant Armor  -  You want armor? Abra Kadabra! You get armor in the blink of an eye!
Disney Acid Sequence  -  Musical sequence set to abstract and often bizarre visuals not present in the rest of the work.
I Regret Nothing  -  When a character has no regrets.
Universal Adaptor Cast  -  Space, western, feudal Japan, you name it, you can fit these characters into any setting.
Changed For The Video  -  A music video uses a version of the song that's noticeably different from the original.
Do Not Do This Cool Thing  -  A work that tries to discourage something ends up backfiring by making it look cool by accident.
The Game Come To Life  -  Video game characters become real.
The Contributors  -  Us.
Translation Train Wreck  -  Translation is a matter entirely incomprehensible. (Translation that's bad to the point of being incomprehensible.)
Character Overlap  -  Characters in one series crossover to another series.
Soft Water  -  Falls into water never hurt.
Bifurcated Weapon  -  Multiple weapons in one.
Dumped Via Text Message  -  Not even bothering to dump someone in face-to-face.
Irishman And A Jew  -  A pair of someone Irish and a Jew.
Richard Nixon The Used Car Salesman  -  Alternate universe-historical figures with vastly different jobs.
World Of Jerkass  -  The author intentionally makes most, if not all, of the characters unsympathetic.
Still Sucks Thumb  -  A character past his baby age still resorts to thumb-sucking.
Revealing Hug  -  Facial expressions made during an embrace reveal ulterior motives.
Blood From The Mouth  -  ...Usually means you're going to die.
Necro Non Sequitur  -  Fatal case of Contrived Coincidence.
Finger Firearms  -  Actual ranged weapons in the fingers and/or thumb.
Image Booru  -  Image repository site with tagging system.
Classical Antihero  -  A mostly noble hero who suffers from flaws and hindrances that must be overcome.
No Neck Chump  -  A character with no visible neck.
Look What I Can Do Now  -  Character shows off cool powers, usually after an extended absence.
Distinguished Gentlemans Pipe  -  Distinguished gentlemen smoke a pipe.
Lovecraft Lite  -  Low-octane Cosmic Horror Story.
Meat O Vision  -  Hallucinations induced by hunger or starvation make anyone and anything look like food.
Contractual Genre Blindness  -  A character who is Genre Savvy sticks to his role because of it.
I Cant Feel My Legs  -  When a character announces they can't feel their legs, something bad will happen to them.
Fake Out Make Out  -  We Need a Distraction! Quick! Kiss me!
Credits Jukebox  -  An unusually high ratio of theme songs to episodes.
Team Spirit  -  An Aesop that if you want to accomplish your goals, you need to work together as a team.
Taking Advantage Of Generosity  -  If you offer an inch, they demand a mile.
So Happy Together  -  The couple shares one last happy moment before the relationship ends tragically.
Forgot I Couldnt Swim  -  Someone throws himself into a situation then belatedly realizes he can't handle it.
Insect Gender Bender  -  Insects have abilities that conflict with their gender.
Two Dun It  -  It's revealed that not one, not three, but TWO people are responsible for the crime.
Morality Adjustment  -  Becoming more of a heel or a face, but not enough to perform a FaceHeel Turn or a HeelFace Turn
Even Beggars Wont Choose It  -  Even beggars have standards.
Alien Catnip  -  Mundane to humans, narcotic to aliens.
Reactive Continuous Scream  -  A loud scream causes a chain reaction of other people screaming, usually Played for Laughs.
The Grand Hunt  -  A formalized hunt for sport.
Genre Refugee  -  This character who looks like (s)he doesn't belong in this setting at all...yet is here nonetheless.
Harsh Word Impact  -  Characters getting attacked by words and/or speech bubbles.
Existential Horror  -  There's no reason or purpose for your life, and that's spooky.
Possession Implies Mastery  -  You automatically know how to use anything you have to its full extent.
Secret Identity Apathy  -  An enemy who doesn't care or want to learn [or reveal] his foe's secret identity despite the idea being presented to him.
Play Every Day  -  Game encourages checking in every day for a bonus or event.
Bait And Switch Credits  -  The opening credits lie about the show.
String Theory  -  A character tracks information visually via an interconnected web of strings.
Magic By Any Other Name  -  Fictional magic never referred to as "magic".
Predecessor Villain  -  The villain who existed before the current Big Bad.
Unstoppable Mailman  -  No matter what stands in his way, the mailman will always deliver!
The Gambler  -  Gambling-themed character.
Giants Knife Humans Greatsword  -  A normal-sized weapon for a monster may be considered huge by human reckoning.
Construction Vehicle Rampage  -  Construction machines are ironically used as weapons of destruction.
A House Divided  -  The cast, who should be working together, start to turn against each other.
Happy Rain  -  Character likes the rain.
Answers To The Name Of God  -  Oh my God! "Yes?"
Review Ironic Echo  -  A movie has a line of dialogue that makes for perfect review fodder.
The Genie Knows Jack Nicholson  -  Magic as an excuse for anachronistic humor.
Dueling Works  -  Two works with similar premises are released at around the same time.
All Women Are Prudes  -  Women have no sex drive at all, in contrast to men who consist of nothing but a sex drive.
Signature Scene  -  Work's defining moment; the scene everyone will remember or is likely to think of when it is brought up.
Evil Laugh  -  Laughter as an expression of evil, especially evil-derived satisfaction.
Istanbul Not Constantinople  -  Classical names for Alternate History countries.
Reverse Whodunnit  -  We know whodunnit from the opening; the question is, howcatchem?
Cruel To Be Kind  -  One character helps another via ostensibly evil acts.
Hijacking Cthulhu  -  A Physical God is successfully enslaved by or fused with a being of much less power.
Erotic Dream  -  Dreams that feature sex or sexual things.
Circus Episode  -  An episode of a (normally non-circus-oriented) series taking place at a circus or carnival.
Mental World  -  What is the landscape of your existence?
Character Development  -  A character changes over the course of a narrative.
Achievement Mockery  -  Achievement Unlocked: You screwed up! Congratulations!
Poltergeist  -  Ghosts that haunt inanimate objects and cause them to move on their own.
The Dragon  -  The Big Bad's Number Two; often the penultimate challenge that The Hero must face before confronting the Big Bad.
Boastful Rap  -  Rapping about how awesome and/or rich they are.
Subverted Punchline  -  An obvious joke is teased...and something else is substituted.
Meet My Good Friends Lefty And Righty  -  These fists have names.
Stand Alone Episode  -  Episodes that don't follow a series' continuity and have their own plot.
Comfort The Dying  -  Making a character feel better in their last moments.
Hulking Out  -  You Wouldn't Like Me When I'm Angry + Shapeshifting = Unstoppable Rage
Melodic Death Metal  -  Swedish death metal guys liked X Japan and Helloween and incorporated their riffs into death metal songs.
Did You Just Punch Out Cthulhu  -  A mortal character defeats a Physical God, Cosmic Entity, or Eldritch Abomination.
Kill Steal  -  Dealing the killing blow for credit.
Jerkass Realization  -  The moment when a character realizes they've been a Jerkass.
Body Backup Drive  -  Body destroyed? No biggie, just transfer your mind to a backup body.
Reinventing The Telephone  -  People use exotic means of communication even when mundane ones exist that would work better.
Bleak Level  -  Downer level in an otherwise upbeat game.
Honest Corporate Executive  -  A character running a corporation by legit means.
Freeze Sneeze  -  A character sneezes from being cold.
Scarily Competent Tracker  -  This character will find you based on many clues, no matter how illogical it seems.
Chromatic Arrangement  -  A Power Trio Color-Coded for Your Convenience with the additive primary colors (Red, Blue, Green), subtractive primaries (cyan/blue, magenta/red, yellow), or a group of four that combines the two (Red, Blue, Green, and Yellow.)
Animal Motifs  -  The use of an animal/animals to underline a theme or make a statement about a character.
Christmas Town  -  The North Pole. Santa's Workshop. The Land of Christmas Cheer.
Eternal Sexual Freedom  -  Anachronistic treatment of present-day sexual mores.
Mirror Universe  -  Alternate Universe where the heroes of the story are villains.
Go Go Enslavement  -  Captive is dressed in embarrassing clothing.
Extruded Book Product  -  Ghostwritten series of books where the main plotline of every book is basically the same, and created at a rate that's higher than any one writer usually writes.
Rule Of Animation Conservation  -  Animation is expensive and therefore used only where necessary.
Formerly Sapient Species  -  Humans, or a similarly intelligent race, that have somehow permanently regressed to an animalistic state.
Tactical Withdrawal  -  An organized retreat from a position, done for tactical gain rather than out of fear.
Just One More Level  -  I will sit here until I beat the whole game and be in denial about it.
Moth Menace  -  Threatening (and often giant) moths and butterflies.
Artistic License Ornithology  -  Factual inaccuracies about birds in a work of fiction, because it makes the story work better.
The Protagonist  -  The main character.
Badass Longcoat  -  Trenchcoats kick ass.
Immortality Seeker  -  This character wants to live forever.
Honorable Elephant  -  An Elephant character has high standards.
Dragged By The Collar  -  An alternative solution for when convincing someone to willingly follow you is not an option.
Innocent Bigot  -  Does not realize that what they're saying is offensive.
Make Some Noise  -  Sound manipulation.
Ten Second Flashlight  -  Portable light source has limited battery life, and may or may not recharge.
Song Parody  -  The same song, but with different lyrics and a different message.
Human Resources  -  Extracting a certain resource from a human body or recycling them as one.
The Show Must Go On  -  No matter what happens, the show goes on.
Uniqueness Decay  -  Allegedly rare and powerful item suddenly becomes commonplace.
Intimate Psychotherapy  -  Sex for Solace causes serious psychological problems to subside.
Fission Mailed  -  False game over sequence.
Former Friends Photo  -  An old picture shows that bitter enemies were once close friends.
Elective Broken Language  -  Speaking a broken language on purpose.
Rape Pillage And Burn  -  An enemy army attacks a civilian settlement, raping and/or killing the inhabitants, pinching their stuff and burning down their homes.
Memetic Molester  -  A canon character turned into an over-the-top mega-pervert by the fanon.
Protect This House  -  Horror/thriller plot about intruders breaking into a home and the occupants having to fight them off.
Stock Clock Hand Hang  -  Hanging from a high place by holding onto a clock's hands. A reference to the film Safety Last!.
Never Going Back To Prison  -  A character who has either been released or escaped from prison makes a pledge to never, ever go back.
Clever Crows  -  Crows and (especially) ravens are often wise or intelligent characters
Trailers Always Spoil  -  A plot point or twist is revealed in the trailer.
Homosexual Reproduction  -  Both of the biological parents are of the same sex/gender.
Its Short So It Sucks  -  Something is bad because it's short.
No Fair Cheating  -  The game knows you cheated, and it won't let this slide by so easily.
Villain By Default  -  These villains are villains because of what they are and not what they do (in some cases, them actually being evil is optional).
Painful Pointy Pufferfish  -  Fish with inflatable bodies and pointed spikes.
Gimmick Matches  -  Matches with rules that are different from a standard one-fall-to-a-finish matches.
A Kind Of One  -  An entire species is named after the name of a popular character of said species.
Apathetic Student  -  A character who doesn't care about school.
Green And Mean  -  Viridian villains.
The Other Marty  -  Original actor's scenes are reshot with the new actor.
Betrayal Fic  -  A fanfic where a character is betrayed by their companions
Last Supper Steal  -  Art Imitates Art with Leonardo da Vinci's The Last Supper.
Metafictional Device  -  Paratext being used as part of the world.
Robot Master  -  A character who uses robots and other autonomous machines to do his/her bidding.note If it involves magic and/or no machinery at all then the character is a Marionette Master.
Starship Luxurious  -  Starships with enormous, space-wasting rooms.
Covered Up  -  The cover version is better known than the original.
Divine Date  -  A mortal romances a god.
Time And Relative Dimensions In Space  -  Traveling through time may also include traveling through space — though if and where is not clear.
Corrupt Church  -  Good church turned bad.
Best Known For The Fanservice  -  The Fanservice (or Godzilla) is the part they all remember.
Celestial Bureaucracy  -  The afterlife has Lobbies, and is a cabinet.
Neck Lift  -  Holding someone in the air by their throat.
Dark Secret  -  This character would do just about anything to keep their secret from getting out.
Salt Solution  -  Salt is a Supernatural Repellent.
The Food Poisoning Incident  -  When a character gets food poisoning or thinks they got food poisoning.
Brutish Bulls  -  Fictional bulls are often portrayed as violent, aggressive and bad-tempered brutes who live for charging things down.
Ominous Latin Chanting  -  Latin + Catholic Church choirs + Anything = EPIC.
I Fought The Law And The Law Won  -  Police forces are nigh impossible to escape or defeat.
Letters 2 Numbers  -  R3plac1ng l3tters w1th numb3rs 2 b3 h1p.
No Budget  -  Making a work with little to no money.
How Many Fingers  -  Oh my God, you're hurt! Quick, how many fingers am I holding up?!
Magical Defibrillator  -  Electricity to the chest always revives people.
Youre Not My Father  -  Younger character rebuffs a parental figure by claiming (truthfully or not) that the elder is not their parent.
The Purge  -  The trope: An organisation's mass murder of dissenting persons out of fear of rebellion.
Red Scare  -  Fearmongering over scary dogmatic communists.
Crowd Hockey  -  Chasing after an object that's rolling around on the floor, being kicked around by a crowd of people.
Musical Spoiler  -  Music clues you in to what's going on.
Script Reading Doors  -  When the needs of the script override the door sensors.
Are We There Yet  -  Character repeatedly irritates others on the trip by constantly asking if they're there yet.
Death Trap  -  An elaborate, but time-delayed, method of execution for a restrained/imprisoned victim.
Absurdly Dedicated Worker  -  A creature continues to carry out its last command even after it's no longer necessary.
Abbey Road Crossing  -  Parody of the Abbey Road cover.
Planar Shockwave  -  A mysterious ring of energy that radially erupts from explosions in space.
Easy Mode Mockery  -  The game alters content in a mocking way or withholds content for playing on an easier difficulty.
Lady And Knight  -  An honourable and courageous character is sworn to defend a high-ranking lady.
Official Fan Submitted Content  -  Creators ask fans for ideas to use in the show.
Tomboy  -  Girl has stereotypically boyish traits.
