Terrorists Without A Cause  -  People spreading terror without having clear motives.
Evil Former Friend  -  Best friends turned deadly enemies.
Not Quite Back To Normal  -  A reverted character retains some characteristic of his / her metamorphosis.
Giant Wall Of Watery Doom  -  TIDAL WAVE!!!
Screwed By The Lawyers  -  A work is negatively affected due to copyright issues.
Heterosexual Life Partners  -  Very close same-sex friends.
Broken Record  -  Something is repeated ad nauseam ad nauseam ad nauseam ad nauseam ad nauseam.
Instant Seiza  -  Single frame transposition from compromising to innocent positions.
Truck Drivers Gear Change  -  A slight shift upward in pitch near the end of a song.
Soft Reboot  -  The plot of the series continues in future iterations, but is tweaked and retconned so that it feels fresh and new.
Benevolent Alien Invasion  -  Intelligent aliens are genuine when they say that they come in peace.
Mexicans Love Speedy Gonzales  -  Stereotype loved by the people it stereotypes.
Overly Polite Pals  -  Two characters (usually male) who are overly polite to each other.
Evil Brit  -  Posh British accent = upper-class evil. Cockney accent = thuggish evil.
Wide Eyes And Shrunken Irises  -  Smaller irises + Widened eyes = A more shocked expression
Traditional Heavy Metal  -  Often blues-influenced Heavy Metal in the style of artists like Black Sabbath or Judas Priest.
Throwing Down The Gauntlet  -  One character challenges another to a fight.
Everyone Has Standards  -  No matter who somebody is, there's still something considered going too far.
Ceiling Banger  -  Keep it down up there! We can hear you!
Palette Swap  -  Swapping colors from an existing sprite graphic to make a second one.
Someone Has To Die  -  One person HAS to die for everyone else's survival.
Justified Criminal  -  Committing crimes for a good reason.
Conflict Killer  -  Someone who suddenly interrupts the conflict of others, causing the others to join forces against the former.
My Secret Pregnancy  -  A woman doesn't want anyone to know she's expecting.
Space Friction  -  Turning your engines off in space inexplicably causes you to slow to a stop.
Denied Parody  -  Something really seems like a parody, but according to the creators, it was not.
Bloody Handprint  -  A handprint made of blood.
Clue Evidence And A Smoking Gun  -  Detective explains minute details leading to their conclusion, followed by evidence so strong it renders the other points unnecessary.
Evil Tainted The Place  -  The site of a tragic and violent event becomes haunted.
Covered With Scars  -  Someone's body is full of scars, either because of badassery or tragic past.
Science Hero  -  Heroes with an affinity for technology and science or derive their powers from such.
Alignment Based Endings  -  When a game's ending is based on moral choice.
Flaming Hair  -  MY HAIR IS ON FIRE!
Consumer Conspiracy  -  Here is the product but don't tell the company that makes it that I told you it exists.
Loose Lips  -  This character really should have kept quiet about that information.
Disconnected By Death  -  Someone gets killed while delivering an important phone call.
Accuser Of The Brethren  -  The character who rejects The Atoner and refuses to let them forgive themself.
Bench Breaker  -  When tied to something, a person just breaks whatever they're tied to instead of bothering with their restraints.
Caught In A Snare  -  A pre-set trap of a net or rope captures someone and leaves them hanging in the air.
Hellish Pupils  -  Non-human shaped pupils on a character's eyes are creepy and frightening.
Meat Versus Veggies  -  Meat-eaters and greens-eaters are depicted as adversarial, with no grey area in between.
Missing Trailer Scene  -  Scenes only found in trailers and other advertising.
Atomic F Bomb  -  Very loud expletive.
Living Shadow  -  A shadow that moves on its own, regardless of light direction and may not even have a host.
I Cant Hear You  -  Common comic gag with a number of variations resulting from one character not being able to hear the other.
The Patient Has Left The Building  -  A hospital patient makes a point of getting up and walking out against the advice of their doctor.
Absent Aliens  -  Humans are the only intelligent life in the universe.
Adorkable  -  A character is somewhat awkward, but it comes off cute.
Hero Insurance  -  Heroes wreck cities to beat the bad guys, but they don't have to pick up the tab.
Ignored Vital News Reports  -  Characters fail to notice a news bulletin that should be important to them.
Fiery Redhead  -  A redhead with a personality as fiery as their hair.
Hostile Show Takeover  -  When one or more characters try to make the show about them.
You Are Worth Hell  -  Together In A Fate Worse than Death.
Dancing With Myself  -  Someone dances alone.
Adaptational Nationality  -  A character's nationality is changed in an adaptation.
Uptight Loves Wild  -  A stuffy and serious urban man paired with a wild and fantasist woman.
Rule Number One  -  A procedure a character has to follow that they memorize by numbering it.
Child Of Forbidden Love  -  A child born from a forbidden romantic union.
Earth All Along  -  Turns out that ruined planet you were on was actually Earth itself.
Deliberately Cute Child  -  Child takes advantage of their cuteness for ulterior motives.
Myth Arc  -  A Story Arc that spans the entire series.
You Watch Too Much X  -  A Genre Savvy character predicts what's going to happen next, only for their friend to tell "You watch too much TV" or something similar.
Generational Magic Decline  -  Your magic is weaker than your father's, just as he is weaker than his father, who was weaker than his father, and so on and so on.
Author Appeal  -  A single gimmick or philosophy is unusually central and widespread, per the author's tastes.
Family Of Choice  -  Unrelated characters commit to always support each other as family.
Best Out Of Infinity  -  Consistent loser insists on being allowed to keep trying until they win [x/2+1] rounds out of [x].
War Is Hell  -  War sucks.
Fertile Feet  -  Wherever they step, flowers grow.
Schedule Slip  -  When authors start to lose consistency with when they update.
Embodiment Of Vice  -  Somebody who has a negative quality assigned to them as a trait.
Impossibly Graceful Giant  -  Humongous Mecha or Kaiju that should be slow and lumbering, but aren't.
Corrupt Politician  -  A jaded politician who has no problems with bribes and helping friends win contracts and maybe worse.
Respawning Enemies  -  WHERE ARE ALL THESE MOOKS COMING FROM???
Hemo Erotic  -  Sex + Blood = This
Ruthless Foreign Gangsters  -  If the criminals aren't originally from around here, expect them to be more vicious than the local criminals.
The Creon  -  A second-in-command who is content with their position.
Artistic License Child Labor Laws  -  Children and young teenagers are depicted with jobs they're too young to hold.
Overcrank  -  Filming at a faster rate so the playback is slowed down.
Laser Blade  -  A sword with a blade made out of energy.
Batman Can Breathe In Space  -  Space suits and oxygen tanks are completely optional in space.
Single Issue Wonk  -  Bringing up a certain subject turns this fine fellow into an obsessive loon.
From Dress To Dressing  -  Makeshift bandages from clothing.
Relationship Revolving Door  -  A couple keeps breaking up and then getting back together.
Favouritism Flip Flop  -  He didn't like it until she did.
Ribcage Stomach  -  The inside of the monster's stomach has a visible ribcage.
Finish Him  -  A fighter is forced to kill his opponent.
Talking To Himself  -  One voice actor (or regular actor) plays two or more characters who end up talking to each other.
Nonhuman Lover Reveal  -  The person you're in love with turns out to be non-human.
Next Sunday AD  -  Story takes place very slightly in the future, with no significant changes from the present.
Getting Ready For Bed Plot  -  A story that is about a character's bedtime routine.
So Proud Of You  -  Everyone shows admiration for the hero's accomplishments, especially his or her loved ones.
Archangel Michael  -  One of the archangels, usually depicted with a sword and the element of fire.
A Taste Of Their Own Medicine  -  A form of Revenge where the victim receives the bad treatment they showed to others.
The Computer Is A Lying Bastard  -  You're given in-game hints. Wrong ones.
Being Tortured Makes You Evil  -  Torture causes you to join your torturers.
Accents Arent Hereditary  -  Family members have different accents when they logically shouldn't.
I Am Great Song  -  A character sings about how awesome and great they are at something.
Visual Innuendo  -  Imagery open to risqué interpretations.
Not Wanting Kids Is Weird  -  People are criticized, pitied, or disapproved for not wanting to have children.
Agitated Item Stomping  -  I'm hopping mad.
Opening Shout Out  -  The theme tune or opening sequence is mentioned or referenced by a character In-Universe in any way.
Mutually Assured Destruction  -  We could destroy each other, but since we know we'd just get destroyed back, we won't actually do it... right?
Idiot Hero  -  A hero who acts like an idiot all the time.
Really Dead Montage  -  They're not Killed Off for Real until they get a flashback montage.
Protagonist Journey To Villain  -  A protagonist who starts out as a hero, then becomes a villain.
Flanderization  -  The process by which one of a character's traits is overstated and exaggerated to the point where it becomes the character's only trait.
Glass Smack And Slide  -  Slamming hard into glass and getting stuck for a while before sliding down.
Anti Sneeze Finger  -  Apply digit under nose to prevent sternutation.
Better As Friends  -  A couple decides their relationship is better off being platonic.
No You  -  A Lame Comeback in the form of simply parroting the received insult.
Flash Step  -  Super Speed that mimics Teleportation.
One Myth To Explain Them All  -  One legend is responsible for all the others.
Alas Poor Villain  -  The villain's death, downfall or just misfortune is painted in a sympathetic light.
Youre Nothing Without Your Phlebotinum  -  Taunting a hero by telling them they're only great because X gives them that power.
Take That Kiss  -  Kissing as an insult.
Arbitrary Headcount Limit  -  You can only have a certain amount of characters in play at one time.
Villainous Valour  -  The villain shows a remarkable amount of bravery, despite possibly being severely outmatched.
Eyes Never Lie  -  The truth is told by the windows of the soul.
Dragon Ancestry  -  Someone with dragonic ancestry or dragon blood.
King Mook  -  Scaled-up, boss version of a regular enemy.
Complexity Addiction  -  Complicated plans are more fun than simple ones, even if they're doomed to fail!
Cant Take Criticism  -  A character doesn't like being criticized for their mistakes.
Offscreen Karma  -  A character receives Laser-Guided Karma offscreen.
Fatal Forced March  -  An extremely dangerous, inescapable and probably lethal journey on foot.
Perpetual Beta  -  Program never stops being fixed and patched.
Real Event Fictional Cause  -  A real-life historical event has a fictional cause behind it.
Suburbia  -  A neighborhood complex that is very neat and organized.
Kleptomaniac Hero  -  Collect everything you can in the game; they might all come in handy later!
Nature Tinkling  -  Deliberately peeing outside.
Super Persistent Predator  -  A predator that goes to unrealistic lengths to catch its prey.
Brains And Bondage  -  When people that are into bondage are portrayed as philosophical or intellectual.
Chronic Backstabbing Disorder  -  Character repeatedly betrays people.
Blind Seer  -  Physically blind, but "sees" with other means, often better than the unimpaired.
Distanced From Current Events  -  A work gets censored, delayed, or canceled due to a then-recent Real Life tragic event or events.
Innocent Prodigy  -  The Child Prodigy isn't (necessarily) Wise Beyond Their Years.
Not Your Problem  -  A character tells the heroes that an issue shouldn't be their problem.
Rewarding Inactivity  -  Being rewarded for doing absolutely nothing.
There Is No Kill Like Overkill  -  Extremely excessive eradication.
Plot Tailored To The Party  -  Each protagonist has to overcome an obstacle specifically matched to their specialty.
Dastardly Whiplash  -  An archetypal villain with depthless schemes, sinister-looking clothing, and a meticulously-trimmed handlebar mustache.
The Svengali  -  A mentor that manipulates and controls his students for his own gain.
Little Professor Dialog  -  Children who talk like smart adults.
All Women Are Lustful  -  Women think about nothing but sex.
End Of Series Awareness  -  Characters know the end of the series is upon them.
Modest Royalty  -  Royalty prefers to cut down on the wardrobe extravagance.
Gangsta Style  -  Holding your gun sideways is cool.
I Uh You Too  -  What is said when a character cannot bring themselves to "I love you."
Unnecessary Makeover  -  A character redesign that is considered worse than what they looked like before.
Screw The Rules Its The Apocalypse  -  Hero disregards normal standards for behavior because the situation is just that dire.
Going Cold Turkey  -  Character quits a substance they are dependent on and is free of their addiction after a single painful withdrawal phase.
Pegasus  -  An airborne horse with feathered wings.
Lightmare Fuel  -  Nightmare Fuel Played for Laughs.
Art Course  -  Generic Video Game Art-themed area.
Close To Home  -  An event causes a character to remember a personal experience that causes anger.
Post Apocalyptic Dog  -  A character has a Loyal Animal Companion (usually a dog) sometime After the End.
Light And Mirrors Puzzle  -  A puzzle consisting of a light and mirrors.
Saved For The Sequel  -  Elements not fully expanded on in a previous installment get expanded on in a future installment.
Cephalothorax  -  The character's face is his entire body.
The Tower  -  The 16th tarot card, traditionally The Tower - usually symbolizes disaster.
Phony Psychic  -  Character fakes psychic powers.
Three Volley Flinch  -  Character flinches at the rifle salute at a military funeral.
Popularity Redo  -  Remaking an old part of an unpopular TV show in another place where it gets more popular.
Inappropriate Speak And Spell  -  Making a kid-friendly language device speak in an un-kid-friendly way.
The Heretic  -  Dissenter upon a religion.
Continuing Is Painful  -  You can continue playing the game even after you die... but not without a serious penalty.
Belated Backstory  -  A character with little backstory suddenly gets one that changes their entire character.
Mooks Ate My Equipment  -  An enemy that consumes (and sometimes destroys) any equipment it touches.
Easy Evangelism  -  Non-believers are converted with no problems.
Magic Floppy Disk  -  They will use outdated technology in the future.
Law Enforcement Inc  -  A Mega-Corp uses a mercenary police force.
Celebrity Superhero  -  A superhero is just like any other celebrity.
Mucking In The Mud  -  Moving in mud either slows a character down or stops them in their tracks.
Of Corset Hurts  -  Device that painfully constricts the waistline.
The Day The Music Lied  -  The Musical Spoiler isn't.
Spirit Advisor  -  A Friendly Ghost/metaphysical being who becomes The Mentor or Mr. Exposition for the hero.
Reprise Medley  -  A reprise of multiple songs in a work, usually towards the end.
Lazy Backup  -  If the active party dies, you lose. Any surviving allies are disregarded.
Obscure Popularity  -  A lot of people know about it, but not as many people talk about it.
Bitter Almonds  -  Smells like cyanide.
Bespectacled Bastard Boyfriend  -  Bastard Boyfriend with Sexy, Stoic Spectacles.
For Happiness  -  Happiness is good, so we should make everyone as happy as possible.
Improvised Weapon  -  Anything can be a weapon with sufficient creativity.
Light Liege Dark Defender  -  A duo dynamic between a personable, charismatic leader and a gloomy fighter fiercely devoted to them.
Lowest Common Denominator  -  Marketing a project to as many people in as little space as possible, or at least that one demographic.
A Nuclear Error  -  When fiction portrays nuclear weapons and nuclear weapons policy innacurately.
Double Weapon  -  A melee weapon consisting of a grip or shaft with a blade on either end.
Stock Animal Diet  -  Animal characters in fiction favor certain foods to a ridiculous degree based on species, which often are not good for their real-life equivalents.
Drone Of Dread  -  A long sustained sound, usually used to invoke Nightmare Fuel.
Blue Collar Warlock  -  Modern, streetsmart spellcasters.
Male Gaze  -  The framing of female bodies in a fetishizing way by male creators or to appeal to a male audience.
Im Crying But I Dont Know Why  -  A character realizes they're crying, but they don't understand why.
And Then What  -  If The Plan succeeds... what next?
No Longer With Us  -  A character uses a common euphemism for death, and means it literally.
Sexual Euphemism  -  Calling sexual intercourse by another name.
I Wish It Were Real  -  Character's favourite fiction becomes real.
Hacking Minigame  -  Hacking in gaming form.
Mating Dance  -  A suggestive dance.
Microts  -  Fictional unit of time.
Gotta Get Your Head Together  -  Victims of assault on the brain, head or ears will clutch their head.
Evil Is Deathly Cold  -  Evil is associated with coldness.
If Only You Knew  -  A character says something that connects to a fact or event of which they're unaware, usually to someone who is in the know.
Benevolent Boss  -  A Nice Guy who treats their employees well.
Conveyor Belt O Doom  -  A Death Trap involving a mechanized delivery system leading to something deadly.
Godhood Seeker  -  A being that aspires to godhood.
Mistaken For Quake  -  Character thinks that there's an earthquake, but it's actually [insert non-earthquake cause here].
Self Care Epiphany  -  A character who otherwise always looks after others learns to prioritize their own well-being, too.
The Shut In  -  A character is unable to leave their house at will, usually due to a physical limitation or condition.
Intelligence Equals Isolation  -  Smart people are doomed to unconditional solitude.
Cutscene Incompetence  -  You are invincible! Until a cutscene arrives.
Embarrassing But Empowering Outfit  -  An outfit that grants its wearer immense power but is also embarrassing.
Her Heart Will Go On  -  Woman's Love Interest is killed off to show how strong she is.
Wouldnt Hurt A Child  -  A character refuses to hurt children.
Threatening Mediator  -  A character threatens to end a conflict between two or more characters.
Gang Bangers  -  Youth street gangs.
Hellfire  -  Fire powers with demonic and dark connotations.
Anachronistic Animal  -  An animal shows up in a work that takes place before or after it existed in real life.
Relax O Vision  -  Censoring graphic scenes by substituting pleasant images.
Blind Mistake  -  Someone makes an error of judgement about their surroundings due to visual impairment.
Foreign Cuss Word  -  Dirty language hidden in a Bilingual Bonus.
The Stations Of The Canon  -  A fanfic revisits a series of iconic canon events.
Diamonds In The Buff  -  Wearing jewelry - and nothing else.
Parents As People  -  Parents being depicted as full-fledged human beings, rather than merely caregivers.
Clean Food Poisoned Fork  -  Indirectly poisoning someone's food via something that will spread it to the food.
Staying Alive  -  A person who never dies.
Implied Death Threat  -  Someone indirectly threatens to end the life of another.
Domain Holder  -  A character who dictates the rules of the universe in a certain space.
Repeat After Me  -  Characters following instructions literally out of ignorance, feigned, or otherwise.
Airstrike Impossible  -  A pilot demonstrates their Improbable Piloting Skills by flying through extremely tight spaces.
Lean And Mean  -  Skinny villain.
The Berserker  -  An Ax-Crazy fighter fueled by Unstoppable Rage.
Bad Liar  -  Unconvincing liar, due to blatantly bad wording and performance.
Little Dead Riding Hood  -  Girl in red lies dead or in danger.
One Drop Rule  -  Character faces bigotry due to an ancestor's race/ethnicity.
Bitch Alert  -  Here comes the bitch.
Religion Of Evil  -  Religion focused on dark powers and evil intentions.
Critical Encumbrance Failure  -  Gradual slowdown/incapacitation from carrying a load is not apparent until you reach the character's capacity limit.
Beautiful Dreamer  -  A person watches over their sleeping partner in admiration.
This Is Your Premise On Drugs  -  Show X is kinda like show Y, if show Y was on psychoactive street drug Z.
Straw Character  -  What the author wants you to think their opponent thinks like.
Gilligan Cut  -  A character immediately does something they said they wouldn't do in the previous scene.
Continuity Nod  -  An intra-continuity Shout-Out.
Humor Mode  -  This text contains a joke.
Damage Proof Vehicle  -  Vehicles in fiction tend to be implausibly indestructible.
Projectile Pocketing  -  Hitting items with projectiles instantly collects them for you.
Kill Em All  -  The entire main cast dies.
Godwins Law  -  As a debate goes on, unfavorably comparing someone to Adolf Hitler and/or Nazi Germany becomes more likely.
Culture Justifies Anything  -  I can shoot/kick this dog because my culture says it's OK!
Collision Damage  -  Touching enemies hurts you.
Talk Like A Pirate  -  Arrrg! I be talkin' like a pirate!
Acme Products  -  A Company that Makes Everything needed for the plot.
Eldritch Ocean Abyss  -  The deep sea is full of eerie and/or terrifying creatures.
Pariah Prisoner  -  A prisoner who's hated even by their fellow inmates.
I Know Madden Kombat  -  Saving the day with pure athleticism.
Belief Makes You Stupid  -  Belief in something can make people act against their own best interests.
Instant Chucks  -  Chaining two weapons together: dangerous and awesome.
Blonde Brunette Redhead  -  A trio consisting of a blonde, a dark-haired, and a red-haired character.
Starter Villain  -  A weaker villain that proves as the first threat the heroes face.
Dating Do Si Do  -  Every single character is bound to hook up with one another if the show runs long enough.
Mood Swinger  -  Someone who changes moods abruptly.
Hell On Earth  -  Demons invade the world and transform it into a hellish wasteland.
Viewers Like You  -  A message dedicated to those who help a media come into shape.
Evidence Dungeon  -  A room (usually a basement) where a criminal keeps everything related to their criminal activities. Discovering this room is enough to prove them guilty.
Experimented In College  -  A (usually heterosexual) person was bi-curious in college.
Magic Skirt  -  Gravity bows to decency.
He Knows Too Much  -  He knows my secret: he must die.
The Fellowship Has Ended  -  The heroes go their separate ways after The Quest is finished.
Comforting Comforter  -  Alice covers a sleeping Bob with a blanket.
Glitch Entity  -  Character that exists because of a glitch.
Year Inside Hour Outside  -  In another dimension/room, what would be a year there could be a minute in the normal world.
But He Sounds Handsome  -  A person compliments himself while disguised as someone else.
School Festival  -  A school-wide event, where all the clubs compete in various activities.
Gigantic Adults Tiny Babies  -  A creature whose females give birth to babies which are tiny, relative to their parents.
Vengeful Widow  -  A villainess or anti-heroine seeks revenge for her spouse's death (often at the hero's hand).
Password Save  -  The game "saves" your progress by giving you a password that represents the game state or at least the level you're on and can be entered when you start the game up again to pick up where you left off.
Fattening The Victim  -  A scheme that involves making the victim fat somehow.
Real Men Hate Sugar  -  If you like sugar, then you're not manly!
Episode Tagline  -  One particular line or phrase is said repeatedly throughout the episode.
Cow Tipping  -  The Urban Legend that you can tip a cow over when it sleeps upright.
Classical Hunter  -  Archetypical hunter.
The Chew Toy  -  A Butt-Monkey whom the audience loves to see suffer.
Heroic Dog  -  A dog who does heroic deeds.
Stranded With Edison  -  Giving Radio to the Romans with the help of that time period's most knowledgeable person.
Hiccup Hijinks  -  Chaos ensues, usually in a comedic way, when somebody gets the hiccups.
Twelve Coins Puzzle  -  A classic puzzle where you are given a number of coins (twelve, most times), one of them has a different weight from the others, and you must determine which one is with only three weighings in a scale.
Nonhuman Humanoid Hybrid  -  A humanoid hybrid between two non-human species.
Friendly Playful Dolphin  -  Dolphins just wanna have fun.
Spoiling Shout Out  -  A reference that spoils what it's referencing.
I Approved This Message  -  Political ads are required by law in some countries to carry an approval message. Some non-political ads parody this.
When It All Began  -  A single important event that causes everything else in the story to be at its present state.
God Guise  -  Someone pretends to be a god, or is mistaken for a god.
Indecisive Parody  -  Is this supposed to be a parody, or what?
Born In The Wrong Century  -  A character wants to live in a different time period.
Doomed Predecessor  -  Finding the corpse of a previously introduced adventurer in a cave.
Apparently Powerless Puppetmaster  -  A Chessmaster or Manipulative Bastard who uses Obfuscating Stupidity.
Murder By Inaction  -  Deliberately not saving someone from dying.
Playing Against Type  -  Creator does something outside of what they're most known for.
We Really Do Care  -  The character's loved ones tell him how he is loved and want him to stay.
Hollywood Pudgy  -  In Hollywood, being average weight/slightly overweight = FAT.
Noble Wolf  -  Wolves are proud, noble, dignified, intelligent and usually reasonable (although still dangerous).
Wakeup Makeup  -  Characters always get out of bed in the morning perfectly groomed.
Ghostly Chill  -  Abnormal cold is a sign of paranormal activity.
Nature Is Boring  -  The belief that nature just isn't all that interesting.
Precocious Crush  -  Child has a cutesy crush on an adult or teenager.
Side Effects Include  -  When a prescription drug's effects are described in a commercial, its side effects must be disclosed, too. There are ways around this.
The Jester  -  This character acts like a dumbass to help others wisen up.
The Mothman  -  Winged Humanoid Cryptid sighted in Point Pleasant, West Virginia.
Billy Elliot Plot  -  A boy faces conflict due to his femininity.
Eyepatch Of Power  -  An eyepatch makes a character look badass.
Standard Alien Spaceship  -  Alien ships are smooth and colorful.
Trouble Entendre  -  Casual talk with a sinister double meaning.
Disposable Pilot  -  The driver of a vehicle has been incapacitated and cannot drive, spelling chaos for the passengers.
Establishing Series Moment  -  The one moment that represents what the whole series will be about.
Port Town  -  Generic Video Game boat town.
Shower Of Awkward  -  A character awkwardly walks in on another character in the shower. Cringe Hilarity Ensues.
Bittersweet Ending  -  An ending that's more or less happy, but still has significant sad notes.
Dub Induced Plot Hole  -  When a dub or other translation creates inconsistencies, often through Cut-and-Paste Translation.
I Call Him Mister Happy  -  Naming your genitalia.
Roc Birds  -  Titan-sized birds of prey.
Story Breaker Power  -  A superpower that would resolve the plot faster than the creator would prefer.
Fat And Skinny  -  An ensemble of one fat character and one skinny character.
Suicidal Overconfidence  -  Despite how much experience or how many kills you've got under your belt, every mook you come across still thinks he can take you down.
Hollywood Silencer  -  Fictional silencers actually do what they're named for.
Good Thing You Can Heal  -  Characters who heal quickly are more prone to injury.
The Perry Mason Method  -  Pester the witness until they confess.
You Can Keep Her  -  My annoying X has been kidnapped? YYEEEEEEEEEEESSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS! FREEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEDOM!!!!!!!
Forbidden Zone  -  An area with a foreboding name that nobody goes to. Ever. Except that you will wind up having to.
Cant Take Anything With You  -  You must bring nothing to the past.
Earn Your Title  -  A nickname with a damn good reason behind it.
Friends All Along  -  Two characters antagonize each other until it's revealed that they're friends.
Top God  -  A god above the rest by their authority or very nature.
Ragnarok Proofing  -  Post-Apocalyptic ruins are in surprisingly good shape.
Plot Device All Along  -  A frequently used weapon/item/skill holds a surprising hidden side
Psychic Powers  -  Magic, sci-fi style.
Make The Dog Testify  -  An unconventional witness, such as an animal, takes the stand in court.
Police Code For Everything  -  An organisation has codes assigned to any situation, no matter the improbability.
Off To Boarding School  -  The Big Bad or antagonistic character plots or threatens to send someone away to Boarding School.
Wanton Cruelty To The Common Comma  -  Punctuation, is-utilized! incorrectly.
Fighting From The Inside  -  A possessed or brainwashed character tries to resist what's controlling them.
Interactive Start Up  -  Playable intro or loading screen.
Foreign Money Is Proof Of Guilt  -  Because Russians pay only in Rubles, even in America.
Kidnapped From Behind  -  Abducting or attacking someone currently in a group of people without the others noticing.
I Gave My Word  -  Determinedly committed to a promise.
Second Hour Superpower  -  Start off as a muggle, move up to Super Weight by Act II.
Stern Teacher  -  A strict/no-nonsense teacher who still cares for the students.
Lady Legionnaire Wear  -  Skirted armour makes the outfit of an Action Girl look more feminine.
Alcohol Induced Idiocy  -  Get drunk. Get stupid.
The Adjectival Man  -  The Mysterious and Otherwise Nameless Character.
Trick Boss  -  A decoy boss you battle before the real one.
Pimped Out Dress  -  This dress looks like a million bucks, and it probably cost that much.
The Brute  -  The big, strong minion of the forces of evil.
Hope Is Scary  -  Hoping frightens a character.
Lethal Chef  -  One taste of this character's cooking could land you in the hospital.
Impromptu Tracheotomy  -  Aiming your attacks at your target's throat.
Breaking Old Trends  -  A series does a major change to its formula.
From New York To Nowhere  -  The big city to the boonies.
Flesh Eating Zombie  -  Zombies eating meat from dead people.
Player Nudge  -  The game throws you a bone during a Guide Dang It! situation.
Interdimensional Travel Device  -  Device that allows travel to other planes/universes/realities.
Ur Example  -  The first known usage ever.
Audience Alienating Premise  -  A premise that scares off much of the potential audience, regardless of the work's actual quality.
Supernatural Floating Hair  -  An otherworldly being has hair that defies gravity.
High Concept  -  The premise can be accurately summarized in one sentence.
Simple Country Lawyer  -  A lawyer from the country who uses their plain speaking and simple charm to win the jury over.
No Shirt Long Jacket  -  Wearing a Badass Longcoat without a shirt on underneath it.
Color Motif  -  A recurring color within a work, often with symbolic meaning.
Next Tier Power Up  -  An item, power, or transformation makes a main character way more powerful.
Graying Morality  -  A series with a good vs. evil conflict becomes more grey.
The Heart  -  The moral center of the team.
Love Across Battlelines  -  A character from one faction is in love with someone from the enemy faction.
The End Of The World As We Know It  -  The Bad Guy Wins, the world goes "boom!"
Mattress Tag Gag  -  Don't rip the tags off a mattress, or you'll be in big trouble!
Required Secondary Powers  -  Powers needed for other powers to work safely.
Species Title  -  The title of a work named for a featured group of beings or creatures.
Unwinnable Training Simulation  -  Simulated no-win scenario.
Retool  -  The format of a medium is changed to appeal to new viewers.
No Guy Wants An Amazon  -  Guys don't make passes at girls who kick asses.
Ladder Physics  -  Ladders in Video Games are screwy.
Fan Girl  -  Squee!! Isn't this laconic entry so cute? I'm drawing fanart of it shirtless and slashing it with the unabridged version!
Ascended Glitch  -  When glitches are officially incorporated into gameplay elements.
Spurned Into Suicide  -  A character is Driven to Suicide after being romantically rejected.
Related In The Adaptation  -  Two or more characters who aren't related in the original are in the adaptation.
All Animation Is Disney  -  Mistaking a different animated work as being made by the leading marketer.
Paralyzing Fear Of Sexuality  -  The character desires romance and/or sex, but is too afraid of sexuality.
Death By Sex  -  People who have sex during the story tend to die.
Anarcho Tyranny  -  A rulership seizes or maintains power through an enforced state of lawless or chaos.
Pointless Doomsday Device  -  An ancient device with the singular purpose of destroying the world.
Your Brain Wont Be Much Of A Meal  -  A character is so stupid that their brain isn't worth eating.
Pistol Pose  -  A still-pose of a character displaying a pistol.
Masculine Lines Feminine Curves  -  Square-bodied males and curvaceous females.
God In Human Form  -  A god takes the form of a human.
Sex Sells  -  Using fanservice to sell your product, regardless if it fits.
Adaptational Jerkass  -  A nice character becomes a Jerkass in an adaptation.
Insert Cameo  -  Directors or other creators using their appendages in a bit part for an insert shot.
Boarding School Of Horrors  -  A Boarding School, but horrible to the students.
Boss Arena Urgency  -  The boss's arena becomes more perilous to fight on as the battle wears on.
Technicolor Fire  -  Fire with lots of different colours.
Slept Through The Apocalypse  -  A character somehow manages to miss the End of the World as We Know It.
Pixel Hunt  -  A task that involves clicking an invisible or elusive hotspot.
Unkempt Beauty  -  Doesn't need makeup or even a hairbrush to be beautiful.
Ki Manipulation  -  Utilizing Ki/Chi in various ways, including combat.
Flashmob  -  Spontaneous large crowds.
My Parents Are Dead  -  Someone close to a character is brought up, leaving the character to respond that the person they were close to is dead.
I Am What I Am  -  A character learns to accept themself and their flaws.
Rewarding Vandalism  -  Smash stuff, get money.
Bully Turned Buddy  -  A bully character becomes a friend to The Hero.
Lets Mock The Monsters  -  Some fictional beasts just look hilarious.
Cactus Person  -  A cactus-based Plant Person.
Tarnishing Their Own Beauty  -  A character makes themselves deliberately uglier for plot reasons.
Mysterious Cube Of Rubik  -  A character finds the Rubik's cube and finds it highly interesting.
Even The Guys Want Him  -  Dude attracts straight women and straight men.
Offing The Offspring  -  Parent kills their child.
Contagious Heroism  -  Working with a heroic character rubs off positively on a less scrupulous character.
Recovery Attack  -  Where a fighter can attack while recovering from being knocked down.
By No I Mean Yes  -  A character says a thing, and shortly after says they meant the opposite.
Bow And Sword In Accord  -  A...Rogue Warrior, a fighter who uses both a sword and some type of bow weapon, ala a rogue and warrior class.
Win Your Freedom  -  The only way to gain your freedom is to win a very deadly contest.
Zapped  -  The trope: The article is so poor, it's deleted without a second thought.
Cold Turkeys Are Everywhere  -  A character tries to abstain from or avoid something, but is constantly tempted.
Horny Scientist  -  A scientist gets turned on by the female protagonist.
Cuddle Bug  -  The character who just wants to give everyone a big hug.
Stupidity Inducing Attack  -  An attack that makes people stupid.
The Alternet  -  Fictional equivalent or successor to the Internet.
Umbrella Of Togetherness  -  Sharing an umbrella implies/causes romance.
Our Wyverns Are Different  -  The various portrayals of wyverns, which are either true dragons or merely dragon-like, in fiction.
Only The Knowledgable May Pass  -  You must know this obscure fact/phrase/secret handshake to enter and/or not be murdered.
Three Month Old Newborn  -  Newborn babies look a few months older than they should be.
New Sound Album  -  The new album sounds completely different from their old stuff.
Gene Hunting  -  Adopted child searches for biological relatives.
Gotterdammerung  -  A sudden, large-scale event causes the gods to die or be sealed away forever.
Threw My Bike On The Roof  -  Pointless, useless destruction of property done solely for the sake of being a jerk.
Charm Person  -  Character influences another's mind. Can be broken.
Incredibly Durable Enemies  -  Regular mooks that can take lots of damage and still keep going.
One Size Fits All  -  Anyone can wear this gear.
Servile Snarker  -  The servant to one higher-up in power as a Deadpan Snarker.
Right On Queue  -  Waiting in line, Played for Laughs.
Biker Babe  -  Hot woman who drives a motorcycle (or a car, or a plane).
Bloodsucking Bats  -  Bats that like blood.
Weirdness Censor  -  When the Muggles see the supernatural but refuse to believe they saw it.
Token White  -  A show which features a predominantly ethnic cast always have one white guy.
Everythings Better With Dinosaurs  -  Dinosaurs are freaking awesome.
Ambiguous Ending  -  The ending of a work is left open to the viewer's interpretation.
Heel Race Turn  -  A race of beings who turned evil or good, depending on which media.
Mc Leaned  -  A character is killed because their actor left the program.
Depraved Kids Show Host  -  Child-friendly show host on camera, not so child-friendly in real life.
Fog Of War  -  Unvisited or unoccupied parts of the map are clouded.
Lightning Can Do Anything  -  Lightning serves any purpose the plot requires.
The Quest  -  A story set around one big adventure.
Platforming Pocket Pal  -  A Non-Player Companion in a Platform Game who is somehow exempt from platforming troubles.
Luke I Am Your Father  -  Characters previously thought unrelated are revealed to be parent and child.
Ninja Looting  -  You killed Evil Demonlord Behemoth The Undefeatable - and some other guy takes all the rewards.
Clone By Conversion  -  Character A is transformed into a copy of Character B.
Escort Mission  -  A task that requires you to guide a CPU-controlled NPC to a destination.
Third Act Stupidity  -  The protagonist(s) or antagonist(s) grab the Idiot Ball so that dramatic tension can be sustained during the climax.
Power Dyes Your Hair  -  Using a Super Mode or gaining a significant amount of power will dye your hair a different color.
I Will Only Slow You Down  -  ...So you must go on without me.
Creating Life Is Bad  -  Creating life is a bad idea.
Easily Impressed  -  Those who are amazed by the mundane and mediocre.
Dead Air  -  A period of unintentional silence over radio.
Gameplay Derailment  -  When video games are played in ways the developers never meant them to be played.
High Dive Hijinks  -  When they call it the High Dive... They ain't jokin!
The Only One Allowed To Defeat You  -  A villain/antihero doesn't want anyone to defeat the hero except him.
Sword And Sorcery  -  Heroic Fantasy, but with Darker and Edgier characters, settings and stories.
Disability As An Excuse For Jerkassery  -  A character tries to justify their asshole behavior with a handicap.
Wiki Vandal  -  One who defaces wiki pages.
Holding Out For A Hero  -  The Trope: The world becomes reliant on heroes for protection.
Fair Play Villain  -  Villain who prefers to give heroes a chance.
Seven Deadly Sins  -  Greed, Envy, Gluttony, Lust, Sloth, Wrath and Pride.
The Slow Walk  -  Slow down foreshadows beat down.
A Chat With Satan  -  A character tries to make our hero recognize their darker desires.
Gossip Evolution  -  The original information gets distorted by gossip retellings.
Comedic Lolicon  -  A person who is sexually attracted to young girls, Played for Laughs rather than drama.
Royalties Heir  -  Character has access to wealth because their family member created a lucrative product or intellectual property.
Above The Gods  -  The setting features entities even more powerful than its gods.
Eccentric Exterminator  -  A Pest Exterminator who takes their job very seriously
Makes Just As Much Sense In Context  -  It doesn't make sense in context.
Red Right Hand  -  A physical flaw signifying that a character is evil.
Walking Transplant  -  Someone literally exists to give organ transplants.
Blamed For Being Railroaded  -  It's your fault that the game made you do this bad thing to progress the story!
Old Save Bonus  -  Save data from one video game affects another game in some way.
Enfant Terrible  -  An evil child.
Colossus Climb  -  Small guy climbs a big guy to attack his lofty weak point.
Big Door  -  A big door.
Possession Presumes Guilt  -  An innocent person holds an item that makes them look guilty.
Secret Test Of Thieving Skill  -  You stole from them earlier, now they hire you to steal for them.
Blunder Correcting Impulse  -  You're so terrible, I'll do it just to make you stop.
Replacement Goldfish  -  A replacement for a lost loved one.
Dry Crusader  -  Doesn't drink alcohol and doesn't want anyone else to drink alcohol.
Motive Rant  -  A villain goes on a tirade about their motives.
Creating Life  -  Creating life in general.
Beak Attack  -  A bird uses its beak in harmful or even lethal ways.
Armor Piercing Slap  -  If a weakling slaps a badass for upsetting them, it will always hurt him no matter how strong he's supposed to be.
Minor With Fake ID  -  A teenager gets a fake ID to pretend to be older.
Are These Wires Important  -  Pulling out the machine's wiring until it stops functioning.
Chekhov MIA  -  If a character related to another major character goes missing at some point in a long-running series, they will appear again.
Never Sleep Again  -  Sleep = Death
Why Did You Make Me Hit You  -  A character resorts to violence to end an argument, but manages to make the other character feel guilty about it.
Obsessive Compulsive Barkeeping  -  Bartenders constantly clean glasses. Constantly.
Happily Married  -  A genuinely successful marriage.
Loves My Alter Ego  -  Alice is in love with Captain Superhero, unaware that he is really Bob, whom she is indifferent to.
Diagonal Speed Boost  -  Diagonal movement is faster than straight movement.
Runaway Train  -  A train is uncontrollably on the loose, which the heroes must stop.
December December Romance  -  Old people in love.
Tall Tale  -  A story told so many times it now makes no sense at all.
Take Your Child To Work Day Plot  -  A designated day for working parents to take their children to the workplace, and get them excited (or bored) about their jobs.
Mistaken For Badass  -  He's so damn lucky, they think he's a real threat.
The One Who Wears Shoes  -  Nobody in this work wears shoes... except for one person.
Revision  -  New information is added to previous story events.
Dissimile  -  A comparison is made and then shown to be inaccurate.
Definitely Just A Cold  -  You've caught some dreadful disease with deadly symptoms. And you've decided to ignore it.
Nine Out Of Ten Doctors Agree  -  X out of Y Professionals think Z.
Rotating Protagonist  -  Each character (supporting or minor) has equal or sigificant screentime as with the main characters.
Dark Reprise  -  An upbeat song is reprised darkly.
Crapsack World  -  Life here SUCKS.
Instant Emergency Response  -  Firefighters, EMTs, and police officers arrive within seconds of any catastrophe.
Curse  -  A persistent supernatural misfortune placed upon one character by another.
Friendly Rivalry  -  A rivalry based on mutual respect rather than disdain.
Humans Kill Wantonly  -  Humans brutally kill because they are humans.
Call And Response Song  -  Vocalists respond to each other's lines in this song.
Genie In A Bottle  -  Our Genies come in a vessel and grants wishes for anyone that frees them.
Parody Assistance  -  The originator or someone else involved with the source material helps out the parody artist.
You Can Talk  -  A character's reaction upon discovering that a creature or object that one would normally never expect to be able to talk can, in fact, do so.
Giftedly Bad  -  Terrible Artist thinks he's great.
Our Phlebotinum Child  -  An artificial being brought into existence through fantastic means and The Power of Love.
Phlebotinum Overdose  -  When Phlebotinum is something you can take, taking too much will be very bad for your health.
Credit Card Destruction  -  A person who fails to make payments on their credit card has their card destroyed by a merchant.
Corrupt The Cutie  -  A lovable character changes for the worse.
Unequal Pairing  -  A romantic and/or sexual relationship in which there is a huge power difference between the participants.
Generic Name  -  Norman MacNormalson.
Conveniently Empty Building  -  Major destruction never puts lives at risk.
Unconfessed Unemployment  -  He can't tell his family he's now out of a job.
Reality Is Out To Lunch  -  The laws of physics have been repealed.
All Myths Are True  -  All mythologies in the work were based on real people and events.
Tom Hanks Syndrome  -  An actor who permanently switches from doing comedy to drama.
Peninsula Of Power Leveling  -  The perfect place for Level Grinding.
Mononymous Biopic Title  -  A biopic titled as a One-Word Title after the central character's last/first name.
Santabomination  -  Santa Claus portrayed as an Eldritch Abomination.
Literal Maneater  -  A sexually attractive female character, often a monster or alien, who feeds on male humans. Often using her beauty as a way to catch him.
I Want Song  -  The Hero expresses their desires or dreams through a musical number.
Lantern Jaw Of Justice  -  Prominent square chin indicates a hero.
Futureshadowing  -  The result of the event is seen before the event itself, and serves as foreshadowing of it.
Void Between The Worlds  -  All the bits that aren't reality/a place of utterly empty nothingness.
Scary Stitches  -  Big, clearly visible stitches make almost anything creepier.
Princesses Prefer Pink  -  Princesses always come proper in pink.
Germanic Depressives  -  Germans are ice kings/queens.
Kaizo Trap  -  An obstacle that can still kill the player after reaching the goal.
Bizarre Human Biology  -  Bizarre Alien Biology for humans.
Thinker Pose  -  Art Imitates Art with Auguste Rodin's Thinker.
Great Way To Go  -  That's the way I wanna go.
Portmantitle  -  A.K.A. A portmanteau title.
I Ate What  -  A character eats or drinks something that wasn't intended as food.
Springtime For Hitler  -  Failing at intentional failure.
Emergent Narrative  -  Video games whose stories are not pre-scripted by the developers but instead emerge out of the interaction between the player and the game systems.
Harmful To Minors  -  Little kids getting exposed to horrific violence and/or sex.
Scary Amoral Religion  -  A religion that believes in 'holy' and 'unholy' but has nothing resembling good and evil.
Howl Of Sorrow  -  A character screaming in animalistic manner because they have experienced something terrible.
Popping Buttons  -  To exhibit a character's weight gain, the buttons pop right off his clothes.
Food Porn  -  You wish you could eat the meal shown on the screen. Admit it.
Took A Level In Cynic  -  An optimistic character learns to be less trusting, caring, and generous, often due to a betrayal.
Girly Girl With A Tomboy Streak  -  A girly girl has some tomboyish qualities.
Patchwork Map  -  A map featuring contrasting climates and terrain existing next to each other.
But Not Too Gay  -  Gays can be gay, but can't express it the way straights can.
Butterfly Of Doom  -  Tiny change in the timeline = horrifically altered future.
Meta Twist  -  A plot twist that's a twist not because of the story, but because of circumstances surrounding the work's genre, author, or role in a series.
SNK Boss  -  A boss (usually found in fighting games) that breaks the game mechanics to be as difficult as possible.
Down The Drain  -  Generic Video Game sewer level.
Emerald Power  -  Color green = mystical/mysterious powers
Dies Wide Open  -  A character dies with their eyes open.
Beary Funny  -  Jolly, friendly, rambunctious bears.
Threshold Guardians  -  Someone or something that tests the hero's will to embark on the adventure.
Skeletal Musician  -  Animated skeletons performing music.
Shiny New Australia  -  Villains planning to Take Over the World using individual countries as a bargaining chip.
Streaming Stars  -  Stars are seen streaking by to emphasize how fast a spaceship is going.
Progressive Instrumentation  -  Music that adds instruments one at a time.
Clean Pretty Childbirth  -  A birth in media is usually clean and simple.
Breakable Weapons  -  Weapons wear out with use.
Spring Is Late  -  Winter has not ended like it should.
Evil Debt Collector  -  The debt collector will stoop to anything to get people to cough up.
Dramatic Alien VTOL  -  Aliens spaceships land slowly. Really slowly.
Everything Is An I Pod In The Future  -  In the future, everything will be monochrome, shiny, sleek, and user-friendly.
Current Events Blog  -  A blog about current events. Duh.
Healthy In Heaven  -  In the afterlife, you cast off any and all disfigurements/disabilities/infirmities you may have had in life.
Demon Slaying  -  Killing demons.
Time Keeps On Ticking  -  Whether you're talking, pausing, or in the middle of a cutscene, the countdown continues on.
Feud Episode  -  An episode focusing on two friends in a conflict with each other, but then reconcile in the end.
Reality Has No Subtitles  -  When dialogue in a foreign language from or between characters receives no captions translating what they're saying.
Vegetarian Vampire  -  Vampires who don't (or try their best not to) feed off human blood.
Familial Body Snatcher  -  A Body Snatcher who only possesses members of their own family and/or descendants.
Thinks Like A Romance Novel  -  Believes things will turn out like they do in romance novels... in a work that isn't a romance novel.
Throw The Mook At Them  -  A Game Mechanic that involves grabbing and tossing Mooks at things.
Cross Cultural Kerfluffle  -  Amusing in one country, not so in another.
Actor Shared Background  -  Actors share similar traits with their characters.
Ive Come Too Far  -  If I turn back now, my whole journey would have been for nothing!
The Night That Never Ends  -  The Big Bad's evil plan is to create endless night.
Uninhibited Muscle Power  -  The brain usually inhibits the body's strength to protect it, but not this time.
Your Magics No Good Here  -  Magic from X dimension does not function correctly (or at all) in Y dimension.
Interclass Friendship  -  A character is friends with another character of a different social/monetary status.
Misplaced Retribution  -  Taking revenge on someone in response to an act they weren't responsible for.
Mental Handicap Moral Deficiency  -  A mentally handicapped villain.
Self Destructing Security  -  Thieves can't steal the loot if you destroy it first.
Art Initiates Life  -  Art comes to life.
Older Hero Vs Younger Villain  -  A plot where an older hero is opposed by a younger villain.
Gut Punch  -  A single moment instantly and permanently changes the tone of a work to something significantly darker.
Addictive Foreign Soap Opera  -  A character becomes enamored with a foreign soap opera, even if they can't understand the language.
Gratuitous Disco Sequence  -  Some sort of "Disco scene" just happens with no Foreshadowing
Entitled To Have You  -  If you're a good person worthy of respect, you HAVE to sleep with me.
Prisoners Dilemma  -  Two unaffiliated individuals tend not to cooperate even if it is in their best interest.
Recurring Riff  -  A Leitmotif for the entire piece of media.
Manly Gay  -  Very masculine gay man.
Pygmalion Snap Back  -  A character who was changed by another character to fit their ideals reverts to their original self.
School Newspaper News Hound  -  An absurdly elaborate school paper that makes the school's news with true commercial values.
Anatomically Impossible Sex  -  SEX DOES NOT WORK THAT WAY!
Auto Tune  -  Software that corrects musical pitch (or makes you sound like a robot).
Inspirational Martyr  -  By dying, they rally many more to their cause.
Big Bad Duumvirate  -  The story has two or more main villains working together.
Why We Cant Have Nice Things  -  ...because we'll just destroy them.
Contrasting Sequel Main Character  -  A sequel's main character is purposely the complete opposite of the original work's main character.
Centrifugal Gravity  -  Spinning your spaceship or space habitat to create artificial gravity.
The Reliable One  -  The friend or team member that can always be counted on, especially for Boring, but Practical advice.
Percent Based Values  -  Something's effect calculates the value used as a percentage of another value.
Inventory Management Puzzle  -  Organizing Grid Inventory-Systems can get incredibly tedious.
Category Traitor  -  Liking something that is out of your culture makes you a sellout.
Upper Class Equestrian  -  Horses and horseback riding are hobbies for rich people.
Fangs Are Evil  -  Sharp teeth as an indicator of evil.
Space Sailing  -  Boats IN SPACE!
With A Friend And A Stranger  -  The main cast is two people who knew each other before the story started and a third who doesn't.
Glacier Waif  -  A fragile-looking Mighty Glacier.
Squeaky Eyes  -  Your blinking is loud.
Run And Gun  -  When Platform Games meet Shoot 'em Up.
Luminescent Blush  -  A visible red blush coating under their eyes when they feel embarrassed or shy.
Grenade Hot Potato  -  I don't want this live grenade! You take it!
Bring My Red Jacket  -  Someone clad in red is about to get hurt badly.
Post Nine Eleven Terrorism Movie  -  A film or TV Show made after 9/11 that censors the destruction or is about the terrorists.
Lame Comeback  -  Less-than-snappy responses to insults.
Afraid Of Needles  -  I'm TOUGH— oh God, a needle!
Lying Heroes Honest Villains  -  A good guy tells lies while the villain tells the truth.
Through The Eyes Of Madness  -  This Unreliable Narrator is unreliable because they're insane. Maybe.
Abandoned Info Page  -  Material that should get the audience up to speed is severely outdated.
Minidress Of Power  -  An Action Girl's primary outfit is a minidress or has a miniskirt.
Manifesto Making Malcontent  -  When a character writes some kind of manifesto, it's a sure sign of them posing a danger to the current way of things.
Rascally Raccoon  -  Raccoons are rascally and mischievous.
Stupidly Long Filler Sound  -  An Overly Long Gag involving a stupid or confused character saying "uhhhhhhhhhhhh..." for a really long time.
Writing Lines  -  A character is made to write something over and over as punishment.
Destroy The Evidence  -  Someone who seems not to be directly involved in a crime destroys or hides some evidence relating to it.
Out Of The Inferno  -  When someone walks out of a field of fire and/or explosions. Usually Played for Drama.
You Can Barely Stand  -  Badly injured hero faces off against the villain.
Sound Off  -  Military songs known as cadence calls.

Open Ended Boss Battle  -  The outcome of the Boss Battle doesn't matter, and the story continues regardless of whether you win or lose.
Sealed Evil In A Can  -  Villain is imprisoned somewhere, usually so that he/she can be let out to wreak havoc.
Inexplicably Awesome  -  A character who is awesome, bizarre, and never to be explained.
To The Pain  -  Torturer describes to the victim in detail what they're doing, or going to do, to the victim's body.

Creepy Child  -  Child displays unsettling behavior.

Tae Kwon Door  -  Opening/closing a door/gate/etc. to cause damage to an opponent.

Clipboard Of Authority  -  Carrying a clipboard automatically makes you look like you should be here, even though you shouldn't.
Disposable Vehicle Section  -  After getting damaged, a part of the vehicle can be removed to let the original vehicle continue without it.
Combat Clairvoyance  -  What better way to create a counterattack than...seeing into the future?
Friend In The Black Market  -  The Plot Device obtainer and deliveryman(beware of overcharging).
Burning Rubber  -  Driving fast enough will leave a trail of fire.
Men Are Tough  -  The man is portrayed as a tough being.
Superweapon Surprise  -  We have hidden super weapons.
Gladiator Revolt  -  The show fighters are through performing.
Non Promotion  -  Someone gets a promotion, but they only get a title and more work.
Implausible Deniability  -  Denial in the face of overwhelming evidence to the contrary.
Annoying Laugh  -  A very very bad laugh.
Evil Doppelganger  -  An evil version of a character.
Walking Armory  -  A character carries, wears, or conceals multiple weapons on their person.
Mars Needs Water  -  Exactly what it sounds like, Mars is dry up.
Mook Chivalry  -  Only one bad mook attacking hero at any given time, while making itself easily defeatable.
Adventures In The Bible  -  Characters time travel to events from religion or mythology.
Villain Override  -  The Big Bad mind-controls their less successful subordinates in order to take down the heroes.
Reversible Roboticizing  -  Cybernetics are easily replaced with organic parts.
Desperately Looking For A Purpose In Life  -  A character looks very hard to find a goal in life.
Magic Cauldron  -  Spellcasters contractually keep a cauldron to brew spells and potions.
Trouble Follows You Home  -  Even your home is not safe from your enemies.
Sacred Bow And Arrows  -  Bows and arrows are associated with the gods and/or holy power.
Damned By Faint Praise  -  Hinting at flaws by praising the target's other lesser traits.
Parachute In A Tree  -  Someone with a parachute runs into a tree while just before hitting the ground.
At Least I Admit It  -  Acknowledging your wrongdoings is better than hiding them or pretending they don't exist.
Deceptive Legacy  -  Lies told to children about their absent parent.
Job System  -  A character can pick and choose between classes and even skills and is meant to change between them at some points.
Monkey King Lite  -  Stock Parodies of the Chinese Monkey King, Sun Wukong.
Military Coup  -  Overthrow of the government by the military.
Love Will Lead You Back  -  Refusing to give up on a Love Interest who has left because you're convinced they'll return eventually.
Magic A Is Magic A  -  Made-up elements behave consistently.
High Tech Hexagons  -  Six-sided geometry equals advanced design.
Yet Another Stupid Death  -  Death resulting from player's stupidity, therefore the player cannot blame the game.
Cigar Chomper  -  A cigar (lit or not) in your mouth makes you look cool or badass.
Got The Whole World In My Hand  -  Symbol of a hand grasping at the globe.
Never Bareheaded  -  Characters that never take their headgear off.
Together In Death  -  You're together with your loved one, but you had to die for it.
Like Brother And Sister  -  A close but platonic relationship between an unrelated male and female that is similar to that of siblings.
Road Trip Plot  -  Everyone goes on road trip. Hilarity Ensues.
Blindfolded Trip  -  A character is made so they cannot know where they are being taken.
Balancing Deaths Books  -  Trading your own death for someone else's. You know... for bureaucracy's sake.
In Space Everyone Can See Your Face  -  Spacesuits always have transparent visors and sometimes even lights to highlight the face of the astronaut.
Artificial Family Member  -  When the creator sees their creation as family.
Multiversal Conqueror  -  Universes: Gotta conquer 'em all.
Crying Wolf  -  No one believes a liar, even when they're telling the truth.
Hiding Behind The Language Barrier  -  Two characters, to prevent a third from understanding them, speak in a language he or she does not know
The Greatest Style  -  A style, art, or craft that outshines the others in its particular field, whether that field be combat-oriented or competitive, or not
Approval Of God  -  Fan works/parodies enjoyed by those involved in the source material.
Impossibly Cool Clothes  -  Clothing which does things which are not physically possible, looks too awesome to wear in real life, or both.
Hidden Agenda Hero  -  They're definitely on the side of good... but they won't say why.
External Retcon  -  Stories about what really happened.
Sociopathic Hero  -  A sociopath who still fights for a good cause.
Country Matters  -  The effects of the word "cunt" differs based on culture.
Ghost Memory  -  Character receives memories that weren't theirs originally.
Significant Birth Date  -  If someone has a birthday during the plot, it's important
Loves The Sound Of Screaming  -  A character loves to hear people scream.
Dreadlock Rasta  -  Dreadlocks as a sign of rebellion, independence, devotion to religion, or just being free-spirited.
Space People  -  People born, raised, and living entirely in space.
Arrogant God Vs Raging Monster  -  A rivalry where the only match for The Ace is The Berserker.
Bad News Irrelevant News  -  Bad news followed by non-sequitur good news.
Tier Induced Scrappy  -  When someone or something in a game is hated for being either too good, too bad, or somehow both.
Freddie Mercopy  -  Parodies or Expies of Freddie Mercury.
Women Are Delicate  -  Women are PRECIOUS
Negate Your Own Sacrifice  -  A character can handle the "death" involved when laying down their life to save others with no lasting harm.
Third Eye  -  Someone has a third eye to indicate a deeper perception of the world.
Big OMG  -  OH MY GOD!
The Many Deaths Of You  -  Some games have many, many ways for you to die.
Bested By The Inexperienced  -  A beginner defeats a more experienced fighter.
Breast Attack  -  Attacking a woman's boobs deals a lot of damage.
Relationship Values  -  A video game feature that reflects on how characters feel about you.
Gunboat Diplomacy  -  Demonstrating one's strength to encourage compliance from another without technically/blatantly/actually threatening them.
Madwoman In The Attic  -  A deformed and/or unstable character kept hidden somewhere.
The Prankster  -  A character who loves practical jokes.
Spam Attack  -  Repeatedly using the same attack.
See The Whites Of Their Eyes  -  Combatants that should have long-range weapons fight at short-range.
Intimate Healing  -  Intimate activities causes serious psychological problems to subside.
Inscrutable Oriental  -  Asians who show little emotion or personality.
You Would Do The Same For Me  -  Stock Phrase about the Power of Trust.
Headphones Equal Isolation  -  Wearing headphones shuts out the rest of the world.
World Of Mysteries  -  A setting consisting entirely of unsolved mysteries, hints, clues, and symbols.
Maternity Crisis  -  Going into labour at a bad time.
Press X To Not Die  -  Press a button to get results right... now!
Build Like An Egyptian  -  Ancient Egypt: The Theme Park Version
Rapid Fire Typing  -  Super Speed typing.
My Species Doth Protest Too Much  -  An entire world/species shares a quirk... except for this guy.
Obvious Judas  -  Are you really surprised that this character turned out to be evil?
Rapid Hair Growth  -  A characters hair grows way too fast.
Acquired Situational Narcissism  -  Popularity makes a character prideful.
Mega Microbes  -  Usually microscopic creatures that are big enough to see.
King Incognito  -  The upper class disguised as lower class.
Speaking Simlish  -  Language that makes no sense and only serves to let you know that the characters are talking.
Flexing Those Non Biceps  -  Check out my muscles! What—you don't see them? You blind, or what?!
The Power Of Friendship  -  Companionship with others is a character's greatest strength.
Intimidation Demonstration  -  Intimidating your opponent by demonstrating your strength or skill.
Inner Monologue  -  A character's thoughts, presented as speech.
Weaponized Landmark  -  Turn a famous landmark into a superweapon.
I Just Want To Have Friends  -  Having a lack of Companions is more depressing than one might think.
The Illuminati  -  An organization with a massive amount of influence on governments which creates conspiracies, orchestrated several historical events, and wants to create One World Order.
Reading Is Cool Aesop  -  A work that encourages children to read books.
Supernatural Repellent  -  A monster or curse's one weakness.
Consolation Prize  -  You lost, but we'll give you a crappy prize anyway.
Girls Like Musicians  -  Female characters in media depicted as being romantically interested in musicians.
A Pig Named Porkchop  -  An animal is named after the meat, hide, or other products that could come from it.
Love Is A Crime  -  Love (platonic and/or romantic) is made illegal by the state.
Understatement  -  Under-valuing something significant to humorous effect.
Closet Sublet  -  A character lives in another character's closet.
Just Plane Wrong  -  Aircraft does not work that way.
Director Displacement  -  A work is more associated with someone other than the director.
Smug Smiler  -  A character who always smiles in a smug manner.
Excessive Mourning  -  A character grieves to such an extent as to be a menace.
Hyper Awareness  -  A character notices everything worth noticing. Super Senses are not required.
Just So Story  -  A fanciful story invented to explain the origin of some natural or social phenomeonon.
Amazon Brigade  -  Group of warrior women.
Testing The Editors  -  A deliberately questionable scene thrown in to check if the editors are doing their job.
Gravity Screw  -  Gravity as a plot/gameplay mechanic.
Barbaric Bully  -  In fiction, bullies are big, dumb, and Obviously Evil.
To Hell And Back  -  The living storm the Gates of Hell for something (or someone).
Haunted Heroine  -  A female character is haunted by ghosts of the past, figuratively and literally.
Jump Scare  -  Scary things come out of nowh-AAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHH!!!!
Even Evil Has Loved Ones  -  Villains love their family and friends like anyone else.
Declaration Of Personal Independence  -  Someone attempts to strike out on their own against their guardians' wishes.
No Peripheral Vision  -  People generally look straight ahead.
Analysis Channel  -  A Web Video channel dedicated to analyzing/critiquing a series or a format.
Missed The Call  -  Events intended for someone important happen to someone else instead.
The Ark  -  Some 'means of protection' from an apocalypse. Might save 1 life, might save one billion.
Sarashi  -  A long bandage or strip of cloth wrapped tightly around the midriff and chest.
Passion Is Evil  -  Heroes are calm and rational whereas villains are passionate and impulsive.
Unholy Matrimony  -  Evil lovers.
God Is Good  -  God, or the setting's equivalent, is portrayed positively.
Honor Thy Abuser  -  A character learns to forgive and respect their tormentor.
Illegal Gambling Den  -  A place where people gamble outside of the law.
Benevolent Genie  -  They give you what you actually want, even if the wording of your wish was a tad sloppy.
Rapid Fire Fisticuffs  -  Punching really fast.
Stalker With A Test Tube  -  A stalker wants someone's DNA.
Off To See The Wizard  -  A work that completely or partially parodies The Wizard of Oz.
Mistaken For Racist  -  All my Unfortunate Implications are unintentional.
Dream Team  -  They are the best of the best, and they work together as one.
Character Roster Global Warming  -  New games in a series rarely add more slow but powerful characters.
Creepy Children Singing  -  Want to make something seem creepy and ominous? Have children singing!
Complaining About Shows You Dont Watch  -  Characters pass judgment on works they know little or nothing about.
Mills And Boon Prose  -  Erotic Purple Prose.
The Battle Didnt Count  -  Although you won the boss battle, the story continues as if you didn't win.
The Greatest History Never Told  -  Interesting time periods that tend to get left out of Hollywood History.
We Hardly Knew Ye  -  Character is introduced quickly. Then killed quickly.
Abandonware  -  Software no longer officially sold or supported.
Foot Popping  -  Raising your foot when someone kisses you.
Head In The Sand Management  -  A high-ranking official refuses to believe that an evil figure poses a threat, or tries to appease or make friends with said figure.
Damage Is Fire  -  Being on fire is a way to communicate "this thing is damaged" to players.
Everythings Better With Cows  -  Milking cows for humor.
Miss Conception  -  Some people don't quite know everything about where babies come from.
Black Gal On White Guy Drama  -  Romantic relationships between black women and white men being subjected to criticism.
Non Standard Kiss  -  A kiss that does not involve the use of mouths.
Mercurial Base  -  A Base on Wheels that keeps pace with the sun, so it's always the same time of day.
Casting A Shadow  -  Darkness/Shadow-based Elemental Powers.
